text: super intent from PBKS. If there is width on the first, the first ball shall go. Cut away by Agarwal in front of backward point. Poor start from Thampi. Short and wide
preText:
Ready to go. Basil Thampi has the new ball. One slip in place. Third man and fine leg back

7.20pm Nandhana: "M Ash is playing against his previous team too!"

"Please confirm - is Bairstow keeping or Jitesh keeping?" Athu, it should be Jitesh. I have updated in the team list. Ten minutes to ball one.

7.10pm So with PBKS batting first, the middle overs are going to be interesting. They are a side that love to keep scoring quickly through the middle overs after a quick start. And here's a Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Which team has the poorest economy rate in the middle overs in IPL 2022?

You can watch the match LIVE in the USA on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

7pm Mumbai Indians have won the toss, and will bowl first. Tymal Mills is back for Ramandeep.

Mumbai Indians 1 Ishan Kishan (wk), 2 Rohit Sharma (capt.), 3 Dewald Brevis, 4 Suryakumar Yadav, 5 Tilak Varma, 6 Kieron Pollard, 7 Tymal Mills, 8 Jaydev Unadkat, 9 Murugan Ashwin, 10 Jasprit Bumrah, 11 Basil Thampi

Punjab Kings have retained the XI they played their last game with.

Punjab Kings 1 Shikhar Dhawan, 2 Mayank Agarwal (capt.), 3 Jonny Bairstow, 4 Liam Livingstone, 5 Jitesh Sharma (wk), 6 Shahrukh Khan, 7 Odean Smith, 8 Kagiso Rabada, 9 Rahul Chahar, 10 Vaibhav Arora, 11 Arshdeep Singh

6.50pm One of the side plots for this match is Rahul Chahar coming up against his former team, Mumbai Indians, who are poorer for the loss. In an interview with Star Sports, he says it is no big deal coming up against them because he has played against his brother, Deepak Chahar, in the past; this is nothing in comparison. Ten minutes to the toss.

6.45pm Fifteen minutes to go to the toss, and here are Gaurav Sundararaman and Shiva Jayaraman running their analytical lens over Rohit Sharma's ordinary IPL numbers of late.

Rohit has been way below par in the last few seasons in the IPL. The last time he averaged 30-plus in an IPL season was in 2016. Since then, Rohit has averaged below 30 - in the high twenties - every year. His strike rates in these five seasons have been ordinary too: he has struck at 130-plus only in one of them - in 2018. From the 2019 season, when he began opening for Mumbai Indians regularly, Rohit has averaged 27.9 and struck at 127.7. However, these numbers are not indicative of what he is capable of.


M Saini: "Loving this year's IPL...five teams at 6 points each and three teams at 4 points each, and two teams below 4 points are the ones expected to be at top of table. EXCITING."

Will: "In terms of bolstering the death overs bowling for PBKS, Sandeep Sharma has one of the best economy rates in that period against MI (for bowlers that have bowled at least 48 balls in that period), so Odean Jitesh -> Rajapaksa Sandeep is making more and more sense to me."

6.40pm Nagraj Gollapudi is at the ground in Pune. His scouting tells me Tymal Mills should be back. Tim David could be back too.

Pahul Gill: "I am very interested to see how PBKS counter Bumrah this match. He is the only wicket taking threat in this MI bowling line-up. If they are smart, they should play him out and attack the other bowlers. You don't want another Rashid Khan situation. A lot of runs to be had targeting the likes of Sams/Allen, Unadkat, Thampi, Murugan, Mills/Meredith"

6.30pm Game 23 of IPL 2022. It's the winless Mumbai Indians against the exciting Punjab Kings, who have been trying their best to counter the handicap of losing the toss by batting aggressively. Both these sides have been unlucky with the toss, having won just one each in four matches each. PBKS, though, have managed to put four points on the board. MI remain the only team with no win so far.

Mumbai Indians will be looking forward to the return of Daniel Sams, who missed the last match with a stomach bug. PBKS have the Odean Smith question to ponder: he is an exciting talent for sure, but is he good enough to be bowling four overs regularly? Of course Liam Livingstone does help out with the ball too, but Arshdeep Singh needs support at the death. Remember Delhi Capitals didn't use to use Kagiso Rabada right at the end of the innings. In half an hour we will know how the teams think about these combinations.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Agarwal, no run
text: wide still but fuller, and Agarwal lets it go
short and wide again. Okay not very short, but short enough for Agarwal to just use the pace of it with a late-cut even though he is on the move. Finds the gap between backward point and cover-point
shortish, widish again, and this time it will be just the single to deep point
preText: Third man moves to deep point, backward point moves to short third man

shortText: Basil Thampi to Dhawan, no run
text: better to the left-hand batter. On a length, shaping back in towards top of off. Defended with an open face

shortText: Basil Thampi to Dhawan, 1 leg bye
text: off the thigh pad as he tucks him up. They get a leg-bye
what a welcome to the bowling crease. Skips down the wicket, gets close to it, and extends his arms through it. Goes over mid-off for a flat six. Sensational caress
preText: Jaydev Unadkat to share the new ball

text: yorker, on middle and leg, dug out for one to the leg side
cramps him up with one short of a length and pretty straight. Agarwal can't do much with that
preText: No slip. Two men on the hook. No boundary rider on the off side

text: good line again. At the hips. Unadkat knows he can't afford to give Agarwal any width with nobody outside the circle on the off side. Another dot
slower offcutter, starts outside leg, ends up at off. Agarwal opens the face, but can't find the gap on the off side

gets a slight bit of width, Agarwal looks to open the face and thread the gap between short third man and backward point. Fails to do so. A good comeback from Unadkat after a six first ball. Just seven off
ordinary start. Well outside leg with fine leg up. Dhawan manages to glance it fine of the man for four. A rare gift from Bumrah. But it has been called leg-byes
preText: Bumrah into the attack now

text: yorker, middle and leg, dug out to square leg for one
again down the leg side, big wide again. Dhawan wants a tickle on it, but fails to get a touch on it. Kishan dives again to save four extras
excellent take from Kishan. Dhawan is down the wicket, Bumrah digs it in, but the line is outside leg again, and Kishan has to dive to his right full length to save four extras
better line against the right-hand better. Agarwal opens the face for a single to third man
dug in short, just outside off, Dhawan looks to ramp it over Kishan, but makes no connection
down the wicket, takes this on the full, clips it to deep square leg for one
postText: Raghu IFMR: "That boundary of first ball of Bumrah was clearly off the batbat but given as leg byes.. Those really hurt the margins.. I am ofcourse talking about my Fantasy league.. Come on Umpp..."

text: driven on the up, and in the air. This is not a half-volley by any means. Agarwal just goes hard at this wide length ball, and manages to clear cover-point. Replays show it is catchable but M Ashwin is late in the attempt to get his hands up
preText: Shyam: "MI are clearly lacking a good powerplay bowler. Someone who can take wickets. That is affecting Boom's role and performance and overall bowling...they are unable to choke opponents like they are used to..."

text: on a length, at the stumps, dropped into the leg side for one
preText: Unadkat continues

text: Agarwal looks to give him the charge and make room but has been done in by a slower one from Unadkat
again a slower one but this is outside leg, and Agarwal clips it past short fine leg for two
big back lift, looking for a big drive, but he is cramped up again. Pushes this towards mid-off for a quick single
on a length, angling across hi, Dhawan stays back to run it down but can;'t beat short third man
preText: Goes round the wicket to the left-hand batter. That is interesting

text: down the wicket, Unadkat counters it with a slower short ball, Dhawan adjusts and manages to upper-cut it over cover. Not enough pace on the ball to take it to the fence, though
on a length, middle and leg, no turn, Agarwal clears the front leg to push this wide of mid-off for one
preText: M Ashwin inside the powerplay

text: down the wicket, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, pushes it along the ground to long-on for one
a matter of time if you bowl spin to Agarwal inside the powerplay. Stays leg side of this by clearing the froint leg and square-drives it between point and cover-point
more emphatic this time by skipping down the track and lofting him over mid-on

mid-off is back but it doesn't matter to Agarwal. Lovely shot. This is just an off-drive in the air. Clears the front leg again, and then reaches out because he is not very close to the pitch of the ball. Still manages to clear long-off. Lovely, clean swing of the bat
looks for another big into the off side, but Ashwin bowls it full enough to not let him get under it. Just the single into the covers
short ball, on the leg stump, pulled to long leg for one
preText: Tymal Mills to see if he can stop the bleeding

text: slower short ball, but enough time for Dhawan to adjust to it and then upper-cut it over cover. Makes it look easy
on-pace this time, and Dhawan looks to use the pace by opening the face on it. A touch late on the shot, and is beaten
short again, but a wide down the leg side
on a length, into the pads, worked to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, wide, Agarwal opens the face on it, beats short third man to his right, and also deep point to his left
short of a length, well down the leg side, Agarwal fails to get a touch on it
yorker, squeezes it under his bat
preText: Round the wicket
postText: Superb powerplay for PBKS. In fact, S Rajesh tells me this is the highest powerplay in Pune this year. Don't take his word or mine, Ask Cricinfo. MI need the breather they vare getting through the strategic timeout

text: on a length, middle and leg, worked around the corner for one
preText: Ashwin continues

text: drifting into the pads, Agarwal is beaten on the sweep. They still get a leg-bye
full, on the pads, whipped into leg side, but can't get past deep backward square leg
long hop but comes slowly off the surface, and Agarwal has to adjust to it and has to settle for the single to long-on
full, outside leg, beaten on the sweep, but they get a leg-bye
no room, good length, draws a rare dot from Agarwal
poor start again. Short, wide, and Dhawan upper-cuts him over point. Bisects third man and deep point
preText: Thampi comes back

text: short of a length, no room, Dhawan drops this at his toes, and Agarwal calls him through for a quick single
preText: Deepak Samson : "Very happy to see Mayank coming good. Quality batsman. "

text: short of a length, offcutter, cramping him up, Agarwal still manages to chip it to wide long-on for two
pull off the front foot, in front of square, and deep square leg has to rush to his left to save two runs
short, wide, cut straight to deep point this time

shortText: Basil Thampi to Dhawan, no run
text: uppish extra-cover drive, Rohit puts in a dive at extra cover, but can't get to it on the full
preText: Karthik: "Punjab on course for their third victory. Title contenders if one more bowler gets into form."

text: wide yorker, just inside the blue line. Under the bat it goes
preText: Mills is back. Round the wicket

text: short of a length, on-pace, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, into the pads, punched down to long-on for one
preText: Over the wicket to Dhawan

text: no deception, it would appear, in this slower ball. Or just that he has erred too full with it. Agarwal loves it. Delays the shot a touch and clears mid-off with ease. That brings up an exciting fifty
short of a length, into the body, punched square on the leg side
full toss, slightly strange that Dhawan doesn't go after it. Merely pushes this to deep midwicket for one

down the wicket, Ashwin bowls it outside leg, and Dhawan lofts it towards deep square leg. Brevis runs to his right from long leg, puts in a full-length dive, but can't get close enough to catch it. However, he does get enough of a connection to actually parry it over the fence
preText: Ashwin continues into his third over

text: drops this into the leg side for one

wkt_text: MA Agarwal c Yadav b Ashwin 52 (51m 32b 6x4 2x6) SR: 162.50
text: finally a wicket for Mumbai Indians. Well bowled by Ashwin. Agarwal is clearing the front leg again to look to go over long-off or straight. Ashwin makes sure he doesn't bowl it under his bat. Just short enough to make him drag it. Agarwal gets the toe end on it, and manages to only sky it as far as long-off. He is filthy with himself
postText: Over to Peter Della Penna for the rest of the innings

text: full on off, defended.
preText: Cheers Monga. Bairstow enters.

text: full and wide on sixth stump, slammed straight through cover for one.
flighted more full on off, prodded gently to long-off for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, guided with soft hands to deep third man for one.
preText:
Reminder that you can watch the match LIVE in the USA on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Bumrah returns around the wicket after bowling one over in the Powerplay.

text: back of a length on middle at 136 kph, defended back to Bumrah off the back foot.
good length ball on off stump, guided with soft hands to deep third man.

uppercut over the keeper nearly picks out robocam on the boundary! It was a well directed bouncer by Bumrah on middle stump but Dhawan was even better angling the bat to play the billiard cue shot straight behind the stumps, one bounce over the rope.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
touch fuller now on off, tap and run into the off side for a sharp single.
good length ball on middle, flicked softly through square leg for one.
flighted full on leg stump, goes for a slog sweep and misses as the ball ricochets behind point. LBW shout is hopeless, but there's some confusion before they finally set off for a leg bye.
gives it some air on off stump, goes for a big slog sweep and misses as the ball bounces over the stumps.
flighted on a fullish length on leg stump, goes to sweep and this time connects behind square for one.
short and wide, slaps this behind point wide of the sweeper for an easy two.
good length ball on sixth stump, cracks a cut straight to the sweeper for one.
overpitched searching for the yorker and instead misses badly full on middle, Bairstow clocks this straight back over his head, one bounce over the rope at long-off.
preText: Tymal Mills back in place of Bumrah now after one over. Left-arm over.

text: slower ball lands short on fifth stump, pulled gently to deep backward square for one.
good length ball at 140 kph on middle, Dhawan backs away to slice this to deep third man for one.
full on middle, goes to drive for mid-off and gets a thick edge through point for one.
postText: Deepak Samson : "Livingstone must be chomping at the bit. Will we see another tactical retired out today?" Not at the current scoring rate with these two.

text: dropped! Back of a length at 133 kph on eighth stump, Dhawan charges to smash through the off side and barely reaches this, gets a toe edge that flies to Ishan Kishan's left at chest height. He flings his body out and gets a glove to it but it doesn't stick. Very hard chance, but plenty of keepers have held on to them in similar instances.
back of a length at 140 kph tailing away from the stumps, goes for a big heave and misses.
clever from Shikhar! Length ball on middle, shuffles well across his stumps to paddle this between the keeper and short fine leg for a sharp boundary.
preText: Unadkat replaces M Ashwin after his spell is done. He comes left-arm around to Dhawan.

text: low full toss at shin height on leg stump, flicks this gently through the leg side to bring up 50 off 37 balls.
fullish length on the stumps, flicks this out to deep midwicket for one.
preText: Unadkat switches over the stumps to Bairstow.

text: full and wide outside off, Dhawan drags this drive back through mid-on for one.
preText: Back around the stumps now to Dhawan.

wkt_text: JM Bairstow  b Unadkat 12 (21m 13b 1x4 0x6) SR: 92.30
text: slower ball at 103 kph produces a drag on! Good length ball angled across off stump, Bairstow tries to heave this over midwicket but is through the shot early and drags a bottom edge onto the stumps.
postText: Sanket: "@peter it's not about who's batting or what kind of pedigree he has regarding the retired out.its about how they are playing in this game despite scoring 40 Dhawan isn't striking as good as he usually does." It's taken 15 seasons for the first tactical retired out in the IPL, and now everyone is expecting it to happen in every single match. Hold your horses folks!

text: slower ball at 107 kph lands full on off, prodded gently into the off side for one.
preText: One Englishman replaces another. Liam Livingstone has arrived.
postText:
Strategic timeout taken.

Huzaifa: "I dont like this whole retire out thing. What I can see happening is teams retiring in and out a batter for matchups. This I feel is bad for the skills of batsmen because they can avoid facing unwanted bowlers. Retiring out cannot be the solution, batters improving their game should be". Well, they've been doing that in baseball for generations. Left-handed pinch hitter is sent up to hit and the other team replaces their right-handed pitch with a left-handed relief pitcher. So now cricket is catching up if so.

text: low full toss at shin height, Livingstone doesn't punish the misfired attempted yorker and instead prods it down the ground for one.
preText: Bumrah being brought back in the 15th for his third over.

text: full again on the stumps, simple punch down the ground again for one.

wkt_text: LS Livingstone  b Bumrah 2 (6m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66
text: 143 kph bread and butter yorker! So much for all the people flooding the feedback desperate for a tactical retired out so Livingstone could enter. Bumrah slings in a missile at the base of middle stump and Livingstone can't jam the bat down in time to keep it out.
searches for yorker again on middle at 141 kph, Jitesh is able to blunt it out to mid-on for one.
yorker on off stump, jammed out into the off side for one.
yorker on middle, defended to mid-off.
postText: Aagam: "Why are comparing cricket with baseball? just because they've got a "bat"?" Count your lucky stars I'm not comparing it to Elvis songs, craps tables, comic book movies or WWE wrestlers.

text: fullish length on middle and leg, goes to prod this into midwicket and misses, big lbw shout denied as the ball caroms into the off side for one. Inside edge on the replay so a DRS review would've been wasted. In fact they have called for DRS, so it will be a wasted review.
postText: Feroz Dhanani: "Just remember guy. If retired out was so common we would never have seen Tewatia pull off what he did at Sharjah"

text: back of a length on fourth stump at 133 kph, guided to deep third man for one.
back of a length on fifth stump at 135 kph, goes to cut and is beaten.

uppercut just clears short third man on the ring! Not quite as much pace on this scrambled seam delivery from Mills on fifth stump, Dhawan leans back to ramp this up over the ring and a leaping effort by the fielder goes in vain.
short and wide at 140 kph, slices a cut straight to backward point.
postText: Kirky: "What was going on with that review? Surely the first spike was the ball hitting the strap of the front pad?" No. The first spike was the bat hitting the back pad. The ball was nowhere near the front pad on the down the pitch camera angle.

text: length ball on fifth stump, swats this through midwicket for one.
postText: Gp: "No comparison between Cricket and Baseball. Latter is just about throw the ball hit the ball, where in Cricket there are so many types of bowling which requires lot of skill, so many different stroke plays. Can you compare Cover drive with any of the slogs from Baseball?" There isn't enough time between deliveries for me to deconstruct how wrong and overly simplistic you are summarizing another very very nuanced and strategic sport.

text: yorker on middle at 134 kph, jammed out into the leg side for one.
preText: Basil Thampi back for his third over.

text: yorker again on middle, jammed out to extra cover for one.
postText: itzvinay: "Call it my cynicism but this is exactly what the traditional cricket fans have been fearing - cricket turning into baseball. And voila, we seem to have arrived at that point! Whether it is better or worse - is a philosophical debate."

text: another attempted yorker on leg stump at 139 kph, shuffle down the track and toes this with a shovel over the bowler to mid-on for one.
hello! And Goodbye over deep midwicket! Fullish length ball at 137 kph on middle, Dhawan heaves this across the line sailing 15 rows back.
postText: Nandhana: "@PDP Gonna have to agree with you. Every sport is beautiful and difficult in its own way. You can never summarize a sport in 2-3 words."

text: full on off stump, driven back down the ground to long-off for a well-run two.
postText: Kris: "Well said @PDP from a Blue Jays Fan ! Lots of physics and fluid flow involved in pitches too"

wkt_text: S Dhawan c Pollard b Basil Thampi 70 (91m 50b 5x4 3x6) SR: 140.00
text: another slower ball produces a wicket. Fullish length ball on middle, Dhawan tries to go over the leg side again but splices this high to long-on. Pollard stands 10 yards inside the rope and waits a few seconds for the ball to come down into his hands at chest height.

almost another wicket on an offcutter. Unadkat floats this full on sixth stump and the drive is sliced high and wide of Pollard at long-off, he tries to reach a hand up to smack it back into play but it just clears him.
postText: Fazu: "The difference between Tewatia and Ashwin is, Ashwin was sent to stop the collapse rather than risking a power hitter Riyan during middle overs, whereas Tewatia was a finisher who was expected to do that role.. Can't compare both!!"

text: fuller and straighter on off, driven firmly and wide of long-off, another effort from Pollard diving left can't save a boundary.
shot of the day over extra cover! Another attempted slower ball at 108 kph wide outside off, Sharma isn't fooled and smokes this flat over the rope landing 15 yards beyond the LCD ad boards.
preText: Unadkat switches around the stumps now.

text: slower bouncer on the body, Sharma tries to pull and is hit in the ribs.
preText: Unadkat switches back over the stumps.
postText: Manu Ajmani: "Whoever is saying baseball cannot be compared to cricket because its a throw the ball and hit the ball sport has never faced a curve ball in their life. The only similarity between baseball and cricket is the games can get very tensed and very interesting in the matter of a few minutes." They are both great sports in their own right.

text: fullish length ball on fourth stump, goes to heave and drags this gently through square leg for one.
slower bouncer is too high to play a pull shot, wide called on height.

well this is a tactical reverse ramp over third man for boundary! Full on off, shuffles across and flicks this back over the ring. Jonty Rhodes in the PBKS dugout lets fly with a few expletives to underscore how Sharma punished that delivery.
yorker on the stumps, jammed out through the ring for one.
fullish length on off, goes for a big leg side heave and a thick edge is sliced over short third man for two.
attempted yorker is a shin height full toss on off, punched back through long-off for one.
yorker on off, jammed out tamely through long-on for one.
postText: JPR: "@Fazu Tewatia got his much deserved identity after that Knock. He was not known as a finisher before that. If Retired Out was made when he was struggling with the ball we couldn't have witnessed an Confident Tewatia after that. Confidence redefined on that day."

text: yorker on fifth stump, jammed out past extra cover and long-off Pollard circles around to relay in for two.
postText: Piyush: "@PDP. Every sport is beautiful so never a point in comparing without understanding the nuances. For those who dont know, knuckle ball in cricket was a contribution of baseball. :)"

text: 143 kph yorker on fourth stump, shuffles well across his stumps to flick this out to wide long-on for one.
yorker full on off, jammed out through long-off for one.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Shahrukh Khan, SIX
text: kaboom! Thampi misfires searching for yorker, instead it lands full on middle and Shahrukh slaughters this 20 rows back over long-on.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Shahrukh Khan, 1 wide
text: bouncer sails over Shahrukh, wide called on height.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Shahrukh Khan, SIX
text: another misfired yorker at 139 kph targeting the wide guidelines, lands too full and Shahrukh crushes this flat over Pollard watching helplessly at long-off.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Shahrukh Khan, 1 wide
text: wide yorker almost lands off the pitch outside off, left alone and wide called.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Shahrukh Khan, OUT
wkt_text: M Shahrukh Khan  b Basil Thampi 15 (17m 6b 0x4 2x6) SR: 250.00
text: yorker finally lands on the proper length at 142 kph on sixth stump, Shahrukh tries to punch this out through the off side and it tails in late to produce an inside edge that cannons back into off stump.
swinging in, tucked away off the hip for one
preText:
Welcome back for the chase. Out come Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan. Can one of them get the better of Kagiso Rabada and become part of our Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Who has the best strike rate against Kagiso Rabada in the IPL (min 25 balls)?

Vaibhav Arora has the new ball in hand. Rohit to face. Third man and fine leg back. One slip in.

shortText: Arora to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: short of a length, angling away, punched to the covers
opens the face on this one to get a single to third man
looks for the ramp, Arora goes wide, and he gets a top edge over the first slip for four
left alone outside off

connects with the ramp this time. That is a shot decided on the analysis table the way he has gone down on a knee twice in the first over. The fine leg is square, and he has got this fine enough of him
Kishan is late on this one. At the wicket, slight shape away, and the outside edge goes down and through to third man for one
preText: Rabada sharing the new ball

text: dreamy little cover-drive. No foot movement, just extending his arms into this wide length ball. Through extra cover it goes
Rabada goes wider, asking if he fancies another drive. Rohit doesn't. Leaves it alone
outside edge. Soft hands to defend this wide length ball, and the edge goes right down, wide of slip, but fine of third man. Odean Smith dives but can't keep it in
that's a bit of a waft at a wide length ball. Beaten
wide length ball, left alone

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: on a length, angling in, slight seam too perhaps, beats the inside edge, hits the thigh pad
preText: Arshdeep Singh to bowl now

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: slight shimmy down, Arshdeep drags the length back, Kishan cuts it to square third man

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Sharma, no run
text: shuffling across to look to work this to leg, Arshdeep gets it to swing back in and beat his pad. A touch too high for the lbw

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Sharma, no run
text: after the last ball that swung, this one goes with the angle, and perhaps seams a touch. Rohit ends up stabbing at it, and gets a thick edge to point
tracks the movement back in this tine, and pushes this into the leg side for one. Chahar's throw from the deep is on the half-volley and goes for an overthrow
short of a length, angling across, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, wide, square-driven off the back foot but can't get it past backward point
thick outside edge as Rabada pitches this up and gets some shape away. The ball goes down and square to point
superb shot. Clears the front leg and goes inside-out over extra cover. Just a touch too full, and he opens the face on the drive and doesn't bother keeping it down

wkt_text: RG Sharma c Arora b Rabada 28 (17m 17b 3x4 2x6) SR: 164.70
text: Rabada handcuffs Rohit. He is surprised by this short one, which doesn't give him any room. He tries to short-arm pull it, but gets a massive top edge. Vaibhav Arora gets around from short fine leg, and takes s safe catch. Rohit just didn't have room to push his hands through this one
short of a length, good carry, Brevis stays inside the line
preText: Brevis is the new man, facing his future South Africa team-mate

text: swings at thin air. Rabada pitches it up slightly, Brevis looks to loft him down the ground, but is beaten by the movement back in. The length is not full enough to hit the wicket

wkt_text: Ishan Kishan c †Sharma b Arora 3 (21m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: lovely delivery. Slight shape back in, pitches on a length, middle and leg, and then seams away to take his outside edge. A T20 wicket on a defensive shot. Superb bowling
full, angling away, beats his drive
preText: Arora comes back now that Rohit is out

text: wide length ball, gets the bottom edge for a single to third man
preText: Tilak Varma is the new batter. Arora goes round the wicket immediately

text: big swing back in from outside off, hits Brevis in the thigh pad. Arora is excited in his lbw appeal but this is always sailing over
it's moving both ways. Brevis walks at him, setting himself up to loft an inswinger down the ground, but this one leaves him and beats him
really full, opens the face on it, can't beat the man at point
big swing at a wide length ball, looking to go over wide mid-on. Not even in the same post code as the ball moves away

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: wide length ball, runs it past slip for a single to third man
preText: Arshdeep is back to close out the powerplay

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Brevis, no run
text: finally Brevis makes a connection with a big swing, but hits this straight to mid-on

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Brevis, no run
text: shape in in the air, and then movement away after pitching. Beaten. The ball is doing much more for PBKS than it did for MI
lovely shot. Brevis finally makes a sweet connection. Short of a length, angling away, and he stands tall, meets it on the top of the bounce and punches it through cover
too full, which means Brevis can drive it hard despite the swing back in. Through mid-off it goes for four

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Brevis, no run
text: looks like an offcutter, he has to adjust his shot to the lack of pace. Defends to cover
short of a length, angling away, runs this down to third man for one
wide length ball, too wide, and called
preText: Odean Smith immediately after the powerplay

text: short ball, pulled away, not very convincingly, but the man at deep square leg is a few yards in. He has to back-peddle. Had he been on the fence, who knows
big swing down the ground, ends up playing down the wrong line. Beaten on the outside edge
driven hard but can't get it past mid-off. Does get the single, though

shortText: Smith to Tilak Varma, no run
text: looks to steer one to third man again, but finds the man to point. Just too close to him
short, but no room. Cut away to deep point for one
offbreak to the left-hand batter, Varma has no room, but he still looks to cut. The outside edge goes fine of short third man
preText: Liam Livingstone before Rahul Chahar

text: offbreak again, into the pads, punched to deep midwicket
legbreak to the right-hand batter now, but too short, and is cut away to deep cover
offbreak, short, wide, Varma is not missing out on this. Cuts this slightly in front of backward point for four
legbreak this time, hit back in the air, but just wide enough and quick enough to not give Livingstone to catch this
driven hard but straight to extra cover
slightly short of a length, bottom edge on the pull, Varma gets a single
preText: Chahar to bowl now

text: walloped. Short again, and Brevis doesn't bother beating deep midwicket. He just smashes it back where it comes from, but at various times the speed. Four towards the sight screen
this one is into the sight screen. Superb straight drive back over his head. What a lovely clean swing of the bat. Needless to say, very AB-like
this has gone farther, but this one is not full enough so he has to drag it, which he does, and goes over wide long-on
thrice as nice. Chahar goes short and fast, Brevis is quick enough to pull this over wide long-on. Another sweet connection

this is sensational hitting. 6, 6, 6, 6. Zero respect. Absolute disdain. Chahar looks to hide this wide outside off, but he has bowled it too full, and Chahar lofts this over wide long-on again. All sweet, clean connections
postText: What an over. Chahar's costliest ever in the IPL. MI's win probability has gone up from 13.3% to 48.5%. PBKS need a timeout here

text: now everything is running for MI. Varma looks to pull, the angle takes the ball away, but the top edge flies over the keeper's head for nearly a six
preText: Arora into his third over

text: shuffles across to work this length ball into the leg side for one
walks at him, Arora bowls the slower one, he punches it down to long-on for one

shortText: Arora to Tilak Varma, no run
text: looks to cut it, but is beaten by the length. Just not short enough

superb shot. Uses all of Arora's pace. That seems to be the strategy against him. Rohit ramped him twice too. Varma goes deep into the crease, also gets inside the line of this short-of-a-length ball, and ramp-pulls this over short fine leg for a flat six
full, middle and off, driven to long-off for one
postText: Over to Peter Della Penna to take you to the end of this one

text: spectacular six over the off side! Short and wide, blazes a cut over backward point flat and beats the fielder leaping at the rope unable to knock it back into play.
preText:
Cheers Monga. Reminder, you can watch the match LIVE in the USA on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Odean Smith back into the attack.

shortText: Smith to Tilak Varma, no run
text: back of a length on off stump, defended.
full on the legs at 140 kph, flicked through square leg for one.
postText: Arjun: "From two teenagers, this is simply astonishing batting. "

text: short on sixth stump at 137 kph, Brewis backs away from leg stump trying to emulate Tilak with a cut over point but is beaten.
postText: Vishnuvardhan R: "That last six from Tilak remained me of Raina!!!"

text: dropped at deep third man! Full on fifth stump at 142 kph, Brewis goes hard at this and slashes a thick edge to deep third man, the fielder judges it very very poorly and is slow getting into position before lunging forward late and it slips through his hands. He should've been able to take it easily standing upright but makes a huge mess of it and it bounces to the rope to compound the error.

wkt_text: D Brevis c Arshdeep Singh b Smith 49 (37m 25b 4x4 5x6) SR: 196.00
text: the drop only costs four runs! Short on the body, Brevis slams a pull flat to deep backward square. Arshdeep is in perfect position and judges it very well coming 10 yards off the rope to pouch a head high catch.
short on off, goes back to pull to long-on for one.
preText: Suryakumar Yadav enters off strike.
postText: Brevis falls one short of becoming the youngest overseas player to score an IPL fifty. He'll have other chances to set that mark during the season for sure.

text: good length ball on fifth stump, prods at this and is beaten. Speculative stumping appeal goes to the third umpire but there didn't seem much excitement from the keeper. And the third umpire confirms that we've just wasted 90 seconds of our lives we'll never get back.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes back to flick to long-on for one.
full on leg stump, clears the front leg and heaves this flat to long-on for one.
another gem spins past an awkward prod on off stump on a good length.
good length ball on sixth stump, slapped to the cover sweeper for one.

length ball on fourth stump, heaved high and wide of deep square leg. The ball is in the air an eternity and Chahar circles around 30 yards but winds up five yards short and it plops into the turf for two.
preText: Arshdeep returns, around the wicket.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Yadav, no run
text: good length ball on off, goes to flick this away and misses off the body.

full on leg stump at 136 kph, heaves at this and a leading edge swirls to deep third man again where the ball is clumsily dropped once again at waist height, though it doesn't matter off the free hit in terms of a possible wicket, but they turn a single into two.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Yadav, 1 no ball
text: length ball seams in from sixth stump at 136 kph, lame swish by SKY misses. The no ball siren goes off and we'll have a free hit. Replays show he landed on the line, but not behind it.
short ball on the body after shuffling across the stumps, sits up for Yadav to cream with a pull high over deep backward square leg into the third row.

wkt_text: NT Tilak Varma run out 36 (46m 20b 3x4 2x6) SR: 180.00
text: horrible mixup results in a dreadful runout! Full on the stumps, flicked into midwicket. It was well wide of the fielder and Tilak sets off. Looked like an easy single on there but SKY is ball-watching at the striker's end. The fielder has plenty of time to throw to Arshdeep with Tilak stranded having completed 3/4 of a run. The bails come off with him 10 yards short. Tilak is spewing plenty of unrepeatable as he walks off.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Yadav, no run
text: full on the stumps, defended.
preText: Pollard enters at the non-striker's end.
postText:
Strategic timeout called.

Sami: "Beavis showing his potential an amazing innings. He provided what Kishan and Rohit havent this season which is a boost." Beavis? I hope you meant Brevis instead of the 1990s MTV cartoon character. Huh huh, huh huh huh. Heh. Heh heh heh. Heh heh. Huh huh huh.

text: good length ball on the legs, comes down the track but can't flick it away.
postText: Prateek: "The ball was straight to the fielder and there was no single there.. " I disagree. Tilak effectively ran one and a half runs for the distance he covered almost making it to the striker's end before trying to come back.

text: full on the stumps, uses his feet again and chips this over wide midwicket, boundary ride has no chance to cut it off.
full on seventh stump, goes to slog sweep over mid-on and miscues this to deep square leg for one.
postText: Eddy: "Brevis and Bathead?" *Flings hair back to rock and roll*

text: short and wide, slaps this to backward point.
short and wide on sixth stump, slaps this through cover for one.
full on seventh stump, heaves a one-handed tennis backhand into midwicket for one.
postText: Deepankar DM: "Agreed with PDP. Risky - yes - but the run was on." It's a T20, not a Test match. If that's a Test match, you don't try a run there. But in the second half of a T20 innings chasing 199, that's a run you go for.

text: full on the stumps, heaves this off an inside edge to deep square leg for one.
yorker on fourth stump at 140 kph, jammed out wide of the keeper and they can't steal a run.
slower ball lands on a good length at 111 kph on fifth stump, SKY launches a pull flat over midwicket into the second row.
length ball again on sixth stump this time at 136 kph, goes to drive and an inside edge skittles past off stump to deep fine leg for one.
short and wide, slices this to short third man.
yorker on middle at 139 kph, jammed out straight to midwicket.
postText: Sachin: "These two more than capable of chasing 60 in last 6. They will target that one over from Smith or Livingston."

text: full on sixth stump, driven straight to the cover sweeper for one.
googly lands on a good length on middle and leg, spins in past an attempted midwicket flick and hits the pads but it was missing leg stump.
charges a full ball dragged wide on seventh stump, toe drags this through midwicket for one.
length ball on middle, sliced out to backward point.
postText: Deepankar Mukhe: "Rahul's mental fortitude has to be applauded here. Going for 29 in the first over "

text: full on fifth stump, driven to the extra cover sweeper for one.
googly on fourth stump on a good length, prods this off an inside edge into midwicket for one.
postText: H. Prasanna: "What an amazing comeback from Chahar to keep the team still in the game!"

wkt_text: KA Pollard run out 10 (18m 11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 90.90
text: Pollard runs himself out trying to steal a second off a misfield! Full on sixth stump, Pollard drives to long-on and slow jogs the first run. Odean Smith fumbles and SKY suddenly calls for two. There's hesitation from both of them, Pollard puts his hands up to signal he doesn't want to run but then sets off late. SKY stops midway then keeps going. A huge mess. The relay from Smith to the keeper is in time as the bails come off with Pollard two yards short. If Pollard ran the first run hard, there was definitely two there, but he got himself into trouble by slow jogging/walking the first run.
length ball flirting with the wide guidelines, Pollard shuffles past off stump to heave and misses. The ball is just outside the guideline but Pollard moved a long way, harshly called a wide.
back of a length on fourth stump at 132 kph, punched away for one.
postText: Ishan L: "That run-out, again, was fully on SKY. He's single-handedly run out two of our best hitters". I disagree. Pollard has to run the first run hard. Yadav was busting it the whole way on the first run and Pollard wasn't. That's where the door opened for the runout to happen. Smith's fumble was bad enough to open the door for an easy two.

text: back of a length on sixth stump at 137 kph, chops this into the ground to the keeper.
postText: Sunil: "Anyone else wondering why Pollard hasnt been dropped from MI team? I also think Tim in the team today instead of Thampi would have helped with the chase"

text: what a shot! Full and wide, slices hard at this and the drive goes very square over cover point into the stands, really over backward point.
goodness he outdoes himself with this one! Wide yorker on sixth stump, again he drives inside out using the pace to slice this flat over deep backward point.
length ball on sixth stump, slaps this to the off side sweeper for one.
postText: Himanshu : "It was definitely Suryas fault in both the runouts. Ball watching in one and not aware of what you partner is doing and running blindly. Pollard clearly put his hand up. Surya can run 4 too but won't help if his partner has said no. "

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Yadav, no run
text: yorker speared in on the legs at 133 kph, misses a flick and a stifled lbw shout is turned down.
preText: Arshdeep returns around the stumps.
postText: WhyTheHate: "Why are people hating on Surya? Tilak was out because he had a start and didn't see the ball. Surya was on backfoot and was not in a position to make to danger end. Pollard was clearly his own fault for just jogging in for first run while the run rate is increasing. "

text: bouncer on sixth stump, goes to pull and top edges this over the keeper for... one? More very slow running. Should have been an easy two and now Unadkat is on strike.
postText: rishi: "i think sky has the "reverse helicopter"...look at those wrists.." Mighty strong to hit back to back sixes in that manner over backward point.

text: full on off stump at 140 kph, miscues a drive over cover and falls into no man's land to be able to come back for two.
postText: Bharat Jakati: "Pollard's fault. Can't be ambling your first run in a crunch chase like this."

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Unadkat, no run
text: wide yorker on fifth stump at 139 kph, Unadkat clears the front leg for a big heave and misses.
postText: Rejith: "@Himanshu, I partly agree. When you need 12 RPO, you need to look at all opportunities to score runs. You don't expect complacency in running at this stage of the game. Surya was right in looking for opportunity of a run, just that Pollard wasn't."

text: yorker again, this time jammed out into cover for one.
postText: Deepankar DM: "Jogging and Putting your hand up to deny a run may be enough to transfer the blame, but it's not good enough to win matches. Not T20s, especially of this stature. You need to turn ones into twos to win, not the other way around."

text: goes for yorker again, winds up as a low full toss at shin height on off stump at 139 kph, driven to long-on for one to keep the strike for the 18th.
postText: Darshin: "Stop blaming Pollard guys. You can't expect a dump truck speeding at the speed of a Ferrari! Expect too much!" The problem was that the dump truck wasn't running period. If Pollard puts in a straightforward effort running the first, they come back for an easy two.

text: searches for yorker and it goes pear-shaped on leg stump! Low full toss on the pads at shin height, flicked with ease through backward square to the rope.
preText: 28 off 12. Rabada to bowl the 19th.

text: yorker on the money this time on off stump at 138 kph, jammed out into square leg, these two hustle all the way on the first run and are able to capitalize on a sloppy misfield by Chahar charging in so they get two in the end.
knee high full toss on middle stump at 138 kph, punched straight to long-on... and Unadkat turns down the single from the non-striker's end so SKY stays on strike.

wkt_text: SA Yadav c Smith b Rabada 43 (44m 30b 1x4 4x6) SR: 143.33
text: knee high full toss on middle stump, could've easily disappeared over long-on for six but flubs the heave trying to clear long-on! It goes straight up in the air to Odean Smith 10 yards inside the rope for a straightforward catch at chest height. Smith slams the ball down in a raucous celebration!
postText: Should they have taken the single on the previous ball? Hmmm....

text: Length ball on sixth stump, slaps this off the toe back to Rabada.
back of a length ball on the wide guideline, Ashwin shuffles way outside off and then tries to fiddle this fine through third man but misses.
postText: James L: "At this level of cricket, you can't be shielding a number 7 from strike." The No. 7 wanted to shield himself! SKY wanted a single there but it was Unadkat who didn't want to run.

text: Smith gets his clock cleaned over midwicket! Bangs it in short on the body, Unadkat blitzes a pull over the car sponsor over the rope and just short of the seats.
preText: Odean Smith returns with 22 required off the last over.
postText: If he can hit the ball like that, then why on earth did he turn down the single at the non-striker's end in the last over?

text: angles this ball full across Unadkat on sixth stump, Unadkat smashes a drive off the lower end of the bat but very straight toward long-off. The fielder on the boundary is very wide and they come back for an easy two.
preText: Smith comes around the wicket now.

wkt_text: JD Unadkat c Agarwal b Smith 12 (23m 7b 0x4 1x6) SR: 171.42
text: another fullish length ball angled across sixth stump, Unadkat goes for a huge heave back over long-on but skies this over extra cover. Mayank backpedals from extra cover on the ring and takes a safe catch at rib height 10 yards from the edge of the circle.

wkt_text: JJ Bumrah c Dhawan b Smith 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: length ball on fourth stump, slices this high over short third man. Dhawan runs from backward point to circle around and complete another catch before doing his customary thigh slap celebration.
postText: Two sixes for a super over anyone?

text: angled short and way outside off, too wide outside the guideline for Bumrah to reach. Wide called.
preText: Bumrah comes out on strike with Smith staying around the stumps.

text: Back of a length ball on middle, Mills sends a stiff breeze to midwicket with a wild heave but the ball passes through to the keeper.
preText: Tymal Mills enters on strike.

wkt_text: TS Mills c Agarwal b Smith 0 (3m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: triple-wicket over for Odean Smith to end the match! Length ball on fourth stump, another top-edged slice finds Mayank in the ring at extra cover for another chest high catch. PBKS win by 12 runs.
postText:
11.28 pm Mumbai were well ahead on the worm at the halfway stage of the chase with plenty of wickets in hand too, but things unraveled after the fall of Brevis followed by the chaotic (and preventable) runouts of Tilak and Pollard.

Gautam: "Where MI lost the tournament is at Auction Table".

Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma: "There's hardly anything to find out from that game. I thought we played the game pretty well, came pretty close towards the back end of our batting innings. It's just that a couple of crucial runouts there was not needed, but that happens. At one stage we were cruising through and keeping up with the run rate as well, but in the end we couldn't hold our nerves. Credit to Kings with the way they bowled at the back end. [On changing batting order] If you're not winning games, you've got to try to find a way you can succeed as a team as a batting group. So we're trying to find different ideas, different thought processes. It doesn't seem to be working at the moment but I don't want to take anything away from the guys. We fought pretty well. We batted brilliantly, but they held their nerves pretty good, the Kings, and they won the game. We've been not playing good cricket for awhile and that's why we've been on the losing side, simple as that. The Kings batted pretty well up front and put pressure on our bowlers, got a 90-100 run partnership to begin with. But I thought 190+ was chaseable on that pitch because that pitch was really good to bat on as you saw when we were batting as well. We just have to go back and see what we do as a team."

PBKS bowler Odean Smith: [About the last over] I was thinking it was such a coincidence that within four games I find myself in the same situation. What doesn't kill me makes you stronger. I just went out there and backed my best balls and it came through for us. [On coming around the wicket] Most of the guys hit the ball straight or leg side. I talked to Shikhar and he said this guy doesn't cut the ball or scoop of anything. I thought it would be harder for him to get me straight down the ground or through the leg side if I was going across him."

PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal has been named Player of the Match: "It was a good night, very very happy to contribute to the team's win but the crucial thing for us was the two points. I can't really say that it was just the runs on the board. I thought this game had a lot of ups and downs, there were a lot of crucial moments and more often than not we were nailing those crucial moments and winning those crucial moments. Somehow or the other, when the game was 50/50, those moments came towards us. So it wasn't just the batting. It was those periods of the game. At the start of the tournament, we said that's the brand of cricket we want to play. We want to play aggressive, hard cricket, and with that we need to show good intent. I think this time around we were a lot smarter with the bat as well. So we showed great intent but we were a lot smarter so that we could keep wickets in hand and use the death as well. I thought in the last game against Gujarat, we gave wickets to Rashid when it wasn't required. But this time we were a lot more aware and careful. We made sure to not give wickets to their main bowlers and if it's your day, you have to take the team through. It can get hard. Credit to Brevis the way he took on Rahul and got the better of him, but then a great comeback from Rahul as well. After that one over, the other three overs he bowled were tight. Obviously when Tilak and Brevis were going the way they were going, we had to change our strategy and get into the main bowlers to try to get a wicket and luckily that happened through a runout. We don't rely on just Rabada, yes he leads the attack for us but we have two other guys to come and do that. It's nice and very happy to have three wins. I think we're playing good cricket overall and if we get 5-10% better every game, I think we'll go on to do special things."

That's it for our IPL coverage today. Come back tomorrow for more IPL action. On behalf of Sid Monga, I'm Peter Della Penna. Keep your eyes peeled for post-match coverage from KK and the rest of the crew. Take care!

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Gaikwad, no run
text: On the money first ball. Fullish around off with a hint of movement away. Defended solidly towards covers.
preText:
Mohammed Siraj with the new ball. Gaikwad has scored 25 off the 17 balls faced against him without being dismissed yet. All set to start. A slip in place. Here we go!

Out come the Royal Challengers fielders followed by the Super King openers Robin Uthappa and Ruturaj Gaikwad. Uthappa has been getting of to fliers and would be aiming to do so again against the new ball, given that spin could come into play earlier, owing to the used surface. Gaikwad isn't having a good run but a small solace could be that he wouldn't have to contend with the left-arm angle of David Willey.

Thanks Shashank! 200th game for CSK in the IPL. Will it be a memorable outing for the four-time champs? They'd have to do a difficult task, as far as this IPL is concerned, in order to get out on the right side - post a total and defend it.

Five minutes to go for the first ball. It's a good time to welcome Sudarshanan.

Bala says: "With their batting also not clicking as per expectations, CSK should have brought in Conway in place of Theekshana and Hangrekar in place of Choudhary. They need to manage their bowling through Jordan, Bravo, Jadu, Moeen, Hangarekar and Shivam. At least they can have a good total to defend by strengthening their batting through Conway and Hangarekar."

ESPNcricinfo's T20 Time Out is now live. Join Sanjay Manjrekar and Chris Lynn.



Heads calls Faf. Heads it is. RCB opt to bowl. Josh Hazlewood makes his RCB debut against his former team. Willey has been left out. Suyash Prabhudesai, the allrounder, gets his first game. CSK are unchanged.

RCB: Faf, Rawat, Kohli, Maxwell, Shahbaz, Karthik, Hasaranga, Prabhudesai, Hazlewood, Siraj, Akash Deep

CSK: Uthappa, Gaikwad, Moeen, Dube, Rayudu, Dhoni, Jadeja, Bravo, Choudhary, Jordan, Theekshana

Mustafa Moudi says: "More than the absence of Chahar, I am more concerned about the absence of Harshal Patel. I was desperately waiting for another Jadeja Vs Harshal encounter after that epic over."

Rathnawhale : "Bowling seems to be CSK's biggest weakness. They need to get Milne back in for some much needed oomph factor."

Let's hear the coaches speak.

CSK head coach Stephen Fleming: "We need improvement in all areas. We've had some moments but they haven't been complete. We don't like to be desperate and getting anxious. But we need to get points soon. It's not derogatory to anyone but we are missing Deepak Chahar and Adam Milne due to injuries and their experience would have been good. We are finding combination to pick wickets and it's no secret that we rely on spin. (Auction strategy) We knew we weren't going to be in Chennai. But it's a group keeping in mind the three years. We're working hard on learning about the players and how they do."

RCB assistant coach Sridharan Sriram: "We have prepared well. The auction planning was done well and the roles were defined well. As a result, we had replacements for Maxwell, Hazlewood when they weren't avaialble. We always had faith in what DK could do and were clear about his batting position. There were very less finishers in the auction and Dinesh's experience is unmatched. The way he sets fields and angles and his contributions on the field are vital. Won't take anything for granted. CSK are a brilliant side. We have had a better start and it's about turning up on the day and starting strong."

Pitch Report now: The same strip as yesterday but an extra day of sunshine means that it is very, very dry. "It's quite dusty," says Graeme Swann after running his hand over it. "It'll support spin and I'd love to bowl on this pitch. Seamers should avoid digging the ball in as it won't work." Swann as well as Sunil Gavaskar feel that 170-180 should be a safe score.

Dinesh Karthik: (On wife Dipika Pallikal winning WSF doubles) "It's a happy household and is a good sign," he says. "Very, very happy for my wife, she's back after a four-year hiatus. Must admit I have thoroughly enjoyed being part of this team. Outside the field the friendships I have developed, conversations we have had, I have enjoyed it a lot. (As a finisher) It's about assessing the situation and using your experience. I have enjoyed the clarity that has been given to me. (Laughs when asked if this is the year for RCB) I am not a man for prediction and I must say we are looking good for the moment."

Have you checked out our Ask Cricinfo feature? Any stat query and we've got you covered through our voice assistant. Our good friends at Maruti Suzuki present the first ASKcricinfo stat of the day: Who have the poorest economy rates in IPL 2022 (min 12 overs)?

6.30pm Greetings and a warm welcome to all of you! It's a classic IPL rivalry this evening. CSK v RCB - the southern derby. Faf du Plessis v his beloved former team. There's going to be a lot of mixed emotions tonight. Get ready for a roller-coaster ride.

CSK dearly need a win. Can tonight be the night that kickstarts their turnaround? I'm Shashank Kishore. With me on commentary through the evening is S Sudarshanan. Stay locked.

Those in the USA can watch the action LIVE on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

text: Length ball outside off, tapped towards point for a quick run to get going.
Fullish well outside off, Uthappa gets it off the outer edge of his blade to third man to get off the mark.
preText: Andrew: "Early Prediction! Siraj to have 4 for!" Wow!

text: This is what lack of form does to you. Gaikwad looks to leave the length ball outside off alone. A bit of fortune for him though as the ball goes off the edge past the slip and to the rope.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Gaikwad, no run
text: On a length in the fourth stump channel, defended towards off.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Gaikwad, no run
text: Length ball on middle, defended to the on side. Decent start for both sides.
preText: The Bangalore players are wearing black arm-bands. Their team-mate Harshal Patel lost his sister earlier this week.

text: Starts with a length ball in the sixth stump line, Uthappa gets forward and presents a straight bat in defense.
preText:
Josh Hazlewood to run in from the other end. His RCB debut against his former side CSK.

Krishna: "CSK will either hit rock-bottom in this match or win the Match to turn around their fortunes."

text: A bit fuller, around off, worked to mid-on for none.
Quick run! Takes on Faf's arm does Uthappa. Pushes it back past the non-striker and hares to the bowler's end even as du Plessis gets to his left from mid-on. Direct hit would have been curtains.
preText: Ashwin: "Ruturaj to get a 50 and go on a crazy run streak after this game" Seeing some really crazy prediction tonight.

text: Outside off on a length, steered to third man for a single.
Back of a length around off, punches it straight to Faf at mid-on.
Fuller than a good length on off, driven straight to mid-off. Just two from the over, Uthappa has been quiet too today.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Gaikwad, no run
text: Beautifully driven but straight to the fielder. Overpitched around off, finds wide mid-off with the drive.
That sounded well! Short in length, Gaikwad stays back and pulls it aerially in front of square on the leg side for four.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Gaikwad, no run
text: Good length outside off, leans into the drive and straight to covers.
Angling in on a length, plays it with soft hands through midwicket for a couple. The pressure created by the batters makes Maxwell there fumble.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Gaikwad, no run
text: Back of a length around off and middle, Ruturaj taps it to the off side and wants one. Sent back as Siraj gets to the ball quickly.
Back of a length outside off, guides it wide of the fly slip for one.
preText: Deep square leg in place.

text: That's smooth as silk. This is what Gaikwad is capable of when in flow. Gets right behind that length ball, uses the very little width on offer. Cuts it through cover-point and third man had no chance running to his right. Highest score this season for him already.
preText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Who has the poorest batting average in IPL 2022 (min 4 innings)?

text: Finds backward point this time with dab off the back of the length ball.
Another length ball outside off, guided straight to backward point.

wkt_text: RD Gaikwad lbw b Hazlewood 17 (19m 16b 3x4 0x6) SR: 106.25
text: Gaikwad is ruled out lbw. Height the factor? He asks for the review. He didn't connect the attempted heave off a length ball and got hit on the back thigh. Surely high? No! Clipping the stumps! One of those things that goes against you when you are not it form. Looked good but has to walk back. CSK don't lose a review even though they lose a wicket.
Fuller on off, driven straight to covers.
preText: Moeen Ali strides out at No. 3. Cue for Glenn Maxwell to come on in the next over?

text: Length ball on off, punched towards mid-off.
preText: A mini Ashes battle here in Moeen versus Hazlewood. A slip in place.

text: Length ball outside off, steered to wide third man for a single.
preText: Meanwhile, in other sporting news, Mumbai City FC scripted history late yesterday night. They beat Air Force Club (Iraq) to become the first Indian club to win a match in Asia's highest-level club competition, the AFC Champions League. It wasn't pretty, but historic firsts rarely are. This is how they did it

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Ali, no run
text: Length ball angling away, punched back to the bowler.
preText: Vishal: "And all the strange predictions remains a distant dream."

text: Edged but well wide of slip. Goes for the drive against the fullish ball angling away. Towards third man for a run that gets him off zero.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Uthappa, no run
text: Outside off on a length, Uthappa defends it towards cover-point. This has been a bit different from him this season.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Uthappa, no run
text: Trying to do something different. Three of nine now for Uthappa. Walked towards the off side and used his wrists to try and play it wide of mid-on. Finds Rawat there, just short of him.

Managed to breach the fortress on the off side. In the sixth stump line on a length, Uthappa frees his arms and cuts it through cover-point. The point, cover-point and covers were quite tight and yet he found the gap.
Pushes it towards mid-off for a quick one, where Faf misfields.
preText:
Akash Deep to bowl the final over of the powerplay. A wide slip, short third and backward point in position. Covers and mid-off complete the circle on the off side.

"It pains me, it physically pains me to see Faf in RCB colors. " Get used to it now, Ram.

text: Length ball around off, flicked aerially to the man in the deep in front of square on the leg side.
Back of a length on the pads, gets an inside edge onto his pads for a single.

shortText: Akash Deep to Uthappa, no run
text: Once again Uthappa trying something different. Gets a length ball outside off, on his pads as he is already outside off. Misses the flick though.
Straight as arrow for a maximum! Will this get Uthappa and CSK going? In the slot outside off, goes straight over the bowler's head for a 76-metre hit.

shortText: Akash Deep to Uthappa, 1 leg bye
text: Short ball, misses the pull. Gets it off the back thigh for a leg bye. 35/1 at the end of the powerplay.
On a length around off, Uthappa goes for the punch but gets an inside edge onto his back pad.
preText: Big show on! Glenn Maxwell. To Uthappa first up. 100th IPL match for Maxi. Starts from around the stumps.

text: Flatter around off, punched off the back foot through midwicket for one.
A bit short outside off, Moeen presents a straight bat off the back foot.
preText: Footmarks already outside the left-hander's off stump. Moeen has been dismissed twice by Maxwell in the 15 balls he has faced from him in T20 cricket

wkt_text: MM Ali run out 3 (16m 8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 37.50
text: Sensational fielding display. Suyash Prabhudessai making an impression early in the game. Flatter and quicker outside off, cut towards backward point. Seemed to be passing the fielder but for a diving stop. Moeen was down in search of a run and stood no chance of getting back after an accurate throw to the wicketkeeper.
Full on off, driven back.
preText: Shivam Dube in at four in the seventh over.

text: Outside off this time, played through cover to get going.
Timed nicely. Angling away on a length, punched through point for one.
preText: Sachinfan: "that runout was poetry in motion"

text: Placed well. On a length well outside off, Uthappa just had to guide it past short third man. Sways back and does so. His second four.
Back of a length on off, punched down to long-on for one.
Second four in the over. Erring in line, Akash Deep, pays the price. Short but well down leg, gets enough bat to get it fine to the leg side fence.

shortText: Akash Deep to Dube, no run
text: Middles the push straight to covers. Was angling away on a length.

shortText: Akash Deep to Dube, no run
text: Shortish again, makes room but finds backward point with the push. Ten runs off the over, the most expensive so far.
Quicker on the leg, misses the flick. Maxwell appeals but he is the only one.
preText: Arjun Yadav : "Not understanding this slow paced batting from CSK. Bowling has been there problem so far. They need to make atleast 20 runs more than the par score and for that purpose they need to capitalise powerplay. " RCB have not allowed them to get off the blocks quickly.

text: Quicker around leg, pushed through wide mid-on for one.
Slower through the air around off, guided to short third.
Dube goes high and long. Leading run-getter so far for CSK and shows in the confidence. Tossed up around middle, in his arc. Swings his arm for a 94-metre six over long-on.
Slower through the air around middle and leg, defended.
Half-tracker outside off, punched to the sweeper for one.
postText: Nine overs done and it's time for the first time-out of the match. I suspect a lot of talking will be done in the CSK camp than the RCB one. "A bit of hold on the surface for the spinners and we could get the job done," says Maxwell about the surface talking to the broadcaster via the spider-cam.

shortText: Shahbaz Ahmed to Dube, no run
text: Almost sneaks through. Tossed up outside off, Dube looks to flick it away, gets it off the inside edge to short fine leg.
preText: The left-arm spin of Shahbaz Ahmed now.

text: Quicker on middle, worked through square leg for one.
A touch short outside off, slapped to deep point for one.
Floated full outside off, worked away with the turn through midwicket for a single.
Short again and wide, a bit of turn. Uthappa goes back and has to reach out as he gets it through covers for one.
Saw Dube charging down and shortened his length a touch. Worked away through square leg for one. Good start for Shahbaz.
postText: Both Faf and DK are seen having a word with Shahbaz after the over.

shortText: de Silva to Dube, no run
text: Tossed up wrong one, Dube goes for the big one immediately but connects with only thin air.
preText: Wanindu Hasaranga is into the attack. Hasn't had the best of times against lefties. Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Here's a Wanindu Hasaranga's bowling average against right- and left-handers in IPL 2022.

text: Connects and connects well. Tossed up ball around middle again, full enough for Dube to connect. Sends it into the orbit over long-on for half a dozen.
Flatter and quicker outside off, slapped past the diving cover fielder for one.
Tossed up around off, gets it off the inner half through backward square leg for one.
Dube manages to fined the gap. Short in length, Dube goes back deep in the crease and pulls it through midwicket. Splits the gap in the deep to earn for more.
preText: Long-on, deep midwicket and deep square leg on the leg side.

text: Fuller on the pads, driven to long-on for a single to retain strike. Productive over that, 13 coming off it.
preText: Gets deep midwicket finer.

text: Shortish around off, cramps Dube for room. Does well to nudge it through square leg for one.
Shortish again, Uthappa goes back to cut it through point for a couple. A bit less turn meant that he could make good contact.
Flatter and shorter outside off, punched straight to sweeper for one.
preText: Chants of Kohli, Kohli at the DY Patil.

text: Pure timing but Prabhudessai at it again. This time he runs to his right from deep point and saves a couple. It was a full ball outside off, Dube timed it well to get past backward point.
Dube is in the mood. Clears the longest part of the ground with ease. Floated full around middle, goes with the turn and clears deep midwicket.
Flatter outside off, pushed to covers for a single to bring up the 50-run partnership off just 32 balls.
preText: Shahbaz comes around the wicket.
postText: Srividya : "Seeing lots of Yuvi in Shivam. Especially the way he loads for the hoicks!!! "

text: Floated around off, chips it to long-on for one.
preText: Maxwell is back on.

text: Uthappa goes big and gets half a dozen! Half-tracker around middle and leg, quick to pounce on hit and pull it over deep midwicket.
Hello everyone, I am here too, says Uthappa with back-to-back sixes. Tossed up full ball around middle, slog swept over deep midwicket.
Quicker outside off, steered straight to short third.
Quicker on off, punched to wide mid-off.
Three sixes in the over and Uthappa has changed gears seamlessly. Gets another full ball in his zone that he deposits 15 rows back over deep midwicket. 19 off the over.
preText: Two sixes followed by two dots. What's in store now?
postText:
45 runs off the last three overs. CSK opt for the time-out now. Breathing space for RCB as well.

Qaaid: "I thought this was supposed to be a good pitch for spinners...they're all getting hammered"

shortText: de Silva to Dube, no run
text: Bamboozled! Googly on a length around middle, Dube is unsure of which way it will go. Misses it completely and the bounce takes it over the stumps.
preText:
58 runs off the last five overs. Our forecaster predicts CSK to get to 172 at this point. Whom do RCB turn to? Remember, there's no Harshal Patel tonight. Hasaranga it is again. Change of ends.

Vamshhi: "CSK is making good use of left right combination here. RCB surely misses Harshal in these middle overs"

text: Glenn Maxwell you superman! Athletic effort from the Big Show. But he signals four at the end of it. Covers a lot of ground to his left from long-on, pushes the ball back in play as he dives over the ropes. But his last contact was the boundary cushions and is four as a result. Dube had hit the slog high in the air in the vacant deep midwicket region.
Half a chance gone down! Floated around leg, slog-swept it towards deep square leg. The fielder hares to his right, gets low with the dive but fails to catch it.
All going CSK's way now. Dube misses the smash and the googly misses the bat as well as the wicketkeeper for four byes.
Fuller on the pads, pushed towards midwicket for one.
Fired side arm down the leg side, Dube looks to paddle it but doesn't.
Quicker legspinner around off, punched to long-on for one. 12 runs off this over. Fourth successive over in excess of 12 for CSK.

shortText: Akash Deep to Uthappa, no run
text: An appeal for caught behind but it was the bat hitting the ground. Misses the hit through the off side of a ball that was outside.
preText:
Akash Deep is back.

Quite humid out there in Navi Mumbai. Uthappa gets a towel to wipe his face soaked in sweat.

prabin: "unlike cricinfo's forecaster, I predict a score to be 190. rest wait to watch." Machine vs human, ehh?

text: Half-century for Uthappa, 27th in the IPL, second this season. Excellently paced knock this. Full on middle and leg, flicked it through midwicket for four.
Short ball angling in, Uthappa gets inside the line and just helps it over fine leg. He's turning it on.

shortText: Akash Deep to Uthappa, no run
text: Good comeback. A yorker well wide of the batter, reaches out and just toe ends it back to the bowler.
Back of a length on off, gets it high on the bat towards mid-off as he looks to pull it.
preText: Faf has a few words with Akash.

text: Fifty for Dube, now! Second this season to go with a 49. Very full outside off, just slices it over a leaping backward point and gets four. How well has the young Mumbai lad batted today! Superb.
preText: More chat between the bowler and the captain. Long-on in place, mid-off in the circle.

text: Great effort in the deep by Prabhudessai! Uthappa walks down early against Hazlewood, who shortens his length a touch. Goes with the heave that lands short of the man running in from midwicket. Gets one.
preText:
No Harshal, make do with Hazlewood. RCB bring back their spearhead.

Chan: "Is there dew?" Not much right now. They had sprayed the chemical before the start of the innings.

text: Length ball on middle, mistimes his heave through midwicket and gets just one.
preText: Change of bats for Dube now.
postText: Chan: "Is there dew?"

text: Walloped to bring up the 100-run partnership! Uthappa has changed gears in some style. Hard lengths won't work, Swann had said at the pitch report. Banged short, pulled handsomely over deep midwicket for another maximum.
Similar back of a length ball, Uthappa goes for the pull but misses.
Very full outside off, driven to sweeper for one.
Very full on middle, squeezed through midwicket. It is the longer side of the ground and the batters run back for two.
preText: Talk about stepping it up. The first fifty runs of the partnership took 32 balls coming. The next fifty? Only 22.

text: Very full down leg, misses the flick.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Uthappa, no run
text: Howzzat? Off the pads. Misses the pull off the length ball but the ball travels straight to short fine.
preText:
Siraj to bowl out. Three overs for 19 so far.

Deepak: "Ex-RCBians performing well against RCB - Nothing new to see here!"

text: Aims London, goes America! Looks to flick the length ball over the on side, but the leading edge takes it over third man for a maximum.
This time it is more authoritative and hit with disdain. Length ball in the slot again, Uthappa dances down and hits it straight as an arrow.
preText: Shiva : "From CSK perspective, wish the RCB faceoff happened bit early in the tournament "

text: Three boundaries? Siraj thinks he has his man lbw. RCB go for the review. But replays confirm that Uthappa got bat to it as he walked across to scoop it past short fine leg.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Uthappa, no run

text: Does well. Low full toss outside off, hit straight to long-off for one.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Uthappa, 1 no ball
text: Length ball on the pads, hit straight to the fielder at deep square leg. But Siraj has overstepped.
Clean as a whistle (podu)! Very full on middle and leg, hit wayyy over long-on for half a dozen.
preText: Akash Deep now. From around the stumps 34 off his three overs so far. Has a task of breaking the highest partnership in this season so far.

text: Gets the pull over the wicketkeeper's head and takes two. Makes it despite the direct hit at the batter's end.
That slipped off Akash Deep's hand. High full toss outside wide outside off. Dube connects and slams it over point for six more.
Short in length, pulled off the glove to short fine leg for a single.
This is fired down leg, misses the flick. Wide given.
It's a full toss outside off, hit through midwicket for one. 58/0 off four overs for Akash Deep tonight.
preText: Now Siraj has something to say to Akash. How does he finish the over?

text: Another one well outside off, Uthappa leaves it alone.
Another one full and outside the tramline. Wide given again.

That is well wide. Was it on the pitch? Uthappa tells the umpire it wasn't and should be a no ball. But replays show it just landed on the strip. Uthappa had moved across and that forced Akash to fire it wider.
preText: Maxwell helping Akash Deep set the field now. Third man and deep point in place.

text: Glorious maximum. Sees the flighted googly, slinked down and hit it straight towards the sight-screen. IPL best score for Uthappa.
preText:
Hasaranga now for his third. 0/22 so far. Uthappa marks his guard again.

Anish: "Last wicket to fall was like yesterday. "

shortText: de Silva to Uthappa, 1 leg bye
text: Goes for the switch hit now, doesn't connect. Gets it off the thigh for a leg-bye.
Hasaranga's record against southpaws only gets worse. Dube ensures that. Wrong'un on a length, Dube goes back and lifts it over long-on for a 92-metre six.
Fired in on a length, powered down the ground for a single.
preText: Just 14 balls for the fourth fifty for CSK.

wkt_text: RV Uthappa c Kohli b de Silva 88 (98m 50b 4x4 9x6) SR: 176.00
text: Finally a wicket for RCB and Hasaranga! Breaks the 165-run stand. The non-celebration from the Royall Challengers says it all. Was a googly on the shorter side, Uthappa picks Kohli at deep midwicket to perfection to walk back with 88 against his name.

wkt_text: RA Jadeja c Anuj Rawat b de Silva 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: Just a one-ball stay for the skipper. Hasaranga has two-in-two but that's it from him tonight. Tossed up googly around middle, Jadeja goes for the slog. Gets it high in the air. Rawat at deep midwicket settles underneath it and takes it safely. Something to cheer for RCB.
preText: Captain Ravindra Jadeja.

text: Effortless, brilliant and maximum. Hazlewood goes for the yorker but misses it not by much. Dube gets under it and hits the biggest six - 102 metres - over long-on. Moves to 86.
preText: MS Dhoni walks out to a loud reception. Final over and Dhoni are stuff of tales. Dube is on strike though. To face Hazlewood.

text: Misses one. Full toss but misses the flick. Goes off the strap of the pad to the keeper.
preText: Can Dube get a ton.

text: Short in length, misses the pull completely.
preText: Sarat : "Uthapppa and Dube proved that both machine and human are wrong..." The forecaster has moved to 215 now.

text: Number one of that! Short in length and on the body. Dube connects the pull and it sails over deep square leg. On 92 now.
preText: Dube needs to hit all to the fence in order to get to his century. Incoming?

shortText: Ali to du Plessis, no run
text: tossed up, Faf turns it gently into the leg side and looks for a single but Moeen is quick to get across
preText: Welcome back, peeps. Interesting from CSK. They'll open with Moeen. Faf on strike. Let's go.

text: this time he's off the mark, tapped into the gap at midwicket

shortText: Ali to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: drifting into middle and leg from around the wicket, turned to short fine
preText: A slip in place for Rawat

shortText: Ali to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: shortish and spinning away from outside off, Rawat thinks of a slap but lets it go in the end

shortText: Ali to Anuj Rawat, no run
