text: how did that miss the stumps? Rawat attempts an ambitious reverse sweep to a fyull delivery drifting in, just misses leg stump.

shortText: Ali to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: tossed up on the stumps, Rawat lunges forward and pats it gently

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to du Plessis, no run
text: slants a length ball across, Faf drives on the up to cover point
preText: Mukesh Choudhary from the other end

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to du Plessis, 3 runs
text: heaved into the leg side. Comes off a thickish inside edge and they will take three. Faf stepped out to have a big swing but didn't control it as well as he would've liked.
preText: Time for our Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Most runs in the last ten overs of an IPL match.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Anuj Rawat, 1 run
text: full and swinging away, Rawat plays with an angled bat as the thick edge runs down to third man

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to du Plessis, 3 runs
text: flicked and into the gap at midwicket. This is a half-volley angling into the pads, two more as Jadeja comes up with a sliding stop

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Anuj Rawat, 3 runs
text: steps out but is cramped for room as Choudhary bangs one in, Rawat goes through with a short-arm jab and gets it into the gap at midwicket. They hare back for the third

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to du Plessis, no run
text: skiddy length ball back into middle, defended gently.
preText: Siddhesh: "Mukesh lucky he is at CSK who traditionally give a long rope to whomever they try. Time for him to repay the faith and make good on the initial promise he showed in the first game." -- If you get a game as a youngster, it's the place to be in. If you don't, it could be a long, long season.

text: slashes at this, well stopped at backward point
preText: Theekshana comes into the attack

text: drifting into middle and leg, worked through midwicket as they jog the single
gorgrous cover drive but down to wide long-off

shortText: Theekshana to du Plessis, no run
text: shortish and angling in, Faf backs away and pulls but mistimes it to square leg

wkt_text: F du Plessis c Jordan b Theekshana 8 (13m 9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 88.88
text: swung away but can't clear long-on. Faf had a grimace as he made contact. First wicket in the IPL for Theekshana and it's a massive one. Faf can't make a big one against his former team.
can't pierce the gap at square leg, pulled straight to Moeen.

shortText: Ali to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: nice drift into middle and off from around the wicket, defended
terrific from Rawat! Picks the length early, uses the depth of the crease to go back and whip it between midwicket and mid-on

shortText: Ali to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: reverse-swept straight to short third
rocks back to pull but hits it straight to Jadeja at wide mid-on, they scamper a quick single that brings Kohli on strike
gets forward fully as he pushes it into the off side for a quick single

shortText: Ali to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: in-drifter around off-stump from wide of the crease, carefully kept out

wkt_text: V Kohli c Dube b Mukesh Choudhary 1 (7m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33
text: he has picked out deep square! Dube takes a good catch running in grom the ropes. Mukesh bowls length, gets it to nip back into middle, Kohli whips it uppishly - the timing is good - but it's as if he forgot there was a man in the deep precisely for that.
runs it down to third man to get off the mark
preText: Maxwell is in earlier than he would've expected

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: this is a beauty! Gets the ball to jag away off a length to square Rawat

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Anuj Rawat, 1 run
text: steps out to smash that down the ground but toe-ends this flat-batted hit, lands between mid-on and mid-off
hammered! Picks the length early and pulls him imperiously in front of square
uppish and on the bounce to Jadeja at mid-off, Maxwell had given up. A direct hit at the bowler's end would've had him
flatter on middle and leg, tucked to the man coming in from deep square. DJ Bravo fumbles to allow a second.
attempts an audacious reverse hit over point but gave away his intentions way too early, smashed a thick edge onto his pad
he's clobbered that over long-off! Not entirely in his half but he went after that one and biffed it magnificently
six more! This one's over deep midwicket. Theekshana drops short, Maxwell latches onto it in a jiffy. He's in a murdeous mood
just eludes Jadeja, who runs back from mid-off to make a valiant effort. The ball was always skewing away from him, two more. Maxwell wasn't in control

wkt_text: Anuj Rawat lbw b Theekshana 12 (28m 16b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75.00
text: got him with a super delivery! Theekshana takes off on a celebratory run that would make Imran Tahir proud. Rawat has reviewed. This one cuts back in sharply to beat Rawat, who tries to whip that across the line. He's hit on the back pad and the ball didn't have a long way to travel. he got into a terrible tangle there and ball tracking comes back to show three reds.
slapped disdainfully! Drops short, Maxwell rocks back ns flays that through cover. Mukesh Choudhary with a dive from deep point but couldn't stop it despite a slide
punched past the bowler to long-on
ah, so very delightful. Width outside off, he rocks back and cuts late to beat backward point
pushed into the gap at point for an easy single

wkt_text: GJ Maxwell  b Jadeja 26 (15m 11b 2x4 2x6) SR: 236.36
text: got him! Maxwell is beaten by the fizz on this arm ball. Swung through a tad early and missed. The length wasn't quite there to pull. This one rushed onto him as well. RCB in tatters.
jabbed back down the pitch
preText: IPL debutant Suyash Prabhudesai comes in

text: welcome boundary, but CSK won't mind. Shahbaz sweeps him uppishly but into the gap at square leg.
uses the depth of the crease to nicely work it through square leg
steps out and swings this one bounce to long-on
worked past a vacant midwicket region

oh dear, the fielder at deep midwicket has put it down. Mukesh Choudhary didn't pick that, by the time he moved to his right and put in a dive, the ball had swirled away. Suyash with his first boundary through a slog sweep
worked into the leg side for a single
bludgeoned! Pure power. Cleared his front leg and used the width to belt that through extra cover.
worked past square leg as he jogs the single
shortish on middle and leg, nurdled into the gap at midwicket, two more

shortText: Jadeja to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: breaks back in off a length to hit him on the body as he tries to work it to the leg side

shortText: Jadeja to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: sharp turn once again, kept out somehow
swept into the gap at deep backward square leg. Got down on one knee and swept him up and over with the angle
width and Suyash has hammered that through cover! Flat-batted it with a touch of arrogance
gentle bunt to point for a quick single
slower and fuller on off, eased wide of point for a quick single
cheeky and very effective! AB would've be proud of that. Goes down on one knee, keeps his eyes on the ball all along as he scoops it over Dhoni for four.
preText: Sabarish: "Why has CSK picked Jordan ahead of Pretorius?" -- A question many people are asking.
postText: Nikhil Vasudev: "Lucky u shashank u didn't have to type the csk innings other wise it will be more typing and typing." -- You bet

text: slips this length ball into middle and leg, turned to deep square
width on offer, flayed into the gap at deep point
whips this to deep midwicket
fired full on leg stump, tucked to square leg, excellent running to hare back for the second
flatter one on the stumps, tucked to Rayudu at square leg
reverse swept over short third! May have given his intentions of the reverse but kept his eyes on the ball all through as he exected it superbly
bye bye ball! Walloped over deep square leg. Down on one knee, across and outside the line as he uses the angle coming in to give it a tonk with the slog sweep. What a hit
pushed through quicker on off, slapped straight to cover

shortText: Bravo to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: beaten as he has a big swipe at that
starts off with a slower ball that he bowls way outside the tram line
preText: DJ Bravo

text: low full toss and he has absolutely drilled this into the gap between wide long-off and deep extra cover.
slips this too far wide outide off, Shahbaz who took a step across to meet the ball let it pass
dabs it to short third for a quick single

oh my word! Mukesh Choudhary has absolutely put down a dolly. This was right down his basket at deep midwicket. Suyash looked to pull but was cramped for room. He was also hitting towards the bigger boundary. Was in no control of the stroke. What a mess
chopped wide of point
drilled to long-on
breaks away from a length outside off, defended back

wkt_text: SS Prabhudessai  b Theekshana 34 (29m 18b 5x4 1x6) SR: 188.88
text: got him! Suyash steps out to hoick him over midwicket but ends up being defeated by the drift and sharp turn away. He swung through a tad early as well, so even if the ball didn't hit the stumps, he would've been stumped. Good knock, terrific intent and we've seen glimpses of something special
preText: Sanyam Kamat: "Very excited to see a fellow local boy from Goa, Suyash Prabhudessai performing in this IPL match. Its a rarity for Goans to play in IPL, only few of the likes of Swapnil Asnodkar and Shadab Jakati have played in IPL before."

text: swept into the gap at fine leg. Down on one knee as he swept him with the angle. DK is up and running immediately.
worked into the gap at midwicket

shortText: Theekshana to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: mix-up but safe. Shahbaz pushed it to cover, wanted a run only to be sent back
swept to deep square leg
just out of Theekshana's grasp at short third. Shahbaz went after that but ended up slicing it behind square ont he off side. Valiant effort
slower ball but way outside the line, wide called
drilled into the gap at sweeper point
slower length ball outside off, punched to deep cover
dipping yorker, driven down to wide long-off as they scamper a second
slants a slower length ball across, Karthik bunts it gently to point. Now, now. He has overstepped. Freehit coming up. The no ball is for having more than two fielders behind square on the leg side.
punched into the gap at deep cover, two more
punched to long-off
length on middle, tucked to square leg
preText: Theekshana into his final over

text: he hasn't timed this and <s> Mukesh takes a catch at point. </s> Oh my word. he has put that down. Everyone around him can't believe it. Karthikl looked to go over long-off but got nowhere to the pitch and ended up slicing it high in the air. Mukesh took a couple of steps back from point, kept his eyes on the swirler but was never steady underneath it. Tough, tough evening for the young man.
preText: Madhusudan H J: "Win or Lose, impressed by RCBs intent here. RCB always folded under 120 when trying a high chase."

wkt_text: Shahbaz Ahmed  b Theekshana 41 (47m 27b 4x4 0x6) SR: 151.85
text: got him this time! Don't need anyone's assistance to pick wickets if you can bowl magicballs like that. It's the carromball that fizzes back in off a length to hurrty Shahbaz into a defensive stroke. Sneaked through the gap to smash into the stumps
pushed wide of point to get off the mark
clears deep backward sqaure leg! Some level of premeditation as Karthik walks across a long way and wallops him with the spin
looks to work it to the leg side but can only hit it back to the bowler
preText: AmoghVk: "Great to see Dhoni put an arm around Mukesh after that wicket"

text: he has cleared the ropes! This was a flat-batted heave across the line. I don't think Wanindu believed he had timed it as well as he did.

wkt_text: PWH de Silva c Jordan b Jadeja 7 (5m 3b 0x4 1x6) SR: 233.33
text: this time, he picks out long-on. Backed away to swing, but no timing this time.

shortText: Jadeja to Akash Deep, no run
text: square turn, edges to short third, sent back by DK

wkt_text: Akash Deep c Rayudu b Jadeja 0 (2m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: What a catch! Rayudu, you beauty. One-handed stunner from nowehre. Akash jabs at the ball, gets it high on the bat as it lobs in the air. Rayudu mvoed to his right and threw himself at the ball as it stuck

shortText: Jadeja to Mohammed Siraj, no run
text: drifts this into middle, defended

shortText: Jadeja to Mohammed Siraj, no run
text: somehow manages to squirt this off an inside edge to the leg side
strike one! The night continues to get tougher for Mukesh Choudhary. Lands a short ball, sat up nciely as DK walked across and belted this pull to clear deep backward square leg
strike two! Another flick and another six! Sails over deep square leg. Goes length on the pads. You just can't bowl there to DK.
scooped for four! Full and angling away, DK gets across the stumps in no time and uses the bowler's pace magnificently. Is the chase on?
up in the air but clears the infield, two more to deep cover. DK toe-ended this lofted hit
length ball outside off, sprays it way outside off. Wide. The young man looks frazzled
preText: Choudhary from around the wicket

text: full toss outside off, lofted over the infield to deep extra cover, gtwo more.
lofted over the infield, plonks near deep cover and they take just the one to keep DK on strike. Sensible from RCB, sensible from DK.
wide, wide, wide! Goes wide yorker, but ends up going way outsidw the wide line.
preText: Shivangi PR makes a bold declaration "If CSK loses this match from this point.. I will resign from my job."

text: drilled to long-on, refuses the single
another slower ball, another wide down leg. DK had a swing at this but couldn't connect. He won't mind though. Two runs already even before a legitimate ball has been bowled
slips this yorker-length delivery down leg, DK misses a tickle and declares it wide even before the umpire could. Has to rebowl that. Replays suggest it brushesd the pad.
preText: Bravo to bowl the 18th. His two overs have cost 25
postText: Manu: "It's a crime if the Indian selectors don't consider DK for the WC."

wkt_text: KD Karthik c Jadeja b Bravo 34 (38m 14b 2x4 3x6) SR: 242.85
text: that's the end of that, surely. DK has an absolute mow at this length ball. connected it really well. but he was hitting towards the bigger boundary. And unfortunately also found Ravindra Jadeja at deep midwicket. He was no more than two or three inches from the ropes. He belts out a roar, as does DJ Bravo. What a knock. Under pressure, must say that is a terrific grab from Jadeja. Both feet were off the ground for a split second as the ball lodghed in his fingers. He controlled it superbly.
flays this full toss to deep point

shortText: Bravo to Mohammed Siraj, no run
text: squeezed to short third.
squeezed to the ege of the ring at cover
lofted down to long-off
leading edge but rolls wide of point

shortText: Jordan to Mohammed Siraj, no run
text: looks to scoop but Bravo ends up bowling full and fast, Siraj failed to angle the bat properly to play the stroke. Nearly lobbed back
hit hard to long-off
yorker, kept out
beaten as Jordan nails a superb yorker
walloped over extra cover. All handy runs in the overall context as it reduces the margin of defeat. This is a length ball, Siraj backs away and uses the width to belt that
just out of the reach of Rayudu running back from cover. Would've been a stunning grab had he taken it
dabbed gently for a single
slips out of his hand, ends up bowling too far wide

past second slip! Bhuvneshwar goes full on leg and the ball swings towards middle. Wade tries to play it leg side but takes a leading edge behind square. Could've been out for a first-baller, ends up with a boundary
preText:
7.27pm The Sunrisers huddle is done, the umpires are in the middle. Bhuvi has taken his hat off. Gill and Wade for Titans. This venue has seen the most sixes so far in the comp.

Bhaskara Navulu: "Why is the list of playing 11 not published so far. Yeah I know the teams are unchanged. But it's a bit of non-cricinfo to not publish the playing 11 after the toss" -- Hi Bhaskara! We have a shiny new "tab" in the scorecard called "Playing XI" - do check that out!

Krishnan: "Gill the other day reminded one of Sir IVAR. Such regal strokeplay. Including the gum chewing swagger. Hope for a repeat."

Henri: "Replace toss with auction. Teams would auction with runs given to opponent as currency. "Team X chose to field and give 3 extra runs to Team Y.""

Mustafa Moudi : "@Henri: Do you want the losing captain to have no relief at all ?? At least they can blame the toss now but if auction happens, every one will blame the losing captain for being Over/Under Confident during the toss/auction!!"

Krish D: "Why isnt Yash Dayal or Sai Kishore playing? Both have been outstanding in domestic cricket. Defo deserve a chance" -- I'm sure the Titans will give them a shot at the right time. They've invested time into Abhinav Manohar and now Sai Sudharshan, so let's hope this duo gets a longish rope first.

Siddhartha Kuma: "I don't know about you but I am tuned in to see who wins the fastest delivery money here.. I am putting my chips on ferguson" -- Probably the best battle of the competition with Umran on the other side.

Sumit Gnawali: "During auction teams didn't bid for legspinner that much but imp of leg spinner has increased in last few games or Am i wrong ?" -- Indian legspinners/wristspinners are in very high demand. But spin bowlers appear quite late in the auction, batters and allrounders appear before them, so that's why they probably get fewer bidding wars.

Here's a revealing Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat for you: Which team has the worst run rate in powerplay overs at IPL 2022?

7pm toss The coin goes up. Sunrisers Hyderabad opt to bowl.

Kane Williamson: "Potential dew factor can make a difference. But want to put skills with ball up front. (CSK win) Largely it was about growth. We improved in the second game and a win in the third. Hope to do that today too. We need to be adaptable with the grounds. Same XI."

Hardik Pandya: "We would've bowled as well. Playing here for the first time so doesn't matter, batting first is okay. (Success as captain) Always good to win but for us results are important but processes are more important. We have got the results since we have been following the plans. This game is more important for us, we need to show we are putting in the hard work. (Tewatia as a finisher) The way he is batting, the confidence he says, it shows courage and character. Being confident is helping him. Same XI."

Shashank: "Kane 4/4 in tosses. Please pass on some luck to my fantasy team !!"

6.58pm Just two minutes till the toss. The team winning the toss has chased in all 20 games so far!

In other news, Royal Challengers Bangalore will be without Harshal Patel tomorrow. Harshal lost a family member yesterday. When he returns, he will have to serve a three-day quarantine before playing. Our prayers are with him in these difficult times. Full story here.

Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English or in Hindi.

Pitch and ground: This is not the centre pitch, so one square boundary is shorter than the other (64m, compared to 74m). Good batting pitch but it will be "a bit slow, and it will turn," according to Daren Ganga.

6.50pm Just ten minutes for the toss. Will Umran Malik make the cut for the Sunrisers XI? Here's how Wasim Jaffer wants SRH to use the young quick. Also a good time to check out our Fantasy cricket tips.

Krishna: "Unpopular opinion but Kane should open for SRH. He takes time to settle more often that not and opening gives him the opportunity to do that. At the same time he's better equipped and experienced to tackle the new ball danger giving space for batters coming in later to play freely. Even while chasing it doesn't matter if he plays slowly as long as he stays till the point where his dismissal doesn't cause a collapse nor hurts the Chase."

Samrat Ahuja: "Would/Should GT persist with Wade? or go with Gurbaz . being from subcontinent, he would be better prepared to play on these pitches!" -- It is a punt worth taking for sure! But in a winning combination, it is hard to see Wade miss out.

6.41pm For the Titans, it has been quite a ride so far. At the start of the season, they were considered "weaker" given that their didn't appear to be any synergy in their squad and XI. But after three games, all those doubts have been put to rest, with Shami-Ferguson-Rashid being the key bowling enforcers, and Gill-Hardik-Tewatia-Miller doing enough between them to lead the batting attack. They have the pace and the spin to trouble Sunrisers today too - they have been susceptible against extra pace. And despite Gujarat's excellent run, there is still some room for improvement. Here's Sanjay Manrejkar and Wasim Jaffer talking about today's contest.

KB: "Should we put an end to the debate of where Williamson should play? " -- I thought he would play at No. 4 and push Tripathi/Markram up to open in the last game, but since that didn't happen, I don't see it happening after a win.

6.33pm Hello! Peter Della Penna and Sreshth Shah here at your service to bring you all the action from match 21 of IPL 2022. Today we're coming to you from Navi Mumbai's DY Patil Stadium where Sunrisers Hyderabad will take on Gujarat Titans.

The Titans are unbeaten, looking for a fourth win in a row, and their trump card tonight could be the man who played such a big role in the rise of Sunrisers Hyderabad - Rashid Khan. He could very well get his 100th IPL wicket against his former side. Here's our match preview penned by Sruthi Ravindranath.

text: more extras, legbye this time. Good length, on leg stump. Wants to flick it off his waist, but misses. Hits his body and rolls away behind square on the leg side
and Bhuvneshwar errs this time with this full ball outside leg. It swings away from Wade, instead of coming in, and it's too much for the keeper to do too!

shortText: Kumar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: better line. Full, fourth-stump line. Just a bit of movement away. Gill shoulders his arms
more extras, but this one will go to Bhuvneshwar's tally. Fullish, but wide outside off and going further away. No shot offered
full outside off. Bit of away movement, and Gill presses forward to finally meet at the ball. Gentle drive to cover for a quick single
full ball on off stump. Minimal footwork as he defends close to his pad
the radar is off as this back of a length delivery lands way outside leg. More futile work from Pooran with his dive
full just outside off. Wade offers no shot, and brings an end to a 17 run opening over

shortText: Jansen to Shubman Gill, no run
text: full on middle stump. Cracking front-foot defense, ball rolls away to the off side
preText: Marco Jansen.

text: shoveled! Full on middle and leg. Gill comes down the track and uses the bottom hand to lift it over mid on. Bit of a slice, so it doesn't have the legs to go for six
preText: Stat alert: That is the most expensive opening over from a Sunrisers bowler in IPL history.

shortText: Jansen to Shubman Gill, no run
text: good length ball, on middle and leg. Fended comfortably, soft hands while standing tall
full, on leg stump or just outside. Misses the clip, hits his pad, rolls away

text: back of a length just outside off. Wade rides the bounce, taps it to the off side, and takes off for one. Jansen chases, collects smoothly and has a shy at the bowler's end, but doesn't hit the stumps. Hits Wade instead. Wade was comfortably in though
good length just outside off. Fended off the back foot to cover and another quick single

shortText: Kumar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: full just outside off. Bit of movement into him, and defended off the front foot
preText: Williamson sticks with the experienced Bhuvi.

wkt_text: Shubman Gill c Tripathi b Kumar 7 (14m 9b 1x4 0x6) SR: 77.77
text: Oh that's stunning A flying catch at cover sends Gill back for 7. Bhuvi bowled it in a slot outside off. Gill met it for a drive under his eye, but Tripathi at cover dived to his left, stuck the arm out, and ends up taking a beauty

shortText: Kumar to Sai Sudharsan, no run

full on middle, and a bit of swing towards off. Wade gets onto the front foot, meets it with the full face of the bat, and the ball goes past the bowler's left for a boundary

postText:
Bhaskar: "Wah, What a catch 'Rhodes'ul Tripati.. "

Faisal : "Oh my... That's the catch of the tournament, hands down !!"

text: a confident back-foot punch that can't pierce the infield. Length ball on off, and struck well square. Point runs to his left and slides to stop

full on middle and off. Wade plays the reverse sweep and that's been struck well. Sharma at backward point may have gotten a hand to it with a dive, but it couldn't stop the boundary

length ball angling into his pads. Clipped to deep backward square leg for one

shortText: Jansen to Sai Sudharsan, no run

text: good length, just outside off. Cut to point, and Wade takes off for one. Sudharsan says no, and Wade has to turn back. Abhishek has a shy to run Wade out, but misses, and that allows the duo to take that single after all

text: wristy from Sai! Length ball angling into his pads, and he uses the wrists to ensure the flick goes behind square. Races away...

goes fullish on middle stump. Hardik looks to defend off the front foot, but some extra bounce makes the ball hit the top half of the pad

text: full on off stump, Hardik wants to be positive, meets the delivery on the front foot, and plays a drive that goes past the non-striker to the long-off boundary. It was in the air for a short time as it went past Wade

text: that's some way to say you've arrived. Malik goes short, and the quick ball zips through. Hardik shapes to pull, but he's late onto that. Hits the grille of the helmet.

text: that's some way to say you're unperturbed! Full outside off. Pandya doesn't hang back waiting for a short ball, but gets onto the front foot as soon as Malik delivered that. Crunches a drive through cover's left
look at me now! Malik goes short, but this time there's no extra bounce. Pandya picks the length early, and drags a pull from off stump to deep midwicket
