preText: KW's bowling Umran out. One slip.

text: extra pace hurts Umran as this attempted cut flies over the slip cordon to third man. Manohar backed away and tried to use the width

between the keeper and first slip! Don't get fooled by the economy, Umran has been unlucky. Back of a length outside off. And angling into Manohar. He is late to cut, gets a thick edge and goes between the gap in the cordon. Keeper didn't move, first slip moved to his left too late
preText: James : "Umran Malik is young, and has the raw pace. He will learn his craft, and he couldn't have a much better coach than Dale Steyn. "

shortText: Umran Malik to Manohar, no run

text: rolls his fingers over this ball. Fullish outside off. Guided to third man
length ball on off and clipped to midwicket for one
good length ball on off stump. Cut to point for one
short ball, aimed at his chest. Fended from near his chest off the back foot, and the ball rolls away to point
full outside off stump. Angling across as he chooses to drive. Finds cover
short ball, leg stump line. Flies over Manohar
good length ball on middle and leg. Nudged off the back foot to point for one
good length ball on off stump. Pushed to cover off the back foot
good end to the over for Titans as Manohar backs away on this length ball from Jansen before swatting a cut over backward point for four. Nearly went all the way for six!
length ball just outside off stump. Punched to long on for a single
preText: Last four overs. Forty more means 166. They'll want 170 atleast from here. ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster predicts 167

text: top edged for four over the keeper. Bhuvi goes shot, Abhinav chooses to pull, and that's flown over Pooran the gloveman.
full outside off stump. Driven to cover
good length ball, fourth-stump line. Nurdled off the back foot behind point for one
length ball angling into his waist. Clipped away to deep midwicket with soft hands, and that's exactly why they can come back for the second
nine off the over as Pandya cuts off the back foot to deep point. Length ball just outside off stump
full in the slot just outside off. Drilled over Natarajan's head, but falls just short of Tripathi at long on. Could've been six, could've been out, ends up as a single

attempts the wide yorker, Manohar falls for the trap and goes for a big hoick. Sliced up in the air and Markram at long off gets under it... but dropped! He got under it well in time, but the ball hit his fingers
yorker on middle and leg. Hardik digs it out, the ball stays on the pitch, and they scurry across for a single

misses the yorker, ends up as a low full toss coming into Abhinav's shin, but he manages to punish that for six over wide long on! He wound up early for the aggressive shot, and went with it irrespective of the length
full ball, outside off and angling further away. Abhinav loses his shape as he tries to play another slog. Through to Pooran
useful innings, this! Misses the yorker by an inch or two, lands just outside off, Manohar uses his fast hands to scythe at the ball, and it's found the gap between deep extra cover and long off!
hits his pad and rolls away for one
preText: To overs to go.

text: another drop at long off for Abhinav! Knuckleball, fullish outside off. Mistimes the aggressive shot, up in the air for long off - Tripathi - to take the catch, but he can't hold on either
attempts the yorker, ends up as a very low full toss. Clipped behind square to deep backward
back of a length, wider outside off stump. Misses out

another catch? No man's land this time! Good length ball just outside off. Manohar goes for the pull. Mistimed high up in the air towards square leg. Deep backward square runs in, fine leg runs in, Bhuvneshwar runs too, and the bowler fails to get there in time. Wry smile on Manohar's face

wkt_text: A Manohar c Tripathi b Kumar 35 (29m 21b 5x4 1x6) SR: 166.66
text: Tripathi runs around from long off to the sightscreen and dives to take a catch. Manohar's whirlwind innings ends. Another slower ball, fullish outside off. Manohar is through the shot too early, loses the grip off one hand, and the ball is sliced way up in the air. Applause from the dug out for Manohar
Bhuvneshwar goes length and wide outside off for Tewatia. Keeping it away from his arc, and he slaps a cut over the infield to the man in the deep
that single gets Hardik (on 48) back on strike. Tewatia backs away before the ball is bowled. Natarajan follows him with a yorker outside leg stump. Dug away to short third man
preText: Final over of the innings. 15 more to breach 170. Natarajan will bowl out.
postText: Sandeep J : "I'm sure that smile from Manohar is awkward smile.. surely he is not proud of that innings.. yet useful runs for team.."

text: full ball outside off. Hardik pre-meditated a ramp and ends up playing the shot to midwicket
full toss, shin high. Tewatia gets down on one knee, and swats one behind square on the leg side!

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: full on fifth stump, goes to drive and drags an inside edge just past leg stump for one.
preText: Chase about to begin. Shami coming around the wicket to Abhishek Sharma.

text: full on the legs, flicked behind square for two.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Williamson, no run
text: good length ball on fifth stump swinging away a touch, left alone.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Williamson, no run
text: back of a length on middle skids on, Williamson prods to defend, looks like an inside edge into the pads. Long chat and Hardik is not convinced by Wade to go for a review.
postText: Replays show there was no edge, it was pad onto pad, but he was hit quite high above the flap.

text: back of a length on middle, goes back to flick into midwicket for one.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length on fifth stump, punched straight to backward point.
postText: Reminder that those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English or in Hindi.

text: good length ball on fifth stump, left alone.
preText: Hardik takes the ball from the other end.

text: good length ball on middle, defended.
postText: The lbw shout to Williamson in the previous over would've been out if Gujarat had gone for a review. Ball-tracking now shows three reds lighting up with the ball hitting just enough of the top of middle.

text: good length ball on fourth stump, defended.
good length ball swinging away from sixth stump at 138 kph, left alone.
back of a length on off, tap and run into the covers for one to get off strike.
postText: Anjan: "Shami had perfectly set up Kane, he bowled a lovely outswinger the previous delivery and then the next one came in, boom! Bad call and inexperience on Hardik's part!"

shortText: Pandya to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length on off, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on middle, flicked into midwicket for one.
preText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Will Mohammed Shami continue to boss Kane Williamson? - Here's their head-to-head in T20 cricket. He would have had him out last over had they gone for the review. The battle continues to start the third over.
postText: Sha D: "Has Williamson just left a ball alone in a T20 match ? " Not just once, but twice.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: bouncer on sixth stump sails wide of Sharma, signaled one short ball for the over.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length on sixth stump, defended to backward point.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: another short and wide ball defended to the off side.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length on off, defended into the covers.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: back of a length on fourth stump, plays this with soft hands to deep third man for one.
postText: Ashok: "This is baffling start once again from SRH. They should use the powerplay knowing they would have Rashid to deal with in the middle overs"

shortText: Pandya to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length on fourth stump, defended to cover.
back of a length into the ribs, fights this off with one hand off the bat to nudge into midwicket for one.
short on sixth stump at 135 kph, cuts this straight to backward point.
postText: Jmani: "Good start by SRH. They can capitalize on this in the post lunch session". *cymbals clash*

text: back of a length on leg stump at 130 kph, backs away from the stumps to create room to punch this off the back foot with soft hands behind point. Direct hit at the non-striker's end but Williamson is in by two yards.
postText: Chintan: "SRH needs to swap Williamson and Tripathi, Tripathi can take advantage of PP as we have seen him with KKR, We cant have Williamson wasting PP everytime.. He can be good number 3 who can anchor"

text: bouncer on middle at 135 kph, miscues a pull well short of deep square leg for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, punched to backward point, misfield allows a run.
miracle! It's a boundary! First of the chase! Short ball on fifth stump, sits up for Williamson to pull through wide mid-on to the rope.
Williamson shifting from first gear to fourth gear in the space of two balls! Short again on the body this time, hooked high over backward square sailing over the rope.
back of a length, flicks it square for an easy single this time.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length delivery seams away and beats Sharma playing back.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, 2 runs
text: fullish length tailing into leg stump, flicks this high over midwicket for two.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: backs away from leg stump and Shami follows him short with a 138 kph ball, Sharma fights it off through point for one.
postText: KB: "I said this before at the start of the match. Kane Williamson takes time to settle. That doesn't mean his approach is bad. And the longer he stays at the crease, the easier chase for SRH. We've all watched too much power hitting in powerplay to enjoy kane's masterclass of leaving balls outside off."

text: full and wide at 143 kph on seventh stump, too much width and shoveled high over point to the rope.
preText: Lockie Ferguson replaces Hardik. Around the stumps to Sharma.

text: back of a length on seventh stump again swinging away, plenty of width again to punch this in the gap between cover and point to the rope again.

hat-trick of boundaries through the off side off Ferguson! Back of a length again on seventh stump, Sharma punches this off the back foot again this time between backward point and short third man to the rope.

shortText: Ferguson to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: now overcorrects on the hips, flicked straight to short fine leg.
how good! Short ball cramps him on fourth stump, but he's still able to keep his hands soft enough to guide this between the keeper and short third man to the rope.
postText: Ashwin: "Absolutely glorious boundaries through the off from Abhishek. Ganguly would be proud"

text: back of a length again on fifth stump at 139 kph, tapped behind point for one.
postText: Strategic timeout is called.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: good length ball on the hips, goes back to flick behind square for one.
preText: Rashid enters the attack after the Powerplay and the break. Over the wicket to Sharma.

text: back of a length on middle, goes back to flick to long-on for one.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR
text: floated full and wide on sixth stump, drives this elegantly high over cover and bounces away to the rope.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, 2 runs
text: good length ball on fourth stump, goes back and across to flick through square leg for a sharp two.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: half-tracker well outside leg, Sharma goes to hammer this but is through the shot a touch early and cue shots it off the toe into midwicket for a tame single.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Williamson, no run
text: googly lands very short on off and spins into the hips, Williamson can't flick it away and it comes off the pads.
postText: Ash : "Seeing Rashid Khan play against SRH is absolutely heart-breaking".

text: short and wide, slices this high over backward point for two.
preText: Darshan Nalkande enters the attack now.

text: length ball angled across fifth stump, flays this high over cover and an athletic save is made by the sweeper running left to turn four into two.

shortText: Nalkande to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: length ball angled a touch wider on sixth stump at 136 kph, this time Sharma fans on a big drive on the up.
back of a length on middle, goes back to tap this into midwicket for one. Direct hit from David Miller at the stumps but the run was completed quite easily.
back of a length on middle, defended into midwicket.
short and wide, sliced behind point for another two.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: full outside leg, misses a flick into midwicket.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR
text: full on fifth stump this time, goes to drive and slices this off a thick outside edge through third man to the rope.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: back of a length on middle and leg, flicked through square leg for one.
full on fourth stump, prodded into the covers for one.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Abhishek Sharma, OUT
wkt_text: Abhishek Sharma c Sai Sudharsan b Rashid Khan 42 (44m 32b 6x4 0x6) SR: 131.25
text: short ball on the body, rocks back to try to heave this over midwicket but the ball hustles onto him and cramps him for room. Winds up picking out Sudharsan at deep midwicket 10 yards inside the rope, who takes a knee high catch tumbling forward.
postText: Rashid needs one more wicket to bring up 100 in his IPL career.

text: full on middle, stretches to paddle sweep this through fine leg for two.
back of a length on fifth stump, defended to the off side.

length ball on seventh stump, slapped through cover wide of the sweeper, who has a very awkward collection getting his knee stuck in the turf sliding, Jayant Yadav, but recovers to pick up and relay it in.
short on middle and leg, pulled flat to deep backward square leg for one.
fullish length on fifth stump at 135 kph, drives this superbly on the up through extra cover to the rope.
bouncer clears off stump easily, Tripathi doesn't bother ducking, wide called on height.
back of a length on middle and leg, flicked behind square for one.
postText: sri: "Oh Abhishek, T20 doesn't mean you have to hit 6s. That's a ball begging to be hit to boundary......you had the whole time in the world to time it square leg, if you had tried for a 4 not a 6. Missed opportunity for you to stay till the chase is firmly in SRH's side"

text: back of a length on middle, defended into the off side.
slower ball at 127 kph lands back of a length on off, defended into the covers.
preText: Ferguson returns.

text: yorker on fourth stump, shuffles way outside off to paddle into the leg side but misses off the pads. Big lbw shout denied. Not much going for this. All three stumps could be seen.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to point.

gem! Back of a length seams past a prod on fourth stump line at 144 kph, beats Williamson and swerves late, hitting Wade high in the chest as he misses the ball grabbing at it. Wade could've really been badly hurt there. He'll have a big bruise after play but after a few moments gets up and is able to continue.
full and flicked into the ring for one.
full and swinging into the legs, misses a flick and the ball comes back to Ferguson for no run.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Tripathi, no run
text: fullish length on off, prods at this and a leading edge balloons short of extra cover.
preText: Rashid switches ends.

text: googly lands short on middle, goes back to flick through the leg side for one.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Williamson, no run
text: full on middle, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on off, goes back to punch to long-on for one.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back to late cut this past the keeper for one.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes back to flick through mid-on for one.
postText: Tinura: "CSK and SRH are really missing this kind of bowling - quality wrist spin - and they will rue not going after likes of Shamsi, Zampa, Sodhi and Qais Ahmed in the auction. They don't have like for like Indian options now, and unlike most other teams they easily could have accomodated one of them in their available overseas spots."

text: length ball on middle, goes for a big heave behind square and inside edges it into the pads.
preText: Delay between overs as Tripathi is getting some treatment from the physio on his right calf for what appears to be a leg cramp. This is not the official strategic timeout though. After a few minutes, we're finally ready to continue.
postText: Terry: "Time for Williamson to retire out". Might be awhile before we see another Ashwin, even though it succeeded yesterday.

text: bouncer on middle, goes to pull and a big top edge flies over the keeper, swirling with enough steam on it to land just over the rope.
another short ball on middle at 136 kph, this time it goes where he meant to hit it screaming high over backward square for another six.
postText: Maybe Kane heard Terry.

text: back of a length on middle, goes back to flick into midwicket and weighted well enough to dribble just past the ring for two before the boundary rider can charge in.
short on middle, whips this through square leg for one.

back of a length on fourth stump, uppercuts this straight to deep third man... who doesn't move an inch off the rope. Shami is the guilty party. It was a clear catching opportunity if he decided to get his legs moving and Hardik is shouting at him furiously. It landed two yards in front of him without any effort. As a matter of fact, replays make it look even worse with Shami taking three steps back as the ball landed two yards in front of him rather than going forward.

wkt_text: RA Tripathi retired hurt 17 (27m 11b 1x4 1x6) SR: 154.54
text: and now Tripathi rubs salt into the wound from the delivery to end the last over. Flighted full on fifth stump and launches a drive high over wide long-off. Tripathi was needing treatment on his calf earlier and stumbles backward again after that shot. The physio is back out.
preText: Tewatia replaces Rashid for more leg spin.
postText: Strategic timeout has now been called with Tripathi needing assistance from the physio. Tripathi is now having to retire hurt. Nicholas Pooran will replace him in the middle.

text: lands this on a good length on sixth stump, Pooran goes back and slaps this straight to extra cover.
short and wide on seventh stump, cuts straight to the point sweeper.
postText: Kishore Bhartol: "What was Shami dreaming off at the fence.. He didn't even moved an inch forward. "

text: back of a length on leg, Williamson goes back to punch to long-on for one.
short on sixth stump, goes back to cut again and chops this into the ground past the keeper for one to short third man.
back of a length on off, goes back to punch to long-on.
postText: Pandey: "Slow, retire out, waste of powerplay yada yada yada... class gonna class. Watch him hit the winning runs today..."

text: good length ball on leg stump, flicked away for one.
preText: Rashid switches ends again.

text: flighted full on middle, heaves this to wide long-on for two. Relay from Miller was very good and nearly had Pooran had Wade been able to collect cleanly. A direct hit would've been out from 70 yards.
full again on middle, this time lofts a drive straight back over Rashid for two again to Miller at long-on.
good length ball on off, prodded behind point for one.
postText: CasualFan: "How often is Lockie not the fastest bowler in the match? Almost never. Umran was faster by 5kphs at least. This is exciting for Indian cricket. "

text: full on sixth stump, flicks through midwicket for one.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Pooran, 1 leg bye
text: good length ball outside leg, goes to flick behind square and misses off the pads, goes for an extra behind square.
postText: Rashid has been seen off. For all the hue and cry about Williamson's Powerplay crawl, Sunrisers have a very manageable 47 to win off the final five overs.

text: slower cutter short ball on middle cramps up Pooran at 135 kph, Pooran tries to sway to get out of the way and the ball pops up off the shoulder of the bat to third man for one.
preText: Ferguson is back.

text: slower ball lands full on middle and leg, defended.
ingenuity from Williamson to bring up a half-century! Shuffles well outside off to scoop this over fine leg, connects oh so sweetly and gets it 25 yards over the rope.
overpitched now on fourth stump, Williamson creams this through cover and the sweeper has no chance.
slower bouncer balloons over Williamson's attempted uppercut at 119 kph. Williamson couldn't reach. Wide called on height.
short and wide outside off, gets on his toes to cut and misses.
postText: Mahmud: "How costly Williamson 1st over LBW!" Hardik and Shami not on the same page on multiple occasions tonight, on that occasion by not calling for DRS.

text: full on middle, driven to long-on for one.
postText: Tony Stark: ""Hardik is shouting at him furiously"- Can't watch the match live so relying solely on Cricinfo. But reading this is making me pretty annoyed. Mistakes happen, and Hardik should remember that he himself has already done a misjudgement himself by refusing to review Williamson when he was on 2, and now GT will lose with 2 useless reviews to spare, AND it is almost costing them the match."

wkt_text: KS Williamson c Tewatia b Pandya 57 (86m 46b 2x4 4x6) SR: 123.91
text: offcutter slower ball full on seventh stump at 122 kph, Williamson tries to drag this with a slog targeting the leg side but instead skies this to long-on. Easy catch taken 20 yards in from the rope by Tewatia casually at chest height.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended to backward point.
preText: Aidan Markram enters on strike.
postText: Paarth: "@Tony Stark Whilst the review was plumb I agree, he's allowed to be annoyed the dropped catch seems like an extreme lack of effort which no one would be happy about"

text: back of a length on fifth stump, guides this behind point for two.
postText: Rudresh: "@Greatest Avenger: Hardik was not at fault for the LBW. It's the keeper and the bowler who need to be confident and convince the captain.Shami at fault on both the occassions."

text: back of a length on fourth stump, guided behind point again for one.
postText: Adarsh: "Even if Williamson had managed to score the winning runs, it doesn't take away from the fact that he was slow in the powerplay. The teams that go on to win the IPL often capitalize on every aspect - powerplays, middle overs and death overs, with specific roles assigned to different players."

text: back of a length on leg stump, tapped gently enough through the ring before the sweeper can attack to cut off the second. Hardik is not happy with the effort coming off the rope and shouts more. Wade gestures his displeasure as well with his arms and can be heard through the stump mic as well shouting, "I told him three times!"
back of a length on off, flicked to long-on for one.

dropped! bouncer on middle, top edged pull off the toe flutters back toward Ferguson. He changes direction in his follow-through and runs backward. He dives on the edge of the non-striker's crease but the ball slips through his hands. Definitely got his mitts to it but wasn't able to cling on.
preText: Ferguson to bowl his last now as waiting until the 20th might be pointless.

text: strays with a length ball on the legs, easily flicked away to the fine leg rope.
back of a length ball on the hips again at 131 kph, a very calypso flick with one leg in the air sails high over fine leg into the front row of the stands.
postText: Mahesh: "Feels like Hardik is too hard on players when something went wrong showing too much emotions). he should be cool as captain. The other day he was almost shouting on Miller for that runout and now shouting on Sai (who is already doing great fielding today) who allowed that 2 runs"

text: another length ball down leg, this time Pooran can't flick it away and wide is called.
yorker on off stump, jams this out behind point for one.
full on fifth stump, shuffles well across to flick through the leg side for two.
full on off, flicked to long-on for one.
length ball on off at 139 kph, heaved to deep square leg for one.
preText: Shami back at the death.

text: back of a length into the body, Pooran flicks this over fine leg for one.
preText: Around the wicket to Pooran.

text: slower ball lands short on fifth stump, punched to the cover sweeper for one.
bouncer again, tries to pull and another top edge sails over the keeper for a one bounce four.
postText: All the top edges have somehow landed safely today in this chase. Less than a run a ball required now.

text: full on middle, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
goes for yorker at 139 kph but doesn't get it full enough on off, Markram smashes this back past Pooran to the long-on rope.
postText: Vishwas: "I don't think Hardik is shouting at mistakes but rather at lack of efforts. Shami didn't move to take a catch, Wade was not happy with the fielding either. It is a game of fine margins and such mistakes can cost 2 points! "

text: into the upper deck to finish the match! Short on the body, Pooran swivels to rock this over backward square leg into the front row of the second tier. Sunrisers canter to victory with five balls to spare in spite of a very slow start to the chase.
preText: Scores level now.
postText:
11.18 pm So Pooran replaces the injured Tripathi in the 14th over and stays to the end to clinch victory. Captain Williamson gets a half-century in victory too.

Titans captain Hardik Pandya: "Batting wise I think we were 7-10 runs short and would've made a difference in the end. Bowling wise, we had a good start but had two bad overs. I think they bowled well [in the last 5 overs]. The bounce was varying about and their bowlers with different heights. Credit to them with the way they bowled. Our motto has been the same which is to learn from the mistakes we make no matter the result. In a couple of days we have our next game. Relax and enjoy the game."

Nicholas Pooran from Sunrisers: "We as a batting group wanted to learn from our mistakes in the past and make partnerships. It was challenging because it was two-paced. The slower balls were sticking in the wicket a bit. We just needed a partnership, not do anything stupid and be there at the end. I try to improve every single day that I train and play. We have some amazing coaches that sit with us and have some amazing conversations. Brian is helping us tremendously, not just me but all the young batters. The first over [in the field] went wrong for us, but having saying that with the dropped catches and extras, 160 on that wicket was fabulous for the bowlers."

Kane Williamson is named Player of the Match: "It was I thought all in all a good game of cricket. I thought we were good with the ball and so were they. It was hard to get a rhythm and so we just tried to build partnerships but good to see signs of improvement. The guys are nice and clear on their roles. Naturally there are always a number of challenges playing the best in the world and you're always under pressure but they adjusted nicely. It was quite tough to hit through the line. It was a fair game of cricket and if you could pick up wickets you could squeeze them a little bit. I think [Tripathi] might just be cramp. Hopefully it is minor and he can recover quickly. I'm not quite sure about Washington Sundar but hopefully he recovers quickly. We're seeing a variety of surfaces throughout the comp so I'm just trying to adjust."

That's it for our live commentary coverage today. Come back tomorrow for more IPL action. Take care!

text: fullish, fourth stump line. Sticks the bat out to poke it to point for one
preText:
7.30pm Chameera to Buttler.

Nick: "@Anubhav : I guess Parag stays there because they need an allrounder. In the first match, Coulter-Nile was injured so they needed a 6th bowler !"

Anubhav: "Both Parag and Jaiswal have had bad runs, Parag for much longer, but it is Jaiswal who is dropped? Why does Rajasthan have such fascination with a player who has performed average for a long time now? (note: if parag performs I will gladly eat my words)"

7.10pm Mahesh: "Finally Rassie gets a game. He walks into my fantasy dream 11 right away" -- Good choice! He wasn't in our "recommended XI" for this match, which you should check out.

Ramji : "Padikkal will open. Samson at 3 and Rvdd at 4. " -- Equally nice idea. Probably better than Buttler and Samson at 1 and 2. Agree.

ESPN+ plug: Those of you in the USA can watch this game live on ESPN+.

KD: "The balance of this LSG team is unreal. Hope KL takes the aggressive route now too"

So to summarise, Super Giants have strengthened their bowling further by adding eight overs of Chameera and Stoinis in place of AJ Tye and Evin Lewis. Bowling pace goes up for sure, now to see where exactly Stoinis bats. As for the Royals, Kuldeep Sen is a right-arm quick from Madhya Pradesh. The tall 25-year old has T20 bowling economy of 8.20 and can bowl a mean yorker according to a quick check of his bowling on YouTube. Whether van der Dussen opens (unlikely) or Samson goes up to opener in Jaiswal's absence is to be seen.

Sumith: "Proactive changes by the Royals. It's not pressing the panic button but realising the importance for winning momentum. "

7pm Toss Lucknow opt to bowl. "No reason other than dew and knowing what to chase," KL Rahul said. "Every game is fresh. I am looking to come out and do the job. I will know a target so will try to pace to the best of my availability. Leadership has been good. We have a good team, that makes job of a captain easy. 9 or 10 of our starters play at the top level, so that makes it easy. They know their roles. Two changes as Lewis, Tye miss out. Stoinis and Chameera come in.

"We'll see how this total behaves before we set a target accordingly," Sanju Samson said. "Nothing to do with the toss so we have a team that can do well with any toss decision. Kuldip Sen instead of Navdeep Saini, Rassie van der Dussen replaces Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Akshaye: "That's 4 out of 4 tosses lost for Sanju"

6.55pm Last week we had R Ashwin with us, this week it is James Neesham who joins ESPNcricinfo on #PoliteEnquiries. Here's what twitter's Mr. funny had to say.

Ramji V: "Will stoinis walk in directly into XI? Who is vulnerable in that case?Lewis Or Tye? " -- Stoinis is available, but I am not totally convinced that he walks into the XI. Lewis has useful at the top, Holder is doing his job well, and Tye ensures the bowling is stocked up in an XI that bats deep anyway with Gowtham also in the team. Let's see.

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Compare the strike rates of Rahul and Buttler at the Wankhede...

6.40pm Hello and welcome to the evening clash of Super Sunday. We are twenty minutes away from the toss of this big encounter with Rajasthan Royals taking on Lucknow Super Giants. For both these sides, today's encounter could be the day that they solidify their positions in the top of the points table. The key battle will be between the two batting orders, both with powerful players and in form. More in our match preview.

text: edged by Padikkal first ball! as Chameera bowls a full ball outside off. Padikkal pushed at it, took the outside edge, but the ball fell just short of Jason Holder at first slip. Fell short of him, and the awkward bounce got it through the fielder

disasterclass from Bishnoi as he throws for four overthrows. Full outside off, and Padikkal pushed it to cover. Buttler is out of his crease, so Bishnoi thinks about a shy at the stumps at the non-striker's. Misses the direct hit, Gowtham isn't backing up well enough, and that's four more for Padikkal

the umpire raises his finger swiftly! Padikkal LBW? He's reviewing Fullish ball on middle and off stump with Padikkal offering minimal footwork. Ball hits his front pad in front of middle stump, but UltraEdge says there's a spike when the ball passes the bat! Tiny edge en route to the pad, and Padikkal survives. Did he know about the spike? Because he didn't review right away. That would've surprised Padikkal too
length ball, early 140s kph. Extra bounce on middle stump and fended off the back foot
fullish, on off stump. Presses forward to defend and see the otherwise profitable over out
full just outside off stump. Buttler presses forward and pushes a front-foot shot back to Holder
fullish ball on a fifth-stump line. Buttler shoulders his arms
full outside off but Buttler moves to the off side this time to get closer to the ball. Caresses a drive, but stopped at cover
that's four dots. Rolls his fingers over this ball. Fullish just outside off. Pushed to the off side but the fielder runs in swiftly to stop the single
postText: Minoma: "I don't think adding overthrows for the bowlers name is fair"

text: there's the release shot Holder goes full outside off, Buttler nonchalantly smacks it over his head, and it's sailed into the sightscreen
postText: Manish K.: ""Disasterclass from Bishnoi " -- That's a bit harsh. It's Gowtham's mistake not backing up."

text: erring in line, and Buttler punishes him. Full on middle and leg, angling into his thighs, and Buttler flicks it gently past the short fine leg fielder! Four dots, and then a six and a four to round off the over
up and over! Stands tall and lofts it over Chameera's head. Full, in the slot on off stump, and Padikkal pounced on it in a flash.
length ball on off stump. Fended off the back foot
preText: Ashish: "Thanks Manish for saying it up (unless Bishnoi's throw was actually wayward). I will never know as I was not watching it live." -- Buttler was in very quickly, the run out was never quite on, and it was too quick a throw from Bishnoi for the one backing up (Gowtham) to get in position. That said, Gowtham could've pre-empted Bishnoi's throw and moved to his left a bit quicker, but tough to do that.

text: good length, on middle and leg. Clipped off his hips to deep backward square leg for a single
full on middle and leg stump. Buttler goes for the fine flick, and its got some pad en route to short fine leg for a single. Umpire confirms it was pad first, with the legbye signal given
good length ball on middle and off. Shuffles onto the off side and fends it off the back foot
back of a length, just outside leg stump. Ducks under it and takes the extra run. This was 144kph
a good comeback over from Chameera after that first-ball four. Length ball angling across and Padikkal guides it to third man for a walking single
postText: Max: "RR is an extremely dangerous and balanced team this year EXCEPT for the all rounders. They really don't have much strength at that position. Which means the specialists can't really have an off day. "

text: full on middle, and flicked with strong wrists to deep midwicket. Padikkal played it before bothering in which direction the ball would turn
preText: Actor Suniel Shetty is in attendance, wearing the Super Giants blue. Here's Ravi Bishnoi now.

text: tossed up on off stump. Pushed to wide long off for a walking single
good length ball on off and middle. Googly turns across his body, and down the leg side
preText: Sarthak: "That throw from Bishnoi was in similar circumstances to the throw he threw to run Gaikwad out.. That day it hit and got the batter out, today it didnt.. worth a shot"

text: length ball, on off, and turning further away. Padikkal hammers this short and wide ball through the off side, and the cut has gone to the boundary
preText: Bishnoi has a slip for both batters. Operating over the stumps for now.

text: another googly. Fuller on off, but turning across. Padikkal capitalises on the width, and punishes Bishnoi with the cut once more

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Padikkal, no run
text: dropped! Classical legspinner's caught and bowled chance, but Padikkal has survived. Full on middle and leg, and Padikkal pressed forward to defend. Met with hard hands, ball went straight back to Bishnoi, but it didn't stick even though he got into a good position, with a straight-on body in prep to gobble the catch
full on off, and driven to long off to keep the strike
full outside off and angling across. Padikkal looks to drive off the front foot, but misses out. Past the bat to the keeper
preText: Run rate of nearly 10. Chameera for a third over.

text: fullish, on middle and leg. Padikkal closes the bat's face and works it to the leg side
attempted yorker, nearly successful. Dug away from middle stump
attempts the yorker again, very nearly lands it. Padikkal mistimes a drive through the off side to get to the other side
full toss around off stump. Surprises Buttler. He bunts it to the leg side - in front of square - for a single
good length ball angling across, and cut to the infielder
back of a length, just outside leg stump. Ducks under it, and given a wide. Not for height, but for the line. Was a close one, but probably a good decision

wkt_text: JC Buttler  b Avesh Khan 13 (30m 11b 1x4 1x6) SR: 118.18
text: what a start to your spell! Buttler's stumps rattled, and Avesh has struck. Full around off stump, angling in to the stumps as Buttler tries to welcome him with a sloggy swipe to long on. Misses the connection, and Avesh hits bulls eye
preText: last over of the powerplay.

text: full just outside off. A gentle drive past cover's left, and they pick up two as Rahul collects the ball from around the boundary line after making a chase
preText: Samson joins Padikkal.
postText: Ram: "Rajasthan Royals are the only team to win 2 games by batting first"

shortText: Avesh Khan to Samson, no run
text: full on leg stump, and clipped in front of square. Samson misses out on the wayward line from Avesh, hitting it to midwicket

shortText: Avesh Khan to Samson, no run
text: good length ball on off stump. Samson expected it to bounce more as he looks to play a punch off the back foot. Mistimed, and it ends up as an inside-edged shot onto his body before rolling away to the off side

shortText: Avesh Khan to Samson, no run
text: fullish just outside off. Samson shuffles across to cover off stump before defending the ball away

shortText: Avesh Khan to Samson, no run
text: just two off his first over. Short ball on leg stump, and left alone by Samson
full, and quite wide outside off. Padikkal slaps a mistimed shot courtesy the width to deep point

tosses it up. Full outside off, and Samson tonks it right over the umpire's head with ease! Bishnoi's legbreaks don't turn as much as the googly, and Samson took full advantage of that. Off the sweet spot
good length on off. Turning into middle. Worked off the back foot to deep midwicket
preText: Dasitha: "Credit should go to the Chameera as well for keeping things tight at one end.. Avesh uses full benefit from that.. This what MI lacks in last few games. No bowler on other end to keep things tight to support Bumrah.. "

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Padikkal, no run
text: good length ball outside off. Angling across as he tries to cut. Quicker delivery and he misses out
full outside leg. Padikkal tries to sweep but misses. The googly didn't turn in much either for a bowled-type dismissal around Padikkal's legs. Wide given
slower through the air. Full on leg, and clipped off the back foot to midwicket

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Samson, no run
text: full on off. Samson expects the googly and therefore plays a heave to the leg side. Straight to midwicket
like a tracer bullet as Padikkal smacks this full ball on off stump down the ground. Too hot for KL Rahul at mid off too, who misfields, and that allows Royals to take the run
lazy elegance as some people like to call it. Length ball on a fourth-stump line. Samson stays on the back foot and plays a cut rather late, and gets it behind backward point for four
good length outside off. Cut again, past point, but man in the deep runs across to intercept

shortText: Avesh Khan to Padikkal, no run
text: fullish ball on off stump. Tapped back to the bowler

shortText: Avesh Khan to Padikkal, no run
text: length ball lands just outside leg and Padikkal tries to play a flick rather fine. Misses the shot, hits the thigh guard, rolls away to the keeper's right

shortText: Avesh Khan to Padikkal, no run
text: full around leg stump. Padikkal misses the flick as the ball angles across and hits his front leg in front of middle stump. Appeal for lbw turned down, that probably either pitched outside leg or took some bat en route to the pad. Time out
108kph slower ball, full outside off stump. Driven with the angled bat to deep point
preText: Holder returns.

text: full on middle and leg. Pushed to midwicket, which is vacant. The outfielder runs in and stops the two

wkt_text: SV Samson lbw b Holder 13 (17m 12b 2x4 0x6) SR: 108.33
text: is he lbw on a full toss? Yes! Slides this full toss into the stumps, and Samson misses the flick from near his knee roll. Hits him, and the umpire has an easy decision to make. Samson does not review

shortText: Holder to van der Dussen, FOUR
text: starts his campaign with a boundary as Holder goes full on leg. Rassie plays it fine, closing the bat's face, and gets it past the keeper's left for four

shortText: Holder to van der Dussen, no run
text: full on off stump. Defended off the front foot

shortText: Holder to van der Dussen, no run
text: good length outside off stump. It's an offcutter. Cut to point. Successful over for Holder

wkt_text: D Padikkal c Holder b Gowtham 29 (51m 29b 4x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: around the stumps. Full on off. Padikkal goes for a reverse sweep, but he's top edged it only for first slip to eat him up! Padikkal tried to hit it over conventional short third man, but was through the shot too early. Gowtham starts with a bang
preText: ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster has Royals on course to reach 156. Not enough on this surface against a line-up that bats till No. 8 atleast. Padikkal, who struggles after the powerplay, needs to get a move on. K Gowtham on now, starting the fifth-bowler overs.

text: continues around the stumps to Hetmyer. Full on middle. Bit of offspin on offer. Carefully fended off the back foot
full on off. Clips it square past the umpire with soft hands off the front foot. Calls early for the second run as well
full on middle, and flicked once more. This time to deep midwicket

shortText: Gowtham to van der Dussen, OUT
wkt_text: HE van der Dussen  b Gowtham 4 (9m 4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: bowled 'im! And Rassie is out after a boundary. Gowtham continues around the stumps. Gets this full ball on middle to go straight through. Rassie misses the cut, the ball goes past the blade, and off stump is broken.
postText: Time for a change in commentary with that wicket and Super Giants on top. Here's Himanshu.

text: good length ball outside off, and dabbed to short third man
preText:
Ashwin the new man in, as Gowtham comes from around the wicket. A leg slip in place.

Thanks Sreshth. A real recovery needed for Royals.

text: zips one at a back of a length just outside off. He has a poke at that, but is beaten by pace
preText: Chameera back. A slip waiting, as he comes from over the wicket.

text: good length ball just outside off, as this keeps just a tad low. Tapped towards over after adjusting for the low bounce
preText: Those of you in the USA can watch this game live on ESPN+.

text: a touch fuller on off at 140kph. Ashwin blocks it to point, as the ball hints to angle away
postText: Manu: "Perfect opportunity for Parag to prove himself tonight..." --- Of course when he comes out to bat

text: drives this fuller ball outside off to point. That made a good sound off the bat, but didn't go far
on the shorter of a good length on off, and clipped expertly to deep midwicket. A reminder of what the Ashwin of old did with the bat. Good chase by long-on running to his right, pulling it back late
phew, this flies past the outside edge now! Ashwin's bat face is half-closed as he tries to clip this fuller ball outside off, as the ball shapes to angle in before moving away late
full ball no off, and driven to deep point
preText: Around the wicket comes Gowtham

text: full again off, and driven to long-off now
preText: Around the stumps to Ashwin too. Leg slip stands.

text: another full delivery on middle and off. Flicked to long-on
good length ball on middle, as he steps across to clip to fine leg
on a good length on off, as he closes the bat face to tuck to midwicket
gets into it with a slog over long-on! Gowtham goes fuller on off, as Hetmyer is down on his knee early to heave that across the line. Makes up for a quiet over until then
low full toss on off, as the ball is tossed up. Pushed to long-off
preText:
Bishnoi back from over the wicket... And Ashwin backs out at the last moment. Perhaps something distracted him near the sightscreen.

Amey: "RR batting is suddenly looking very thin. "

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Hetmyer, no run
text: past the outside edge. Slides this fullish and fast on off, and it turns away, as he has a poke
preText: A word between the batters, as Bishnoi stays over the wicket to the left-hander. A slip there too.

text: shorter in length and outside off. Cut away to deep point
pretty full ball on off, and driven to deep point

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Hetmyer, no run
text: fuller and outside off. Again he has tries to have a dab, but is beaten on the outside edge
shorter in length outside off, and turning away. Cut to point
postText:
Sky: "@Amey From the start of the tournament I've felt that way. Which is why the decision to not play Neesham is bizarre. Adds depth to the batting can bowl in the death. Partially solves the only 2 problems RR have right now."

Time-out

text: full on off, and flatter too. Tapped to cover
preText:
Gowtham will continue.

Seven overs to go. How far can Hetmyer, Ashwin and Parag take this? Our predictor says 145.

text: dropped by Krunal at long-on! That was an easy catch. Hetmyer tries to pull that ball, but it isn't short enough on middle, and neither does he get it off the middle of the bat. Krunal almost seemed unsure how to take it, and ended it somewhere between a reverse cup and his fingers facing the sky
single to deep midwicket, as Ashwin clips this fullish ball which is quicker too on leg
pushed back to the bowler, as the ball is on a good length
fuller on leg, and nudged towards midwicket. The bowler gives the chase
fullish in length and a little wide of off, as Ashwin has a jab but misses

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Hetmyer, no run
text: shorish in length, and wide of off. Finds extra cover with his cut
off the outside edge, but wide of slip. Goes pushing at this fullish ball turning away. Good diving stop to his right at short third man
short of a length on off, and pulled to long-on from deep in the crease
fullish and down the leg side. Left alone, and called wide
leading edge there. Closes the bat face early to that good length ball on off, and somehow manages to get it towards long-off

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Ashwin, no run
text: a yorker on middle, and quick and flat. Jammed off the inside edge
gets a bottom edge, as he looks to sweep that full ball outside off. A single behind the wicket
sends that flying over the bowler's head! Boom! Opens the bat face a touch to that full ball on off, and launches into that with his front leg out of the way
preText: Max: "Ravi Ashwin is one of my fav cricketers, but seeing him bat 4 down in a T20 is a bit of a joke tbh. What is RR thinking?"

text: six more, and Ashwin presses the accelerator! Short of a length on leg, and he waits for the ball to come to pull over deep midwicket from deep in the crease
full toss on off, and he lofts that on the bounce to long-off
preText: Over the wicket now

text: short and wide of off, and cut away to the right of deep point
fuller and just outside off. Pushed back to the bowler
preText: Ashish: "Ashwin answers Max in his own style!"

text: this is quicker and on a good length on middle and leg. He clips to short fine leg
back of a length outside off, and punched to point
preText: Avesh from over the wicket
postText: Gagan: "@himanshu: who will win today? Man city or Liverpool?" --- If you ask me, I will hardly be affected by the result. Manchester United can barely manage a win after all.

text: has a swing at that pretty full outside off, but just manages to nudge it to the bowler's right. A single dribbling to long-on
preText: He runs in, but Ashwin backs out... To be reloaded.

text: short of a length just outside off. He taps that to point after getting on top of the bounce
fires a yorker on off, as Ashwin gets an inside edge while trying to slog to the on side. The ball goes to fine leg, as the keeper can't collect the throw cleanly to allow an overthrow
postText: Keyan: "when negative event happens after someone's comment we say Jinx. What is it for Positive event? Max -positive jinx?" --- Reverse jinx?

shortText: Avesh Khan to Ashwin, no run
text: swing and a miss! On a shortish length outside off, and he misses his pull
wide outside off. Too full and too wide. Left alone
lofts that to long-off. Pretty full ball on off at 135kph, and Ashwin mistimes his slog
yorker on leg, as he makes room. Flicked to fine leg
preText:
Holder from over the wicket

Jay: "There is only Parag left who can bat in their line up. From Boult down it is a lottery of sorts. Perhaps Ashwin was sent 1 spot ahead to play a bit sensibly before slogging out"

text: fires that over wide long-on! Right there in his hitting zone on a full length on middle, as he gets his front leg out of the way to launch into that heave
preText: Third man and fine leg up. Holder over the wicket still.

text: has a swing again, but misses this. It was full and pretty wide of off, and angling away further as it was a slower ball
postText: Malli: "This RR team reminds me of SRH few seasons ago, strong bowling lineup, consistent opener and no/thin middle order. It wins when top orders strikes, loses otherwise"

text: hoicked over short fine leg! Has a free swing of the arms to that good length ball on middle, which is angling away. Gets that off the inside edge, but four still
Has that landed in the sea? Drilled over the bowler's head. Takes a step across off, and gets that full length ball outside off. Fires that bang over the bowler's head
change of pace, and short and wide of off. He slaps that to the man at cover-point, and pinches a single
preText: Around the wicket now

text: a near yorker on middle, and crunched to long-on from deep in the crease
preText:
Two overs to go. Anyone for 160?

Bala: "My comments a while back was not published. I had stated that Hetmyer is likely to have fun with the fast bowlers as the quota of Gowtham and Bishnoi are over. It is a reality now." --- You said it...

wkt_text: R Ashwin retired out 28 (40m 23b 0x4 2x6) SR: 121.73
text: full and wide of off, as he drags that to deep point
swatted over deep point! Short and wide of off, and he rides the bounce to slash that far and wide of the man at deep point
preText: Ashwin rushes off the park... He has retired out! Wow!
postText: Arali : "Ashwin has 5 test hundreds - more than the rest of the RR players probably combined, that's not a joke" --- Yes, but I am not sure how much that matters in a T20.

text: slapped over deep midwicket! What has got into him suddenly? Reaches his fifty off 33 balls. Right in the slot on a fullish length on middle, and he swings like freeing himself of pain
has another heave, and gets that on the bounce to deep midwicket. Fuller on middle and leg this time from Avesh
cracks a yorker on middle. Parag jams his bat down late for a single
a slow, dipping full toss on middle and leg. Swung away to fine leg
preText: Sriky: "Always thought retired out is a gully cricket innovation and not a real cricket rule. Wow"

text: all that doesn't matter, as Hetmyer still gets six! A slower ball, and a full toss outside off. He is ready to dispatch that out of the world. Six over deep midwicket
preText: Deep midwicket now pretty straight. Third man out too, with deep point wide. Holder around the wicket.
postText: Ahan: "Retiring someone out is a purely tactical move in t20 and should be seen as such. Hopefully it becomes more mainstream in the near future."

text: makes room, and pulls this short of a length ball wide of off to long-on
preText: Conference between Stoinis, Holder and Rahul now. Holder back over the wicket.

text: another slower ball, another full toss and another six! Parag is down on his knee to send that blazing over fine leg. More pain for Holder
postText: Andrew Evans: "I once retired out in a 3rd XI game as I wasn't scoring. RR must have taken notice of my example." --- Why not? Who knows what happens in the world of so much data and info?

wkt_text: R Parag c Gowtham b Holder 8 (10m 4b 0x4 1x6) SR: 200.00
text: is that a clean catch by Gowtham at fine leg? Yup, looks like. But the umpire will check even as Parag is ready to walk back. A slower-ball bouncer from Holder on off, and he gets extra bounce. Gowtham has to go low, but takes it well in the end

wkt_text: KL Rahul  b Boult 0 (1m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: peach of a ball! Comes around the stumps, bowls full, ball originates outside off but swings in with the angle. Rahul can't get any bat on it with the late swing, and Boult's angle has worked against Rahul! Through the gap between bat and pad as Rahul tried to mow it through the leg side
preText: Welcome back to the chase. de Kock, Rahul and Boult are protagonists for the opening salvo.

wkt_text: K Gowtham lbw b Boult 0 (3m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: two wickets in three balls! The new-ball master is at it. The Gowtham experiment has not worked, Boult too good for him with the new cherry. Boult comes over the stumps. Full on middle, and angling into leg stump. Gowtham can't get bat on ball.
top take by Samson as he flies to his left to grab this one handed. Bowl went full on middle to the No. 3 Gowtham, but went down the leg side courtesy the swing.
full outside off as he searches for the swing. Ends up overpitching. Toe-ends a drive to mid off
preText: Holder at No. 4.
postText: Navin: "Thats pure class from Boult!! But Badoni will be hitting the winning runs today!! "

text: full outside off stump. Pushes at the ball angling away from Holder. No swing
length ball on off, and just going across Holder subtly. He sticks the bat out to try and push at it, but the ball goes past the outside edge. So close!
fullish, wider from Boult, and Holder pounces on it. Good length outside off, and cut behind square, past the packed slip cordon

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to de Kock, no run
text: full ball around the stumps. Swings in and lands on middle. de Kock flicks off his pads

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to de Kock, 1 run
text: good length on his pads, and clipped to the leg side

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Holder, no run
text: full outside off, from over the stumps. Bit of outswing, taking it away from Holder. Left alone
preText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: How many times have Ashwin and Chahal dismissed de Kock in the IPL?

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Holder, no run
text: full outside off. Bit of movement away as he presses forward to defend. Past the outside edge

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Holder, no run
text: good length, outside off stump. Tries to cut, misses out on the connection

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Holder, no run
text: ends up as a wide full toss since Holder reaches out to drive and the ball is swinging away. Mistimed to cover point

shortText: Boult to de Kock, no run
text: full from over the wicket. Lands around off stump. Full face of the bat in his front-foot block

full and wide outside off stump. Presses forward and caresses a drive through the covers. Got four written all over it, but Jos Buttler has other plans. Runs towards the boundary, throws in the dive, and slides the ball back in even though he crashes into the boundary line.
full outside off, and he gets into the front-foot drive to the off side
full on middle and leg, and swinging further into leg and perhaps down. Holder can't get the flick, and it hits the front pad. No lbw appeal either
around the stumps. Back of a length and angling into Holder's body. Looks to pull, but mistimed. Bottom-edged onto the deck
inside edge and luck goes Holder's way. Boult went length from around the stumps, and Holder tried to muscle a pull over the leg side. Edged, over the stumps, and races away to fine leg

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to de Kock, 1 leg bye
text: around the stumps. Length ball trying to follow de Kock if he backs away to the leg side. He doesn't, tries to flick, hits the thigh and rolls down to long on

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Holder, no run
text: over the stumps. Full outside off, enticing Holder to drive. But the ball swings away, and he misses the connection
preText:
Sachin: "You know now, why Mumbai is at bottom of the table."

Jassim : "@sachin they were preparing for 2023 IPL...forgot about this year's ipl"

wkt_text: JO Holder c Ashwin b Prasidh Krishna 8 (17m 14b 2x4 0x6) SR: 57.14
text: in the air and mid on - Ashwin - pockets that with ease. Prasidh bowls short of a length, Holder looks to be in position to pull, but the bat's face is looking up, and has sliced the shot in the air. A fist pump from Prasidh as Super Giants go 14 for 3
crunched over cover for four! Prasidh goes full outside off, Hooda chooses to drive with hard hands. Off the bat's middle, and flies over the infielder

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Hooda, no run
text: back of a length, fifth-stump line. Hooda rides the bounce, gets on top of it, before cutting to point

full outside off stump. Leans into a drive, well struck, but Buttler flies to his right along the ground from mid off to complete a one-handed stop. Saves three runs, and keeps the pressure up on Super Giants
postText: Kapil Baldawa : "Honestly, what exactly is the rationale of sending 2 finishers at No.3 and 4 respectively? Why not try Hooda at 3? He is in good form and can make use of the PP too and when QDC is still around, he can take care of PP big time. Poor planning from LSG to waste two big hitters"

text: back of a length, on off. Rides the bounce and fends it to the off side. Soft hands
postText: Jamdy: "RR Bowling looks solid.courtesy MALINGAAAA.."

text: full on middle and leg. Swinging into Hooda. Looks to flick it off his toes, but it's a quick ball that zoots through. Hits his front leg, but impact on leg is probably outside leg stump too.
smart shot as Hooda uses Boult's pace and the field placement to ramp this short ball over the infield
full on leg, and flicked well behind square off his boots. Rassie at deep square leg runs towards fine leg and puts in a slide to save two runs
around the stumps. Length ball outside off but angling into off stump. Bottom-edges the cut
postText: Prashant: "I personally feel Boult is too underrated. Hardly gets retained, while being your opening and death bowler, gun fielder, who can hit some blows with the bat too. He is one of those good guys who is taken for granted."

text: full on a stump to stump line. Defended to the off side off the front foot
preText: over the stumps

text: full on middle stump. Defended off the front foot to mid on
preText: Ashwin.

text: around the stumps. Full on middle stump. Pushed to long off for one
preText: Noor: "@Prashant, he wasn't retained because he wasn't that good before his time with Mumbai Indians in 2020. Mumbai deserve some credit for buying him and using him so well."

text: full on off stump. Flicked off his pads to fine leg for a single
full on off stump. Guided off the front foot to the off side
slider. Length ball on off and angling in. Punched to long on

shortText: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
text: good length, on off and middle. Defended towards the off side. Single? No, infielder swoops in from point to stop
postText: Aslam: "Royals have the most number of number 11 batsman. Boult, Chahal, Krishna. And now with Sen they cant afford a top order collapse. I think this will be their achilles heel for the tournament the lack of batting depth. "

text: almost a yorker on off stump. Ends up as a low full toss and he toe-ends the drive back
preText: First look at Kuldeep Sen. He's tall, touching 6 feet if not crossing it.

text: full on off stump. Pushed to mid off, and he takes off for one. Running to the danger end, and Prasidh aims a throw. Not a direct hit!
good length, on leg stump. Swivels and pulls over deep backward square!

shortText: Sen to de Kock, no run
text: is it a wicket for Kuldeep?! Length ball on leg, zips through. de Kock tries to pull in front of square, but it goes through to the keeper. En route to the keeper, it touched something, since there was some noise. Massive appeal for caught behind but not given. They don't review either. The sound was ball grazing the waist
full on middle and leg. Clipped to deep backward square leg
full outside off. Hooda wants to drive. But he loses his shape, and the ball goes past to Samson. Good first over, despite the six
postText: Over to Himanshu now

text: good length ball on off. Clipped to deep square leg
preText: Thanks Sreshth. Here comes Chahal from over the wicket

text: fuller ball on middle, and flicked to deep square leg
full again, and outside off. He clips to deep square leg. de Kock wanted a second, but was sent back
gets a leading edge as he looks to clip this full ball on leg, which is turning away a touch
skips down, and swings to deep midwicket! Gets to the pitch of the full ball on middle, and plays across the line after getting to the pitch
short of a length on middle and turning away. Pushed to long-on
good length ball with a hint of turn in. Punched to long-off
preText: Ashwin from over the wicket

text: slams that full ball outside off over the bowler's head after backing away
preText: Around the wicket to de Kock

text: fuller and straighter. Pushed back to the bowler
postText: krishnadeep: "Kuldeep Sen is quick!!"

text: short of a length and wide of off. Slashed to deep point
back of a length on middle, and he gets an inside edge as he looks to stab at that. Single to short fine leg
fuller on off, and driven to long-on
postText:
Srivatsa: "Hunting in packs now between Ash and Yuzi.. Like this passage of play"

Time-out

wkt_text: DJ Hooda  b Sen 25 (28m 24b 3x4 0x6) SR: 104.16
text: crashed into the stumps! Sen has his first IPL wicket. The middle and leg stumps are shaken. On a good length on middle, as Hooda swings across the line and misses. Hooda was standing on leg stump there, with his front leg out of the way. Clean bowled
preText:
Sen back from over the wicket.

Time to restart. 114 to get from 66 balls. Royals ahead, you would think.

text: back of a length outside off, and tapped to third man
preText: Badoni the new man in. A slip there.
postText: Mohan: "Surprised to see how many Indian domestic talented quick bowlers are hitting 140 regularly."

text: swipes this fullish ball - not all that short - on middle, and drags that wide of long-on
fullish on off, and he quickly dabs that to cover for a single
runs this shortish ball outside off down to third man with an open face of the bat
outside edge, and that races for four! Samson dives to his left, but doesn't get a hand. A low full toss just outside off, as de Kock drives but doesn't get the placement
full ball on off, and tucked to cover for a hurried run
postText: KK: "Come on AB! I mean Ayush Badoni!"

shortText: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
text: reverse sweeps this full ball on off to short third man. Dot ball early in the over
drags this full ball outside off to extra cover, who doesn't collect cleanly and allows a single
