text: point dives to his left and gets a hand to cut that off! Chahal the man there. Short and wide of off, as Badoni went slashing
on a good length on middle, and from wide of the crease. Clipped to deep midwicket
low full toss on middle and leg, and clipped to deep square leg
fullish ball outside off, and clipped wide of long-on for a couple
preText: Prashant: "It's boiling over in... Manchester"

text: sweeps hard and flat in the vast gap at deep square leg! Full ball on middle, and also tossed up. He gets down early to drill that
full and tossed up on middle. Turned away to fine leg after playing late
shimmies down, and the ball is a low full toss on middle. Jammed to long-on
shuffles across off, and Chahal bowls on a good length wide of off. de Kock gets a leading edge while trying to clip. A single to deep point nevertheless

wkt_text: A Badoni c Parag b Chahal 5 (16m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 71.42
text: straight to long-off! Skips down the pitch early - and he had to get bat on ball once he had danced down - as Chahal went full and outside off. Badoni looks to loft, but finds the fielder bang where he was placed on the boundary
full ball on his pads, and flicked towards midwicket. Ashwin gives the chase
looks to clip this fullish ball on middle, but gets a leading edge to short third man
preText: Pandya the new man in. Ashwin around the wicket.

text: comes down the pitch and defends this fullish ball on off
preText: Slip in now

text: fuller on middle, and leans into a drive to long-off
full on middle, and clipped to deep midwicket
pushes this full ball on leg aerially to long-off. Ashwin ends with 0 for 20
preText: Deepak Sahu: "It's time for Krunal to prove his worth."

text: has Hetmyer pulled it back at the deep point fence? Still, it was a great effort. He ran and dived to his right, and the ball passes below him before he pulls it back. Short and wide of off, and slashed hard
preText: Sen back. Over the wicket.

text: short of a length on middle, and pulled to deep square leg

shortText: Sen to de Kock, no run
text: looks to pull this back of a length ball outside off, but is beaten by the pace. Not as much bounce there too
postText: Anu: "Pandya not bowling, Holder at 4, Stoinis not out yet, talk about overthinking it"

text: has a heave outside off, and gets an outside edge to this pretty full and wide of off
full ball on his pads, and flicked to deep square leg for a quick two
low full toss on middle, and pushed to mid-off. A near yorker there

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pandya, no run
text: yorker length on middle. Jams his bat down to push back to the bowler
preText:
Prasidh back. Over the wicket.

79 from 36 balls. Very difficult for Super Giants from here.
postText: Visakh: "@Anu may I add Gowtham at number 3 against Boult?"

text: whips that to deep midwicket! Full ball on his pads, and he capitalises on the length to use his bottom hand. Right in the gap there
gets that off the toe end of the bat to point, as he looks to pull that good length ball outside off

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to de Kock, 1 run
text: drills that swing across the line to long-on, with the ball being full and outside off
preText: Afeef: "Two former MI boys batting together at the Wankhede. Backing them to win it for their new team."

text: shuffles across, and laps that full toss outside off! He was across early, and spotted square leg inside the circle while depositing it over his head

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pandya, no run
text: full toss and wide-ish off. He has a swing, but is beaten
short and wide off, and dragged to long-off away from his body
preText: Chahal back. Over the wicket.
postText: Shankar: "QDK, Rahul, Stoinis, Hooda, Krunal, Badoni, Holder, Gowtham - this should be the batting order with Krunal as floater. "

text: down the pitch, and the ball is on a good length on middle while turning into him. They pinch two, and then a third as the throw is not collected cleanly at the bowler's end and on the back-up

wkt_text: Q de Kock c Parag b Chahal 39 (80m 32b 2x4 1x6) SR: 121.87
text: grabbed at long-on! de Kock had to go after Chahal, but he falls. Is it all over for Super Giants? Short of a length and wide of off, as he pulled across the line only to find Parag on the fence. Chahal helps himself to a quiet celebration
postText:
Kamal: "Textbook de Kock dismissal against Chahal. Holing out deep in front of the wicket. "

Time-out

text: good length ball outside off, and cut away to deep point
preText: 65 to get off 27, and Stoinis is here, finally.
postText: Akhil: "Stoinis in finally. But guess it's 15 overs late than it should be."

wkt_text: KH Pandya  b Chahal 22 (24m 15b 2x4 0x6) SR: 146.66
text: bowled him around his legs! Pandya was across his stumps really early, and missed his attempted sweep there. Tossed up - and looked like the wrong 'un too - on a fullish length on middle and off. Pandya ended up down on his knees way outside off, and the ball crashed into the stumps as he missed
goes flashing at that wayyy outside off, and gets an outside edge. Tossed up, full and wide of off, as he went chasing that. Got an outside edge, and went for four to third man
preText:
Chameera in now

Varunnath: "Now I understand Ashwin's contribution with the bat."

text: slower ball on a back of a length on middle. Tapped to point after letting the ball come to him
preText: Boult back for the kill. Over the wicket.

text: much fuller and just outside off. Driven to deep point for a quick two
yorker on off, and he jams that down to point
pretty full on middle, and he drills that to long-on after making room
pulled to deep midwicket! Short of a length on middle and off, and he swivels while riding the bounce and pulling with his front leg in the air
fuller length on off, and he hoicks across the line to fine leg. It was a slower ball too
six over deep midwicket! Short ball from Chahal, and quicker on middle and leg. Stoinis pulls from deep in the crease, and hammers that away
pretty full and wide of off. Slashed to extra cover, as he doesn't find the gap
preText:
Change of ball now... Maybe because that one was lost.

Sonal ST: "Incidentally, RR scored 50 off the last 3...same as reqd. rate now"

text: sharp turn away from the batter. Short and outside off, and turning away further. Slashed to deep point away from hid body
chipped back to the bowler on the bounce! Fuller on middle, and tucked back
and again, but this is wide. Short and wide of off, and spins away well. He cuts, but misses

wkt_text: PVD Chameera lbw b Chahal 13 (15m 7b 2x4 0x6) SR: 185.71
text: animated appeal for leg before, but turned down. And Samson reviews. A yorker length ball on middle and leg, after being tossed up. He had his front leg out of the way, and missed the ball while trying to jam. There is no inside edge there as well. And replays show that would hit the base of middle stump
more turn for Chahal. Called wide... and Chahal has a chat with the umpire. Full and tossed up outside off, and turning away as he misses his sweep. Harsh call
has he been practicing swinging his bat? Nails that slog over deep midwicket after going down on his knee to that tossed up ball on middle and off. Chahal is hurt, and shakes his head
preText:
Avesh the new batter

Anil Kapur: "The umpire has had a couple of bad balls there. No way a wide, and misses a plumb lbw..."

text: clips behind the wicket for four! Walks across off very early, and ended up exposing all three stumps. Fullish ball on middle, and he clips away from his body. Beats short fine leg to his right by a fair margin
wide to begin. Too full and wide of off, and left alone
preText: 34 off 12. Stoinis the only hope for Super Giants. And here comes Prasidh.
postText: Mohd Irshad: "There Samson simply gave up on umpire, and went directly for review."

text: low full toss on middle, and swung away to deep midwicket. The throw arrived at the bowler's end, as Prasidh even whipped the bails off while Avesh seemed well in. But the umpires goes upstairs, and it is not out
preText: Boult and Buttler in a chat with Prasidh

text: fired over the bowler's head! Another low full toss on middle, and Stoinis has his front leg out of the way to help swing himself. Bang for six down the ground
preText: Bimal: "An Englishman and a Kiwi tips to take out an Aussie! "

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Stoinis, no run
text: goes for the yorker, and it's a full toss on off. Pushed to long-on, and they don't run for him to keep strike
preText: How will Prasidh come back now?

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Stoinis, no run
text: bangs it in short on off at 140kph, and Samson and Prasidh go up for a potential caught behind as Stoinis misses his pull. Not given, and Samson reviews. Nothing there, as confirmed by UltraEdge, with the ball passing over his bat and then his right shoulder. Review lost
preText: 21 needed off 8.

text: he holds the pose, and six down the ground! A low full toss - yet again - perhaps while missing his yorker, and Stoinis tears into it with high elbows and the full face of the bat
preText: Buttler and Prasidh in a conversation again...

text: full toss on middle, and he lofts that over cover. Only a single there, of course
preText: Sen to Avesh. 15 off 6. Super Giants need Stoinis back on strike.

text: sends that to the man at extra cover. Full and wide of off, and he drills that straight to the man
preText:
Third man and fine leg in.

14 off 5. What can Stoinis do?

text: looks to scoop, but is hit on his front pad. Pretty full ball outside off, and Stoinis is hit outside off after shuffling across
swing and a miss! This should potentially deicide the match, unless of course there aren't wides or no-balls. Again pretty full and wide of off, and Stoinis has a heave but is beaten
preText: Two dots in a row... 14 off 3 to get.

text: no-look hoick, and takes the outside edge over short third man! Full delivery outside off, and he swung for the on side but had no control there.

Stoinis launches that over midwicket, but alas! Rajasthan Royals win by three runs. Right in the slot on off, and he heaved across the line to send that flat and furiously over the fence. It doesn't matter though
postText:
That's all from us at ESPNcricinfo. A cracking game. A cracking defense of a par score. An impressive evening out for Hetmyer, Boult, Ashwin, de Kock, Chahal, Stoinis and Kuldeep Sen. See you tomorrow for more IPL action!

Presentation time.Yuzvendra Chahal is the Player of the Match: "I've been bowling well always, in the middle I had a bad patch, but my main strength is my mind and I didn't want to divert from that. (Wet ball) It was tough but it is my duty. I am ready to bowl any time. I thought to protect runs so that it will be useful later. My favourite wicket was de Kock's dismissal since he set and is a gamechanger. (Tossing it up, Badoni wicket) He had done it before, so I thought may be he will do it again. It was my intuition, which is why I went full and wide. (150 IPL wickets) Thank you, don't think too much. Next game comes up soon. No Instagram reels for me, my Mrs is making them now (laughs)."

Winning captain Sanju Samson: "Didn't know we are top of table. (Kuldeep) Depends upon how he bowled his first three overs. I thought he had done really well and had the confidence to bowl those wide yorkers. Whatever I saw in Syed Mushtaq Ali, after that Royals picked him up. He is a special talent, can be for India soon. (Boult) Great character on and off the field. After the first ball he said, 'I will change my plans.' Really funny guy to hang around with and skills are commendable. (Hetmyer) Conversations are 'have you eaten? Slept well? Are you happy?' He has great cricketing sense and reads situations well. (Ashwin retired out) We thought if some situation occurs (before the season) that if we need to use retired out, we will. It was a team decision. (Chahal) He is someone who can be given the ball from over 1 or over 20. He is the greatest legspinner India has ever seen at present. He is a great matchwinner, Ashwin's four overs are also crucial so though why not use him later in the innings."

Saurabh Mantri: "Finally, first successful target defend at Wankhede this season. RR is keep on defending their target where others are struggling."

Trent Boult: "(Around the wicket to KL Rahul) It was a late call in the morning. It was Neesham's idea. Rahul is a great player, but nice for a plan like that to come off. It is my role with the new ball to be aggressive and take wickets in the powerplay so it was a good feeling to get a couple. (Came over the wicket later) You guys have seen me bowl enough. At the top it is to pitch it up and get some movement. (Kuldeep Sen) He is a great guy, bowls with heart. Executed under pressure and will only grow from an experience like that. There are some quality fast bowling assets in our side and throughout the tournament. (Are you going to watch the over again?) I will probably watch my batting first."

8670Ronnie: "That brilliant retired out moves proves to be the masterstroke in the end ! If Ashwin had stayed, perhaps he wouldn't have been able to hit that six that Parag did and Lucknow wins the game by 2 wickets !" -- Don't forget the four overthrows!

11.38pm Thanks, Himanshu. Quite the hold from Kuldeep Sen at the end.

Here's losing captain KL Rahul: " (His wicket) I didn't see it, otherwise would've put bat on it. Was a good ball, got to give it to Boult. (Target) We have a team that is never out of the contest. We bat really deep, got options with the ball, so we kept believing even at 20 for 3. In our games, we've gotten ourselves in some trouble and also found ways to get out of it. We needed one good partnership that didn't get going. Towards the end, brilliant from Stoinis to take it that far and give us a chance to win. (Stoinis) We know how dangerous he is, so we wanted him after the 15th over. But we have options and we will try to be unpredictable and shuffle the batting order sometimes. We sent Gowtham today since it was a 160 game, 160 games can be tricky. We know how important powerplay is, so we thought Gowtham could put bowlers off. Didn't work out today. (Summary) We've done really well so far. Our death bowling has stood out. Today we couldn't execute our yorkers well but that can happen. With Shimron and Stoinis and other guys, they can really do damage at the back end if you miss your plans. We learn from it when they don't come off."

Sreshth will close out the day from here.

11.37pm Super Giants fall short by a whisker. Maybe they got it wrong with their batting order; but maybe we wouldn't be saying that had Stoinis - even from as low as No. 8 - helped them over the line.

text: Tame start from Umesh, top start for Shaw! Length ball outside off, just a bit of movement away. Nothing much to trouble Shaw, who stands tall and punches it through wide mid-off for four.
preText:
3:28pm Right then! All set for the action to begin. The final huddle for KKR is done as the players jog out to their respective fielding positions. Prithvi Shaw and David Warner stride out to the middle. Shaw looked so good in the previous game. Powerplay star with the ball, Umesh Yadav has a slip in place for the powerplay star with the bat, Shaw. Time to roll!

Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English or Hindi.

George: "I've been reading your article on how the Aussie women's team became so awesome. Could BCCI have two or three women's teams play in one of the Ranji plate groups for men, to accelerate their development?" The women could have a competition of their own, for starters. This is the story that's being referred to, cricpeeps!

"Am i missing something or is DC playing with only 3 foreigners? " You are absolutely spot on, Riasat. Nortje is replaced by Khaleel today.

3:20pm Under ten minutes to go for the start. The head-to-head numbers pose for an interesting read. KKR have won 16 out of the 28 matches they've played against DC. However, since 2018, the Capitals have won five of the eight matches the teams have contested.

Meanwhile, you can follow our Live Report for a bit extraa tit-bits throughout the match.

Though Lalit didn't do much in his first season with Delhi Capitals, this year, things have been different, writes Hemant Brar

Rohit: "Nortje is dropped due to fitness or performance?" He was returning after a long layoff, so perhaps a bit more time for him to gather himself.

3:10pm Lalit Yadav: I am confident in this season more than the previous one. I am less afraid and am enjoying this part of my game. Having played short-form cricket in local games helps during the IPL. I am a batter who can bowl at the same time a bowler who can bat, as per the team requirements.

Krish: "Is this where I get my comments posted from?" Yes, you are absolutely at the right place.

Delhi Capitals: 1 Prithvi Shaw, 2 David Warner, 3 Rovman Powell, 4 Rishabh Pant (capt/wk), 5 Sarfaraz Khan, 6 Lalit Yadav, 7 Axar Patel, 8 Shardul Thakur, 9 Kuldeep Yadav, 10 Mustafizur Rahman, 11 Khaleel Ahmed

Kolkata Knight Riders: 1 Ajinkya Rahane, 2 Venkatesh Iyer, 3 Shreyas Iyer (capt), 4 Sam Billings (wk), 5 Nitish Rana, 6 Andre Russell, 7 Pat Cummins, 8 Sunil Narine, 9 Rasikh Salam, 10 Umesh Yadav, 11 Varun Chakravarthy

3pm Pant calls heads, tails it is, KKR will bowl. "Pretty hard surface" behind the move, says Shreyas Iyer. Rishabh Pant doesn't mind batting first and aims to put up a big score. "Definitely a big relief for the bowlers that there is no dew," says Pant. Capitals bring Khaleel Ahmed in for Anrich Nortje, who took a pasting last game.

Naseef: "KKR looks a completely different side now! They were smart at the auction, yes they have missed out on a player or two, most notably Shubhman Gill, but they got the one player that they must have had on their radar as the most important one - Shreyas Iyer!"

2:55pm Under five minutes for the toss. Most teams have opted to field first owing to the dew in the evening matches. However, Kane Williamson too opted to chase yesterday, in the day game against CSK. What will it be like today?

Prakhar: "@Prashant Vats, I don't exactly agree with you there, Pant has been far from a bad captain, we topped the table last season under his captaincy and only lost because of our bad luck with tosses(we all know how much they matter in the UAE), just hope he becomes the free-flowing batter we all know him to be and that he stops taking the pressure of being a captain."

2:50pm David Warner now has a chat with the broadcaster: (Fitness routine) As I am getting older - I have a great running partner in my wife - I do longer spells to get me up and running. From back when I started, T20 was more about, not hit and giggle, but more about going out there and play your game. But now franchises look about putting more and investing for the future and has become professional. For us it is about getting another win on the board, can't afford to be too far behind. If everyone brings their 100% attitude on the field, then it should be good.

"Can someone show us Fizz bowling record" You can Ask Cricinfo and get your answer, Shamim. ;)

2:45pm "It is just the second day game at the Brabourne and significantly, there'll be no dew factor," says Daren Ganga at the Pitch Report. "It is the centre pitch and there's an even covering of grass. Hard surface. The ball will bounce, fair amount of pace, can hit through the line. A little bit of moisture around, so spinners can take pace off the ball and be effective."

Shamim Ahmed Ip: "I'm Fan of KKR but today I'm supporting DC because of Fizz "

2:40pm Alagappan Muthu wonders who Pat Cummins is exactly in the preview. Meanwhile, what should your fantasy team look like? Take a look at the tips Ben Cutting and Wasim Jaffer share. Psst… Narine and Shreyas could get you points.

Prashant Vats: "Ah! Sad to see Iyer at the rival team. He was the epicenter where this DC/DD team started their resurrection in IPL (post 2018).I still feel DC made a blunder to sticking to Pant as a captain and not retaining Iyer in auctions. DC looked completely different lineup when he was incharge!"

Sunil Narine: The way our fast bowlers are bowling, especially Umi (Umesh Yadav), he's doing a very good job. Makes it easier for us spinners to get in the game. The main thing for us is keeping it simple and continue what we are doing.

KKR are at the top of the points table and a lot of credit could go to Umesh Yadav, who's taken six wickets in the powerplay, the most this season so far. And quite rightly, here's what Sunil Narine had to say speaking to the broadcaster.

Mustafa Moudi: "Fun Fact: Not just Shreyas, but more than half of KKR First Choice Players are Former DC (DD) Players - Rahane, Billings, Russell, Cummins and Umesh. Soon Aaron Finch, who changes an IPL Side almost every year, will also be part of this list. BTW, When will Finch be available for selection ??" He should be available from today ideally.

2:30pm Shreyas Iyer, Delhi Capitals - both come together but on opposite ends. Shreyas, a former Capitals captain, will be plotting their downfall from the other side, leading Kolkata Knight Riders. Rishabh Pant, who replaced Shreyas as the skipper after he was injured in 2021, will be aiming to stem their run of losses. They've lost chasing as well as while defending. What would their strategy be like? Welcome everybody to this riveting match No. 19 of IPL 2022 between KKR and DC. I am S. Sudarshanan and will be soon joined by Himanshu Agrawal in our virtual comm box.

text: Angled in on the pads, clipped through backward square leg for a brace. Shaw is up and running.
Back of a length around off, punched to mid-on from the crease.
Punches the length ball straight to cover.
preText: JPR: "Last 3 games, 3 youngsters stepped up to the Grand Occasion. Now it's turn for DC " Are you looking at Lalit Yadav?

text: Umesh errs, Shaw capitalises. Harmless length ball on the pads, tickled away fine on the leg side for another four.
preText: Garv Asnani: "It's hard luck that Chetan Sakariya misses out yet again! He was getting every match for RR last year and was doing a tremendous job but not getting a chance in DC. I don't see the point if you don't want to play your bowler who was sold for more than 4 crores." About team combination and what they see of players in the nets perhaps.

text: Better line. On a length on off, defended from the crease. Good start for Capitals and Shaw.
preText: Deep square leg in place, fine leg inside the ring.

text: Sprayed full and well outside off at 127.5 clicks. Warner reaches out and gets it past the diving point fielder to open his account.
preText:
Rasikh Salam from the other end. Has a slip to start off with.

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: What's Prithvi Shaw's strike rate against Suni Narine in the IPL?

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Shaw, no run
text: Full and a bit of swing inwards. Shaw waits back and flicks it with the angle to midwicket.
There goes Shaw! After a couple of watchful deliveries, he charges down to the length ball and absolutely thrashes it through covers with disdain.
On a length on off, a bit of shape away. Pushes it towards mid-on despite losing his shape a touch and gets to the other end.

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Warner, no run
text: Beaten Warner for pace! Fuller and outside off, movement away. Warner looks to cut but misses due to the extra bounce.
Warner finds the real estate on the leg side. Short in length, quickly rocks on to the back foot to heave-pull it through midwicket. All along the ground.
preText: AshB: "That's a supremely long run up to bowl at that pace "

text: Crisply punched to mid-off for none. It was just full of a good length on off.
Strays in line again. Tickled fine but finds short fine leg. Just one on this occasion.
Fuller on the pads, tapped towards square leg for one. Rahane's shy misses the stumps at the striker's end. Would have been curtains for Shaw, who doesn't dive.
preText: Not much movement in the air and off the surface for Umesh so far. And that could perhaps make things easy for both Shaw and Warner.

text: Umesh had telegraphed the short ball by having deep point and deep square leg. But Shaw manages to get the pull away, despite not being in the best of positions. Beats deep square leg to his right. Wow!
Another bumper! Off the helmet. Rattles Shaw, who looks to be in some discomfort. Misses the pull and it goes off his helmet over short third man.
postText: Good to see both Umesh and Shreyas go up to Shaw to check if all's well. His trigger, that takes him forward, is creating problems for Shaw, reckons Daren Ganga on air.

text: Hammered away! A gentle ball on a length around middle and leg, Prithvi flicks it over the fielder at midwicket and gets four. Doesn't seem all that at ease, as he adjusts his helmet yet again, touching the part where he got hit on the last ball.
postText: Afeef: "No early wickets for Umesh means bad luck for KKR."

text: Some way to welcome his Test captain by Warner. Short ball and going away on the angle, he hopes and thumps it over covers for four.
preText: Pattrick Cummins to his Aussie team-mate Warner from over the stumps.

text: That's crunchy as chips from Warner! Length ball going away, enough room for him to free his arms. Gets it through covers for another four.

Edged but just short! Not sure if it was intentional, but he's just escaped, has Warner. Looks to guide the fuller ball to third man but gets a thick edge that lands short of a diving Billings to his left.
preText: Around the stumps now.

text: Length ball outside off, steered to deep backward point for one.
Shortish in length around the fourth stump line, Shaw stays back and blocks.

Sixy Shaw! Bouncer on middle and angling in to him, Shaw rides the bounce and pulls it way over the man at deep square leg to bring up the fifty partnership. Didn't bother keeping it down. Expensive start for Cummins.
Angling down leg on a length, misses the flick.
Slower and fuller on off, Warner defends it off the inner half towards midwicket.
preText: Time to slow it down, feels Shreyas. Brings on Varun Chakravarthy.

text: One ball's enough for Warner! Sees the tossed up ball well outside off, fetches the slog and deposits it over deep midwicket. Long day on the field for KKR bowlers, ehh?
Quicker and fuller on middle, goes back and turns it to midwicket.
Very full on off, driven to mid-off.
A touch shorter outside off, mistimes the chop towards cover-point for a quick one.
Fuller on off, worked away through midwicket for one. Eight off the over despite that big six.
preText: Kiran Kadam : "Wow!! This is why this pair was the most dangerous one on paper in ipl.."

text: Flatter on middle and leg, worked away to deep midwicket for one.
preText:
Double change. Sunil Narine from the other end for the final over of the powerplay.

pramod: "@3.6 : is it spelling mistake???" Call it a cricketing adjective, shall we? ;)

text: A mix-up, thankfully doesn't cost Capitals. Warner works it to midwicket and is in the crease, but Shaw is down in search of a run. Sent back and would have been gone had he hit.
Shot! Flatter and outside off, Warner gets out the reverse lap and hits it over short third man for four.
preText: Bala: "BTW what is the highest PP score in IPL? Looks like this innings can potentially qualify as one of the top scores." Here's Ask Cricinfo telling us that.

text: Quicker one on middle, played through midwicket for one.
Floated just outside off, Shaw looks to go over covers but gets a thick edge to short third man. Well short.
Now the sweep. On the pads, Shaw hits it through backward square leg for four more. Delhi end the powerplay on 68 for none.
postText:
Time to revise strategies for KKR. First time-out of the match.

Pawan : "5th bowler in 6th over. Kkr has too many options, I think they have to use them all today."

text: Starts with a short of length ball outside off, the offcutter at 105 clicks. Cut through covers for one.
preText:
What will KKR do now? Time for Russell early? Nope, Venkatesh Iyer it is. Andre Russell it isss, with that purple strip on the back of his head to go with his orange boots.

Mohit: "The pair of Warner and Shaw is like a pair of pocket dynamite. Not very big in stature but powerful and fierce."

text: Short in length again, pulled to midwicket, where a misfield, or a half-stop, allows them a run.
preText: Shamim Ahmed: "I'm here in Ipswich, Suffolk, over 5 thousands miles away from India following ball by ball coverage at work if I get caught using phone might get warning ⚠️ for it but for love of my Cricket "

text: Short in length, on the pads, pulled away to deep square leg for one.
preText:
Meanwhile Russell aborts his run-up after getting to the crease.

Brendon McCullum, the KKR head coach, says he didn't have any message to the players in the break. He wants them to figure it out and get back. Says he would perhaps tell them more in the next break. Interesting.

text: A bit of yes and no again. Russell is not cranking it up yet. Ambles in and lands it on a length on the pads, worked away to short fine leg. A misfield there and Shaw wants one, but Warner disagrees.
Short in length, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
Short in length well outside off, Warner hops and glides it to third man for a single to retain strike. Just five singles in the over, a quieter one in comparison.
Short in length, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
preText:
Venkatesh Iyer to bowl now. Seventh bowler in eight overs.

Here's a timely Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Which team has the best economy rate in the middle overs in IPL 2022? KKR could no doubt do with some of this control in today's game.

text: Very full on middle, whipped away through midwicket for one.
Length ball outside off, punches through cover-point for a single.
preText: Amir : "KKR bowlers r going faster than RRR movie box office collection " Whattay comparison.

text: Shawwt! Full ball, in the slot. Plays the pickup shot and the ball sails over deep midwicket rope.
Over correction from Venky, pays the price. Short and wide outside off, Shaw reaches out and cuts it over point for a four. Ten runs off the last two.
Slower one well outside off, Shaw drives it to long-on to bring up his 12th IPL fifty off just 27 balls. Second in a row and he's just decimated the KKR bowling thus far.
postText: Aagam: "Not taking anything away from Shaw but he has literally played on these grounds since he was a child so he knows them"

text: Fuller on middle and leg, worked through midwicket for a single.
preText: Chakravarthy back for another over. One of the two bowlers to have a single-digit economy rate so far.

text: Warner nearly pays the price for the switch hit. Changes stance and plays the right-hander's sweep aerially just past a diving backward point for four.
preText: Shah Safeer: "@Amir they prefer Baahubali's route! "

text: This one has been played to long-off for one.

wkt_text: PP Shaw  b Varun 51 (44m 29b 7x4 2x6) SR: 175.86
text: Bamboozled! Chakravarthy has the last laugh as the Shaw show at Brabourne ends. Tossed up around off, Shaw played for the one going away but this one came back in. Bowled him through the gate. End of the 93-run opening partnership for the Capitals.
Tossed up carrom ball outside off, Pant gets it off the inner half towards the bowler.
preText:
Wow! The Capitals are off to a flier and captain Rishabh Pant is in at three. Varun from around the stumps.

Ashish: "I thought of picking Shaw or Warner in my team cos Shaw was getting into groove slowly and Warner has the reputation of scoring it big generally. I didn't pick any one of them and here's what they have done :)"

text: Strong appeal but only from Chakravarthy. Pant misses the paddle and gets hit on the front pad. But he was long way across outside off.
Quicker on the pads, Warner misses the flick and the ball rolls to short fine off his pads.
preText: Narine's back for another spell too.

text: Pant gave it away early. Looks to play the reverse early but had to adjust. Pulls it towards backward point for one to get off the mark.
preText: Moloy: "Shaw-sank redemption for Varun" Keep 'em coming!

text: Flatter on middle and leg, punched towards mid-on, but Narine stops it in his followthrough.
Landed on a length around middle, seemed to stick a bit. Warner chips it over the bowler for one.
Swept away nicely. Flatter and quicker on middle, once again he gets his front leg across and plays it well to the right of short fine leg. One hand off the blade as he played that. 100 up.
Tossed up around off, Pant dances down and pushes it to covers for a quick run.
postText: The Capitals are flying away to a good score and it's time for Himanshu to call this mayhem now.

text: swept away over deep midwicket! Full length ball on off, and he is down on his knees early to hammer that far and wide
preText:
Varun around the wicket

Hello all. Capitals in command here. A 200-plus score there for the taking, unless of course something strikes.

text: reverse sweep over short third man in typical Pant fashion! Slightly back of a length on middle, and he swivels with his bat off his hands and while losing shape. The bat just evades the stumps as it drops off his hands
preText: Over the stumps now

text: fuller ball on off, and tucked towards point
shortish in length on leg, and he pulls that to deep midwicket. Rahane there runs and slides to his right to cut that off
preText: Another free-hit

text: full and outside leg, and he readies himself to switch-hit but misses. The ball goes past the keeper too, and races away for four behind the wicket. Another no-ball
preText: Free-hit. Over the wicket to Warner too.

text: clips this fullish ball on middle towards fine leg after a step back in the crease. And it is a no-ball
slashed over cover, and Capitals make merry! Bowled full and outside off, and was also tossed up. Warner steadies to loft that comfortably to deep extra cover
tucks this fullish ball on middle and leg towards square leg. They wanted a second, but the bowler gave the chase
on a short of a length and angling into middle. Pulled to fine leg from deep in the crease
preText: 24 off that Varun over. Cummins back from around the wicket.
postText: Maghi: "Think this is the first time a wicket doesn't fall when you enter the comms Himanshu!" --- Never mind, I made some runs this time!

text: slashed hard and on the bounce to point. Short and wide of off, and he went forcefully at that. The take wasn't clean by the fielder, and that allowed a single
preText: Stays around to Pant

text: shapes to pull, but it isn't short enough. On a back of a length on middle and angling in, as he his hit on his back thigh. The ball rolls for a leg-bye
slower ball on a shorter length on middle. Pulled away to fine leg almost after taking his eyes off the ball
change of pace again. Bangs it in short on middle and off, as Warner makes room and then has to pull to long-on realising there is no pace on ball

fired over the bowler's head! The extra delivery in the over resulting in the maximum for Capitals. Right there in the hitting length and full on middle and off. Pant waits before swinging his bat full stretch
slower-ball bouncer, but called wide. Short of a length on middle and off, as Pant tries to pull but the ball goes over his head, and then bounces and turns before going to the keeper
short and a bit wide of off. Cut to deep point away from his body, and they pinch two
preText: Russell from over the wicket

text: almost taken! Would have been a dream catch had it come to hand properly, but it's fifty for Warner instead. Slower ball on a shortish length on leg, as Warner makes room and clobbers that to long-on, where the man runs and flies to his right. Gets it into his hands for a second, before falling on the other side with the momentum taking him there.
postText: Purvil: "How many times bat has gone flying or he has played singled handed shot for pant? Would be interesting stat" --- Of course we have all lost count of that.

text: on the bounce to deep point. Went slicing at that full and wide-ish ball outside off, and sent that flying. The fielder had to rush in there
preText: Venky Iyer was the man who tried catching it last ball, and seems to have hurt his knee

text: whipped to wide long-on. A full toss on middle, as he swings across the line between long-on and deep midwicket

wkt_text: RR Pant c Yadav b Russell 27 (24m 14b 2x4 2x6) SR: 192.85
text: swats at that, but finds third man! Pant falls while trying to keep going after the bowling. That was short and outside off, and seemed to have bounced more than what the batter would have liked. Pant had to get on top of the bounce to try and rap that, and ended up sending to the third man fielder

shortText: Russell to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: short of a length a touch wide of off, and he finds the man at midwicket with his pull
preText:
In comes Lalit

Manan: "Just have the gut feel that it's going to be the most thrilling match of the season. Even more than GT vs PBKS!!" --- Ummm, not sure we would mind that.

text: short of a length on off and turning in. Pushed to long-on from deep in the crease and with his front leg out of the way
preText: Narine back from around the wicket

text: back of a length outside off, and punched to deep point
preText: Over the stumps to Lalit

text: much fuller on off, and driven to long-on

shortText: Narine to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: turns into him off a good length on middle and off. Hit on his back pad while trying to clip
preText: Aagam: "Wicket in this over!"

wkt_text: Lalit Yadav lbw b Narine 1 (6m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00
text: appeal for leg before, and given in a flash! The finger went up even before Narine and the keeper completed their appeal. Lalit went to sweep that back of a length ball on middle, which went on straight after pitching. There was no turn there as he missed his sweep and was hit on his back thigh, and that looked plumb to the naked eye. Quick wickets for Knight Riders here
looks to paddle that fullish ball outside off, but is struck on his front pad. The impact is outside off, and so not out
preText: Powell the new man in. A slip there, as Narine comes from over the wicket.

text: short and outside off, and slashed to deep point
preText: Varun from around the wicket
postText: Adam Hamdule: "@Aagam Any words about Crypto" --- A lesson that says what one freakish moment can do to you...

text: full and outside off. Tapped to deep point to get off the mark
preText: Over the wicket to Powell

text: shuffles across off to that short and wide ball outside off. Ends up slashing to the right of the man at cover
goes flinging, and gets six! Swings at that full ball outside off, which hints to turn into him. Not quite off the middle of the bat, but still over deep midwi
pulls his length back a little, and goes wider of off. Patted down towards cover
much fuller and outside off. Run down long-off

wkt_text: R Powell c sub (RK Singh) b Narine 8 (9m 6b 0x4 1x6) SR: 133.33
text: grabbed at fine leg! Powell went for the slog sweep to that full ball on off, almost as if he thought of playing that shot no matter the line and length of the ball. He sends that up into the clouds, as Rinku at fine leg has to keep an eye on it for a long time. But he maintains his calm, and takes it well
preText:
Varun has an expensive outing, being taken for 44 in four overs. Here comes Narine for his final over.

Tejjas: "Rovman's rope is running out of length. He must prove his worth soon."
postText: Time-out

text: fullish on off, and defended down towards the bowler
preText:
Axar in now. Narine around the wicket with a slip.

Radha: "Warner to get a 100.. you heard it first here" --- Noted for the world to see.

Warner at the crease, and our forecaster says 210 from here.

text: fullish again on off, and quicker. Blocked back
good length on middle, and hinting to come into him with the angle. Clipped to fine leg
slower this time. On a good length on off and turning away. Nudged back to the bowler
this turn into him now. On a shortish length on middle, and turning in sharply. Finds cover with his punch
on a back of a length on middle at 139kph. He gets his bat down, and ends up getting an inside edge on to his pad. A single stolen after the ball dribbles to the off side
preText:
Umesh returns from over the wicket.

Meanwhile, today was Varun's second-most expensive outing when he has bowled four overs in an IPL game.

text: shuffles across off early, as Umesh bowls a near yorker outside off after seeing the batter move early. Half-swept towards short fine leg
preText: Free-hit

text: slower ball. Full and wide of off, and has Warner trying to reach out for it after a step across as he is beaten. But it is a no-ball
dropped by Billings tumbling to his right! He went diving with both hands, but the ball went off his gloves, as Axar tried to pull a slower ball on a short of a length on leg

wkt_text: DA Warner c Rahane b Yadav 61 (90m 45b 6x4 2x6) SR: 135.55
text: nabbed at deep midwicket! Warner's party ends. On a scrambled seam on a back of a length on middle and off, as Warner makes room early. He goes for the swish to the on side, but finds Rahane lurking on the boundary, who is content to only give a thumbs-up after taking the catch. Capitals losing their way in the death overs
lofted off the outside edge, and on the bounce to point. On a good length outside off, and he went driving at that
preText: Thakur in. No Sarfaraz yet.

text: good pace and bounce! That was fired in short on middle, and took off from the pitch, as Axar came down the pitch to try and have a swing but missed. Billings had to collect it high to his right
flayed away on the bounce to deep point. Full and outside off, and bowled with a scrambled seam. Thakur has a heave, but mistimes it
preText:
Cummins back. Over the stumps.

Nabil Bhati: "Still no Sarfaraz Khan?" --- Just saw him setting up his blade in the dugout. That's all I can say.

text: slower ball, and chipped back towards the non-striker. Cummins chases to his left, and there is a bit of yes-no between the batters, before Axar is sent back by Thakur
preText: Around the wicket to Axar

text: wow, that somehow ended up finding the gap between fine leg and deep square leg! Change of pace on a short of a length on off, and he pulls well with the bounce and the movement away
this time paddles to fine leg. The keeper gives the chase. On a back of a length on middle, and runs that down
slower ball again. Fullish in length and wide of off. He has a hoick at that, but ends up pushing to deep midwicket off the inside half of the bat
preText: Elsewhere, India are chasing history in the women's Junior Hockey World Cup, seeking a maiden final appearance. In their way stand the Netherlands, who've scored 43 unanswered goals so far. Catch live updates from the semifinal, here.

text: good bounce there, and Axar climbs on to that short delivery on middle at 116kph. Pulled with a swivel to long leg

what a sound off the bat! That goes 29 rows over deep square leg. A reminder of Thakur's heroics at The Oval last year. On a short of a length on middle and leg, and he waited before pulling that forcefully into the stands. That went 95 meters
preText: 200 anyone? We still have 12 balls left.
postText: Aashrit: "It would be criminal if DC don't reach 200 from here. No excuses"

text: good comeback. Sends that yorker a touch wide of off, and Thakur lets that pass
six more! Thakur flays that away over extra cover. Cross seam, and full a touch wide of off. All Thakur does is swing it using his bottom hand, and send that flat and flying
attempts a yorker, and that lands on middle at 144kph. Thakur is hit on the pad as he tries to flick

six for me too, says Axar! Lofts that with high elbows, and waits for the slower ball to come to him. It is there in the arc, and full on middle and off. Axar dumps that over the bowler's head for the third six of the over
preText: Mehul: "What's with Shardul and India's speedsters. First Bumrah, now Yadav"

text: 23 off the over! Who cares if there is no Sarfaraz? This time Umesh goes full and wide of off, and Axar lifts that off the length to play that like a half volley. The ball flies off his bat, and goes with a couple of bounces into the extra cover fence.
preText: 19 off the over, with one ball to go. The ball is sanitised before Umesh bowls.

text: over mid-off now! That brings up the 200. A slower ball, and full and wide of off. Thakur spots mid-off was inside the circle, and swats that flat and hard. The man there jumped to his right, but didn't get a hand
yorker length on off, and he swings across the line. Gets that off the inside half of the bat, and they rush for two
drills this full ball outside off to long-on from deep in the crease
loses his bottom hand in trying to slash at that back of a length ball outside off at 140kph. Deep point chases that to his right
preText: Swappy: "Lord Shardul doing his things..."

text: pulled away to deep square leg. He makes room early, and Cummins follows by bowling a slower ball on a shrotish length on leg

it is six! Just clears the rope at deep midwicket. Another slower ball from Cummins which is on a full length on off. Thakur knew he had to swing no matter the line and length, and the ball seemed just full enough for him to have a heave. That landed beyond the rope in between long-on chasing to his right and deep square leg to his left
preText: Last ball of the innings. Six maybe?
postText:
A massive target to chase for Knight Riders, and Sudarshanan will be back for the reply.

Bilal : "And that's 3 fifties from Pat Cummins in 2 games and might get a chance to score one more"

Sunil: "Although unlikely, it would be interesting to see Narine open today and have a stab at giving KKR's chase a headstart.."

Shaw: "I am fine [after a blow on the head]. Keeping it simple from my side. Just trying to strike. The powerplay was really important for us... It is a good total as well. I love watching Warner bat... Our execution was well. We did pretty well to get 215."

5.25pm Surprising that Sarfaraz wasn't sent by Capitals despite them losing five wickets. Or maybe there was a trick to it; who knows? But Thakur and Axar crack 49 off 20 balls in their stand, and take Capitals to 215 after fifties from Shaw and Warner, and a little burst from Pant.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rahane, no run
text: Strong appeal and the umpire gives Rahane the marching orders after a thought! Speared in on a length from over the stumps, Rahane is a tad late in getting his bat down. The ball goes off the front pad to the wicketkeeper. The players appeal and get the decision but there was no bat at all. Pant now asks the umpire to check for the lbw as per the protocol and the impact is well outside off. Eventful beginning.
preText:
The Pant-led Capitals walk out and take their spots. Mumbai-lad Ajinkya Rahane walks out to open with one of the the flavours of IPL 2021, Venkatesh Iyer. Mustafizur Rahman has the ball even as Bangladesh struggle in a Test in South Africa.

Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English or Hindi.

5:35pm Welcome back! Runs galore in the first half, wickets in the next phase before the final flourish - that was how Capitals progressed to post the highest total this season. How will the Knight Riders start? The track looks good for runs, apart from the odd one stopping on it. Should be game on at the Brabourne.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rahane, no run
text: Rahane has been given out lbw again and he review again. Survives as there is a thick inside edge. Fuller and on middle, gets it off the inner half onto the pads but the umpire failed to spot that after a strong appeal. Rahane is amused.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rahane, no run
text: Full and well outside off, Rahane goes fishing at that.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rahane, no run
text: Hint of swing inwards, fuller on off and middle, driven to mid-on.
preText: AK: "Two Unsuccessful Review by Umpire...done for the Innings"

text: On a length on off, Rahane plays it with soft hands towards covers and gets going.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to VR Iyer, 1 run
text: Full on off, steered towards backward point for a single. End of the eventful over where the Fizz should have had a wicket.
preText: Oh, my, my! Rahane had got an edge on the third ball going for the drive away from the body but nobody appealed. Pant didn't hear anything, he gestured. Ponting has his hands on his head.

shortText: Thakur to VR Iyer, no run
text: Starts off with a peach. Full and outside off, swings in as it pitches. Venky goes for the drive but gets beaten on the inside edge.
preText:
Shardul Thakur to run in from the other end.

Siddharth: "Rahane can walk on water right now..."

shortText: Thakur to VR Iyer, no run
text: Fuller on off, played solidly from the crease.
Easy peasy! Short ball down leg, Venkatesh pulls it way over deep square leg with a swivel. But he seems to be limping a touch. He was out after injuring his knee in the first innings.
Short again, six again. Similar half-tracker from Thakur after having a few words with Warner. Venky is happy to pull it way over deep backward square leg again.
Offcutter on a length but on the pads, nudged through backward square leg for one. Limps to the other end.

Another lbw appeal against Rahane. Not given this time. Fuller around off, Rahane played around it and was rapped on the pads. Warner says height as Capitals ponder for the review. A leg-bye taken as the ball rolls to the off side.
postText: Anish: "Shardul already gave away two sixes out of three sixes he hit."

text: Fuller outside off, pushed through covers for one. Wanted a second but had to turn it down since Iyer is not really running well.
preText: Khaleel Ahmed to bowl the third over of the innings, replaces Mustafizur.

text: Iyer dances down and goes hard at it. Gets a good deal on that as the ball flies over short third man for four. He's grimacing after playing every shot.
preText: Indeed height was the factor as Warner seemed to suggest in that Rahane lbw appeal on the last ball of the previous over. Ball-tracker confirms.

wkt_text: VR Iyer c Patel b Ahmed 18 (16m 8b 1x4 2x6) SR: 225.00
text: Venkatesh's short, dashing stay ends. Pulls the length ball straight to Axar at deep square leg. Despite not having enough room to free his arms for the pull, he made a good contact. And that brought about his downfall. Early strike for Capitals.
preText: Short third pushed back now.

text: Shreyas expects the short ball and makes room a bit early. Gets a length ball instead. But he has a stable base and thrashes it through covers to get going.
preText: Captain Shreyas Iyer walks out to bat. Has a good record against both Axar and Kuldeep. But it's Khaleel he'll face now. Short third in place and a fine leg and deep square leg. Short ball?

shortText: Ahmed to SS Iyer, no run
text: Back of a length ball down leg, Iyer misses the flick. Not given a wide and Shreyas isn't pleased.
Fuller on off, driven straight back for a single.
Length ball angling in around off, bowled from wide of the crease. Patted towards wide mid-on for a quick single.
Now Rahane dances down, gets it off the inner half through mid-on for a single.
preText: Ashish: "I am sure Rahane will win it for DC."

text: Almost chopped on! A touch fuller, Shreyas clears his front leg but then has to adjust. Tried to run it towards the off side but gets it off the inside edge past the stumps for another quick one.
Pleasing to the eye. Length ball on the pads, Rahane just lifts it over short fine leg and gets four.
Once again Rahane comes down the track early. Misses the pull and it goes off his shoulder towards short third.
preText: Deep square leg and fine leg in position.

text: Yet again Shreyas shuffles in his crease before the ball is bowled. Gets a full toss as Thakur goes for the yorker. Smashes it through covers for his second boundary.
preText: Deep square leg is in front of square now.

text: Run out chance but Khaleel couldn't pick it up cleanly. Runs across to his right after Rahane got it off the leading edge. Was an offcutter hence Rahane was through his attempted flick a bit early.
preText: Tinura: "Shreyas will be tha one who would decide the fate of KKR....and my fantasy team."

text: Length ball punched to covers.
Length ball outside off, Rahane walks across but finds mid-on with the heave.

wkt_text: AM Rahane c Thakur b Ahmed 8 (29m 14b 1x4 0x6) SR: 57.14
text: Straight up in the air and Lord Shardul can do no wrong! Had to run all the way back from mid-on towards the ropes. Keeps his eye firmly on the ball, fumbles it three-four times but eventually hangs on with a slide. Superbly done by Thakur. Rahane looked to go over the bowler against the length ball but has to walk back now.
Fuller and outside off, Rana judges it and lets it go. Wasn't too far from the off stick.
preText:
Nitish Rana walks out at No. 4.

Sandy_SG: "Lord Shardul should have dropped that Rahane catch in the larger interest of the team! "

text: Spears in full on the pads, flicked through midwicket for a brace to get going. Just two runs and a wicket off the over, job well done, Khaleel.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to SS Iyer, 2 runs
text: Length ball angling across, steered to deep backward point for two.
preText: Change of ends for Mustafizur.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to SS Iyer, no run
text: Very full on off, driven to mid-on.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to SS Iyer, no run
text: Fuller on middle and leg, Shreyas wants a run as he pushes it towards midwicket. But he is sent back by Rana, who spots a fielder swooping in.
preText: Gp: "Narine should have come aftet 1 down. "

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: Short in length, pulled to midwicket for a quick one. Shaw has a shy but the ball misses the stumps and hits Shreyas on the side of the right knee.
postText: Iyer's down in pain. Shaw immediately goes towards him to have a word and check on him.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rana, no run
text: Length ball around middle, flicked to midwicket.
preText: nes: "Could KKR have sent Billings instead of Rahane as an opener?" No point changing major strategies in the middle of the game.

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rana, no run
text: Full on middle, worked away straight to midwicket. Another tide over from the Fizz.
preText: Rehan: "Khaleel has looked good this IPL with his bowling variations, smart pick by DC in the auction"

text: Short and wide outside off, cut away through point for one.
preText: Spin time! Axar Patel is on now. To bowl to Shreyas, who has scored 24 off the 15 balls he's faced him in T20s.

text: Shortish again, slapped through cover-point for another one.

shortText: Patel to SS Iyer, no run
text: Shortish again, Shreyas goes back but finds point with the cut.
Excellently struck. Slower through the air but very full outside off. Shreyas slams it through covers and beats long-off running to his left.
A touch shorter, punched through covers for one.
Slower one on a length, Rana comes forward and clips it through backward square leg for one.
Starts with a shorter one, pulled to deep midwicket for a single.
preText:
Kuldeep Yadav, another spinner whom Shreyas takes a liking to, is into the attack now.

Naseef: "KKR doesn't need to panic, they have the anchor in the middle followed by 4 power hitters of the highest class! The chase is very much on!" Good to see hopes high.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: Shortish again, pulled to deep midwicket for another one.
There goes Rana! Half a dozen rows back into the stands. Tossed up ball outside off at 86 clicks. He gets down on a knee and slogs it over deep midwicket for a 91-metre hit.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Rana, no run
text: A cry of anguish from Rana as he cuts a short one straight to point. Missed out.
Worked through the on side for a single. Was very full on middle and leg.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: Short ball, pulled through the ground to deep square leg for one more.
Fuller on middle, pushed to long-on for one.
preText: Required rate climbs above 13, the win predictor firmly in favour of DC.

text: Flatter outside off, Rana gets across and slaps it towards cover-point for one.
Floated full outside off, Shreyas makes room early and smashes it through wide mid-on for two.
Soars Iyer! Tossed up around off, Shreyas dances down and deposits it way over the sightscreen.

shortText: Patel to SS Iyer, 2 leg byes
text: Fired in quicker and shorter, Iyer misses the pull. But the ball goes off his pads fine down leg for a couple of leg byes.
Sees Shreyas charging down and fires it on middle. Worked away off the inner half to deep square leg for one.
postText:
First time-out of the innings.

Japneet: "Shreyas vs Kuldeep, until last year would've played in this match but for the opposite camps. Guess both are happier in their new teams"

text: Stiff shoulder perhaps. Short ball at very low pace and outside off to start with. Shreyas stands tall and slaps it over covers for four.
preText: Rovman Powell to have a bowl now. KKR need 142 in 66 balls.

text: Fuller outside off, driven through covers for a single.

Excellent effort in the deep, it's Thakur again. Covers a lot of ground to his left from deep backward square leg to save a couple. Rana had moved across the stumps and ramped it over short fine leg. He got more height and not much distance or pace on that.

Clean strike! Full and outside off, Rana has enough room to swing his arms. Goes over wide long-off and gets a six. Lalit tried his best with a jump at the ropes but almost hurt himself by crashing into the ad board.
That's very wide as Rana lets it be. Pant misses it and concedes a bye.
Fuller on middle and leg, hit aerially towards wide long-on for one.
Fuller on middle, eased through midwicket for a brace. 30 runs have come from the last two overs.
postText: KKR are managing to get a move-on as Himanshu shifts to the hotseat here.

text: skips down first ball, and pulls that shortish ball on middle to deep midwicket
preText:
Kuldeep back from over the wicket.

Game on at the Brabourne! Don't go anywhere yet.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, FOUR
text: swiped across the line and over the bowler's head! Tossed up full and very wide of off, as he reaches for that to send that back down the ground. Thakur chases to his left from long-on, but can't stop it

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, 1 wide
text: full and wide of leg. Left alone, and wide called
preText: Stays over the wicket to Iyer

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, 2 runs
text: swings to the on side off a full length on middle. A few to deep midwicket

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, no run
text: misses another attempted sweep. There is half an appeal for stumping from Pant, as Iyer goes heaving at that full ball outside off and is beaten. Replays show Iyer's back foot never moved out of the crease there

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: goes for the reverse sweep that full ball outside off, and ends up patting Pant's pad. A single to short third man
pulls this short of a length ball on off to deep midwicket after it turns away from him. A flat shot

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Rana, no run
text: loud, loud appeal for leg before, but not given. Pant reviews after a thought. Rana goes reversing first ball, and is hit on his front pad. Good length ball on middle and leg, and going on with the angle there. Replays show there is no inside edge, and the ball would have gone on to miss leg stump
preText: AK: "Bring on Lalit Yadav" --- And on he comes. Around the wicket.

text: bam! Six over deep midwicket! A long hop on a short of a length on off, and Rana hammers that blow over the fence. Lalit apologises for that immediately

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Rana, no run
text: fuller length on leg stump. Rana is down trying to sweep, but the ball hits his front pad

wkt_text: N Rana c Shaw b Lalit Yadav 30 (37m 20b 0x4 3x6) SR: 150.00
text: finds long-on! Lalit does the trick. Comes back with a wicket one ball after being hit for a six, although it was a dipping full toss on middle and off, but not low enough for him to miscue. Rana cleared his front leg there to facilitate the slog, and found the fielder as he ended up hitting that off the bottom of the bat
good length ball outside off, and swat-pulled to long-on, as Lalit bowls from wide of the crease
preText: In comes Russell. Lalit over the wicket.

shortText: Lalit Yadav to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: Lalit dives in front of the non-striker, but the ball passes him to long-on. Shortish ball on off, and punched from deep in the crease
preText: Over the stumps to Iyer too

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: down the pitch, and slogs on the bounce to deep midwicket. Pretty full ball on off, and he was ready to swing his bat early
postText: Joydeepsinghgil: "Platform for Russell and Cummins to go at bowlers from both end"

text: sweeps this full ball on middle to fine leg. That was hit hard
preText: Over the stumps to Russell. A slip there too.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, no run

preText: Pant says to Kuldeep to let the batters hit

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, SIX
text: tonked over long-on to raise his fifty! Skips down the pitch again, and Kuldeep goes fuller and in the hitting zone on off. Iyer obliges, and sends that ramming

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to SS Iyer, OUT
wkt_text: SS Iyer st †Pant b Kuldeep Yadav 54 (54m 33b 5x4 2x6) SR: 163.63
text: gone, stumped! Kuldeep hits back right away. The googly gets the opposition captain out. Pitches it on a slightly good length on off, and gets it to turn away from the right-hander. Iyer is down the track prepared to clobber that over the on side again, but is beaten. Pant has a lot of time to clip the bails
fuller ball on middle, and he sweeps the first ball he faces to fine leg
preText: 99 off 43. The game running away from Knight Riders. Here comes Billings, with a slip waiting.
postText:
Datta: "Russell, Narine, Cummins - We are entering the Mad Hatter time. Anything can happen now"

Time-out. You wonder why it wasn't taken after the wicket fell.

text: just sends that reverse sweep over short third man! Good length ball on off, and he got a top edge, but it doesn't matter for Billings and his side
preText:
Axar back. Around the wicket.

Required rate now 14. Can the trio of Russell, Billings and Cummins do some damage here? We think Knight Riders have a meagre 3.33% chance of winning from here.

Japneet: "Cool after being hit to the Deep, that's the new Cool-Deep Yadav"

text: backs away to this fuller ball on off, and punches to the man at cover from deep in the crease
this time short third man dives to his right, and just gets a hand. The point fielder does the cleaning after that. Another reverse, but this ball is fuller outside off
just beats long-off! Billings knows there is only one way to get to the target. Full ball on off, and he backs away to send that lofting with the full face of the bat
Pant has to turn, run and dive to his left, but falls short of the ball. Another reverse from Billings to a full ball on middle and off, and this seemed to have taken the back of the bat
blocked down. Full on off, and tapped
preText: Stays around to to Russell

text: back of a length just outside off, and pushed to point away from his body as he backed away
preText:
Khaleel returns. Over the stumps.

AK: "Sam Billings against Spinner - Sweep and Reverse Sweep"

text: slashes to deep point. Fuller in length and just outside off, as he cuts that after clearing his front leg
shapes to sweep that fullish ball on middle and off, but is struck on his front pad. Went down on his knee early

wkt_text: SW Billings c Lalit Yadav b Ahmed 15 (10m 9b 1x4 1x6) SR: 166.66
text: goes slogging, and falls! Taken by Lalit running forward from fine leg. Billings was sitting deep in the crease, and again went across off to try and repeat that slog sweep. The ball was full and outside off, and he could only send that high up without any real timing. Knight Riders staring at a defeat now?
drills that for four! Starts from where he had left in the last match. Steps across, and fires a full ball outside off to beat mid-off to his right
preText: Cummins. Khaleel stays over the wicket.
postText: Tarun: "Anyone for Russel special?" --- Special won't do. It has to be VVS - very, very special.

preText:
79 from 30. Russell on strike. Kuldeep from over the wicket.

Alex: "What follows will be 3 overs of madness. Fasten your seat belt."

text: good  legnth ball on leg, and clipped to short fine leg
wide down the leg side. Turns in after pitching on a fullish length outside leg

wkt_text: PJ Cummins lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 4 (7m 3b 1x4 0x6) SR: 133.33
text: given leg before, and Cummins' dream ends for the day! But he has reviewed. Goes swinging to the on side, but is beaten by that good length ball on middle which is turning in, and is hit on the back leg. There is no inside edge, and the impact appears to be outside leg. Ah, it pitches in line and shows umpire's call on hitting leg stump. So the decision stands, as Cummins is left frustrated
preText: Ashish: "Russell needs to do a Lord Tewatia actually."

text: has a heave to the off side, and manages four! Full and wide of off, and turning away. He lofts, and beats a sliding deep point to his right
preText: Narine out to bat. Kuldeep stays over the wicket to the left-hander.

wkt_text: SP Narine c Powell b Kuldeep Yadav 4 (3m 2b 1x4 0x6) SR: 200.00
text: taken at long-off! In and out for Narine. Fuller line and again a little wide of off, turning a tad away after pitching. Narine is ready and prepared to send that into the stands, but can send that only wide of long-off, where Powell does well to keep watching it

wkt_text: UT Yadav c & b Kuldeep Yadav 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: excellent take by Kuldeep! Oh my, catch of the year so far! Kuldeep rans across to his right, and ends up almost where an imaginary midwicket would have been placed. He keeps focusing on the ball while continuing to sprint, and has to stretch out his hands to his right to complete the grab! Pant was chasing the ball too, but gave up there. Fullish ball on middle, and Umesh went sweeping but top-edged it
preText: Umesh the new batter

text: hammered wide of long-off. Full and outside off, and goes inside out for four

postText: Nimesh: "This is going to boost Kuldeep's confidence so much. Good for him and DC. "

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rasikh Salam, 3 runs
text: hoicks that fuller ball on off at 114kph. They steal three there, or try doing that to get Russell back on strike. Rasikh just about made his ground at Fizz whipped the bails off
goes slogging across the line to this fullish ball on middle and leg. Single to deep midwicket
postText: Vishwa: "Lord Tewatia on both ends also con not get this score now"

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Rasikh Salam, no run

great stuff from Khaleel. Yorker length on middle and leg, and jammed down towards square leg

dropped by Pant, but that was a very difficult catch! And he has banged his head on the floor, looking a bit hurt for a second. He ran forward as far as until a short midwicket position, and dived forward. But the ball fell in between his gloves. Good length ball on middle, and Russell went slogging but got a top edge

preText: Japneet: "Russell needs to hit 10 sixes in about 15 balls to win this. If anyone can do it, it's him" --- I can't believe how people think it's still possible.

text: yorker length on off, and sliced to deep backward point. Pretty full, and he clears his front leg to send that slicing. Deep point chased to his left and dived, but the ball went past
launched down the ground! Bowls full and in the length on middle, and lofts that from deep in the crease
postText: Laks: "So impressed with the way Khaleel Ahmed and Kuldeep Yadav were playing this season, and also credit shall go to DC management for handling these players "

shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Russell, no run
text: slower-ball bouncer to fox Russell. Short of a length on middle, and rising up steeply. He ends up swatting towards square leg after shaping to pull

another swat, and Warner has stopped that brilliantly at deep point after running to his left from long-off! He looks to have hut himself there, as he ran to his left and patted the ball back from his left hand very late. Warner ended at the other side, and collided with the fence. Short ball again on off, and Russell played with the bounce there

yorker length just outside off, and heaved wide of long-on as he played with his bottom hand off. Not a great-looking shot, but four still
preText: Thakur from around the wicket

wkt_text: AD Russell c Khan b Thakur 24 (45m 21b 3x4 0x6) SR: 114.28
text: swatted right to the man at deep point! Tries to get on top of the bounce of this short of a length ball on off while hopping in the crease, and finds the man there for an easy catch
pushes that at good length ball outside off to deep point while playing away from hid body
preText: Varun the last man in. He runs in, but stops at the last moment because the man running in from long-off wasn't inside the circle.

wkt_text: Rasikh Salam c Powell b Thakur 7 (21m 6b 1x4 0x6) SR: 116.66
text: game over, as Thakur takes his second! Rasikh looks to have some fun by lofting that full ball on middle, but ends up ballooning the ball towards long-on, as Powell runs forward for another catch
postText:
That's it from Ranjith, Sudarshanan and me, Himanshu, for this match. Before long, don't forget to hop on to the second of the double-headers today, as Rajasthan Royals play Lucknow Super Giants. See you there!

Kuldeep Yadav is the Player of the Match: "[On the catch] Actually I didn't think much. I felt I can reach it, and it is my wicket at the end of the day. It is important to take a pause and think about the bowling. This is a good wicket and the batters do well. Since some of the side boundaries are longer plus the ball was gripping, it was important to do well. Shreyas was batting well and hitting it well, so that was a big wicket. Enjoyed Shreyas' wicket more because it was my first and was the main wicket from the team's point of view since he was batting well. I haven't tried too much and am focusing on my rhythm. That's what I did when I returned to the Indian team. I am enjoying my bowling and bowling good lengths. I pulled the lengths against Shreyas as well as Cummins. I am enjoying the environment here and have a good backing of the side. Rishabh guides me well from behind the stumps, too."

Rishabh Pant: "We would have fielded first but didn't think much. As a batting unit we wanted to put pressure on the opposition. In these conditions, when the dew is not there, if teams score 170-180 it is decent and the pressure is not as much as it is when the score is 200 or more. Kuldeep has been working for one year but hasn't been getting enough chances. We are trying to back him and he is doing well. We wanted to keep momentum going, and hence sent Axar. We wanted Sarfaraz to arrest the slide if we lose too many wickets and hence kept him back."

Hang around to hear from the presentations

Sajid: "How good fizz has been with the DC filling the shoes of Rabada-Nortje duo! His bowling figure so far 12-0-70-3 (Economy: 5.83!!)"

Warner: "Felt pretty good. A nice wicket... Prithvi is an exciting player. Takes pressure off. Loving my time here. Ricky Ponting is like a father! A great coach, and everyone is happy to be underneath him."

Karan: "At least the initial concerns of the tournament - win the toss, bat second and win the match are beginning to fade. "

Iyer after the loss: "They got off to a really quick start... We were a bit clueless what to do. They built on a really good partnership at the start, and carried that till the tenth over. Looked like a good batting pitch... We made a decision, and that didn't work out well."

7.32pm A comfortable two points for Capitals. A margin of 44 runs boosts their net run rate too, as an all-round performance does the deal. Pretty much everyone stepped up: the top three and the finishers with the bat, and Khaleel and Kuldeep with the ball. And what a catch by Kuldeep running and diving to his right!

shortText: Willey to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: starts with a full delivery on off from wide of the crease, Kishan has a good look at that as he leaves
preText:
Thanks, Sreshth. Hello everyone. Which way is this one going? Last year, the first leg of this rivalry produced a Harshal Patel hat-trick (I think). Who is your pick for the performer of the night? Out come the openers, Kishan and Rohit. Willey has the new ball for RCB. Let's go. A slip in place

7.25pm Just five minutes for the first ball. Let's welcome Shashank Kishore.

Sanket: "Can't make sense of MI going with only 2 overseas players. Meridth has a pace and bounce which could have been really handy on this wicket."

Mohit: "Bumrah was always partnered by the likes of Malinga, Johnson, Boult, Pattinson, Coulter-nile etc. Now this, can't see them making to playoffs."

Prasu: "Looking at bowling options MI gone with today, they may follow winless streak in this season like CSK did " -- Ramandeep's medium pace and Brevis' legspin might be something we may see today

JPR: "Exactly an year ago on this same date, Harshal Patel death over Prodigy in the making took five for against mighty 5times champion Team MI "

Nikhil Awate: "Who is Ramandeep singh ? " -- Punjab middle-order batter, only 24 years old, and eight innings to his name in T20s. Strike-rate of 136 in the format. Interesting that the team prefers him over someone like Tim David. Maybe Ramandeep is a good player of spin, something David has struggled with.

In the USA, you can watch the match live on ESPN+ in in English and in Hindi.

aryan: "ramandeep singh or sanjay yadav ??" -- Ramandeep. The broadcaster initially got it wrong.

7.10pm Only two overseas players for Mumbai. Really putting the "Indians" in their name.

Mumbai Indians: 1 Ishan Kishan (wk), 2 Rohit Sharma (capt), 3 Suryakumar Yadav, 4 Tilak Varma, 5 Dewald Brevis, 6 Kieron Pollard, 7 Ramandeep Singh, 8 M Ashwin, 9 Basil Thampi, 10 Jaydev Unadkat, 11 Jasprit Bumrah.

Royal Challengers Bangalore: 1 Faf du Plessis (capt), 2 Anuj Rawat, 3 Virat Kohli, 4 Glenn Maxwell, 5 David Willey, 6 Shahbaz Ahmed, 7 Dinesh Karthik (wk), 8 Harshal Patel, 9 Wanindu Hasaranga, 10 Mohammed Siraj, 11 Akash Deep.

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: What's Rohit Sharma's average against left-arm spin in the IPL (since 2018)?

7pm Toss time We're a minute away from the toss but new caps are being handed out in the Mumbai huddle. Jaydev Unadkat and Ramandeep Singh to debut.

Royal Challengers Bangalore opt to bowl.

Rohit: "We wanted to bowl first too, trend and nature of the pitch. It gets better as the game goes on. We know we have to play good cricket to win, whether we bat first or bowl first doesn't matter. We need to apply ourselves more than before. All games you play are big games. You want to get some momentum with a win, we've been looking for it for three games. (Suryakumar) He's a quality player. Strengthens are batting with him coming back. We look forward to the same not only from him but everyone else. Left out Tymal Mills, Unadkat comes in. Daniel Sams is out too. "

Faf: "It's our first game here so not sure what it will do. Stadiums are putting grass initially to protect surfaces. Hopefully there's dew later. For me the pleasing thing was that we managed to get across in games that have had pressure. Maxwell is back, been really good for RCB. Replaces Rutherford. Will slot into the No. 4 position, that middle period he is very good player of spin. DK is going really well, it's the role and clarity that we've given DK that will give him some consistency."

Sarthak: "MI can replace Sams with David.. 5th bowler quota can be fulfilled with all 4 - Tilak, Pollard, David and Brevis having the ability to bowl..."

Neil : "RCB need to get Hazelwood in place of Willey and Kaul in place of Akash to strengthen their death bowling"

6.55pm Five minutes to the toss. Perfect time to check out our latest #25Questions video series episode - this one is with one of RCB's most prolific cricketers! Also a good time to check out our #FantasyCricket tips.

6.50pm In other news around the IPL surrounding Mumbai Indians, yesterday Yuzvendra Chahal shared a story of how he was hung outside a balcony by a Mumbai player in 2013. We asked Ravi Shastri for his opinion around the whole incident, and he was clear: "if it happened today, give the player a life ban." Here's the full chat with him and Carlos Brathwaite.

Mustafa Moudi : "Like the Opener Sharma of SRH , hope this Opener Sharma Scores Big today in the this match. Otherwise 2 Most Popular Sides (The El Clasico Sides) would be sitting at the bottom with 4 Straight loses !!"

6.45pm Rohit has told the media that the team needs to show more hunger. Are you caught up on the details?

6.40pm Welcome to the evening match of Super Saturday and it's a big one. Rohit Sharma's Mumbai Indians taking on Faf du Plessis' Royal Challengers Bangalore. The five time champions are in the unenviable position of 0-3, and are up against an RCB side that will be even more boosted up by Glenn Maxwell's return.

But Mumbai have been here before. They had 0-3 starts in 2008, 2014, 2015 and 2018, and if there's one team that can get on a winning run, it's Mumbai. Here's today's match preview for you to catch up on the big picture.

Don't see why Unadkat is better than Mills, specially in death."

text: charges down the track and boom! He has disdainfully slapped that over wide long-on. By no means a bad delivery. Just solid striking from Rohit

Pollard gone for a golden D.

It's taken the edge and DK takes a low catch while being off balance and almost falling over.

preText: Unadkat.

chest before wicket? Harshal bowls a slower ball, but it's a full toss. Suryakumar bent low to get out of the ball's way, but the ball follows him, and it has thumped into him. They appeal for lbw, but not given out. RCB review and the first thing the TV umpire checks for is "waist-high no ball" and he confirms it is fine. Ball tracking says it is hitting him in line, and impact on stumps is "umpire's call", appearing like it would've clipped leg stump. Suryakumar survives, and aren't we glad it was the slower ball that hit him near the chest.
yorker length, on off. Dug away to the on side. Suryakumar could've taken a single, but didn't
short and wide. Suryakumar flays this with the bat's face looking up on purpose. Sliced over the infield for four
slower ball. Length ball on middle. Suryakumar swivels, waits for the ball to get to him, and then flicks it to the left of Siraj at fine leg. Akash Deep runs around, and dives to stop a four
in the slot, just outside off. Unadkat gets forward, and drills it over Harshal's head for four. Full face of the bat, and a brave shot with mid off inside the circle
full just outside off. Unadkat tries to drive again. This time it's a mistimed slice over cover, but still yields him two with Faf chasing after the ball
preText: Shankar: "Suryakumar is currently the best T20 batter in India. You will see him rarely struggling and he bats consistently at good strike rate. He has all the shots against pace and spin. "

text: length ball, full outside off. Suryakumar stands tall and punches it off the back foot over extra cover for six!
