text: good comeback Length ball outside off, SKY tried to slap it through the off side but mistimed back to Siraj. Siraj aims at the stumps, and even though he misses, Suryakumar is on the floor since he put in a dive anyway
preText: Free hit loading. Suryakumar on 49.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Yadav, (no ball) 2 runs
text: fifty partnership as Suryakumar gets this full ball through midwicket. The siren goes on very late....no ball!
postText: Stavan : "This is why MI retained Surya over Ishan, Hardik and Boult."

text: full on his pads, and flicked to deep midwicket. His 15th IPL fifty. Applause from the dug out, they know how important this is as Mumbai now inch towards 140
postText: Malathesh Barik: "Has fafdu forgot about david willey. He has given only 8 runs in 2 overs and he is not given chance to finish his overs.. strange" -- I think the older ball's lack of swing may have dissuaded Faf after we moved past the 10th over or so

text: top edged but lands well short of fine leg. Short ball, and Unadkat gave the pull an attempt. Too late into the shot, with Siraj cranking the speed up
glorious strokeplay. Full on leg, Suryakumar clears the front leg, and uses his wrists to play a flick in such a way that the ball flies high into the night sky before landing in the stands. Wristy.

ridiculous! Attempted wide yorker at 145 kph. Suryakumar just sticks the bat out and slices the ball. It flies over first slip, and not only that, it has hit the boundary skirting on the full! 23 run over
slower ball full toss outside off. Tries to go for a big heave over the off side. But misses it altogether
preText: Six balls to go, and they can realistically aim for 160. But for that, Unadkat will have to bring Suryakumar on strike. Harshal to bowl out.

text: another dot. Two top balls keeping Unadkat on strike. Short ball, full pace. On off stump. Unadkat goes for the pull but the ball whizzes past his ears
preText: Thiru: "Faf made a big mistake of giving 19th over to Siraj when willeys have left with 2 overs"

text: there's the single to bring SKY back. Yorker length on middle, and Unadkat hits it straight past the diving bowler. Suryakumar wanted to get on strike desperately, he had started running even before Unadkat had gotten bat on ball
postText: Noor: "@Thiru, Willey is not a death bowler. Plus Siraj had great success last year bowling at the death."

text: can't put it away! Suryakumar fails to connect. Back of a length slower ball on off. Suryakumar walks across to the off side and tries to play it towards short fine leg. On the bounce to the keeper
what a final over this has been from Harshal. Offcutter, full outside off. Suryakumar tried to drag a slog from outside off but the ball dipped, went under the bat, and through to DK again
breaches 150! Harshal bowls a full toss wide outside off, and Suryakumar swings across the line. Top connection, flies over deep midwicket and Mumbai finish on 151 for 6
postText:
Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: How quickly does Glenn Maxwell score against Mumbai Indians?

Malli: "Bumrah has to be at his very best to make a match out of this. There's no other threatening bowler in this Mumbai bowling line up. SKY has given a chance to try out something for bowlers but with Maxi back in the team RCB favorites"

9.23pm From 79 for 6 in 13.2 overs, Mumbai will take this. And it is all thanks to Suryakumar Yadav, who made 68 with six sixes and five fours. Strike-rate of 183 during a time when wickets were just tumbling. He trusted his own strokes, and the result is right here.

The collapse started when Rohit Sharma, looking fluent, fell to Harshal right after the powerplay. Hasranga trapped Brevis and Pollard with googlies. Ishan Kishan fell after a sluggish 26 to Akash Deep and a Maxwell special ran Tilak Varma out. Incoming player Unadkat stood his ground, don't forget his contribution of just hanging in there during the unbeaten 72 run partnership in 40 balls.

Harshal Patel: "Definitely taken 7 in the final over, especially against a quality batter like Surya. (Slower ball) They were drifting in the air, made it a bit more effective today."

Mihir: "High time RCB make Siraj sit down. He neither contributes with the bat and last few games have been really expensive. Its.proving to be an expensive retention."

hit hard, one bounce to long-on
postText: RCB chugging along nicely despite Faf's loss. Over to Sreshth for the back half.

text: drilled! Full on off, and Rawat hammers it over Kohli's head for a boundary. Races away off the grass
back of a length, extra bounce. Pulled in front of square to the deep for a single
full and wide. Googly turning in as Kohli presses forward and tries to swipe it through the off side. Inside edged onto his body
dancing shoes are on! Full on off. Gives Ashwin the charge and flicks it off his toes through midwicket for an exquisite four
flatter ball, played towards short third for a single

shortText: Ashwin to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: good length on leg. Turning to off. Stays on the back foot and fends it to point
welcome to the attack, says Kohli. Full on leg stump. Kohli had moved away anyway, exposing all three stumps, and simply chips it off his toes courtesy his wrists to midwicket for four
preText: ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster has RCB as 70% favourites. Here's Basil. Economy of 2.50 in his first spell.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Kohli, no run
text: back of a length on off stump. Kohli bunts it off the back foot to midwicket

shortText: Basil Thampi to Kohli, no run
text: short ball. Risky ball with fine leg inside the circle and Kohli looking to attack. He aims to pull after taking a few steps down the ground, but then gets low to let the ball through
back of a length, off-stump line. Fended off the back foot, and the ball rolls past Thampi. They scurry across for one

shortText: Basil Thampi to Anuj Rawat, SIX
text: sounds so s-w-e-e-t! Full on middle and leg. Rawat nonchalantly flicks it off his toes, and the ball sails over deep midwicket! The replay shows how he used his wrists to give the shot a whip that took it upwards

shortText: Basil Thampi to Anuj Rawat, FOUR
text: slashed but slashed hard! Good length ball angling across. Looks to cut, and has enough in that shot to fly past point's right!
fullish outside off. Played square to Tilak in the deep on the off side, and he cruises back for the second run
preText: 15 off that over. Unadkat appears to be returning. Around the stumps to VK

text: pace off. Length ball angling into Kohli with that angle. Tucked off his hips to midwicket with soft hands, and they race off for the first one quickly. Is two on? Nope, choose not to
moves to 48 with that single. Unadkat around the stumps, length ball on leg and middle. Fended off the back foot to the off side
postText: Affan: "You have to stop those rolling back to you (11.4) especially when it's coming at that pace. "

text: over the stumps. Full outside off and angling across. Driven away from his body to deep extra cover

shortText: Unadkat to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: around the stumps to Rawat. Slower ball bouncer on leg stump and angling across. Rawat is interested to slap it square, but eventually misses getting any connection
full slower ball outside off stump. Rawat pushes at it to cover, and they take off for a single. Brevis attacks the ball, picks, and has a shy at the batter's end, but no direct hit

full ball on middle. Nurdled away to midwicket where there's a gap for one. Off they go, and Rawat raises his bat after getting to the other side. Strike-rate of 132 so far, and he'll want to stay there till the end now
preText: Bumrah is back. Rohit knows he needs that wicket right about now.

text: good length ball on a fourth-stump line. Kohli pokes at it, and sends it down to third man for a single
postText: Taha: "So is Thampi or Bumrah bowling?" -- Bumrah. The glitch will be sorted asap!

text: guides this length ball outside off to point for a single
Kohli 1 - 0 Bumrah. Back of a length outside off and he drags a pull from outside off and sends it in front of square. One bounce four to cow corner and Kohli gives Rawat a heavy fist bump
bouncer. Back of a length outside off. Kohli can't put it away behind square on the off side. Through to the gloveman
length ball angling into his hips. Kohli flicks it behind square, forcing deep square leg to run to his right. A dive on the boundary line saves the four, but Kohli's placement was spot on there

Brevis! Nerves? The crowd rejoices. Length ball pulled to deep midwicket, where Brevis was lurking. It's turned out to be a low catch for him, but he can't hold on. The ball goes through him and that's four more for Kohli. Dropped
preText: 50 in six overs. And here's Thampi.

text: full on his toes, and whipped to the right of long on. Couple more for Virat

shortText: Basil Thampi to Kohli, no run
text: length ball on an off-stump line. Kohli shapes to pull but the ball stays low and goes under the blade to Kishan. There was some sound from the stump mic, and replays show the ball kissed the trousers
good length, on off stump. Places a pull to wide long on for a single

shortText: Basil Thampi to Anuj Rawat, 1 run
text: good length ball on middle and off. Rawat wants to pull but he's not in position. Uncomfortably dragged to the bowler's left
wants to pull this length ball in front of square but ends up flat-batting a mistimed shot to mid on instead. He'll keep the strike as we take the evening's final time out
postText: Amogh K: "Bumrah's inability to take wickets is hurting MI as he is the only wicket-taking option for them. The only match where he struck was against RR, but Jos was the difference in that match. "

text: dibbly-dobbly pace. Length ball, wide outside off. Slaps a cut, past point's right for a run
preText: A virtual David Shepherd hop from our side as we enter the last five overs with the score at 111/1. Pollard.

text: gives Pollard a charge as the bowler goes wide and full. Rawat mistimes a dragged shot past Pollard's left to long on for one though
full on middle. Tucked with soft hands to midwicket and he runs the first one hard. But Tilak runs in quickly to ensure they don't think of a second

shortText: Pollard to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: slower ball, full and wide outside off. Rawat loses his shape as he tries to swipe across the line, Misses it completely
Pollard bowls a wide full toss, way outside off stump, with Rawat offering no shot

Rawat swats Pollard away after that! Pollard bowls a gentle length ball on leg stump, and Rawat has smacked it across the line by going deep in his crease and exploring the region behind square on the leg side
preText: Pollard runs in but doesn't bowl. Stops in his stride. We've seen this before. Slowing down proceedings.

text: full toss wide outside off. Drilled to deep extra cover with a cut
postText: Crafty: "@Amogh: Maybe Bumrah's inability to take wickets us because he's the only wicket taking option. The opposition know they can just play him out."

shortText: Unadkat to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: around the stumps. Length ball on off stump, and angling across. Cut in front of square, finds the fielder at cover
preText: Unadkat.

text: gets to double six with a six! And that's his sixth sixth! Full on middle. Rawat skips down the ground and hammers a slog from his pads over deep midwicket. So confident right now that he took on the player positioned on the boundary line there

shortText: Unadkat to Anuj Rawat, 1 leg bye
text: \yorker, on leg stump or maybe just outside it. Rawat misses any connection, hits him, and they scurry across for one. Huge lbw appeal but turned down. Mumbai review but pitching just outside leg. Rawat survives
full just outside off. Ball angles into VK sharply as he can't connect with the cut. Ball whizzes over off stump

wkt_text: Anuj Rawat run out 66 (87m 47b 2x4 6x6) SR: 140.42
text: length on off. Bunted to mid on's right, but Kohli wants two. Rawat does as Kohli says, but he's fallen short! Direct hit from Ramandeep who runs in from the deep and throws at the base of the stumps. Ends Rawat's knock of 66
full just outside off. Knocked to the off side for one
postText: Aravind: "That was probably the only way Mumabi were going to get Rawat out. None of the bowlers seemed likely to get him today"

text: Almost a run out, but then overthrows as Kohli punched this length ball outside off to backward point. Brevis dived and threw it to the batter's end, which would've had DK run out for a 0-ball duck, but he missed. Poor backing up from Tilak allows the overthrow run
preText: Bumrah is back.

text: takes a single by knocking it to the side
length ball just outside off. Wants to guide it to third man but the ball ends up hitting the bat's inside half instead
preText: H. Prasanna : "Ooh... DK ahead of Maxwell. Speaks volumes about his ability."
postText: Manish Shamnani: "I would have picked completely different side for Mumbai - Rohit, Kishan, Sky, Tim David, Tilak, Anmol, Fabien, Riley, Bumrah, Unadkat, Mayank.Because clearly this side is not working."

text: crucial dot. Back of a length on off. Kohli wants to ramp it over the keeper, but can't connect. Bit of a groan from him after missing out

terrific from Kohli and DK, forcing the pressure and errors from Mumbai. Length ball on middle, and Kohli very gently tapped it to midwicket. Called for two early, and DK was going to be in comfortably at the bowler's end, but the fielder Tilak makes an awry throw, and that's another overthrow run for RCB.

DK turning it on!. Usual transmission from Dinesh Karthik, so quick off the blocks always. Doesn't bother to see Bumrah's final ball of the evening off, instead sees the short ball and pulls in front of square for six.

wkt_text: V Kohli lbw b Brevis 48 (56m 36b 5x4 0x6) SR: 133.33
text: over the stumps. Full on middle, and Kohli presses forward to defend. Ball doesn't turn as much, and the ball goes past the bat's inside half. Hits the front leg, and lbw appeal is given out! Has Brevis taken a wicket off his first IPL delivery? And that too Kohli? Hold on, young man, Kohli has reviewed.- This is close because the ball is close to the bat's edge AND the pad. What will the TV umpire decide? He decides that the ball is too close to the bat and pad at the same time, so he has to go with the on-field umpire's decision (of out) on the bat/pad issue and doesn't have evidence to overrule it. The rest is decided by technology, as ball-tracking says that's crashing into middle. Kohli isn't happy, but he has to go for 48 and Brevis has a first baller!
preText: Eight off 12. Here's some Brevis legspin

text: welcome back, Maxi! Half-tracker outside off. Maxwell goes for the switch hit, and thumps a left-hander's pull behind square for four
length ball outside off. Maxwell stays on the back foot, thumps a cut in front of square, and that is GAME OVER. Royal Challengers Bangalore win by seven wickets
postText:
That's all from us for Saturday. Two more games tomorrow, so we'll see you after lunch, won't we? Till then, ta-da!

11.37pm Time for the presentation.

Anuj Rawat is the Player of the Match: "It feels great to score runs in a winning match. I was just following the process. I was not being able to connect in other games, today did it well. Hope for many more to come. RCB team has given us confidence but they have backed me even when I couldn't finish the game. Enjoying the company of Virat bhaiya and Faf."

Subburam: "There is this famous dialogue from a Tamil movie that says "it doesn't matter if it's a marriage or a funeral, I should be the one the town talks about ". MI and CSK performances this year validates it!"

Winning captain Faf du Plessis: "Mumbai are a quality team and we had excellent bowling for atleast 18 overs. There was something in it for the bowlers in the first innings. We didn't want to give them a good start. Rohit played some good shots but his wicket was valuable. Akash Deep bowled really good tonight. It was just one of those nights, where you mix bowlers around and they keep getting wickets. (The chase) Very good, Anuj. I spoke about him before the tournament, he has potential and we talk a lot to develop game awareness. Comes down the wicket, shows intent, he's a very good player for the future."

Mukhlis: "I think CSK will start to win when Deepak Chahar is comeback. But, it is difficult for MI because their issue with the ball will exist until the end of this season."

Sancasm: "Going too hard for Jofra during the auction, looks like MI completely forgot about their bowling unit for 2022 IPL."

Csk fan: "Who would have thought both MI and CSK will be at the bottom of the table at the start of this IPL?"

Samrat Ahuja: "Irrespective of the result, Man of the match should be given to SKY! Although Rawat batted extremely well, Surya's innings was a class above rest!!"

PRASAD REDDY Mu: "Dear MI, THANKS FOR STAYING WITH US IN OUR TOUGH TIMES.....REGARDS CSKIANS"

Wanindu Hasaranga: "Normally my googly turns more than legspin, so that's why I bowl googlies more. We have lot of good talent. So whenever I get a chance I am ready to take it."

Rohit Sharma: (two overseas players) Just went with the combination that would be ideal. We chose the best from whatever we had. I wanted to bat as long as possible but got out at the wrong time. We had gotten off to a 50-run partnership, but got out at the wrong time. That is hurting us a little bit. Definitely not a 150-run pitch, Surya showed us you can do that if you bat sensibly. Credit to Surya, but we knew it wasn't going to be enough. (Areas of concern) We want batters to bat deep. And if you get runs on the board, there's something for the bowlers to do."

11.20pm Make that 0 and 4 for Mumbai Indians. And ended in style by Glenn Maxwell with two sublime shots. Faf du Plessis walks out to lead the handshakes. Harshal, Hasaranga and Akash Deep ensured that all Mumbai Indians could crawl to was 151. On this surface, with dew around, it was never going to be enough even if you account for Faf's slow start. Anuj Rawat grew into his innings with 66, Kohli looked sublime in his 48, and both Maxwell and Dinesh Karthik showed they are seeing the ball so well. RCB go 3-1, and move right between the table leaders on six points.

Mumbai have issues with both bat and ball. Kishan is not being aggressive enough, or his timing isn't coming on. Pace bowling barring Bumrah is also an issue.

text: good ball first up. On a back of a length on middle and off, and angled in but going on straight off the pitch. Tapped down
preText:
Out come the umpires, as the Sunrisers' fielders spread all around. Uthappa will take strike, as Bhuvneshwar will start with the ball. A slip in place.

In the USA, please watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

3.28pm Five minutes to ball one. Buckle yourselves up as the Super Kings openers arrive to face the new ball against Sunrisers.

KB: "Got to feel for Conway. Came half the way around the world to carry drinks when he's been in a dream form for the last 2 yrs since his international debut in all formats and he could've been the orange cap contender in this edition of IPL." --- Moeen was always going to be a certain starter for them, and they made that clear by retaining him. So it was always hard for Conway to slip in in the batting order, especially with Moeen offering offspin.

2k: "CSK need 200 Runs to win this match" --- There you go...

Neil: "SRH need to open w Markram (Anchor) and Tripathi to go berserk in powerplay with Kane, Pooran, Priyam Garg, Abhishek S to follow and Sundar"

3.15pm The toss is done and the XIs have been firmed up. What do you make of the two sides today, with both teams looking for their first win?

Zaheer: "Unless SRH change their batting order they will give CSK their first victory" --- Maybe open with Tripathi, or even Markram?

Sunrisers Hyderabad: 1 Abhishek Sharma, 2 Kane Williamson (capt), 3 Rahul Tripathi, 4 Aiden Markram, 5 Nicholas Pooran (wk), 6 Shashank Singh, 7 Washington Sundar, 8 Bhuvneshwar Kumar, 9 Marco Jansen, 10 Umran Malik, 11 T Natarajan

Chennai Super Kings: 1 Ruturaj Gaikwad, 2 Robin Uthappa, 3 Moeen Ali, 4 Ambati Rayudu, 5 Ravindra Jadeja (capt), 6 Shivam Dube, 7 MS Dhoni (wk), 8 Dwayne Bravo, 9 Maheesh Theekshana, 10 Chris Jordan, 11 Mukesh Choudhary

3pm The coin goes fluttering… and lands in favour of Sunrisers, who bowl first. Williamson says bowling first was preferred with the "make-up of the side today". He has made two changes by leaving out Samad and Shepherd for Shashank and Jansen, and wants to build on some of the gains he said they took from the last game. Jadeja is happy they don't have to deal with dew today. Theekshana for Pretorius is their only change.

Kev: "T20 do need match winners... of both kind- Gill and Tewatia... Both these teams are struggling to find them in their playing 11." --- Agreed, and as Karthik Krishnaswamy wrote last night, a clash of T20 ideologies got its grandstand finish.

Marco Jansen and Shashank Singh debut for Sunrisers. Meanwhile, Super Kings' fans would love to look at this: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat - Which team has the poorest powerplay scoring rate in IPL 2022 so far?

Shamim Ahmed: "Mark my word SRH will win today I don't see any chance for CSK at all" --- Have drilled it on stone!

Graeme Swann brings the pitch report for us, and says there is good grass there. He is hoping bowlers don't bowl short - and reckons there will be no dew with this being a day game - while expecting slow turn for the spinners.

2.50pm And for some intrigue ahead of the match, Ravi Shastri and Piyush Chawla look ahead to the contest, while our Runorder crew of Shastri, Sam Curran and others debate if Super Kings can make the playoffs. Curran, of course, played for them until last year.

2.45pm The toss is 15 minutes away still, and it is just about time you finalised your dream teams. Our in-house expert Carlos Brathwaite suggests you should bank on Robin Uthappa and Dwaine Pretorius.

Kalyan: "The young SRH players have had a bad start to the season. The batting order once again looks too reliant on the overseas players."

2.40pm There is time yet for these two sides to revive their campaign, as Sreshth Shah's preview states. But how soon will it be before they run out of time, probably just like how Manchester United have in the race for the top-four slot in the Premier League?

Here's the Sunrisers' fast bowler Umran Malik ahead of the match: "I feel very proud because I was a net bowler before. Then to play for the state and then in the IPL, I hope to do well for SRH this season. The team's mindset is positive and aim to qualify for the playoffs. Very excited to play against MS Dhoni. My role model is Jasprit Bumrah and I started from playing tennis-ball cricket like him."

2.30pm They come thick and fast in the world of IPL cricket: barely half a day after Rahul Tewatia made a mockery of Punjab Kings at the Brabourne, we fly north-east to the DY Patil Stadium for two still-winless teams to clash. Sunrisers Hyderabad sit at the lowest rung at No. 10; and if ever there was any consolation for Chennai Super Kings, they are placed No. 8 despite three back-to-back losses. This is Himanshu starting off the action this afternoon, with Sudarshanan ready to roll soon after.
postText: Qaaid: "As a Sri Lankan fan, I was disappointed yesterday when Punjab dropped Rajapakse, but pleasantly surprised by Theekshana's inclusion today and excited to see how he performs" --- Such is life after all...

text: outside edge, and past the lone man at slip! Bhuvi is left amused. On a fuller length and around fifth stump, as Uthappa went driving only to get it wide of slip for four to third man

chips that to cover, and survives again! This was again bowled full and wide of off, as he reaches out for it while playing a check drive. Sundar at point dived to his left at point to get a half stop
pushes this full and straight ball down the ground, and beats mid-on to his left. That was played softly, and they managed two
punches this good length ball wide of off to the man at cover-point. Presents the full face of the bat to play at that
and this time dabbed to point with an open face of the bat. Again on a slightly back of a length outside off from Bhuvi
good length ball on off, and straightening off the pitch. He opens the bat face to tap that to point
preText: Jansen from the other end. Over the wicket, and with a slip.

text: on a shorter length on middle and leg, and he gets good bounce. Clipped down towards square leg to get off the mark
pretty full line and just outside off. Pushed to mid-off after coming right forward
pulled to deep square leg! Jansen goes short on middle, as Uthappa swivels while pulling to the right of square leg. Fine leg chases to his left and pulls the ball back last moment
on the fuller side of a good length on middle. Defended forward off the inside edge
pleasing cover drive! Presents the full face of the bat to that full ball outside off, which is right in the driving length. Drills that to beat cover to his left

has a big heave, and sends that off the outside edge over cover! The longer boundary there means it is pulled back by the point fielder chasing that. Full length ball outside off, and looked like Uthappa wanted to flick that to the on side
fuller on middle this time. He closes the bat face to clip to midwicket
deep point was pushed back, and so Uthappa gets only a single. Full and in the channel outside off, as he drives all along the ground now
full and just about on off. He goes low to block to mid-off
postText: Upender: "Why not try to open CSK with MS and Ruturaj Gaikwad." --- Ha, Dhoni opened the batting for India only twice in his entire career. Not sure about his domestic teams.

text: pulls his length back just a touch, and again goes outside off. Tapped to point
cut away to third man! Point and third man were both inside the circle, and Gaikwad got the width he wanted. On a good length and wide of off, as he effortlessly places that between the two men

wkt_text: RV Uthappa c Markram b Washington Sundar 15 (17m 11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 136.36
text: Uthappa goes after the spinner first ball, and gone! Looks to slog-sweep that full and tossed-up ball which is bowled wide of off. He almost had to fetch that from that wide line, and so ended up skying that wide of mid-on, where Markram ran and went low across to his right. Sundar strikes first ball, and Sunrisers right in the game after an expensive first three overs
preText: Here comes Sundar now. Over the wicket.
postText: Akshay Jajoo: "As a CSK fan, I'm counting every little victory. Rutu going beyond 4 balls is no. 1 for the day." --- Exactly the way to live life...

text: pretty full on off, and he jams his bat down for a single to long-off
preText: Out comes Moeen. Sundar from around the wicket.

shortText: Washington Sundar to Gaikwad, no run
text: full and closer to off, shaping to turn in. Blocked towards point
preText: Back over the wicket to Gaikwad

shortText: Washington Sundar to Gaikwad, no run
text: on a much shorter length outside off. Turns in with good bounce, and is punched back to the bowler from deep in the crease

Gaikwad's turn to sweep, and that is great fielding by Tripathi at deep backward square leg. Full ball on off, and Gaikwad is down on his knees early to slog that. Tripathi from fine leg runs and dives to his left to save a few for his side
this time the sweep gets him four! Plays this in front of square towards deep midwicket, where no man was present. Full length and there to smash on off, and Gaikwad was ready to launch into that
cuts hard at that short and wide ball outside off, but finds point. He played away from his body there
preText: Jansen switches ends. Over the wicket to Mo, with a wide slip present.
postText: Kabir Ali: "@Himanshu is giving life lessons to every comment. Can you give some to me too plz... " --- All credit goes to our users and followers, without whom we are nothing.

text: the short delivery, which was a matter of moments away with Moeen at the crease. Digs it in short just outside off, as it sails off the pitch after he sways out of the way
clips this back of a length ball on middle and off to deep midwicket, as deep square leg runs across to his right to cut that off
on a shortish length on fourth stump. Tapped to point from close to his body
and some tight lengths here. On the shorter side of a good length on off, and Mo blocks it down with a loud call of "no"
looked like was ready to pull, but the ball wasn't all that short. On a good length on off, and he eventually has to clip to deep square leg's right

wkt_text: RD Gaikwad  b Natarajan 16 (28m 13b 3x4 0x6) SR: 123.07
text: nails it first ball! What a dream start to have. On a pretty full length on middle, and bowled with an upright seam. That threatened to angle in, as Gaikwad shaped to flick, but the length was a bit too full to facilitate that shot. There is gap between bat and pad, and the ball rams through to shatter the stumps
preText:
Natarajan from over the wicket

Afeef: "Gaikwad seems to be finding his groove today. Bad news for SRH."

text: stands outside leg already, as the ball is on a good length on middle while also swinging in. He has a poke, but the ball takes the bottom edge
preText: Rayudu the new man in. Nattu runs in from over the wicket, but stops late. Time to reload...

text: skips down the pitch now - in a hurry here - and hoicks that rather uncomfortably. The ball was a touch fuller on leg, and Rayudu played from the inside half of the bat to fine leg while almost losing his balance
Short fine leg runs and slides to his right, but in vain. And he himself signals four, so no need to go upstairs. Mo clips this full delivery angling into his pads, and gets his first four of the day
full length on off this time. The length is not all that different to what got Gaikwad, as Mo defends to the off side
tucked to the bowler on the bounce. Full again outside off, and this time he nudges at that a bit away from his body

shortText: Umran Malik to Rayudu, no run
text: on a back of a length on off, and shaping to angle in at 140kph. Blocked down after opening himself up
preText: Malik from over the wicket now
postText: Sid Raju: "A Tamil Nadu boy gets a Chennai batsman, only for a Hyderabadi boy to face the SRH bowlers.."

shortText: Umran Malik to Rayudu, no run
text: excellent dive by Abhishek diving to his right at point. A touch fuller from the bowler and a little wide of off, as Rayudu looked to punch
outside edge, and four! No slip there, and that raced away. Pooran could only look on. A very late attempt to have a poke at that shortish ball just outside off, and manages four in the end

shortText: Umran Malik to Rayudu, no run
text: on the shorter side of a good length in the channel, as Rayudu looks to punch but is beaten. That was fired at 145kph

shortText: Umran Malik to Rayudu, no run
text: dances down to try and smack that short of a length ball on off, but is beaten. Rayudu looking impatient from ball one today, wonder where he'll end up
preText: Slip now in

shortText: Umran Malik to Rayudu, no run
text: looks to pull, but the ball isn't short enough this time. On a fullish length outside off, as he walks across to pull with his front leg in the air but gets an edge on to his pads
good length ball on middle, and clipped off the inside edge to square leg
preText: Sundar back as Nattu is taken off. Around the wicket.
postText: Maghi: "@Sid Raju, not one TN guy got a CSK guy out... Both Washi n Nattu are TN boys who picked up wickets against CSK!"

text: punches that to deep backward point. Short and wide of off, and he plays with a slightly open face of the bat
preText: Around the stumps to Rayudu too

text: on a good length and just outside off. Cuts towards deep point
short of a length on off, and pushed to deep point after a step back in the crease
much fuller on middle and leg. Softly nudges that to long-off while playing from outside leg
skips down, and Sundar bowls on a shortish length on leg. Pulled to fine leg with a hint of turn into him
fullish ball angling into him and finishing on middle and off. Fired at 153kph. Rayudu goes across and tries to flick to the on side, and gets that off the inside edge
postText: Mohd Irshad: "Waiting for Umran vs Lockie, the two fastest bowlers of IPL, and will see who would win fastest ball award :)"

shortText: Umran Malik to Ali, no run
text: bangs it in short on middle and off. Mo has to ride the bounce while hopping in the crease, and pats that down
slashed to deep backward point! Pretty full length this time, and in the channel outside off. Mo uses the pace of the bowler to send that flying over point for four
good length ball on middle, and clips to deep midwicket with a closed face of the bat
reaches out for that short and wide-ish ball outside off, which climbed on to him off the pitch. Manages to swat that over extra cover while leaping in the crease

flayed away over cover! Malik gives his second boundary of the over, and provides Rayudu with what he has been waiting for ever since he came to the crease. Full and right in the hitting zone outside off, as Rayudu lofts that with high elbows to deep extra cover
preText: Akrsh: "Was there an inside edge on 8.1? It looked plumb" --- Yup, although the bowler did appeal half-heartedly for leg before.
postText: And here comes the time-out

text: on a good length on middle and leg, and clipped to deep backward square leg from deep in the crease
preText:
Sundar will continue after the break.

Our forecaster suggest Super Kings will reach 159 from here. That means another 96 from the 11 overs remaining.

Hriday Shah: "Irshad, don't forget Nortje"

text: again skips down after making room, and the ball is a on a shortish length on middle and leg. Presents the full face of the bat for a single to long-off
pretty full and quick on off. Pushed to deep point
goes slashing hard at that pretty full ball on off, and sends that on the bounce to deep backward point
postText: Renji: "Was that the fastest ball in IPL 2022?" -- I would guess so, unless I have not missed something.

shortText: Washington Sundar to Ali, no run
text: off the inside edge to the on side, as he goes pushing at that good length ball on off which is coming into him
again goes heaving, but this ball is fuller on middle and leg. Gets a bottom edge towards fine leg
Sundar at cover has to turn and run, and he stretches his hand out only for the ball to land wide. On a back of a length outside off, and Mo looked to loft
preText:
Jansen back from over the wicket

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Who does Dhoni have the best death-overs strike rate against (min 25 balls faced)? One of the top three bowlers there is playing today.

text: goes flashing at that, and gets four wide of third man! Fuller in length and wide of off, as he gets a top edge to fly behind the wicket for a rusty four
heaved to deep midwicket! This was hit cleaner, as he went low and swung across the line to this fullish ball on middle and off. Four more
steps across late, and dabs that good length ball outside off to point on the bounce
makes room and dances down, as Jansen spots that and bowls with a scrambled seam on a short of a length on middle. Rayudu pulls and is beaten by the bounce
again he makes room and dances. Fuller length and wider of off, and swatted to long-off
short and wide of off, and he slaps that to deep point from deep in the crease
preText:
Nattu back. Over the wicket.

Supriya: "Seems a sticky surface - difficult for SRH to chase anything above 140!" --- Yup, that Moeen escape showed the ball stopping on the surface.

text: a swinging yorker that was tailing into Mo. He ends up clipping that to deep midwicket and plays it like a low full toss
change of pace there. On a back of a length on leg, as Rayudu again stands after making room. Dabbed to point for another single

dropped by Malik at short third man! He nearly clung on to that, having to dive to his left with the ball being highish there. On a fuller length outside off from Nattu, and Mo went slogging but got an outside edge
drills this drive to deep point, as he plays this fullish ball after backing away
a near yorker length ball on off, and jammed to long-off
pulls this to the longer side of the boundary to deep square leg. On a short of a length on middle, and whacked
preText:
Malik back from around the wicket

Nattu keeping things in check, but our forecaster still says 159 for Super Kings!
postText: Sumeet: "Ali is struggling." --- Yup, and the pitch seems to be slower than what he expected.

text: gets a top edge, and that flies for six nevertheless! The pace of 146kph from Malik means Mo ends up benefiting, since it wasn't a long boundary either at fine leg. On a short of a length again on middle and off, and he went for the pull

four to third man! Mo gets the ball rolling after a slow start. Another shortish ball, but this a touch wide of off. Mo waited for the ball to come before ramping late. Beats third man scampering to his right
much fuller on middle, and angling into his pads. Flicked to deep square leg

shortText: Umran Malik to Rayudu, no run
text: a yorker length ball on off, as Rayudu is across the stumps early. Jammed down from deep in the crease
preText: 13 off the first four balls of the over. Will Rayudu try and get more? Over the wicket comes Malik.

shortText: Umran Malik to Rayudu, no run
text: short and wide of off at 152kph, and he goes across while trying to slash at that away from his body
postText: The final time-out of the innings

text: goes pulling but gets an inside edge towards square leg, with the ball not being short enough on middle and off
preText:
Right then. Seven overs to go. Anyone for 175? Sundar is back with Mo in the mood. Around the stumps he comes.

Sandip: "Typical Csk wicket. they would love to defend in this wicket"

Maghi: "@Sumeet, I think Ali heard that..." --- Reverse jinx maybe?

shortText: Washington Sundar to Rayudu, no run
text: skips down, and the ball is there in the length on leg. But he gets an inside edge on to his pad
postText: john: "Typical Moeen, seems to be struggling and having a rotten time out there, then flicks a switch."

wkt_text: AT Rayudu c Markram b Washington Sundar 27 (42m 27b 4x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: finds long-on this time! Wanted to send this out of the ground, and once again he made room and cane down the pitch to this full ball on leg. The ball was a bit tossed up, and also in the hitting zone, but Rayudu doesn't get the placement there
postText: Deepak Samson : "Cannot blame Rayudu. Was trying to do the right thing. They need to keep going."

text: pretty full on middle, and flicked to deep square leg
preText: Dube in now. Sundar stays around the wicket.

shortText: Washington Sundar to Ali, no run
text: goes to lap-sweep that, but the ball is a touch short and outside off for that short
back of a length on middle and leg, and floated at 98kph. Clipped to deep square leg
and Mo dances down first ball, with the ball being fullish and on leg. Hoicked to long-on off the inside half of the bat
preText: Markram is given the ball. Around the wicket.
postText: Bhanu: "175 very much on the card the way Dubey playing last few innings and Jaddu Dhoni to follow"

text: slower, and on a good length on middle. Nearly chipped to midwicket there
shortish and wide of off. Slashed to deep point, who does well to cut that off to his right and keep it to one
six over long-on! Never looked like that was going all the way, but such is his power. On a shortish length on middle and off, and he pulls from deep in the crease. Great placement there

wkt_text: MM Ali c Tripathi b Markram 48 (59m 35b 3x4 2x6) SR: 137.14
text: taken at long-on now! The Markram gamble works for Sunrisers. Slower and fuller in length on middle, and a hint of turn away. Mo goes for the slog over the on side again, but this time finds the man right at the edge of the rope. Super Kings lose two set batters in quick succession
goes to sweep first ball, as the ball is full on off. Can only nudge that close to his right, as the keeper threatens to whip the bails off after collecting that
preText: Jadeja now. Another left-hander.

text: on a back of a length outside off, with Dube standing on leg stump. He closes the bat face to clip to deep square leg
preText: Nattu back
postText: Deepak Samson : "CSK doing exactly the thing to do in the situation. With Jaddu, Dhoni, Bravo to come they need to push for runs. There are no trophies for the number of wickets left!!"

text: much fuller and a little straighter on middle and leg. Pushed to long-on with the full face of the bat

wkt_text: S Dube c Umran Malik b Natarajan 3 (11m 5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 60.00
text: gifted to short third man! Soft dismissal there. He tries to use the pace of the bowler while attempting to guide that short of a length ball outside off over third man. Finds the man placed inside the circle as he plays late, and that lands another blow for Super Kings
runs that down third man from close to his body, with the ball being on a good length just outside off
preText: Dhoni at No. 7. Nattu stays over the wicket.

text: driven down to long-on. Much fuller length on off, and he plays with the full face of the bat
postText: Chandra: "122-7 would look fabulous" --- Any Super Kings fan around?

text: slower ball now. On a back of a length on off, and he waits before dabbing it towards point
guides that back of a length ball outside off after playing late to short third man. A rapid run stolen even as the throw went at the bowler's end
preText:
Bhuvi is back from over the wicket.

Into the death overs now, with the two specialists at the crease. Our forecaster says 154 form here.

text: past the outside edge! On a good length on off, as he looked to poke at that but was beaten. Good accurate stuff from Bhuvi
back of a length on off. He closes the bat face to clip to square leg, as the bowler gives the chase to his left. They rush for two there
postText: Asna: "Pretty sure that Shivam Dube would have got goosebumps seeing the standing ovation and roar that crowd gives when he walks back to the pavilion :p" --- Perhaps the perfect pun

text: a full toss on middle, and clipped to deep square leg. Perhaps Bhuvi missed his yorker there
has a jab at that good length outside off, but doesn't get bat on ball
slower ball, and beaten again. This one angles away after pitching on a good length outside off again, as Dhoni has a flash but is beaten
shapes to swing to the on side, and ends up sweeping to long leg. On a back of a length and wide of off, as he fetches it from outside off after going down on his knees
preText: Jansen returns from over the wicket

text: much fuller length and angling into him. Clipped to deep square leg

wkt_text: MS Dhoni c Umran Malik b Jansen 3 (12m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: finds fine leg with his pull! Jansen sends Dhoni packing with his first ball to him. He bowls a slower ball on a back of a length on middle and leg, and that rolling of the fingers on the seam means the ball angles away after pitching. Dhoni pulls from middle and off, and finds Malik right where he stood
preText: Over the stumps to Dhoni too

text: another short of a length ball on middle. He skips in the crease before clipping down towards square leg
preText: Bravo time

text: pretty full on off, and that is driven down the ground. Tripathi at long-on runs to his right and tumbles to save a few
looks to swing to the on side, but the ball is fullish on his pads. He misses and lets out a roar, as the ball hits his pad
lands a yorker on middle. Clipped to fine leg after bringing the bat down late
preText:
Two overs to go. Some hit-and-miss stuff awaiting? Nattu from over the wicket.

Chris Taunton: "When Dhoni's wicket fell your Forecast went down by a mere 2 runs!" --- Jadeja and Bravo still there after all...

text: another yorker there. Great bowling at the death. Lands that on middle, as Jadeja gets an inside edge on to his pad
a yorker on off this time. He can only manage to jam that to extra cover with an open face of the bat
postText: JPR: "Williamson smart enough to sneak in a over with Markram's Over once Rayudu was out with 2 left handers to face an offie. Tactically sound. Kane got icing on top with Moeen Ali's Wicket."

text: he tries to back away, but it is another perfect yorker on off. He loses his bottom hand, and ends up pushing to long-off
drilled down the ground! That was a fine shot considering the length was a bit too full on off for that. He lofts that back, as Nattu hangs his left hand out before withdrawing it
that goes wayyyy high, and is called wide. Bangs it in short - why would you after nailing those yorkers - outside off, and Jadeja lets that go

six to end the over! Jadeja gets the hitting length this time, and the extra delivery in the over results in six. In that length outside off which allows a free swing of the arms, as the ball flies off the bat over the bowler's head
full toss on middle, and launched over the bowler's head! A one-bounce four there. He swings off his bottom hand, and sends that bang straight
wide down the leg side. Bravo shuffles back and across, and Bhuvi lands that full and wide of leg
preText:
Bhuvi will bowl the final over

Dimkesh: "In all fairness, Dhoni's dismissal should probably take CSK's predicted score higher." --- Maybe a bit too harsh there?

text: goes to pull this back of a length ball on leg, but gets that off the inside half of the bat to deep midwicket

wkt_text: RA Jadeja c Williamson b Kumar 23 (29m 15b 2x4 1x6) SR: 153.33
text: taken at extra cover! Williamson there had to backpedal his way while keeping his eyes on the ball. He took a few steps to his right, and nabbed that. A low full toss on off - maybe a yorker that Bhuvi was aiming - as Jadeja ended up ballooning the ball since the length was too full for that attempted loft. Williamson takes that with a reverse cup
and the third wide of the over. Bhuvi feeling the pressure. This was much fuller but still pretty wide of off. Left alone as it was angling away
preText: Gajendra: "Jadeja doing Sir Jadeja Stuff..."

text: another wide. Short and wide of off, and Jaddu goes flashing at that away from his body but doesn't connect
preText: Four balls to go. More action from Jaddu? Bhuvi stays over the wicket.

text: loses his bottom hand to that slower ball bowled full outside off. But the ball takes off, and somehow lands between both long-off and long-on running forward. 150 up though
more wide balls. Pretty short outside off, and that flies over the batter. Left alone
preText: Jordan in. He can strike a blow or two.

text: low full toss on middle, and clipped to deep midwicket. The longer boundary there allows them to bag two
swats that full and wide ball outside off to long-off, who chases to his right. They manage two more, as they rush for the second run
postText:
Join Sudarshanan for the chase to see which team gets off the mark today.

Kalyan : "The predictor should probably thank Bhuvi's wides for its success"

Afeef: "This pitch seems perfect for Bravo to excel with his change-ups"

Jansen on his Sunrisers debut: "Nervous at the start, but nice to get the opportunity. Back of a length is the most difficult to play along with your change-ups... There wasn't much swing for me, so I went for the cross seam route. Anyone will be happy to get MS Dhoni... Target is gettable. Just run hard and take the opportunities that come"

5.21pm A fair total on a slow pitch, where the ball is stopping before coming on to the bat. A few scratchy knocks from the Super Kings' batting order - including from Moeen, who ended with 48 - as excellent death bowling prevents them from running away with the match. Not quite the finishing touches that the batting side would have liked, but Sunrisers well and truly in the game.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: Almost catching practice to start off! Short in length outside off, Abhishek pulls it towards the left of mid-on to get off the mark. Went on the bounce to Jordan there.
preText:
Abhishek Sharma and Kane Williamson are in the middle, while Mukesh Choudhary is at the top of his mark with the new ball.

Meanwhile, if you are in the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Welcome everybody to the run-chase. 155 should be gettable for Sunrisers, given their long batting line-up. But the Super Kings would be interested, too, given how much the conditions aided slow bowling in the first innings.

Thanks Himanshu!

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Williamson, no run
text: Length ball outside off, angling away. Williamson shoulders arms.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Williamson, no run
text: On a length around off, Williamson hops and defends it back.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Williamson, no run
text: Fuller and honing in on the off stump, Williamson pushes it towards covers.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Williamson, no run
text: Back of a length now, around the fifth stump. Williamson is on his toes as he pushes it towards point and shouts "NO!"

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Williamson, no run
text: Full and swinging in on off, squeezed towards backward point. Five dots, just a single. Good start for Choudhary.

shortText: Theekshana to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Darted it fuller around middle, Abhishek defends with a straight bat.
preText:
Spin from the other end, as expected. Sri Lanka's Maheesh Theekshana, on IPL debut. A slip in position.

Arun: "This score is Williamson territory.. Expect him to shepherd the chase today!"

text: Slower this time, fuller on middle. Driven through wide mid-off for a single.
Fuller and outside off, pushes Williamson back in defence.
preText: Over the wicket to Williamson.

text: A 'hit-me' ball, Williamson obliges! Half-tracker outside off, he stays deep and cuts it through cover-point for the first four of the innings.
Very full on off, dug back towards the bowler.
preText: Slip moves to the ring on the off side.

text: Flatter trajectory, just outside off. Punches it back to the bowler. Good way to end the over.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: Done him for pace but lands just short of Shivam Dube running in! Dug short around middle, Abhishek is hurried as he goes for the pull. Ends up getting a top edge. Dube runs in from fine leg and dives but lands just short.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Williamson, no run
text: Length ball outside off, pushed towards the off side.
Excellent running. Taps the full ball to the off side and hares to the other end.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, 2 runs
text: Length ball angling in, worked away through backward square leg for a couple.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Fuller around middle, driven to mid-on.
preText: Virat: "Rahul Tripathi uses the field restrictions in PowerPlay. SRH should play him as opener so he can take advantage of it.."

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, FOUR
text: Nails the pull this time! Short in length, Abhishek was anticipating it perhaps. Stands tall and hits it over midwicket for four.
Quicker one on a length around off, pats it towards midwicket for a quick run.
preText: Anand: "What I dont understand is Abhishek's intent here ? His role is clearly to try to maximize the power play and give Kane a bit of time to settle. He doesnt seem to be making any headway in that direction so far in this IPL. He either needs to be chopped or given a talking to...." Coach Tom Moody did speak to the broadcasters about their choice. They want to give Abhishek a decent run at the top.

text: Slices it hard and gets the desired result. Floated outside off, spins after landing. Abhishek looks to go over covers but ends up getting it off the outer half over the short third man. Has enough in it to go to the rope.
Fuller around off, pushed towards covers for one.
Fuller around the fourth stump line, defended solidly off the front foot.
Tossed up fuller around middle, Williamson gets to the pitch of it and drives it to long-on for one.
Fuller on middle, whips it through midwicket with a call of "two, two, two" and gets it comfortably.
preText: Long-off comes in, long-on and deep midwicket in place.

text: Length ball on the pads, flicked to short fine leg.
preText: Chris Jordan now.

text: Fuller outside off, driven to covers.
Beauty! Length ball, just a touch short. Williamson hops and looks to punch but the nip-back cuts him into half.
Length ball outside off, taps it to the right of short third man for one.

shortText: Jordan to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Angling in on a length, tucked towards midwicket.
preText: Jordan round the wicket to Abhishek.

shortText: Jordan to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Similar delivery on a length, defended from the crease back towards the bowler. Just one run of the penultimate over of the powerplay.
Quicker and fuller around middle, pushed towards midwicket for a quick run.
preText:
Theekshana's third in the powerplay.

Vijay: "I don't think there any problem with Abhishek's game here. He has played more as an opener. However I feel Williamson should bat 3 or 4 which will solidify their batting. And push Sundar or Tripathi as opener to take advantage of field restrictions."

text: Majestic hit! Tossed up outside off, Sharma brings his wrists into play as he goes inside out over cover.
Slower through the air on a length on middle, Abhishek lets it come to him before tapping it in front of point for one.
Fuller on off, driven towards covers. Abhishek wanted a run but it was hit straight to the fielder.
Very full on middle and leg, drilled to long-on for one.
Mighty! Floated around middle, Abhishek gets down on his knee and under the ball. Thumps it over deep midwicket to sign off from the powerplay with a six.
Tossed up around off, Williamson reaches out and defends.
preText: More spin. Captain Jadeja. In his 150th game for CSK. Bravo at slip.

text: Fuller on middle, pushed to cover. Williamson is on 10 off 23.
Flatter just outside off, goes back and taps it towards the left of backward point. Uthappa misfields and concedes a second.
Flatter on the pads, worked away through midwicket for one.
Darted in on a length, angling away. Goes back to punch it through backward point for two.

shortText: Jadeja to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Flatter one on middle, punched back to the left of the bowler.
Flatter ball outside off, slapped through point for one.
preText: Moeen Ali now.

text: Pushes this fuller one to the off side for one.
Loopy ball on off, driven to long-on for one.
Flatter on the pads, works it through midwicket. Wants a second but isn't on as Moeen does the mop up.
Lovely shot that. Tossed up ball, Williamson dances down to get to the pitch of it and hits it straight over the bowler's head to bring up the 50. "No, Mo!" shouts Dhoni.
Quicker outside off, smashed straight to cover.
Flatter on the pads, worked away through backward square leg for one
preText: Continues from around the stumps.

text: Fuller on middle, turned through midwicket for one.
A touch short, cut away in front of square on the off side for a brace.
Fuller, driven towards deep midwicket for one.
Fired in on a length, punched off the back foot through midwicket for one.
Picks the length early. A bit short, Abhishek transfers his weight back and pulls it to the vacant deep square leg region.
postText:
H. Prasanna : "They need to get Pooran in at 3 after they lose a wicket in the next over."

Time out.

text: Length ball around off, climbs a bit more than Williamson expected. Fends it to the off side.
preText:
Dwayne Bravo now.

SuGP: "Has CSK ever lost 4 games in a row?" They have lost three in a row to open the tournament for the first time, if I remember right.

text: Fuller on middle, pushes it with the full face towards mid-on for one.
Angling away on a length, Sharma stays back and cuts it through point for a couple. Was the longer boundary.
preText: Nazeer: "Unless CSK finds a way to pick up wickets in the powerplay it will be very difficult for bravo rescue csk everything." The void of Deepak Chahar's absence is strongly felt.

text: Clever running. Abhishek works it away towards the vacant midwicket region for a couple. It is the shorter end, so the fielders in the deep are very deep.
preText: Nobody deep square on the off side now.

text: Full and outside off, driven to sweeper for a single.
Well outside off, Sharma lets it go.
Full outside off, finds cover with the drive.
Fuller and angling away, Abhishek opens the face for one towards short third.
Williamson is happy to go back and tap this length ball towards covers for one.
Fuller this time, easily pushed towards covers for one.
Slower and fuller around off and middle, pushed towards Moeen at covers for another quick one.
Abhishek dances down to the length ball and heaves it to deep square leg. Longer part of the ground and gets two.
preText: Midwicket goes to backward point

shortText: Jadeja to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Flatter and fuller outside off, hit to backward point.
Shot! Length ball angling in. Williamson stays back, just pulls it through backward square leg. No chance for fine leg running to his left.
preText: Jordan is back for his second. CSK were 78/2 at this point, win predictor 67% in SRH's favour.

text: Fuller this time, pushed towards covers for one.

First half-century in IPL for Abhishek Sharma! Stays back and steers the length ball through point for a couple. One run short and he stays on 49. Didn't get his bat across the crease at the other end.
preText: Around the wicket to the lefty.

text: Gets his fifty now, Abhishek! Guides the length ball to third man to get to the other end. He's been at the forefront of this chase so far.
On a length on the pads, tucked to fine leg for one.
preText: Atif S: "So Abhishek gets two standing ovations from SRH dugout. "

text: Ho, ho, ho, it's a beauty! On a length from around the wicket, he clears front leg and swats it over long-on for a maximum. Easy to the eye.

wkt_text: KS Williamson c Ali b Mukesh Choudhary 32 (53m 40b 2x4 1x6) SR: 80.00
text: And there's the wicket! Choudhary gets Williamson. Soft, soft dismissal. Full ball outside off, catching practice for Moeen at short extra cover. The SRH captain is livid with himself.
preText: Whom do CSK turn to for a wicket? SRH are coasting at the moment. Choudhary is back for now.

text: Length ball on the pads, tucked away to fine leg to get going.
preText: Rahul Tripathi is in at 3 with a strong base. Just 66 off 47 needed. Our predicter says 79.59% in SRH's favour.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: On a length outside off, hit straight to backward point.
preText: James Cricket: "So, is it fair to conclude that CSK is the weakest team of this IPL?" Errr.....

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: Punches the length ball through covers to get to the other end.
preText:
Choudhary doing well to apply the brakes so far.

Rohit: "SRH going to mess it up from here!" Really? Even after this strong a start?

text: Nails the pull! Short ball down leg, Tripathi uses the pace to help it wayyyy over fine leg. Just the second ball he faced. Wow.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Tripathi, no run
text: The extra bounce on the length ball means the ball passes above Tripathi's attempted glide.
preText: Ajith: "CSK is known for strangling oppositions on slowish pitches. I expect this game to go till the last over. "

text: Full length ball outside off, enough width for Abhishek to swing his arms. Thrashes it through covers for four. The sweeper runs to his left and jars his knee on the surface as he gets out the dive, all in vain.
preText: CSK were 97/2 at this point. Almost neck and neck save for the wickets. Bravo is back now.

shortText: Bravo to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Yorker on off, dug out back to the bowler.
Low full toss outside off, swatted to long-on for one.
preText: Another fielder on the off side now, at covers.

text: Just past midwicket! Full and on the pads, whipped it just past a diving Jadeja and gets four.
preText: Around the wicket to Tripathi. Deep square leg and a long-on in position.

text: Slower one on a length, mistimes the pull through midwicket for one.
preText: Over the wicket now.

text: Dropped! And it's Jadeja. Slower one on a fuller length, away from him. Abhishek had to reach out to it but checked his shot. Spooned a catch to the right of backward point. Jadeja dived full strength but only got his finger tips.
preText: Continues over the wicket to Abhishek.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Length ball on middle and leg, pushed back.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: On a length outside off, flayed over cover-point for one.
preText: Four men deep on the leg side. Short ball?

text: Short ball angling away, Tripathi moves to the off side and guides it to third man for one.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, SIX
text: Stand and deliver! Effortless, brilliant and maximum. Stands tall to the length ball and bashes it right over the bowler's head for half a dozen.
preText: Krish: "If jadeja can't get it, it's not a drop ! "

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: Fuller now, pushed to long-on for one.
Now Tripathi gets into Choudhary. Hits the length ball well over the leaping cover fielder for four. 13 runs off Mukesh's final over.
preText: Prashant: "Mukesh is looking like Indian version of Starc. " This comparison would make Abhishek feel wayyy better about his previous hit.

text: Flatter on middle, turned to midwicket for one.
preText: 34 needed off 30 balls. Don't need numbers from the win predictor to tell who's in front. Here's Theekshana.

text: Length ball on the pads, tucked away to short fine leg for one.
Fired in on the pads, worked away through square leg for one.
Flatter outside off, punched back past the bowler for one.

shortText: Theekshana to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Fuller around middle and leg, defended. "Doesn't matter," shouts Tripathi from the other end.

shortText: Theekshana to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: Fuller outside off, driven to covers. Just four runs from it.
postText: The final strategic time-out of the match.

text: Perfect start after the time-out! Overpitched on off, Tripathi lofts it straight over long-off.
preText:
Jordan is back. Is there any twist in this tale?

Venkat: "If CSK loses this match (seems more likely unless a miracle happens), I am done watching IPL this session. Anyone else shares this sentiment"

text: The free hit doesn't cost much. Full ball, hit straight to sweeper for one.

Troubles compound for Jordan and CSK. Short ball down leg, Tripathi gets a top edge over the wicketkeeper's head on the pull. Jordan's right hand clips the bail at the bowler's head and it's a no ball as a result.
preText: 42 runs in the four overs that Tripathi and Abhishek have batted together.

text: Off-pace ball on a length, slammed to long-off for one.
That's timed and placed to perfection. Full and outside off, Tripathi just slashes hard at that. Connects it perfectly and hits the square drive beating point and third man.
Full and outside off, hit to sweeper for one.
Very full on off, squeezed towards covers for one. 19 runs coming off the over.

wkt_text: Abhishek Sharma c Jordan b Bravo 75 (81m 50b 5x4 3x6) SR: 150.00
text: End of Abhishek's brilliant stay in the middle! Bravo's slower ball does it for CSK. Takes the aerial route but ends up finding long-off on the bigger side of the ground. Greeted with a standing ovation by the SRH dugout and rightly so.
Sprayed well outside off, left alone.
preText: Bravo into his third

text: Edged but four! Full ball on a length, angling away. Pooran hangs his bat at it but gets a thick edge. Short third dives over it as Bravo is on his haunches.
preText: Nicholas Pooran can end this in a flash.

text: Fuller ball at a slower pace, steered to short third man for a quick single.
Full and outside off, goes past the flashing blade of Pooran. Wided.
Tripathi trickles it fine to get SRH their first points this season. A low full toss on the pads, gets enough blade to leave Dhoni behind with no chance.
postText:
7:21pm That's all from this game. Thanks for joining us and do jump in to the next game here. This is S. Sudarshanan signing off on behalf of Himanshu. Ciao!

Player of the match Abhishek Sharma: It was a pressure game for the team and me. I am pretty much lucky to have a team like SRH as they have been very supportive. It's a good start for me and I look forward to score more. They just wanted me to bat naturally and play my strokes. 100% I have been waiting for my bowling. Whenever I get the situation I am ready for it.

Kane Williamson: Every game you play is tough. We want to keep on improving. Although it's our first win, we had to look on some of the things we'd done right in the previous game. Staying calm and staying on task. For us it's focusing on our cricket and play smart. We are starting to see games played on surface once, twice. The target was competitive on that definitely. The ball held on the surface. We were able to build partnership and Abhishek was terrific. Learning from the first innings and taking it into our chase. The game always challenges you, everybody is trying to make contributions to the team.

Remember, it's Super Saturday, which means, there's the second game of the double-header for you to follow. Jump right here to follow that game live.

7:07pm Tripathi added his own little touch after walking in at three, looking as fluent as ever in his 15-ball 39. Earlier the SRH bowlers, led by Washington Sundar's two for 21 ensured that CSK don't run away with the game. T Natarajan, Aiden Markram et al struck at regular intervals to then restrict CSK to a gettable total.

kumar: "Rahul tripathi is an under-rated cricketer. He has consistently played valuable knocks since all through last few seasons, yet he is seldom given much attention or credit in discussions."

Rahul Tripathi: The skipper and opener gave us a great start. It was important to spend time in the middle and I had to just play my shots. It was important for the team to go out there and express ourselves. The win was very important for us. I think Abhishek played extremely well. He took the bowling on and kept up with the run-rate. The win is important because this tournament is competitive.

Here's Ravindra Jadeja: It's with the ball that we are disappointed but we were 20-25 runs short. We were looking to fight till the end. 155 isn't bad and our bowlers were looking to take wickets. Tomorrow might be a day off but we'll look to improve. We'll talk about where we are lacking. We are professionals and need to work hard, stick together and come back stronger.

<7:02pm> Comfortable win for Sunrisers to open their account in IPL 2022 as the Super Kings still stay winless. And credit to Abhishek Sharma for acing the run-chase. Should SRH open with Abhishek? Or should they have Rahul Tripathi instead? All these questions have been laid to rest comfortably by the youngster, stroking his IPL best score. And what an opposition to do it against than the Super Kings, who have had the upper hand over Sunrisers overall in the competition.

CSK have a lot to think about with respect to their bowling composition. They couldn't dislodge Abhishek and Kane Williamson throughout the powerplay. In fact, the partnership was broken due to an error in judgement from Williamson. But Abhishek and then Tripathi ensured that there is no twist in the ultimate fate.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Agarwal, no run
text: fired in full on off stump, presenting a beautiful seam, starts to wobble back in as Agarwal defends towards point
preText:
Out come the PBKS openers, Mayank Agarwal and Shikhar Dhawan. It'll be Mohammed Shami to kick off with the ball, slip in place. Can Titans keep their winning run going? The leather does tend to fly at this old ground

Hello folks, good to be back. Lots going on today, from the Test in Gqeberha to some hot and sweaty damp and mizzly county action. And we should be in for a cracking contest here at the Brabourne, as Himanshu has set out. Straight up it's Kings' pongo-tastic batting against the incisive quality of Titans' bowling attack

7.20pm The action is just ten minutes away, and here comes Alan to fire things up further.

Remember, in the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Mustafa Moudi: "Off Topic: Is Smith the most common Surname in the IPL. With Graeme, Steven, Dwayne and now Odean now!!" --- Among foreigners, yup, looks like.

Abhilash: "Completely forgot about the dew !!Thought GT have lost a chance to put pressure on punjab batting lineup by choosing to bowl first." --- To forget among the batters' best friends this season is harsh.

Here's Bairstow ahead of his Kings debut: "It's been great so far. It's an exciting time, everything starts again. The brand of cricket that the boys have played has been great. You want to put your best foot forward... Training has gone well. You know the schedule these days... Not too sure [if I'll be keeping today]!"

7.10pm Kings will be batting first after losing the toss, as we take a look at this: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: What is Shikhar Dhawan's strike rate against Mohammed Shami in the IPL?.

Devon Thomas: "Everyone at my office was waiting for the team announcement to decide whether we will watch the match. No Rajapaksa means we will not be. Bad call by PBKS" --- Oh no...

KarthikRG: "Should we just say the so and so team won the toss? Why bother telling they elected to field." --- Right, it is 16 out of 16 opting to bowl now.

Punjab Kings: 1 Mayank Agarwal (capt), 2 Shikhar Dhawan, 3 Jonny Bairstow, 4 Liam Livingstone, 5 Shahrukh Khan, 6 Jitesh Sharma (wk), 7 Odean Smith, 8 Arshdeep Singh, 9 Kagiso Rabada, 10 Rahul Chahar, 11 Vaibhav Arora

Gujarat Titans: 1 Shubman Gill, 2 Matthew Wade (wk), 3 Sai Sudarshan, 4 Abhinav Manohar, 5 Hardik Pandya (capt), 6 David Miller, 7 Rahul Tewatia, 8 Rashid Khan, 9 Darshan Nalkande, 10 Lockie Ferguson, 11 Mohammed Shami

7pm Up goes the coin… and Gujarat Titans opt to bowl first. Pandya expects dew to be present at the ground. He says he is happy with the "character" of the side, and himself declares the changes: Shankar out with a back spasm, and Aaron is out too. Agarwal would have bowled first too, and says Bairstow for Rajapaksa in their only change.

Mahesh: "With Bairstow making the debut, I pray that Rajapaksa continues to find his place in the team. He is an aggressive player who can change the game if he bats few overs"

Siddu: "Just searched Google and learned how to make comment in ESPNcricinfo." --- Thanks for the effort, but a lot of life's problems can be solved without Google too.

6.55pm Meanwhile, for those keen to have him, Bairstow to debut for Kings. Also, Darshan Nalkhande will debut for Titans, possibly to make way for the injured Varun Aaron, while Sai Sudarshan also plays his first match for them.

Hampy: "I hope Bairstow gets a game today. I don't understand why Punjab have left their best batman on the bench so far." --- But who do you leave out among the foreigners? Rajapaksa has been pretty good, while Livingstone has been indispensable. Although Smith hasn't had a great start, he provides a bowling option and plays the finisher's role. So despite what Bairstow offers, he has had to unfortunately spend time on the bench.

Leon: "I hope Odean is given one more shot. Today should be make or break"

6.45pm Fifteen minutes to the toss. Gear up and firm up your fantasy sides. Wasim Jaffer helps you do that tonight. And here comes Jaffer again - along with Carlos Brathwaite - to forward to the match: Do Gujarat need an extra spinner? Does Odean Smith keep his place? They answer these, and more.

Can you guess the answer for this one? Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Who has hit the most fours in the IPL over the years? Not de Villiers, not Russell, not Gayle.

Jags: "Mayank the batter needs to step up. This IPL, he has been pretty quiet" --- Yup, he hasn't had such a slow start to any IPL in recent times.

6.40pm In some quick getting up to speed, here comes the match preview for the day. After all, one team has the best scoring rate in the powerplay; the other has the best bowling average in the same phase.

Jaspreet: "Would be a shame if Bhanuka Rajapaksa is not in playing eleven. This guy has no baggage with him and delivered in each match." --- Is there a reason to not have him? Like he says in this interview with Andrew Fidel Fernando, 'I've always felt like a rioter who would go and fight for the rights of the boys'.

6.30pm Batting might vs bowling accuracy. Livingstone, Shahrukh and Smith vs Shami, Ferguson and Rashid. Punjab Kings vs Gujarat Titans: perhaps the most-awaited match of the season yet. Welcome to the 16th match of this IPL, where the unbeaten Titans stand in front of a ruthless Kings line-up. This is Himanshu saying hello this evening, as Alan Gardner will be keeping one eye on IPL today along with county cricket.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Agarwal, no run
text: length and holding its line, comes off the outer half of the bat as Agarwal gropes forward

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Agarwal, no run
text: touch shorter, 136kph and he jumps across to defend square on the off side
pumped over the head of mid-on, Shami gets a little too full and straight and Agarwal gets the scoreboard ticking with a lofted four
postText: "Was really looking forward all day to watching Rajapakse play, only to find out that he's been dropped. My disappointment is immeasurable and my day is ruined." Can I interest you in this AFF interview with Bhanuka instead, Qaaid?

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Agarwal, no run
text: back of a length and steered towards point from the crease
banged in and he's hanging back, opens the face on a single to third
over the wicket, back of a length into the hip, comes off the padding for one
preText: Pandya will take the new ball today, in the absence of Varun Aaron

text: chopped past the dive of Wade! Too close to cut but Dhawan throws the hands, gets away with a thick inside edge
preText: "A PBKS fan usually but I'll be supporting the Titans today. Poor team selection dropping the exciting Bhanuka." Hmmm, not sure that's how supporting a team is supposed to work, Michelle Herft

text: length ball sliding across the bows, 136kph and Dhawan lets this go
short length on the body and worked down to fine leg
[itched up in the channel, Agarwal is watchful defending with an open face towards point
postText: "Another 100 for Cook! Not that it matters on this section." We can always squeeze in a mention, Kartik. Matt Critchley is going for three figures on Essex debut, too

wkt_text: MA Agarwal c Rashid Khan b Pandya 5 (11m 9b 1x4 0x6) SR: 55.55
text: bumper, flapped to midwicket! Another low score for Agarwal, and he's chewed up quite a few balls this time, too. Banged into the pitch and he took on the pull, but it came high off the bat, presenting Rashid Khan with an easy catch. Kings lose their captain early, and it's Titans' captain who does the job
postText: Out comes YJB at No. 3, on his PBKS debut

text: another streaky edge to fine leg, Dhawan neither back nor forward and the bat scissors down, chopped past the stumps for four once again
preText: Dhawan on strike to Shami

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Dhawan, no run
text: short and swerving away at 139kph, he watches this one through
jumps down, shortish length and Dhawan follows it with the hands, almost slashes to third on the full
tickled off the pads, Bairstow gets going with four! Nibbling back in but he was on his toes and times it well through square leg

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Bairstow, no run
text: slightly back of a length, tucked to midwicket

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Bairstow, no run
text: back of a length, 137kph on fifth stump and YJB defends, the ball bouncing down close to the off stump as he comes across and wards off any danger
postText: Here's Hemanth: "On the other side, Hardik seems to be sending a message to all and Venky that he is ready to be back as an allrounder. He is sharing the new ball and he is batting at 4 as well"

text: back of a length length, zipping through outside off as Dhawan hangs the bat out
preText: Pandya to bowl another
postText: "You've forgotten about Nick Browne hundred." Never, Joydeepsinghgil! Read all abaht it here

text: beats the inside edge, lovely line from Pandya and again Dhawan nearly comes a cropper hanging his bat in the channel

tight single, there's a direct hit from Miller in the covers... it's going to the third umpire, but YJB is okay! Hard running from the Yorkshire terrier, slid his bat in adeptly as the diving underarm throw came in
back of a length, 132kph and tucked to the leg side
short, room to swing the arms, Bairstow connects well but picks out Miller at cover
creamed over midwicket! Casual as a walk on Scaborough seafront from Bairstow... short outside off and he serves up a portion of battered cod
postText: Breaking news: Critchley has a debut ton at the ECG! I know you've all been dying to find out

text: lofted down the ground, slightly overpitched and Dhawan seizes on it, front elbow pointing the way as he clears mid-off with ease
preText: First bowling change, Lockie Ferguson on

text: crunched through the covers! Hit off a length with an angled bat, Ferguson's line was wide and he pays for it with another boundary
pace of to 147kph, dabbed down into the covers for a quick single
145kph, shortish and angling in, tucked to the leg side
preText: "Was it just me or did the third umpire on that run-out review sounded so much like God aka SRT?" Well, he's got to earn a living somehow, I suppose, Abhishek

wkt_text: JM Bairstow c Tewatia b Ferguson 8 (17m 8b 2x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: goes for the ramp, picks out short third! Bairstow won't be improving that powerplay strike rate today. Fiery short ball and it veered back at him like a barracuda in the shallows, maybe struck the glove, otherwise it was travelling... well intercepted by the leaping Tawatia. Sachin Third ump wants to check the catch, but it was clean
preText: "YJB going at a strike rate of 133," huffs Louise Alexande. "What was Rajapaksa's SR in the powerplay again? Oh that's right... 280 "
postText: Out comes Liam Livingstone, been in some hot form

text: short into the body and flicked fine, 143kph and he uses it to his advantage to get off the mark first ball. Went in the air but short fine leg wasn't a chance
floated up from over the wicket, clipped off leg stump through the infield
preText: First sight of Rashid Khan, as Titans look to exert a little extra pressure in the final over of the powerplay

text: flicked off the stumps through midwicket
preText: Long-on and deep midwicket out

shortText: Rashid Khan to Dhawan, no run
text: full and straightening, tapped back on the front foot
flighted and Dhawan is able to get down, works a couple in front of deep midwicket

shortText: Rashid Khan to Dhawan, no run
text: googly, 99kph and spinning away on off, comes off a leading edge
possibly another wrong'un to finish, flicked through midwicket on the back foot
postText: "So after a wicket falls the new batter comes and starts with a boundary," observes Ashish. "Punjab continue their attacking intent. Never back down."

text: round the wicket, banged in and defended on off stump
