preText: Powerplay done, this is Kings' lowest six-over score of the tournament

text: length in the channel, tapped away warily
145kph on fourth stump and Dhawan punches on the up, gets it past cover for a couple to the sweeper
short and into the body as he walks across, flicked through backward square leg
postText: "Don't want to harp on about it but Punjab really know how to make things harder for themselves," grumbles Pardeep Vasudev. "Take out a form player like Rajapaska and leave in someone who hasn't done it last IPL or any games this IPL in Shahrukh Khan. If nothing else, why change a winning team?"

text: slower ball, 127kph and loopy wide off off, Livingstone steers it into the point region for one
back of a length, hauled away through midwicket for a couple more
banged in short on fourth stump, defended behind square for a quick single
starts with a slower-ball bouncer, sailing through above Livingstone's noggin
preText:
Darshan Nalkande to bowl on his IPL debut

Mayank Shekhar: "@Alan, On the topic of SRT, if he would have started his career now with the same skillset - immaculate technique and bowling of all sorts, do you think he would have been as successful as he eventually became?" Well, Mayank. He's one of the greatest players of all time... so I think he'd have done okay

text: skiddy length ball, 134kph wide of off as Dhawan slashes and fails to connect
postText: "Alan, why isn't Labuschagne playing for Glams ?" More county chat, I like it. He's only just landed in the country, Kalyanaraman. Colin Ingram subbed in for him in this round

text: skips out and throws the bat for a single to deep backward point
by the beard of Zeus that's gone far! Dances out and crumps him off a length, clean bat swing and it disappears over long-on for Livingstone's first six of the night. There could be more to come
slower ball wide of off stump, settles for a cut through point
length on off stump and Dhawan dabs it down square of the wicket
postText: Strategic timeout time, please get some electrolytes on board

text: scuttles in and loops the ball up, worked through the leg side for two
preText:
Rashid Khan is back

"You say like county chat, but you've been ignoring my comments all week, Alan, come on mate, I've got nothing else than Cricinfo on this rainy Parisian work day." Sorry, Amar, there are a few comments to sift through... what point were you trying to make?

text: flattish on off and dabbed into the point region

shortText: Rashid Khan to Livingstone, no run
text: fizzes down a 96kph legbreak, Livingstone pokes a leading edge back towards the bowler
preText: Slip is in

text: slapped hard into the leg side... but taken on the rope! Excellent running, jumping catch from Pandya - or so it looked on first glance. But his boot just slid into the boundary marker as he took a step and then attempted to throw the ball up and complete the catch; didn't quite let go in time. Livingstone is straight back to the middle as soon as he sees it on the big screen
steps out and punches to long-off

shortText: Rashid Khan to Dhawan, no run
text: quick legbreak, coming back at Dhawan as he chops down and gets an inside edge
Livingstone scoops all the way! Twists the knife for Titans, walking across and using the pace on the ball to flick it for six
goes again, walking miles across and clearing Wade! Nalkande had shifted his line well outside off but couldn't prevent Livingstone playing the safe shot, this time for four
loses his shape attempting to slog down the ground. Decent slower ball that spins through wide of off stump
length ball, pace off again, dragged through midwicket on the pull. Looking to give it some proper welly, but came off the inside half of the bat
Dhawan takes a step down to a 134kph short ball, glided for one down to third
preText: "Livingstone living the dream," cackles Kartik

text: hammered through cover point! Livingstone cashes in on a short, wide ball. Punishing bat speed as he cuts in front of square
postText: Halfway through the innings, it's back over to Himanshu

wkt_text: S Dhawan c †Wade b Rashid Khan 35 (56m 30b 4x4 0x6) SR: 116.66
text: Tickled to the keeper! Full length ball on middle and off, and turning away from the left-hander. Dhawan has a poke at that with a slightly open face of the bat, but the ball turns away more than he perhaps anticipated, as the outside edge lands right into the keeper's gloves, who goes up straightaway
preText: Thanks Alan. How thankful are Kings' fans for that escape for Livingstone? Rashid from over the wicket.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Sharma, no run
text: good length ball outside off, as he dabs that to point with the ball turning away
preText: Jitesh the new man in. Rashid stays over the wicket.

text: the googly now. Full ball on off which comes into him, as he tries to defend but gets an inside edge towards square leg. He is off the mark though
preText: A slip there

text: chips that to deep midwicket. Closes the bat face to that pretty full ball on middle and off, and gets a single in the vast space there
pretty full on off, as he opens the bat face a little to play a combination of sweep and loft to long-off, since he was down on his knees early to try and sweep

shortText: Rashid Khan to Sharma, no run
text: full delivery outside off, as he taps that towards point
good hard length on middle and off, and angling into him. He steps back in the crease to clip to deep midwicket
preText: Pandya back

text: Slashed wide of third man! Short and wide of off, as he waits for the ball to come before lofting that late while using the width. Beats the man in the deep to his right. Great placement
postText: nachos: "As soon as Himanshu comes back a wicket falls :/" --- I'll take the credit, thanks!

text: on a back of a length and a touch wide of off. Tapped to point on the bounce from deep in the crease

backs away, and lofts that down the ground now! Jitesh wanted three, and they manage that in the end. That is excellent running. And great fielding by Gill to at long-on, as he dives to his left after chasing at the ball, and gets a left hand to push the ball back last moment. On a short of a length on off and rising on to him, as he swats that over the bowler's head
goes to pull that wide-ish ball outside off after shuffling across, but the length isn't all that short. Gets an inside edge on to his body, as he sends Jitesh back
another short delivery on middle, and again there is extra bounce. He ducks, and that is called wide as the ball angles away into the keeper's gloves

skips down a step after also shuffling across off, and ends up chipping the back of a length ball wide of off. Just places that close to the non-striker for a single to long-on, as Pandya tries to dive to his right and get a hand, but doesn't manage it
crashed through cover! Short and wide of off, and turning away, as he slashes that away from his body to beat deep point way to his right
preText:
Tewatia replaces Rashid. Over the wicket.

James : "The key wicket now for Titans? Livingstone, I presume....." --- Never in doubt...

text: short again, but closer to off. Again swatted to cover, where Pandya fumbles and allows a single
clears the longer boundary! Six over deep midwicket. Fuller length, but right in the hitting zone on middle and he gets down to swipe that across the line for a big six
More punishment for Tewatia! Six more! Fullish length on middle, and just about short enough for Jitesh to launch a pull over deep midwicket again
dropped by Manohar at long-off! Jitesh dances down early, as Tewatia bowls full and wide of off. Jitesh has to launch at that nevertheless since he is down the pitch

fifty for Livingstone, the second-fastest this season! He gets there off 21 balls, and they pick 24 off the over. Short of a length on middle, and again too short and friendly for a six over deep midwicket

wkt_text: JM Sharma c Shubman Gill b Nalkande 23 (17m 11b 1x4 2x6) SR: 209.09
text: taken at long-on! Jitesh's fun is over. A slower ball on a full length on off, and although that was there in the slot to put away, Jitesh was perhaps beaten by the lack of pace there since the ball didn't come to him as well as he would have liked. Gill in the deep comes running forward, and goes low to take a good catch pretty close to the circle

wkt_text: OF Smith c Shubman Gill b Nalkande 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: Another catch for Gill! Nalkande on a hat-trick on IPL debut. Smith looks to send that firing first ball, but finds long-on. It was a full ball on off - a knuckle ball - as Smith had a free swing of the arms as if all he had to do was dispatch that at any cost. There is only height that he can manage to get, as Gill runs to his right this time, and waits patiently for the ball to land into his bag
preText: In comes Smith. What can he do? Third man back, long-of in.

text: much shorter in length, and a touch wide of off. Punched to deep point after a step back in the crease
preText: Hat-trick ball to Shahrukh

text: top-edged four! Change of pace from Naklande, as he bowls short on middle and off. Livingstone has a pull at that, but the ball goes over the keeper's head and beats fine leg running to his right
this time to the left of fine leg! Another short ball on off, as this time Livingstone has a swivel while pulling well and wide of the man in the deep
and a slower ball again. Pushed off a back of a length outside off to cover, where Pandya tumbles to his left to cut that off
preText: Mid-off back, fine leg in

text: returns with a yorker tailing into middle. Jammed down to long-on
preText:
Shami back. Can he do something for Titans?

Meanwhile, in other sporting news. The Indian women's hockey team have entered the semifinals of the junior World Cup. And they did it after a four-minute, two-goal blitz that absolutely flattened South Korea.

MagicBall: "Will Punjab keep hitting now or back down for a couple of overs?" --- With their approach so far this season, I don't think they will ever press the brakes.

And a belated call for time-out. Did all that hitting put the time-out signal out of the umpires' heads?

Avesh: "Looks like Livingstone is seeing ball entirely differently than others, or playing on a different pitch." --- With those lengths, he is getting them like he would want too.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: that is a sharp bouncer! On a short of a length just outside off, as he pulls but the ball goes over his bat. First bouncer called

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Shahrukh Khan, SIX
text: just clears long-on! Looked like the fielder there had a chance, but no way! Shahrukh lofts that fullish ball on middle and off, and although that was not off the middle of the bat, it had the power to travel

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Shahrukh Khan, SIX
text: this is much cleaner, and goes much further! In that hitting zone on a full length on middle and off - and a slower ball too - as he hoicks that away with full freedom

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run
text: now that hurries on to him. On a short of a length on off, and climbing on to the batter, who pulls unconvincingly to midwicket, as Shami chases to his right

wow, that was gracious! Can Livingstone look so free-flowing too? I thought he was all about power. On a full length just outside off, as he drills that down the ground between the bowler and mid-off, almost nudging that with disdain as if Shami were a newcomer

shortText: Rashid Khan to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full ball on middle and off, and tucked back to the bowler
preText: Rashid returns

shortText: Rashid Khan to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run
text: much shorter in length on middle and turning in. He pulls late towards square leg with the turn into him

wkt_text: LS Livingstone c Miller b Rashid Khan 64 (58m 27b 7x4 4x6) SR: 237.03
text: gone, taken at deep square leg! This time there is no doubt about the catch. Rashid pulls his length back to go even shorter on middle and off, as Livingstone goes deep in the crease to pull. But he finds Miller, who has a little leap before taking that well inside the rope. Kings losing wickets in a hurry here
full and on off, as he drives to long-off with the full face of the bat
preText: Rabada now. Rashid stays over the wicket, and has a slip.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Shahrukh Khan, OUT
wkt_text: M Shahrukh Khan lbw b Rashid Khan 15 (15m 8b 0x4 2x6) SR: 187.50
text: the umpire waits for ages before giving that out! Rashid had run away to the keeper while celebrating already with his right hand up before realising that there had no response from the umpire, as he looked back. But Shahrukh reviews. No inside edge there, as he goes down on his back knee to sweep this good length ball on middle and leg but the ball hits his back thigh. And replays show the ball would have crashed into middle and leg
full ball on middle and off, as he goes down to block but gets an inside edge towards fine leg
preText: Kings again happy to keep attacking, but again losing their way here. Chahar in now.

text: on a short of a length on middle and angling in after climbing steeply. He looks to pull but gets that on his body
preText:
Ferguson back from over the wicket

Basil George : "3d umpire sounds like Sachin :)" --- Absolutely.

wkt_text: K Rabada run out 1 (9m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: run-out at the keeper's end? Yup, he is short of the crease. They wanted a second for once, but Rabada was sent back after they realised it wasn't possible, as he had to dive to try and get in. Not sure where they saw the second run there. Shami at third man scampered across to his right to pick the ball and throw back flat to the keeper after the ball was bowled on a back on off, with Chahar opening the bat face to beat diving to his right
good length ball on off, an tucked back towards the bowler
taps at this fullish ball on off to point. A direct hit at the bowler's end would have had him in trouble
bowls short of a length on middle and leg, and angles in. Bowls from wide of the crease too
postText: Ankur: "Rashid is the difference between Kings 165 now vs 200 , defining over"

text: short delivery on off, and slower in pace too. He has a ramp at that, but is beaten
back of a length on middle, as he clips to deep midwicket with a skip in the crease. They gobble two this time

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Arora, no run
text: good ball. On a good length just outside off at 140kph, as he has a poke at that without any foot movement, and the ball just passes the outside edge
preText: Shami is back since Rashid is done
postText: Tanstheman: "Thin red lines between senseless aggression and aggressive mindset. Unbelievable. Rashid's last over. Knock it around for 6-7 runs. Maybe get a boundary. And then kill it in the next 4 overs. Shaking my head…"

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Arora, no run
text: on a back of a length again on off. This time he dabs down towards the bowler
a touch fuller on middle and off, as he gets bat on ball to have a little tuck towards mid-on. Pandya rushes in to hit the stumps at the bowler's end, but the batter is safely in
pretty full on middle and off, as he stabs that to deep point after making room

wkt_text: VG Arora  b Mohammed Shami 2 (8m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33
text: those stumps are splattered! Kings in danger of getting bowled out with two overs left. On a good length with an upright seam - that enviable seam position of Shami - and pitching on middle and off. That goes with the arm, as Arora's poke is late, by which time the middle and off stumps are destroyed
preText: Dasitha : "Ok.. I think enough is enough with this Odean Smith experiment.. "

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Arshdeep Singh, 2 runs
text: lofted over cover, and some useful runs for Kings here. On a fullish length and angling into middle and off, he chips for a chase for deep point to his left
preText: Arshdeep is the last man in. Shami around the wicket.

text: pretty full ball just outside off, as he jams the bat at that after getting the front leg out of the way
preText: Ajay Gour: "I sent a comment at the end of 15th over about Punjab may not be able to bat all 20 overs. Now it seems all the more certain." --- Ah, how did I miss that?

text: drilled for four! Chahar says if Livingstone can, so can I. A slower ball on a pretty full length in the channel outside off, as he drives that to the left of deep point after clearing his front leg
on a back of a length on middle, and rising on to him. He fends at that uncomfortably
shortish in length on middle, and he pulls to fine leg

shortText: Ferguson to Arshdeep Singh, no run
text: takes his eyes off as he tries to half-pull that short ball on middle, which is angling in at 141kph. Beaten by the pace and bounce
preText:
Around the wicket to Arshdeep

Wondering: "Yesterday it was Ravi Bishnoi, today its Rashid. Fastish legspin seems to be doing the trick so far"

text: wohooo, six four for Kings from the No. 11 too! Falls just short of the rope at deep square leg as Rashid chases to his right. Their strategy paying off well and deep into the order, or so you can say. On a short of a length on middle again, as he pulls with a swivel after again taking his eyes off
bingo, six and fun! A slower ball on a short of a length on off, as he just beats fine leg with that classy pull off the middle of the bat
preText: Pandya to bowl the last over

text: on a much fuller length on off, and change of pace. Pushed to deep point
makes room and manages to push that back of a length ball on leg towards cover, as Pandya follows him
preText: karthik: "Arshdeep batting and some statistical delights."

text: flung away for four! If you turned away after that famed line-up fell, here you go now. On a yorker length and wide of leg, as he gets his front leg out of the way to swing between fine leg and deep square leg
a leg-before review by Pandya out of hope! Chahar looks to heave that good length ball on middle, which is angling in, and replays confirm the inside edge

some fun off the last ball too! Ball falling one bounce short of the deep midwicket fielder when it nearly felt like going for a boundary, then the batters' attempted two followed by a fumble by Ferguson after the throw from the deep, and a third then tried by them. After all this, Pandya takes the ball at his end, and crashes the stumps only to give the impression that he has done that off his body instead off his hand. There are replays and relays and replays checked, and finally the Tendulkar-like voice of the third umpire says that the stumps were clipped with his foot even while the batter was miles away. So forget about the run-out. All in all, they took the three runs. Just to get back to the actual ball, it was a short of a length ball outside leg, as Pandya saw the batter make room and followed him, with Arshdeep pulling flat and with force
postText:
Once you are done getting over this piece of action, join Alan for the chase.

Vaibhav Sharma: "Arshdeep's total runs in career were two and now he's gone and quintupled that!"

Shaz: "Momentum plays a big part in t20 cricket. I'm afraid the Gujrat Titans have let it slip!"

Nalkhande: "I was nervous, but before the match, Ashish sir and Hardik bhai gave me some confidence. I am feeling good, and want to contribute. I just wanted to execute what Hardik bhai said. It is a good batting wicket and the ball is coming on nicely, so we are hoping to chase it down."

9.26pm Are Kings 20 short? Or have they managed 20 more than what they thought? After the madness of the middle order, the final pair of Arshdeep and Chahar tonks 27 off 13 balls. The last five overs stand at 37 for 4 after Livingstone and Jitesh threatened to keep pounding at will. But credit to Rashid - take nothing away from Kings' willingness to keep hitting and getting out - for Titans restricting the opposition before the final part of the fun at the end.

text: length ball on leg stump and swinging across the left-hander, 129kph, Wade is slightly squared up, edging through backward point to get off the mark first ball
preText:
Shubman Gill and Matt Wade are heading out to the middle. Vaibhav Arora, who had a great impact on debut the other day, has the new ball

You may have heard the phrase "opportunity cost" tossed around a bit at the start of the this IPL - well, Punjab Kings are the opportunity cost OGs, as evinced by another free-swinging thrash to get up above par, right down to the last pair. We'll soon find out if they've succeeded

In the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

text: short, wide and spanked! Looking for inswing but the line was wide and Gill latches on with a breezy swing through the covers
too straight and flicked fine, past the man on the edge of the circle. Arora gets taken for back-to-back boundaries

shortText: Arora to Shubman Gill, no run
text: length ball, 133kph and shaping back in, past the outside edge as Gill dangles his bat
on a length and coming back in, worked through midwicket
round the wicket, back of a length and stabbed to backward point. "No run!"
preText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: What is Hardik Pandya's strike rate against Kagiso Rabada in the IPL?
postText: Sai Charan: "Vaibhav Arora's release reminds me of another pretty good swing bowler: Praveen Kumar." Well worth a link to Sharda Ugra's TCM piece from way back

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, FOUR
text: timed down the ground past mid-on, beats the dive and it keeps on going as if on rails

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 wide
text: fired across the right-hander from over the wicket, signalled wide
preText: Arshdeep Singh from the other end

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run
text: cuts but picks out backward point

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, FOUR
text: smashed through midwicket! Arshdeep drops short and is collared on the pull

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run
text: pitched up, defended uppishly back to the bowler

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, FOUR
text: full and wide, larruped again! Gill is seeing it big already, bends the front leg and frees the hands to thrash a cut through the covers

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run
text: length ball, 132kph and sliding towards the tramlines again, cut for a single out to deep backward point
preText: Slip is out now
postText: "How's the dew situation, is it too much??" Don't think we're at the swimming pool stage yet, Nikhil V. But it may well come

text: pitched up, 132kph and punched towards mid-off, they take one
carved through the covers, Wade rocks back and gets his innings going with a meaty cut. Too much width from round the wicket from Arora
straighter, 136kph and flicked off the hip coming across, just a single to deep backward square
over the wicket, 132kph length ball on the stumps, turned quietly around the corner
on the stumps, tucked to the leg side
preText: "Gill is like Federer of cricket, easy and smooth technique," purrs Himanshu (not that one. I think). Update: my colleague Himanshu confirms he's more of a Nadal fan

text: pitched up straight from over the wicket, Wade clips to Dhawan at midwicket
slung down full on leg stump, 140kph and whipped away to deep backward square
preText:
KG Rabada, with a slip in

"Err....where is Rabada???" You asked, Kartik, you get

wkt_text: MS Wade c †Bairstow b Rabada 6 (18m 7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 85.71
text: got him, gobbled up in the corridor! Immaculate line and decking away just a fraction, Wade wants to force it off the back foot, only manages to feather through to Bairstow behind the stumps! Rabada makes the breakthrough for Kings

shortText: Rabada to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: fullish on middle and leg, tapped back
preText: Sai Sudharsan, the debutant, is next in

text: helped to the fence past short fine leg! Rabada lets go a low full toss down the leg side, just needed some bat on it
pitched up, 139kph and pinged neatly back past the bowler, mid-off comes across

shortText: Rabada to Shubman Gill, no run
text: fired in towards the blockhole, tapped back to the bowler
flicked through square leg, they thought about two but Dhawan's throw keeps them honest
preText: Third for Arora

text: short and wide, 135kph and Gill threads the gap again, clattered through point! Scrambled seam but drifting away and steered in front of the sweeper for four
preText: Here's Ashok: "What a moment for young Sai Sudarshan...Straight out of TNPL now upto facing Rabada"

text: brings it back in on a length, tucked to leg

shortText: Arora to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: pitched up in the channel and punched towards cover
fullish and ticked towards mid-off, not fielded cleanly
length ball, 132kph and shaping in, Gill works one more to mid-on
postText: "Much ado about Smith's poor batting, but with Nathan Ellis waiting to come in after his stellar showing against Pakistan, I feel Smith is really at a make or break moment with the ball," suggests David

text: short of a length outside off, 137kph and Gill pings a back-foot punch, well stopped in the covers
postText: Ram: "For the 2ng game in a row, Punjab end up with 190 after threatening to go past 220. Whatever happened to situational awareness. For their sake, I hope I don't get away with it today. "

shortText: Rabada to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: touch short outside off and nicely chopped but he picks out backward point
swatted confidently over short fine leg! Sudharsan is smoothly across and tackles the bumper with aplomb, front leg flicking up as he pirouettes on the shot
fuller, 140kph and steered through backward point for one
steps out and punches a length ball to mid-off, continues on through for the single

shortText: Rabada to Sai Sudharsan, 1 leg bye
text: skids into the pads, tucked leg side... Rabada gives up a lone appeal. Agarwal uses up almost all of the time before calling for a review. Looked like it pitched outside leg to me... Yep, by a good few inches, so Kings lose that review
postText: Sai Sudharsan was the breakout star of TNPL 2021 and then went onto win the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy with Tamil Nadu. Here's a lowdown on the 20-year-old left-handed batter

text: Sudharsan sinks six over deep midwicket! Straight out of the blocks against the leggie, plants the front foot and creams the ball high into the stands!
preText: Powerplay done with, Titans going pretty well. On comes Rahul Chahar

text: goes back and flicks with the spin to backward square leg
flattish legbreak outside off, 93kph and punched in front of the cover sweeper

shortText: Chahar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: floated up outside off, pushed to cover
goes back and forces this into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket. Livingstone goes sliding along the boundary to cut it off
rolled out on middle and leg and Gill works wristily into a gap at square leg for two more
postText: Bharti: "In form Gill is going to be the key for this run chase as the first inning was getting disturbed at regular frequency but lower order of PBKS showed really good temperament nonetheless!"

text: back of a length outside off, 133kph and sliced through point for one
preText: Odean Smith on now

text: munched over deep square leg! The bouncer got up pretty high but Gill fetched it with a cross-batted hoick, goes all the way
preText: "Who was the third umpire?" wonders Andy. "He sounded a lot like Sachin Tendulkar." Not for the first time, Pashchim Pathak is the story of the night...

shortText: Smith to Shubman Gill, no run
text: dropped! Smith can't hold on in his follow through! Came off the cue-end with Gill looking to pull, Smith got his hands to it, and then had a second go, but it bobbled free
back of a length outside off, 133kph and cut for a single
fired in straight, raps him on the back thigh with Sudharsan attempting to pull. Smith was convinced by his lbw appeal, but Agarwal goes with the umpire. Pitched outside leg again, I think
shortish and sliced through backward point
postText: Think we're having a strategic timeout, although it could also be a toilet break for one of the batters. Ah, here comes Sai Sudharsan, doing up the string on his trousers... Might have also had a timeout, too, I'm not sure

text: floats up a legbreak outside off, cut off the back foot for a couple
preText: Liam Livingstone on to bowl, Titans at 44% on win predictor

text: belted through the covers, that's fifty! Lovely shot to get there, leaning out to stroke a drive. Brings up the mark from 29 balls

shortText: Livingstone to Shubman Gill, no run
text: shout for lbw as Gill defends around his front pad. Livingstone thought it was pad first... replays suggest otherwise
crashed through backward point, four more to the Titans opener! Cut hard off the back foot, beats the fielder's dive
tucked into the leg side
round the wicket, tosses up an offbreak that Sudharsan works through the leg side
postText:
Ah, okay, now we're having the strategic timeout

Here's Sandeep: "Gill in form reminds me a lot of Kohli in his prime. Elegant, risk-free, but dynamic."

text: dug in, 139kph and Sudharsan miscues this into the on side, lands safely between midwicket and long-on
back of a length outside off, cut through the inner ring for one

shortText: Smith to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: low full toss wide of the stumps, 141kph, Sudharsan swings and misses
preText: Something causing another delay here, not quite sure what. Ah, looks like some sand being applied to the footmarks on the popping crease

text: pitched up and tonked through cover! Sudharsan nails his shot, deep in the crease and makes a full 141kph delivery look like a gentle half-volley

shortText: Smith to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: round the wicket, fizzes through in the channel as he loses his shape looking to cut

shortText: Smith to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: short of a length, 137kph on fifth stump, chopped into the turf through to the keeper
postText: This chase is beautifully poised, 51% in favour of Titans according to win predictor. Himanshu is back to see it through

text: pretty full ball on middle, and nudged towards deep midwicket. They steal two there after great running
preText: Chahar has the ball now

shortText: Chahar to Shubman Gill, no run
text: much fuller on middle still, and he jam the bat down to get that back to the bowler
short of a length on middle, and pulled on the bounce to deep square leg
short and wide of off, and turning away. He has to reach out for that to slash to deep point, and he wanted a second too before he was sent back
short and wide of off, and hammered for four to deep point! Cuts that hard and fast to beat a diving deep point to his right. Gill on song
postText: Looks like Jitesh, the fielder there, has hurt himself while diving on the boundary

text: short again and outside off. Turns away, as he slaps to deep point
preText: And so on comes a sub fielder right away

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run
text: bowls on back of a length on off from wide of the crease. The ball angles into the batter, as it is clipped to deep midwicket
preText: Arsh returns. Around the wicket.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: much fuller length on middle, and again coming into him a touch. Goes to flick but the ball hits his pad
preText: Over the wicket to the left-hander
postText: Alex: "I guess these two will carry GT to win in the 19th over." --- Forecast No. 2 for the day?

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: change of pace, and beaten. On a short of a length outside off, as Sudharsan pulled but missed

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Sai Sudharsan, 1 leg bye
text: makes room, and the bowler follows. Bowls a yorker way outside leg, as Sudharsan tries to flick but the ball balloons off the pad for a leg-bye to the off side
postText: Vijay S: "Perfect platform set up. Now it's time for Sai to pick up the pace given the batting that can follow. "

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, FOUR
text: swats that between long-on and deep midwicket! Waits for the slower ball to come to him, as it was also short on off. There was good bounce there too, as he rammed that late

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run
text: nearly  a yorker on off this time. Gill presents the full face of the bat to drill that to long-off
makes room and skips down the pitch, as the ball is on a back of a length outside off. Punched to deep point
preText:
Arora back from over the wicket

Required rate exactly 10 an over now. Titans still ahead with nine wickets in hand you would guess?

text: follows the batter to go on a shortish length outside leg, as Sudharsan is backing away. Pulled to deep square leg after almost being cramped for room
preText: Stays over the stumps to the left-hander

text: crashed for four to deep extra cover! Flat, fast and furious. A back of a length outside off, and he swats that powerfully to beat cover to his right and deep point to his left
good length ball on middle, as he closes the bat face to clip to deep square leg
pulls for a single to deep midwicket. A slower ball on a short of a length on middle and leg, and angling into him. He gets Gill back on strike
on a hard length on off. Again Gull clips happily to deep backward square leg
preText: Kartik: "Gill auditioning for 2022 T20 WC?"
postText: That rings in the time-out

text: full delivery on off, and flicked to deep square leg rather nonchalantly. They scamper two more
preText:
Rabada is back from over the wicket.

71 to get off 42. Both teams must be quietly discussing that the game remains in the balance. Titans need at least one boundary every over from here, something which Gill can well and truly provide. But just two quick wickets, and Kings will be happy seeing the required rate spiral.

Sandy_SG: "Can see a Shubman 100 coming with Hardik hitting the winning runs today!"

text: pulls his length back to go on a good length on off. A little clip to deep square leg again
lifts that nearly miraculously! What hands there! Four to deep midwicket. Bowled with a cross seam on a length on middle, as he plays that impressively on the bounce for four
postText: Ram: "I love how Gill has evolved as a T20 batter. From playing the cute 50 off 40 knocks last year to 2 great 80 scores already at a clip of 180!!!"

text: fuller on middle and off, and flicked to long-on
short of a length on off, and pulls to deep square leg all along the ground as that makes a pleasing sound off the bat

shortText: Rabada to Sai Sudharsan, no run
text: fullish length on off, as he opens the bat face to tap to point
full ball on off, and towards deep extra cover softly. They rush for two. Quick running
preText: Chahar back from over the wicket
postText: JPR: "Classic run chase by these two youngsters. Boundary in each over of GT's innings, all risk free shots. Also not letting away RRR slip in excess. Kudos to Gill"

text: clears short third man turning around and running! Goes for the reverse sweep, but the ball is not that full on middle and leg. Gets a top edge there, and is lucky
much fuller on off, and pushed to long-off after leaning forward

wkt_text: B Sai Sudharsan c Agarwal b Chahar 35 (58m 30b 4x4 1x6) SR: 116.66
text: goes for the big one, and skies that to cover! This was a googly bowled from back of the hand on a full length outside off, and so threatened to turn away from him. Sudharsan wanted to loft over the off side, but only got height without any distance. Mayank at the edge of the extra cover circle takes that to his left after keeping his eyes on the ball all along
preText: Over the stumps to Sudharsan too

text: full ball outside off, and tapped to point after a good stride forward
preText: Chahar has a slip for Pandya. He comes from over the wicket.

text: opens the bat face a touch to nudge that full ball on off to long-off

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Pandya, no run
text: slower ball on a full length outside off, and angling in. He drives, but gets that off the inside half of the bat to the man at midwicket
preText: A quiet over by Chahar, and the required rate is now 11.20. Here comes Arsh from around the wicket.

text: pulls that to deep midwicket. That was hit hard off a short of a length on middle and off, and to the longer side of the boundary
postText: Mp: "@JPR jinxed it! First over with no boundary and a wicket."

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run
text: jams that to short third, and doesn't find the gap. Full and wide of off, and Gill can't place that well with third man in

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run
text: a near yorker just outside off, as he has to again push that late to the man at extra cover, who is placed on the periphery of the circle. Gill in the 90s

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Pandya, no run
text: good delivery. He executes that wide-ish yorker well. Around sixth stump, as Pandya has a slash but the ball is too full. He is beaten, and that is another dot

four this time! Pandya finishes it off with a boundary. Another pretty full ball outside off, but not quite a yorker. Pandya runs that down well to beat point to his left for four to third man, with no man on the fence there
full and straight. Pushed back to the bowler
missed stumping! Gill skipped down the pitch, and Chahar bowled full and wide of leg. The ball wasn't collected cleanly though, and they ran one there
slashed for four to deep point! Short and outside off, and turning away. He capitalises on the width, and sends that crashing
down the ground, and four more! This is much fuller and just outside off, as the tossed up full is sent over the bowler's head
dives to his left to stop the run off his own bowling. Good length ball on off, and punched back

top edge, and dropped by Rabada! He was running forward from fine leg, and the ball was dying on to him. He had to eventually dive forward, as the ball popped out after kissing his fingers. Short of a length ball on middle, and Pandya went for the pull only to miscue it
short in length on off again, and swatted wide of long-off. They pinch two

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Pandya, no run
text: bouncer, and that seemed to have bounced too high. Pandya wanted a wide, but not given. This rushed on to him of a short of a length on middle and off, while angling in. He wanted to pull, but swayed away in the end
postText: Bala: "Hardik has started bowling. Shubman and Prithvi have started hitting, while fringe players like Hooda, Badoni and Tilak Verma are shining. Nice headache to have for the Indian selectors to finalise the team for the England T20 tour.

text: yorker now. What a ball! Lands that really full on off, and all Pandya can do is jam that to extra cover

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 2 runs
text: slices over extra cover, as long-off runs and slides to his left to cut that off. The ball was swerving away, as Gill opened the bat face to that full ball outside off
preText: Just 1 off the first 2 balls so far... Will Gill attack now?

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run
text: another yorker on middle and off, and that is clipped to square leg. Smith throws at the keeper's end, where Pandya had given up, but the ball is wide of the stumps
preText: Gill one hit away from a hundred...

text: low full toss on off - perhaps he missed his yorker - as Pandya crashes that to long-off after getting his front leg out of the way

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run
text: goes to scoop, but he is hit on his pad after shuffling across off to this really full ball just outside off. Precious dot for Kings
low, dipping full toss on off, and lofted to long-on
preText: Free-hit at a crucial stage

text: nails that yorker on middle, as Pandya flicks that to deep backward square leg off the inside half of the bat. But... it is a no-ball
preText:
32 from 12 balls. This should be the deciding over. Rabada returns from over the wicket.

Dipanjan Show: "This match has the potential to be the first real thriller of the season!"

text: one-handed four to deep midwicket! Beats the man there to his left. A low full toss again on off, as he heaves across the line with his front leg out of the way, as he uses his bottom hand to whip that away

wide yorker, and four wide of long-off now! This is turning around now. The ball was dying on to Pandya, and was a very full length wide of off. Pandya reached out for it, and beat long-off to his left
another pretty full length outside off, and driven to deep point

wkt_text: Shubman Gill c Agarwal b Rabada 96 (96m 59b 11x4 1x6) SR: 162.71
text: taken at extra cover! Gill falls for 96. Another full toss from Rabada that is on a near yorker length which is really wide of off. Gill reaches out for it, and ends up pushing that to Agarwal placed a step closer in than what he has been today. We've seen a no-ball, then two fours this over, and now a wicket. This game nearing a twist, maybe?
full and a little wide of off. Driven aerially to long-off
preText: Miller the new man in. Rabada from over the wicket.

wkt_text: HH Pandya run out 27 (28m 18b 5x4 0x6) SR: 150.00
text: Pandya is run-out! Bairstow shatters the stumps at his end by dribbling the ball with an underarm throw to dislodge the bail on middle and leg stump. Pandya can only walk back with a little mutter to himself. It was a good length ball wide of off, as Miller had a swing at that away from his body but was beaten. They had to run - that is all Miller knew - and Pandya fell well short
wide called, and Bairstow is not happy. Good length ball pitching on middle and off, and angling away. He leaves it alone, and gets what he wanted
preText:
Over the stumps to Miller

19 off 6. Super Over anyone? Smith will bowl the last over, as Agarwal has a chat with him first.

Nithin: "How crucial partnership that was on the 10th wicket…"

text: slashes to deep point. Pretty full and wide of off, and he lofts that away from hid body
preText: Tewatia on strike. Remember what he did to Kings in 2020? Can he get just two of them away here, if not more?

text: one-bounce four to deep square leg! It was a slower ball on a shortish length on middle, and he pulled firmly there. Miller keeping them ticking here
preText: Naseef: "Heart says Miller will finish it off in Miller style!"

text: Smith misses his throw at his end, and that allows an overthrow. Tewatia wanted a run after Miller biffed the back of a length ball on off back to the bowler. Tewatia was well out when the throw came, but alas

Tewatia gets the first of those! Only just six that one! That was nearly gone. The man there at deep midwicket was falling back and even grabbed it for a second before he fell on the other side with the ball also dropping beyond the rope after it was heaved off a length on middle and leg. A clean swing, and six over deep midwicket
preText: 2 sixes to win...

text: He is a hero! Dial Tewatia for six! He looks at the dressing room with a swagger of Superman, and why not? He is pumped, chuffed and thrilled. 12 were needed off two balls - two sixes of course - and Tewatia smacks them with the calmness of Bevan, Dhoni and Klusener combined. Walks across off, and nails that slog-sweep off a full length wide of off beyond long-on
postText:
That was a breathtaking finish; maybe just another day in the office for Tewatia though. 19 to win off the last over? Done. 12 to get off 2 balls? Surely, he says. Brace yourself up for a double-header Saturday as you try to sink in what just happened, as we bid you goodbye for the day. Take care!

Bala: "Kings are known to have lost many close games. This one is an addition to the list of "must have won""

Shreyas HM: "Not just the overthrow. The first ball of the over was possibly not a wide too." --- Are you planning to open a pandora's box?

Tewatia Gill is the Player of the Match: "It's important to keep the scoreboard ticking. The outfield is really rapid... It's just about execution. It's just one of those days when I was hitting the ball well. Trust me, I am hitting it very hard from my own power! It might not feel like that, but I am doing my level best. Me as an opener is important to bat through the innings. You go to nets and try to practice... We all are really tired, and it'll take us an hour to get back to the hotel."

Pandya has managed to realise they have won: "The kind of ups and downs happen, I think I have now become used to. It was Kings' game; some sympathy for them losing this. Gill has been telling everybody that he is there. A lot of credit goes to Sai as well. Body is coping all right; I am getting tired obviously. As the games come, I'll be getting better."

Time for the presentations

Vinay: "this is the first time 12 scored of last 2 balls to win a game in ipl, right?" --- You ask, and our stats hero Shiva Jayaraman delivers. There have been three previous instances of two sixes being hit off the last two balls to win a game in T20s where data is available. The last time this happened was in 2019, with Nishan Peiris sending Anuk de Alwis all the way. Before that, it was Dhoni hitting Axar for two in two in 2016.

Hus Silverado : "PBKS and a Windies Bowler against Tewatia...The result was obvious!!!" --- Ding dong!

Viswa: "That overthrow lost the match for Punjab. Miller was struggling"

The hero of the milennium Tewatia: "Amazing feeling. There was nothing to think! Just go there and hit sixes, that's what me and David where thinking. I planned against Smith... The last ball was off the middle of the bat, and I knew it was six. The first ball he bowled was wide outside off, and so I thought the last ball was going to come there too. Staff is really chilled here. They just tell us practice hard..."

James Iyer: "That's the way to win a cricket match!"

Agarwal after having to swallow that: "It was a tough game, but we fought heard. We were five-seven runs short... We did really well to get ourselves to that score, so we were really happy with that. Last over could have been anybody's game; we totally back Odean. It's all right; it's just a game of cricket. The talk in the group is we back the guys."

11.30pm How many bet on that? 12 to win off 2, and two sixes required. Tewatia lives a dream. He turns the clock back, and how! Who knew what would have been had Kings not conceded that overthrow? Miller wasn't really looking in great touch - plus there was the Pandya run-out - and Tewatia looked in the mood. What a game here! Gill's 96 set it up, young Sudharsan contributed too, and Titans remain unbeaten.

text: fullish length on the pads and squirted away, well chased down by AJ Tye in front of the rope at deep midwicket. Did brilliantly to flick it back before crashing into the boundary marker
preText:
Jason Holder has the new ball

Right, here come the DC openers, including Davey Warner back in blue (plus a natty splash of red). Let'ssssssssss get reaaaaaaaaaaady to rummmm-bllllllllllllllllllle!

"@Geetha James Hildreth is currently on 64 but we all know that the English selectors would rather have a heart attack than pick him..." There there, AlistairDiamond. Probably time to let that one go. Poor Hildy beast...

7.25pm: Hello, hello. Yes, it's a big day indeed - and with all due respect to game 15 of the 2022 IPL, I will have half an eye on the scores in the County Championship. As for your question Geetha... I don't think Cook's enduring class tells us much we don't already know (ie. the English game doesn't make them like it used to). Runs for Nick Browne might mean something, although at 31 you suspect his England chance has gone

Anyway, back to the IPL. Any Graeme Napier fans in the house?

7.20pm Geetha: "A quick red-ball game comment before the white ball game starts. Alastair Cook chugs along to another 50 for Essex, while the English cricket team struggles across the world. What does that say of the English red ball game?" --- I'll let Alan Gardner take that question before he jumps into T20 mode

7.15pm Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: What is Rishabh Pant's strike-rate against legspin since IPL 2020?

3 games, 3 wins, 11 goals. The Indian women's junior hockey team have already stunned favourites Germany in the World Cup. How will they fare against South Korea in the quarterfinal? Find out here.

7.10pm For the lucky ones in the US: You can watch the match LIVE on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

7.05pm Tune into T20 Time Out with Carlos Brathwaite and Wasim Jaffer

DC: Prithvi Shaw, David Warner, Rishabh Pant (capt&wk), Rovman Powell, Sarfaraz Khan, Lalit Yadav, Axar Patel, Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Mustafizur Rahman, Anrich Nortje

LSG: KL Rahul (capt), Quinton de Kock (wk), Evin Lewis, Deepak Hooda, Ayush Badoni, Krunal Pandya, Jason Holder, Krishnappa Gowtham, AJ Tye, Ravi Bishnoi, Avesh Khan

Jayant Isswani: "Finally we get to see Delhi batting first. Hope this frees up the likes of Prithwi Shaw, Rishabh Pant and Rowman Powell as they discover their form back!"

7pm LSG win the toss and choose to bowl first vs full-strength DC

Rahul: Can't really think of a reason, but it's a fresh wicket and we can know what to chase. One change: Manish unfortunately misses out and Gowtham comes in. The chat has been about forgetting what happens [last game] - whether we win or lose. Everyone is fresh and pumped to be out in the middle.

Pant: I think we would have bowled first as this is our first look at this pitch. We have three changes: Warner for Tim Seifert. Safaraz for Mandeep and Nortje for Khaleel.

Prashant Vats: "Interesting choice by DC on including Sarfaraz. Wonder whom they left out?If it is Mandeep, then I would have liked to include KS Bharath instead of Sarfaraz."

6.55pm "There is quite a bit of grass on it, but it looks fairly even," according to Graeme Swann. "If you look at the way spinners have bowled, there is just enough to beat the outside edge. Don't be surprised if you see spinners bowl straight today. It should be a very good pitch." Toss in five minutes. Teams will be wary of the asymmetric square dimensions

Gokul: "Interesting to see how Avesh Khan will approach against his former team."

mohit: "If Stoinis is available, then I'll drop Manish for Gowtham. Promote Stoinis to 3 and Gowtham can bat at number 8 with an additional bowling option."

6.49pm Warner gets his maiden Delhi Capitals cap from Ricky Ponting, his first captain at Australia and now head coach at the IPL. Shane Watson, meanwhile, hands Sarfaraz Khan his first DC cap. Sarfaraz has been tearing up the Ranji Trophy either side of the pandemic. Can he come good in the shortest format too?

Sanket: "Interesting to see How long LSG will stick with Manish Pandey who is seems to be really bad patch. Because of Manish batting at the top, the in-form middle order of Hooda, Badoni, Krunal and even Holder are not getting enough balls to make a greater impact with the bat."

6.40pm If you're into fantasy cricket, here are some expert tips from Wasim Jaffer and Chris Lynn

sanket: "Who goes out if Nortje comes in, Khaleel really bowled well despite not much too show for it and he bowled better than what Shardul did but Shardul provides a bit of depth to this not so experienced lower order."

Kev: "@Mustafa, DC right now seems to be a balanced side... Kohli forever RCB, Rohit the eternal hit-man for MI, Shreyas Iyer left out by DC now found in sync with KKR, Jaddu forever CSK, KL not going anywhere but LSG, Same for Hardik with GT, Sanju a loyal Royal, I dont know who gets more love at SRH- Birayni or KW... Only existing captain that can plug the hole in DC line up would be to include Mayank at No. 3 in the batting line-up...!!!"

Ganesh Kumar: "Warner vs Bishnoi. The contest everyone is looking for tonight. " --- Pant vs Bishnoi could also be fun

Sanket: "Having Warner at the top will surely give a lot of strength to this DC line up, but still their middle order looks really fragile. They need to get Mandeep out and have KS Bharat or Yash Dhull or even play Sarfaraz and Roman Powel need to step up for his reputation."

Aditya: "@Mustafa well, judging by the pattern of teams, It may be Kane Williamson! :P"

mohit: "@Mustafa Moudi, answers lie in your question.With KXIP and RR's love for their captains(or lack of), my money is on Sanju or Mayank to feature for DC. The fun fact is both of them already represented DC(then DD)."

Mahesh: ""This game is exciting to start with in terms of selection conundrum. Both teams have exciting players like Warner, Stoinis, and Nortje available to play""

6.30pm Rishabh Pant vs KL Rahul. Two superstars of Indian cricket will be up against each other this evening in IPL 2022, but the contest could be decided by the talent around them. This is a chance for Delhi Capitals and Lucknow Super Giants to move to the top half of the points table, where five teams are locked with four points. David Warner and Marcus Stoinis could be available for selection for Capitals and Super Giants respectively. The seamers have owned the powerplay in the early exchanges of the league. Can the blockbuster pair of Warner and Shaw buck the trend? I'm Deivarayan Muthu and I'll be joined by Alan Gardner to bring you all the thrills and spills from the DY Patil Stadium.

Mustafa Moudi : "Fun Fact: Maxwell Captained KXIP in 2017, Delhi got him next season. Then Ashwin Captained KXIP in 2018, Delhi got him next season. Rahane Led RR in 2019, Delhi got him next year. Smith led RR in 2020, Delhi got him next season. Warner led SRH last season and now he will be playing for DC. Looking at DC's love to acquire captains, I only wonder who, among the 9 existing Captains, will be playing for DC next season ??"

text: length on off stump, Warner leans out and defends, accompanied by a growl of "Wait onnnnnnnn!"
preText: Still a slip in

text: back of a length, jumps across and blocks into the off side
extra bounce for Holder, climbing up around the ribs as Warner fends off towards square leg for his first run
touch short outside off, Shaw dabs towards backward point with an open bat face
short, holding its line as Shaw jumps across, connects well with his pull but only succeeds in picking out midwicket
postText: "How long before ECB gets desperate and asks Cook to do an Afridi (Shahid not Shaheen)? He's still churning runs out..." Could definitely do a job, Anand

text: round the wicket, angled in flat and tapped down
preText: Spin in the powerplay - in defiance of the prevailing trends. K Gowtham bowling with a slip to Warner

text: flat off break and he drops back to work one into the leg side
slashed through the covers, floated up outside off, no real turn and Shaw just hits through the line
straighter, prodded away in front of the stumps

rockets off the edge, Holder takes evasive action! Huge, windmilling hoick at a length ball from Shaw, and it flies high and to the left of slip, who barely sees it. Holder was just looking to avoid a ball in the mouth
fires this down at 96kph outside off, swing and a miss from Prithvi
postText: Here's Ashish: "Shaw will be the aggressor today. He has had a quiet IPL till now. He might break the shackles today."

text: sliced up and over cover, Lewis can't quite get to the chance running back! Aggression from Warner but it's nearly his undoing
smashed! Short ball, 125kph and Shaw steps out to greet it, baseball batting the ball flat through midwicket
cleaned out over deep midwicket! Back of a length, nothing ball and right in the arc ffor Shaw to unleash more cross-batted pongo
pitched up and there's some outswing for Holder here, prodded away
bouncer, clears Shaw as he looks to ramp. Slower ball, in fact... and called wide on height. Holder not happy
back-of-the-hand slower ball, dipping wide of off, dug out towards cover point
pace off again, driven to the man on the edge of the circle at cover
another slower ball, disappears down the leg side
preText: "Not only Cook's classy batting, but also his calmness was so amazing. Never looked in hurry or anger." Aagam is keeping the Champo chat going. Good lad

shortText: Avesh Khan to Shaw, no run
text: starts well, 139 clicks in the channel, nibbles back inside Shaw's flailing attempt to hit down the ground
preText: Just one over for Gowtham, and one comes Avesh Khan

text: boshty from Prithvi! Length ball, slightly wider line and he can swing the arms, thrashed mercilessly between two men in the covers
width again and carved in front of deep third! Tad fuller but he's got time to adjust and guide it off the back foot
flashes hard, gets four more to third! The man back had been moved but again Avesh serves it up wide of off, and is punished
short into the body, swatted out in front of square for one. Warner was pushing, Shaw not interested
preText: Deep square leg and fine leg are out

shortText: Avesh Khan to Warner, no run
text: back of a length on the stumps, defended down to the leg side

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Shaw, no run
text: over the wicket, fizzed down outside off at 102kph. Shaw tamps down in it
preText: Ravi Bishnoi on now. Sip is in

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Shaw, no run
text: pushed through outside off, cut firmly but straight to backward point
spanked through point - literally! Gowtham gets his fingertips singed by a rasping cut for four

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Shaw, no run
text: flattish outside off and cut again, this time Gowtham fields
preText: "Shaw has gone off the radar a bit," reckons Pankaj, "needs a few good scores to get back in the reckoning... could learn from Sir Alistair Cook"

text: tossed up and punched down to long-off

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Warner, no run
text: pushed through from over the wicket, possibly a wrong'un, Warner pokes it back
preText: This could be the match-up LSG are after - Bishnoi has dismissed Warner twice from four balls previously

text: back of a length outside off, mistimed into the covers
preText: Andrew Tye for the final powerplay over

text: fuller, 131kph on fourth stump, Shaw looks to go down the ground and ends up chipping it off the toe of the bat, just about clears mid-on and mid-off running back
struck amidships! Back of a length and skidding on as Shaw looks to pull. Takes a blow squarely on his fourth stump
postText: After a moment or two to regain his composure, Shaw's ready to go

text: crunched over backward point, Shaw responds to that painful blow with one of his own! Touch short, 137kph and he opens the shoulders to carve it away
postText: Fifty up for DC, Shaw doing all the running

text: slower ball on the stumps, nudged to leg
back of a length outside off, Warner opens up with a crisp cut, but can't get it through
postText: "Shaw has been farming the strike. Hope that does not fluster Warner." I'm sure he's seen it all before, Sumith

text: pushed through on the stumps, tucked to deep midwicket going back
preText: Powerplay done, DC going nicely (well, Shaw certainly is). Krunal Pandya on

text: fired into the pitch, 92kph and swung away on the pull, just one to wide long-on
preText: Kalyanaraman: "AlistairDiamond, when you said 'James Hildreth is currently on 64', I thought he is quite old to come into Test cricket, but then quickly checked to see that he is only 37 ! apologies!! "

text: skiddy trajectory, maybe an arm ball and it does Shaw on the inside, deflecting off the pads. Heading down leg, though
makes room and slices a couple more through point, brings up Shaw's fifty! Eleventh time he's done so in the IPL
angled in straight and flicked around the corner
tossed up, Warner bunts it back to the bowler. Still searching for some rhythm in his first outing, is Davey
launched over long-off! Dances down and hurls the bat through the line, creaming the offie waaaaaaay back over his head
preText: K Gowtham is back

text: smoked! Floated up outside off and Shaw cracks it through cover. Just opens the face a little, beats deep point running around

wkt_text: PP Shaw c †de Kock b Gowtham 61 (37m 34b 9x4 2x6) SR: 179.41
text: nicks him off! Gowtham changes the angle, gets a bit of extra bounce, and makes the breakthrough for LSG! Round the wicket, Shaw went back to cut, but a fat top edge nestled in de Kock's gloves. Prithvi 100 walks slowly from the field, won't be getting 100 today
preText: "Are Warner and Shaw playing the same game? Same pitch?" Different gravy, Matthew Vincent

text: over the wicket, tossed up slower outside off, Powell plays over the top of it
preText: Rovman Powell is up the order at No.3

text: pushed through and tapped down from the crease
darted, 97kph outside off, Powell taps it into a gap in the cover to get going
postText: "Well played Mr. Vincent !!!" hoots Raja Muthu

text: fires this in straight, skids into the pads... maybe some inside edge?
preText: Bishnoi is back

text: flat legbreak on middle and off, worked ton leg for one

wkt_text: DA Warner c Badoni b Ravi Bishnoi 4 (42m 12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33
text: Bishnoi's got him again! Third time in six balls in T20... and Warner's lengthy-but-unproductive stay is over! Went back looking to cut one angled across him, but only managed a limp top edge to short third. Looking at the replay, Warner made the tiniest motion to change his grip, so Bishnoi threw in a wide googly
preText: Here's Ed: "So good to see David Warner getting game time at Delhi, I always thought that Sunrisers didn't play him enough, as Matthew Hayden would say, 'one man's trash is another man's treasure'..."
postText:
Rishabh Pant is in at No.4

With that wicket, the umpires signal for a strategic timeout. Here's the Warner vs Bishnoi match-up courtesy of AskCricinfo. One-sided

postText: "I'd be surprised to not see Vincent's and Ed's names in the MVP section after the match," chuckles VL

nicely bowled, bit of flight and grip, beats the outside edge

text: reaches out and steers into a gap
round the wicket still to the right-hander, nudged down and Gowtham runs after it

tossed up and Pant nurdles off his pads into the leg side as Gowtham again gives chase

postText: Right, halfway through, here's Deiva once again

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Pant, 1 leg bye
text: sliding into the pads at 103.3ks, Pant can't get hold of the flick. Leg bye
preText: Thanks, Alan. Hello again, everyone. Powell doesn't like starting against spin although he's improved after working with Robert Samuels, Marlon's elder brother and West Indies Women's assistant coach. Ravi Bishnoi has dragged LSG back into the game with his angle and wrong'uns. Gowtham has also kept it tight to Powell and Pant so far.

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Powell, no run
text: fizzing wrong'un from a short of a length, Powell wears it on his thigh pad, having missed the pull

wkt_text: R Powell  b Ravi Bishnoi 3 (14m 10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 30.00
text: Another wrong'un. Another wicket for Bishnoi and he celebrates this with a big roar. Googly from over the wicket, fizzing in to hit off stump. Powell has a roundhouse swipe to the leg side and fails to touch the ball in the end. LSG are well and truly back into the contest

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Khan, no run
text: Sarfaraz presses forward to defend this full googly sliding into off
preText: Sarfaraz vs Bishnoi

text: tossed up full and outside off, allows the batter to stretch out and drive it with an open face to the right of sweeper cover
pushed through flatter and quicker, googly from Bishnoi. Sarfaraz dares to reverse-sweep from the stumps and places it fine of short third man for a timely boundary for DC
postText: KedarKshirsagar: "First boundary for a non-Shaw player today." --- Good spot

text: short dart, skidding through outside off and beating Pant on the cut. Some extra bounce for Gowtham
sliding on outside off, chopped straight to short third man
pushed through on middle, forward and drilled to extra-cover
sliding in at off from round the stumps, inside-edged to the leg side

postText: Mayank Shekhar: "Warner, Powell and Pant have made a combined 10 of 35 balls. That's less than 2 an over for 6 overs from 3 of the premium T20 batters."

text: dinked into the vacant midwicket region for one
pitched up on off, sort of stops on the batter, chipped in front of Tye
preText:
AJ Tye is back into the attack. ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster reckons that DC will reach 149. Andy Bichel, LSG's bowling coach, says Stoinis is undergoing quarantine at the hotel

Sai: "Looks like Pant plays differently when he is captaining the side. He is not the same flamboyant free flowing basher anymore."
postText: Saurabh Mantri: "Gowtham: Gave 4 runs in 16 balls, after Shaw 's back to back 4 and 6. Amazing comeback"

text: dug in short and outside off, Sarfaraz aims for the ramp, but does not connect in the end
slower bouncer, aimed at the body, 116ks, flapped away to deep midwicket

Run-out chance missed? Back of a length and angling across off, another slower ball, sliced away to short third man for an urgent single. Tye breaks the stumps before even collecting the ball. Replays indicate it was a chance
Sarfaraz goes for the lap-sweep and tickles it done to fine leg
slower yorker from Tye, pushed wide of off, squeezes underneath the bat

text: Pant stays back to this full one that dips at middle, and wafts it down to long-off

preText: Tushar: "I don't like Pant and Hardik being given captaincy roles by their IPL franchises. Captaincy will naturally kill off their natural aggressive instinct, converting them to more calculated, cautious, more responsible players. This may bode well for their franchises, but not for Team India."

text: near yorker-length delivery pushed wide of off, chopped wide enough of short third man for a single
marginally too full on middle, Pant camps back, swings for the hills and swishes it away to the cover fence
slower dipper on off stump, jabbed away to the left of sweeper cover with an open bat-face
Tye searches for a yorker, comes out as a low full-toss outside off. Pant sizes it up and pumps it away straight of long-off for four
Tye goes for another yorker. Marginally misses his mark. Pant doesn't quite get underneath the length, but manages to slice it over Tye's head for six
wide full-toss, Pant reaches out for the ball and scythes it away only as far as extra-cover
postText: Ashish: "Looks like Avesh will not get another over today. This is poor from Rahul the captain. Just cos your bowler had 1 bad over you can't keep him off totally. Avesh has been the best bowler of this IPL till now."

text: wide yorker from Tye, finishes just inside the tramline, as Pant can't touch it
lifter angled across off, sails across to de Kock, wide called
preText: Nazir: "Ahem''15. 3 Pant-astic shottttt!!! ''"

text: sliced over long-off for another six. The attempted yorker goes wrong for Tye again. Marginally overpitched and outside off, Pant sits back and launches it down the ground
full and wide of off, with third man up inside the circle, Sarfaraz slashes and sends an outside edge flying over that infielder for four
preText: Avesh is back after conceding 13 in his first over earlier in the evening

text: low full-toss outside off, Avesh misses his yorker, but not by a long margin. Sarfaraz makes it look a whole lot worse by pumping it over mid-off
bouncer outside off, slower ball into the pitch, hauled away to wide long-on
another slower variation outside off, Avesh hits a hard length, Pant drags it down to long-on
back of a length and outside off, another slower ball, which is heaved away to the left of deep midwicket
postText: Mudit: "Will disagree with the crowd and say Pant has played this really well so far, great maturity. Not much batting to come after this, if he got out 4-5 overs ago, DC would have struggled to put anything worthwhile up. "

text: another slower ball into the DY Patil pitch, Avesh hides it away from Sarfaraz's swinging arc. Plinked down to long-on
fullish and just a shade outside off, Sarfaraz aims for a reverse-sweep but can only get it to the right of de Kock. Leg-bye
pretty full and Holder takes it away from Pant, asking him to reach out. Sliced in the air, but lands in front of deep third man
postText: Sarthak : "@Mudit wdym by "not much batting left".. Lalit Axar and Lord are all in dugout waiting.. they all are proven batters and good strikers of the ball"

text: slower offcutter veering down the leg side. Brushes the pad on its way to the keeper
pitched-up delivery on the pads, picked up and whipped away to the left of long leg
full and into middle and leg, thrashed down to long-on
lifter, angling across off, slower one into the pitch. Pant slog-pulls at it and winds up top-edging it over the keeper's head
low full-toss outside off, Pant opens the face and drives to Krunal at sweeper cover
another low full-toss outside off, dragged down to long-on off the inner half
preText: Rahul has a chat with Avesh

text: helicoptered away to the left of deep midwicket. Avesh misses another yorker. It comes out as a full-toss outside off, picked up and whipped with a flourish, placed wide of the outfielder

postText: Sanket: "It's surprising despite Avesh's amazing form from last year Rahul doesn't show lot of faith in him. Even in last game his double wicket over changed the game but here he is bowling one over short."

text: near yorker outside off, Pant looks to helicopter it away over the leg side once again. This time he connects only with a whole lot of thin air

text: wide yorker, stabbed back to Avesh

postText:
Watch T20 Time Out Live with Carlos Brathwaite and Wasim Jaffer

9.13pm Delhi Capitals have been restricted to 149 for 3, despite Shaw's opening salvo. He rattled off nine fours and two sixes during his 34-ball 61, but the rest of the batting line-up struggled. Here's K Gowtham speaking to Star Sports: "Feels good, making a comeback to the IPL. Feels good to bowl in partnership with Ravi. It's about mixing the pace and you can't bowl one pace. We communicated it to the bowlers. Some [balls] are holding in the surface. I think there were some jitters; I haven't played much in the last three years, so I would take that as a learning and will move forward. I'll learn from my mistakes." Alan will be back with you for the start of LSG's chase.
