preText: Paras: "KL Rahul has carried the jinx to LSG from KXIP"
postText:
11.55pm That's all we have for you from this game. Thanks for your company and comments. This is Deivarayan Muthu signing off on the behalf of Alan Gardner and P Ranjith. Stay safe and good night.

Rahul: I think we were brilliant [with the ball], but powerplay is something we have to work on. We showed a lot of character but after the powerplay, the bowlers had a good chat and knew what lines and lengths to bowl and executed well. We just like to know what to chase. Dew factor does play on the minds of team and everyone chooses to bowl first because of that. Last game there wasn't much dew here and we got lucky. Today, there was a lot of dew and I think everyone likes chasing. Badoni has held his nerve everything he has gone into bat. Obviously, great learning for him and it's important for him to keep working hard and stay humble.

de Kock, Player of the Match: I just play what is put in front of me. It was a chaseable score but we made sure not to get too ahead of ourselves. We just wanted to keep wickets in hand. Obviously, Prithvi made it look easy and I also felt the wicket was a bit low and slower balls were gripping. It was a matter of playing straightish.

11.35pm Third win in four games for Lucknow Super Giants. It was set up by their bowlers who restricted Capitals to 149 for 3, despite Shaw's 34-ball 61. De Kock hit a half-century in LSG's chase but they stumbled thereafter and only managed to finish it off in the last over.

Pant: Obviously when the dew is like that, you can't complain. But as a batting unit, we were 10-15 runs short. We just wanted to give our 100% till the last ball of the 40th over. I think the powerplay was fine, but the main game changed in the middle overs. The spinners bowled well, but we were 10-15 runs short.

Sancasm: "This new guy - Badoni is going to be a huge name in India's white-ball cricket very soon. Temperament, shots, class, attitude - all in one package. Very excited for India's AB."

Jay: "Who would have thought that? Only Gujarat Titans is the unbeaten team till now!"

Vikas: "Badoni making a mark every single time he comes out to bat."

Afeef: "Badooonniiii finishes it off in style!!!"

text: zippy line and length, skidding through at the top of off stump, and squeezed away uncomfortably via an inside-edge... probing!
preText:
7.27pm Here come the umpires, and out come KKR, with Pat Cummins back in the fold after his impressive feats in Pakistan with Australia. Rohit Sharma takes guard, with Ishan Kishan looking on. Umesh Yadav has the new ball. Let's play some cricket!

7.22pm We're five or so minutes from the start. A glance at the current IPL table is a bit disorientating... RR on top, and MI and CSK without a win between them in five. At least Sunrisers are in a familiar role...

Doosra: "Andrew as usual you open a Pandora's box! Darren Stevens could well be the most expensive IPL player if he bothered to show up. The man is a legend!!"

Dimkesh: "I believe your reply was precisely what Disbelief wanted to hear when he asked that, Andrew." I aim to please...

In the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

7.15pm Evening all. Let's get cracking, shall we? Cummins vs Rohit? That'll whet the appetite nicely... before I pop down to Chelmsford tomorrow to watch Alastair Cook vs Darren Stevens in the County Championship opener!

Disbelief: "Andrew, you gotta be kidding.. Cook vs Stevens. Will it match the excitement of teams getting bowled out in 20 overs? :)" Have you watched English cricket lately?

With the action not far away, here comes Miller firing on all cylinders.

Udit: "They had 9 bowling options last game too, but what is more important is that, they have an extra batter in the form of Cummins! Umesh and Varun's small cameo with the bat last game would also keep the tail up and wagging! "

7.10pm Here's the new arrival Cummins who speaks to the host broadcaster: "Feeling good. It's been ten days since we finished our last Test match. I am happy to play my role. Hopefully, I can add something whatever phase it is. [On match-ups in T20s] It helps having played against other people... You get a good feeling of their strengths. That helps. Shreyas is a great operator. I'll be ready to help anyone in any way I can."

Adarsh: "Wow! KKR have 9 bowling options in their today's playing XI, excluding Rahane and Billings" --- A dream XI in every sense of the term!?

Mumbai Indians: 1 Rohit Sharma (capt), 2 Ishan Kishan (wk), 3 Suryakumar Yadav, 4 Tilak Varma, 5 Kieron Pollard, 6 Dewald Brevis, 7 Daniel Sams, 8 M Ashwin, 9 Tymal Mills, 10 Basil Thampi, 11 Jasprit Bumrah

Kolkata Knight Riders: 1 Ajinkya Rahane, 2 Venketash Iyer, 3 Shreyas Iyer (capt), 4 Nitish Rana, 5 Sam Billings (wk), 6 Andre Russell, 7 Sunil Narine, 8 Pat Cummins, 9 Umesh Yadav, 10 Varun Chakravarthy, 11 Rasikh Salam

7pm The coin is up… and Knight Riders opt to bowl. Iyer says they are comfortable to chase with "a set target in mind". He confirms two changes: Cummins for Southee, and Rasikh for Mavi. Rohit says he would have batted anyway. Suryakumar for Anmolpreet, and Brevis for David are Mumbai's changes.

Meanwhile, Dewald Brevis will be Mumbai's debutant.

Sanket: "MI may consider replacing thampi with unadkat and sams with Meridith. Yes this may make thier batting relatively weak but they need to have strong options to back bumrah otherwise it really doesn't matter how much you score if you don't have good bowling department to defend like we have seen with RCB over the years"

Rasikh Salam's debut for Knight Riders is confirmed.

Piyush: "Mumbai can make a tactical change by playing Dewald Brevis (by replacing Tim David) as Brevis is a good player of spin so he can be the one alongside SKY to play off the spin duo of KKR (Narine, Varun)"

Deep Dasgupta says it is a fresh pitch in play today, which means the dimensions have changed too. He expects pace and bounce to again have a say, and there is also "a lot of live grass", as he confirms while patting on the pitch.

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Andre Russell vs Kieron Pollard - strike rates at the death (since 2018).

Sam: "KKR have seriously good momentum and MI have the opposite, about time David and Goliath (Pollard) fire."

6.55pm Five minutes to the toss. What changes in the XIs are you expecting? The golden boy is up and ready after all; so is the blooming batter with whom his franchise is happy to be flexible.

Mahesh: "Teams like MI and CSK are finding it hard to win a game. It has been that kind of IPL. MI will be desperate to get a win today"

Mustafa Moudi : "Since Iyer coined the term Swimming Pool, that match and then the last match (RCB vs RR) were won by chasing sides while all matches in between were lost by chasing sides. Iyer had successfully jinxed the Dew!!"

6.45pm Does Pat Cummins walk straight into Knight Riders' XI? Who misses out if he is in? And should Mumbai replace Thampi with Unadkat? Our experts Ravi Shastri and Brathwaite answer.

Sanket: "I am really looking forward to see Narine and Varun vs Tilak Verma. Tilak played really well in the last game but there was some fragility in the way he played spin. The footwork wasn't precise and eventually Ash got him so this is going to be cracking contest."

Meanwhile, there is just enough time before the toss for you to finalise your fantasy teams. Our in-house expert Carlos Brathwaite suggests Shreyas Iyer is the man to root for tonight.

6.40pm As Shashank Kishore's preview states, the return of Suryakumar and Cummins is expected to add spice in today's contest, as an in-form Knight Riders eye the top spot while Mumbai search for their first win.

6.30pm 22-7. That's Mumbai Indians' record against Kolkata Knight Riders so far. But then, Mumbai are winless - and No. 8 in the points table right now - unlike Knight Riders, who are - a little lopsidedly - placed at No. 2 with two wins out of three. This is Himanshu saying hello to all, with the animated Andrew Miller set to join me soon.

text: on the back foot, and dabbed back down into the crease, and nearly played on...
swinging delivery, very full again, inside-edged down into the crease once more, this is an intense opening gambit!
a scamper to the pitch, and a wild slash across the line to the leg side, Rohit scuffs his way off the mark

shortText: Yadav to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: back of a length to the left-hander, Dre Russ hurtles in from square leg to cut off the single

shortText: Yadav to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: stretching onto the front foot, head right over the ball, and blocked to cover with a big stride. That's a mighty over to open his account
postText: VinayMudunuru: "The reason mega auctions are exciting is the transitions that teams undergo .. MI has done it twice to build a powerhouse of a team and they hope to do the same. Tonight might be the beginning of it!"

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Sharma, no run
text: back of a length, open face, swinging away and poked to point
preText: Rasikh Dar to share the honours
postText: Rajkumar Lingav: "Umesh in this IPL already troubled few batsmans including Virat. It's time for him to do the same with Rohit."

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Sharma, no run
text: decent shape on his outswinger, fractionally short of a good length, but Rohit plays with respect, back through the line outside off
big inswinger! That's a well-controlled variation, lovely straight seam, hooping at a good pace back into the stumps, and fenced to leg by the watchful Rohit

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: another inswinger, or outswing to the leftie, Ishan is deep in his crease and pushing with the angle into the off side, just back of a length on this occasion

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Sharma, no run
text: width outside off on the inswinger, but kicking through at a good lick off the deck, Rohit shapes to cut but settles for a pat to cover
slower ball, tight lines, back of a length, nudged out to point, two excellent overs to launch the powerplay
postText: Afeef: "Back in 2019, Rasikh made his IPL debut playing for Mumbai Indians. Now he's bowling to his former captain."

text: back of a length, middle-and-leg line, Rohit looks for the clip to midwicket but can't time his stroke
thuds the thigh-pad on a tight line, bending into the right-hander, and they pinch the leg-bye as short backward square gathers

shortText: Yadav to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: head over the ball, solid block back down the wicket. Lovely length so far, and with the subtle swing, there are no liberties to be taken
attempted pull/paddle, not quite sure what he intended that to be! Down on one knee, flapping the bat across the line, and gloving the not-very-short-ball behind square

wkt_text: RG Sharma c †Billings b Yadav 3 (15m 12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00
text: that was coming! Rohit never looked comfortable, and now falls to Yadav for the fifth time in their IPL rivalry! Short, skidding into the pull, a spiralling top-edge, Billings calls as he runs back to fine leg, and avoids the collision as he pouches the offering!
postText: Well now. That was not the Rohit I am used to watching... What a start for KKR, and here's Brevis

text: tucked up on the back foot, sharper pace to welcome the new man, fended to the leg side to get off the mark
panned off a good length through wide long-on! Baby AB doesn't need to go 360 when he can just mosh it through the line! High and handsome for the first boundary of the night!

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Brevis, no run
text: what a riposte! Nibbling, wobbling, zagging round the outside edge, a Test-match delivery, beating the bat with aplomb!
genuine edge! And is the lack of slip a missed trick? Ball is dominating bat right now, and that just kissed off the splice with half a bat's movement... down to third man

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: swinging away from the leftie, who leans into his stroke and is beaten outside off

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: fuller length, into the pads, clipped to mid-on. This is a fine comeback from that first-ball four
another edge, wouldn't have carried, but dangles the bat outside off and picks off the single to third man. It's a struggle out there!
corker! Proud seam, perfect length, fizzing off the deck past a vertical blade. You can't lay a bat on that!
preText: Umesh for a third over. Quite right too

text: plants the front foot, and pumps on the up, over the covers. Good response to the mounting pressure
rocks back and wallops! An initial gallop to the pitch, then transfers his weight to clobber across the line, one bounce, inches short of long-on!
fierce straight punch! That's such a fine strike, but too straight for the stumps' liking. They get splattered, and Brevis is robbed of a boundary
tucked up by Umesh as he drags his length back, Umesh hurtles through in his followthrough to field, but his over-eager shy gives away extras. Full marks for commitment!

shortText: Yadav to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: zippy lines to finish, Umesh's figures take a relative dent, but that's a fine powerplay effort
postText: David Willey bowled four straight through yesterday. Wonder if there's any temptation? Meanwhile, hello Patrick, we've been expecting you..

text: full and straight, back through the line of the ball, and gathered by the bowler
shaping in on a full length, flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
postText: Siddharth: "Dewald Brevis looks like a genuine ball-smacker! He's going to go places." Brevis is the soul of wit, or something

shortText: Cummins to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: pushed across the left-hander, just back of a length, and Ishan goes fishan... just a nibble in the corridor outside off
he lands this one alright! Back of a length, a hint of room to free the arms, Kishan throws the kishan sink across the line and pumps the four through long-on
chopped to the off side, hopping into line
Brevis has a swing, and that's fizzed over the keeper's head! Banged in short, a fling of the bat, Cummins gets a dent in his first over
postText: Mitan: "The wrist flick of Brevis doe remind me of ABD. No wonder why they call him Baby AB.. :)"

text: tight lines as ever, pushed into the off side
preText: The powerplay is done, so here comes Narine

text: outside off, enough width to cut but skidding through to limit Brevis's options, third man tidies up
postText: You've already heard of Dewald Brevis, but do you really know him? Here's our profile on the young man, from how he built his game, his conversations with AB de Villiers and his favourite IPL team. Hint: it's not Mumbai!

shortText: Narine to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: flashed back through the line, Narine gathers

shortText: Narine to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: much wider on the crease from round the wicket, Ishan chases the drive but straight at cover
nurdled off the legs, and gathered at midwicket. Slim pickings so far
over the wicket, wicket-to-wicket line, Brevis sets a solid base outside leg, and clonks through the line, but can't beat the field. The stranglehold is maintained
postText: Tanstheman: "Brevis can go longis. " I like what I'm seeing so far...

text: twirled into Brevis's arc, angled onto the pads, and out roar those wrists! Plinked high and handsome off the toes, up, up and away, picking the googly and hitting with the turn
postText: Vaibhav Athalye: "By the end of this year, Baby AB is gonna have one thing that AB never got - ICC trophy" Well now ... let's see!

text: makes room to leg, creating an angle for a slap into the covers, but straight at the man
zipping through a touch faster outside off, misses a hurried cut
pushed into the crease, high-elbowed drive back into the off side. Cramped on the angle

wkt_text: D Brevis st †Billings b Varun 29 (24m 19b 2x4 2x6) SR: 152.63
text: huge swing, and off come the bails! Billings is quietly confident here, his toe seemed anchored, but it did wobble with the force of his yank across the line. Nope, in fact, it was already well out of the crease! Smart glovework, and so ends a sparky cameo
postText: mohit: "You know the hype is real when Ishan Kishan is striking at ~75 at the opposite end while you're smashing it at 170." Indeed. He's applied some humpty to an otherwise shaky innings from MI

text: leaning onto the front foot, pushed to mid-off, and that's the end of a fine opening over. Six first ball, then nothing on offer
preText: Here's SKY. It's the new-old firm for MI, back in harness, and with a job to do
postText: Himanshu : "Good innings by the young AB but this KKR bowling is relentless and MI would be happy to score 130 odd if they can. "

text: pushed through outside off, a dangle of the bat outside the eyeline and deflected to backward point
preText: Narine to continue

text: skidding through, hint of spin back into the right-hander, who adjusts late to squeeze to the off side
fuller length, into the toes, clipped with the spin through mid-on
nudges another single, just feeling his way into the innings
postText: Kalyanaraman: "Dewald Brevis innings brief is, to quote Yoda the Jedi!!"

shortText: Narine to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: stretching onto the front foot, smothering the ball outside off

shortText: Narine to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: cautious block, back foot anchored, jabs the hands into a push to cover
postText: That will be the Time Out. Here comes Himanshu for the innings' final push

text: fullish ball and quick ball turning into off. Pushed to cover with his front leg out of the way
preText:
Varun will continue from over the wicket.

Sam: "Brevis being born in 2003 is the most remarkable thing for me. A terrifying reminder of the relentless passage of time." --- I am confused: is he too young for your liking? Or are you too old?

Thanks Miller. High time for Kishan to get going, as the returnee Suryakumar starts his season.

text: turns away after pitching on a shortish length on middle and leg. Clipped to deep square leg away from his body
preText: Stays over the stumps to the left-hander Kishan

text: fuller length and straighter on off. Tucked to the man at cover with the full face of the bat
the man at cover dives to his right and gets a hand, but can't prevent the single. Another full ball on off, and this was driven hard
swept away after going down on his back knee. Beats short fine leg to his right, with the ball being full on his pads
postText: Ahmed: "We have lot of expectations from Himanshu for final push (towards MI Win)" --- I am feeling the pressure already

text: turns in now. Full length on off, as Surya has a nudge and gets the ball off the inside half of the bat to deep midwicket
fullish length in the channel outside off. Surya shuffles across a touch before pushing it back to the bowler
preText:
Cummins back. Over the wicket.

In the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

text: shorter in length, and wider of off too. He has a slash at that without any foot movement, and plays away from his body. Beaten there
and again, but this angles in before moving away. On that back of a length but closer to off, shaping to come in before Surya's cut sees the ball go above bat
good length again on off. This is tight stuff from Cummins. Surya can only slightly open the bat face to nudge to point
pushed aerially to deep point. On a back of a length and outside off again, as Surya has a poke away from his body

wkt_text: Ishan Kishan c SS Iyer b Cummins 14 (53m 21b 1x4 0x6) SR: 66.66
text: gone! Gifted to the man close in at midwicket. Kishan was struggling all this while, and he falls to Cummins for the third time in his career. On that hard length again from Cummins, and with good pace. That pitched on middle and leg, and Kishan looked to pull. But that seemed to have hurried on to him, and went bang to Shreyas, who took it in front of his stomach
preText: Over the wicket to Kishan too

text: good length ball on off. Driven off the back foot to long-on
preText: Mumbai in trouble, and in comes Tilak. But he will be off strike for now.

shortText: Varun to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full ball on off, and tapped down after leaning forward
preText: Over the wicket to Tilak
postText: Harti: "So Cummins gets his bunny :( "

shortText: Varun to Tilak Varma, no run
text: backs away, with the ball being on a good length on middle and off, and turning away. Tucked to point
closes the bat face to this fuller ball on his pads. Clipped to fine leg for two quick runs
good length ball on middle. A hint of turn away, and clipped to deep midwicket after getting deep in the crease
preText: But, but, but... There is a check for a short run, with Tilak barely - by the minimal of margins - managing to touch his bat with the crease. Short run called, and that is down to a single.

text: good length again on middle, and turning in. Surya has a slog to the on side, but misses and is struck on his back pad
on a back of a length around fifth stump. That is tapped towards point, and they set off for a rapid run
preText:
Umesh replaces Cummins. Over the wicket.

Meanwhile, Indian athlete Swapna Barman overcame pain and severe illness to win gold in heptathlon at the Federation Cup. The Asian Games gold medallist almost quit the sport last year due to her persistent injury troubles and off the field issues. But she endured difficult times with great fortitude and now aims to quit on a high note. Read her incredible story here .

text: shortish ball on off, and he pulls to deep square leg. Another single only, as Mumbai struggle to get going

shortText: Yadav to Tilak Varma, no run
text: dropped by Rahane! There seemed to be no clear calling between him and Billings, who was running forward towards the stumps at his end. Rahane went low and stretched forward to try and grab, but the ball popped out after kissing his fingers. It was a short delivery on middle, as Tilak pulled and got a top edge
postText: Caruso: "How is the second run deemed fair if the first run was a short one?" --- It is not, that is just one run there.

text: fuller length on leg, and he clips that off his pads to fine leg
slower ball, and pulled to deep midwicket! On a friendly, back of a length, and the lack of pace means Surya has a lot of time to smack this ball on off. Four runs. Can this get them going?

six over third man, and that goes 15 rows back! He leaps in the crease to ramp that shorter ball, which is a touch wide of off. Presents the full face of the bat - much like that man Sehwag did years ago - and sent that flying. The boundary there wasn't too big either, for what it's worth
postText: That's the second time-out exactly when Surya had pressed the accelerator.

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Tilak Varma, no run
text: fullish ball on middle and leg, and angling in. He tries to clip to the leg side, but the ball takes his pad to dribble to the off side
preText:
Rasikh back from over the wicket.

Right then. Seven overs to go, with Pollard due to come. Where do you see this going?

Kumar: "popup between batter and keeper ?? 10 times out of 10 it has to be a keeper catch"

Ashwin: "Very poor cricketing awareness from Rahane. It is always the keeper's catch when it is right behind the stumps. "

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: on a good length on middle and leg again, as that is half-pulled-half-dragged to deep square leg
sweeps that for four to deep backward square leg! A change of pace from Rasikh on a pretty full length and just outside off, as Surya is down on his back knee to send that away in style
postText: Afeef: "Pollard to score the fastest IPL 50 today" --- Probably the first forecast of the day?

text: another slower ball, but this time he pulls his length back and also goes wider of off. Driven to deep point with a good sound off the bat

shortText: Rasikh Salam to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: a gentle push to mid-off off this full ball on off, and they complete a rapid single
the bowler sticks his right hand out in his follow though while falling to his left, but doesn't get a hand. Surya pushed aerially at that fullish ball on off, and managed a run to mid-off
fullish length outside off, and turning in a touch. He goes to sweep, but the ball takes his front pad outside off
preText: Narine replaces Umesh, who is done for today. Over the stumps.
postText: Ruchit Vachhraj: "@Ashwin, But did the keeper call? That's what probably confused Rahane as he was expecting keeper to call and take the catch??? Not sure what happened." --- Probably the argument is that it should have been assumed to be the keeper's catch.

text: that is lofted expertly off a good length on off. He plays with high elbows, and sends that to deep point on the bounce
good, hard length on off. Whacked to long-on with a Dhoni-style whip
short of a length on off, and he pulls to fine leg with a swivel
preText: A man at deep third man for Tilak, who faces Narine from around the wicket

text: much fuller and straighter on middle and off. Swiped to deep midwicket
backs away early, and Narine bowls on a fullish length turning into the stumps. Nudged towards mid-off for another single
preText: He runs in, but doesn't bowl. Reloaded...

text: scoops over fine leg! No respect for Cummins there. On a fullish length and wide of off too, and he goes across really early to just use the pace of the bowler and send that ramping
preText:
Cummins from over the wicket

joydeepsinghgil: "As of now dropped catch by Rahane of Tilak proving effective by his strike rate"

shortText: Cummins to Tilak Varma, no run
text: makes room, with the ball being on a good length and angling away to end outside off. Has a slash, but is beaten
preText: Four men out on the leg side

text: slower ball on a short of a length outside off. He pulls to deep square leg after letting the ball come to him
change of pace again, and on a good length on middle. Cramping him for room there, as he can only pull unconvincingly to fine leg
preText:
Third man up for Surya.

RT: "Thanks for the jinx @joydeep"

text: drilled down the ground! Much fuller from Cummins on off, and he clears his front leg to have a hard go at that. Nails that between the non-striker and mid-off after playing from deep in the crease
short delivery on middle, and he swats that to long-on with a flat bat

sends that flying over deep midwicket! Tilak continuing his good season. Full length ball outside off, and he gets down to sweep that away for the maximum. Not quite middled, but the short boundary meant it was six
preText:
The run rate is above six after a while now. Ummm, something brewing? Varun returns from over the wicket.

HMody: "If they do not accelerate now then I don't know when will they?!??" --- Not to worry, they seem to have understood what you felt.

text: makes room, and slashes over cover! That's the fifty stand too. Bowled full and a little wide of off, as he backed away and tonked that over the man inside the circle's head
hoicks this fullish ball on middle and leg to deep midwicket
off the inside edge, as he looks to heave that full ball on off. A single to deep square leg, as Surya is not in control
preText: Tilak already on the charge. How does Surya deal with Varun now? Over the wicket comes the bowler.

text: tossed up full outside off. Driven to mid-off all along the ground
postText: Siddharth: "@Himanshu, do you mean breving?" --- You got it...

text: swept over short fine leg! Surya and Tilak taking it away now. Full delivery just outside off, and again he goes down on his back knee to loft that comfortably over the fielder's head
preText: Man at deep point sent wider to deep extra cover

text: makes room, and the bowler follows. On a good length on middle, and turning into leg, as Tilak pulls to long-on after getting cramped there
preText: That was 17 off the last over. Mumbai kicking on for 150 here. Narine from around the wicket.
postText: Ishan: "Rahane needs to score atleast whatever run Tilak scores today"

text: tonked highhhhh over deep square leg! What a sound that made. Where were you Surya, ask his fans? Full length ball on middle and off, and that is absolutely thrashed for six
preText: Over the stumps to Surya.

text: gets that off the bottom edge, as he goes chasing to that shortish ball which is wide of off. Short third man chases to his left, as the ball would have been a wide had he left alone
flies off the inside half of the bat to the man at deep midwicket. Full length and turning in, as he tried to play after making room

slashes that elegantly! Pure timing there after that powerful six. Short and wide of off, as he uses the pace of the bowler to cut that late and to the right of point. Deep point had no chance to his left
much fuller and outside off, as he sweeps but misses. The ball rolls over off Billings' gloves, and that allows a bye
he is having fun here! Fifty for Surya on his comeback. On a good length and outside off, as he waits for the ball to come before slashing over short third man. He is in command
preText:
Russell from over the wicket.

saar: "i think they waited a little too much to to bring back narine and it has costed them" --- But even he wasn't spared there...

text: yorker on leg, as he jams the bat down. A single to fine leg off the inside half of the bat

shortText: Russell to Tilak Varma, no run
text: good ball. On a short of a length on middle at 136kph, as he pulls, but the ball is past him. Good pace there. Billings appeals for caught behind, but he is all alone there
preText: Over the wicket to Tilak too. What does Tilak do now?

text: how did that go for four!? He has to reach that for that short and wide ball outside off, which seemed to have been a slower ball. He lifts that away from his body, and goes over mid-off with his front leg out out the way

shortText: Russell to Tilak Varma, no run
text: Fire from Russell: a short ball at 139kph. On a short of a length on middle, and cramping him. He sways away, and then thinks to ramp but doesn't connect

shortText: Russell to Tilak Varma, no run
text: more short stuff, and that is another dot. On a short of a length, but on off stump this time. Tilak has a pull, but is beaten

wkt_text: SA Yadav c †Billings b Cummins 52 (57m 36b 5x4 2x6) SR: 144.44
text: that is a wide yorker, and Surya has a slash but is beaten. There is half an interest for a caught behind, and Shreyas goes upstairs with some hope. That pitched very full, and around an imaginary seventh stump. Surya had a go at that away from his body, and guess what... There is a spike as the ball passes bat, and out of nothing, Surya has to leave. Woah, maybe a luck break for Knight Riders since nobody really looked convinced with that review
preText:
Cummins from over the wicket

Vishal: "So much hype for Brevis but hardly any compliments for Tilak. The kid is brilliant for sure. Hardly any fear in his batting"

Final over. 150 on?

text: this time there is an appeal for run-out. No breather for the third umpire. Tilak is diving for life, and he is in. Looked like the bat was in the air for a while, which prompted multiple replays. But he is safe in the end, with the bat grounded in time. That was another wide yorker outside off at 138kph, as Pollard managed to get some bat down in time. Pushed to long-off, and they manage two
preText:
Cummins vs Pollard.

Pankaj: "Rohit and Ishan playing 33 balls for 17.. that could prove costly.. Umesh lethal once again.."

text: launched flat and hard! Typical Pollard there. Stands across off expecting the wide yorker, and Cummins obliges. Pitches it bang in that full length and in the arc outside, as Pollard hammers that 141kph ball over long-on
change of pace, and that is hoicked to deep square leg. On a fullish length on off, as Pollard gets that off the inside half of the bat
preText: Man straight bang behind the bowler. Remember Dhoni doing it in 2010?

text: much wider of off, and called wide. On a slightly good length, and he tried a slash but was beaten

gets a top edge, and gets six! The pace of the pitch, and that of the bowler takes that away. On a short length outside off, as Pollard pulls but gets a top edge over short third man. Bonus runs there

six more! Pollard comes and tonks 22 off five balls. That is now 23 off the final over, as Mumbai get past 160. Leading edge takes that over short third man yet again. He closes the bat face to clip that fullish ball on off, but does that too early. The pace of the bowler helps it sail over the off side though
postText:
Join Miller for the run chase to see where this goes.

Jigar: "Hate to say it but Surya's wicket was a blessing in disguise. Pollard's innings pushed the score from a probable 150 to a respectable 161."

Saurabh Mantri : "Are we sure its not highlights of yesterday's match RR vs RCB?" --- Looks like, yeah.

Surya speaking after that cracking knock: "Looks like a good score. The wicket is still a bit sticky. That is a lot of runs for our bowlers to defend. We decided to go ahead with the [second] time-out... and it exactly went how we wanted it. I just wanted to spend time, run hard... I feel we can win it! The wicket is going to remain the same. I didn't find any dew out there."

Ayan: "The missed catch turned out to be costly for KKR"

9.16pm What a finish by Mumbai. Not dissimilar to what Delhi Capitals did to them in their first match of the season. Surya returns, and shines right away. A knock of 52 from 36 balls when Mumbai seemed off track, and when 140 seemed like a distant score. Massive contributions from Tilak and Pollard at the death, as Rahane's drop of Tilak earlier proves crucial.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Rahane, no run
text: zip off the seam, back into the right-hander, and thumped on the thigh pad. Tight lines
preText:
9.28pm Welcome back. It's a score on the board, but is it enough? Let's find out. Basil Thampi has the new ball... he had a bit of an encounter with Jos Buttler the other night. But maybe holding Bumrah back is the way to go... he's got a slip for starters

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: What's Andre Russell's strike rate against Jasprit Bumrah in the IPL?

In the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

text: back and across, and nurdled into the gap at midwicket to get the chase up and running

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, 1 run
text: full length, flicked through the line to the leg-side, another single to get the left-hander up and running too
pop from a good length, and spliced over gully! This are zippy, seaming conditions, Test-match vibes, and it's a struggle out there.
preText: A delay as the umpire replaces a malfunctioning zing bail...
postText: Naman Jogani: "Mumbai doing everything right except for the opening...If we take out the boundary from Ishan then he has scored 10 off 20 and Rohit score 3 of 12...that is 13 off 32 during the powerplays...Might just cost their first 2 points..."

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: drawn forward to the full length, and pushed into the covers

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: skids on, on a leg-stump line, attempted clip to midwicket but can't connect. Tidy opening gambit
back of a length, skiddy off the deck, hurries on a pull to leg
preText: Daniel Sams to share the powerplay honours

text: swings across the line, and inches short of backward square! Diving forward, unsure whether it would carry, but committing all the same, and doing very well to watch the ball all the way and prevent the four
postText: paramdev: "Thampi like Natrajan was bowling yorkers ar will, and at higher pace, and then went off radar, I hope he does well today"

text: opens the face, back of a length, dabbed to third man
very full length, and a big appeal from Sams! Nothing doing from the umpire, pinned on a leg-stump line, but a nick saves the lungs
dabbed behind square, just back of a length
tip and run to cover, a fine pounce and under-armed flick at the non-striker's end, but Iyer is into his stride early and safely home

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: massive wind-up, but just thin air as Iyer throws everything through the line outside off

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, FOUR
text: dinky dab through fine leg! A gallop across the crease, to the off side, opening up his stumps, and flipping the length ball past the catcher on the leg side. Nifty

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: good follow-up, just zipping past the edge as Thampi backs the pitch to do his work as he hits a good length

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: back of a length, cramped on the crease by a hint of nip back into the left-hander, poked down the pitch

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: leaning back, and cracked at backward point, timed well but excellently pounced
postText: Paramdev: "I was trying to get my comments published for months, now I finally got one, I took a screenshots and saved on my phone, and I realized I made a spelling mistake" That's probably why it got published. We are all secret sadists here...

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, 1 run
text: full toss, low and straight, so effective enough, no room to free the hands as Iyer settles for a push to cover
postText: Shub: "Anyone else thinks Narine is best suited as an opener ? He can take the game away from opponent if gets going " In the right conditions he can be lethal. Ask Cricinfo concurs...

shortText: Bumrah to VR Iyer, no run
text: Lovely line and length, across the left-hander, climbing past the splice into the keeper's gloves
preText: Time for Bumrah. Buckle up!

shortText: Bumrah to VR Iyer, no run
text: wonderful seam, climbing past a loose drive, on a tight line. Bowling
hurried on an off-stump line, a fraction fuller, Iyer slashes down to backward point
tight lines again, forward to meet the full length, squeezed back down the pitch
more hustle on a full length, at 144kph, Rahane comes forward but can't get it away
wider on the crease, bending the inswinger back towards off stump, a open-faced tap to third man and that's two off the over. That 162 target is looking better already...

wkt_text: AM Rahane c Sams b Mills 7 (22m 11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 63.63
text: banged in short, and strikes first ball! That's a wonderful start, Rahane climbed into the pull, but the left-arm line, into the body, had him cramped from the get-go. Sams backpedals at deep midwicket, clings on inside the rope, and KKR lose their first!
preText: Tymal Mills

text: on the legs, flipped around the pads, down to fine leg. Fuller length from Mills, and the wrong line on this occasion

shortText: Mills to SS Iyer, no run
text: hops back into the crease to fence back down the pitch

shortText: Mills to SS Iyer, no run
text: excellent bowling, fuller length but climbing into the body all the same, bending back into the right-hander and cramping him on the back foot at 142kph

down the leg side and dropped! Not a brilliant ball, but the pace from Mills nearly prised another opening, a flashing pull across the line, off the face of the bat it seems, and though Kishan leapt with both hands he could only palm it to fine leg
fenced out to deep midwicket.

shortText: Sams to VR Iyer, no run
text: onto the front foot, tight lines from over the wicket, punched back to the bowler
swished up and over third man! A lusty hoick across the line, and a steepling top-edge, high over the keeper's head
postText: VinayMudunuru: "Brilliant comeback from Thampi so far. Bowlers loose confidence eventually move out of season after such onslaught. Kudos to MI think tank for sticking with him!"

shortText: Sams to VR Iyer, no run
text: back on a better line, pushed back down the pitch
opens the face, outside off, clattered through backward point! The width does the trick, a despairing dive from the fielder
on the back foot again, pushed firmly out to cover. Just ticking along now

wkt_text: SS Iyer c Tilak Varma b Sams 10 (9m 6b 2x4 0x6) SR: 166.66
text: banged in short, and the short ball strikes again! Left-arm over, into the body, grip off the deck, Iyer tried to roll his wrists, but like Mills' bouncer, it just came on quickly from a lively deck, and square leg stoops to gather, five metres in from the rope
postText: Sam Billings has a job to do... and after the powerplay, Mumbai were... 35 for 1

shortText: Tilak Varma to VR Iyer, no run

shortText: Tilak Varma to VR Iyer, 1 run

shortText: Tilak Varma to Billings, no run
text: reverse sweep, pushed across the right-hander, who can't connect outside off
postText: Chandan Shyamal: "This seems to be a Gabba or a Perth wicket." It's zippy, that's for sure

text: advances to the pitch this time, meeting the round-the-wicket line with an uppish flick to long-on

shortText: Tilak Varma to VR Iyer, FOUR
text: there's some meat in that sweep! Boshed off an incredibly full length, but the sound off the bat said it all. Wide long-on couldn't blink before he was beaten

shortText: Tilak Varma to VR Iyer, no run

skiddy outside off, outside off, and Billings almost undercuts into the stumps

text: into position early for the sweep, play it from the other end for now
pulled to the leg side, not timed but shimmying at the pitch to make an angle
postText: Rise: "Man!! That 4 from Iyer was like the strongest shot this season!! " It went woof.

text: lumped over long-on! Strong from Billings, a forceful march to the pitch, and a clean-lined pick-up high into the stands!
swept again, good timing on this stroke too but backward square is well positioned, and they have to bail out of an ambitious second run

shortText: Ashwin to VR Iyer, no run
text: pushed across the left-hander, back onto the stumps to defend back to the bowler
postText: Prashanth BC: "Unpopular opinion but Looks like this Sam-Venky combo will recreate yesterday's Dk-Shabhaz's heroics."

shortText: Basil Thampi to Billings, no run
text: firmly onto the front foot, punched with a full face to mid-off
preText: Thampi's back. KKR still on track, but it's not easy out there

shortText: Basil Thampi to Billings, no run
text: open-faced glide, on the back foot, outside off, backward point leaps and pounces to cut off the run
swivelled into the stands! That's the way to pull them! Rocking into the stroke, skidding into the middle of the bat, and flat over square leg's head
another sumptuous stroke, guided with high hands and a full face out to cover, picked up by the sweeper, but this is a confident pick-up in tempo

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: back of a length, tight line outside off, and Iyer flashes off the back foot and nearly nicks off
postText: Manoj: "KKR's DK is still in the dressing room... Might be preparing his sword for the battle."

shortText: Basil Thampi to VR Iyer, no run
text: another fine delivery, lifting past the outside edge. Just seven off the over in spite of Billings' big hit. Time for a Time Out
postText: Here's Himanshu to apply the finishing touches to a bubbling chase

text: misfield by Bumrah at short fine leg, and that allows a single. Full ball outside leg, and he went to sweep that away
preText:
Ashwin will continue from over the wicket.

Hello again. The chase is on in Pune, and why not? Russell is due to come after all.

shortText: Ashwin to VR Iyer, 2 leg byes
text: shapes to reverse sweep, but is not in control. Invites a leg-before appeal from Ashwin and Kishan, and Rohit thinks... thinks... and decides not to review. Full ball outside leg, and that hit his front pad after turning like a googly
preText: Stays over the wicket to Iyer

text: crashes a sweep over deep square leg! Full ball on off this time, and he sweeps with command with his back leg down. That was nailed
backs away before returning to his original stance, and slashes that shortish ball outside off to deep point

wkt_text: SW Billings c Basil Thampi b Ashwin 17 (19m 12b 0x4 2x6) SR: 141.66
text: skips down, and ends up slicing to long-off! Surya right on the edge of the boundary, and takes it with a little leap. Billings is left with his hands and bat on his head. He came down the pitch to that full ball outside off, and once he was jumping out, he always had to get bat on ball. Ended up slicing with an open face of the bat, and ends up departing
plays the reverse sweep first ball to this full delivery on off, but finds short third man. Iyer wanted a single, but was sent back
preText:
Rana out in the middle. Aswhin from over the wicket.

Ahsan Butt: "Smashing premium spinners out of the park with no helmet has its own vibe!"

text: off the inside edge, and four behind the wicket! Yorker on off, as Iyer had a swing and got that nowhere from where he wanted. There was an appeal for leg before from Mills, but of course there was no pad there
preText: Mills back from over the wicket
postText: Ravi: "MI, in many instances they have came out of no where... Will it be their day???" --- Well on their way maybe? Unless, of course, the Russell cyclone doesn't arrive.

text: crunches this drive to cover, who dives to his right and just gets a hand to stop the momentum. Full and wide of off, and Iyer drove away from his body
slower ball on a back of a length on middle. Pulls to fine leg with a swivel
shorter in length, and around fourth stump. Rana tries to ramp after trying the reverse sweep first ball, but fails to connect. No bat there
postText: Raghu: "Required run rate is too low for DreRuss to come in!" --- That's the spirit!

text: slashes over third man! That was short and wide outside off at 140kph, and Rana loved that pace. He backed away early to that cross-seam ball, and got his front leg out of the way before lashing out on that to go over the rope
change of pace, and pulls to deep midwicket running forward, as the ball falls just short with the fielder diving forward
low full toss on off, as he tosses that up. Swept away to fine leg for a single
preText: Remember if you are in the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.
postText: Krish: "We're all expecting a Russell cyclone but it'll be an Iyer typhoon today." --- What a world we live in; there was the Pollard storm earlier...

text: shmmies down the pitch, and sees the bowler bowling short and wide of off, turning away from him. Slashes to deep point
full and just outside off. Nudged back to the bowler's left

wkt_text: N Rana c Sams b Ashwin 8 (10m 7b 0x4 1x6) SR: 114.28
text: taken at deep midwicket! It was there to be hit by Rana, but alas! That should ideally have been six. Short delivery pitching on middle and leg, and nearly going on straight off the pitch. He went to pull by getting his front leg out of the way, and ended up gifting the man there a catch, as he was placed well inside the rope. Knight Riders losing momentum here
Pretty full and wide-ish of off. Dragged back to the bowler with a flat bat
preText:
Russell in. Ready. Steady. Go. Ashwin from over the wicket, with a slip.

Arun: "All hyping up Russell. Don't forget that his nemesis still has 3 overs left!"

text: tonked down the ground! Right into the action. Full and tossed up on middle and off, and right where someone like a Russell would have loved it. He smells something with his blade, and lets that ram over the bowler's head
good length ball on middle and leg, and straightening off the pitch. Cramps him for room, as he uncomfortably dabs towards cover
preText: As some of you were calling, Bumrah is back. Over the wicket.

text: top edge, and four over the keeper's head! We've seen those a few times today already. Good pace off the pitch, as Bumrah digs it in short on off at 143kph, as Russell swings for the leg side, but the ball flies off somewhere else
preText: Bumrah vs Russell

text: this is a good ball. Cramps him for room with a hard length ball on middle, which hints to angle in. Pulled unconvincingly towards midwicket
makes room, and pulls to long leg! Bumrah followed him by going back of a length outside leg, and Iyer obliged. Pulled that to beat fine leg to his right. Bumrah going for some runs here
back of a length on off, and this was closer to his body. He dabs that from close to his body, and beats point to his left. Deep point scampers across to his right

shortText: Bumrah to VR Iyer, no run
text: good ball. Change of pace, and goes short on middle and off while getting it to angle away. There is good bounce too, as Iyer misses his pull

wkt_text: AD Russell c Brevis b Mills 11 (9m 5b 1x4 1x6) SR: 220.00
text: taken at point, and the Russell storm/cyclone/earthquake lasts only this longer today! A short delivery with an upright seam on middle by Mills, as Russell is prepared to pull that early. The ball goes off really slowly off the pitch, as Russell goes to pull with his front leg out of the way. Gets a top edge - again, like he did against Bumrah last over - and gets it to balloon to point
preText:
Mills from over the wicket

Harsha : "10 in 4 balls already. Russell viper and Iyer anaconda too hot to handle for Bumrah" --- The next over is awaited...

text: good length ball wide of off, and dragged to cover away from his body
preText: Some life left yet? Cummins is in. Mills from over the wicket.

text: another top edge, and this lands beyond the keeper and short fine leg running back. Short of a length on off, and Iyer seemed to be in his shot early. There was a fumble in collection from Bumrah near the rope after he ran back, but that is two still

another miscue, and this lands well short of the man running in from deep square leg. Some luck for Knight Riders here. A slower ball on a short of a length on off, and he is not in control of that pull
Cummins lands from Pakistan, and sends that flying to Mumbai! Good length ball on middle, and right in the slot. Hoicked over fine leg for six

four this time! These are valuable runs for his side. Finds the gap between point and short third man, as he drags this fullish ball wide of off. Plays away from his body, but still manages to place where he wanted
preText:
Three men out on the leg side

SantySK: "Earlier Cummins went for more than 12 an over. Time to return the favour!"
postText: The final time-out of the day

text: fifty for Iyer!. But he needs to hang on. Gets an inside edge as he looks to drive forward to that good length ball on middle. The ball dribbles to the off side
preText:
Bumrah will continue. Can he stem the momentum here?

The required run rate is under eight an over. Can Iyer and Cummins take their side home? Remember, Mumbai are pretty much one wicket away here.

Tony Stark: "To all the KKR fans out here, please don't post any more praise comments and jinx the batters!!!"

Ahsan Butt: "@himanshu, didn't Cummins go home first before landing in India?" -- That shot was so good that I forgot...

text: slower-ball yorker just outside off. Cummins almost looked prepared to dispatch that, before realising he never had the pace he wanted
preText: Cummins on 11 off 3 so far...

text: on the bounce to extra cover! Another slower ball, but full and wider of off. Pushed away from his body
postText: Joy: "Iyer is the key now, he should be farming the strike and allow one or two hoicks from Cummins. That would do, would do just fine!"

text: that flies off the bat to deep midwicket! Bring on Mills and Bumrah, but Cummins is not going anywhere. Pretty full on off, as he gets his front leg out of the way, and swings with freedom. Although that didn't really come off the middle, it still went a long way

short third man dives to his left, but doesn't get a hand! Would have been wide had Cummins left it alone. Full and pretty wide of off, as he goes for a fish and manages to get off the outside half of the bat
a low full toss on off at 140kph, as Bumrah goes for the yorker. Jammed to long-on
over long-on now! Cummins making up with the bat after being expensive with the ball. Slower ball on a hitting length and full on off, as he swings after waiting for the ball to come
preText:
Sams from over the wicket

We were wondering what Russell would do. Who knew Cummins would give the deciding blows? 35 to get off 30. What can Mumbai do?

text: between long-on and deep midwicket now! Sams bowls a slower ball, which turns out to be a full toss on off. Cummins clears his front leg, and sends that heaving

six more! Over deep midwicket. You know how he did it, didn't you? Anyway, waits for the slower ball to come, gets his front leg out of the way, goes down on his back knee and really nails that over the fielder
6, 4, 6, 6. He is on 44 off 12 balls now. On a shortish length on middle and leg, and he swivels to pull over fine leg. Great shot, as he piles up boundaries after boundaries
Cummins equals the record of the fastest IPL fifty! Just 14 balls for his fifty. Slower ball on a short of a length on off, and he pulls to deep square leg after letting the ball come to him
preText: Free-hit

text: is that an excellent catch by Surya at long-off? That was taken extremely well, but it is called no-ball for height. Oh my, everything happening here. Sams ends up bowling a high full toss on off, and Cummins swats that to long-off with his bottom hand off. Surya there was falling back while he took the catch, with his back leg very close to the rope. He ended up going outside the rope and pushed the ball back in, only to be back in and take it again. So an outstanding effort all in vain there
preText: Can he get to fifty off 13 balls? 14 is the record. Sams from around the wicket.

text: Oh God, Knight Riders have won with four overs to spare! They needed 35 from 30 balls, and Cummins got them all in six deliveries. Unbelievable stuff! Cummins ends with 56 off 15 balls. Four fours and six sixes in that innings. Slower ball on a full length on fifth stump, as he went slogging over the bowler's head. A lifetime of a T20 innings there
preText: Is Iyer even batting? Anyone?
postText:
Phew! The game is done; and with a good time to spare. Credit Cummins for that. A knock for the ages - aka 56* off 15 balls - makes it look like child's play, as Mumbai remain winless. But don't forget to join us for the action tomorrow. Until then, it's goodnight and goodbye from Miller, Ranjith and me, Himanshu!

Animesh: "Pakistan must be feeling lucky!! "

No prizes for guessing. Pat Cummins, of course, is the Player of the Match: "I am more surprised [with that innings]! It just came off. I was not trying to overthink. That's really satisfying. The ball seems to fly here... So just hitting in the shorter side. I am sure it sends a message...! We were lucky to keep the core of the squad like last year. Happy with how it came out [with the ball]. Overall pretty happy."

Shreyas Iyer can't help but smile: "I was just watching the ball fly! I couldn't believe. Outstanding from him. They just stuck to the plans, and before we could even execute the plan, Pat just finished it. When I went in to bat, I told him [Venky] to just time the ball. Batters batting in top four - one has to play the anchor. I was just saying that we still haven't played the best cricket yet. I think the pitch was the same in the powerplay of both innings. The ball was bouncing when I went in to bat."

Hang around for the presentations.

Prakash: "Illegal for bowler to hit like that" --- Dear MCC, any such law in the works?

Bimal: "Wasn't Cummins bought as a bowler? He can ask for a pay hike!" --- Of course, he has ended up celebrating his birthday a month in advance.

Manojkumar : "Wow Cummins you beauty. He compensated more than he conceded in his last over. "

Venky Iyer: "For everyone other than Put the pitch looked very tricky. Got to give it to Pat for that on a pitch which was actually tricky to bat on. There'll be days when you'll not be hitting the ball as well as you want... With the batting line-up that we have with some big-hitters coming, I could play the anchor role..."

Rohit Sharma on that shock: "Never expected him to come and play like that! Lot of credit to him for the way he played. With the bat we didn't start well. Over the last four overs, to get 160-plus was a great effort... We had the game until the 15th over, but the way Cummins played... We thought we could have them. But this will be hard to digest - the way it turned out to be in the last few overs. There is a lot of hard work we need to put in."

saikat: "All those hypes about Russell being tornado, cyclone, storm today but Cummins be like: hold my sixes! "

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: The most expensive overs in IPL history.

Rajiv: "What. Was. That. Huh."

11.02pm I need time to gather my thoughts. Incredible. Outstanding. Cummins plays a dream knock. If you thought the game was over when Russell departed, Cummins killed all of Mumbai's hopes. He threw the ball wherever he wanted; and equalled the record for the fastest IPL fifty.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Buttler, no run
text: fuller around off and shaping away. Buttler is watchful and pushes it towards cover
preText:
Siraj to bowl. A slip in place.

7.30pm Buttler and Jaiswal are walking in. The RCB players are in a huddle. Kohli with the pep talk, I think.

Watch T20 Time Out live with Carlos Brathwaite and Ravi Shastri

7.25pm We are just five minutes away from the first ball. One question for RR will be if they go hard, considering there could be dew in the second half, or they bat normally without bothering about the dew factor.

Terry : "RR should try Devdutt Padikal before Jaiswal I suppose. " --- I think it's about who can adapt better in the middle overs and perhaps the answer is Padikkal. So he is batting at No. 3 and Jaiswal is opening.

Here are the XIs

Royal Challengers Bangalore 1 Faf du Plessis (capt), 2 Anuj Rawat, 3 Virat Kohli, 4 Dinesh Karthik (wk), 5 Sherfane Rutherford, 6 Shahbaz Ahmed, 7 Wanindu Hasaranga, 8 Harshal Patel, 9 David Willey, 10 Mohammed Siraj, 11 Akash Deep

Rajasthan Royals 1 Jos Buttler, 2 Yashasvi Jaiswal, 3 Devdutt Padikkal, 4 Sanju Samson (capt, wk), 5 Shimron Hetmyer, 6 Riyan Parag, 7 R Ashwin, 8 Navdeep Saini, 9 Trent Boult, 10 Prasidh Krishna, 11 Yuzvendra Chahal

7.10pm What did the first week of IPL 2022 tell us? Dew, middle-over mantra and new Indian talent. Also, when to use your pacers. Gaurav Sundararaman explains all that here.

Sarthak: "How is Saini better than Mccoy or Parag better than RVD or Neesham?" --- To be honest, that's a bit surprising to me as well, but maybe they want to continue with the winning combination.

7.00pm RCB have won the toss and they will bowl first. "Even though you are not playing to the best of your ability, getting over the line gives you the confidence," says Faf du Plessis. "We are unchanged."

Sanju Samson says they don't mind batting first. He says they want to do those small, small things well. Rajasthan Royals are unchanged as well, so only three overseas player, no Neesham, no McCoy.

Sanket: "like the way RCB is using shahbaz as a bit of floater, the last game was kind of stuck when Rutherford and Willey were batting but the cameo of shahbaz did the job for rcb even in the last season he showed the glimpses of his potential with both bat and ball."

6.55pm Matthew Hayden reckons this particular pitch has less grass on it, it's pretty hard as well. He thinks batters will enjoy more on this surface.

Kapoor: "I just want to see a good innings from Kohli, loooooong time I haven't seen one"

6.45pm If you play fantasy cricket, here are our tips for today's game: Go with Buttler, Samson and Chahal.

Thomas: "Mike Hesson said in RCB's video today that no CA has allowed Australian players to be available only from April 6th, so they won't play even though they arrived. Not sure how all of it works tbh" --- Oh yes, that's there. Just realised it's April 5 only.

Mohit Arya: "Would love to see Mccoy debuting for RR in place of Saini, Mccoy can mix it up which will be handy on Wankhede pitch." --- I am a big fan of Obed McCoy, the variations he has and the way he executes them is superb. But the question do you want Jimmy Neesham (in place of Riyan Parag) as your fourth overseas player, or McCoy for Saini.

Mustafa Moudi : "It will be interesting to see how Chahal does today against his former Team RCB. Especially after his recent statement that he is "Emotionally Attached" to RCB!!"

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Hetmyer vs Rutherford strike rate in the middle overs (all T20s since 2019)...

Thomas: "Rajasthan are a rare case of looking incredible on paper and on the field. I've never been this nervous about facing any team, RCB will have an uphill task without Maxi" --- I think Maxwell is available for tonight's game.

Garv Asnani: "I would want to see RR play 4 overseas players in Buttler, Hetmyer, Neesham and Boult. Neesham can come in place of Parag and RR can have a solid top 6 with a strong 6th bowler."

If you are in the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

6.30pm Hello and welcome to game 13 of IPL 2022. It's Rajasthan Royals v Royal Challengers Bangalore at the Wankhede Stadium. Rajasthan have ticked all the boxes so far, winning both their games despite batting first. Each time they posted a formidable total and their bowlers defended it successfully. RCB, on the other hand, have one win and one loss from their two games, and they must get their batting right to make it tough for Rajasthan. I am Hemant Brar and will soon be joined by Alan Gardner as we bring you all the action. Meanwhile, take a gander at Srinidhi Ramanujam's match preview.

postText: In other sporting news, Tokyo Paralympics medal winner Praveen Kumar has set himself a new goal - to outcompete regularly abled athletes. At the Federation Cup event in Kozhikode, he finished sixth in a field of 11 elite Indian athletes. Read his story on how he's planning to overcome yet another major obstacle.

text: length ball shaping away, goes for the cut and gets beaten
short of length on the stumps, Padikkal goes for a Nataraja pull but cannot connect. The ball hits him on the pads and goes towards the leg side, allowing a leg-bye
length ball angling away. Buttler takes a step towards the bowler but ends up chasing it with his hands and gets beaten
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket where Anuj Rawat lets it go through his legs and costs three runs to his team
fuller on the stumps, flicked in front of square leg
length ball outside off, pushes at it, gets an outside edge that beats the short third man on his left, and the ball races away for four
postText: sanket: "why not introduce hasarnaga in the pp and try to get Buttler or DDP here and put pressure on RR destructive but thin batting line up."

text: length ball around off, punched to the right of mid-off for a quick single
preText: Akash Deep. One slip

shortText: Akash Deep to Padikkal, no run
text: 136.9kph, nice shape on that one. Pitching on a good length around leg stump and going across the left-hander. Almost squaring him up and beating the outside edge

shortText: Akash Deep to Padikkal, no run

shortText: Akash Deep to Padikkal, no run
text: 136.5kph, this is the line he should bowl more. On a good length, around off and leaving the batter. Padikkal is stuck in his crease and tries to follow it with his hands. Beaten
short of length around off, goes for the pull but gets an under edge on this. Ends up dragging it towards short fine leg
preText: Willey to bowl his third

text: length ball around off, steered behind point where Akash Deep makes a diving stop to his left
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards short midwicket. A bit of a fumble there
short of length around off, pulls it towards deep square leg
short of length around off once again, pulled towards deep square leg
length ball around off, goes for the drive but gets beaten on the inside edge
postText: Virat: ""Nataraja" Pull Shot was originally Patented by the Great Kapil Dev and Coined by another Great Sunny Gavaskar!!" --- Irfan Pathan once told me how he used to copy the Natraj shot as a kid (Kapil Dev was his first sporting hero)

text: through the hands. A length ball around off, Buttler pushed at it but failed to keep it down. Luckily for him, it caught Akash by surprise and he couldn't react quickly enough. Long-on moved across to cut it off
preText: Sanket Patil: "Everyone was like bit surprised when RR went behind DDP as they had top order sorted in the form of Buttler,Jaiswal and Sanju but the way he is playing at different position than he always bat leaves you no option to admire the tactical move, and also sometimes clarity on role is more important than the position"
postText: Ani: "Looking at Yashasvi Jaiswal's form, I wonder if it would be better for RR to drop Jaiswal and have Paddikal open. They could get Neesham in the middle order to provide some back up overs and a big-hitting finish"

shortText: Akash Deep to Padikkal, no run
text: length outside off, looks to drive it through covers but gets beaten
length ball leaving the batter, Padikkal manages to work it towards covers and sets off for a quick single. The fielder has a shy at the bowler's end but misses. Think Padikkal would have made it

dropped by Willey! A length ball outside off, Buttler moves across and slogs it across the line. Couldn't middle it and ended up skying high towards deep midwicket. Willey moved to his left but I think it was swirling in the air and fell just away from him as he dived
insult followed by the injury. Fuller around off, Buttler clears his front leg and smashes it over long-off, a six after a drop
length ball outside off, stays leg-side of the ball and pushes it towards sweeper cover

Willey to bowl out

text: short of length on the stumps, pulled towards deep-backward square leg

text: another drop?! Was a short ball from Willey, Padikkal pulled it in the air towards deep square leg. Siraj charged in, dived forward and got his hand to it but it went though. Full marks for the effort though and maybe a touch harsh to call it a drop
driven down the ground for one

fuller, in the slot for Padikkal and he launches it over long-on. The fielder puts in the jump with an outstretched hand but it goes just over him. 14 from that over

postText: Time for a strategic. And Guess who is coming for our next edition of #PoliteEnquiries? Send your question for Neesham on Twitter. Don't forget to mention that hashtag

It goes up high in the air, Kohli pedals back from mid-off and takes it with reverse cups, and falls on his back after taking the catch. The third umpire wants to make sure if Kohli was in control of the ball and the ball didn't touch the ground as he fell down. Replay shows it was a fair catch, nothing wrong there

The suggestion is that this isn't quite the typical Wankhede belter, Ani. Spin could be more of a factor, and RR definitely not on for such a towering score in this one

Into the last four over, Royals looking to Buttler for the fireworks

Harshal Patel back on

Here's hard taskmaster Samuel: "Maybe they've not let Jos have much of the strike because he can't hit the ball off the square today, James L? Even on a tough pitch, 40 off 38 is disappointing."

postText: Buttler is up at the other end, shaking his head after that shot. Clearly something is amiss for the competition's leading run-scorer

postText: "Buttler have just played 38 deliveries out of 102," notes Amiya. "That's astonishing." Now 40 out of 108

clubbed through the hands of Faf! Fantastic diving effort at long-off, and he got the fingertips to it... couldn't cling on. He's such a good fielder you almost expect him to hold those
full and wide, Hetmyer opens the face on a lofted drive through point, Willey has to throw himself after it and they come back for two

postText: Here's Kiran Timilsena: "Buttler in recent said its about targetting that one over. Cheering for RR, lets just hope that over is yet to come today."

text: creamed over long-on! Steps across and gets a half-tracker with pace on, bullied back down the ground and over the head of the fielder. Buttler nails one
bludgeoned... and he gets enough on it! Buttler clears long-off and brings up his fifty. Wide full toss and he connects, despite slicing across the ball slightly
pitched up outside off, mistimed down the ground
preText: Last over, RR hoping to boost themselves up to 160. Akash Deep to bowl

shortText: Akash Deep to Buttler, 1 no ball
text: well bowled, spears a yorker into the pads with Buttler looking to make room
bottom-handed boshing! Misses the leg-stump yorker and Buttler's timing is right back, clean swing and he crunches six more down the ground
goes full and wide, 127kph and he has to reach for it, squeezed between short third and backward point
preText: "Extraordinary from Buttler..." gulps Vishwa. "67 Runs but no 4s"

text: wide full toss with pace on, Deep gets away with one chopped to long-off
smoked! Hetmyer butters Royals' parsnips with six more from the final ball! Length ball and Hetmyer gets low to slam it up and over deep square leg, an emphatic finish to the innings
postText:
9.25pm: Royals found some chili oil to stir in at the end. Forty two runs from the last two overs, and that's given their bowlers something to defend. Jos Buttler played one of his more laboured innings, but still ended up with 70 from 47, and he's handed the orange cap for his troubles. Buttler put on 83 in 50 balls with Shimron Hetmyer, edging things towards RR at halfway: they are a 55% chance, according to Win Predictor. Don't go anywhere, Hemant will be back for the RCB chase shortly

Here's a word with Buttler: "[Pitch] Feels a little bit soft, seam went into the wicket at the start. Whether that changes with the dew, not sure. [Innings] Frustrating at times, you feel you need to kick on, but sometimes you've got to suck it up and try to get a few away at the end. We're in the game [with 169]. If conditions don't change, I back our bowlers to defend it."

text: length ball on the stumps, a bit of swing into the batter, flicked towards square leg
preText: 9.40pm Welcome back. Buttler's 70* is the highest individual score that didn't feature a four in all T20s. Anuj Rawat and Faf du Plessis to kick off the chase. Trent Boult has got the new ball. One slip.

postText: In January last year, CS Santosh, India's first Dakar Rally rider, suffered a brutal crash at 135kmph. He suffered brain trauma and was placed in a medically induced coma. Here he talks about his battle against depression, loneliness, sense of self. And how he's determined to get back to what he does best: Racing.

Willey takes half a step down before saying no but Sanju Samson swoops to the ball and throw it off-balance to Chahal, who collects and breaks the stumps. The umpires have sent this upstairs and Kohli has been run-out by a frame

text: is that a drop? Shouts of "catch!" as he pulls and it goes low to the right of the diving Ashwin at midwicket. Yep, it carried, though would have been a superb take

shortText: Chahal to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: rags back at Shahbaz, over the wicket and spinning big into the left-hander, who chops down

shortText: Chahal to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: flighted, can only poke this back to the bowler
tosses up a slow legbreak on the stumps, Shahbaz drags a sweep through square leg for one
skidding through quicker, 92kph outside off and Rutherford chops it away on the back foot
postText: "Cricket is a funny ole game. RCB went from favorites to underdogs in the space of 12 balls by losing 4 wickets." Sheldon pretty much sums it up

text: back of a length, 140kph and skids into the thigh pad with Rutherford playing across the line
preText: Change in the bowling, Saini replaces Ashwin

text: blootered just short of the boundary marker! Shahbaz clears the front leg and crashes a length ball away to cow corner
short ball, climbing through past the top edge as Shahbaz swings at a pull. Signalled wide on height
preText: Here's M Sudhakar: "Willey, Rutherford, Shahbaz at No.4, 5 and 6. RCB is kidding themselves if they think they can win IPL with that middle order. Each of these players is a tailender when playing for his natiom/state." I guess Glenn Maxwell might just squeeze in there once he's available

text: goes full, 134kph and dug out back over the bowler's head
full length outside off, carved out to the cover sweeper
powered down the ground... just clears long-on! Misses the yorker and Shahbaz spanks it towards the RCB dugout, beyond the outstretched arm of Buttler. Just brushed the fingertips, I think
back of a length, 127kph and jabbed down into the covers

shortText: Boult to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: back of a length, Shahbaz hops down and mistimes a cross-batted hack
preText: Chahal's fourth is held back, Boult returns

text: length on off, pace off the ball, makes room to cut for one

wkt_text: SE Rutherford c Saini b Boult 5 (21m 10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: Saini bags a swirler! Boult strikes, RCB five down. Short and Rutherford hacked across the line, the ball flying up and over the keeper... but Saini circled around from short third, and then judged it well as the ball dropped a yard or so in front of him, clinging on at full stretch
preText: "Shahbaz out there to prove @sudhakar wrong today," yips tanstheman

text: back of a length from over the wicket, 136kph and Karthik shows it a solid straight bat
preText: DK walks out with plenty of work to be done. Win predictor down at 14%

text: hard length on fourth stump, punched to cover
short, swatted away on the pull to deep backward square leg, well stopped by Prasidh Krishna
lobbed up from over the wicket, clubbed out to deep midwicket on the bounce
preText:
Ashwin back on for his fourth

"No dew? RR seem to be in no hurry to finish the overs of their premier spinners." The swimming pool is closed tonight, Aravind

text: round the wicket, pushed through and pushed down to long-on
DK donkey kongs it over long-on! Tossed up in the slot and he connects sweetly with a thrash down the ground
postText: "Why isnt Maxwell in the playing XI today?" Only just out of quarantine, I think, Kumar

text: poor ball, carrom down the leg side, I think, Karthik smashes it through backward square! And Ashwin has overstepped, too
postText: Free hit

text: chipped over mid-off for four! Lovely from Karthik, uses the feet and just picks a spot, beats long-on running around
carrom ball, 90kph outside off and gripping, beats the bat
brings out the reverse, and he gets enough on it. Beats the half-dive of Chahal at short third and races away
postText: Life support for RCB! Win predictor jumps back up to 36%

text: shortish outside off, Shahbaz dabs it behind square and takes one
preText:
Saini is back, 61 needed from 36

This stat is from Gaurav Sundararaman: "Joint second highest number of runs conceded by Ashwin in an over in the IPL"
postText: Nick: "How on Earth is Karthik batting below Willey? And Hasaranga at 8? RCB shooting themselves in the foot..." But they're still standing (just about)

text: full and straight, slower ball, whipped through midwicket! Basically a slow full toss from Saini, but DK again times the pants off it
lap-sweep, four more! Another pace-off delivery and he's down early, across his stumps and shovels through backward square
postText: Matthew Vincent: "Funny old game, 1.5 good overs and we're back to 50/50." And RCB jump ahead on win predictor with that boundary, up to 56%

text: full, another slower ball, whisked into a gap leg side for two more
full and wide, 138kph and DK slog-sweeps, not the sweetest connection and it's cut off by the boundary rider at deep midwicket
short and flipped over short fine leg! Another slowie, but he doesn't have cover there. Shahbaz rocks back and swings it away
length ball, punched on the up into the cover region
preText:
Prasidh Krishna back, RCB at 66% on win predictor

"Controversial statement coming. 'DK better than Dhoni at this point in time'." Play bold, Karthik S

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Shahbaz Ahmed, FOUR
text: wide yorker, but squeezed through! Gets it past the despairing dive of short third, and that's another boundary!

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run
text: hit off a length, 139kph and thick-edged out to deep backward square leg
preText: Third is back now, as well as deep point. Three men out on the leg side

text: length ball on the stumps, tucked through square

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: slower delivery, pace down at 101kph, Shahbaz can only poke it back to the bowler
preText: Here's Deepak Samson : "DK playing a gem here. Actually, he has been doing it for several years now. Just unfortunate that his career coincided with a certain other wicket keeper batsman"

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Shahbaz Ahmed, SIX
text: into the hip, swung all the way! Swivel-pulled up and into the empty first tier at fine leg. Shabash, Shahbaz!
postText:
The strategic timeout is called, Royals on the ropes. RCB have got the requirement, which was almost two a ball a while back, down to eight an over from the last four

"Earlier in the match 12 balls shifted the momentum towards RR and now the same 12 balls shifted the momentum towards RCB," declares Yogesh. "That's cricket my dear."

text: tosses up a legbreak on off, defended towards cover
preText: Samson needs a wicket, turns back to Yuzi Chahal

text: pushed through flat, 87kph and DK jumps back to cut, can't get it past Jaiswal in the covers
flighted, full on the stumps and swept firmly, straight to deep backward square leg
fizzed down at 90kph on leg stump, clipped out to deep square
postText: "How good has Shahbaz has been for RCB," whoops Abhinandan. "They were trolled for getting him back. He almost guarantees 20-30 runs with bat. Can give couple of good overs and a live wire in the field."

text: floated up wide, Karthik reaches for a slap through to the covers to the sweeper
big-spinning legbreak angled across the left-hander, he steers it carefully down in front of backward point and takes the one
postText: RCB see off Chahal, leaves them needing 28 from 18. Win predictor at 75%

shortText: Boult to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run
text: nearly bowled attempting to scoop! Just clears leg stump as Shahbaz goes a long way across and fails to connect
preText: Boult for his last over

text: carted past long-on! Makes room and slaps a length ball into the boundary boards, fine of the man running around
smeared, flat over midwicket! Boult goes short but it sits up nicely, Shahbaz connects with a full-blooded mow to cow!
slower ball, he's waiting for it and lifts a couple more over short fine leg

wkt_text: Shahbaz Ahmed  b Boult 45 (50m 26b 4x4 3x6) SR: 173.07
text: bowled 'im! Full and straight, tailing in as Shahbaz went across looking to scoop again. Actually deflected off the glove and then through his legs into the stumps. RR break the stand, but is it too late?
leg-stump yorker, dug out calmly for one to mid-on
preText: Harshal Patel trots out, 16 needed from 13

text: low full toss, swatted down to long-on
preText: Krishna to bowl the 19th
postText: "In the death overs, count out the side coached by Lasith Malinga at your peril," squeals Afeef

text: length ball wide of the stumps, 136kph and driven out to the cover sweeper
preText: Fine leg comes up

text: hard length, into the body and dabbed down in front of backward point. Gets Karthik back on strike
dragged through midwicket, 140kph full-length ball outside off, DK gets enough on a meaty swing across the line. Brings the rate below a run a ball
slung down short and wide, just straying into the tramlines!
tonked! Slower ball, short and inviting Karthik to happy-slap it away over deep backward square leg. One-bounce four

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Karthik, no run
