text: beaten with a beauty! Length ball on fourth stump, 142kph and sliding past the outside edge
postText: RR take it down to the final over... but the fat lady is warming up her tonsils

text: smashes a lollipop into the stands! Patel dumps Jaiswal's tentative legbreak over deep midwicket, sealing a four-wicket win for RCB
preText: Samson tosses the ball to Yashasvi Jaiswal. Three runs needed
postText:
11.50pm: That's a wrap for another day at the IPL. Sreshth Shah has rattled up the report and there will be more video and analysis on the site shortly. Thanks for keeping us company, we'll do it all again tomorrow. Bye!

11.40pm: Time for the presentations. RCB captain Faf du Plessis: "That's one out of the hat. To pull it out of nowhere you need some good characters, and DK is as big a character as you can get. That calmness towards the end allows others to just come in. I think we bowled really well up until the 19th, then Jos got some shots in with the bowlers under pressure. Got them a score just above par. We didn't get the start we needed, Yuzi came in and bowled well. But the belief we have, guys can come in and win games from nowhere. [Shahbaz innings] He's a skinny guy but he hits a long way, and he's got a clear gameplan. I believe he'll play a big part with the ball, too."

Dinesh Karthik is Player of the Match: "I made a conscious effort to do justice to myself. Felt I could have done better in the last few years. The way I've trained has been different. I was telling myself I'm not done yet. I have a goal and I want to achieve something. We needed 12 runs an over, so you need to figure out what to do. Stay calm, know your game and who you can take on. Made an effort to play white-ball cricket, practice matches and scenarios. Those are the hours you put in when no one sees. The real work is done in the lead-up, which is what I'll give credit to. You have to premeditate in T20, but if it's not there, you have to have the ability to change the shot."

11.27pm: So DK drives Royal Challengers across the line, with solid support from Shahbaz Ahmed, handing Royals their first defeat of this year's IPL. RCB were seemingly in all sorts of strife at 88 for 5 after 13 overs, needing 82 from 42 - but Karthik took 19 off R Ashwin's fourth over, which cost 21 in all, and suddenly the momentum flipped. Sounds like the dew did properly take effect towards the end, and RR were unable to defend a middling total, underpinned by an unbeaten 70 off 47 balls from orange cap-wearer Jos Buttler

Here's Royals captain Sanju Samson: "I can't pinpoint a moment [when the game was lost], great effort to put in that total, after losing the toss. Think it was a respectable score, but when the dew is coming up... I think it's a great effort by my team. As a bowling unit you like to take your time and set your fields. Lot of positives to take, and we can learn a lot of things, too."

text: length ball straightening along the fourth-stump channel, defended with an open face towards backward point
preText:
7.28pm Here we go. Bhuvneshwar Kumar has the new ball, and KL Rahul and Quinton de Kock walk in to open for LSG. Washington Sundar, by the way, is playing his 100th T20 game. Two slips in place for Rahul.

Lucknow Super Giants: 1 KL Rahul (capt), 2 Quinton de Kock (wk), 3 Manish Pandey, 4 Evin Lewis, 5 Deepak Hooda, 6 Ayush Badoni, 7 Krunal Pandya, 8 Jason Holder, 9 AJ Tye, 10 Ravi Bishnoi, 11 Avesh Khan

Sunrisers Hyderabad: 1 Kane Williamson (capt), 2 Abhishek Sharma, 3 Rahul Tripathi, 4 Nicholas Pooran (wk), 5 Aiden Markram, 6 Abdul Samad, 7 Romario Shepherd, 8 Washington Sundar, 9 Bhuvneshwar Kumar, 10 Umran Malik, 11 T Natarajan

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Ravi Bishnoi's ER against right- and left-hand batters...

Harshit: "Battle for the best biryani Supremacy " -- We need an IPL team from Ambur for that to happen...

Prafin: "Holder should have been in for Tye , any day Chameera is the better bowler , yes he had a bad outing last game ,you need to give confidence to your players , he had great first game though."

Prathamesh Sons: "I think we are going to see 2018 version of Rahul today specially with that deep batting lineup of LSG"

Sam: "An interesting strategy teams have used in the auction is "countering match-ups", for example buying Holder and Bishnoi, protecting Ravi from the tremendous record Jason has batting against him" -- Bishnoi's bowled only five balls to Holder! Can't read too much into that.

7.00pm Kane Williamson tosses, KL Rahul calls tails, and it's heads. SRH choose to bowl, as expected. "We've seen some similarities in a number of early matches and we'll try to get something out of the surface early on, and potentially some dew later on," Williamson says.

SRH are unchanged.

Rahul says he would have liked to bowl first as well. One change for LSG. Holder replaces Dushmantha Chameera. "We picked Jason at the auction because he's a top allrounder, and he can swing the new ball, and can bat as well."

He also has words of praise for Ayush Badoni. "One of the biggest takeaways for us has been how he has performed under pressure."

6.50pm Our Live Blog is now up and running, by the way. Hop over there from time to time for Mr. Monga's pearls of wisdom.

In the USA, you can watch the match LIVE on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Abhi: "If the top 6 fail, there is not much Romario can do with bat and his bowling is sub par. Better Jansen in his place, he can bat too. And Jansen is in the form of his life. He should pick new ball with Bhuvi. We have seen how new ball bowlers are making the difference this season."

6.40pm Jason Holder has just received his LSG cap. Andy Flower's making a fairly long speech in the team huddle.

Mustafa Moudi : "Before talking anything about Cricket, the first thing I want to say is the New Cricinfo Theme is just awesome and refreshing. You people never fail to surprise us!!"

sanket: "Unpopular opinion but I think LSG Should drop Pandey, and get back Ankit rajpoot and replace Chameera/tye with Holder, Apart from Bishnoi the bowling unit doesnt look that threating. so my 11 would be Rahul. QDK, Lewis, Hooda, Badoni, Holder, Krunal, Tye. Bishnoi, Avesh and Ankit. With Pandey everyone bats 1 spot lower than they should and replacing him with Rajpoot gives boost to bowling unit."

KB: "Are we not going to talk about the fact that we won't get to see anymore of Ross Taylor's slog sweep between deep mid-wicket and long on?" -- I'll miss his square-cut even more!

Mahesh: ""Jansen will be a good addition to the playing 11 for SRH today. He can swing the ball and has been among wickets representing SA recently"" -- He'd be a good addition for sure, but replacing Romario Shepherd might compromise their batting depth a little.

Afeef: "LSG have arguably the strongest top 4 batsmen in this season. They will be the key to this new team's success. We saw how LSG lost their first match when each of those 4 batsmen were dismissed early."

6.30pm Hello, hello. Sunrisers Hyderabad have played just the one game this season, and lost that game heavily; they'll hope to get their first points today, and improve their net run rate, which currently sits at -3.050. They're up against Lucknow Super Giants, who've shown their hitting prowess by gunning down 211 against Chennai Super Kings, and who we expect will be bolstered today by the inclusion of Jason Holder. This should be fun, so settle yourselves in your most comfortable nooks, and make sure you have snacks and beverages close to hand.

text: fullish, close to off stump, presses forward and pushes to the left of mid-off

shortText: Kumar to de Kock, no run
text: full, slanting away from off stump, checked drive to mid-off
preText: Stays over the wicket to de Kock.

text: length ball on middle stump, hangs back and whips wristily to long leg
length ball angling into middle and leg, stays back and clips to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, takes a big step back and back-cuts crisply to deep third
starts with a half-volley, though, and Rahul steps away from the line to make room and drills a drive to the left of mid-off
preText: Here's Washington Sundar. A little bit of homework from LSG, I think. Apart from QdK's left-handedness, Rahul also has a pretty low strike rate against offspin over the last few seasons.

text: quickish length ball turning in towards middle and off, hangs back and clips to deep midwicket

shortText: Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run
text: a bit of in-drift towards leg stump. Wants to drive inside-out, ends up playing it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
preText: Around the wicket to QdK, with long-off and deep backward square leg on the boundary.

shortText: Washington Sundar to de Kock, OUT
wkt_text: Q de Kock c Williamson b Washington Sundar 1 (10m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00
text: got him, a terrific catch from Kane Williamson at short extra-cover, slightly squarer than an orthodox short extra. Again the leg-stump line, again QdK making room to drive inside-out, but he drives in the air, and Williamson throws himself to his right to take a superb catch

shortText: Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run
text: big lbw appeal, not give, and SRH have reviewed... Lewis was going for the sweep there, and Washington gets this length ball to mostly slide on with the angle into the left-hander. Beats the bottom edge to hit the knee roll. Was there any bat on this? No bottom edge, no glove. Where's the impact? He stretched across, and it's juuuust inside the line of off stump, but ball-tracking suggests the ball was bouncing quite a bit. Umpire's call on height! Nearly a first-baller for Lewis.
preText:
Left-hander replaces left-hander. Here's Evin Lewis.

Zak: "I wonder if LSG might ever just replace Tye with kyle Mayers it allows their batting to play better and his bowling is really underrated."

shortText: Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run
text: another lbw appeal after Lewis misses another sweep, but this one's clearly angling down leg. Speared in flatter and quicker too
length ball straightening slightly towards off stump, clipped watchfully to mid-on
preText: One slip for Rahul now. Deep point and fine leg back.

text: length ball nipping in towards off stump, makes a bit of room and jabs wristily to deep point
yorker outside off, jams his  bat down to dig it out but the angle causes it to slide past his outside edge
preText: Stays over the wicket to Lewis. One slip for him too.

text: length ball angling across to off stump, was premeditating a pull but it's nowhere near short enough, and he whips to deep square leg instead
back of a length, straightening towards off stump, lets it come and clips to the left of deep square leg
preText: Saoirse: "@Zak underrated in red ball but I can't see it working in T20 in this team. You'd want him bowling in the middle overs which clashes with the spinners. Tye's bowling skillset offers far more imo "

text: timing! On a length, but offers a bit of width, and Rahul drives on the up with a slightly open face and beats deep point to his left though he didn't have a lot of distance to cover

wkt_text: E Lewis lbw b Washington Sundar 1 (10m 5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20.00
text: three balls, three missed sweeps, three lbw appeals, and this one's given. Washington has completely tormented Lewis today. Flat slider, pitching on a length just inside off stump and mostly going on with the angle. Clears his front leg to slog-sweep, and he misses and is hit on the thigh pad, right in front. Doesn't review either, and it just looked very out. Umpire's call on leg stump, it turns out.
preText: Sundar continues. Round the wicket to Lewis.

shortText: Washington Sundar to Pandey, no run
text: tossed up slow outside off, driven firmly, and short extra dives left to stop it. Williamson again
preText: Manish Pandey is in at No. 4. Washington goes back over the wicket.

shortText: Washington Sundar to Pandey, no run
text: length ball dipping and bouncing extra outside off. Looked to dab it behind point, ends up beaten on the outside edge. Less turn and more bounce than expected

shortText: Washington Sundar to Pandey, no run
text: flat length ball outside off, leans back and chops towards backward point

shortText: Washington Sundar to Pandey, no run
text: sharp turn this time, from just back of a length. Looks to work it into the square leg region, and is hit on the front pad. Clearly turning down leg though
flat offbreak finishing on off stump, goes back and punches to long-on. Terrific over, just the one run off it
back of a length on off stump. Hops to ride the bounce and defends to midwicket
preText: First bowling change of the day. Here's Romario Shepherd. One slip in place still.

text: drops a touch too short outside off, and Pandey plays his trademark topspin pull, swats it hard to the right of midwicket

short again, this time looks to tuck him up for room. Opens his hip up to make up for the lack of room, and pulls in the air, but times it sweetly enough to clear the leaping Samad on the square leg boundary
back of a length on leg stump, hops and defends to midwicket

wkt_text: MK Pandey c Kumar b Shepherd 11 (8m 10b 1x4 1x6) SR: 110.00
text: got him, the persistent hard length works for Shepherd. It's on off stump, and Pandey, stepping out and opening up at the hips, ends up with no room for his arms to play what ends up as a straight-bat drive on the up. Ends up hitting it straight to mid-on at stomach height
back of a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket
preText: Deepak Hooda is in at No. 5. How are LSG going to approach this situation? They can't take too long to rebuild, given the likelihood of dew later on.

shortText: Washington Sundar to Rahul, no run
text: back of a length, turns towards off stump, punched to cover point, who deflects the ball to extra-cover
preText: Third over in the powerplay for Washington.

text: tossed up slow on off stump, gets forward and clips to the left of square leg
flat length ball turning in towards off stump, driven to long-on
flat and fairly full outside off, gets forward to clip to deep midwicket
flat, back of a length, speared in towards the stumps, punched to long-on
flat full-toss close to off stump, shows the full face and drives to long-on
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and steers towards third man
preText:
Here's Umran Malik.

32 for 3. Rahul isn't taking any chances against the offspinner, which could be a bit of a polarising strategy, even though LSG are three down.

shortText: Umran Malik to Hooda, no run
text: back of a length, angling into leg stump. Looks to work it into the leg side and is beaten by extra pace and bounce, and is hit on the flap of the front pad. Not much of an lbw appeal because it's going down leg
full outside off, gets forward and drives with an open face. It's in the air briefly, but to the left of the diving backward point fielder, and down to third man

shortText: Umran Malik to Rahul, no run
text: in the blockhole, a hint of inswing towards the stumps. Jams his bat down and blocks it back to the bowler

shortText: Umran Malik to Rahul, no run
text: short ball in the corridor, looks to lean back and ramp it over the keeper, but the ball bounces too much for him to make contact. 145.6kph
full, angling into middle and off, clipped to the right of midwicket, who makes a diving stop
terrible start. Loopy full-toss at thigh height on off stump, and he clears his front leg and hammers it back over the umpire's head
preText: Abdul Samad comes in to bowl his legspin.

text: wide of the crease, spears a full one in towards off stump, driven down to long-off

shortText: Abdul Samad to Hooda, no run
text: flighted and very full outside off, opens his bat face and jabs to backward point
short ball skidding on towards off stump,flat-batted to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched watchfully down to long-on
length ball outside off, slapped firmly to the left of sweeper cover
back of a length on middle and leg, stays leg-side of the ball and whips to mid-on
preText: Saurabh: "Why is Natarajan being held back? Strange call. Could use him to put more pressure rather than letting LSG settle with a part timer like Samad." -- It's that time of the match when neither side is attacking the other just yet. But here's Natarajan. Left-arm over.

text: length ball angling away from off stump, punched to deep cover point
length ball nipping from leg to off, maybe a cutter. Watches it well and shows the full face to punch down to long-off
preText: Prithvi: "Rahul isn't learning from his previous mistakes. He did the same against Markram in the SA series. With the analysts we have today, he is simply painting a weakness on himself by not attacking offies in powerplay."

text: back of a length angling away from off stump, punched to the right of sweeper cover
fullish, slanting across to off stump, clipped to long-on
beaten. back of a length, slanting away from off stump and then it nips away further. Rahul looks to slice it towards third man, and the ball goes past his outside edge
preText: It's Natarajan's 31st birthday today, by the way.

text: sees Hooda looking to make room, tries to follow him with a yorker, but ends up bowling a low full-toss. Punched firmly to beat extra-cover diving to his left
preText:
Malik swaps ends.

Time-out time.

KB: "@saurabh. SRH has only 4 bowlers (nattu, washi, bhuvi, mailk) who can bowl full 4 overs quota. The remaining 4 overs need to be filled by shepherd/samad/markram. Nattu and Malik need to be saved for the later part of the game so it's only natural to bowl out the remaining 4 overs before that."

Tushar Ponda: "Just an observation a bit different from the core tents of the game - the LSG gears color probably is the most soothing of all the teams in IPL so far. The color is a very different kind of a shade of light blue (a light turquoise). Anyone agrees with me?"

text: full, close to off stump, makes a bit of room and drives to sweeper cover
shot. Superb hands from Rahul. Back of a length, angling into off stump at 151.8kph, and he leans away and creates just enough room to ramp the ball away through the vacant slip area
length ball outside off, offers just enough width for Rahul to hit on the up over cover and beat the sweeper to his right
low full-toss on off stump, punched down to long-on

oh, nearly a catch at third man! Good field placement, kept that fielder fine for just this sort of shot, the ramp. Sharp bouncer, and Hooda leans away and middles the ramp. Bhuvneshwar gets a hand to it while leaping and stretching upwards, but he can't hold on to this half-chance. Ends up tipping it over the boundary
back of a length outside off, cut away to the left of deep point. Swift running to pick up two
preText: Natarajan, from round the wicket.

text: back of a length angling into middle stump, clipped away to the left of deep square leg
slower ball angling into middle and leg, lets it come and clips down to long-on
preText: Tarun: "@Tushar - on the contrary, I don't like their uniform one bit.. nothing with the color.. the color is soothing, but when you look closer, the prints all over the uniform poke your eyes.. "

text: full, close to off stump, opens his bat face and squeezes it to the left of deep point
preText: Ashish: "145 kmph consistently. Umran Malik is the Shaun Tait of this season. Full of pace but leaking runs as well. Hopefully he improves and he has time on his side to get better." -- Both Rahul and Hooda had to play hard-to-execute shots to get their runs in the previous over. I thought he bowled it pretty well.

text: cutter, straightens in the fourth-stump channel. Rahul was looking to use the initial angle and clip down to long-on, ends up getting a leading edge that rolls along to deep point
length ball on off stump, punched to extra-cover

bang. Steps away from leg stump to make room, and Shepherd looks to follow him, but he bowls a length ball that Hooda can get underneath and slog away over the square leg boundary. Bat turned in his hand and the bat face closed a little early, but he still hit it a long long way
preText: Isaac Marshall: "Shepherd is a front line bowler though too, he's in his teams to bowl four overs and most games, he does." -- Here he is again.

text: full, angling into off stump, clipped to long-on
preText: That's the fifty partnership.

text: back of a length close to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on
slower legcutter angling down leg, looks to step across and sweep over short fine, can't connect. Hits his thigh pad on its way to the keeper
steps out while making room. Bowls another legcutter straightening towards middle stump. Punched to long-off
on the fuller side of a length on middle stump, looks to clip it to long-on, plays a touch early and nearly pops a return catch to the bowler, but it drops just short
steps out and the ball nips back in towards the stumps. Looks to hit down the ground, ends up dragging it to the right of midwicket
preText: Bhuvneshwar.

text: full on off stump, whipped to the right of midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, chopped to the left of deep point
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
low full-toss on middle and leg, clipped to the right of long-on
length ball on off stump, punched to the right of sweeper cover
full on off stump, makes a lot of room and that's a terrific shot. Opens his bat face to slice the ball to the right of backward point
preText: Malik returns.

text: in the blockhole on leg stump, makes room and plays another open-face drive to deep point
length ball, offcutter, finishing around middle and leg. Looks to make room but can't manage it, swatted into the on side off the inside half of the bat
shot. Length ball angling into leg stump, makes a lot of room and flat-bats it firmly between the stumps and the non-striker

shortText: Umran Malik to Hooda, no run
text: back of a length in the corridor, beats the outside edge as Hooda makes room and tries to drive through the covers

what an innings this is from Hooda. Another terrific shot. Shortish, angling into the hip, and you would think he has no room to hit it cleanly, but he whips it away over the backward square leg boundary, finishing with his front leg prancing in the air
appeal for lbw as Rahul misses the flick, but the ball pitched outside leg. Ricochets into the backward point region
preText:
Natarajan, over the wicket.

HMody: "Recovery done well. The key now is how they will be able to capitalize knowing their batting depth."

Ashish: "Hooda seems to have a liking for Umran's bowling for sure. I so wish that Umran becomes one of India's spearhead in the future. He has pace. If he gets better then we will have one more good name in our fast bowling reserves."

text: ooh, nearly a chance! Slower ball, and he's into the flick too early. Leading edge pops up in the air, to the right of backward point, but the fielder there, Bhuvneshwar, doesn't get close to the ball in time
full on middle stump, hit firmly, on the bounce, to long-on. Too full for him to get the elevation he desired
full on middle and leg, clipped to long-on to bring up a 31-ball half-century. Outstanding innings given the team situation when he walked in
back of a length on leg stump, tries to make room, but only manages enough to punch to the right of extra-cover for a single
steps out and Natarajan spears a full one at his feet. Good over, this, not given the batters too much of a chance to free their arms. Clipped down to long-on

wkt_text: DJ Hooda c Tripathi b Shepherd 51 (50m 33b 3x4 3x6) SR: 154.54
text: got him. Caught on the midwicket boundary. Hooda steps away from the stumps, looking to make room, and gets a back-of-a-length offcutter that finishes around off stump. He has the room to free his arms, but he doesn't quite hit this pull/slog cleanly, ends up finding the man on the boundary
preText:
Shepherd.

Akrsh: "Sundar's 4th over should have been utilised long ago.. it'll be expensive if he bowls now" -- I doubt he'll bowl it, especially since Samad has also filled in with one over.

text: back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and dabs to third man
preText: Ayush Badoni is in at No. 6. Krunal Pandya and Jason Holder still to bat.

text: back of a length offcutter outside off, pulled to the left of deep midwicket to bring up his 50th T20 half-century. Wow
shot. Full outside off, gets down on his back knee to drive crisply to the left of deep point. Samad makes a sprinting, diving save, but he might just have touched the boundary along the way
back of a length close to off stump, steps across and clips to midwicket
length ball just outside off, nips away a touch. Steps out and punches it back to the bowler

bang. Spears a flat length ball at leg stump, and Rahul clears his front leg to try and swipe it over the leg side. Hits the high part of the bat but he gets it into the gap to the left of short fine leg
preText: Interesting. Washington is bowling his fourth over. Long-on, long-off, deep midwicke, deep square leg, sweeper cover.

text:
bang. Drops a touch short outside off, and he offers enough room for Rahul to free his arms and flat-bat cleanly over 
wide long-on
sweeps from outside off, a touch too full for elevation, drags it along the ground to deep square leg
steps out and Washington bowls a flat, shortish one turning into the body. Swiped along the ground to deep backward square leg
another one that's a touch too full for elevation on the slog-sweep. Hit along the ground to deep midwicket

floated up wide of off, and that's nicely done by Badoni, stretches out and sweeps to beat deep backward square leg  sprinting and diving to his left. Samad the fielder once again. Could have stopped this, but let it slip through his fingers
awkward full-toss, angling into leg stump and finishing around thigh high. Whipped away to the right of long-on
preText: Bhuvneshwar to bowl the 18th. Shepherd, Umran and Natarajan have one each left.

text: length ball outside off, and Samad puts down a difficult chance at sweeper cover. Rahul hits it up and over, and Samad creates the chance with a quick sprint to his right, but the ball bursts through his hands
blockhole ball on middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and jabs it back to the bowler
in the blockhole again, on off stump, clears his front leg and swipes to long-on, all along the ground. Hit it on the full, but it's so low he can't do much about it
low full-toss, angling in and denying Badoni the room he craves as he moves to the leg side. Whipped down to long-on
another low full-toss on the stumps, makes a bit of room and drives to long-off
postText: Terrific over, just seven runs off it.

wkt_text: KL Rahul lbw b Natarajan 68 (93m 50b 6x4 1x6) SR: 136.00
text: given! Natarajan goes for the yorker as expected, and Rahul looks to sweep and misses. Looks very out, but Rahul has reviewed... Wasn't quite a yorker, but pitched quite full. Did it pitch in line or outside leg? Juuuust in line, and it's going on to hit middle and off stumps. Rahul finishes with 68 off 50. Hasn't quite managed the late acceleration to make up for the slow start, maybe, but a decent knock given the situation LSG were in
preText: Natarajan. Over the wicket to Rahul.

text: full-toss angling into the shins, whipped away to deep square leg
preText: In walks Krunal Pandya.

text: short now, gets up to shoulder height on off stump, and that's superbly done by Krunal, gets on top of the bounce and pulls firmly to the backward square leg boundary

wkt_text: KH Pandya  b Natarajan 6 (3m 3b 1x4 0x6) SR: 200.00
text: bang. A bit of late inward swerve on the attempted yorker, and he was looking to clear his front leg and hit into the leg side. Ends up as a swinging full-toss that beats Krunal's inside edge and goes between his legs to hit the base of leg stump
goes deep in his crease to drive this attempted yorker, angling away from off stump, towards long-off
preText:
Here's Holder on LSG debut. Natarajan stays over the wicket.

Hari: "Rahul should have shifted gears way earlier while batting with Hooda. Opening the innings and being at 70 odd from 50 balls isnt that impactful of a performance"

text: nice shot, but the field is set for it. Attempted yorker slanting away from off stump, and he shuffles across to lap-sweep it to fine leg
nice shot. Length ball outside off and he steps across for the sweep to the left of fine leg
preText: Romario Shepherd to finish off the innings. Can LSG get close to 170?

text: half-volley on off stump, poor ball given the field. The batter was always going to look to make room. That's what Badoni does, and he drives crisply over extra-cover
preText: Four on the leg-side boundary, and sweeper cover.

text: slower ball close to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on

this is a difficult field to bowl to. Now he expects the batter to make room and bowls a slower ball down the leg side. Badoni just allows it to go through for a wide, and then the ball nutmegs Pooran behind the stumps
terrific shot from Holder. Drags the slower ball a touch short, outside off. Plenty of room for Holder to free his arms and clear long-on with the flat-bat hit
preText: Nick: "Really great death bowling by Bhuvneshwar and Natarajan. 15 runs and 2 wickets in the 18,19th overs? I'll take it every time."

text: follows Holder down the leg side with a blockhole-ish ball, clipped away to deep midwicket

wkt_text: A Badoni run out 19 (30m 12b 3x4 0x6) SR: 158.33
text: steps out, looking to make room, and Shepherd bowls a slower length ball wide of off. Slashes and misses, and then they hurry through for the bye. The throw from the keeper comes back to the bowler in his follow-through, and he dives and flicks it onto the stumps at his end to catch Badoni short of his crease
postText:
Meanwhile in other sporting news, the Federation Cup in Kozhikode saw high drama on Sunday. A new national record in the long jump but it wasn't good enough to win gold. And the winning jump wasn't deemed a national record. Read this story on how M Sreeshankar and Jeswin Aldrin pushed each other in an epic battle.

Anish V: "That is a tactical error by SRH I can tell you. Washy has bowled 3 tight overs upfront. He should have completed his quota way earlier. That extra over bowled at the death not only spoiled his figures but also leaked 17 runs which wouldn't have happened if he was bowled out earlier. "

Deepak Hooda: "Innings was good but was disappointed that I couldn't do my role of capitalising in the last five overs. But happy with 170-odd. To be honest I didn't think about Orange Cap [he missed out by 17 runs]. Thought of a good total. Rahul and I were set, we were getting runs, and we wanted to cash in. Rahul told me it's a good wicket and to give myself time and that straight-bat shots are going to prove good. Self belief and self confidence are both high. I prepare myself as every day as a new game anyway. It's a decent total, and the balls that are delivered into the wicket are skidding a little low and not coming on well."

9.15pm A tightly contested innings ends with LSG setting a target of 170. Terrific innings from Hooda, 51 off 33 after coming in at 27 for 3. A half-century from Rahul as well, though at a slower pace. Good recovery from LSG, but do they have enough, especially if there's dew later on? Terrific bowling displays from the two Tamil Nadu boys in the SRH line-up too. Two early wickets from Washington Sundar, and excellent defensive bowling from T Natarajan, who finishes with 4-0-26-2. Typically impressive powerplay-and-death display from Bhuvneshwar Kumar as well.

text: full on middle. Bit of movement into him. Nudged off his pads to midwicket for a quick run
preText:
Abhishek Sharma and Williamson will open. Holder has the ball.

9.26pm Hello, folks, welcome back to the chase. That was a decent recovery for Lucknow from 3 for 27. If Lucknow defend this, they'll move to tied first with four other teams on four points with only NRR separating them. Sunrisers need to earn first points, albeit this is only their second outing. Kane Williamson is under the lid, sitting down, waiting for the restart. KL Rahul leads the Super Giants huddle.

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: What's Nicholas Pooran's batting average in the middle overs in the IPL (since 2021)?

text: full on off stump. Presses into a defensive shot off the front foot
full just outside off. Defended off the front foot with soft hands. Takes the outside edge and rolls towards the slip cordon
full outside off stump. Bit of movement away and driven along the ground to cover
good length outside off and angling into his body. Fended off the back foot to short cover. Early, quick call for one
turned around the corner! Holder tries to test him with the short one on leg stump. Sharma moves towards off side, and gives it a flick from near his shoulder behind square for four
good length on middle. And flicked towards midwicket for one
preText: Krunal from the other end.

text: good length, outside off, and nudged off the back foot to point
good length on off. Gets onto the back foot. Flicked from his hips to midwicket
good length just outside off. Backs away and punches to long off for one
low full tos or might've pitched near his toes searching for the yorker essentially. Around leg stump. Bunted to wide long on for one
good length ball angling into him from off. Flicked off his waist to midwicket, which is vacant, for one
back of a length on off. Bit of extra bounce near his chest. Soft-hand flick to the leg side with short midwicket lurking
back of a length around off and angling into him. Flicked from near his gut region to deep square leg
length ball angling across, and he slaps a cut along the ground to Krunal at deep point
full and very wide outside off. Wanted Sharma to reach out, but the angle takes it quite far away from him

innovation! Good length outside off. Williamson walks across to the off side, waits for the ball to get to his waist-height, and then ramps a lap shot with ease over the keeper. Did that hit the boundary skirting on the full? Oh yes it did!
full and wide outside off. Williamson came down the track and tried to clatter a cover drive. But the ball swung away from him, goes past the outside edge too
full toss, shin high on middle and leg. Driven to mid on's right for one
good length, fifth stump line. Williamson waits for it, bends his knee, and then cuts gloriously through point's right!
preText: Avesh replaces Krunal
postText: Amit: "LSG might grow like one of best team in IPL in future. They are recovering very well even after loosing early wickets. KL Rahul showing tremendous confidence as Batsmen and using his experience to build the innings. Its just a matter of time for them to get settle down in IPL as a team"

shortText: Avesh Khan to Williamson, no run
text: good length, around off stump. Tapped off the back foot to mid on's left with soft hands

wkt_text: KS Williamson c Tye b Avesh Khan 16 (16m 16b 1x4 1x6) SR: 100.00
text: pays the price for being too cheeky! Avesh stays full and wide. Williamson walked across to the off side to play that lap/ramp over the keeper and short fine leg. But this time it comes off the bottom of the bat, and Tye at short fine got under it for a sliding catch
overpitched, fifth-stump line. Driven with the toe end of the bat to deep extra cover
preText: Tripathi joins Sharma.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: good length on middle. Flicked off his back foot to midwicket

shortText: Avesh Khan to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: full just outside off stump. Stays low and drills a drive to the fielder at cover
seam up. Length ball on middle. Worked off his waist with soft hands to square leg for a single
preText: Tye inside the powerplay. This should be interesting. Does he change the pace up or try and use whatever little he can extract with the new-ish ball?

shortText: Tye to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: good length on middle and off. Opens the bat's face and guides it to point

nearly goes for six! Full ball just outside off. He loses his shape as he tries to muscle a slog. But still gets enough connection to get it over mid off, and one he achieved that, it was a question of four or six. Still Tye won't mind that, Sharma was not in control
good length on middle and leg. Dabbed off the back foot to the off side for a quick single
good length ball on off and angling into his pads. Tripathi tries to turn it off his hips down to fine leg, but misses. However, it hits the thigh pad and rolls past the keeper for four legbyes
good length, just outside off. Back-foot push to the off side
postText: Tushar: "Not a criticism but the big 4 as they were called look to be on downward road atleast in T20's. Root and Smith are not being considered (in IPL). Virat and Kane are not doing much. We need new terms of Big 4 dedicated to T20's. Who would they be on current form?"-- I'd throw Rizwan in there for sure. What do you guys think?

shortText: Avesh Khan to Abhishek Sharma, OUT
wkt_text: Abhishek Sharma c Pandey b Avesh Khan 13 (25m 11b 2x4 0x6) SR: 118.18
text: into orbit and Manish Pandey holds on. Avesh Khan gets his second. Went fullish on off, but went with the cutter. Sharma didn't pick the change in pace and went for the loft after clearing his front leg. Sliced in the air, and Pandey runs in from outside the circle and takes the catch around the cover region
good length, fifth-stump line outside off. Puinched off the back foot, but played behind square

shortText: Avesh Khan to Tripathi, no run
text: dropped! Tough one for Hooda, with the ball dipping after Tripathi tried to play a cut. Hooda at gully dived to his left... but in and out
postText: Matthew: "Babar, Rizwan, Buttler, and KL Rahul for me "

shortText: Avesh Khan to Tripathi, no run
text: full ball just outside off. Uppish drive that goes to mid off on the bounce

shortText: Avesh Khan to Tripathi, no run
text: bowling hard into the deck. Good length outside off, and some extra bounce as Tripathi tries to ride the bounce and cut. Finds the infielder
good length ball on off. Pulls from near the chest to deep backward square leg
preText: last ball of the powerplay
postText: Atit: "One from Pakistan so Rizwan for sure @Matthew. How about Warner OR Maxwell?"

text: full outside off. Starts off with the legbreak. Driven rather confidently to deep extra cover
preText: The TV shows Pooran taking some advice from Lara. He's carded in next, with Samad and Shepherd to follow. Here's Ravi Bishnoi.

text: full on middle. Bit of turn away. Markram clears the front leg and drills it down the ground along the grass. Long on and long off get together and do a 1-2 combo effort to stop the four
preText: Free hit loading.

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Markram, 1 no ball
text: full outside off. Now the googly. Slaps a drive to KL manning the cover region. But the buzzer comes on....cardinal sin - front-foot no ball!
fullish outside off, googly turns in as he scurries to play a cut to deep point
gets it over! Full outside off but turning in. Tripathi looks to play with the straight bat, and uses the bottom hand to loft it over the bowler - but just about
half-tracker on a fourth-stump line. Worked off the back foot to square leg for only one
full and wide outside off. Slaps a drive but Rahul commits to a dive to his right, and stops a certain four
postText: Kartik: "Babar, Rizwan, Latham, Warner"

text: good length ball outside off. Put a lot of shoulder into that delivery, grunting as he delivers. Punched off the back foot to deep extra cover
back of a length outside off. Tripathi backs himself and drags a pull from way outside off. Places it at the vacant cow-corner region
postText: Sanjay : "When Abhishek Sharma's hit went into the night sky, I didn't know how far it has gone, and where Manish Pandey was fielding, but I instantly thought it would be Pandey. If anyone could have taken that catch in that team, it was him. He has established such a reputation in IPL."

text: deft! Tye goes for a short ball, pretty good ball, aimed for near Tripathi's ears. But Tripathi waits, and then just sticks the bat out late to play a cheeky ramp/guide over the vacant slip region for four
pace off, full outside off. Mistimed drive that's sliced to backward point on the boundary line
postText: Isaac Marshall: "Honestly for white ball batsmen, I think it's just big three at the moment with Babar, Rizwan and Buttler. Rahul is almost there but not quite."

text: full on middle and leg. Flayed away to wide long on, with two fielders protection the region there
low full toss on middle and leg as he misses the yorker. Hard flick off his boots, and gets it between deep midwicket and deep square leg! Four to bring up the time out
Krunal around the stumps after the time out. Fullish on middle. Straightens after pitching. Worked off the back foot to deep midwicket
preText: Simon Katich: "This has always been SRH's best opening pair. They should roll with this, bring Kane one down, and replace Abishek with Gopal for another true spinner option. "

text: enough to clear fine leg! Full on middle and leg. Tripathi gets low, and then uses his wrists to flick it over Gowtham manning the boundary!
length ball on the stumps. GUided off the back foot to the ap at midwicket. Calls fo two early, and successfully done
full on middle. Flicks this from near his toes to deep midwicket once again
full on middle and leg. Closes the bat's face in his flick, but finds short fine leg
good length on off. Punched off the back foot - after backing away - to wide long off for one
good length just outside off. Backs away and clatters a cut to the sweeper fielder to the deep
preText:
Bishnoi replaces Tye.

Kartik: "What advice u reckon Lara was giving Pooran? Dont get a duck AGAIN?!" -- Maybe how to approach Bishnoi's googlies?

text: fullish, outside off and turning in. Late dab to short third's right for a single
good length, outside off stump. Cut to deep point for a single
full outside off. He moves to the right side to try and playing a ramp by getting low but gets a glove onto his pad, and past de Kock.
good length, on off. Cut to the off side

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, no run
text: good length outside off. Legbreak. Fended off the back foot

wkt_text: AK Markram c Rahul b Pandya 12 (23m 14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 85.71
text: inside out but can't clear cover! Krunal goes around the stumps, on off stump. Markram backs away and tries to play an inside out cover drive, but doesn't have the elevation! Rahul puts both hands up and the ball sticks!
preText: 88 needed off 60. Who you backing, fans? ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster has Sunrisers as 59% favourites.

text: full on middle. Defended off the front foot
preText: ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster has the game at almost 50-50! Nicky P walks out. Expect googlies from Bishnoi and short balls from the pacers for him.

text: full and wide outside off. Forcing him to stretch. Swatted towards the non-striker but Krunal runs to his right to intercept
flatter ball. Length on off. Pulled along the ground off the back foot for one to the man in the deep
full on middle. Skidding into him as he misses a defensive shot. Hits the front pad, soft lbw appeal but not given. Going down leg, this slider
back of length outside off but comes in sharply with the arm such that Tripathi cuts this from around off stump! To the point fielder

shortText: Avesh Khan to Pooran, no run
text: peach of a ball to start a new spell. Length ball on middle but there's lateral movement away after pitching the deck. Pooran pokes at it, almost, and the ball whizzes past the outside edge
preText: Just one run off that Krunal over. Avesh Khan now.

text: back of a length on middle and off. Pulled in front of square to wide long on for one
preText: Kartik: "Think Sunrisers need to target Tye and Bishnoi here"

text: full on a fifth-stump line. Slaps a drive through the covers. Bit of an uppish shot, and Evin Lewis' slight misfield in the deep allows them to take the second
back of a length, fifth stump line. Stays on the back foot and plays a cut. Gets it between backward point and gully!

shortText: Avesh Khan to Tripathi, no run
text: back of a length, outside off. Wants to play a late dab to try and beat short third man but can't on this occasion
aiming for the yorker, ends up as a low full toss. Drilled to wide long on for a single
postText: Vijay S: "Washy should be next in if a wicket falls before the 15th over. Let Shepard and Samad hit the big shots near the end" -- you make a good point. They may do better against the seamers.

text: tossed up, wider outside off stump. Driven to deep extra cover for a single
preText: Bishnoi to Tripathi. Required run rate still under 10.

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Pooran, no run
text: full on off and the googly turns further away as Pooran presses forward to defend. Whizzes past the edge leaving the keeper and bowler groaning
could've been out around his legs! Bishnoi goes full outside leg and Pooran tries to sweep. He misses, but its dangerously a googly, and very nearly clipped leg stump
fullish on off stump and the googly is punched off the back foot to long off
full outside off. Legbreak is tapped off the front foot to cover point for a single

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Pooran, no run
text: full outside off and the googly turns further away. Pooran tries to cut but misses out

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Pooran, no run
text: full outside off. Turning away and Pooran throws his bat at this to cut. Misses again!
postText: Aagam: "Pooran has a split personality problem One Pooran is seen in internationals, fearless and dominatingThe other is in IPL, who struggles against everything" -- To be honest it is tough to play Bishnoi's googly for a left-hander. However, yes, against seamers you'd want him to do better knowing fully well that the bowling side will try and make him stretch way outside off stump and keep it out of his arc

wkt_text: RA Tripathi c Ravi Bishnoi b Pandya 44 (48m 30b 5x4 1x6) SR: 146.66
text: slog sweep straight to deep midwicket. Full on off, Tripathi went for the big shot, and Bishnoi is a good catcher in the deep. Did Pooran's scoring rate force Tripathi to do that? We'll never know ..... this is a shot that Tripathi does enjoy, just didn't come off this time.
good length, on middle. Clipped off the back foot to square leg for a single
full toss on off and slapped to long off. Mistimed though
postText: H. Prasanna : "Bishnoi earned that wicket as much as Krunal..."

text: slows it down. Fullish, but wider. Sundar waits, and plays a late-ish cut towards point for one
baseball style! as Krunal offers it in his arc. Comes over the stumps. Length ball from outside off turns into him. He stands and drags a hammered shot over wide long on
full on off stump. Flicks this with a flourish of his wrists, only to deep midwicket for one

back of a length on middle and he swivels quickly to pull along the ground in front of square. Holder didn't really bend his back for his first ball, with the delivery not really bouncing despite being back of a length
preText: Holder to Pooran.

text: full outside off. Reaches out to drive, and thereby converts it into a low full toss. Sliced to deep cover
back of a length outside off. Cuts, but in front of square, where there are big gaps. Lewis has to run around from deep point to cut it off

full, wide-ish and he reaches out to try and clatter a drive. Toe-ended to mid off, and the poor timing actually tempts him to take the single. Pooran running to the danger end, but the throw is not a direct hit. Would've been tight if that hit
preText: around the stumps

text: full on his toes. Flicked away to deep midwicket for one
smartly played! Holder over-corrects. Full on his toes, and Pooran's flick is placed square, instead of in front of it, and the ball rolls away to the boundary! 15 off that over
postText: Kartik: "May be Lara's advice is working!"

text: full ball, wider outside off. Beyond the tramlines with Pooran not attacking

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, 1 run
text: full on leg. Flicked off his pads before the ball could turn in either direction
preText: Sunrisers' game to lose from here, you'd have to think. Forecaster still suggests its a very close game. Meanwhile, Lewis is off the field getting treatment on his right leg. Bishnoi to bowl out.

text: fullish on off. Turning away. Stays on the back foot and cuts to deep point for a single

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, no run
text: top ball! Full outside off and turning away. But the length is such that Sundar is tempted to drive. Nearly falls over after missing the shot, and the back leg may have been up while the keeper whipped the bails off. Side-on umpire wants to go upstairs to check. The back leg came back inside the popping crease in time.

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, 2 runs
text: tossed up. Full on middle and leg. Places a flick to wide long on, and the placement allows them to take the second

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, 1 run
text: full on middle and off. The googly is driven to wide long off, albeit mistimed
full on off and the googly is met with a controlled drive. Along the grass, past the cover fielder, and too much for long off to do! Ends the over on a high!
postText: Time out again. Last of the evening.

text: Slower ball. Full and wide outside off. Hard hands as he sticks the bat out. Hard ping off the bat and goes to cover. They're off for a single, and take off for one, but its a direct hit from cover! Totally safe though
preText: They need 10.25 per over. The Sunrisers owner Kaviya Maran looks nervous. Tye is back. Expect some change ups, a useful thing to have as long as you don't overdo it.

text: full and wide outside off. Forcing him to stretch. Mistimed drive away from his body to wide long off
top yorker, on middle and leg. Plays the Nat-Meg between his legs as he gets the bat down and its squirted away to square leg
back of a length around off stump. Walks across the stumps to play a flick behind the keeper but couldn't connect
full and wide outside off. Throws his bat at this in a bid to try and drag a shot through wide long on. Mistimed, ball goes away to deep midwicket
postText: Vijay: "The nawabi derby - the clash of the Biryanis - is spicing up."

text: great use of the wrists! Uses the bottom hand too, to get it up and over cover. Full outside off. Sundar cleared the front leg early and then just stroked the ball through its line. There was long off and deep cover in place, but both were spectators
short ball as predicted but not quick enough. Pooran stands tall, and smacks a pull from near his chest, and gets enough behind it to clear deep square leg
preText: What a crucial boundary that was. Now they need 33 in 18. Avesh is back. Pooran on strike. Expect either short balls or those quite wide outside off. Pooran will enjoy the pace if it is in his arc.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Pooran, no run
text: good comeback as he bowls a yorker on the fourth-stump line. Pooran can't get anything on it

wkt_text: N Pooran c Hooda b Avesh Khan 34 (42m 24b 3x4 2x6) SR: 141.66
text: lucky wicket for Avesh! As the knee-high full toss is mistimed down to long off. Avesh wanted the yorker but overpitched it, Pooran's adrenaline makes him go for the big shot anyway. Not off the sweet spot, and Hooda gets behind it. The Lucknow supporters go up in delight, the Sunrisers owners sink into their seats

shortText: Avesh Khan to Abdul Samad, OUT
wkt_text: Abdul Samad c †de Kock b Avesh Khan 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: two in two! Raw pace, nearly a yorker outside off. Samad tries to drive, but its taken a tiny edge through to the keeper! Two more balls left to get a five-for! Samad falls for a golden duck tonight

shortText: Avesh Khan to Shepherd, no run
text: yorker for the hat-trick ball. But Shepherd digs it out and the ball settles near his toes
preText: So its been a top comeback after that six. Three dots, of which two are wickets. Here's Romario Shepherd.
postText: Jigar: "In first game people were criticizing LSG for paying 10 CR to Avesh Khan or saying his bowling was mainly reflection of good bowling of rabada and nortje. Today he's answering all his critics"

shortText: Avesh Khan to Shepherd, no run
text: end of a top spell as Avesh finishes with 4/24. Fullish outside off but the ball takes off after hitting the pitch. Shepherd shapes up to play a cut, but is beaten by the pace of the delivery
short and wide. Way beyond the tram-lines. He'll have to rebowl....
postText: Vern: "Romario Shepard is capable of finishing this for SRH with balls to spare. "

text: full outside off. Rolls his fingers over this ball. Smacks one to deep extra cover for just one
preText: Sunrisers need 26 off 12. The Sunrisers box looks quite nervous. To be fair, even the Lucknow camp (Gambhir et al) are quite....Gambhir
postText: Raja Muthu: "As long as a West Indian is batting, the match isn't over."

text: yorker length, fifth-stump line. Shepherd moved to the off side to get closer to the ball, but couldn't get any connection
yorker length, trying the wide yorker. Nearly successful, but just over the wide line
postText: Kirthi: "Last over highest was 26 in 2009 for Deccan Chargers. " -- Was that the Mashrafe over against KKR?

text: slower ball, delivery slipped out of his hand. Loopy full toss, wide outside off. Mistimed slap to long off
full outside off. Sundar gets low and tries to get under it for a loft. Struck well, but one bounce to long on
game is alive as long as a West Indian is here! Full toss on his shins. But Shepherd's bat swing is simply sensational. Golf-swing with great connect....and its over long on for half a dozen!

OUT! NO! Dropped! Slower ball, full and wide. Shepherd tried to smack it over cover, but didn't have the elevation. Straight into Bishnoi's gut, but he can't hold on! #InAndOut and Shepherd survives. Importantly its a dot.
preText: big ball coming up.

wkt_text: Washington Sundar c Rahul b Holder 18 (38m 14b 1x4 0x6) SR: 128.57
text: perfect start for Super Giants as Sundar holes out at long on. This was fullish on a fourth-stump line with Holder coming around the stumps. Sundar tried to clear the straight boundary, but the bat's face turned. Not a great connection, and provides enough time for both Manish Pandey (deep midwicket) and KL Rahul (long on) to both attack the ball, with the latter eventually taking the catch
preText: Holder needs to defend 15. Sunrisers need 16. Who is thinking about a Super Over?
postText: Kartik: "Shepherd gave 17 off the last over. SRH need 16 now....fun n games"

text: full and wide outside off. Bit of a dab to deep backward point for one
preText: The batters crossed, but according to the new IPL rules, the new batter must be on strike

text: low full toss, outside off. Tries to go for a big shot, but totally mistimed. Ball rolls away to deep midwicket, and unfortunately for Sunrisers, Shepherd is stranded at the bowler's end
preText: Holder runs in but pulls out. He'll have to reload. Just slowing proceedings. Lots of running around happening between the Super Giants players

wkt_text: B Kumar c †de Kock b Holder 1 (6m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: that should seal it unless there are extras. Holder knew Bhuvi must go for a big shot, and therefore he totally takes the pace off. Full loopy ball on off. Bhuvi is through the slog too early. Ball pops right up in the air, and de Kock gets under the swirling white ball. A fist pump from a few key Super Giants players.
preText: Ajit: "SRH has their batting order completely wrong. Washy is not a finisher. Abhishek was decent last year at 5 or 6. Tripathi is your opener and Kane is your middle order shepherd! Too many cooks? "

text: full outside off. No eyes on the ball as he tries to swing across the line. Sliced to short third man
preText: Guess that's two losses in two games for Sunrisers Hyderabad.

text: length ball on the stumps, a bit shape in to the batter, which actually helps Agarwal who flicks it fine and gets off the mark with four
preText:
7.30pm Shikhar Dhawan and Mayank Agarwal are in the middle. Mukesh Choudhary will start for CSK. A wide slip.

We are playing on a corner pitch today. One square boundary is 81 metres, the other just 65. The straight boundaries are around 80 metres.

Thanks, Deiva. By the way, the groundspeople sprayed the anti-dew spray much closer to the start of play today. Let's see what effect it will have on dew.

7.20pm We're ten minutes away from the first ball. Time to hand over the controls to Hemant Brar.

Ashish: "I still remember Vaibav Arora's beauty of an inswinger to dismiss N Jagadeesan (current CSK player) who was the highest run scorer in that season of the Syed Mustaq ali. CSK's openers should be wary of him."

7.15pm Interesting selection from Punjab Kings. They've picked Vaibhav Arora over a more experienced swing bowler in Sandeep Sharma. Arora has a sharp inswinger in his repertoire and he ripped out Tamil Nadu's top order in the 2020-21 Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy quarter-final in Ahmedabad. Arora set up the game beautifully for HP, but Shahrukh Khan's mighty blows eventually tipped it TN's way. Arora and Shahrukh are now team-mates at PBKS. Arora was with KKR last season and they bid for him at the most recent auction too, but the winning bid (INR 2 crore) came from Kings.

Ankit: "CSK and MI seem to have lost their X-factor in Boult and du Plessis. Two all time greats but twice as destructive when paired with Bumrah and Gaikwad."

Arumugam Thonda: "Chris Jordan and Dwayne Bravo offer very similar skillsets. I'm not sure i understand why CSK didn't go with an extra spinner instead."

Bert Wade: "would really live to see odean smith do well with the ball. this guy is super talented but showed his inexperience in his previous appearance. hopefully he have a decent outing for his team today "

Shankar: "CSK is very light on spin. Neither Mooen nor Jadeja are genuine wicket takers in this format. I will prefer Theekshana/Solaniki in place of Jordan/Mukesh."

7pm CSK win the toss and will bowl first. Jadeja wins his first toss and wears a big grin on his face. Jordan has recovered from illness and will make his debut for CSK, against his former team.

PBKS: 1 Mayank Agarwal(capt), 2 Shikhar Dhawan, 3 Bhanuka Rajapaksa (wk), 4 Liam Livingstone, 5 M Shahrukh Khan, 6 Jitesh Sharma, 7 Odean Smith, 8 Arshdeep Singh, 9 Kagiso Rabada, 10 Rahul Chahar, 11 Vaibhav Arora

CSK: 1 Ruturaj Gaikwad, 2 Robin Uthappa, 3 Moeen Ali, 4 Ambati Rayudu, 5 Ravindra Jadeja(capt), 6 MS Dhoni(wk), 7 Shivam Dube, 8 Dwayne Bravo, 9 Chris Jordan, 10 Dwaine Pretorius, 11 Mukesh Choudhary

Jadeja: We want to keep things simple and the boys know what to do when they're under the pump. One change: Jordan replaces Tushar.

Agarwal: I think it looks like a good batting wicket. We want to put a good total and use the scoreboard pressure. We have Vaibhav and Jitesh for Harpreet Brar and Raj Bawa.

Mahesh: "Jadeja after winning the toss "trying to keep things simple" sounds to me Dhoni's way"

HP swing bowler Vaibhav Arora and Vidarbha keeper-batter Jitesh Sharma have received their maiden IPL caps. Warm applause for them in the PBKS huddle.

6.50pm Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Who has scored the most runs in powerplays in the IPL?

JoMarch: "So, is this it for Devon Conway? Just the one chance at the top of the order? A shame for a player of his quality." --- Deepak Chahar's injury-enforced absence has shaken up the balance of the team

SpaceyAVP: "For PBKS, I would bring in Bairstow for Liam Livingstone if at all, else not change the foreign players. I wouldn't drop Smith- he's been in great form and he has express pace too. But I would definitely drop Harpreet Brar and get in another bowler - maybe Sandeep. Either way rooting for Sadda Punjab!"

6.40pm Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Paarth: "Whilst I understand why CSK were hesitant giving a spinner another over in the last game. Giving Dube the ball for the penultimate over was terrible, the guy isn't a bowler he's a batsman who could be used in the middle overs very occasionally. If dew is a concern then use your spinners at the top"

johal: "I would go in with Bairstow,bhanuka ,livingston and KG for the 4 overseas and replace brar with sandeep as he is good in powerplay then u can keep KG and arshdeep for death bowling and replace bawa with rishi Dhawan."

Samrat Ahuja: " Hangargekar seems to be a popular choice based on his recent exploits at under19 WC, However, Mukesh Choudhary showed 'spark' in his first appearance. Knowing CSK, won't expect a lot of changes in playing 11 from them!"

Varshith : "Hello guys, good evening and backing Shikhar get a good one tonight, he's improved his range of shots and loves playing vs CSK." --- He sure does

Sanket: "CSK should give U-19 champ Rajvardhan Hangargekar a go, he has that pace which can really unsettle the opposition and also can swing the ball upfront."

Samrat Ahuja: "Preview said Punjab would slot in Bairstow for Odeon Smith. Should it not be in place of Livingstone, Smith won the man of the match award in first match, before being ripped apart by Russell!!" --- I'd still stick to Odean. His rapid pace can test CSK's batting line-up and Milne aside, CSK don't have a 'shock bowler' who can pin down Odean. I'd still go with Rajapaksa and Livingstone and hold back Bairstow.

6.35pm In case you're into fantasy cricket, we recommend you to pick Ruturaj Gaikwad as your captain even though he has managed only scores of 0, 1 upon return from injury.

6.30pm For the first time in their IPL history, Chennai Super Kings have started a season with back-to-back losses. It is not panic stations yet. So says Eric Simmons, their bowling consultant, speaking to Super Kings' social channel. Is Adam Milne fit again? Has Chris Jordan recovered from illness? Should CSK bring in mystery spinner Maheesh Theekshana or leggie Prashant Solanki? How about Hangargekar for Dube? Plenty of questions to answer for them.

CSK's opponents Punjab Kings have had two contrasting games so far, opening with a victory against RCB and then collapsing to a defeat against KKR. Johnny Bairstow has completed quarantine upon arrival from the Caribbean, but Bhanuka Rajapaksa offers left-handedness in addition to similar muscle in the middle order. Kings will have to make the tough selection call. I'm Deivarayan Muthu and I'll be joined by Hemant Brar to bring you ball-by-ball action. Srinidhi's preview will tell you everything you need to know for now.

wkt_text: MA Agarwal c Uthappa b Mukesh Choudhary 4 (4m 2b 1x4 0x6) SR: 200.00
text: what a comeback! It was a length ball, bowled wide outside off. Agarwal went for the drive but couldn't keep it down. A simple catch for Uthappa at cover

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Rajapaksa, no run
text: length outside off, a hint of away movement. Goes for the cut but gets an under edge that bounces towards the keeper
...and he strays down the leg side. Fuller but way too down the leg side
preText: Bhanuka Rajapaksa. Two slip

text: excellent running between the stumps. A length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg and they sprint back for the second
fuller and wider outside off, pushes at it and gets an outside edge as the ball swings away. Too far away from the second slip

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Dhawan, no run
text: length ball in the channel, Dhawan leaves it alone
preText: Amit : "Have to say, that was casual from Mayank"

text: short of length angling down the leg side. Rajapaksa goes for the pull. The bottom hand comes off as he gets a top edge. Sails over the fine-leg boundary
preText: Chris Jordan. Around the wicket with a slip
postText: Prithvi: "Mayank completely lost his touch after that 1st innings against SA in the 1st test where he scored 60."

wkt_text: PBB Rajapaksa run out 9 (8m 5b 0x4 1x6) SR: 180.00
text: that's some athleticism and presence of mind from Dhoni. Was a length ball on the stumps, Rajapaksa pushed it on the leg side and set off. Dhawan took a couple of steps down but he waiting for it be clear of Jordan, who ran across - in front of Dhawan - fielded that ball and had a shy at the stumps. Rajapaksa turned around but was never going to beat the throw. The ball missed the stumps, but Dhoni was charging in. He collected with both hands and threw it underarm at the stumps while diving forward to find the batter short
length ball around off, defended
preText: Livingstone

text: length ball on the stumps, flicked uppishly behind square leg. It lands just short and the fielder collects it and flicks it back as the momentum takes him over the line
short of length outside off, defended
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
postText: Balaji Prasad: "From no wickets in the powerplay in the first 2 matches, CSK might take more wickets than any other team in powerplay this IPL in this match"

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Livingstone, no run
text: fuller and wider outside off, left alone
preText: Afeef: "This kind of athleticism by Dhoni at the age of 40 is truly remarkable."

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Livingstone, no run
text: fuller outside off, pushed towards covers

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Livingstone, no run
text: short of length outside off, defended
short, down the leg side and Livingstone has pulled over fine leg, all the way for a six. No half-measures when it comes to Livingstone

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Livingstone, no run
text: length ball around off, punched towards extra cover from the front foot

over extra cover this time! It looked like it bounced just inside the boundary line but it has been given a six. Wait, the third umpire is having a look and he decides it's four. It was a length ball and Livingstone stepped down the track and smashed it over extra cover
length ball around off, dropped towards cover-point for a single
almost nails the yorker, Livingstone just manages to clip it towards square leg
Dhawan dances down the track this time and cuts it hard. Bravo at point puts in the dive and gets a hand to it, which slows it down. Two in the end
length outside off, cuts it straight towards the point fielder this time
length outside off, stays back and punches it towards backward point. Ruturaj Gaikwad intercepts it
fuller outside off, driven firmly but straight towards the cover fielder
postText: SidB: "Mayank seems to be looking to play one shot too many at the start of his innings without getting his eye in. Even in the previous game he was looking to hit out at every other ball in his brief stay"

text: this is one of the most disdainful sixes you would ever see. And one of the longest too, 108 metres. He is standing on the off stump and pulls this length ball way over, I mean way, way over, the deep-midwicket boundary

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Livingstone, no run
text: a good comeback from the bowler. Bowls a cutter in the channel. Livingstone looks to slice it but gets an outside edge. Luckily for him, it bounces just in front of Dhoni
down the track and converts this into a leg-stump half-volley. But he goes inside out and blasts it over mid-off

fuller and wider outside off and Livingstone scythes it over extra cover. The sweeper sprints to his right but cannot reach there in time. A couple of bounces and over the boundary line. That's the longest side
the same drill as the last ball. Livingstone gives the charge and the ball bowls way outside off, even wider than the previous ball
use of feet once again and Choudhary slips in wide outside off, too wide actually
four more! Fifty comes up for Punjab in just 4.5 over! Fuller and wider and he throws his bat at it. And it sails over short third man

Six? Four? fuller around off, this time Livingstone takes a step towards the off side and launches it over deep midwicket. Looks like it hit the boundary cushion on the full, and that makes it 26 off the over
length outside off, cuts it towards extra cover
preText: Dhoni comes up to the stumps

text: down the track but Bravo bowls it way outside off
preText: Bravo. Around the wicket

text: free swing of the arms. Fuller around off, Dhawan takes a step towards the ball and launches it over long-on. Easily done - 84 metres
fuller and wider outside off and smashed through covers. Too much width from Bravo

Dhawan shuffles around in his crease before finishing outside off. Bravo slips in a slower one outside off, Dhawan leaves that alone hoping for hit to be called a wide but the umpire thinks he was close enough to the ball to play a shot

a low full toss on the stumps, flicked towards mid-on where Jadeja is stationed. Dhawan was looking for a single but decides against it. Jadeja fires in a throw at the non-striker's end but Livingstone was back I think
length ball on the stumps, Dhawan pulls it down past short fine leg, who dives but cannot stop it
preText: Dhoni is standing back now

text: but it doesn't seem to matter for Livingstone. He goes down the track first ball and launches it over long-off. Another massive six
preText: Jadeja. The powerplay is done

text: length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, use of feet and flicks it towards deep square leg for a couple
length ball on the stumps, goes forward and back and eventually flicks it behind square leg

Dropped by Rayudu! Goes down the track again but gets an outside edge that lobs to the right of short third man. Rayudu circles around it, gets under it but it pops out. Was a straightforward chance but he messed it up completely
a low full toss outside off, Dhawan moves across and looks to paddle it fine. Gets hit on the pads. Will get a leg-bye
preText: Pretorius, around the wicket

text: fuller down the leg side, goes for the flick but gets a fine edge. Dhoni dives to his left and catches it but looks the half of the ball was out of the gloves and when he fell down, it brushed the ground. Dhoni in his heart knows it and hardly celebrates even though the bowler is excited. Dhoni signals the square leg umpire to check upstairs and the replay confirms the ball did touch the ground
fuller around off, gently guides it towards cover for a single

fuller outside off, Dhawan goes down and slogs it across to the left of long-on. Bravo moves across and stops it just inside. For a moment it looked like the momentum would take him over the boundary line but he showed great control and kept jogging around the boundary line, just inside
preText: SuGP: "Those 2 wickets inside PP doesn't seem to had any effect on the score, going at almost 12 an over"

text: down the track and takes it on the full. Tapped towards long-off
fuller but way outside off. Called a wide
fuller on the stumps, flicked with the wrists towards long-on
postText:
Sarah : "@SuGP I dunno about that. Could have been worse for csk if livingstone and rajapaksa were batting together"

Kumar : "This is a game of small margins all around. That third over for Mukesh when he was already struggling with line and length opened the flood gates. "

Kishore Bhartol: "Was their a soft signal from the on field umpire Or did I missed it while watching live on TV? " --- No soft signals in the IPL

Time for a strategic break

text: length outside off, goes for the cut but mistimes it towards mid-off
length outside off, goes for the cut again but misses
fuller outside off, smashes hard but cannot beat extra cover
fuller outside off, looks to drill it through covers but mistimes it towards extra cover. Gets a single
length but well outside off, left alone for a wide
fuller length on the leg stump, Dhawan moves across, goes down and laps it between the keeper and short fine leg
short of length, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
fuller around off, skips down the track and stays leg side of the ball. Drives it through extra cover and hundred comes up for Kings
fuller but way outside off, left alone
preText: Bravo. Over the wicket

text: fuller around off, driven towards deep extra cover
Fifty comes up for Livingstone, off just 27 balls. Fuller length on the stumps, he goes down and looks to sweep it. Gets a top edge that sails over the keeper's head and carries all the way
preText: Around the wicket to Livingstone

text: a slower one outside off, more like a dipping yorker. Livingstone swings across but was a touch early and fails to connect
a low full toss on the stumps, swings it towards deep-backward square leg. Not the best of the timings on this

wkt_text: S Dhawan c Jadeja b Bravo 33 (59m 24b 4x4 1x6) SR: 137.50
text: fuller outside off, Dhawan looks to go over extra cover but mistimes it and it goes straight up. Jadeja runs sideways to his right at extra cover and pouches it
postText: Deiva is back to take this innings to its completion

text: Jadeja drops it short and wide of Livingstone, he reaches out for the ball and crunnnnnches it away to the left of sweeper cover
preText: Thanks Hemant. Super Kings finally hang onto a catch. Their captain and best fielder Jadeja has settled under the skier coolly. In comes Jitesh, ahead of Shahrukh

text: similar ball, but this is carved more or less straight to that sweeper cover fielder
pushed through outside off, driven down to long-off off the front foot

wkt_text: LS Livingstone c Rayudu b Jadeja 60 (52m 32b 5x4 5x6) SR: 187.50
text: Rayudu clings on at short third man and flashes a wry smile. Relief for Rayudu and CSK. 100ks dart, shorter and outside off, Livingstone aims for a cut and ends up slicing a thick outside edge to short third man. CSK are well and truly back in this contest

shortText: Jadeja to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: on a length and drifts into off stump, played back to the bowler
preText: Shiva Jayaraman, our stats whiz: "This is the first time any team has breached the 100-run mark inside the first ten overs despite losing two wickets by the end of the second over in the innings."

shortText: Jadeja to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: back of a length and quicker on the stumps, blocked back off the front foot
pushed through on middle and leg, knocked to midwicket
preText: Moeen comes on

text: down the track and swiped over the longer leg-side boundary for six. Jitesh holds nothing back, staying true to Punjab's playbook
forced back to the bowler after stepping out
whisked down to long-on
postText: Vedansh : "This Punjab team is playing the brand of cricket which England plays under Morgan. Everyone attacks without caring about wickets column "

shortText: Ali to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: worked with the spin to midwicket
dragged down on middle, hauled away to deep square leg off the back foot

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run
text: just short of a length and outside off, punched down to long-on off the back foot
preText: Choudhary is back for his last over
postText: Shankar: "PBKS should be careful here. They have Smith and nothing else after these two. Try to consolidate for 3 overs and launch back in last 5 overs"

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Sharma, no run
text: back of a length and angling across off, run away to short third man

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Sharma, no run
text: Choudhary hits an in-between length and aims for the stumps, forced back to him
slower short ball into the body, Jitesh lines it up and muscles a pull over long leg for six. Clean strike from Jitesh

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Sharma, no run
text: back of a length and angling across off, but fairly close to off, played back to Choudhary
pitched-up delivery, sliding across off, Jitesh chips a drive down to long-off
preText: Pratheek Jain: "I think the bowler tried to double bluff with the short ball. Didn't come off."

text: full and fired outside off, driven on the up to wide long-off
preText: Raja Muthu: "Everyone's talking about Deapak Chahar's absence, but Hazlewood's void is hurting CSK pretty much as well."

shortText: Jadeja to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: pushed through on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket off the front foot
sliding down the leg side, Shahrukh sweeps and misses. Wide
speared outside off, chopped to sweeper cover off the back foot
preText: Slow start for Shahrukh. Spin is his weaker suit as well

text: Jitesh smokes a six down the ground. He backs away outside leg, Jadeja follows him and bowls into the pitch. Jitesh, however, launches a straight six
veering down the leg side for another wide
preText: Kevin Menezes: "Looking forward to Sharukh khan bat through middle overs. Not sure if he has the game to rotate strike "

text: down the track and flat-batted down to long-off. Jitesh looks more comfortable against spin

shortText: Jadeja to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: Shahrukh chews up another dot against spin. Darted into the top of off stump, pushed back to him
slower ball, 114ks, floated wide of off, dips underneath the swing of Jitesh. Good start from Pretorius
preText: Vinay: "@Raja it's the combination of a lot of people missing. They could afford 3 overs from Thakur, but not from Dube here. Faf can't be compared to anyone else in this team" --- Pretorius is back for the death

text: another slower cutter, full and wide of off, carted away to the left of Choudhary at sweeper. He slides across and stops the ball
Does not carry to Gaikwad at deep cover. Pretorius rolls out another cutter, pushed wide of off, sliced in the air. Bounces in front of the onrushing Gaikwad
on-pace hard-length delivery outside off, Shahrukh splices it down to long-off

wkt_text: JM Sharma c Uthappa b Pretorius 26 (23m 17b 0x4 3x6) SR: 152.94
text: Pretorius bests Jitesh with the slower delivery. Caught at short third man. Pitched up and outside off, Jitesh aims to reverse-scoop it over Uthappa at short third man, but does not have enough pace to work with or elevation. Simple catch for Uthappa. Pretorius continues to impress in yellow
preText: Raja Muthu: "Looks like Pretorius is the new Bravo for CSK in the coming years."
postText: Vinod: "PBKS can't afford to play 4 tailenders if they want to adopt Morgan's template. I feel they haven't utilized Raj Bawa properly. He should bat at 8 and bowl in powerplay. "

text: another slower one floated outside off at 108ks, stabbed into the covers as Odean gets off the mark
preText: Odean has joined SRK. This could be fun.

text: middle-stump yorker, dug back to Jordan. Well bowled, CJ
very full and sprayed down the leg side, wide called
preText: Jordan vs Odean

text: another middle-stump yorker from Jordan, squeezed down to long-on
low full-toss on off, hacked away towards deep midwicket off the inside half. Good bowling from Jordan

wkt_text: M Shahrukh Khan c Pretorius b Jordan 6 (25m 11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 54.54
text: Shahrukh holes out to deep square leg, Jordan celebrates. Jordan misses the yorker, comes out as a low full-toss on leg stump. Shahrukh picks it up and swings it to Pretorius. First wicket for Jordan at CSK
postText: Adarsh Gopi: "Jordan seems to be joining the long list of players who have a middling stint with other teams, but come to CSK and start shining again at the deep end of their careers."

text: wide yorker from CJ, squeezes underneath Rabada's bat outside off
