text: Fittingly, it is Livingstone who takes it at long-on and closes out the game for Kings. Dragged down on middle, CJ rocks back and hauls a pull to Livingstone
postText:
11.35pm: The game began with Jadeja flashing a smile after winning his first toss as IPL captain. It ends with Agarwal and Livingstone grinning ear to ear. That's all we have for you from this game. Looking forward to your company for the rest of the season as well. Until next time, this is Deivarayan Muthu signing off on the behalf of Hemant Brar and Chandan Duorah. Stay safe and good night.

Livingstone, Player of the Match: The first two games didn't go my way, but [it's] nice to contribute to a win. We got to a target we thought was defendable and the seam bowers set it up for us. We wanted to be aggressive and as exciting as we can. Nice to get a few today, but as I said the seamers set it up in the powerplay. I've been swinging hard, so nice to get it off the middle today. But it was all about the seamers. I play my own way and I struggled a bit with Rajasthan as well. Hopefully, this will bring some confidence. Bowling is something I really enjoy and I keep practicing. Hopefully, I'll come more and more into the game. I also bat in the nets with Odean Smith.

Agarwal: We were thinking we were 5-7 short, chasing 180 is never going to be easy. I was very, very happy with the way we bowled with the new ball. I said nothing to Livingstone. Everyone holds their breath when he's batting. Vaibhav was with us a couple of years back and we saw the talent. KKR picked him up, but we wanted him because he's something different. With Jitesh, Anil bhai had seen him at Mumbai Indians. He has great intent and he's a fantastic keeper. The standout thing about him is his attitude. We will definitely look to play hard, positive cricket. We have to be emotionally intelligent if it doesn't come off.

Jadeja: I think we lost too many wickets in the powerplay and didn't find momentum from ball one. We need to find a way to come back stronger. No, we need to give him [Gaikwad] confidence; we all know he's a very good player. I'm sure he will come good. Dube has been batting well and I think keeping him in a good frame of mind is the key. We will try our best to work hard and come back stronger.

The Birmingham Phoenix boys catch up at the sidelines. Moeen, Howell and Livingstone involved in an intense chat.

Ramki: "Great to see teams batting first winning three on the trot. This will open up the tournament further and make it more exciting to watch. Bring out the dew spray everyday closer to the start, please."

Mohit: "@Pramod, we're used to seeing MI at the bottom in the first half of most of the IPLs. They take off in the 2nd half."

Dhawan: It feels great. We made a great comeback. Vaibhav was swinging in the nets and troubling us - that's why he got a debut and he kept his calm. We lost early wickets and we knew we had to build a partnership. Livingstone took the game away from the opposition and I played the supporting role. We were just positive because 180 is still a big score. It's not that easy for a chasing team even though dew comes.

11.12pm Punjab Kings hand CSK their third successive defeat. Debutant Vaibhav Arora and Kagiso Rabada scythed through the top order in the powerplay and when Odean Smith bounced out Rayudu, CSK were 36 for 5 in the eighth over. There would be no way back for them, despite a 26-ball half-century from Dube. Dhoni tuk-tuked his way to 23 off 28 balls in a bid to limit NRR damage before CSK ultimately folded for 126 in 18 overs. Kings secure their second win in three games, having stayed true to their explosive style of cricket - both with bat and ball. Agarwal will also be buoyed by the debuts of Jitesh and Arora. On the other hand, plenty to ponder already for CSK.

SpaceyAVP : "Punjab have started to look like a dangerous side. If Rajapaksa, Smith, and Livingstone all get going (right now it seems like 1 of them does each game), it could be devastating for teams. The only thing missing seems to be a bit of experience- the tail needs to keep the momentum going. "

Naina: "I think it's right time to bring Bairstow in place of Rajapksa, which might be very unfortunate for him but Punjab needs a bit of experience in the lineup to not repeat what happened today where they scored only 70 runs in last 10 overs"

RayOfSunshine: "I feel that CSK is still just a win away from clicking... Some unfortunate events - heavy dew in the second match and lack of application from almost all of batsmen have led to their downfall..."

Aravind: "This is exactly like CSK in 2020. When batting clicks, bowling doesn't..when bowling clicks, batting doesn't.. And they lose the small moments"

Hashir: "Well, 3 of the 4 most decorated IPL teams are at 8, 9 and 10 respectively (at least until SRH's match tomorrow). Looks to be a case of fierce competition more than a case of the mighty falling. Exciting days ahead!"

George : "So refreshing to see dew not deciding outcomes and letting skills take the center stage."

CSKFAN: "I'm getting 2020 flashblacks :(. Feel for jaddu. This is tough "

text: length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
preText:
7.30pm Shubman Gill and Matthew Wade are in the middle. Mustafizur Rahman has got the ball. Wade on strike, two slips.

Arfaa: "Just a guess, but I'm assuming DC are giving arguably their two weakest links (Mandeep and Khaleel) another shot to see who gets to keep their slot when Warner returns. Either Seifert retains his place, and Warner comes in for Mandeep, or its like for like with both Warner and Ngidi coming in next match. "

Prashant Vats: "Why isnt Nortje not playing? He was in the dug out and he completed his qurantine rules too." --- He is still not match-fit, he has been dealing with back and hip issues.

Rahul: "Why are DC playing Khaleel ahead of a quality bowler like Ngidi ?" --- Not sure, it's a bit puzzling, because I thought he was available for tonight's game.

7.00pm Delhi Capitals have won the toss and opted to bowl. They have brought in Mustafizur Rahman for Kamlesh Nagarkoti, strengthening their death bowling. Gujarat Titans are unchanged.

Here are the XIs:

Gujarat Titans 1 Shubman Gill, 2 Matthew Wade (wk), 3 Vijay Shankar, 4 Abhinav Manohar, 5 Hardik Pandya (capt), 6 David Miller, 7 Rahul Tewatia, 8 Rashid Khan, 9 Varun Aaron, 10 Lockie Ferguson, 11 Mohammed Shami

Delhi Capitals 1 Prithvi Shaw, 2 Tim Seifert, 3 Mandeep Singh, 4 Rishabh Pant (capt, wk), 5 Rovman Powell, 6 Lalit Yadav, 7 Axar Patel, 8 Shardul Thakur, 9 Kuldeep Yadav, 10 Khaleel Ahmed, 11 Mustafizur Rahman

While we wait for the toss, here's our Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Which batter has the poorest powerplay strike rate since 2019 (min 400 balls faced)?

6.50pm One of the big positives for Titans, and India, from their previous game was Hardik Pandya bowling his four overs without any discomfort. With the next T20 World Cup just six months away, Pandya's bowling fitness is crucial from India's perspective.

Mustafa Moudi: "Cant believe we have completed 11 years of that Historic World Cup Win.... We have already seen the Final Heroes Gambhir and Dhoni reunited a couple of days ago. Also, Jayawardene, who scored a century in that final and Sanagkkara, who led the SL,are having their team clash at the moment - MI vs RR !!" --- Indeed it has been 11 years. Last year, for the tenth anniversary, I spoke to the tournament's key players about India's journey to the title.

6.40pm If you play fantasy cricket, Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant should be your go-to players. Head here for more fantasy tips.

Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English or in Hindi.

6.30pm Hello and welcome to game 10 of IPL 2022. It's Gujarat Titans vs Delhi Capitals in Pune. Both sides registered narrow wins in their opening games with their middle orders rescuing them. Rahul Tewatia steered Gujarat Titans home against Lucknow Super Giants, while Axar Patel and Lalit Yadav helped Delhi Capitals pull off a coup against Mumbai Indians. Which side will stay unbeaten after tonight's game? Here's Sruthi Ravindranath previewing it.

text: fuller on the stumps, moving away once again. The batter looks to push at it, gets a thick outside edge but it goes down towards second slip, who dives to his right, makes the stop and has a shy at the stumps. A direct hit would have been close

shortText: Thakur to Shubman Gill, no run

preText: Free hit

shortText: Thakur to Shubman Gill, (no ball) FOUR
text: length ball around off, stands still and pulls it through midwicket for four. You know what's worse? Thakur has overstepped as well
preText: The two slips are quite staggered

text: length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg where the fielder puts in a diving stop. The partial stop is good enough to prevent the single
length outside off, cuts it towards backward point. Straight to the fielder
length ball, wide outside off, slapped through covers
preText:
And here is Khaleel

Kabir: "I think the competition will be: Fizz vs Ngidi when Warner joins the XI as the fourth foreigner. That's why Khaleel is likely to be a set member in the XI. "

text: length ball on the pads, tucked away towards long leg
preText: There's just one slip now

text: nearly chopped on. Short of length outside off, goes for the cut but there's not enough room. Goes parallel to the stumps, just missing them
length outside off, looks to get on the top of the bounce but fails to get the timing right. Chopped towards mid-off

edged but it falls short of Pant. Was a length ball outside off, Shankar was looking to open the face of the bat but gets a thick outside edge. The slip fielder gathers the deflection and aims at the stumps. Misses but think Gill was home
short of length and Gill tucks it towards square leg. The call is for two but they will get only one
crunched. Length outside off, plenty of room this time and Gill cuts it past the point fielder
length but way down the leg side
length again, Gill goes for another cut but this time there is little room. Chopped towards point for a quick single
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards covers for a quick single
preText:
No slips in place, just in case anyone is wondering

Raja Muthu: "You have to select playing 11 based on best players available and try to win the match , rather than thinking who will be available for the next match."

shortText: Thakur to Shubman Gill, no run
text: fuller outside off, looks to crash it through covers but doesn't get the timing right. Bounces towards the fielder
length outside off, dabs it in front of point for one

length ball angling towards the pads, helped towards midwicket

text: into the crowd. Fuller outside off, Gill goes down on one knee and sweeps it over backward square leg, all the way for a six, 77 metres
shortens his length, just outside off. Gill taps it towards long-off
length ball on the stumps, Shankar backs away and hits it just over the bowler, who jumped but couldn't get his fingers on it. Long-on cuts it off
mistimes the cuts towards covers
quicker outside off. Shankar is staying leg side of the ball. He tries to steer it fine but is beaten by the pace

Fizz is back

postText: dyg: "Vijay Shankar batting at 3 is similar to Shivam Dube bowling 19th. Whole lot of risks involved on the most important parts of match."

text: length ball angling across, goes for the pull but is cramped and the ball bounces towards point off the splice

text: length ball on the stumps, flicked towards forward square leg. Straight towards the fielder but he fumbles and allows a single

text: length outside off, little footwork as he throws his hands at it. Gets beaten

length ball on the stumps, moves across and whips it behind square leg and they come back for the second

text: fuller on the stumps, pushed on the leg side for one. Axar fields himself

length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg

length ball on the stumps, punched towards wide long-on

Shardul

Nandhana: "Saha could also be a strong contender for number 3 or opening spot because of the form he was in for SRH in the past few seasons. Wade could field too after handing over the gloves to him."

length outside off, slaps it to the left of mid-off, a tumbling half-stop there allows the second run

text: length outside off, cuts it to the left of the diving extra cover fielder. The sweeper had no chance to cut it off

preText: Rashid
postText:
Watch T20 Time Out LIVE with Wasim Jaffer and Ben Cutting:

So, Capitals need 172 to notch up their second win in as many games. The dew factor can play a big role in that. Matt Roller is here to take you through the chase.

Tanvir: "What a over by Fizz. That last over might be the deciding factor today"

Shubman Gill: I felt I left a few runs out there but overall pretty satisfied. My focus was to play as few dots as possible and keep rotating the strike as we had lost some early wickets. It was holding a bit at the start, it wasn't easy to score in front of the wicket but it settled down as the game went on. Hopefully, we can defend this.

9.14pm A 105 runs in the last ten overs but a slow start means Titans can manage only 171 for 6. Gill played an excellent knock, scoring 84 off 46. In fact, he was the one who did the bulk of the scoring most of the time. Let's hear from the man.

text: on a length outside off stump, and Shaw gets up on his toes, square-driving through point for four! Deep in the crease, slapping it away square off the back foot
preText:
Shami will take the new ball. Slip in.

Prithvi Shaw is getting some underarm throwdowns on the boundary edge. Hardik bowls a couple of balls into a mitt and then calls his team into a huddle. Tim Seifert walks out alongside Shaw.

Thanks, Hemant. Hello, everyone. Rajasthan are the only side to defend a total in IPL 2022 to date. Can Gujarat Titans become the second?

Mustafa Moudi: "2 Retained players - Hardik and Gill already did their Job. Time for the 3rd one (Rashid) to get Wickets for GT!!"

Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English or in Hindi

text: drags his length back a touch, and Shaw dabs a single into the off side. 135kph

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Seifert, no run
text: nips back appreciably off the seam from a good length. Seifert is late on it, and struck in the groin. Skews away into the gully
back of a length, Seifert jumps into the pull. Mistimed, so deep backward square will get around to cut it off

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Seifert, no run
text: angling in on a length, 138kph, on-drives to mid-on. Shami tight to the stumps on release
springy bounce from a good length. Seifert cloths the pull, and it falls short of mid-off as they scamper through for a single

wkt_text: TL Seifert c Manohar b Pandya 3 (8m 5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 60.00
text: chipped to short midwicket, Hardik strikes with his first ball! Seifert admonishes himself as he trudges off. On a good length, Seifert looked to nudge it into the leg side but it stopped on him, and hit the splice of the bat. It looped up into the leg side, and Abhinav took a straightforward catch to his left, in tight. Early strike for Gujarat, Hardik's first IPL wicket since 2019!
preText: Hardik to share the new ball. That's a surprise. Deep point and deep square leg are the two men out. Slip in.

shortText: Pandya to Mandeep Singh, no run
text: back of a length, inside-edged into the pad and it skews away into the off side. 141kph
preText: Mandeep Singh at No. 3.

text: back of a length, skied into the leg side... but lands in no-man's-land. 141kph. Steepling bounce, and Mandeep plinked the pull towards square leg. Wade and Abhinav both ran towards it, but it fell safely
preText: Point up in the ring, deep third back on the fence.

text: edged but short of slip. 138kph. On a good length, Shaw has a flash and the outside edge falls short of the man at wide slip. Fumbled, and they get through for one

shortText: Pandya to Mandeep Singh, no run
text: angling in from a fullish length, worked to short midwicket

shortText: Pandya to Mandeep Singh, no run
text: back of a length, fenced to point with an open face. 141kph, great start from Hardik
postText: Dhoni: "DC batting looks wafer thin. Big, big mistake to not have retained Shreyas, Dhawan or Hetti"

text: angling in on a length, 139kph, clipped out to deep backward square

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Mandeep Singh, no run

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Mandeep Singh, FOUR
text: dragged away through midwicket. 140kph, slightly too full and angling in towards the off stump. Mandeep plays across the line, swinging him away through the leg side

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Mandeep Singh, no run
text: back of a length, 138kph, steered to backward point on the bounce with an open face

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Mandeep Singh, FOUR
text: slapped away over cover! 141kph, but a half-volley outside off stump. Mandeep gets down on one knee, carving him away over the infield with his weight back

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Mandeep Singh, 1 run
text: on a length outside off, dabbed down to deep third with an open face and soft hands

shortText: Pandya to Mandeep Singh, no run
text: skids through on a length, Mandeep can't beat short midwicket. Short-arm jab across the line, but straight at the man in tight
preText: Tonight is only the seventh time Hardik has taken the new ball in an IPL game. And he'll stay on for a second over.

text: back of a length, wide outside off at 133kph, and Mandeep upper-cuts over short third. Good awareness. Knew the man on the 45-degree angle was up inside the ring, so stayed leg-side of the ball and chopped it up over the infield

shortText: Pandya to Mandeep Singh, 1 leg bye
text: banged in short, 138kph, and Mandeep is struck on the side of the grille while trying to pull it away. The physio rushes on as this hit Mandeep in the helmet. Looks like it might have skimmed the glove on the way through, and he looks like he'll be OK. He's passed a very quick concussion check and will continue. Sharp, skiddy bouncer from Hardik
back of a length, Shaw takes it on and drags the pull away through midwicket. Not out of the middle and slightly uppishly, but into the gap between short midwicket and mid-on
back of a length, wide outside off at 139kph. Dabbed away behind square on the off side

pulled through wide mid-on to finish the over with a boundary. Back of a length from Hardik, skidding on, and Mandeep doesn't get this out of the middle. But the field is up, and he drags it into the gap between mid-on and midwicket

wkt_text: PP Shaw c Shankar b Ferguson 10 (25m 7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 142.85
text: banged into the pitch, and Shaw plinks his pull out to deep backward square leg! 138kph, a hint of nip in off the seam, and Shaw can only top-edge it out into the deep, the bat turning in his hands. Vijay Shankar settles underneath it and takes a steepling catch, and Delhi have lost both of their openers
preText: Lockie Ferguson, with his trademark jet-black shoes.

text: squares him up with a length ball at 141kph, angling in. Skews away out to deep third, with a hint of outside edge as he steers it away
preText: Rishabh Pant at No. 4. Left-right combination. Lockie comes around the wicket, with a slip in place. Short leg-side boundary for Pant to target.

shortText: Ferguson to Mandeep Singh, no run
text: good length, angling in towards the off stump. Defended into the off side

shortText: Ferguson to Mandeep Singh, no run

wkt_text: Mandeep Singh c †Wade b Ferguson 18 (24m 16b 4x4 0x6) SR: 112.50
text: feathered through to Wade, Lockie has two in his first over! Hard length into the pitch, Mandeep backs away and looks to cut it away but only manages to get a thin edge on it. He was looking to target the shorter off-side boundary, but Ferguson cramped him for room with a back-of-a-length ball
short ball, banged in. Mandeep stays leg side of it, looking to steer an upper-cut over the keeper, but can't lay bat on it. Too short for the umpire's liking

shortText: Ferguson to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: angling in, nipping in off the seam at 141kph, and Lalit inside-edges into the leg side via the pad
preText: Lalit Yadav.
postText: Kerala Blasters finished on the losing side in the ISL final, but it was a big step up from 10th last season. Here's a closer look at how Karolis Skinkys built Blasters' indomitable class of '21-22.

text: full, angling in towards the leg stump. Pant flicks off the pads, out to deep backward square. There's a mix-up as Lalit sends Pant back, but he scrambles back to make his ground at the bowler's end
preText: Final Powerplay over. Change of ends for Shami. Attacking move from Hardik, giving him a third over up front. Around the wicket to Pant, with a slip in

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Lalit Yadav, FOUR

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Lalit Yadav, no run

text: thick outside edge, down to Rashid who flings himself to his right to cut it off at deep third. 148kph
preText:
Only four men out as Gujarat look to squeeze Delhi.

Neil: "Gujarat's bowling is the strongest this season, wouldn't matter even if they fall 10-15 runs short of the par score at any venue."

shortText: Ferguson to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: banged in short, Lalit flaps at it. Shapes to lap it over fine leg but is rushed, and can't lay bat on ball. 140kph

shortText: Ferguson to Lalit Yadav, 1 leg bye
text: full, angling in towards the pads. Late on the shot, and it skews away off the pads into the leg side
hard length, Pant drags him through midwicket. Pulled off the front foot. 142kph, skidding through towards the hip, and Pant's short-arm jab flies away through the gap

thick outside edge, Wade drops a tough chance! 146kph, hard length, wider outside off stump. Pant looked to pump him back over his head, cross-batted, and it flew through to Wade. He flung himself high to his left, but could only tip it over the bar!
slapped out into the covers to retain the strike
postText:
Strategic timeout.

Varun: "With all due respect to Mandeep, I just don't understand the logic of playing him ahead of Sarfaraz. Sarfaraz has been in red hot form whereas Mandeep looks like a sitting duck. And the most important thing is that it's for the most important position (No. 3) in this format. Where you should play your best player, it's too much for Mandeep. Delhi deserve to be in this position match after match."

text: googly, angled across him. Sits deep in the crease, dabbing it away past slip with an open face. Hint of outside edge
preText: Rashid Khan. Interesting head-to-head against Pant, here's how it's gone in the past. Slip in.

text: swept hard, out to Lockie at deep backward square. Slight misfield, but they don't come back

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, 1 run

full googly, poked away to backward point as he lunges forwards

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, 1 run

preText: Yuvaraj Krishna: "Rashid vs Rishabh will decide the course of the match"

text: legbreak, wide outside off stump. Slapped out to deep point on the back foot
postText: Wade muttered "double hit" over the stump mic there. Clearly not intentional, so not out, but looked like it might have hit Pant's bat twice in quick succession

text: angled across him, back of a length. Drags a pull out to deep midwicket
preText: Here's Varun Aaron. Will Delhi target him? Over the wicket

text: back of a length, outside off stump. Plays across the line, dragging it through square leg
preText: Abhinav: "Where's swimming pool today?" -- Not much dew so far here compared to most other venues.

text: angled across him, 133kph. Slapped to point on the cut
postText: Prasad: "Folks who are writing Delhi off, don't forget that Axar and Shardul can deal heavy blows too."

text: short and wide, angled across him. Pant jumps into the cut, and slaps it away through backward point for four. Slower ball, which Pant picked
back of a length, down the leg side at 135kph. Pant looks to pull it away fine, but can't beat short fine leg
postText: Aaron is struggling with the landing area on the crease. Gill runs on some sawdust.

text: skied up... ball falls safely. Lalit is living a charmed life. 141kph from Aaron, slightly full of a length. Chipped up via a leading edge as the bat face closes early. Loops up agonisingly for GT, but lands between mid-off, running around to his right, and long-on, scampering in off the rope

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: full and flat outside off, prodded to short cover. "Oooooh, yes Rashy!" yelps Wade

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, SIX
text: slog-swept over deep midwicket for six! Nailed, flat and hard over the leg side. Abhinav was in the game, jumping back over his head on the rope, but couldn't get there. Full outside off stump from Rashid, but Lalit went towards the short leg-side boundary

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: mistimed into the leg side, via the inside edge, and they decide against the single

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: googly on a length, Lalit has no room to get it away through the off side. Rashid fields off his own bowling

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, 2 runs
text: another googly, Lalit picks it this time. He gives himself room outside leg stump, and chops it away through point. A slight misfield allows them back for the second

shortText: Rashid Khan to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: very full, drifting into him. Comes forward, and steers to short third via the outside edge. 98kph

on a length, down the leg side. Pant looks to lap it around the corner to fine leg but doesn't make clean contact. Wade throws at the non-striker's end and it's a direct hit as Pant scrambles through, but he's made his ground comfortably enough
preText:
Hardik brings himself back. Over the wicket.

Game in the balance at the halfway stage of the chase. Our win predictor has Gujarat as slight favourites but there's not much in it.

text: nipping in off the seam, pulled out to deep backward square where Rashid fields. They come back for two and Wade, in front of the stumps, flicks it between his legs and into the stumps, Dhoni-esque. This could be tight... but Lalit's bat is down just in time
postText: Nimesh: "That was some serious lazy running. Got saved by fraction of margins!"

text: good length, angling in towards the right hip. Plinks the pull away over short midwicket, and they scamper back for two. 50 partnership, off 34 balls.
rushed on the pull. One hand comes off the bat and it dribbles away into the leg side
swung away down to long leg

shortText: Pandya to Lalit Yadav, no run
text: nipping in, back of a length. Nudged into the leg side
postText: Tight over from Hardik. Both batters have had a fair bit of luck tonight - have a look at those control percentages, both well below 50%.

text: cutter, cramps Pant for room... but he gets the cut away for four! Point and short third were up inside the ring, with a short off-side boundary, and Pant played it late, dabbing it away with a wristy slap
preText:
Put on your 3D glasses. Vijay Shankar to bowl his first.

Maiyanka Sinha: "What speed is Hardik bowling?" -- Hit 141kph in his first over. Slightly slower in his third, low-to-mid 130s.

text: poor bowling, and Pant tucks in. Fine leg is up inside the ring, but Shankar bowls a half-volley outside leg stump. Pant rolls the wrists, chipping it up over the ring. Falls just short of the advertising toblerone. Too easy
wayward. On a length, sprayed down the leg side. Pant can't connect, looking to pull it around the corner
looks to hit this into the ocean, but swings himself off his feet. Cutter, angled across him as Pant charged down the pitch, but it spun past the bat

wkt_text: Lalit Yadav run out 25 (40m 22b 2x4 1x6) SR: 113.63
text: chance for a run-out at the bowler's end. Shankar has stepped on the stumps as he loops to whip the bails off, but only one of them is initially dislodged. He takes the other one off as Lalit dives at full stretch to make his ground and this will be given out. Pant nudged a length ball off his hip straight to Abhinav Manohar, the man at square leg. Mix-up between the two batters, and Lalit had to scramble back. Pant is confused as to what's happened and is in discussion with the umpires, but Lalit has to trudge off

another run-out chance as Shankar fields off his own bowling! Pant nudged a back-of-a-length ball towards midwicket, and called Powell through. Fantastic work from Shankar, running to his left and pinging it at the stumps. Direct hit, but Powell's bat was just about grounded. Bruce Oxenford says 'not out'.
preText: Rovman Powell at No. 6.

text: wide outside off stump, slapped away through point on the cut. Gentle pace from Shankar, and wide enough for Powell to free his arms, sitting deep in the crease. Beats backward point and picks up four to get off the mark

shortText: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
text: back of a length, Pant looks to swing through the leg side but bottom-edges it towards mid-on. Rashid fields off his own bowling
preText: Jack: "Since the stumps were already disturbed, doesnt it require stump to be uprooted?" -- Nope, one of the bails was still on. So Shankar just had to remove that bail, and did so cleanly.

text: googly, full and wide outside off. Swept firmly out to deep square leg
preText: Wade tries to tempt Pant into giving Rashid the charge. "Step out, step out," he tells him on the stump mic.

text: googly, mistimed into the leg side for a single through midwicket
preText: Powell has struggled against wristspin in the past, but has improved against it in the last year or so

text: full googly, drilled away on the pull, sitting very deep in the crease. Absolutely nailed, fast and flat out of the middle, but Lockie fields well on the bounce at deep midwicket

full outside off stump, nudged down to long-on for a single. Rashid and Pant collide at the non-striker's end as Rashid looks to field off his own bowling. Slight grimace from Rashid after wearing a spike to his foot, but he'll be OK
googly, sharply-spun. Wide outside off stump, and slapped out to the sweeper on the cut
wide outside off stump, slaps a cut away through point towards the short side. Googly, gentle pace, and he sits deep in his crease to carve it away
preText:
Wade is giving Pant plenty of chat over the stump mic, suggesting he should charge down the pitch. Tewatia is on, bowling his first over of the season. Long leg-side boundary for Pant

Afeef: "Perfect time for Powell to showcase his power in the IPL"

text: legbreak, Pant shuffles across to cover his stumps and whips it out to deep midwicket

drilled dead-straight down the ground for six! Powell is more confident against legspin these days and nails Tewatia back over his head for an 87-metre six. Tossed up above the eyeline, Powell clears the front leg and clears long-on comfortably
wide on the crease, tosses up a legbreak, wide outside off stump. Powell looks to drag him over the legside but can't lay bat on ball
preText:
Hardik wanders over to offer some advice to Tewatia.

Som: "Bad move from Hardik. When Varun has so many overs left, why bowl Vijay Shankar and Rahul Tewatia?"

text: fullish, much straighter. Punched out to cover and they scamper through for a single, taking on Hardik's arm. Would have been out with a direct hit at the bowler's end!
full googly, angled across him. Milks a single out to deep midwicket to keep the strike

wkt_text: RR Pant c Manohar b Ferguson 43 (58m 29b 7x4 0x6) SR: 148.27
text: plinked to deep backward square leg! 145kph, banged into the pitch, and Pant is stuck in two minds. It nips away off the seam - or perhaps it's even a very quick offcutter. Pant tries to drag it across the line, but isn't sure whether he's looking to play it away for a single or commit to the shot fully. He mistimes the pull, which loops up agonisingly into the leg side... where Abhinav settles underneath it! What a game Lockie Ferguson is having, 3 for 12 in 2.1 overs. And great call from Hardik to bring him back!
preText: 54 off 36. Delhi are now favourites. Lockie returns.
postText:
And suddenly the game swings back towards Gujarat. Strategic timeout with the fall of the wicket. Axar is the new man, coming in off the back of his 38 not out off 17 balls against Mumbai.

Ashu: "How many Manohars are on the field?? Looks like ball is finding him always"

text: inch-perfect 144kph yorker. Axar has no choice but to dig it out in defence
preText: Lockie continues from around the wicket

text: misfield by Hardik and Axar picks up four. Full of a length, punched away through the off side, but Hardik couldn't get down in time to cut it off at extra cover
another short ball, 141kph and angling in before nipping away, but Axar commits to it fully. He jumps into the pull, timing it away over midwicket

wkt_text: AR Patel c †Wade b Ferguson 8 (5m 4b 2x4 0x6) SR: 200.00
text: strangled down the leg side, Lockie has FOUR! Perhaps the worst ball he's bowled all night, a 130kph offcutter, angling a long way down the leg side. But Axar flaps at the pull and gets a thin edge through to Wade, who takes a sharp low catch to his right. Gujarat have their sixth wicket
wide on the crease on release, 143kph yorker outside off stump, plinked into the off side via the toe
preText: Shardul Thakur at No. 8.
postText: Superb over from Lockie. And credit to Hardik for bringing him back for his third over earlier than he might have planned.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Powell, no run
text: googly, which he doesn't pick. Hit on the pads
preText:
Rashid's final over.

The only other time when Lockie Ferguson played in Pune, he was player of the match for his bowling figures of 4-1-7-2

text: googly, hangs back and whips it out to deep midwicket
preText: Navin: "The Lord enters the Ring!! Time for some fireworks."

shortText: Rashid Khan to Thakur, no run
text: legbreak, wide outside off. Dabbed down on the cut, to short third, and Powell sends Shardul back

shortText: Rashid Khan to Thakur, no run
text: another googly, which beats the bat as Shardul looks to whip it away. Wade jumps across this time and just about gets in the way. Shardul is baffled as to why it's not a wide... "it hit your thigh pad," Wade tells him
googly, down the leg side. Shardul looks to clip off the pads, and Wade is unsighted! Five crucial extra runs for Delhi
whipped out to deep backward square, and Shardul scampers back for two

wkt_text: SN Thakur lbw b Rashid Khan 2 (8m 5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 40.00
text: full googly, smashes him on the front pad and up goes the finger!. Shardul has little choice but to review. Plants the front foot and plays across the line. No bat involved, hits him on the shin. Impact in-line, and hitting leg stump halfway up! Rashid strikes with the final ball of his spell, and Gujarat are closing in...
offcutter, angling in on a length. Clipped off the hip with soft hands
preText: Lockie to bowl his final over. Hardik going in for the kill.

text: angled in from around the wicket, back of a length at 142kph. Inside-edged into the leg side, scampers through to get off strike
preText: Kuldeep facing his first ball.

text: back of a length, angling in. Dabbed out through backward point. 142kph

shortText: Ferguson to Kuldeep Yadav, no run
text: beaten for pace. 143kph, angling in from a good length. Kuldeep's feet are rooted to the crease as he fiddles at it, and it's not far away from the top of his off stump
short ball, aimed at the left shoulder. Kuldeep takes it on, and plinks the pull out to Rashid Khan at deep backward square leg on the bounce
back of a length, wide outside off, steered away with a deft late cut. Clever from Powell, who knew short third was up inside the ring. Angled his bat to dab it past him, and picks up four
postText: Ferguson ends with 4 for 28 from his four overs. Brilliant spell.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run
text: wide on the crease, on a length and angling in. Thick inside edge past his leg stump, down to long leg for a single
preText: 30 off 18 balls. Shami returns for his last over. Around the wicket

wkt_text: R Powell lbw b Mohammed Shami 20 (33m 12b 2x4 1x6) SR: 166.66
text: on a length, angling in and skidding through. Smashes Powell on the back thigh and the finger goes up! He has to review, and does so. He was looking to swing him away down the ground but was beaten. Looked like an offcutter, cramping him for room. Smashing into the stumps, and the on-field decision is upheld! Gujarat closing in on a second win.
preText:
Shami loses his run-up. Powell needs to think about hogging the strike here. 29 off 17 required.

Darshin: "Hardik's intelligence is under-rated. Really impressed by his captaincy so far."

wkt_text: KK Ahmed c †Wade b Mohammed Shami 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: nicks him off! Back of a length, angling in, and Khaleel backed away, looking to steer it away through point. He could only manage to tickle an outside edge through to Wade, and Shami has two in two balls
preText: Khaleel Ahmed at No. 10.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Mustafizur Rahman, 1 run
text: attempted yorker, slips out as a full toss. Dead-batted into the off side, and they sneak through for a single
preText: Shami is on a hat-trick. Mustafizur is the new man. Around the wicket. Short leg and slip in.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run
text: slapped away through extra cover, sets off for the single but Fizz is late to react. Hardik throws at the striker's end... but his throw is wide!

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Mustafizur Rahman, no run
text: dropped at fine leg! Banged in short, Mustafizur looked to steer an upper-cut away behind square on the off side. He was late on the shot and it flew down to fine leg via the inside edge of the bat. Jayant Yadav, the sub fielder, runs in and dives forwards. Gets two hands underneath it, but it slips out!
plinks a pull into the leg side

shortText: Pandya to Mustafizur Rahman, no run
text: angled across him on a good length, steered to point
fullish on leg stump, backs away and hacks it down to long-on
preText: SMK: "Great captaincy by Hardik, he went for the kill instead of holding his frontline bowlers back, he was sure the match won't go till the last over!" -- Yep, similar to Shreyas last night.

shortText: Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, no run
text: banged in short, following Kuldeep as he backs away, looking to uppercut. 140kph bouncer and he can't lay bat on ball

shortText: Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, no run
text: on a length, follows Kuldeep again as he looks to give himself room outside leg stump. Can't get it away through the infield
short ball, cloths the pull shot through mid-on via the splice. Sharp again from Hardik, up at 141kph

shortText: Tewatia to Kuldeep Yadav, no run
text: googly, angled across him, hidden very wide outside off stump. Left alone, not given as a wide! Must have been very close
preText: 24 required off the last over. Tewatia will bowl it.

text: full on the pads, swept out to deep backward square leg
googly, Fizz rocks back and punches out to deep cover
charges down the pitch, and hammers him over wide long-on! Kuldeep gets his dancing shoes on, shimmying down, and swings him 74 metres into the stands
postText: Charlie: "That's Kuldeep Yadav's first six across all cricket formats." -- Has hit six sixes in first-class cricket, in fact. But this was his first in the IPL.

shortText: Tewatia to Kuldeep Yadav, no run
text: googly, Kuldeep hangs back and slaps it straight to Hardik at extra cover
googly, tossed up and spinning away. Top-edges the sweep out to deep backward square
postText:
That's all from us for tonight. Thanks for joining us throughout the day, and make sure to tune into our coverage of Punjab Kings vs Chennai Super Kings tomorrow night. Until then, this is Matt Roller signing off on behalf of Hemant Brar and Ranjith P.

Lockie Ferguson is player of the match: "One of those nights. We had a lot of chances early on. With the calibre of bowling team-mates I have out there, it makes my job a lot easier and it was nice to pick up the treats tonight. It's great. The best thing was the fight we showed towards the end. The pressure was coming from both ends so the risks had to happen at some point. It's an instinctual thing. There was a little bit of nibble with the newer ball so I was hoping to bang away on a hard length. When Pant is there you have to be a little bit more creative, so I'm glad that one gripped. It's nice when they do. The all-round performance from the bowlers was great. Hardik is good at giving you the confidence and permission to play the game you want to play. It's nice to have a captain who trusts my abilities."

Hardik Pandya: "[2 from 2?] Not bad, to be honest. Very happy with the way everyone is stepping up at the right occasion. The kind of attack we have, we thought we might be 10-15 runs short sometimes but with the attack we have, we can restrict them to 20-25 runs short. That over from Lockie changed the momentum. To be honest, I felt we were 10-15 runs short. I thought par was 185, to be honest. When Rishabh was there, I thought the game was in the balance. Varun [Aaron] felt something happened to him. We were one bowler short so we had to finish the game on the 19th over. Some brain has to come there... the courage Tewatia and Vijay showed, when they had not been told to bowl, they stepped up and helped us to win the game. [Gill?] Fantastic, this is the Shubman Gill we all want to see. The kind of confidence he's carrying is going to come to all the batters."

Rashid Khan: "Enjoying my time so far. Had a good start, two wins in a row. So far, so good. Enjoying myself, trying my best to contribute for the team. [Mumbai vs Pune?] A bit of dew is fine, I don't mind that. It wasn't much dew there tonight. The wicket wasn't as supportive but length was crucial on this wicket. The focus was just on hitting that good area as much as possible. First over, I tried a few different grips to see which was the right one on this wicket. Overall, it was a good contribution."

Rishabh Pant: "I think according to the wicket, the total was not so big. We could have batted well, especially in the middle overs. Every match, it's going to be hard for us to come back after losing so many wickets. [Ponting?] I think he's been amazing since day one. When you're on the losing side, you feel heartbroken. But we can improve in the next match."

Mohit: "After a whole week of chasing side dominating the match, we saw batting side winning both of today's match. Breath of fresh air in the IPL." -- Yep, dew wasn't really a factor tonight.

11.24pm: Gujarat win by 14 runs and have two wins from their first two games. They posted 171 after being asked to bat first, thanks primarily to Shubman Gill who played a blinder at the top of the order. Delhi were in the game throughout the run chase, but Lockie Ferguson was the game-changer, taking two wickets in the 15th over and finishing with four-for.

text: back of a length, angling in and veering in further from over the wicket. It does not threaten off stump, so Buttler lets it go
preText:
3.29pm Former Mumbai Indian Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal, who plays for Mumbai in domestic cricket, will open the batting for RR vs MI. Mumbai's players huddle up near the boundary. This is a fresh pitch, will MI's seamers find some swing and seam movement? Jasprit Bumrah has the new ball. He has the wood over Buttler

Fasna: "@Deepak- Shreyas had that luxury because KKR was bowling first and they have Narine and Varun who can bowl at the death. I don't think other teams can copy that. "

3.20pm ICYMI: You can watch the match LIVE in the USA on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Garv Asnani: "@Sarthak honestly, I think Daniel Sams is a very destructive player who can score a quickfire 50 and bowl in the powerplay like he did in BBL but it was just not his day against Delhi so he got another chance."

Afeef: "The Pollard vs Saini match-up will be interesting... 3 innings, 22 balls, 18 runs, 2 dismissals. I feel that's one of the reasons why he was picked."

Sarthak: "MI should have played Ramandeep Singh/Sanjay Yadav in place of Sams and tried the young sensation Dewald Brevis aka *Baby AB*.. was very eager to watch him bat in MI colors but alas :("

Gaurav : "So happy to see Navdeep Saini get a game. He was knocking on India doors a few seasons back and then just didn't play. He has got the pace, can bowl at the death. Will he also see a new lease of life like his ex team-mate Umesh Yadav!? "

3.15pm Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: How has Rohit Sharma done against left-arm pace (since 2019)?

Deepak Samson : "Shreyas' tactics yesterday of continuing with his strike bowlers and not giving a respite to the batting team was very interesting. Will that be a blueprint for matches to come? Captains going for the kill, gambling on bowling teams out before the "death overs"??"

Trent Boult: Obviously, good memories in the MI jersey, but excited for the chance with Rajasthan Royals. Looking forward to this encounter. For me, it's just about keeping it simple like I naturally do. I pitch the ball up and get it moving around. Different ground, day game, let's see what happens... Obviously, very early in the tournament and different to the conditions in Pune. We're here to play the big boys and enjoy ourselves. Never played here before but don't have too many experiences to draw from. Nice and comforting to throw the ball to Ashwin and Chahal in the middle overs.

Abhi: "RR playing only 3 overseas players? Thats enormous trust on Parag placing him above RvD, Neesham and Mitchell!"

Kb: "I don't understand why RR didn't go for either Mitchell or neesham. Both are handy with the bat as well as the ball. No offense to Saini but he lacks control and isn't economial. Neesham could've filled the role of Coulter Nile."

Mumbai Indians: 1 Rohit Sharma(capt), 2 Ishan Kishan(wk), 3 Anmolpreet Singh, 4 N Tilak Varma, 5 Kieron Pollard, 6 Tim David, 7 Daniel Sams, 8 M Ashwin, 9 Jasprit Bumrah, 10 Tymal Mills, 11 Basil Thampi

In the absence of Coulter-Nile, Royals' batting looks light, with Riyan Parag at No.6 and R Ashwin at No.7

Rajasthan Royals: 1 Jos Buttler, 2 Yashasvi Jaiswal, 3 Sanju Samson(capt&wk), 4 Devdutt Padikkal, 5 Shimron Hetmyer, 6 Riyan Parag, 7 R Ashwin, 8 Yuzvendra Chahal, 9 Trent Boult, 10 Navdeep Saini, 11 Prasidh Krishna

Deepak Samson : "Must bear in mind that this isn't a night game. The dew will not play as much of a role. If Jos and the royals get off to a flyer, Mumbai will have their hands full!"

sanket: "The big task for MI bowling department will be to take wickets in powerplay, they cant afford to give bumrah 2 over spell in PP, Mills is death over specialist, sams has been really expensive and even Meridth isnt the bowler who can swing upfront. Thampi,undakat to add few but dont see someone with quality like boult, umesh, bhuvi ,shami etc."

3pm Mumbai Indians win the toss and choose to bowl first. No Suryakumar for them.

Rohit: No particular reason; we've seen the trend [of chasing] in the tournament. Dew is not going to be a factor tonight but we wanted to have the score in front of us as a batting group. We're here to correct the wrongs from the last game. We're a young team that is learning every game. We're playing the same team.

Samson: We would have liked to bowl first on this wicket too. The chatter in the camp is just to be smarter and understand what the conditions demand. We were lucky to get a strong team at the auction. One change: Navdeep Saini comes in place of Coulter-Nile.

2.53pm Star Sports reports that Suryakumar wasn't spotted at the MI warm-ups. Will Anmolpreet get another go if Surya isn't fit enough?

Nandhana: "Gonna have to back Tilak Verma after his impressive batting in Mumbai's tournament opener. Also, Riyan Parag should play as a specialist batsman, not as an all rounder. Dewald Brevis aka Baby AB is the goy to watch out for."

2.50pm We're ten minutes away from the toss. A fresh pitch has been rolled out at the DY Patil Stadium. You can watch the match LIVE in the USA on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Nikhil: "If RR opted for 5 proper bowlers, they could have gone for a proper batter in Karun nair instead of Parag. But Parag has been hitting well in the nets i suppose and they want to give him the continuity. Why change things if they could get going like last game"

2.45pm If you're into fantasy cricket, we recommend you to pick MI legspinner M Ashwin who could be a point of difference in their attack.

Fun fact: M Ashwin's father Era Murugan, a writer, penned dialogues for the Kamal Hasan movie Unnai Pol Oruvan, the Tamil remake of A Wednesday

CricDude: "There are talks about RR's death bowling and the 6th batting position. I have a rather unpopular idea on that. Neesham and KC Cariappa for NCN and Parag. Cariappa and Neesham for death overs too. Narine has done it before. Cariappa did that in domestic matches. Why not try? Neesham was almost death overs specialist for NZ. Cariappa can be handy with the bat too."

2.40pm Mumbai will be buoyed by the return of Suryakumar Yadav from injury. Where will he bat? "There is a possibility depending on the opposition we are playing and the conditions we are playing in," Zaheer Khan, Mumbai's director of cricket operations, said on the prospect of Suryakumar being a finisher, like he is with the Indian team. "We might opt for those kind of options, but at the end the decision is pretty much [to] stick with whatever has been working for us and whatever a player can bring in in terms of maximum impact."

Garv Asnani: "As we saw in the auction, both of these teams were bidding against each other for most of the times. But it was Rajasthan who got the upper hand and Mumbai will be missing many of their ex-players who are now in Rajasthan like Boult, Coulter-Nile and Neesham."

2.35pm Mumbai Indians, who are usually slow starters in the league, run into early pace-setters Rajasthan Royals this afternoon at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. Mahela Jayawardene vs Kumar Sangakkara & Lasith Malinga. Rohit Sharma vs Sanju Samson. Kieron Pollard vs Shimron Hetmyer. Jasprit Bumrah vs Trent Boult. M Ashwin vs R Ashwin. This could be fun. I'm Deivarayan Muthu and I'll be joined by Sreshth Shah to bring you ball-by-ball action.

text: shorter and Bumrah brings another one back into Buttler, this tucks him up, squeezed into the leg side
postText: Mustafa Moudi : "Fun Fact: Both these side swapped their premium Fast-Bowlers - Boult and Archer from last season. But RR had the advantage of Boult's service this year while MI will have to at least wait for next season for Archer's service!!"

text: Bumrah searches for the inswinging yorker, but slides it down the leg side. Buttler tickles it away fine past the tumbling Kishan for four
shorter and seams away outside off against the incoming angle. Buttler throws his hands outside off and is beaten in the channel
Bumrah hits a heavy length once again, this is slanted back into Buttler, who does not make contact with a flick and wears it on his body
full-toss, starts outside off and swings away from Buttler as he plays and misses once again
good length and sliding back in at off stump, tip and run to cover
preText: Sams from the other end. Left-arm over

text: nip-backer from a short of a length, kicks up and catches Buttler in a tangle and hits him just below the ribs
preText: Stays over the wicket to Butler

text: hip-high short ball, straightens along an off-stump line. Buttler sizes it up and mows it over midwicket for six. Such a powerful back-foot pull
fuller than a good length and curls back into Buttler once again. Carefully tapped down to mid-on
even fuller on middle and leg, suspect it was the slower variation, played back to Sams
Buttler picks this full ball off his pads and flicks it away to deep midwicket
nice and full, swinging back into off and middle, blocked back to Bumrah
full and veering into the pads, deflected away only as far as Kishan
another nip-backer from Bumrah, 139ks, inside-edged onto the pad. Buttler chances a single. M Ashwin can't throw the stumps down. A direct hit could've had Jaiswal

wkt_text: YBK Jaiswal c David b Bumrah 1 (13m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: Chipped into the lap of square leg. This wasn't a great ball from Bumrah - good length and on the hips - but it brings the right result for MI. Jaiswal is usually strong off his hips, but this he picks out David in the infield
preText: Deepak Samson : "Just sense Buttler is a bit tentative against Bumrah. Those stats playing on his mind?"
postText: Adil: "As a MI fan, I am bit sad to see Malinga sitting in RR dug out. He was arguably the biggest match winner MI had after Pollard. "

text: Test-match line and length from Bumrah. Pitched up and angling across off stump, left alone
preText: Padikkal joins Buttler

text: chipped in the air once again, this time Padikkal clears mid-on for a second-ball four. Bumrah stays on the pads, Padikkal punishes him this time

shortText: Basil Thampi to Buttler, no run
text: very full on middle and leg, clipped away straight to midwicket
preText: Basil Thampi comes on. Over the wicket

text: Buttler splices a pull over mid-on for four. Thampi shortens his length outside off, Buttler clears the infield and collects four
clobbered over long-on for six. Off-stump half-volley from Thampi, poor ball and duly put away by Buttler. He clears his front leg and dumps it over the leg side
shanked over midwicket for another six. 140.3ks, just short of a good length and outside off. Buttler jumps back and swings it over the leg side once again
Having seen off Bumrah, Buttler is laying into Thampi. A bit too full on the stumps, he clears his front leg once again and belts it over Thampi's head

Clubbed over wide long-on boundary for another six. Thampi ventures a slower ball outside off. Floated too full, Buttler manufactures his own pace and sends it over the leg side. Make that 26 runs off Thampi's first over
tickled off the hips to short fine leg as M Ashwin starts with a slower legbreak
preText: M Ashwin has been give more responsibility at MI. He will bowl in the powerplay once again

text: pretty full on middle, driven away to the left of long-on. They take on Pollard's arm and complete a double
whisked more or less straight to long-on off the front foot this time
starts off with the wrong'un to Buttler, finishes on the pads, worked away to square leg
preText: Watch out for M Ashwin's wrong'un

text: seems like another wrong'un from Ashwin, down the track and flicked away through the gap at midwicket
another googly from M Ash, darted on a back of a length and veering away from the left-handed Padikkal. Played back to the bowler. Good first over from M Ash
good length and on middle from over the wicket, guided to cover
preText: Double-change: Tymal Mills. Left-arm over to Buttler

text: Mills puts it on an in-between length and gets it to leave Buttler. He has a weak prod and watches the ball pass the outside edge
shorter and rises further at Buttler who hops and fends it off to the off side
preText: Sunil.G: "Do we get to see Tim David bowling today and may be even Pollard to make up for Thampi's quota?"

text: Buttler jumps across off for the ramp over short fine leg, but Mills drags his length back and beats him outside off
fuller and dips on the stumps, slower variation at 113ks, driven to mid-on
postText: Proudfoot: "Basil Thampi is a really good bowler who can hit the deck hard and can generate some decent pace. I really hope he gets going well and finds a place somewhere."

wkt_text: D Padikkal c Sharma b Mills 7 (17m 7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: Padikkal holes out off the last ball of the powerplay. M Ashwin and Mills have pulled things back for MI. Dug in on a back of a length on middle, gets big on Padikkal who advanced at Mills. He ends up flapping a weak pull to Rohit who settles under the skier at cover
postText:
Time-out at DY Patil Stadium. Parag at No.6. R Ashwin at No.7. RR's batting line-up looks a whole lot lighter after the loss of two wickets in the powerplay

Malli: "MI have 18 runs and took 2 wickets in the remaining overs in PP except for that huge over from Thampi. MI will be satisfied team so far"

text: floated on a length on middle, glanced away through backward square leg
preText: Pollard will probably fill in for Thampi

text: good length and nibbling into middle, defensively knocked away
slower, shorter and wider. Samson latches onto it and carves a cut through backward point for four
wide of the crease, back of a length and floated into middle, played back to Pollard
postText: Stuart: "Mumbai are one wicket (Buttler) away from bundling Royals out for 130/140"

text: just short of a good length and outside off, solidly punched away to the left of cover
slower ball on a back of a length and outside off, punched away wide of sweeper cover
preText: Deepak Samson : "Thampi will probably be brought back after Buttler is dismissed"

text: 117.6ks slower ball, short and angling across off, Buttler chops it away through the cover-point region
preText: Sams is back

text: on-pace back of a length delivery sliding across off, Samson opts to let it go
full again and angling across off stump, dinked away to deep third man

short and Sams takes it away from Buttler's swinging arc. Buttler reaches out for the ball outside off and scythes it away to the left of sweeper cover. Anmolpreet tears across to his left, aims to slide it back into play, but the ball rolls behind to the boundary
Buttler brings up a 32-ball half-century. Shortish and angling across him once again, dinked away fine of short third man for another four
finishes the over with another slower cutter, which is forced away to wide long-off
fuller and sliding into the pads, clipped away through square leg
preText: Raghul S: "For RR to put up a challenging total, they should start attacking in the middle overs. Scoring against the deadly pair of Bumrah and Mills at death is simply out of the equation."

text: slides it down the leg side, Buttler sweeps and misses, wide called
preText: M Ashwin is back

text: Samson backs away outside leg, Ashwin slips in his go-to ball the googly and keeps him to a single to midwicket
dangled up and veering into middle, another googly? Played back to Ashwin
preText: Santhosh: "Chahal at 8? That's something more than a long tail"

text: wide of the crease, short and angling into middle, stabbed away to the midwicket region
darted down the leg side, Buttler catches up with this and shovels a sweep, but can't beat Bumrah at short fine leg. Ashwin gets away with that
Ashwin slides down the leg side once again, this time Buttler punishes him, sweeping him fine of Bumrah at short fine leg
very full and wide of off, angling away from Samson further. Sliced away to the left of sweeper cover
preText: Mills replaces Sams

text: low full-toss, dipping into leg stump, this slower ball is tucked away behind square. Thampi hunts it down in the outfield with a slide
short and slanted across off, cut away straight to point off the back foot
Whacked away to the right of deep midwicket. Chest-high short ball on middle, sits up for Buttler, pulled away over the leg side
punched away to the right of point with an open face
Samson joins the party! Slower ball into the pitch at 113.7ks, sits up to be hit. Samson obliges, swatting it over midwicket. He holds nothing back does Samson
pushed through on middle, non-turner from Ashwin, swept flat and hard through square leg
M Ashwin needs to reset his radar. Another leg-side wide
pumped over long-off for six. Samson gives himself room, takes this legbreak from outside off and launches it downtown. Such a clean strike
shorter and turns away outside off, forced down to long-off off the back foot
preText: Rohit has a chat with his legspinner
postText: Muhammed Riyas: "With Rohit's style of captaincy, we'll see Bumrah soon back in action, to remove Butler/Samson before they run away with the match."

text: Buttler backs away outside leg even before Ashwin delivers. Here comes the legbreak. Here goes the legbreak over extra-cover. Buttler takes it from middle stump and hoists it over the off side
speared down the leg side for another wide
postText: Sajid: "Everyone saying RR got a weaker batting line up. But why don't you see the other side of the coin. RR got a strong bowling unit and would be able to defend a par total really well. Mind that there is no threat of dew as well! "

text: Reverse-swatted away to the right of short third man, where Tymal Mills fumbles and gives up four. He puts his hand up in apology right away
quicker googly on middle and leg, patted into the leg side
full and angling across off, driven more or less straight to extra-cover
preText: Sams has been called back into the attack

text: dipping slower ball wide of off, Buttler reaches out and flays it down to wide long-off
yorker on middle and leg, Samson, having shuffled across off, gets back in line and squeezes it out
Samson launches it over extra-cover for six. Another slower ball from Sams, but he has overpitched it. Samson lines it up and swings it away
lifter, angling across off, one for the over, as the ball sails past Samson to Kishan
Sams nails a middle-stump yorker to close out the over. Squirted back to him
short and wide of off, scythed away to sweeper cover
short and into the pitch, punched down to long-on
slower ball from Pollard once again. Banged in short and outside off, Buttler delays the ramp and gets it fine of short third man for four
bursts from a back of a length outside off and beats Buttler on the cut
preText: Raja Muthu: "Butler is a perfect T20 opener .. knows when to defend and when to attack"

text: back of a length and outside off, Buttler opens the face and finds a single between point and short third man
clipped away through midwicket. Samson eyes a double, but has to settle with a single in the end
on a length and angling into off stump, played back to him
preText: Bumrah is back. Can de deliver a breakthrough for MI?

text: back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, run away towards point
back of a length and angling into a solid punch down to long-on
postText: Shaji: "5 years back the discussion was whether it is Gayle or Warner or both as opener in an all time IPL XI. Buttler is definitely giving us a happy headache now! "

text: full-toss outside off, as Bumrah misses the yorker, sliced away to the left of backward point and right of deep third man for four
back of a length and slanting into the top of off, defended back to Bumrah off the front foot
shortish and outside off, tip and run to cover. Buttler plays out another over of Bumrah
postText: Anthony: "There is still division here in England whether Jos should be the opener or finisher. At this rate, he could perfectly do both......"

text: flicked off the pads through backward square leg for a single

wkt_text: SV Samson c Tilak Varma b Pollard 30 (39m 21b 1x4 3x6) SR: 142.85
text: Pollard has Samson holing out. Another slower ball into the pitch, 112ks, messes with Samson's pull. Simple catch at deep midwicket for N Tilak Varma. Timely wicket for MI
preText: Shaik: "I guess MI Management would me ruing the decision of leaving Buttler, and RR the happiest for retaining him. May be they won't leave them for at least 5 years!! "

text: pitched-up delivery outside off, driven away to the left of long-on
preText: Hetmyer vs Pollard

text: slower offcutter, flicked away through square leg for a hard-run double
preText: Basil George: "Pollard is doing a great job.. taking the pace off and bowling a length which looks a slight difficult to take shots "

text: fuller and drifting down the leg side with short fine leg inside the circle, glanced away fine of that infielder
full and straight, whipped away to deep midwicket
postText: Kansan : "Rohit as always is street smart. Used Pollard really well. "

text: good length and sliding across off, wafted back to Sams
preText: Sams. Left-arm over

text: back of a length, starts outside off and angling away from Buttler, slashed away to sweeper cover
slower cutter, floated in towards leg stump, chipped down to long-on
bouncer, heading down the leg side, wide called. Sams has to re-bowl it
wide yorker, squirted out in front of the keeper
preText: Ashish: "@Shaik - you can't have all the great T20 players in one team, budget constraints. And this is what makes IPL interesting."

text: slower ball into the pitch, on a middle-stump line, dinked to midwicket
full and veering down the leg side
another wide yorker from Sams, squeezes underneath Buttler's bat
preText: Muhammed Riyas: "When "Universal Boss" left IPL, "Universal Joss" takes over!!"

text: thigh-high short ball, drifting into leg stump. Hetmyer gets inside the line, picks it up and shovel-pulls it over backward square leg
swiped over midwicket for six. Just short of a good length and outside off, Hetmyer delays the pull, bends his back knee, and puts it away over the leg side
full-toss outside off, Hetmyer maintains a stable base and hauls it away to the right of long-on for another boundary
postText: Ashwin: "After getting a hammering in the first match, Sams has bowled well here. He has bowled good yorkers, bouncers and slower ones. "

text: Pollard loses his line this time. Full and sprayed down the leg side, with fine leg inside the circle, turned away to the right of short fine leg
back of a length and heading down the leg side, Hetmyer can't put bat on ball, but it brushes the pad and rolls away past the tumbling keeper into the fine-leg fence
slower offcutter, but finishes past the tramline. Left alone. Off-side wide
pitched-up delivery on the stumps, driven down to long-on. Royals plunder 26 off Pollard's last over
spanked over midwicket for six. On-pace full ball outside off, Hetmyer doesn't middle it, but still clears the leg-side boundary
preText: Mills is back, replacing Sams

text: Mills wins an lbw appeal from umpire Menon. Hetmyer reviews the on-field out decision. Change-up delivery from Mills as he takes pace off. Dips at middle stump. Hetmyer, having jumped across off for the scoop, misses it altogether. No inside edge. The ball hits the back pad in line with middle. The impact was outside off, so the on-field decision has been overturned
on-pace short ball, the line is wide of off, 140ks. Hetmyer reaches out for the ball, uses the pace, and steers it away between backward point and short third man
mighty full on middle, 141.2ks, draws a leading edge that rolls down to long-off
preText: Aditya: "Butler and MI is a breakup gone bad"

text: dipping yorker from round the stumps, squeezes underneath Buttler's bat
hard-length delivery outside off, Butter moves to 99 with a weak little push down to long-off

inswinging yorker from Bumrah at 141ks, jammed into the leg side. Bumrah goes up for an lbw appeal. Not given out. Bumrah and Rohit ask for a review. Think Buttler inside-edged it onto the pad. Indeed. So, the on-field not-out decision is vindicated. Buttler hits the first century of IPL 2022. He raises his bat and a hug from Hetmyer is also part of the celebrations

wkt_text: SO Hetmyer c Tilak Varma b Bumrah 35 (25m 14b 3x4 3x6) SR: 250.00
text: slower full-toss angling across off stump. Hetmyer bends his back knee and hauls it straight to deep midwicket. Hetmyer throws his back in despair but he's played another blinder in the IPL: 35 off 14 balls at a strike rate of 250
another inswinging yorker from Bumrah, 142ks, Parag hastily jabs his bat down. Not given out lbw. Perhaps it was heading down the leg side
preText: Parag

text: Buttler shuffles across off and misses the scoop. This one dips and nearly shaves the leg stump

wkt_text: JC Buttler  b Bumrah 100 (97m 68b 11x4 5x6) SR: 147.05
text: Bumrah yorks Buttler. 145ks, swinging into the blockhole. Buttler hastily jabs his bat down, but this is too good for him. Clatters into the base of middle stump. Nevertheless, excellent innings from Buttler (although he slowed down later)

wkt_text: R Ashwin run out 1 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: pitched up and outside off, sliced away to the right of sweeper cover. Ashwin wants the second and is caught short. Terrific last over from Bumrah. Sharp throw from Tilak Varma in the deep
preText: Kiran : "Other than that full toss, this is as close to a flawless over as I've seen in some time. "
postText: Prithvi: "After a rare off day in the first match, boom boom Bumrah is back. "

text: off-stump yorker, squirted into the covers
preText: Mills to bowl the last over

text: Saini backs away outside leg and slices this middle-stump delivery in front of sweeper cover
preText: Mir: "That over from Bumrah is worth a 15-run head start to Mumbai's innings"

wkt_text: NA Saini c †Ishan Kishan b Mills 2 (4m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
text: Kishan settles under this skier. Clever slower variation from the back of the hand. Saini is already through with the leg-side slog by the time the ball reaches him. Kishan does the rest
preText: Tinura: "Yorking a set batter who was smashing bowlers all over the park. Bumrah doing Bumrah things. Malinga will be proud despite being in the RR dugout."

text: slower bouncer, 107ks, flapped away to short fine leg
preText: KB: " if there was another batsman rn (Mitchell or neesham), the score could've crossed 200 and not hover around 180s. RR might pay for not scoring these extra 15 to 20 runs."

text: on-pace full ball outside off, Mills pitches it in Parag's slot. The batter holds his shape and thumps this half-volley past the bowler for four

shortText: Boult to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: full outside off. Bit of swing away as Kishan stretches out and fends to the off side.
preText: 5.30pm Welcome back to the chase. The openers - Ishan Kishan and Rohit Sharma - make their way out. Two slips for Trent Boult, against his old side.

shortText: Boult to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: fullish outside off stump. Movement away and Kishan pokes one towards backward point
slapped in front of square for four. Boult goes length, offers Kishan room, and he clatters a cut through the infield

shortText: Boult to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: full on off and Kishan's head falls over as he looks to whip it to the leg side. Hits the front leg, but only a polite enquiry for lbw since it's probably going high

shortText: Boult to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: full outside off. Bit of shape away. Pushed to the off side

shortText: Boult to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: full outside off stump. Stretches out to meet this ball that's already moving away. Mistimed towards point
full on middle, and Rohit is off the mark with a flick through the leg side to the sweeper fielder in the deep
swivels and deposits a pull off his gut area to sent it over fine leg! Not short enough to trouble Rohit, and he's put that away
length ball angling into his pads, and nudged off his pads through to the sweeper fielder on the leg side behind square
goes full, but down the leg side. Rohit tried flicking behind square anyway, but missed out

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Sharma, no run
text: fullish on off stump. Angling into his pads again. Rohit tries to flick it square, but misses it. Hits him on the flap of the front pad

wkt_text: RG Sharma c Parag b Prasidh Krishna 10 (11m 5b 0x4 1x6) SR: 200.00
text: crunched, but straight to the fielder! Stylish catch from the stylish Riyan Parag, rocking the goggles. Krishna bowls a nothing delivery, short and wide, asking to be hit, but Rohit fails to get it over point. Parag goes low, takes the catch, and the Royals fielders are celebrating!
preText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: How has Rohit Sharma done against left-arm pace (since 2019)?

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Anmolpreet Singh, FOUR
text: full on his toes, and Anmolpreet begins his innings beautifully. Flicks it right off his boot, and sends it to midwicket for four
back of a length outside off but angling into his body. Tucks him up, and he uncomfortably nurdles it to the leg side for a quick single
full on middle and off. Anmolpreet punches a front-foot drive between cover and mid off for a single

teasing! Full on middle, and Kishan looks to go over the leg side but the ball swings away and takes the leading edge. In the air, but it falls just beyond Parag chasing it from backward point. A sloppy throw earns them an overthrow

shortText: Boult to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: top ball. Length ball outside off but shaping away. Kishan sticks the bat out in a desire to play at it, but it goes past the edge

shortText: Boult to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: full outside off. Gentle push to the off side off the front foot
good length, on off. Stays on the back foot, and guides a flick off his waist to deep midwicket

shortText: Saini to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: back of a length on off and angling across Kishan. He dabs this with the angle to the off side
preText: Saini, first time this season.

text: so quick to spot the length! Saini goes short on leg stump, Kishan is quick to pirouette on his toes, and then hooks it over fine leg so easily

goes full, outside off stump. Takes pace off again, and Kishan knows it's a risk-free ball and therefore absolutely clubs it with as much power as he can. Gets it over the cover-mid off region for four more

shortText: Saini to Ishan Kishan, (no ball) FOUR
text: slower ball. Wider outside off. Kishan is through the shot too early as he looks to smack it straight. Loses shape, one hand comes off the bat, but still gets enough power to hammer it over mid off. Front foot no ball too
good length ball on middle and off. Dabbed down to third man

shortText: Saini to Anmolpreet Singh, no run
text: full outside off. Meets the ball on the front foot and drives to mid off's left

wkt_text: Anmolpreet Singh c Padikkal b Saini 5 (13m 4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 125.00
text: the extra ball has earned Saini a wicket Fullish outside off, but the ball doesn't come off the deck as quickly as it should've. Anmolpreet's attempted loft over cover is mistimed, and cover pockets that with ease
postText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Which team has the best win-loss ratio against Mumbai Indians?

text: full just outside off. Skips down the wicket and pushes it to mid on
preText: Ashwin. Around the stumps.

text: off the mark with an inside out push to wide long off. Full on middle and Tilak backed away before playing the shot
preText: With two left-handers out there, Samson has swiftly moved to Ash.

text: fullish on off. Angling in with the arm instead of turning across. Worked off his waist to square leg

shortText: Ashwin to Tilak Varma, no run
text: length ball on off. Punched off the back foot, straight to Ashwin

good length, outside off. Back-foot tap towards cover and they call for a quick one. Fielder from cover aims at the bowler's end for a run out, and Jaiswal very nearly knocks Ashwin over with that throw
full on off. Gets onto the front foot and plays against the turn, guiding one to midwicket for one

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Ishan Kishan, FOUR
text: guided for four to third man. Prasidh bowls length on middle and off. Kishan waits for it and plays the shot super late
preText: Prasidh is back.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: rolls his fingers over this ball. Length on off, and slapped with a lot of force, but the timing is not quite right

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: good length on middle. Bit of extra bounce and Kishan tries to play a cute late dab to third man but this time he can't get bat on ball. Past the bat's outside edge to Samson

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: good length outside off, and he flays a cut to point. Misfield from Parag, and even though he recovers quickly, they can collect the single

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Tilak Varma, no run
text: good length ball on leg. Bit of extra bounce. Varma is cramped, and offers no real shot. Hits him near the top of the pad and rolls away to the off side
preText: Team fifty up.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Tilak Varma, no run
text: just short of Saini at mid off! Tantalising. Slower ball on middle and off. Varma meets it with hard hands and the ball has popped up in the air. Saini at mid off scurries in to take a catch, even puts a slide in, but the ball falls in front of him.
postText: That's a good comeback over from Prasidh, more so since he conceded a four off the first ball in this over too

text: full on off. Kishan gives Ashwin a charge to look for a big shot straight but mistimes it. Ball rolls away to wide long on
flatter ball, less loop. Length delivery skidding into Varma. Worked to deep midwicket
full ball on leg stump. Dug away to midwicket, and they jog across for one
full on leg stump. Gets forward and flicks off his toes to deep midwicket
preText: Ashwin darting them in after noticing Kishan is giving him the charge.

text: full on leg stump. Kishan's first sweep of the evening, hitting it to deep backward square leg

is that the flattest six ever?! Ashwin tries to cramp him with a length ball angling in, but he is quick to turn to his right, opening up the leg side and then drills a pull from near his waist to deep backward square leg for six. Very little elevation as it falls beyond the boundary line. That's a good way to end an otherwise quiet over

shortText: Chahal to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: full on middle and finds turn right away. Turning into leg, and hits Kishan's pad
preText: Chahal.

text: good length, on leg and turning further into his pads. Flicked to the sweeper fielder behind square on the leg side
googly. Fullish on off and turning away. Varma mistimes a cut in front of square and calls early for the second run
full on middle. Flicked off his pads with the turn to the right of short fine leg
preText: Afeef: "Watching Tilak bat reminds me of former MI player Krunal Pandya. They have similar physique and their batting style is also similar."

text: Kishan walks around his crease before Chahal delivers it. Good length on middle, and worked off his pads to the leg side
full on middle and leg. Turning in. Varma goes for the sweep, and gets a top edge over Samson. Chahal's got both hands on his head
Saini starts with a low full toss outside off. Varma walks across to the off side and drills a drive through cover point for four!
preText: Tilak Varma gets a bit of treatment on his arm. Maybe the last delivery hit his arm instead of glove/bat

text: full and wide. Varma goes for another attacking shot but this one is a bit too far for him to get the sweet-spot connection off the bat. Slapped to deep point
full and wide outside off stump. Throws his bat at this, and ends up slicing an uncontrolled shot to deep backward point
Saini continues taking the length ball away from Kishan. He walks across to the off side and slaps it to point
preText: Required run rate almost 10.5.

text: how good is that? Full, just outside off, Varma stands still, offers the full face of the bat, and lofts it over long off. Saini pays the price of being a bit predictable with his line. Tilak expected the ball somewhere in that region
back of a length on middle and leg. Slower ball bouncer, in fact. Tucked from near his face to square leg, and they are off for one. Time out
full on middle stump. Wants to work it leg side, but it takes a leading edge to the off side
preText:
112 needed off 66 and here's Chahal for his second over.

RT: "Just 1 dot ball in the last 3 overs!!! That's what is maintaining the RR below 11! Fab"
