text: full outside off. But Kishan comes down the track and therefore ends up yorking himself by mistake. Dug away to the off side

strike rate of nearly 200 with that six and he's not afraid to take on someone of Chahal's calibre. Full on middle. Turns into Tilak as he comes skipping down the track. And smacks it across the line over cow corner.

shortText: Chahal to Tilak Varma, no run
text: good length, on leg stump. Tilak loses balance as he thinks about backing away to make room. Defended

full outside leg. Chahal misses his line, and Tilak punishes him with a glorious sweep. Gets low, down on one knee, and knocks a punch with his sweep. Uses his wrists to play it finer than usual. #Whippy

shortText: Chahal to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full on middle and off. Defended off the front foot
postText: Shovik: "What's the point of thinning your batting and playing an extra bowler when they're getting tonked because of decent line and lengths. They missed out on 20 extra runs by not playing daryl or neesham"

shortText: Ashwin to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: Ashwin around the stumps. Good length outside off. Quicker ball, skidding through. Misses the cut
full just outside off. Kishan skips down and converts it into a full toss. Slapped down the ground to long on for one
flatter. Full on off and worked off his pads to midwicket. Dangerous two, but Tilak gets in there before his 2020 U-19 World Cup mate Yashasvi Jaiswal could make his throw count
full outside off stump. Pushed towards cover for a jogging single

the fine margins between "catch of the season" and going down as a dropped catch! Full on middle. Kishan goes for the slog sweep, but it doesn't have the distance. Jaiswal at cow corner runs to his left, and jumps to his left to take a catch, but it just doesn't stick! #InAndOut
flatter, length ball on middle. Flicked off his waist to deep midwicket
postText: Prashant: "Ashwin being a senior cricketer needs to appreciate the efforts of such attempts. Somehow, he always ends up making faces. "

text: around the stumps. Full outside leg. Even Kishan is surprised by the line. Mistimes a one-handed sweep to the leg side for a couple. Could've potentially been five wides
preText: Interesting choice, Riyan Parag.

text: full on leg. Kishan uses the angle Parag is offering by sweeping to Chahal at fine leg
good length on leg. Varma goes way back - exposing all stumps - before cutting to the deep
postText: Nikhiljoy: "Both sides on similar pace in their innings so far and have similar batters in lower order. Trouble is RR doesnt have the death bowling capability MI has. They have to strangle MI in the middle overs to have any chance in the match. Right now it looks like MI is running away with the game"

text: good length on middle. Bit of grip off the deck, slowing it down before reaching Kishan. Drags a pull in front of square, but mistimed

that's hit the cameraman on the head! Hope he is okay as Varma chooses to hit Parag's full ball on off with a beautiful front-foot loft. Good to see Boult first checking up on the cameraperson before bothering about where the ball is

shortText: Parag to Tilak Varma, no run
text: pushed to the off side
postText: Mudassar Ahmad: "Tilak Verma looks like younger Shikhar Dhawan to me, Strong and hits Straight!! One for the future for Sure!!! "

text: fullish ball angling into him, and worked off his pads behind square on the leg side
preText: Royals need a wicket, and so Boult is back.

text: full toss on leg stump, nearly waist high. Mistimed to midwicket for one
full outside off stump. Kishan drills a drive straight down, and the long-off fielder cannot stop it despite getting to the ball! Fiffy for the richest Indian at the auction
full toss outside leg and going further down
preText: Jayawardene: We have given ourselves a good chance after losing a couple of wickets. One side is a short boundary, so getting 9-10 runs per over is not that hard.

text: good length, on a fourth-stump line. Cut to deep point
postText: abhim: "it really shows why Tilak Verma is rated so highly in domestic circuit. Irrespective of how much he scores in this match, his talent should be nurtured. An attacking left hander in the middle order - anybody remembers one Mr. Singh?"

text: Varma moves to 49 with that punch of a full toss to long off

wkt_text: Ishan Kishan c Saini b Boult 54 (64m 43b 5x4 1x6) SR: 125.58
text: what's happened there? Saini is holding his head. OK, he's fine, and Kishan is gone. Saini takes a catch, but he has taken a blow to his head/back of the neck while completing the catch. Boult was brought back for the wicket and he delivered. Length ball angling in, and Kishan went for the pull. But couldn't really get the connection with Boult cramping him. Saini at deep backward square leg takes a catch, but tumbles over while completing it, and ends up having an awkward fall where his body weight went onto his neck for a brief moment.
first of many! Legbreak on off stump, and he cuts this length ball to deep point for his maiden IPL fifty. Raises his bat all around, and Pollard congratulates him too
preText: Seems like they want to check up on Saini, so he is off the field. Maybe for concussion (for the whiplash he suffered on the way down) or for his neck. Either way, hope he makes a swift recovery. He did walk out of the boundary though, so good to see him up. Pollard joins Tilak.

text: hits his pad and rolls away square.
preText: Update: We can see Kuldip Yadav talking to Lasith Malinga and warming up. Maybe he can be Saini's concussion sub if the match referee signs off on it.

shortText: Chahal to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full on leg. Slower through the air this time. Varma bunts one off the back foot, but finds midwicket, where sub fielder Neesham is lurking
good length outside off and turning further away. Varma wants to cut, but it's a wide

poor from Yuzi and Varma punishes him. Length ball on leg stump. Legbreak turns it even further down the leg side. Varma stays on the back foot and hammers this drag-down ball over deep backward square leg for four more. Strong wrists on display once again, going low to get that elevation with his connection
good length. On off stump. Cut to deep point for a single

full outside off. Turning away. Pollard looks to play a wild heave/slog over the leg side, but misses. Samson whips the bails off, and the square umpire has gone up for a TV referral. Pollard is safe, his back leg is grounded despite the long stride forward
preText: a slip for Pollard.
postText: Abhimanyu Singh: "They should rename Mumbai Indians as India A. No other IPL franchise has unearthed even half the talent that MI has. Truly the Men In Blue. "

text: this young man is making heads turn! Reverse sweep over regulation third man! Full on middle and off. Varma changes his stance and lifts it with ease and sends it near the supersopper that is parked outside the boundary
preText: Ashwin for his final over.

wkt_text: NT Tilak Varma  b Ashwin 61 (50m 33b 3x4 5x6) SR: 184.84
text: the senior gets the youngster but what an innings! Full on middle. Varma gets low for a sweep. Misses, deceived by the slower ball, and that knocks off stump back. Ashwin gives Varma a bit of a send off after being clattered for a reverse-sweep six off the last ball. The Mumbai bench is standing to greet Varma back
postText: Krish: "Wow that meant a lot to ash! What a celebration! " -- It only increases Tilak Varma's stocks that a senior bowler like Ashwin celebrated his wicket with such aggression

text: over the stumps. Full outside off and the carrom ball turns slightly away. David can't connect with the drive, and through to Samson
preText: Tim David. Slip, Parag under the helmet on the leg side

text: full and wide. David comfortably cuts to deep point for a single
good length on off. Stands tall and fended back to Ashwin
preText: Two new batters in the crease. These last 5.2 overs will be a cracking contest.

text: full on off. Driven back to Ashwin, and he ends his spell on a high. Four dots off his last five balls, plus the wicket of the dangerous Tilak

wkt_text: TH David lbw b Chahal 1 (6m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33
text: fullish ball around leg stump. Legbreak turns across David but he is caught on the back foot while the ball hits his pad. Appeal for lbw and given. David chats with Pollard and they take the review - fair enough, there's no use taking the reviews home. No bat involved, and the ball is pitching on leg stump. Ball-tracking shows the ball would "clip" middle stump, and therefore David has to walk back.
postText: final time out of this game.

wkt_text: DR Sams c Buttler b Chahal 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: the Buttler does it! And Chahal shows his worth with two wickets in two balls. Full ball on middle, the googly turns into Sams so he has lesser room in having a free flow of the bat. Sliced in the air, Buttler - from cover - runs towards mid off, away from the pitch and facing the boundary as the ball goes over his shoulder. Then throws his body forward, offering some hang time, before taking the catch on the way down
preText: Sams.

text: is that a hat-trick missed? Oh yes, poor Chahal! Full ball on off. Googly turns into him. Looks to fend having not known where the ball is turning. Takes the outside edge and goes to the left of Karun Nair at first slip, but he has fluffed the catch!
full outside leg. Driven to long on for one
full on middle. Defended with the full face of the bat
preText: Poor Chahal! It was a snap catch that took Karun by surprise but he was there for exactly that purpose. Chahal has to forget that now with two balls to go.
postText: Mustafa Moudi: "For me Chahal has completed his hattrick. He has created the chance !!"

text: good length wider outside off. Turning further away. Pollard pokes at it, and taps it to point. Chahal finishes on 2 for 26
postText: As soon as the over ended, Karun Nair ran over to Yuzvendra Chahal and they hugged it out. No hard feelings clearly, with both wearing a smile. Royals now heavy favourites.

text: good length on off stump. Tap and run towards point for one

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pollard, no run
text: full on middle, and he looks to flick it off his pads. Misses, hits the front leg. LBW appeal turned down. They don't review, the angle probably taking it down the leg side
preText: Ram_Modies: "Pollard has to be aggressive from the start - no runs off 6 balls just takes away too many balls even if he is famed for making up for it in the end. He does so more when they're posting a score and not when they're chasing. MI will lose here and KP will not have scored even a run a ball."

text: length ball outside off stump. Cut behind square for one
back of a length on middle and leg. Going further down

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Ashwin, no run
text: back of a length on middle and leg. Sways away from the ball's line, gets low, and lets the ball go through to Samson
hammered over cover. Prasidh goes length outside off. M Ashwin has a flurry with the bat, and gets enough connection to clear the infield.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Ashwin, no run
text: back of a length on off and middle. Left alone by Murugan Ashwin
full toss on his pads. Pollard looks to club it through midwicket but the bat's face turns and the ball goes behind square for four
preText: Boult for his final over.

text: full outside off stump. Angling away as Pollard looks to drive. Misses, and through to Samson

there's life in this game as Pollard deposits Boult for a six over wide long on! Full on off. Pollard walks a bit towards the off side and clatters it over Riyan Parag who is manning the boundary line
full outside off. Pollard gets low and drags a shot from outside off to long on
low full toss quite wide outside off. Ashwin walks to the off side and slaps the full toss, but straight to cover on the bounce
preText: Boult will want to keep M Ashwin on strike for the last two balls.

text: low full toss on middle. Flicked to deep midwicket. M Ashwin wants the single but Pollard turns it down!
postText: Pollard on strike for the 19th.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pollard, no run
text: full and wide. Scrambled seam. Not bowling in Pollard's arc, and he toe-ends an attempted slog back to the bowler
preText: So Prasidh and Saini have 1 over each left, but we haven't seen Saini on the field for a while. Who will bowl the 20th?! This 19th is crucial, Prasidh needs to ensure he leaves enough runs for, say, a part-timer's 20th.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pollard, no run
text: slower ball, full on middle, and angling further into Pollard. He shapes up to tee off, but is deceived by the lack of pace. Hits the pad and rolls away to the off side
gets back on strike as Prasidh bowls around off stump. Drilled to long off, and even though the throw was good from Parag, Pollard committed early for the second
postText: Unadkat runs out with two new bats for Pollard.

text: another wide. Back of a length outside off. Collects the extra run
full and wide. On the tram-lines. Is that a hat-trick of dots? No, umpire Pathak says that's wide.
postText: Dixith : "It was a tactical mistake from Pollard to take single of 17.4. Could have easily scored 4-6 runs more by keeping the strike."

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pollard, no run
text: full outside off. Pollard throws his bat at this, and slices it high in the air. Jaiswal at deep point is waiting to gobble it up, but maybe, just maybe, he had too much time! Drops a regulation catch, but atleast he didn't knock it over for six. He was close to the line
back of a length on off. Goes for the pull, misses, ball goes over his helmet, and Samson grabs. Umpire Pathak says that's a wide
cruel as this full ball gets Pollard's outside edge and flies over short third man. Full ball just outside off

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Bumrah, no run
text: slower ball, full on leg stump. Misses the flick, hits the pad and rolls away to short fine leg

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pollard, 1 no ball, OUT
wkt_text: M Ashwin run out 6 (24m 8b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75.00
text: Pollard loses his bat and runs without one! Prasidh goes short and takes the pace off. Pollard is through the pull too early, but the ball hits his blade and rolls away to the leg side. They scurry across for an attempted single, but M Ashwin is run out! No ball called because of an extra short ball
preText: important last ball.
postText: Opinion: That's one problem with late no-ball calls. If the no-ball was called at the time of delivery by the square umpire, then Pollard may not have have run and stayed on strike for the free hit.

text: full and wide outside off stump. Just inside the tramlines. Pollard drills a drive with the bat-face angle at 45 degrees, and that's beaten the two outfielders in front of square
28 off six as he starts off with an extra. Full and wide outside off, trying to keep it out of Pollard's reach, but he'll have to re bowl
preText: Mammoth 10-ball over from Prasidh over. Mumbai need 29. Pollard has the skills. Only last night did Russell/KKR hit Odean Smith for a 30-run over. And Saini is here for the final over

text: looks to make room first up and ends up too far from the line of a good-length outswinger outside off. Slashes and misses
preText:
7.27pm Here we go. Mayank Agarwal and Shikhar Dhawan walk out to open the PBKS innings. Will Umesh Yadav and Tim Southee get the new ball to swing? We will see. It's Umesh to start off, with one slip in place for Agarwal.

Kolkata Knight Riders: 1 Venkatesh Iyer, 2 Ajinkya Rahane, 3 Shreyas Iyer (capt), 4 Nitish Rana, 5 Sam Billings (wk), 6 Andre Russell, 7 Sunil Narine, 8 Tim Southee, 9 Umesh Yadav, 10 Shivam Mavi, 11 Varun Chakravarthy.

Punjab Kings: 1 Shikhar Dhawan, 2 Mayank Agarwal (capt), 3 Bhanuka Rajapaksa (wk), 4 Liam Livingstone, 5 Raj Bawa, 6 Shahrukh Khan, 7 Odean Smith, 8 Harpreet Brar, 9 Arshdeep Singh, 10 Rahul Chahar, 11 Kagiso Rabada.

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Andre Russell vs Odean Smith - who has the better strike rate?

Meanwhile, do hop over to our Live Blog (briefly, before coming back here) to join Sidharth Monga as he puts this match under his microscope.

Jens: "A lot of Sheldon Jackson bias today. As a KKR fan I don't think it is unfair to drop him - yes he contributed well behind the stumps, but little / nothing with the bat. I think Shreyas Iyer has made a brilliant decision - his captaincy has been brilliant thus far - his decisions in the last match were absolutely spot on defending a very sub-par total. Billings will be reliable behind the stumps, and has already shown his reliability and steadiness with the bat. Come on KKR!"

Pneuma: "I don't think there is a clear stronger team this edition. This mega auction created an even page for all teams though MI and DC were the hardest hit. The squad depth may have some difference but there are strong 11s in all 10 teams. Depends on captains and coaches how they build it."

Sarthak: "Interesting to see who KKR drops when Cummins comes in. Think Cummins will provide them the right balance as right now they are either one batter or one bowler short. If Southee does well again they should replace Mavi with Cummins and BIllings with Jackson."

Nikhil Sood: "Who's keeping wickets in the PBKS?" -- Rajapaksa.

Dev : "Very, very harsh call to drop Sheldon. I thought he was brilliant behind the stumps. And a handy batter too." -- Well, it was probably a forced move since Andre Russell can't bowl.

Dev: "I'll come right out and say it: we DON'T like an IPL where the toss plays such a vital role."

7.00pm Shreyas Iyer tosses, Mayank Agarwal calls heads, and it's tails. Kolkata Knight Riders will bowl. "The reason," Iyer says, "is the swimming pool we've seen in the evening."

Knight Riders have strengthened their bowling. Looks like Russell will probably play as a specialist batter. Shivam Mavi comes in for Sheldon Jackson. Sam Billings will probably keep wickets.

One change for PBKS as well. Kagiso Rabada replaces Sandeep Sharma.

6.55pm Umesh Yadav already has four powerplay wickets this season. Four more, and he'll have the all-time IPL record, as Ask Cricinfo tells us.

Nick: "Who is Bairstow likely to replace ? Rajapaksa or Livingstone, depending on they play this match?" -- It'll be a tough call for sure. You'd think Rajapaksa is the most vulnerable, but he offers a left-handed option in an otherwise right-hander-heavy line-up.

6.39pm Kagiso Rabada has just received his Punjab Kings cap. Jonny Bairstow, however, is yet to complete his quarantine after flying to India from the West Indies.

Nandhana: "KKR should try and slot in Anukul Roy - a prolific allrounder. We've seen him as a regular fielder for MI but him as a player in the 11 would be a plus point for KKR. They should also probably try to choose between Sheldon and Sam and give that spot to Anukul, or even Aman Khan so that they gain more depth in the 3 departments."

Abhi: "Anil Kumble and co have been receiving lot of flak the last couple of years though I feel its one of the best coaching staffs in IPL. There were many improvements. The last 2 years have been the most PBKS has been talked about in all its seasons apart from 2014. Rise of Shami as white ball bowler. Bringing out Arshdeep and Brar. Backing Mayank for a bigger role. Structured management which was absent prior. A couple of wins would have made so much difference in the points table." -- They also happened to lose a lot of very close games both in 2021 and 2021.

Nasim: "Any chance for Nabi in today's match?" -- Depends on Russell's fitness and the pitch, I guess. There will be a temptation to play him, given that PBKS have two left-handers in their top three in Dhawan and Rajapaksa.

CricDude: "KKR were a bowler short in their first two games" -- It's always a quandary for them given how injury-prone Andre Russell is. We're waiting to see if Russell plays today, and, if not, who comes in for him.

Binu: "I think Punjab should give chance to Rishi Dhawan for this match. He is match-winner on his day and Punjab need one gun-bowler to bowl in PP so that Arshdeep's over can be more utilised in Death."

If you're in the US, you can watch the match LIVE on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

6.30pm Kolkata Knight Riders have been one of the most impressive bowling teams in the early part of this season, but there are question marks over their batting. It wasn't really tested in their opening-day win over Chennai Super Kings, but in their second match, against Royal Challengers Bangalore, their approach of never taking a backward step misfired, even if their coach Brendon McCullum said he "loved the intent". He suggested that luck wasn't quite on KKR's side that day.

Their opponents today, Punjab Kings, showed what that sort of intent can do when it comes off, when they chased down 206 against RCB in their opening match. If the ball comes onto the bat nicely tonight at the Wankhede, we could have quite a game on our hands.

Hello and welcome. This is Karthik Krishnaswamy, and I have Chandan Duorah alongside me. We'll also be joined by Matt Roller later tonight. Hope you're all doing well, wherever you're following this from.

text: length ball straightening towards leg stump, hops back and clips to midwicket, where Southee makes a diving stop to his right
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and stabs to deep point
preText: Third comes into the circle, point drops back to the boundary.

text: length ball straightening late towards middle stump, hangs back and clips to deep square leg
preText: Stays over the wicket to Dhawan. One slip for him too. Deep square leg and fine leg are back.

text: back of a length outside off, a bit of outswing. Looks to chop to deep point, ends up playing a little early and hitting into the covers

wkt_text: MA Agarwal lbw b Yadav 1 (6m 5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20.00
text: got him, that's an excellent delivery. Looked like the wobble-seam/offcutter release. On the fuller side of a length, and it nips back in from just outside off. Mayank was shuffling across premeditatedly, looking to target the leg side. Ends up playing all across this one as it nips past his inside edge, striking his front pad right in front. Fifth wicket for Umesh in the powerplay this season
full, slanting away from off stump initially before tailing back in. Looks to drive into the covers and gets a thick inside-edge into his back pad
preText: Two left-handers at the crease as Bhanuka Rajapaksa walks in. Here's Southee, also from right-arm over. One slip in place.

text: fullish, slanting across into a wide-ish channel, inviting the cover drive. Dhawan leaves it alone
steps out and the length inswinger cramps him slightly as he looks to make room to flay the ball through the covers. Ends up playing it to mid-off
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
very full, a bit of late swing towards leg stump, and Dhawan nearly overbalances while flicking to deep square leg
nice shot. Full, slanting away and offering width, and Rajapaksa gets a nice stride forward and deliberately scoops his drive over extra-cover
preText:
Afeef: "Resurgence of Umesh as a T20 bowler, love to see it."

Fred: "I questioned when we picked up Umesh in the auctions closing stages for 2cr but he's turning out to be an absolute steal for bowling up top in the powerplay."

text: steps out, gets fairly close to the pitch of this ball that's straightening towards off stump. Whips it away to deep square leg
preText: Inswinger: "What was the swimming pool reference for Iyer ?" -- The dew.

text: back of a length, angling across to finish just outside off. Not much width, and Rajapaksa lets it come on and opens his bat face to just beat Venkatesh Iyer sprinting and diving to his right at backward point. Third man is also in the circle and it just keeps running away to the boundary
back of a length, straightens his line to tuck Rajapaksa up at the hip. Worked away to deep square leg
shot. Jumps down the track and gets to the pitch of this off-stumpish ball, while making himself a bit of room, to launch it back over the bowler's head, effortlessly
shortish on leg stump, tucked gently into the square leg region
back of a length on leg stump. Not short enough for the short-arm pull, and he gets a bottom edge onto his thigh pad and it rolls away behind square on the leg side
length ball angling across to off stump, and Rajapaksa swats it away, hitting across the line, and gets a thick inside edge that bisects short fine leg and deep square leg
preText: Shivam Mavi comes on as first change. Over the wicket to Rajapaksa. No slips for him. Third man and deep square leg are the two fielders back.

text: steps out, attempting to make room, possibly targeting the off side at first, but this ball is just in the right place to flat-bat gloriously over mid-on. This is terrific intent and ball-striking
preText: Deep midwicket goes out, third man comes in.

text: shot! This was full, angling across to off stump, and it looked a little too full to get the elevation you might need to hit it for six, but Rajapaksa brings his wrists into play and just whips it over the long-on boundary. Stunning

sensational. Absolutely sensational. Mavi bowls a slower ball outside off, and Rajapaksa sees it early, steps across and sinks onto his back knee, and slog-sweeps it high over the forward square leg boundary
preText: Mavi goes round the wicket now. Deep point and deep square leg are back.

wkt_text: PBB Rajapaksa c Southee b Shivam Mavi 31 (17m 9b 3x4 3x6) SR: 344.44
text: got him, but what an innings this has been. Pure T20. Digs in a back-of-a-length ball that's angling into off stump or thereabouts. Slightly cramped for room as he tries to back away and hit over extra-cover, and he ends up spooning a simple catch to mid-off
preText: 4, 6, 6, 6 so far this over. Mavi stays round the wicket.

shortText: Shivam Mavi to Livingstone, no run
text: length ball on off stump, presses forward and plays a checked drive to mid-off
preText:
In walks Liam Livingstone. Slip in place for Mavi, who goes back over the wicket.

Sushanth : "Leave Rajapaksa out of T20 team SLC, I dare you!, I double dare you!!"

Vijay S: "Eagerly waiting for the updated Andrew Fidel Fernando piece on the Sri Lankan selectors now!"

text: fullish, angling into middle and leg, steps forward and clips to deep backward square leg. Deep midwicket was the other boundary fielder
fired in full, angling down leg, and Dhawan misses the attempted fine sweep
preText:
Can spin bring some normalcy to proceedings? Here's Varun C. Around the wicket to Dhawan.

Rohit: "Punjab don't really need Rabada once bairstow comes! Play sandeep for Bawa!" -- That would be one tasty batting line-up.

text: nicely timed. Full, just outside off, and he leans forward and eases an effortless drive between extra-cover and mid-off
preText: Slip in place for Livingstone. Long-on and deep midwicket are back.

text: shortish, angling into off stump. Skids on and hurries Dhawan on the pull. Bottom-edged back towards the bowler
length ball angled into the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
in the effort to cramp Dhawan for room, he fires another full ball down the leg side, past the attempted sweep
wrong'un, turning in from just back of a length to finish around off stump, goes back and tucks it to the left of short fine leg. A bit of bounce there too
preText: James : "I think the departure of Rajapaksa is what will bring some normalcy to proceedings."

text: appeal for lbw as Dhawan misses the sweep, but it was clearly angling down leg
fullish, and it nips back in towards middle stump. Pulls his front pad out of the way and drives watchfully to mid-on
preText: Akheel: "don't understand Iyer here, would be have given one more to Umesh against Livingston " -- Well, he's brought back Southee now.

text: shot. Jumps down the pitch, moving to the leg side to create room. Southee tries to follow him, but can't cramp him enough. Full follow-through and he clears the long-on boundary
offcutter, doesn't bounce as much as Livingstone expects, maybe, as he tries to whip into the leg side off the back foot. Hits his thigh pad and rolls away into the short third man region

this is some outfield. Full outside off, tried to make Dhawan reach out as he looked to step out. Reaches out to hit over extra-cover, and ends up slicing it over the gap between backward point and short third. Both give chase, in vain
preText: Round the wicket to Dhawan.

wkt_text: S Dhawan c †Billings b Southee 16 (35m 15b 1x4 1x6) SR: 106.66
text: got him. Steps out again, and it looks like the three-quarter ball/offcutter that straightens from a length outside off. Looks to crash it away through the covers, and gets a thick edge that Billings does very well to catch low down, diving forward
postText: What a powerplay this has been so far. PBKS very aware that they have to maximise it given the dew advantage KKR will have while chasing. They've already got 62, but they've lost three wickets. Raj Bawa is the new batter. Another left-hander.

text: fullish outside off, gets forward to defend to short extra-cover
preText: Southee stays around the wicket.

text: back of a length, straightens slightly towards off stump, goes back and whips to long-on
preText: Varun continues.

text: legcutter/carrom ball finishing on off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
preText: Stays over the wicket to Bawa.

text: tossed up slower on off stump, another carrom ball, gets forward and defends with an open face to backward point
back of a length on off stump. Wants to punch to long-on, the ball stops on him and he ends up dragging it to midwicket
quickish length ball on off stump, opens his bat face and steers to deep point
length ball nipping in towards leg stump, gets on the front foot and clips to deep backward square leg
offbreak, tight on off stump, clipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
preText: Narine.

text: gets forward to the length ball and dabs with an open face to backward point. He's anxious to get off strike, and has to hurry back and dive to beat the throw
preText: Round the wicket to Bawa.

text: flat, fired into the pads, clipped to long leg
preText: Sam: "Enterprising start. But here comes the CV-SN strangle."

text: back of a length carrom ball, sticks in the pitch as Livingstone goes back to punch down the ground. Has to check his shot to ensure he doesn't offer a return catch to Narine
quick offbreak turning down leg, past the attempted flick
fuller now, on middle stump, gets forward to clip to long-on
full, angling into off stump, driven to long-off
full, angling across to off stump, shows the full face and eases it down to long-on
preText:
Umesh returns to the attack. Over the wicket to Bawa.

Padraig Harring: "Mayank, Dhawan, Rajapaksa, Bairstow, Livingstone, Odean, SRK will give bowlers nightmares in IPL 2022. PLEASE Kumble sir, make it happen. "

Adam: "Why is the dew so much more impactful this year compared to previous editions?" -- Three out of four venues being in Mumbai might be one reason. Coastal venues tend to get more dew.

text: shot! Fullish, offers quite a lot of width, and Livingston collapses his back knee to get down low and frees his arms to slap it extremely hard to beat the diving extra-cover fielder to his left
preText: Kasun Udana: "In first 8 overs, Bhanuka 31 from 9 and others 34 from 39. What a contrast."

text: again goes for the wide line, looking to make Livingstone lose his shape while hitting. That's what happens as he looks to hit down the ground, and he ends up slicing it down to third man
preText: Free-hit.

text: again goes for that wide yorker. Gets the length right this time, but the line juuust overshoots the tramline. And he's overstepped too. No-ball overrides wide
length ball angling across to off stump, clips into the on side, and it just beats midwicket diving to his right to roll down to long-on
slower ball, full and fairly wide of off. Reaches out to drive, and he's beaten by the lack of pace

wkt_text: LS Livingstone c Southee b Yadav 19 (27m 16b 1x4 1x6) SR: 118.75
text: fullish, not as wide as the previous balls, and Livingstone takes on the big hit down the ground. Doesn't quite middle it, though, and Southee catches it right on the edge of the long-off boundary. A very, very timely wicket for KKR
floated up outside off, stretches out and drives to the left of sweeper cover
preText:
Narine continues from round the wicket to Bawa.

Shahrukh Khan is the new batter. Not sure PBKS wanted him in this early. A bit of a quandary for them right now, with the run rate having slid down since the powerplay, and with one eye still on the dew still to come.

text: full on off stump, and that's superb wristwork to create power on the drive. Drills it away and beats long-off to his right

wkt_text: RA Bawa  b Narine 11 (18m 13b 1x4 0x6) SR: 84.61
text: bowled him, that's a Narine special. Flat, quick, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, and it straightens dramatically from there to beat the outside edge and knock back off stump. Bawa's feet were stuck in the crease, not going forward, back or across, and he looks to defend and plays a long way inside the line
stretches out to defend a length ball pitching outside off. Nips in to take the inside edge and roll away towards deep midwicket. Was probably playing for the one going away from him
preText: Harpreet Brar is in at No. 7. PBKS keep the left-right pairing going, and hold Odean Smith back for later. Slip in place as Narine continues from round the wicket.

shortText: Narine to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: quick length ball straightening towards off stump, defended down the pitch

shortText: Narine to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: carrom ball finishing close to off stump, punched towards midwicket, was probably looking for the single to long-on

shortText: Varun to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: fullish carrom ball on middle stump, stretches out and defends it back to the bowler
preText: Varun, over the wicket.

shortText: Varun to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: nice. Now the one that goes the other way. Angled a little further across initially as well, and Brar, stretching out to push to long-off, is beaten

shortText: Varun to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: quicker length ball spinning away from off stump. Jabs at it from the crease and is beaten again
fuller on middle and leg, clipped to the left of midwicket

shortText: Varun to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: carrom ball, angling in and straightening towards off stump, gets forward to clip it back to the bowler

shortText: Varun to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: quick length ball turning in from outside off. A little late on the forward defensive, ends up getting a thick inside edge into the on side

shortText: Narine to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: nicely bowled. Floated up slow, angling in from wide of the crease and then straightening outside off. Stretches out to defend and is beaten on the outside edge

shortText: Narine to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: fuller outside off, stretches out and pushes to short extra-cover

shortText: Narine to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: fired in quick, and prompts the lbw appeal, Brar ending up playing around his front pad in the attempt to get a single. Probably angling down leg

shortText: Narine to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: now he stretches out for the lap-sweep and is hit on the pad again, but impact is outside off

shortText: Narine to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: third lbw appeal in a row, and Anil Chaudhary shakes his head. Another carrom ball coming into the left-hander as he gets on the front foot to flick. This looked closer than the other two - was the impact in line? KKR have reviewed... No bat, the bat was well on front of his pad, and it strikes him in line with the stumps, but it's turning too much and is heading down leg

shot. He's been struggling badly to pick Narine, but he backs his sweep and picks up a six to end the over. Narine goes to a wide line outside off, and Brar gets down low and uses his wrists to drag the ball from that line. Nails that wristy sweep and hits it over the boundary to the left of deep midwicket

wkt_text: M Shahrukh Khan c Rana b Southee 0 (14m 5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: another attempted at a big hit, another wicket. Good ball from Southee, back of a length outside off, and Shahrukh is caught in that awkward zone between a straight-bat hit down the ground and a horizontal-bat pull. Ends up skewing the ball high in the air over the on side, and Rana moves to his left from short midwicket and settles under the ball
preText: Southee.

text: back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends into the point region. Thinks of a quick single but the backward point fielder closes in quickly to make him change his mind
preText: Here's Odean Smith.

text: back of a length outside off, steered with an open face to third man
nice shot. Back of a length close to off stump, and Brar leans backwards, opens his bat face, and dabs it smartly to the left of the keeper. Third man is too square to cut it off
preText:
Southee goes round the wicket to Brar.

Mustafa Moudi : "Knew it. Why would Shah Rukh Khan score runs against KKR !!"

shortText: Southee to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: there's that three-quarter ball. Angling in from round the wicket, hits a good length close to off stump, and straightens. Brar is beaten while opening his bat face and looking for another fine dab

shortText: Southee to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: beaten again. Similar ball, a bit quicker maybe, and Brar was looking to open his bat face and steer through point on this occasion
full outside off, driven to long-off
preText: Round the wicket to Brar.

text: big offbreak turning down leg. Looks to go back and across and work it away, but can't connect. Beats the keeper as well, hits his thigh pad and runs away into the backward square leg region
preText:
Narine.

Fayiz farooq : "Harpeet Brar has never lost his wicket in IPL. 6 innings and not out every time. Any predictions for today. Fingers crossed."

Jayant Isswani: "Shreyas Iyer is going with his main bowlers early just like Jadeja(or Dhoni) went yesterday. But the results seem to be contrasting. This suggests that one should go with the process rather than result!!"

Matt Roller sends us this stat, on Rajapaksa's innings (which feels like it happened yesterday): "Joint-second-highest IPL score for an innings of fewer than 10 balls. Highest is Chris Morris, 38*(9) for Delhi vs Pune in 2017."

text: carrom ball close to off stump, gets forward and defends to extra-cover
quicker carrom ball turning away from off stump. Looks to defend from the crease, gets a thick edge that rolls to backward point
back of a length outside off, punched towards deep cover point
flat length ball close to off stump. Looks to punch through the covers, gets a thick edge that rolls to the right of short third
tossed up slow on off stump, stretches out and defends it back to the bowler

shortText: Yadav to Harpreet Brar, no run
text: back of a length on middle and leg, cramping him for room. Looks for the clip to midwicket, plays it too close to the bowler's follow-through to get the single he wants
preText:
Umesh to bowl out his fourth over. Over the wicket to Brar.

Kapil Baldawa : "Livingstone some how plays as if he has to hit a 6 every 3-4 balls.. Poor approach when your side is 4 down and you are the last recognised batter left. Had to show some restraint especially with 4 scored off the last ball he faced. What looked like 200 now when 150 would be a challenge from here. Shahrukh Khan too needed to take it deep but I guess they may be too worried of opposition batting might "

wkt_text: Harpreet Brar  b Yadav 14 (23m 18b 1x4 1x6) SR: 77.77
text: stumps all over the place, and Harpreet Brar is dismissed for the first time in seven IPL innings. Length ball angling across to off stump, doesn't do all that much. In fact, it looks like it deviates slightly inward to straighten a bit, but Brar, opening his bat face to play it square on the off side, is beaten on the outside edge. Off stump is knocked back, as are the other stumps
back of a length outside off, gets extra bounce to beat the attempted dab to third man
preText: Rahul Chahar is in at No. 9.

wkt_text: RD Chahar c Rana b Yadav 0 (3m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: got him, that wide slip is immediately in play! Banged in short on off stump, gets it to bounce steeply, and Chahar, trying to get his upper body out of the way while also looking to get his bat up and defend, ends up hitting it to the right of the slip fielder off the sticker of the bat. Nitish Rana dives to his right and completes a good catch
preText: A wide slip in place.

text: back of a length, finishing around leg stump, defended back to the bowler
preText: Kagiso Rabada is in at No. 10. Umesh stays over the wicket.

text: length ball angling away from off stump, no feet but nice hands to punch to extra-cover
postText: Umesh finishes with 4 for 23 from his four overs. He's now got eight wickets for the season, and is on top of the Purple Cap charts.

text: steps out to whip an off-stumpish ball to deep square leg
preText: Varun. If PBKS can bat through the innings, they'll have at least one over from the sixth bowler to face.

text: length ball turning away outside off, defends inside the line and lets himself get beaten
preText: Stays over the wicket to the left-hander.

text: another wrong'un, pitching within the stumps this time, gets forward to defend and is beaten again
three in a row. Tossed up fuller, inviting the cover drive, and it rips away to beat the outside edge once more
quick wrong'un, beats Rabada for the fourth time in a row as he looks to defend from within the crease
preText: Slip in place, by the way.

text: carrom ball straightening towards off stump, goes back and punches to long-on
lovely. Full outside off, and Rabada leans into a smooth drive over extra-cover
preText: One over from Southee left. Three from Mavi, but he can't bowl all of them. Southee comes in, from round the wicket to Rabada.

text: full again, closer to off stump this time, and Rabada plays another lofted drive, chips it higher this time but just as cleanly, over the wide mid-off region
wow. What an over this is. Rabada backs away to make room and Southee follows him with a full ball. Rabada just frees his arms again and launchres it high and straight, smacks into the sightscreen
full, outside leg stump, follows Rabada's attempt to make room. Driven down to long-on
preText: Free-hit coming up. Southee goes over the wicket.

text: full-toss outside off, looks to lean back and steer it behind point, but can't connect. Adjudged a no-ball for height
yorker outside off, looks to make room and jab through the covers, but he ends up playing it off the inside half of the bat back to the bowler
wide yorker. Looks to drive through the covers, and inside-edges into the ground and then into his body

wow, what a glorious shot this is. Length ball slanting away from off stump, and that's just room for Rabada to free his arms. Clears his front leg and flat-bats it hard and flat, back over the bowler's head
preText: Here's Mavi. Over the wicket to Rabada.

text: Goes full and slants it wider, looking to go away from Rabada's arc. He does, but Rabada, reaching out to slash, gets a thick edge that flies between the keeper and a fine short third
wham. Back of a length, angling away from off stump, flat-batted hard and along the ground to long-on

shortText: Shivam Mavi to Smith, no run
text: 132.4kph, but it looked quicker. Full and just angling past leg stump. Odean, looking to make room and launch it down the ground, is beaten on the inside edge
preText:
Afeef: "Those two accurate yorkers by Southee to Odean to close out his over after being expensive at the start was a perfect display of his skill and experience."

Caruso: "Rabada to open the batting next match??"

shortText: Shivam Mavi to Smith, no run
text: fullish legcutter close to off stump, and it straightens to beat Odean on the outside as he looks to clear his front leg and launch it down the ground
preText: Andre Russell is warming up to bowl...

text: slower bouncer wide of off stump, too wide for Odean to be able to reach out and slash it away
unlucky for Mavi. Hits a hard length around off stump, and Odean, early on the pull, only manages a top-edge, but it absolutely flies and goes all the way over the fine leg boundary
another slower bouncer, this time the bounce is too high for Odean to reach it with the slash. Called wide again

wkt_text: K Rabada c Southee b Russell 25 (21m 16b 4x4 1x6) SR: 156.25
text: what a terrific catch from Southee! Runs all the way from long-off to mid-on and finishes by throwing himself forward to grab the ball in both hands, low down. Russell bowls a slower offcutter, angling it away from Rabada's hitting arc. Clears his front leg and goes hard at it, but manages more height than distance
preText: Here's Russell. Over the wicket to Rabada.

wkt_text: Arshdeep Singh run out 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: and it ends with a run-out. Odean hared out of his crease even before Arshdeep played the ball, and in the end both batters were stuck at the same end. Back of a length, angling across, and he opens his bat face and dabs it straight to Rana at backward point. All he had to do was lob the ball back to Russell
preText: Arshdeep Singh is the last man for Punjab. Another left-hander.
postText:
Umesh Yadav: "My task is always to take wickets with the new ball, whether one or two. That's the task my team has given me, and I'm trying my best to do that. I think it's a chaseable score. The ball is skidding off the wicket a bit. The earlier pitches, the ball was sticking on the pitch, but the ball is coming on better today."

Malli: "That run out is only because of the new rule of new batsmen to take strike regardless of batsmen cross at the time of catch. It forced Odean Smith to farm strike with number 11 at the crease. This new rule is helping bowlers"

Akrsh: "Shreyas be like - you don't need death bowlers if you don't bowl death overs"

Vishal: "This KKR bowling lineup is looking so strong that I wonder how exactly they will bring Cummins into the XI"

9.11pm A moment of desperation there from Odean. PBKS end their innings with ten balls left unused. This innings went pretty much exactly like KKR's against RCB a couple of days ago. Now KKR benefit from their opposition's high intent going wrong. But you can see why teams are doing this, given how much of an advantage dew is giving to chasing teams this season. The conditions are heavily loaded towards chasing.

Anyway, this match isn't over yet. KKR almost defended an even lower total against RCB in that match I mentioned above, and PBKS will have to believe they can do something similar here. KKR, remember, are also playing one batter fewer today. Matt Roller will be with you soon to bring you the chase.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahane, no run
text: very wide outside off stump, on a length at 136kph. Left alone
preText:
KG Rabada, on Punjab debut, will take the new ball. Nope, Arshdeep Singh to kick things off. Dhawan in at slip, long leg and deep third are the two men outside the ring. Left-arm over to the right-hander.

Thanks, KK. Mayank addresses his side in a huddle on the boundary edge. This should be the perfect sort of chase for KKR's openers, Venky Iyer and Ajinkya Rahane, who won't have to worry too much about their strike rates.

Kalyanaraman: "@Malli, the new rule comes into force only from October 2022 and that can't be the reason" -- It's in place for this IPL.

In the USA, you can watch the match LIVE on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: IPL - who has the most wickets in death overs since 2019?

Watch T20 TimeOut with Ravi Shastri and Chris Lynn - LIVE

text: full, swinging into the pads, and Rahane whips the half-volley away through midwicket with a roll of the wrists. Easy pickings. 133kph

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahane, no run
text: on a length, very straight and angling across him. Steered out to point
length ball, on the pads. 129kph, another freebie aimed at leg stump, and Rahane nudges it calmly off his thigh to pick up four more, going past 4,000 IPL runs in the process

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahane, no run
text: full, wide outside off stump at 137kph, looking to entice him into the drive. Rahane shoulders arms
preText: Fine leg comes up, deep square goes back

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Rahane, no run
text: angled across him, back of a length, and rolls his fingers over it. Punched to point off the back foot, where Chahar fields
angled across him, good length at 138kph. Venky opens the face, steering behind square on the off side. Rahane scampers through
preText:
Rabada. Slip in, over the wicket

Abhimanyu: "When Bairstow comes back, they should look to replace Odean for Bairstow and Bawa for a pacer (Sandeep or Porel). That strengthens their batting and bowling" -- Will be a tough call after Rajapaksa's bright start. Livingstone and Odean's spots both look vulnerable, all of a sudden.

text: wide outside off stump, good length. Rahane shoulders arms
half-volley, hint of width outside off stmup at 136kph, and Rahane leans forward, pressing it away through the covers on the drive. Compact shot, just steering it through the gap in the ring.
fuller, and tighter to the off stump, but still wide enough to leave alone. 140kph, Rabada finding his rhythm
sprayed very wide outside off stump, left alone
offcutter, back of a length, coming back into Rahane to cramp him on the cut. Steered to short third

wkt_text: AM Rahane c Smith b Rabada 12 (11m 11b 3x4 0x6) SR: 109.09
text: gobbled up at short third! Rabada has his first Punjab wicket. Wide outside off stump, slightly full of a length but not quite a half-volley. Rahane comes forward looking to drive but is playing away from his body, and his thick outside edge flies to Odean, who takes a good, comfortable catch on the edge of the circle, moving to his left with his weight coming forwards. Punjab will need early wickets to stand a chance here and they have one

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to VR Iyer, 1 leg bye
text: full, sliding down the leg side. Dribbles away into the leg side via the pad as Venky misses out on the flick
preText: The skipper, Shreyas Iyer, at No. 3. At the non-striker's end to start with

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: angling across him on a length, Shreyas opens the face and steers out into the covers

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to VR Iyer, 1 run
text: full on off stump, driven to wide mid-off for a single. Looked like an offcutter at first glance, but clocked in the mid-130s kph

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to SS Iyer, no run
text: back of a length, angled across him. Shreyas looks to punch through the off side but can't beat short cover. 134kph

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to SS Iyer, FOUR
text: slower ball, Shreyas waits for it and drills it through straight extra cover. Picked the offcutter. Pitched up, and comes forward to punch imperiously through the off side

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to SS Iyer, FOUR
text: wide outside off stump on a length, slashed away over backward point! Back-to-back boundaries for Shreyas. Poor ball from Arshdeep, and Shreyas sat very deep in his crease, slapping it on the up. Knew he only had to beat the man at point in the circle and did so with ease

shortText: Rabada to VR Iyer, no run
text: half-volley on the stumps, 138kph, driven firmly to mid-off
preText: Anuk: "Why does everyone think Bairstow is a default starter in the first XI? Let's give the current overseas players a decent run if the team keeps winning shall we?" -- Because they've seen Bairstow bat?!

shortText: Rabada to VR Iyer, no run
text: hard length, nipping back into the left-hander. Steered away to point
skips down, turning a yorker into a low full toss, and squeezes out a single to mid-off via the toe. 138kph
preText: Point goes back, third man comes up.

text: just short of a length, angling in. Clipped away through midwicket and they cruise back for a couple. 139kph
full toss, sixth-stump line, and Shreyas punches through mid-on. Rabada overpitches looking for the yorker, and Shreyas is in complete control, driving straight down the ground
half-stopped in the covers. Drags his length back and Shreyas can't quite pierce the infield
sprayed down the leg side, Shreyas helps it on its way! Pitched outside leg stump and flew further down the leg side. Just a roll of the wrists from Shreyas, and falls just short of the rope
preText: Odean. Very expensive on debut

text: 132kph, much better line and length. Squeezed out into the off side and they scamper through for one

wkt_text: VR Iyer c Harpreet Brar b Smith 3 (23m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42.85
text: slapped into the off side, but Brar clings on at cover! Banged in on a length, wide outside the off stump, and Venky frees his arms, standing tall to slap it away through the off side. But it flies straight to Harpreet Brar on the edge of the ring. It reaches him so quickly that he hardly has time to react, but he sticks his hands in the way. It bursts out, but he reacts brilliantly, grabbing it with his left hand as he tumbles forwards. Superb effort in the field and Odean has a breakthrough
phwoar, what a way to get off the mark. Full of a length from Smith, angling into the pads, as Billings comes forward to whip him away through straight midwicket
preText: Billings at No. 4

text: back of a length, outside off stump. Steered into the off side with a cry of "NO RUN!"
wide outside off stump, just full of a length. Fenced to short cover. 138kph
preText: Pankaj: "KKR have a change this season.. their captain is contributing in a big way with bat"
postText: Nick: "I really like Livingstone, but he looks pretty nervous in IPL. I think he'll make way for Bairstow in next match. Punjab have invested so much in O Smith (way too much for me, but... he got the hype so ...) that they're bound to stick with him for a while"

text: shot! Wide outside off stump, short of a length, and Shreyas gets up on his toes, threading a square drive away through point towards the shorter boundary
preText: Final Powerplay over, and Rabada gets a third. Attacking captaincy from Mayank

text: back of a length, rides the bounce and dabs behind square on the off side
postText: Shreyas looks in stunning form tonight.

text: thick inside edge skews past short fine leg, Livingstone does well to get round from deep backward square. Angling in from a good length, and it skews away off the inside half of the bat as Billings looks to whip through midwicket
back of a length, outside off, dabbed to short third. Billings set off but was sent back
full bunger, whipped away through the leg side for a couple as Livingstone gets around to his left
angling in from short of a length, steered into the off side. 134kph

shortText: Chahar to SS Iyer, no run
text: ripping legbreak, drops a little short. Slapped straight to point
preText:
Rahul Chahar comes into the attack.

The asking rate is just over a run a ball after the Powerplay. Should be a cruise from here for KKR.

shortText: Chahar to SS Iyer, no run
text: fuller, flighted, and rips past the outside edge as Shreyas lunges forward. Beaten on the outside edge

shortText: Chahar to SS Iyer, no run
text: flat and full outside off, stabbed to point
preText: Slip in

wkt_text: SS Iyer c Rabada b Chahar 26 (22m 15b 5x4 0x6) SR: 173.33
text: tossed up, and Shreyas is lured into the big shot. He top-edges his slog sweep, looking to hit towards the short side, but it flies miles up into the air. Rabada settles underneath it, and takes a straightforward catch. Shreyas falls - he looked a million dollars against the seamers in the Powerplay but much less comfortable against Chahar
fullish at the pads, nudged to short midwicket
preText: AB: "Unpopular opinion, but if KKR lose a wkt now, they need to let Narine in to disrupt the other bowlers rhythms, since Rabada is almost done with his quota!!!" -- They've gone with Nitish Rana.

wkt_text: N Rana lbw b Chahar 0 (4m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: full googly, smacked on the pad. Chahar is convinced, pleading with the umpire, and the finger goes up! Rana reviews. Nowhere near the inside edge as he lunged forward to defend. Pitched in-line, impact in-line, smashing into the top of middle stump. Saiyed Khalid's decision is upheld and Chahar starts with a double-wicket maiden!
skids on with the angle from around the wicket. Billings backs away to give himself room, and punches down to long-off
preText:
Harpreet Brar.

Wow. Gamechanging over. KKR were cruising in this chase but suddenly look vulnerable. Dre Russ at No. 6, rather than Narine.

Sandeep Ganiga: "This is not Shreyas Iyer! Reckless batting! When he has got the start, he is just throwing away.He is letting the opposition to get back into the game."

text: on a length outside off, no turn. Slapped straight to point, but the misfield lets them through for a single

shortText: Harpreet Brar to Billings, no run
text: skids on with the arm, Billings backs away looking to punch through the off side but Harpreet fields in his follow-through
wide outside off, tossed up. Threaded through the off side

shortText: Harpreet Brar to Russell, no run
text: full and straight, no real turn. Dre Russ comes forward to defend

shortText: Harpreet Brar to Russell, no run
text: full on off stump, prodded back down the pitch
postText: Sankalp: "That was an extremely poor review from Rana. Teams need to talk about this, otherwise it can cost them dearly in a crucial match at an important juncture"

text: full googly, Billings looks to whip through the leg side but Chahar fields off his own bowling
preText: Nandhana: "And Shreyas's struggle against Rahul Chahar continues." -- Sampath from ESPNcricinfo's stats team tells me Chahar has got Shreyas 3 times in 15 balls

text: full toss, on off stump. Billings gets out the reverse-sweep, but slaps it straight to backward point. Half-stopped, and they squeeze through for one
legbreak on a length, nudged into the covers. Thinks about the single but Billings sends him back
preText: No helmet or cap for Dre Russ, meaning his purple-and-gold mohawk in on full show.

text: full legbreak, comes forward to nudge to short cover

full legbreak, outside off stump. Steered straight to backward point but Billings sets off... and <strike>just about</strike> comfortably makes his ground, diving at full stretch. He's lightning-quick between the wickets
flat, length ball, skidding on. Punched into the covers on the back foot
postText:
Strategic timeout.

Nandhana: "Shreyas' batting style has taken an over-aggressive turn after joining KKR. Should stick to his natural style of playing according to situation."

Great Boo: "Graeme Swann referred to Russell's purple-and-gold mohawk as rhubarb and custard, a description that works for me."

shortText: Harpreet Brar to Russell, no run
text: skids on with the angle, Russell bottom-edges his cut into the off side
fired down the leg side, starts with a wide after the timeout

clears the front leg, smokes it into the second tier! This is a monster. 90 metres, swiped over midwicket. That was the longer boundary, but Dre Russ clears it comfortably. On a length, into Russell's arc, and disappears into the stands
looks to go again, clearing the front leg, but he's slightly late on it. Bottom-edged through short fine leg, and they sneak back for two

does go again. This one looks even bigger than the first... though measured at 89 metres, one shorter. Clears the front leg, high backlift, and mows it over midwicket. Much more height on this one, and again reaches the second tier
full, yorker at leg stump. Whipped down to long-on
on a length, punched out to wide long-off to retain the strike
full and straight, nudged down to long-on for one
sharply spun. Pitches a long way outside leg stump, and Russell has to dead-bat it into the leg side after it rips away from him
width outside off, slapped out to deep point with a swish of the wrists and they cruise back for two
on a length, pushed through very straight, nudged away out to deep midwicket
tossed up, full outside off stump. Driven down the ground, out to long-off
sharply-spun legbreak again, on a good length. Nudged into the off side, tip-and-run to keep the strike

freebie, and Russell cashes the cheque. Russell cleared his front leg because Odean released, and he looked to follow him by firing it full and down the leg side. Russell keeps his composure, and flicks it over short fine leg
preText: Harpreet is whipped out of the attack. Odean Smith returns, bowling to his compatriot and idol, Russell. Around the wicket to him

text: smoked into the stands! Clears his front leg, his back hip drives through, and he crashes him over midwicket, 88 metres. Absolutely nailed

slower ball, on a length outside leg stump. Russell plants his front foot outside leg stump early, and the knuckleball is slow enough that he has to wait a while. He swings hard, thumping him 84 metres, over square leg. Russell is on one tonight!
postText: Ahsan Butt: "DreRuss has arrived in the IPL!!!"

text: hard length, angling in, and Russell is beaten on the pull
preText: Over the wicket now

text: half-a-dozen more! Russell is taking his compatriot to pieces. This wasn't out of the middle by any stretch of the imagination, but it still clears the boundary easily enough. Back of a length, Russell clears the front leg and swings him cross-batted over his head
on a length, wide outside off stump, and Billings gets in on the act! Frees his arms, swinging him cross-batted, dead-straight back over his head
postText:
Benjie: "As they always say, never meet your idols!!!"

Adarsh: "Billings: small mercies? Hold my beer."

Bhawesh: "RussellMuscle IS BACK!!!! Watch out everyone"

KK: "Smith's mind voice: So this is how it feels eh?"

30 off the over. Shocker from Odean, and KKR are nearly there.

text: banged into the pitch, 137kph, and drags the pull out to midwicket
postText: 23 off the over! And suddenly, the required rate is down to 4.53... hang on a minute... Odean has over-stepped, by an absolute mile as well. Small mercies: he's bowling the free hit to Billings instead of Russell.

text: wide, flat legbreak, pushed through. Slapped out to deep cover
preText: In other sporting news, the draw for this year's FIFA World Cup has just gone live. Who will favourites Brazil draw? Will it be Messi or Ronaldo in this edition's 'group of death'? Find out all that and more, right here!

text: full and flighted, punched out to long-off, giving the strike back to Russell
full, outside leg stump, nudged out to deep midwicket
quicker one, full and straight, whipped out to midwicket
quick legbreak, fizzed through, and beats the bat as Russell looks to drag him through the leg side
looking to stay out of Russell's arc, and hangs it very wide outside off stump. Too wide
full and wide outside off, tossed up. Russell looks to crash him over cover but only manages a thick outside edge, which drops short of short third
postText: Brilliant spell from Chahar, but likely to be in vain.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Billings, no run
text: short ball, Billings pulls out of his shot as he shapes to pull
preText: Arshdeep returns.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Billings, no run
text: wide on the crease, angling in from a good length. Defended back to the bowler
preText: Goes around the wicket now.

text: slightly fuller length, angling into the pads. Billings clips down to Odean at wide long-on
clears the front leg and pulls hard through the leg side. Mistimed to midwicket, and they get back for two

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Russell, (no ball) FOUR
text: full toss, and Arshdeep has to take evasive action as Russell drills it back towards him. 50 for Russell off 26 balls... and he'll have a free hit too, as Arshdeep has overstepped. Rabada couldn't get round from long-off. Pure power from Dre Russ, drilling it back past the bowler

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Russell, no run
text: slower ball, angled across him from over the wicket. Russell is through the shot early, and can't lay bat on ball

stunning shot. Angles it across him, looking to hide a wide yorker outside off stump. His length isn't far off at all, but Russell manages to chip him effortlessly over cover for six. Outrageous batting!
legbreak to start, quick and into the pitch. Whipped out to midwicket
preText: "You're too strong, man," Rajapaksa mutters to Russell over the stump mic. Livingstone into the attack to bowl his all-sorts.

text: tosses up a full lebgreak, which Russell clubs over long-off. Clears his front leg and slams it back over his head. Nowhere near the middle, still 85 metres!

finishes it with a six! What a player. Russell has announced his arrival at IPL 2022 tonight. He's only faced 31 balls but he's hit eight of them over the rope. This one is nowhere near the middle of the bat again as Livingstone drags one down, but has enough on it to clear deep midwicket, running round to his left. KKR win by six wickets with 33 balls to spare.
postText:
That's all from us for tonight, as KKR become the first team this season to win two games. It's a double-header tomorrow, starting with Mumbai vs Rajasthan before Gujarat play Delhi, so make sure you tune into our live ball-by-ball coverage. Until then, thanks for tuning in this evening. This is Matt Roller signing off on behalf of Chandan Duorah and Karthik Krishnaswamy.

Umesh Yadav beats Russell to the player-of-the-match award. That's his sixth POTM award against the Punjab franchise, the most by a player against a single opponent in IPL history. My language skills are sadly lacking, so my colleague Afzal Jiwani has translated for me... "[Work ethic?] In the nets, I just try to work on my skills. You can get better only if you practise. I didn't expect Mayank to charge down the track on the very first ball. When you're bowling at 140 clicks, your focus is to bowl the perfect line and length."

Shreyas Iyer: "We were stunned - we didn't expect them to come so hard, especially losing a wicket in the first over. But when I saw them timing it so well, I thought I could as well. [Front-loading bowlers?] We got early wickets after the Powerplay so my mindset was if I get wickets as much as possible... my plan was to get the best bowlers when they had hard-hitters coming in. [Spinners?] They make my job very easy on the field. They come up with their own strategies and in team meetings, they already know their plans. They know what they're doing. [Dre?] It was such a relief to see him hit so clearly. Simply outstanding hitting - it was Russell muscle, for serious. [Umesh?] I was just having a chat with him. He said he's getting older but I told him he's getting fitter and stronger. He's been putting in the hard yards at practice, I see him in the gym every time I go. He's hungry and wants the team to win. He's been a great colleague to work with."

Andre Russell: "Feeling awesome, man. This is the reason why we play the game. In that position, I know what I can do. It was good to have someone at the crease like Sam. Once I started sweating, I told him that I'm gonna go. I back my ability. I'm happy to do whatever the team requires. I'm looking to bowl in the death. We have a good amount of bowlers, a few guys that can slip in one or two as well. If I bowl two, at least I can feel like an allrounder. But some games, I may not bowl a ball so I'm happy to take the batting as well and hit some sixes - do whatever I can do to contribute for the team. We were a couple wickets down and behind me was Sunil and then the other bowlers. I told Sam 'listen, let's bat a few overs and see what happens'. But I realised the left-arm orthodox wasn't spinning the ball. Chahar was bowling extremely well and the ball was gripping so we didn't want to take much chance against him but I knew we'd wait on the seamers and it would get easier. [How many out of the middle?] I'm going to say one..."

Mayank Agarwal: "We didn't bat well enough. That's where it started. We showed some real fight with the ball initially but then Dre Russ came in and got going. Credit to him for that. It was a 170-ish wicket. I thought we started off well but couldn't capitalise, a few soft dismissals. But a game like this at the start of the tournament is fine. I thought the bowlers pulled the game back really well, to get 4 wickets for 50-odd runs. But Russell took the game away from us. A lot of positives for us to take away."

Eric: "At 51/4, any other team would've taken it deep… this side embodies their coach like no other. Never a dull moment with KKR"

Abhishek: "Russell orange cap, Umesh purple. I feel the man of the match should be shared between these two"

Afeef: "The way Billings gave Russell most of the strike, I bet he also wanted to watch the Russell show just as much as we did"

Abhi: "There's very few players who evoke this kind of fear that Russell does. No total is too big for this guy!"

10.40pm: Russell acknowledges the fans in the crowd who are chanting his name, and puts an arm around Odean Smith. KKR looked in real trouble after Rahul Chahar bowled the seventh over, a double-wicket maiden, but after a cautious start, Russell flicked the switch. His partnership with Billings was worth 90 in 7.3 overs, and he scored 70 of them by himself.

text: first ball four and that's classic- Uthappa. Full on leg, and he flicks it nonchalantly through midwicket for a boundary.
preText:
Avesh Khan has the new ball, but KL Rahul is not quite happy with the ball on offer. Chatting with the umpire, but they will continue with it nonetheless.

7.27pm The umpires are walking out. KL Rahul is leading the team huddle. Gaikwad and Uthappa jog out.

CricDude: "@Krishna, CSK have Conway as a long term plan. I don't think he is dropped. The management might just be trying to ease him into the setup. Infact he might take up the gloves after Dhoni."

Here's your ASKcricinfo stat ahead of today's match: Who do you think has hit the most sixes in the IPL since 2018?

Also, If you're in the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

Ishank: "Why is Jordan not playing? " -- He is unwell, we understand.

Krishna: "Tough decision to sit Conway out but i think once Milne was out, bowling was very thin so they went for a bowling all-rounder(Pretorius) and a bowler (choudhary) by sitting out Conway.So going forward it looks like Conway in the playing 11 kinda depends on Milne's fitness."

Confirmed three changes for CSK. Milne, Conway and Santner - all three NZ CSK players are out. Choudhary, Moeen and Pretorius are in.

The XIs.

Chennai Super Kings 1 Ruturaj Gaikwad, 2 Robin Uthappa, 3 Moeen Ali, 4 Ambati Rayudu, 5 MS Dhoni, 6 Ravindra Jadeja (capt), 7 Dwaine Pretorious, 8 Shivam Dube, 9 Dwayne Bravo, 10 Mukesh Choudhary, 11 Tushar Deshpande

Lucknow Super Giants 1 KL Rahul (capt), 2 Quinton de Kock (wk), 3 Evin Lewis, 4 Manish Pandey, 5 Deepak Hooda, 6 Ayush Badoni, 7 Krunal Pandya, 8 Andrew Tye, 9 Dushmantha Chameera, 10 Ravi Bishnoi, 11 Avesh Khan

7pm Aaaand it's toss time. Pretty sure the winner will choose to field, but that doesn't necessarily mean it is the winning decision. KL Rahul wins the toss, and Super Giants will chase as expected.

KL Rahul: "I know we need to play good cricket as well but we saw in our other game that the ball gets wet in the second innings - that's the only reason, also it's a fresh wicket, grass on it, want to take early wickets. Really enjoyed the last game. Boys showed good fight. To fight till 19.3, we showed real character and we'll take confidence. That game is gone, and now try to do our skills right. Tye replaces Mohsin"

Ravindra Jadeja: "Would've bowled too, but now we bat first and put a good score hopefully. We are blessed with a good support. Moeen is back, Milne has a side strain." Jadeja also said that there are three changes in all.

Nandhana: "Foreign player unavailability due to quarantine/international commitments have let the teams use their domestic options and cherish them. Loved the first round because of this."

Sachin: "Technically, MSD against his ex-franchise."

6.55pm Andrew Tye, the replacement for the injured Mark Wood, and the IPL 2018 purple cap winner, has been handed a cap by the Super Giants, so he will play today. Who will he replace? Probably Mohsin Khan since they played with three overseas last time around. BTW, our Live Blog is also up and running, where we dissect the game with a keener eye, something not always possible on our ball-by-ball commentary with the action moving at breakneck speed, so do keep hopping over to that tab intermittently.

Afeef: "About a thousand kilometres away from this match's venue, LSG player Marcus Stoinis is hitting the ball rather sweetly against Pakistan"

Anfal: "It is not Jadeja vs Rahul. It is Dhoni vs Gambhir. Two of the smartest cricket brains in world cricket. "

Pitch and ground conditions: Expect a lot of boundaries around third man/backward point, which is slightly shorter from one end. Therefore the midwicket boundary is nearly 90 metres at its opposite end. Bit of extra bounce has usually troubled batters here. Short-pitched bowling earned seamers four wickets in Sunday's day game, But today's deck is greener than that Mumbai-Delhi encounter.

6.47pm We now have a sample size of one game of Jadeja - the captain. After that assessment, here's what Ravi Shastri wants to see more of, from the allrounder. And here's Shastri's tips for Rahul, the captain. Toss in under 15 minutes.

Even though Jadeja and Rahul are captains, there's no doubt that both sides will have certain "seniors" - two major architects of India's 2011 World Cup final win - helping them along: Dhoni behind the stumps, Gautam Gambhir behind the scenes. Here's the match preview that informs me that Moeen Ali will be available for CSK today. Have a read as we count down the clock. If you're more into visual content, then here's Ravi Shastri and Chris Lynn answering the big questions surrounding tonight's encounter. PS. Our Hindi coverage is LIVE too.

Balaji: "Wow. One knock and we compared Badoni to Dhoni. This is the reason why kot of young Indian cricketers fail to perform consistently. Comparing to legends. We killed many all rounders comparing them to Kapil Dev. Let the kid breathe and enjoy his cricket"

Garv Asnani: "It's a battle between Dhoni and Badoni. One of them is already a legend and the other looks like a future star. Both have scored 50s in their first match so it will be interesting to see their approach."

6.30pm The IPL juggernaut rolls on - it is MS Dhoni Ravindra Jadeja vs KL Rahul tonight with Chennai Super Kings taking on Lucknow Super Giants LIVE from the very batting friendly Brabourne Stadium.

Both teams started off their IPL 2022 campaigns with losses, albeit under different circumstances. CSK were outclassed in their opening encounter by KKR while the Super Giants showed enough character in their defeat to Gujarat Titans for their captain Rahul to exclaim that the almost successful defense of a middling total nearly felt like a win. How will today pan out? Catch all the action with me Sreshth Shah and Andrew Miller as we build up to the first ball.

text: back to back as Avesh goes short and wide after going full on leg the last delivery. Uthappa stays on the back foot, and scythes a cut through point!

shortText: Avesh Khan to Uthappa, no run
text: length ball on off and angling into middle. Fended back to Avesh

shortText: Avesh Khan to Uthappa, no run
text: bang on the helmet as Uthappa does not duck in time. Avesh cranked up the pace, went short, and Uthappa took his eyes off it without dropping his knees quick enough. Hits him near the maker's name and pops up to short third man. Fielder catches, soft appeal for out, but obviously no bat involved.
full just outside off. Looks to defend but closes the bat's face late. Ball dribbles away to backward square leg region for a couple more

Uthappa had no idea where that went as Avesh troubles him with the short one once more. Back of a length slightly outside off, and coming in. Uthappa looks to sway away, but his hands are close to his face. Flies past him, over the keeper, and four more
length ball angling in, and worked away to midwicket
preText: Dushmantha.

text: good length just outside off. Stays on the back foot, opens the bat's face, and nurdles it to backward point
fullish just outside off stump. Confident defensive shot off the front foot
postText: Phani: "Every fast bowler now know what to do against Robin.Even V Iyer had a troubled stay against short ball yesterday."

text: goes short on off and middle. Uthappa scurries under it, and de Kock has to give a mighty jump to grab it

that's a hit of nostalgia as Uthappa flicks it behind square for half a dozen! Chameera errs in line, goes full on leg, and Uthappa doesn't need a second invitation. Uses the bottom hand to clip it so well for an 83m six
full, just outside off. Uthappa defends with hard hands. Ball rolls back to Chameera
fullish on middle, and that's in Uthappa's slot once again. Flicks it, albeit not as convincingly, but gets it over square leg umpire. Fielder at deep backward square has no chance in cutting it off
full on middle and leg. Wants to flick, but hits the outside half of his pad. Ball rolls towards short fine leg for one
preText: AJ Tye.

text: good length on off. Angling in. Tries to pull, but mistimed to square leg for one

wkt_text: RD Gaikwad run out 1 (16m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00
text: massive appeal for lbw and the umpire hasn't reacted, but that doesn't matter! Because Gaikwad has been run out with a direct hit! Bishnoi with the bulls eye with Gaikwad a metre short. This was full on off and Gaikwad missed the flick. Ball hit his pad and rolled away to point and he wanted a single, but Uthappa did not, forcing him to turn back. Either way, whoever was going to run to the batter's end was going to be out with a rocket throw like that. Another failure for Gaikwad.
full on off. Crunches a drive, and stopped at cover
preText: Moeen Ali at No. 3.

text: full on middle and leg. Pushed towards mid on
good length on leg stump. Wants to push at it, but the chance of pace forces a mistimed defensive shot. Ball lands near his toes and that's a top over from the returning Tye
sublime! Avesh goes full, outside off stump, and he shuffles into a drive despite the lack of much movement of his feet. The timing is so pure that it races through cover
preText: Avesh to continue.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Uthappa, no run
text: back of a length, fourth-stump line. Fended off the back foot towards cover point
good length on off stump. Tap-and-run towards mid on off the back foot
postText: Bharath: "Hypothetical question based on the runout: If a batsman is appealed for lbw and not given by umpire and non-striker got run out, can the fielding team still go for DRS against the batsman because they only want him more than the other? If DRS review is successful, then the non-striker will get to continue playing even after the runout? " -- I believe they can review, yes, since the first incident takes precedence and therefore the LBW decision would've counted if he was out after review. Haven't seen it happen though.

text: hooked! Avesh goes short on leg, and he gets inside the line of the ball before swiveling and connecting with a six over fine leg

shortText: Avesh Khan to Ali, no run
