text: good length on middle and off. Tapped towards mid on off the back foot. Wants a run, but eventually they decide against it

shortText: Avesh Khan to Ali, no run
text: fullish on leg. Wants to work it leg side, but the bat's face turns and rolls away to the off side
drags a pull in front of square! Not short enough, bit of width, and he pounces onto the pull in a flash. Another classical Uthappa shot
on purpose! Fullish, outside off. Waits for it, opens the bat's face, and just helps it with a late nudge past short third man for four. #SoftHands
Tye goes back to what Uthappa has struggled the most again. Short quick ball on off stump, and once again de Kock has to jump high to intercept
postText: Vishwa: "Robin is turning back the clock don't think there is anyone as elegant as him when in full flow and I mean not even Rohit or Rahul."

text: premeditated but executed with perfection! Full on middle, but Uthappa walks across to the off side and having seen fine leg inside the circle he uses the bottom hand to turn a paddle over the infielder for four

shoddy fielding and that brings Uthappa back on strike. Nudged this length ball to square leg and they scamper across for one. But the two fielders on the boundary line are way too slow to attack the ball - thinking the other would do it - and therefore the batters can take two
my oh my oh my! Length ball from wide of the crease but angling into Uthappa. Quick swivel, fast hands, and pulled to the right of deep backward square for another four
postText: BK: "This robin is 10 yrs back young robin. robust and fearless. raw batting from robin. all around the park."

text: full on middle. Worked to wide long on for a single
preText: Krunal, around the stumps.

text: full on off, and worked off his pads to deep midwicket for a single
fullish, on middle and leg. Clipped to square leg
superb timing as he pounces onto a ball that's angling across him. Length on middle and going towards off. Moeen just nonchalantly drives standing tall, and pierces the off side gap
gets low, hits high! Full on middle, and Moeen goes down on one knee before flicking a sweep over deep square leg! Hits the boundary skirting on the full.
ends the powerplay in style as Moeen waits on the back foot and meets this length ball with a dragged pull across the line in front of square!
good length outside off. Pushed to point for one
preText: Stat alert: That's CSK's fourth-highest powerplay score in history. Full details here.

text: pushed off the front foot to the off side for a single
preText: Gaurav Vohra: "I honestly feel Avesh Khan got picked up pre maturely. He still needs some good guidance from Ricky ponting. No offence to LSG coaching staff." -- Second highest wicket-taker last season (most smart wickets according to ESPNcricinfo's Smart Stats) + India player. Surely not premature!

text: fullish outside off. Presses forward to push a shot towards cover for a single
postText: Sheldon: "With this new 10 team format you cannot afford to many losses. CKS is aware of that and pushing hard. This could be a 200 run chase" -- I think they are not thinking of the format but the dew that may come around later when batting becomes even more easier

text: Mowed by Mo! Length ball angling across. Moeen stands tall and punches a back-foot drive through the covers!
takes pace off. Length ball on middle stump. Pushed to mid on for one
postText: Varma: "That performance from Avesh was purely due to the pressure from Rabada and Nortje on the other side." -- You make a solid point.

text: full on middle, slower one again. Flicked off his boot to cow corner for a single.
postText: One boundary, five singles, a super way to start the post-powerplay phase.

text: full on middle. Skidding into his pads. Flicked off the back foot to deep backward square. Huffs and puffs back for the second and there's his fifty! 25-ball half-century from the experienced man. His 26th in the IPL. He's never got a hundred though - will it be tonight?
preText: Bishnoi.

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Uthappa, no run
text: good length, outside off stump. Punched off the back foot towards point
postText: BK: "Can we give batsman little credit, they are playing some real good cricketing shots. Also the pitch is flat. So even good bowlers cant do too much in it. "

wkt_text: RV Uthappa lbw b Ravi Bishnoi 50 (41m 27b 8x4 1x6) SR: 185.18
text: pinned him on the back foot but lbw appeal is turned down! Bishnoi asks KL to review. This was a skiddy delivery that landed around middle and went right through. Uthappa was caught on the back foot, surprised by the speed it got to him. Hits his front leg, no bat involved, so the only question is whether the googly took the ball down the leg side or not. Ball tracking says that's crashing into middle and leg! Umpire has to change his decision, and that's a second wicket for Bishnoi - first the run out, now this lbw.
good length outside off stump. Cut off the back foot to deep point for one
full on middle stump. Nudged off his toes to wide long on for a couple

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Ali, no run
text: full on leg. Clipped to Krunal at square leg. A successful over for the young leggie
back of a length on leg stump. Stands tall and fends from near his chest
preText: Chameera.

text: punished for the poor line as Chameera goes short outside leg. Dube just flicks it from near his armpit, and the dive from fine leg can't cut it off
with a flourish! Full, on off and Dube simply smacks it over cover for four! Met it almost parallel to his eyeline, and tonked it for four
postText: Srinivasa Moort: "Dube could be the Albie Morkel of this CSK side"

text: full and wide outside off. Mistimed drive to mid off
preText: around the stumpss.

text: rolls his fingers over this ball. Length ball outside off, Dube stands tall and punches a glorious shot through the covers. Chameera's scrambled-seam change up makes no difference!
almost chopped on as this length ball outside off is met with an attempted cut. Ball hits the deck and rolls away to the off side
outside edge and it runs past short third man for four! Full on off, and as expected the googly to turn away from Moeen. He looks to push through cover, but nicked instead

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Ali, no run
text: good length on off, and turning across. Moeen can't connect with the back-foot punch
preText: Stat alert: fastest team century in IPL 2022

text: full on off, and turning across. Presses forward to play with soft hands. Outside edge again, but this time short third man can't cut it off
good length ball outside off. Turning further away. Slapped to deep point

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Ali, no run
text: top ball. Just past the outside edge as he presses forward to defend. But the turn takes it away.
full on off. Drilled to long on for one, and that's a tidy finish from Bishnoi.
postText: Let's welcome Andrew Miller on now. His countryman Moeen will be on strike on the flipside.

wkt_text: MM Ali  b Avesh Khan 35 (38m 22b 4x4 2x6) SR: 159.09
text: aw, gone so soon! Moeen stands and attempts to deliver as Avesh hits a good length at good pace... but he's thrashed clean through the wrong line there, flat feet, flatter off stump. Fizzes through his loose mo(w) towards midwicket. A fine cameo ends at the halfway mark
preText: Well hello there. And hello Moeen... it's been a while...

shortText: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, no run
text: outside off, at 137kph, a hint of inswing on a good length, and left alone! Gosh, it's like watching Kraigg Brathwaite all over again

shortText: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, no run
text: full length, just short of a yorker, but arrow-straight, and dug out, back down the pitch. Avesh on the money in this over, and some
banged in short, and waves the bat on a delicate uppercut! Sticks up the stick, as if trying to knock an apple out of a tree, and picked off through third man!
dabbed out to point, full length outside off
back of a length, opens the face, and nudged to the off side
postText: Well, that was a different tempo to the fare that has preceded it. The start of a Super Giant fightback? Or just a small one, for that matter...

text: tossed up on the left-hander's off stump, tapped to cover
preText: Bishnoi, the other wicket-taker

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, no run
text: back of a length, punched out to cover, sliding into the crease as Bishnoi probes on a full length
postText: Heesa Canadian: "You sow today, reap tomorrow. It was Bishnoi who created the pressure and Avesh reaped the reward. "

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, no run
text: swishes and misses, holding its line outside off, zippier off the deck
clattered hard through the covers, and through the sweeper too! Big spin as the ball pitched and ripped past the floundering Chameera! Ends up on his backside, but that turned like a massive offbreak

down on one knee, swept hard on the angle, and so nearly holes out to backward square. Despairing dive inside the rope, leaping forward, but just gets a palm as the ball reaches him on the half-volley. Saved four though

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Dube, no run
text: zips past the off stump, that's a fine finish to the over
looped up on a middle-and-off line, nudged with the angle to the on-side
rocks back, and slapped firmly out to deep cover, and another misfield inside the rope! Over-runs the ball, and fumbles! That's poor fielding from Chameera
postText: Vinay: "113 in 11.2 overs and the projected score at the end of the innings is just 197. You must be kidding right? Something is amiss with the algorithm." I guess we shall wait and see!

text: donked into the stands! Good length, languid hands through the line, launched into the stands at long-off!
opens the face to work to backward point
chopped hard behind square, from round the wicket, and not quite timed
round the wicket once more, banged in short, that's a quicker ball and is met on the back foot with a full face, and a push down the pitch
low full toss from over the wicket, flicked out to midwicket across the line
round the wicket this time, worked to the leg-side with the angle
flicked to leg, just a minor lull in the wild momentum of this innings
back over, and that's a wild wide... the dew is likely kicking in as Pandya flings out way outside off, keeper does well to pounce
skidding on, middle and leg, round the wicket and straightening. Pushed back down the track
tries to give it the charge, pulls out as he fails to get to the pitch, and deflects off the knee-roll past the keeper
squeezed to the on-side, another very tight over as CSK are pegged back after the loss of their early chargers
postText: Pranay: "The forecast is considering Dhoni will take 15 balls to settle and score just 3-4 runs and then catch up" All permutations taken into consideration

text: tighter line, back of a length, pressed on the up to the covers
fired across the left-hander, on a wide line
preText: Right, six overs to go, and it's all bubbling along nicely, quite literally to judge by the dew coming off the rope going round the outfield. Here's AJ Tye

text: back of a length, Rayudu hops back into his crease for a measured pull to midwicket
back of a length on a tight line across the left-hander. Dube swings into a cramped pull but Tye pounces in his followthrough
spanked hard out to deep midwicket, solid connection on the back-of-a-length ball, but straight at the sweeper
Hacked over wide long-on! That wasn't timed, but there was enough oomph through the slog to leg as the ball sat up in the pitch. Flat into the gap, out of the fielder's reach
outside off, poked to backward point, another single to end the over
postText: Phani: "I got to a point where I don't question cricinfo's forecaster.It knows something that we do not know, may be MS' special it is discounting." We have all the numbers... they are crunchy. Like a Braeburn apple (Brabourne, even?)

text: worked to the on-side, midwicket tidies up for another single
over the wicket, too much width this time! Short and wide, and clobbered on the cut in front of square, a big splashy dive from Avash but can't keep it in
another shocker from Chameera! Full-toss, close to no-ball height, and slapped around the corner to short backward square. Into the fielder's hands and out again!
postText: We've had a change of ball due to the damp conditions. It is a swimming pool out there tonight!

text: heave-ho! That'll dry it out! A massive great panning slap through the line, high and mighty over the bowler's head! 88kph, and launched!
fired into the pads, nurdled to the leg side
low full toss, clipped hard to wide long-on, Manish slides well on the boundary's edge to cut off the four
postText: CasualFan: "Dushmantha is being his own Dushman today." He'll dush himself down and come back stronger

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Rayudu, 4 leg byes
text: a hacking great swipe to leg, and a fine deflection through third man! Down on one knee, eyes leaning skywards, half an appeal but struck outside the line, and the runs are flowing now

wkt_text: AT Rayudu  b Ravi Bishnoi 27 (32m 20b 2x4 2x6) SR: 135.00
text: another massive wipe to leg, and the leg stump is plucked out! A gallop to the pitch, fired in flatter, beaten all ends up and that's a timely strike from the Giants' main man of the night so far
on the back foot, and glided out to deep cover
plonked through the line, full length outside off, hard and flat to long-on, where Hooda tumbles brilliantly to gather a fast-travelling ball inside the rope

shortText: Ravi Bishnoi to Jadeja, no run
text: skips through outside off, a tricksy little spell taking shape here
biffed on the up through a very straight long-off! The fielder was back but couldn't get round in time. A dent at the end, but that's an excellent spell from Bishnoi
postText: Sachin: "A wrist spinner bowling in swimming pool with such a control, Team India management definately seen something in Bishnoi." Too right. Very impressive. And it's not going to get easier for bowling either...

text: back of a length, leg stump line, a hurried pull but not timed, Bishnoi rushes in off the rope at fine leg to tidy up
preText: Chameera... redemption time?

text: short again, and that's superbly timed! Launched in front of square with a flat pull, Chameera's bouncer skids onto the bat nicely and a gallop round the rope can't cut it off
back of a length, slower ball, pumped with a full face to deep cover, intercepted with a tumble
tight lines, aiming for the yorker, but comes out as a low full toss. Straight enough to respect though, pushed to long-on
postText: Gautam: "Quick Q- Does David Duchovny look like Ravi Bishnoi?" He brings the X factor, at least

text: rocks back, and hoisted high over backward square! It's an 80 metre boundary, but that's almost into the tennis courts! Slower ball, picked like a mango, high and mighty!
round the wicket, aiming for the yorker, scuffed to the leg side, behind square. No redemption just yet for Dushmantha
postText: Rahul Pathak: "Bishnoi will learn to turn to turn his leg breaks sharply too. What a complete package he will be then "

text: full length, just the single, to deep backward point
preText: Two overs to go, and 210 looks a juicy target. Here's Avesh to crank it up again

wkt_text: S Dube c Lewis b Avesh Khan 49 (56m 30b 5x4 2x6) SR: 163.33
text: mashed into the night sky, but it doesn't have the legs! That was clobbered through the line, on a good length, seemed to have been timed well enough, but it was all height, not enough distance. Lewis steadies himself well at wide long-on, and pouches the catch!
postText: SandyKam: "Dube seems to have somehow found home in CSK...like every player does :-) Marvelous coaching staff."

text: Banged in short, and flogged hard over extra cover! Rocks back, no messing around, forearms through the wide line, into the stands!
preText: Hello Mr Dhoni. What have we in store tonight?
postText: Syed: "CSK has scored 162/1 in 14 overs excluding the Bishnoi spell. What a bowler, what an impact."

text: inside-out, hacked over backward point! Fuller length, wide line, blitzed through the gap!
postText: SACHU : "Did you forget the new law change? " I did... took most of the Hundred to get to grips with that one...

shortText: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, no run
text: a thrash at thin air, and oohs around the ground as his strike-rate plummets

shortText: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, no run
text: Whoops, we had a blackout for that ball. Nothing much seemed to happen
postText: AJ Tye to bowl the final over

text: low full toss, biffed off the pads, through backward square, another boundary to bring up the 200!

wkt_text: RA Jadeja c Pandey b Tye 17 (19m 9b 3x4 0x6) SR: 188.88
text: flicked off the legs once more, but Pandey is lurking in the deep and swallows the chance

wkt_text: D Pretorius lbw b Tye 0 (3m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: fires in the yorker, angling in on leg stump... that's a decent appeal but probably doing too much. It's a review either way... No under-edge, so all on ball tracker... ooh, it's hitting leg stump! Very full length, which did the trick, a very brief encounter for Pretorius
postText: Shiva tells me that was the first time MSD hit a six off the first ball he faced in the IPL. He's a changed man! (And so's Dhoni, honk)

text: low full toss, clipped calmly out to deep midwicket, and the old stagers cross. It's like the last decade never ended
preText: And so it's a hat-trick ball. DJ Bravo has seen it all before...

text: wide full toss, Dhoni thrashes through the line, but he can't connect properly. A flat slap to wide long-off, the runs are drying up a touch here
210 it is! Width outside off, and chopped down through third man. Dhoni's cameo does the needful to post a very challenging total on the board.
postText:
9.21pm: So, the score is on the board.A penny for Andy Flower's thoughts. The dew factor is massive tonight, and with two fingerspinners in the ranks, it's not going to be easy for CSK to defend this. What does Moeen think?

"A great wicket, nice to get a few runs and a good total on the board. It's going to be difficult cos of the dew and they have a brilliant batting line-up. We are going to have to bowl well. Got to have a good start, you don't set a target, you just keep going and get as many as you can. We have to be on our A game. Ravi was fantastic today, good bats these days which helped me. Got a great start in the Powerplay which allowed me to chill a few balls and get going."

Sid: "Wow MSD stood unbeaten in both of the matches with average of infinity.. Great comeback Thala.." To Infinity and Beyond. Just call him Buzz

Faisal: "Dhoni 7000 Runs is T20 Cricket with that 4. Amazing" Gosh, so he did.

Right, that's me done for the moment. Time for Sreshth to reload for the first half of the chase

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Rahul, no run
text: starts off with the short one on middle. Angling across towards off and Rahul semi-ducks and watches the ball go through
preText: Aloha, welcome back to the chase. Still a few minutes to go, the CSK boys are warming up. With a wet ball, no total is enough at the Brabourne. Jadeja is in the huddle, but who is talking to the boys? Well, Mr. Jersey No. 7, MS Dhoni. Debutant Mukesh - left-arm seam - has the ball.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Rahul, no run
text: good length on middle and off. Shaping in slightly. Fended off the back foot
preText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: How does Quinton de Kock do against Moeen Ali in T20s?

text: good length on middle and leg. Nudged off his waist to midwicket to get off the mark for the season. Rahul lost his shoe while taking off for the single

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, no run
text: full on off. de Kock carefully fends off the front foot. But struck off the bat's sweet spot

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, no run
text: full on middle, and angling into leg. Wants to push it to mid on but a leading edge takes it to the off side. Falls a few metres in front of cover. de Kock was off for a single, but Rahul sends him back. Throw from Dube is a direct-hit at the batter's end, but de Kock is in

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, 1 run
text: solid opening over from Mukesh as this full ball on middle and leg is caressed down the ground to mid on for a single
preText: third man comes in. Midwicket goes back

shortText: Deshpande to de Kock, no run
text: full on off, and he drives well, but it is hit straight towards the mid off fielder
preText: Deshpande from the other end.

shortText: Deshpande to de Kock, no run
text: full on off. And the drive is slapped with a bit more power. Mid off moves to his right to stop that
de Kock loves that shot. Stays put on the back foot for this short of a length ball on leg stump, and polishes a pull in front of square over the infield
fullish on middle, and de Kock opts to play a cut, even though there is very little width. Slapped behind point for one
preText: HMody: "Can you imagine what's Mukesh' heart rate was throughout that over? Imagine his family's feeling. What a moment for the local? Embedded beauty of IPL. "

text: misses the line by a little bit, and Rahul sends it past the keeper for four. Length on leg, and he whips it off his waist to fine leg with a tiny swivel
preText: If you're in the USA, you can watch the action live on ESPN+ in English and in Hindi.

text: top ball. This is length outside off but the ball takes off, surprising Rahul with the extra bounce as he tried to play a back-foot punch. Whizzes past the edge to MSD

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, 1 run
text: worked off his waist through to midwicket for one off the back foot

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Rahul, no run
text: good length on middle. Stands tall and offers the full face of the back in his back-foot punch. Ball rolls back towards Mukesh
scythed away! In the slot, just outside off, and Rahul holds the pose after slapping this over cover for six. Played from under his eyeline

putting pressure on the rookie as he goes full once again just outside off. This was overpitched which meant that Rahul couldn't totally get under it, but he knew that as long as he offered fast hands, he would generate enough power to clear the infield. Sliced over point

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Rahul, no run
text: full on middle and off. Gentler drive, rolls away to mid off
length ball on a middle-stump line. Pulled along the ground behind square, and Dube on the boundary line runs around to keep the boundary at bay
smacked right back as Deshpande goes full on off, and de Kock smacks it through the ball's line. Ball races between the gap between the umpire and the non-striker
preText: Sir Lancelot: "Expected KL to take on the bowlers from first over. Has the pitch changed or good bowling by the Indian duo? " -- I think after the duck in his opening game, it was expected that he would just see off any new-ball movement and figure how the deck would play.

shortText: Deshpande to de Kock, no run
text: full on middle, and off. de Kock wants to mow a drive, but the ball doesn't angle across the way he imagined. Ball whizzes past the bat-body gap to the keeper
drilled and four. Full outside off stump, and he throws his bat at this to smack a boundary through extra cover. #LikeATracerBullet
length ball outside leg. Quick to spot that line and he swivels to hammer it from around his chest to fine leg for four. Deshpande also took the pace off, but it didn't quite work out

shortText: Deshpande to de Kock, no run
text: full ball, pitching just outside leg. de Kock looks for a slog over midwicket but can't connect. Hits the pad. Appeal for lbw turned down

shortText: Deshpande to de Kock, no run
text: goes full, but de Kock gets low for the drive, and therefore the ball ends up as a full toss. Sliced to cover, but stopped
hammered through cow corner. Full on his toes, and punished
preText: Vaneez Saraswat: "On a different note @ESPNcricinfo Insights which players have found the right franchises in this ipl and which have gone into a franchise where they will rarely get a game I think the most unluckiest is srikar bharat as he is in delhi capitals which have pant so will be on bench whole season " -- He could still play in Mandeep Singh's position, but yes, just one spot for him for now. Someone like Kartik Tyagi at SRH may be harder with Natarajan, Bhuvi and Malik.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to Rahul, no run
text: good length on middle, and angling across. Rahul looks to pierce the small gap to the left of the fielder at short fine leg. But Pretorius dives and stops
full on middle and leg. Almost a yorker, in fact. Dug away to the leg side

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, FOUR
text: full toss on middle. Lets the ball get to his pads before flicking quite easily behind square for four. Fine leg didn't bother moving much
preText: Shriram: "Does anyone know why is csk not playing Jordan today as the 4th overseas?" -- We hear he is unwell.

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, FOUR
text: fifty up in style for LSG! Goes short, ends up head high for de Kock. He rolls his wrists over this pull, playing the shot along the ground past the square-leg umpire for four

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, 1 wide
text: back of a length just outside off. Too high, and de Kock knew that, offering no shot and taking the extra run that comes with it
postText: Varun: "Speaking of the underutilization of players like Bharat and Tyagi, the disinterest in the mid-season loan system baffles me. Franchises and players should push for loans and maximize the IPL just like football clubs do in January. "

shortText: Mukesh Choudhary to de Kock, 1 run
text: full on middle, and he drives to mid on's right for a quick single

around the stumps to QdK. Full and wide, and de Kock plays a drive through the off side. Went for placement over power, and therefore it does not go for four with Gaikwad running around the boundary from point to cover and sliding to intercept
preText: Rajan: "Chetan Sakariya might be another unlucky player. He was doing quite well at RR last season and he's quite far down in the pecking order for DC, considering that he didn't get a game even when they only had only 2 foreign players available." -- Here's DJ Bravo.

shortText: Bravo to de Kock, no run
text: easy catch for Moeen..... but wait! Dropped. Slot ball outside off, de Kock creams a drive but its uppish. Moeen is behind it at a square-ish mid-off, and it pops in and out! Bravo is nearly on his knees
preText: Rohan: "@Varun, football clubs in direct competition rarely loan players to each other. " -- Actually they do, but then there's a clause where the player can't play against his original team. Maybe they could do that?

shortText: Bravo to de Kock, no run
text: full outside off, this time de Kock drives along the ground. Cover gets behind it

shortText: Bravo to de Kock, no run
text: wide yorker, inside the tramlines. de Kock offers no shot, and that's a dot. Top ball
sticks with the wide line and a full ball, but takes the pace off. de Kock slashes at it, and gets a sliced shot down to deep point
continues around the stumps to Rahu. Full on middle, and Bravo takes a tumble thereafter. Struck down the ground past the bowler to mid-on/long-on for one
preText: Sachin: "@Vaneez. Hello, I would also add Ishan Porel, Rishi Dhawan (PBKS), Sarfaraz (DC). These guys have been performing extraordinarily well in the Domestic front. Was waiting for them to get a long run at their franchise this season atleast."

text: length ball on off. Gets back and flat-bats a shot to long on
preText: powerplay done, and here's the captain. Bravo at first slip.

text: full on middle and leg. Clipped to deep square leg gently enough to get back for the second run. Nobody there on the leg side behind square inside the circle
full on middle. Gets onto the back foot, and taps it to square leg for a comfortable single

gives Jadeja a charge and lofts him over long off! Maybe Jadeja saw Rahul come down since he went a bit wider outside off stump. But Rahul stayed far enough from the ball to truly get the bat swing right, getting under it, and smacking it for half a dozen
good length, on off. Slapped to long on off the back foot

shortText: Jadeja to de Kock, no run
text: appeal for lbw but not given. Length ball, outside leg stump and skidding through. de Kock tried to pull off the back foot, but couldn't connect
postText:
Siddhesh: "I'll admit I am a pessimist but can't help but feel that with the dew getting heavier LSG will win this in a canter. CSK will badly miss Chahar here and Bishnoi might have already made the match winning difference. "

Sheldon: "Memo to Moeen. You don't drop those catches. They come back to bite you"

text: full on off and he pushes a drive to the left of mid on
full on middle. Driven with the turn to long on
so smart! Moeen is coming around the stumps, but de Kock gets to the leg side of the ball before dispatching a four through cover after making room. He created that boundary
slapped to deep extra cover for one

going, going, gone! Innocuous offbreak and Rahul has got his eye in. Fullish on middle, and Rahul skips down the ground and hits it straight 88 metres. Taken by someone in the crowd, and he gives his pals a high five

tough chance! But has to go down as a drop. Moeen went slightly wide knowing Rahul is in the mood to dance down. Rahul slices the attempted loft after skipping down, and slices it. Fielder inside the circle runs towards the cover boundary, but the ball is always going away from him, making it tough for him to catch. Dives facing away from the action, but the ball pops out while he hits the floor. Top effort from Deshpande though
full on leg. de Kock is quick to get low, almost on one knee, and sweeps it hard enough for fine leg's dive to end up as futile

shortText: Jadeja to de Kock, no run
text: full on leg. de Kock tries to play the reverse slap, but it hits his body

shortText: Jadeja to de Kock, no run
text: full on off stump. de Kock taps it to the left of Jadeja, but he's quick. Runs to his left and keeps it down to zero

does he have Thor's hammer?! Struck sooooo sweetly! Length ball on middle, but de Kock backs away creating some more room to give his arms a proper leg-side swing. Slapped in front of square to deep midwicket for four
full on middle. Pushed to the left of Jadeja for a single
length ball on off. Cuts it from close to his body to the off side. Time out
preText: ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster still gives CSK a 72% chance of win. They had an 89% chance of a W before the second innings started
postText: Sam: "They are paying it forward: Moeen drops odd Bravo, Deshpande drops off Moeen. Who drops off Deshpande?" -- And I shall pay it forward to Andrew Miller. Thanks for your company!

text: leg-sided, on a full length, nudged off the pads to mid-on
preText: Evening all... It's getting a bit rowdy out there. And soggy if you're a bowler! Bravo's back for his second over already. The death overs start now...

text: round the wicket, full length on a wide line, opens the face for a jammed steer to deep point
postText: Rahman: "To put into perspective, LSG is still below the RRR." Well, there is that

text: right up to the toes, punched fiercely back at the bowler, who half-stops with a leap forward in his followthrough, the ball deflects to mid-on
he reaches for this one, another wide line, but inside the lines this time, a open-faced slap to deep backward point and up comes his fifty
overcooked again, swinging away, the wrong side of the tramlines. Out of QDK's arc, at least
round the wicket, aiming for the tramlines on a very full length. QDK leaves alone, fishing for the wide
right up to the toes, slower ball, eased down the ground with a whip of the wrists through the line, long-on gathers
postText: Sam: "6 balls without a boundary!" It's a miracle!

text: open face, full length from round the wicket, that's a fine over, QDK is forced to wait for the ball to reach him and pushes the single to point
round the wicket, slower ball to start, good length angled into the bat and pushed to the off side
preText: DJ: "Pretorius means leader, will lead CSK to victory tonight." Well, here he comes... looks like it might be with a new dry ball too

wkt_text: KL Rahul c Rayudu b Pretorius 40 (57m 26b 2x4 3x6) SR: 153.84
text: over the wicket, a pre-meditated pull, but Pretorius spears the short ball out on a wider line, out comes a steepling top-edge, and a fine running take at short backward square! Rayudu judged that well, watching it over his shoulder all the way. And a key breakthrough comes just after the halfway mark... as in CSK's innings in fact
rolls the fingers on another wide line, back of a length, punched at the top of the bounce to backward point
outside off, another slower ball, back of a length, chopped to cover
back of a length, cracked hard through long-on, a sliding stop in the deep
looping slower ball, clipped out to midwicket where Deshpande the fielder loses his footing on the practice wickets, but just about gets in the way
and again, the right tactic, the wrong line. Outside off
fired outside the tramlines this time, keeping it out of the right-hander's arc, but just too much on that
poked off the back foot to mid-off. The momentum has just gone out of this innings for the moment

wkt_text: MK Pandey c Bravo b Deshpande 5 (8m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 83.33
text: battered at Bravo, who clings on at mid-off! Crashed through the line, clearing the front leg for extra oomph, that is travelling fiercely, but those are good hands, and an even better jog of celebration. Big shift in this chase now!
right up to the left-hander's blockhole, a calm press through the line, and he's off the strike to mid-off
postText: Vinay: "I'm closely watching this and the Pak-Aus game. The worm graph is so similar. Nail-biting finish."

text: wide full toss, would have been called as such, but de Kock touches his cut out to deep cover for the single
postText: Mohit: "LSG are looking good to do a PBKS.If you know, you know." SMH

text: A rare boundary! The first in three overs, and it's a skewed drive out through backward point. Just opening the face on impact, on a wide line
guided down to third man, no pace on the stroke, and they hustle back for the second as the fielder swoops round
postText: Kumar: "Reminds me of the 2021 final where Iyer and Gill built a strong stand for KKR, only for the wickets to start tumbling and CSK sealed the win!" Certain similarities so far...

text: nurdled off the toes, round the corner to backward square, enough lack of pace to pick off two more

shortText: Pretorius to de Kock, no run
text: round the wicket, angled into the hip from back of a length, can't connect on the pull to leg
slower ball, wide line, de Kock waits and waits, and picks off another measured steer to deep point
fuller length from round the wicket, speared in at leg stump and worked to backward square
slower ball again, back of a length, Lewis waits on his crease and taps the single to midwicket
fenced off the pads, round the wicket, pace off the stroke and another two runs as the fielder rushes in from the deep. In the absence of boundaries, these twos are handy
postText: Saksham: "Clearly a dip in run rate since the ball was changed and CSK got a dry ball. Why was the ball changed though?" Consistency. It was changed in first innings too

text: crashes through the wide line this time! Gets underneath the stroke to skew it through backward point...
excellent bowling, right on the tramline, outside off. No stroke offered...called wide, but that was marginal
postText: Avishek: "Bad planning by CSK. Why would you get Manish Pandey out to bring Evin Lewis to the cease in a 12 RPO chase!" Left-hand right-hand was a factor I suspect.

text: opens the face, down to third man
wide line once more, very full length, another chop into the covers
wide full toss, clobbered out to deep cover, and Jadeja's safe hands do wonderfully to pick up on the dive and fling it back in one motion
clears the front leg for a hack over the leg side, looks like a firm contact, but the sweeper at wide long-on is on hand
postText: Sanleen: "You didn't understand the joke Avisek cracked!!" Apparently so, I'm new round here...

text: launched over long-off! A priceless end to a decent over, just missed his length this time, and Lewis was onto it immediately, with a lean-back-crack up and over the ropes!
round the wicket, into the blockhole, punched to long-on
round the wicket, hopeful appeal as the batter gets in a tangle in front of the stumps, but Dhoni indicates that is sliding down leg... clipping as it happens, so umpire's call
crunched down to long-off, thrashing through the line, struck well but straight at the man back on the rope

wkt_text: Q de Kock c †Dhoni b Pretorius 61 (82m 45b 9x4 0x6) SR: 135.55
text: spirals straight up in the air, and Dhoni takes a cool-as-cucumber catch! Clears the front foot, round the wicket, into the arc, de Kock makes room to drill over the off side, but gets right underneath his stroke, and the keeper calls loud and early. That's a big old breakthrough. Runs on the board looking handy now!
wide line, full length, bashed hard to cover
beats the man at backward square! Clawed around the corner with an urgent fling of the hands across the line. Useful boundary to end the over. Three-quarters done...
over the wicket, angling across the right-hander with some outswing on a full length, cunning bowling, poked to cover
cuffed with an open face down to third man, shaping in on a full length round the wicket. Excellent line and length, to a perfectly set field
flogged through the line! That was so hard and straight, it might have vaporised the non-striker's stumps, and the umpire's shins, had it hit either. Full length and crashed!
hops inside the line, takes the deflection to the leg side
spanked through the covers! Bravo misses his length, serves up a full toss on that wide line, and it's punished!
full again, tighter to the stumps, punched to the man on the edge of the ring, a precious dot to finish the over.
postText: And it's a Time Out too. The official one is brought to you by a tyre company. Mine comes courtesy of the kettle and a tea-bag!

text: round the wicket, into the pads, attempted pull but can't connect
slower ball, back of a length, another hopeful pull but worn in the midriff. Singles won't cut it from here
too much on that one, outside the tramlines, on the full.
fired past a wild swing for the hills, full length outside off
postText: SB: "Has dhoni and jaddu miscalculated the overs? They have one more over of spin to bowl though either from Mo or Jaddu" It's going to be a big over either way...

text: width again, on the full length, and a fat edged slog down to third man. Good areas from Pretorius, changing his pace to good effect
pummelled over long-off! Pace back on the ball this time, at 124kph, but it's in the slot, and Lewis was waiting for that one! The balance tilts again
slower ball, and Dhoni reckons there's a nick on that! It loops down to the bat, an ambitous swipe through the covers, and there seemed to be a sound in real time... but not on UltraEdge!
postText: Gopal Raju: "Dhoni was shown telling "We have two referrals!"" Not any more...

text: crushed down the ground! It's a length ball, with a bit of pace, and high over the sightscreen! Hoo-da-man indeed!

wkt_text: DJ Hooda c Jadeja b Bravo 13 (17m 8b 1x4 1x6) SR: 162.50
text: slower ball, low full toss, launched to the leg-side ... into Jadeja's hands! It was high, it was handsome, but it didn't have the legs it appeared to have. And Bravo is the leading wicket-taker in IPL history!
postText:
171 wickets and counting.... Which, coincidentally, is also the score...

Siddharth: "Woah...that boundary must be really long. Watching live, I was sure he had nailed that. "

text: slower ball, nudged off the legs, they push for the second
bangs in the bouncer, a flashing pull, a bit of excitement from bowler and keeper, but mostly to blag the non-wide. It doesn't work...
pace on this time, outside off, steered to backward point with an open face
full again, squeezed out to deep point, no pace on the stroke so they push for the second and get there easily
chopped out to deep cover, a decent end to Bravo's spell.
postText: Deepankar DM : "5 sixes would do nicely here.." That would be handy. And with the West Indian Lewis at the crease, I suspect he knows it too. It's how they tend to roll...

text: down on one knee, and lumped over square leg! That's a huge hit, sweetly timed, from outside off on a full length, and it hits a girl on the head in the stands too... she seems fine, but that was travelling!
preText: Dube is the man for the penultimate over... interesting. His first of the night. Moeen and Jaddu kept out of the firing line. What can he leave Choudhary to defend?

text: smashed out to deep cover, solid connection, but that's a win for CSK this time
better from Dube... no, a late call from the umpire! Swinging away on a wide line, and though Badoni throws his hands at the ball, it's the wrong side of the line!
width, too much width!. This is a suboptimal start to the over
round the wicket, length ball, angled into the bat, an open-faced slash from Lewis, and Dube gets away with it... off the toe of the bat, and it plugs out of the reach of deep backward point
pongo-ed through the covers! I wonder if Jaddu or Moeen might have been a better bet after all. A non-descript length ball, no pace, or lack of pace. Just dobbed, and flogged!
belted up and over long-off! The worm has turned in dramatic fashion! Another length delivery, from round the wicket, in the arc and dispatched again!
driven, inside out, over long-off! A 23-ball fifty from Lewis, and that was a throw-down from Dube! In the slot, slammed with a full face!
whoops, a rank wide, and the equation is down to eight
preText: Cripes. That's changed things somewhat...
postText: Utsab : "OMG. What a decision it turned out to be. Feel for Dube. Difficult time to bowl." Unlucky Dube, you might say... the lucky version is here

text: slower ball to start, on a length outside off stump. Dabbed into the ring, behind square with soft hands, and they race through for one
preText:
Willey will take the new ball. Left-arm over the wicket. One slip

Faf, wearing the orange cap after his innings against Punjab, addresses his team in a huddle. Venky Iyer and Ajinkya Rahane run out to open up for KKR. Rahane marks out his guard.

If you're in the USA, you can watch the KKR vs RCB match live on ESPN+.

Thanks, Shashank. Looking forward to seeing how KKR approach this innings - might they float Sunil Narine in the middle order against RCB's spinners?

The Live Report, meanwhile, is live. Tune in for cutting-edge analysis half-informed guesswork from Karthik Krishnaswamy, and Sidharth Monga later in the evening. With that, it's over to Matt Roller, who is waiting for us from London. Say hello to him.

Mustafa Moudi : "Fun Fact: When Umesh last played for KKR against RCB, this happened." -- Cheeky. Mustafa's referring to this.

T20 Time Out is now live with Chris Lynn & Wasim Jaffer

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat of the day: Guess which team Andre Russell has hit the most sixes against in the IPL?

Heads calls Shreyas, tails it is. RCB opt to bowl. "I'm no pitch expert but this pitch feels tacky. With dew later in the evening, the ball could skid on a bit more," says Faf du Plessis. RCB unchanged.

"I would've bowled first as well," says Shreyas. "Spoke to the bowlers. They said the ball was slipping at the end of the first innings (in their first game). The bowlers did an amazing job, batters finished off on a good note. This is a good test for us, to try and put up a good total." Tim Southee comes in for Shivam Mavi. Remember, they played just three overseas players in the previous game, so Southee becomes the fourth overseas player today.

The XIs for you

RCB: Faf, Rawat, Kohli, Karthik, Rutherford, Shahbaz, Harshal, Hasaranga, Willey, Siraj, Akash Deep

KKR : Venkatesh, Rahane, Shreyas, Rana, Jackson, Billings, Russell, Narine, Southee, Umesh, Chakravarthy

Manu Ajmani: "Once almighty Josh Hazelwood/Maxy starts his stint with RCB, they will look a completely different side. Their problem still lies with the 16 overs to complete. Siraj can't go about giving away 59 runs when retained in 2022 (only spell worth mentioning was the 3/8 against the same opposition). Karn could be given a chance too! RCB needs to do their permutations and combinations early in the tournament and prepare for a final playing XI towards the latter stage."

6.55pm Sprinkling of live grass right through the strip. But that isn't the reason captains will want to bowl first. It's the dew factor. Last night in Pune, Royals defended a total successfully for the first time this season. Wonder if the win-toss-bowl-win-match trend will resume tonight. Let's hope for a cracker whichever way. Toss coming up.

Here is Sanket's pro tip: "RCB need to play Chakravarty and Narine really well. Don't give wickets to them and then rest of the bowling line up can be put under pressure at any stage, especially at the death just like MSD did on the opening night."

6.50pm Are you into Fantasy Cricket? Who isn't, right? If you're looking for a pro tip and trying to rustle up your team after having slept through the day, here's a quick primer

If you're in the USA, you can watch the KKR vs RCB match live on ESPN+. And if you want to follow our ball-by-ball commentary in Hindi, we've got you covered too.

Vikram: "It was refreshing to see Kohli using his feet and going over the top on Sunday. Long time coming. I hope he brings out Sweep also, just like Ravi Shastri mentioned."

Dinesh Karthik will be plotting against the very guys he was playing with six months ago. From deciding when to bowl Sunil Narine and when to unleash Andre Russell, he will now be giving his Royal Challengers mates a blueprint on how to counter those very players. More in my match preview.

6.20pm Howdy, folks? It's RCB v KKR, the rivalry that kickstarted this summer festival 14 years ago. Brendon McCullum, the protagonist from that magical night of April 18 is now coach of the same team, plotting against a team whose coach Mike Hesson (well, he's Director of Cricket) was his one-time confidante during their time together at New Zealand. I'm Shashank Kishore. Pleased to have Matt Roller's company, and of course, yours for this match.

shortText: Willey to VR Iyer, no run
text: full, swinging away just a fraction. Iyer steers into the off side
preText: Square leg and deep point are the two men out.

text: back of a length, no swing at 126.8kph. Clipped off the hip, past short fine leg. Deep square runs around to cut it off
angling into the pads, 125.6kph. Clipped out to deep backward square, and they jog through for one
angled across him, just short of a length and no swing. 127.2kph. Steered out into the off side with an open face
uses his feet, shimmying down, but can't lay bat on ball. Willey angles it across him, and Rahane misses out looking to guide it into the off side

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to VR Iyer, FOUR
text: crunched through point for the first boundary of the match. 137.5kph, Iyer steps across, frees his arms and slaps it away square of the wicket with an open face. Too much width, in the slot
preText: Tidy start by Willey but the new ball isn't swinging as yet. Mohammed Siraj shares the new ball after a tough outing last time. Slip and short mid-off in place.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to VR Iyer, no run
text: hung outside the off stump, left alone. 137.8kph
preText: Point goes back to the fence.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to VR Iyer, no run
text: so nearly chopped on! 135.1kph, hard length, and Iyer bottom-edges into his back thigh pad, looking to slap it away through the off side. It almost got stuck on his thigh before dropping down, just past off stump

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to VR Iyer, no run
text: beauty. 142kph, a touch fuller, and swings past Iyer's outside edge as he looks to drive through the off side

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to VR Iyer, no run
text: tucks him up, on a length towards the hip. Iyer looks to work through the leg side but can't get it away, pushing it back to Siraj. 142kph

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to VR Iyer, 2 runs
text: on a length, angled across him, and skews away via the shoulder of the bat, behind square on the off side. Good bounce from Siraj. The fielder at backward point takes a tumble as he fields, allowing them to sneak through for two
full, swinging in. Clipped out to deep square leg off the pads. 128kph, gentle pace from Willey so far

shortText: Willey to VR Iyer, no run
text: beaten while fiddling outside off stump. Just back of a length, decent bounce and a hint of shape away, and beats the outside edge as Iyer looks to steer wide of gully

shortText: Willey to VR Iyer, 1 leg bye
text: fuller and straighter, looks to clip into the leg side and they scramble through for a single, via the front pad. Strangled appeal, but looked to be missing leg
angled across him, Rahane shuffles across and punches away through backward point off the back foot. Rahane was thinking about two, but Iyer had other ideas

shortText: Willey to VR Iyer, no run
text: tight to the stumps on release, looking to hit the top of the stumps from a good length. Nudged into the leg side, and Willey bounds around to his left to field in his follow-through
shuffles down, so Willey drags his length back. Venky pushes into the off side with soft hands - soft enough that they can squeeze through for a single to the man on the edge of the ring at cover

shortText: Akash Deep to VR Iyer, OUT
wkt_text: VR Iyer c & b Akash Deep 10 (16m 14b 1x4 0x6) SR: 71.42
text: back of a length, chipped up into the leg side, and Deep settles under it in his follow-through! Venky was looking to pull, but was cramped for room as the ball got big on him. He skewed it up via the top edge, presenting Deep with a straightforward chance, changing direction and running to his left as the ball hung in the Mumbai air
preText:
Akash Deep replaces Siraj.

Akheel: "RCB is playing with three captains... lot of experience here with Dinesh, Virat and Faf"

shortText: Akash Deep to SS Iyer, FOUR
text: half-volley outside off stump, pounded through the off side! 144kph, nipping in just a touch off the seam, but Shreyas sees the width and flogs him away, cover-driving with real power as well as timing
preText:
The new KKR skipper, Shreyas Iyer, at No. 3. Still a slip in place.

Sowmya: "Quicker than he expected. The extra pace"

shortText: Akash Deep to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: back of a length, 132kph, nipping into the leg side. Clipped off the hip, out to deep backward square
back of a length, pulled away in front of square for a couple. 141kph, dragged through midwicket with a short-arm jab

shortText: Akash Deep to Rahane, no run
text: lifts past the bat. Extra bounce from Akash, 138.7kph. Back of a length, width outside off stump. Rahane was up on his toes trying to cut over point, but was late on it
back of a length, width outside off again, and this time Rahane gets it away. Hangs on the back foot, sitting deep in his crease, and dabs it away past short third with soft hands and an open face

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to SS Iyer, FOUR
text: beats square leg on the dive. 134kph, back of a length but straying onto the pads. Shreyas rolls the wrists, clipping off the hip. Past short fine leg, and deep backward square couldn't cut it off. Flying start for Shreyas
preText: Siraj. Change of ends for him.

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: on a length, nudged to short midwicket for one

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Rahane, 1 leg bye
text: on a length, 141kph. Clipped out to square leg, via the pad

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to SS Iyer, no run
text: caught-and-bowled chance? Yes, but a difficult one. Shreyas cleared his front leg, looking to go through the off side, and Siraj cramped him for room with a back-of-a-length ball. Miscued back to him, Siraj couldn't quite cling on in his follow-through. Arrived at shin-height

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: on a length, a touch fuller than he has been. Nudged to mid-off, pressing forward to drive

wkt_text: AM Rahane c Shahbaz Ahmed b Mohammed Siraj 9 (25m 10b 1x4 0x6) SR: 90.00
text: back of a length, Rahane frees his arms and pulls... straight down the throat of Shahbaz at deep backward square! Cross-seam, sets the trap by dropping a touch shorter. Rahane took on the shorter ball, pulling off his ribs, but picked out the man in the deep

shortText: Akash Deep to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: good length outside off stump, pressed out to the sweeper on the off side
preText:
Akash Deep continues. Rana, the new man, is at the non-striker's end

Hari: "Shreyas Iyer seems to be in pristine form, he is showing wonderful game awareness and adaptability with his style of play. A very strong contender for the No. 4/5 position for the T20 WC later this year."

text: hammers his first ball over midwicket for six! Where did that come from?! On a length, angling across the left-hander and dagged 83 metres over the leg side. A statement of intent from Rana
preText:
Slip in, stays over the wicket

BK: "Very poor by Rahane, full set-up created and he did not understand. How such a senior player can get trapped in such an easy set-up?"

text: looks for the wide yorker, but it's a low full toss at 140kph outside off stump. Rana keeps his composure, reaching for it with no foot movement, and steers it away between short third and backward point, through the ring
preText: The no-ball siren sounds. Free hit incoming.

shortText: Akash Deep to Rana, 1 no ball
text: back of a length, good carry through at 139kph. Rana clears his front leg, looking to flay him over the off side, but can't lay bat on ball... hold on, Akash has overstepped!

shortText: Akash Deep to Rana, no run
text: angled across him on a length. Looks to nudge a single into the leg side, but a leading edge skews it back down the pitch

wkt_text: N Rana c Willey b Akash Deep 10 (8m 5b 1x4 1x6) SR: 200.00
text: superb diving catch by Willey! Akash has two, and RCB have three in the Powerplay. Hard length again, angling across the left-hander, nipping away just a touch off the seam. Another attempt heave over the leg side from Rana, but horribly miscued via the top edge. It loops up into the leg side, miles up in the air, and Willey, running back, slides onto his knees and clings on
preText: Slip moves to wide gully
postText: I wondered if KKR might do this to counter RCB's spinners: Sunil Narine walks out at No. 5, as a floating pinch-hitter. Means one of Billings, Jackson and Russell will bat at No. 8.

shortText: Akash Deep to Narine, no run
text: tucks him up, back of a length at 136kph and angling into the body. Narine looks to clip a single into the leg side but can only push it back towards the bowler
postText: Supradeep: "All three wickets off miscued pulls. Extra bounce?" -- RCB's seamers have found the perfect length for this pitch, just short of a good length.

shortText: de Silva to SS Iyer, no run
text: googly, 83kph, delivered with a low arm. Shreyas, batting without a helmet or a cap, comes forward and looks for a single into the covers but Hasaranga fields well in his follow-through
preText: Wanindu Hasaranga, the big-money buy. Struck with his first ball against Punjab.

shortText: de Silva to SS Iyer, 1 run
text: flat legbreak, steered out to point with soft hands and an open face
flat outside off stump, Narine clears his front leg to give himself room and punches away through point
preText: DK comes over to Hasaranga.

shortText: de Silva to SS Iyer, OUT
wkt_text: SS Iyer c du Plessis b de Silva 13 (23m 10b 2x4 0x6) SR: 130.00
text: holes out to long-on! Hasaranga strikes as Shreyas picks out Faf on the boundary. Very full legbreak, hit hard and flat down the ground, but straight to Faf, just above head height. Shreyas throws his head back in frustration
postText: Sam Billings at No. 6. Bright orange spikes with neon green laces... He was Narine's captain at Oval Invincibles last summer.

shortText: de Silva to Billings, no run
text: googly, ripping in to smack Billings on the pad. Hasaranga goes up in appeal, but it's turned down. They don't review. Looked like it was sliding down the leg side

shortText: de Silva to Billings, no run
text: another flat wrong 'un, and Billings can't beat short midwicket
postText: Wow-indu. What a start for him, one wicket and just two runs conceded.

text: clears the front leg, and hammers it over mid-off! On a length, angling across him. Mid-off is up inside the ring and Narine backs himself to clear him. He does so comfortably, slapping it over the rope after one bounce
preText:
Akash Deep gets a third

PD: "Brain freeze batting by KKR so far.."

text: top-edged for six! Flies over the keeper, and just over the rope. Back of a length, Narine clears the front leg looking to pull over midwicket, and a thick top edge skews away

shortText: Akash Deep to Narine, no run
text: banged in short, Narine pulls out of his shot as he clears the front leg, shaping to pull
offcutter on a length, 123kph, slapped out to deep cover
on a length, angling into the pads. Clipped away, behind square on the leg side

shortText: Akash Deep to Narine, no run
text: full, wide outside off stump as he angles it across the left-hander. Narine looks to slap through the off side but can't put bat on ball. 139kph
postText: Afeef: "One must keep in mind that Narine is coming off a 13-ball 50 and a 21-ball 50 in his last two innings at the BPL not long ago" -- And has a fantastic record vs RCB

text: full googly, Billings brings out the reverse-sweep and drags it out to deep point. Long square boundary, so they scamper back for two
preText: Abhi: "Say what you will about Kohli's captaincy. But it feels weird to see him not being one for RCB." -- Faf has done a good job so far tonight. Hasaranga continues.

text: clubs a full toss over midwicket! Hasaranga lets this one slip out, and Billings skips down the track. Reached him at thigh-height, a couple of steps out of his crease, and his drills it 84 metres

shortText: de Silva to Billings, no run
text: googly, Billings hangs back looking to punch through the off side but is cramped by the turn and can only push it back to the bowler
preText: Hasaranga dries his hands on a towel. Kohli goes over to offer a calming word.

text: leading edge, but past Hasaranga's left hand as he flings himself low to his left. Looking to work it down to long-on, but skews it out to mid-off as the bat face closes early

wkt_text: SP Narine c Akash Deep b de Silva 12 (20m 8b 1x4 1x6) SR: 150.00
text: miscued to backward point, Hasaranga has two! Googly, which Narine looks to club over the leg side, clearing his front leg. Leading edge skews up, and Akash takes a couple of steps to his right, before taking a straightforward catch. Fullish length, and plenty of turn on the wrong 'un. Not at all sure Narine picked it.
postText: Strategic timeout. KKR still have some batting to come but have lost half their side before the end of the ninth over. Sheldon Jackson in at No. 7, with Russell still in the dugout, waiting for the back-end.

wkt_text: SP Jackson  b de Silva 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: knocks him over with a ripping googly, Hasaranga yelps in celebration! Hasaranga's trademark, the sharply-spun googly which nobody can pick. Expansive drive from Jackson, leaving a gap between bat and pad, which the ball squeezes through. Knocks back his off stump, and Hasaranga has his Ronaldinho hands out again. KKR six down and in deep trouble!
preText: Slip in

text: hard length, outside off stump. Steered down through the off side on the 45 with an open face, and Harshal races round, diving to his left to cut it off. He doesn't quite slap the ball back cleanly and it dribbles back towards the toblerone, but he recovers well, diving back to his right to flick it back
preText: Dre Russ at No. 8, starts at the non-striker's end. Short midwicket and short cover in place.

text: fuller, tucked off the pads out to deep midwicket. Slight fumble by Anuj Rawat on the rope, but it doesn't cost them a run

short ball, aimed at the right shoulder. 140kph. Russell drops his hands, pulling out of his shot and swaying inside the line, and DK can't gather cleanly. Siraj glares at him as he concedes a couple of byes
hard length outside off stump, cross-seamer, but width for Russell to free his arms. Plants his front leg and slaps it cross-batted, away through cover. Pure power

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Russell, no run
text: yorker at 141kph, tailing in towards the stumps as Russell looks to back away and create room. Jams his bat down on it, pulling out of the attacking shot

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Russell, no run
text: short, Russell ducks underneath it. Not given as a wide - might have got away with one.
postText: Here's Shashank.

shortText: de Silva to Billings, no run
text: drifting in, defended gently
preText: On a hat-trick is Waning

text: steps out and works it through to deep midwicket

shortText: de Silva to Russell, no run
text: skids a length ball on off, Russell defends

shortText: de Silva to Russell, no run
text: slower through the air, gets it to dip and spin back in as it hits Russell's pad as he prods forward
muscled over wide long-on! Saw this tossed up and couldn't hold back. Down on one knee as he walloped that deep into the stands. 94-metre hit.

shortText: de Silva to Russell, no run
text: pushed through quicker on off, Russell solid in defence
length ball on off, flayed on the up, good stop at extra cover
slants one in from wide of the crease, Billings is squared up as he squirts this into the off side
slower delivery dug into the pitch outside off, Billings looks to steer it behind square but misses

wkt_text: SW Billings c Kohli b Patel 14 (28m 15b 0x4 1x6) SR: 93.33
text: he has hit this straight down long-on's throat. Harshal's slower variations to the fore. Gets it to rear up from short of a length, Billings goes for a flat-batted pull but got it really high on the bat, Kohli ended up taking a dolly.
preText: Vijay S: "As a CSK fan, I've seen this show before many times. You have KKR pegged back, and Dre Russ hits a blinding 50 and you have to chase a big total."

text: goes full and fast outside off, Southee digs it out
goes for a skiddy bouncer outside off this time, he looks to rise with the bounce and upper cut but is beaten

shortText: Shahbaz Ahmed to Russell, no run
text: flatter length ball from around the stumps, defended
preText: Shahbaz Ahmed into the attack

text: he's hit this into the stands at deep midwicket! Length and drifting in, Russ is down on one knee as he plays the slog sweep to perfection. Was hitting against the turn but when you're hitting it with the kind of power Russ is, no worries about the returns especially when the ball isn't spinning big.
width outside off, slapped into the gap at sweeper cover
smeared wide outside off, he tried to bowl outside Russell's hitting arc but looks like it slipped
believe me he hit this off the toe end but he's still managed to swing this over the long-off boundary. Shahbaz throws this up on a length and gives him width too - asking for trouble.
fired full on the pads, worked to deep square

shortText: Shahbaz Ahmed to Southee, no run
text: drifts this into middle, Southee is well forward as he defends
dug into the pitch again, Russell sways out of the way of this short ball on the stumps
helps this pull along but it's a good stop at short fine leg by Akash Deep
excellent from Harshal. Bowls the heavy ball this time, Russell is beaten by the skid and bounce as he shapes to pull
makes some room to use the pace, but steers this straight to short third. Harshal yet to concede a run in 1.4 overs

wkt_text: AD Russell c †Karthik b Patel 25 (26m 18b 1x4 3x6) SR: 138.88
text: kept frustrating him with his variations and eventually has Russell! He reaches out to slap this up and over point but ends up reaching out to this wide delivery that he nicks through to DK.
slower and fuller on the stumps from wide of the crease, squirted to mid-on
mistimes this slog to long-on
tossed up on the stumps, worked to long-on
preText: Which IPL batter has the highest strike rate against an opposition? (Min. 300 runs)

wkt_text: TG Southee c du Plessis b de Silva 1 (18m 5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20.00
text: swung away but no timing behind that as Faf, running in from long-on, takes a comfortable catch. Hasaranga did him in with the length. Didn't allow the batter to get underneath the flight. Fourth for him
preText: George : "The dew factor really diminishes the thrill of the IPL.It's like two separate pitches, the way the ball behaves so differently. Sides batting first in these conditions must be given a decent handicap to make matches more even.No one likes to have matches decided by the luck of a coin toss."

shortText: de Silva to Varun, no run
text: flatter one on off, defended

shortText: de Silva to Varun, no run
text: defended from the crease again

shortText: de Silva to Varun, no run
text: flatter one on off, bunted away
preText: Can he finish with a five-for?

text: hits the hard lengths as he bowls from wide of the crease, Umesh mistimes a slog to long-on
goes full and straight on the stumps, eased down the ground for a single
attempted the dipping yorker but executed wrongly, ended up being a high full toss that he helps to short fine.
preText: Watch out for the slower, dipping yorker

text: excellent short ball outside off, Varun arches back to let it pass after initially harbouring hopes of an upper cut
dug into the pitch and angling in from wide of the crease, Chakravarthy lets it go
right into the blockhole from wide of the crease, kept out. RCB have asked for an lbw referral. And it's the most ridiculous review you'll ever see because it was straight off the bat.
swings this Yorker-length delivery to long-on

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Varun, no run
text: cramped for room as he looks to pull, bounces to short midwicket

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Varun, no run
text: hit high on the bat as he's thrown off balance trying to pull, squirts to the off side
drives hard, gets a thick outside edge to third man
off a thick inside edge, beats short fine leg for four. Umesh was looking to wallop this through midwicket

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Yadav, no run
text: appeal for lbw as this zips back in off a length to hit him on the pad. Siraj calls for the captain to refer. Faf politely says no.
slower length ball on middle, defended
this one's off a thick edge again but it's so fine that even a fine third man can't stop that. Useful runs
full and straight on the stumps, squirted to the leg side
beautiful slower variation again, this one's the split-finger one, I think, Umesh reaches out to drive but beaten
cutter off a length, he steers this to short third where Wanindu makes a right royal mess and lets it through his legs.
snorter of a short ball, wasn't far from Varun's gloves as he tried to steer it away
misses his length, bowls a full toss and Umesh wallops this over wide long-on!

shortText: Akash Deep to Yadav, no run
text: swing and a miss! This time he went fuller and just around the wide line, basically away from his hitting arc

shortText: Akash Deep to Yadav, no run
text: swing and a miss again. Looked to scythe this length ball over point

drilled over the infield, Wanindu runs around from square third man but overruns the ball to let it through to the boundary. Poor, poor effort. That can really be embarrassing. Am sure he doesn't want to watch the replay of that any time soon

wkt_text: UT Yadav  b Akash Deep 18 (26m 12b 2x4 1x6) SR: 150.00
text: cleans him up finally! Goes full and fast yorker on middle and leg from wide of the crease, Umesh, clearing his front leg, looks to swing this to the leg side but misses and sees the leg stump knocked back. The pesky final-wicket stand has added 27 to help give KKR's bowlers something to defend.
postText:
9.15pm A solid effort that will please Faf du Plessis and the millions of RCB fans. They won a good toss and did everything asked of their bowlers. Akash Deep was tapped around but had better returns with three wickets, while Wanindu Hasaranga sliced through the middle order in a terrific spell, picking up four wickets. Later in the piece, Harshal Patel, with his truckloads of variations, brought his experience to the fore to keep the lower order honest. RCB would've taken this at the toss and will back themselves to chase this down.

Watch T20 Time:Out live with Wasim Jaffer and Chris Lynn:

Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat: Who was the batter with the lowest strike rate against spin in 2021 (min. 100 runs)?

text: nearly chops on! Back of a length, swinging away appreciably. Faf shapes to punch through cover off the back foot and gets a thick inside edge, past leg stump and away to deep backward square
preText:
Slip in place. KKR need new-ball wickets and Umesh Yadav will kick things off. Tim Southee likely to bowl the second over, you'd think.

Shreyas address his team in a huddle on the boundary edge. Light show over the floodlights at the DY Patil. Kohli has his pads and helmet on in the dugout, but Faf and Rawat will continue together at the top of the order.

A reminder that those of you in the US can watch today's game live on ESPN+.

Devarsh: "Chase the target down in 15 overs and boost up your NRR should be the aim for RCB. Take advantage of chasing a low total."

Sri Harsha Anug: "Anyone else getting 49 vibes??? The situation was similar even then. Kkr had a barely enough total on board." -- Very similar target...

shortText: Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run
text: angling in, looks to clip off the hip but gets a leading edge back to the bowler. 136kph

wkt_text: Anuj Rawat c †Jackson b Yadav 0 (4m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: nicks him off! Umesh strikes with his third ball. Umesh steams in and bangs it in, short of a good length. Rawat is turned into an 'S', unsure whether to play or leave, and pokes at it. It takes the shoulder of the bat and flies through to Jackson. Plenty of pace and bounce for Umesh
wide outswinger, back of a length. Kohli sees the width and his eyes light up, and he punches elegantly through cover point, away from his body. Off the mark with a boundary
preText: Kohli at No. 3. Slip in.

text: full, swinging into the pads. 140kph. Kohli leans forward and clips effortlessly through straight midwicket, tucking it away for four. Russell catches up with it, sliding into the rope as he tries to flick it back. They check it, and it is indeed four
on a length, clipped off the hip to square leg. 132kph
postText: Early wicket for Umesh, but two crisply-timed boundaries for Kohli to get up and running.

text: fullish, angling into the pads and swinging away. Leading edge into the off side, lands short of the fielder
preText: Mahesh: "Backing Southee to make some impact in first few overs to get the game open up for KKR" -- Here he is, sharing the new ball.

text: back of a length, tight line, clipped into the leg side
back of a length, Kohli shimmies down so Southee goes very wide outside off stump. Steered away behind square on the off side, opening the face

shortText: Southee to du Plessis, no run
text: back of a length, hint of width outside off. Faf punches back down the ground, and Southee gets a fingertip on it in his follow-through
on a length, very wide outside off stump, gentle pace at 132kph. Faf's feet are rooted to the spot as he stands tall, flogging Southee over cover, cross-batted

wkt_text: F du Plessis c Rahane b Southee 5 (11m 4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 125.00
text: leading edge, squirted to point! RCB have lost both their openers, including their captain, inside the first two overs. Fullish length, angling into the pads. Faf's bat face closes too early as he looks to clip into the leg side, and it skews up and away to Rahane at backward point, who takes a simple catch. KKR are still in this...

wkt_text: V Kohli c †Jackson b Yadav 12 (10m 7b 2x4 0x6) SR: 171.42
text: nicks him off, KKR on fire! Kohli feathers one through to Jackson and Umesh has two. On a good length, sixth stump line, and Kohli fiddles at the ball in the channel. Outside edges it through to the keeper, and RCB are wobbling here... surely we couldn't see a repeat of the 49 game?!
preText: David Willey gets a promotion, in at No. 4.

text: short ball, aimed at the shoulder. Rutherford ducks underneath it. Steepling bounce through to Jackson, and it flies away to the rope for byes
preText:
Sherfane Rutherford at No. 5. Two left-handers in.

Abhilash: "Am I watching a live match or a replay from 2017?"

text: back of a length, nudged to short midwicket. 139kph
angled acorss him on a good length, 138kph. Rutherford shoulders arms
postText: Saksham: "@Matt, missing DK behind the stumps for KKR?" -- Thought I'd got away with that one...

text: tight to the stumps on release, dug into the pitch. Rutherford cuts it away behind square
back of a length, Willey is up on his toes to clip off the ribs towards square leg
postText: Shreyas and Billings deep in conversation at the end of the over.

text: fullish length, wide outside the off stump. 131kph, left alone
preText: Southee gets a second. Stays over the wicket to the lefties. Slip in.

text: fuller, still very wide outside off stump and can't tempt Rutherford into a drive
full outswinger, angled across him. Three leaves in a row
preText: Sook: "Despite all the talk about dew hurting the team bowling 2nd, some of the new ball spells in the 2nd innings in this IPL have been thrilling to watch"

text: tighter line, dragging his length back slightly too. Rutherford looks to clip through the leg side but the ball stops on him just a touch, and he nudges it back down the pitch
full, angling across him. Clipped to Billings at short midwicket
back of a length, Rutherford swivel-pulls off the hip, on one leg, out to square leg. No maiden for Southee
full, on a sixth-stump line and angled across the left-hander at 143kph. Left alone, not suckered into the drive
back of a length, defended into the leg side. 138kph
back of a length, pushed back down the pitch with a loud cry of "NO!". 134kph
back of a length, angling into him from wide on the crease. Pressed towards mid-on
preText: Change of angle, around the wicket

text: wide outside off stump, nipping away on a good length. Willey thought his back-foot punch had got through the infield, but Rahane did well diving to his left at backward point
angling into the pads, clipped away to deep backward square leg to retain strike
back-of-a-length, Willey is up on his toes and plays tip-and-run, nudging it to point with soft hands. Rutherford is alert, and scrambles through for the single
preText:
Final Powerplay over. Andre Russell will bowl it. No slip

Afeef: "Both Willey and Rutherford having to play contrary to their natural big-hitting ways is interesting to see"

text: back of a length, defended with a straight bat on the back foot. 130kph
dug in short, Rutherford is cramped but gets a half-cut away to deep backward point
extra bounce form a length again. Angled across him, 139kph on a good length outside off stump. Flies over the top of Willey's bat as he looks to flay Russell through cover

short ball, Willey swats at the pull and it flies over the keeper! Don't think he got a top edge on it... nope, given as wides. Extra bounce, way over the batter's head and Jackson had no chance behind the stumps
width outside off, Willey gets up on his toes and flays him through the gap between point and short third, opening the face and playing with a straight bat
preText: Sanjeev: "Willey and Rutherford's T20 batting average is exactly the same to the 2nd decimal! INSANE.." -- Spooky!

text: on a length, slapped into the off-side ring
postText: Powerplay done. RCB will still feel in control of this game with a long batting line-up - Hasaranga is due in at No. 8 - but KKR have made a strong start with the new ball and have eight overs of high-class spin to come.

text: wide on the crease from around the wicket, turning it away from Rutherford and beating his outside edge
preText: Narine on, with the field restrictions lifted.

text: skids straight on from a good length, Rutherford punches down to long-on
preText: Slip comes in

text: cramped for room as he angles it into the left-hander. Steered to point
offbreak, punched out to deep cover for a couple with a straight bat
skids on, full and wide outside off stump. Slapped out to deep cover
full, carrom ball which angles into the left-hander. Defended into the leg side
on a length, but enough width for Willey to free his arms. Slapped away cross-batted, and it skids away through cover towards the short boundary
preText:
Ain't no party like a Varun Chakaravarthy. Spin through the middle for KKR, as we saw throughout last season. Around the wicket

Pravin: "Umesh has been a revelation this season. Can't believe he was unsold during the first round of IPL auction."

text: somehow misses everything! Fuller length, tighter line. Willey was turned into an 'S', and it turns away from the bat, past the outside edge and just about misses the top of off stump

bludgeoned over midwicket! Extra bounce from Varun, and Rutherford looked like he was cramped on the pull shot. But he got so deep in his crease that he still managed to get it away, sending it high into the night sky. 85 metres, into the stands
postText: Takes RCB past 49...

text: shows him more respect, coming forward and poking a fuller ball back to Varun's right hand
googly, nudged into the leg side. They set off for a very tight single, taking on Shreyas at short midwicket, but his bounce-throw is wide and Willey was probably in regardless
squared up again, squirts it away towards point via the shoulder of the bat as the face closes early
full, drifting in. Rutherford lunges forward, defending into the off side
full, outside off and spinning away. Steered into the covers, and they scamper through for a quick single
full and flighted, steered into the covers with an open face
extra bounce from a length, no real turn. Prodded into the covers. Willey thought about setting off for a single but Rutherford sent him back
keeps a touch low, skidding through. Willey jams down, steering into the covers
lunges forward to a good length ball, defending into the off side with a high front elbow
postText: Strategic timeout. Just one run off Narine's second over, but the required rate is still in check.

text: googly, spinning away from him and drifting across him. Dabbed into the off side and they scamper through
preText: Sam: "Rana's a better match-up than Varun to the two lefties." -- Varun continues, Shreyas on the hunt for wickets. Short midwicket in place. Over the wicket now

text: tight to the stumps, dragged down. Willey sits deep, clubbing a pull away through straight midwicket. Not right out of the middle and in the air, but largely in control, and Billings can't get round to his right
googly, full on the pads, defended cautiously

googly, ragged past the outside edge. Willey is completely foxed as he comes forward to defend and Jackson whips off the bails. Loud, lone appeal, and it's sent upstairs for the stumping. Nothing on Ultra-Edge, and his back foot never left the ground.
fired down the leg side, Willey misses out on the clip
tossed up above the eyeline, flighted, full googly. Defended into the off side
extra bounce, punched back to the bowler
