postText: Here's Shashank to see you through the rest of the chase.

text: shortish outside off, Rutherford looks to cut behind point but is beaten
preText: Narine to continue from around the wicket

text: Wiley may be in trouble trying to scamper a single. Saved by the dive in the end.. Rutherford tapped it into the off side and set off for a single. Willey responded even as the throw came in to the striker's end from cover. He dived full stretch to make it in the end.
gentle bunt into the off side for a quick single
drifts in a full delivery from wide of the crease, Rutherford plays a copy book forward defence
works it with the angle to short midwicket, a clean pick up and throw from Rana at the striker's end may have made things interesting.
postText: Willey calls for a change of gloves

wkt_text: DJ Willey c Rana b Narine 18 (42m 28b 3x4 0x6) SR: 64.28
text: he has chipped this straight to midwicket. Looking to whip it up and over but didn't get the elevation. KKR continue to chip away. Make no mistake, this ain't over yet.
bowls full on leg stump, worked to deep midwicket
sweeps this full toss to long leg, gets off the mark immediately

that's a delightful cut shot from Rutherford. Used the depth of the crease superbly to transfer weight back and crash that behind point. Russell with a dive but the body was in contact with the ropes as he tumbled over.
pats it gently with soft hands to point for a quick single

toe-ends a lofted drive to cover. Russell went for a wide yorker and executed it superbly. They scamper a run though

shortText: Russell to Shahbaz Ahmed, (no ball) 1 run
text: flayed on the up to sweeper cover. Oh, dear. Russell has overstepped. Free-hit coming up
preText: Russell from around the wicket

text: he has walloped this pull to clear deep midwicket! Brute force of Shahbaz to the fore. length ball slanting away, he trusted his strengths and swatted that away.

shortText: Russell to Shahbaz Ahmed, no run

preText: Pasan: "KKR should consider giving Chamika a chance over Billings. He has the firepower to stroke, ability to bowl a couple of overs in between and brilliant in the field." -- Yep, doesn't make much sense playing two keepers in the same XI.

text: attempts a short-arm jab but misses. Southee appeals, Jackson appeals. They thought there was a thin bottom edge on that. KKR review. Rutherford was deceived by the slower one that may have just about deviated a wee bit. Ultra edge throws up a flat line when ball passed bat. Not out it is, original decision stays
slash and a miss to this fuller delivery angling away
postText:
Ishan: "@Pasan: How about Nabi? A proper 5/6 number batsman and will give you overs to bowl." -- I reckon he could come into play in the second half of the tournament as pitches start to tire and offer more turn. That said, he's not a bad option even now.

Time out taken

text: reverse swept a tad wide of short third, quick single taken
attempts another reverse sweep, hit on the pad. Stifled appeal for lbw from KKR but this pitched way outside leg.
swing and a miss. Looking to deposit this deep over deep midwicket, hit on the pad and way outside leg,
rocks back and pulls, but can't get any power behind the stroke. Down to deep square leg
steps out, takes it on the full and swings this over midwicket. Using his long levers superbly. What a hit

text: got him! Is there life in the game yet? Shahbaz steps out to go over the top again but is deceived in flight as Jackson pulls off an excellent stumping. Shahbaz has done his job though.
heaved over the infield to wide long-on, good work in the deep.
lunges forward and defends this in drifter
preText: Karthik comes out trying to finish the game off against his former team. Must have faced Narine so many times in the nets.

text: skids one through on a length, Karthik tucks it towards deep square. There's a misfield but they don't take the second
knocks it wide of short third for an easy single
works it down to the man coming in from deep midwicket
beaten by the fizz! Rutherford looks to force this through the off side but it was a lot fuller than he anticipated
preText: Saksham: "While Shreyas did well to keep Narine for DK, there is no scoreboard pressure at all, and he can just play him out."

text: steered down to third man
bowls full but slips it down leg, DK misses a tickle. Wide called

wkt_text: SE Rutherford c †Jackson b Southee 28 (79m 40b 1x4 1x6) SR: 70.00
text: unbelievable catching from Jackson! Was going the wrong way, had to change track and then dive low to his right to complete the catch. Rutherford was looking to swing this to the leg side but ended up getting a thin inside edge. Stunning

shortText: Southee to de Silva, no run
text: tucks him with a length ball angling in, defended
preText: Wanindu walks out to much pressure

text: slapped over point! That should ease some pressure. Southee hits the hard length but ends up giving him width. Wanindu freed his arms and slashed that away

wkt_text: PWH de Silva c Russell b Southee 4 (4m 3b 1x4 0x6) SR: 133.33
text: taken by Dre Russ running back from mid-off! Wanindu looks to back away and hit on the up but gets it off the bottom part of the bat. Couldn't clear the infield. Good use of the angle from Southee, excellent catching from Russell.
punched to deep point
full on off, pushed wide of mid-off for a quick single
preText: Right, 17 off 12. KKR get DK here and the game may well be within their grasp. Russell to bowl one of them. Who bowls the other? Venky Iyer

text: both batters at one end, DK was a goner. But the throw is wayward at the striker's end and DK survives. Umesh with a throw to the wrong end. Had he lobbed the throw to Venky Iyer, Karthik would've been going back to the dressing room. He need not even have looked back. What a costly miss. Chaos. Tension. Madness. Back to the stroke, DK was looking to squeeze it behind point.
preText: Vinod says: "This is the difference between captaincy of Shreyas and Rahul. Inspiring captaincy irrespective of result. Not bowling out Chameera last night was shocking decision. "

text: cheeky for four! Harshal gets inside the line and scoops it over the keeper's head.

shortText: VR Iyer to Patel, no run
text: swing and a miss. Venky bowls this full and wide, Harshal throw the kitchen sink at it but misses

shortText: VR Iyer to Patel, no run
text: another swing and a miss. Slow off cutter dug into the stumps, Harshal has a heave at that but played too early
he has pumped this into he gap between wide long-on and deep midwicket! Another short ball dug into the pitch, Harshal backs away, holds his shape and wallops that away when it finally arrives.
pulled over deep backward square for six! Short, sitting up and DK swats that away. All the way, over the ropes. Fist bumps in the RCB camp.
preText:
Final over. Russell seems to have some discomfort in his right shoulder but has the ball in his hand. He'll bowl the final over.

Chikke: "Anyone expecting super over finish"

text: drilled back down the ground for four! Game, set and match, RCB. Jangling nerves? What's that, he asks. RCB are up and running this IPL
postText:
Thanks for joining us. It was a pleasure to have your company. Until next time, this is me Shashank Kishore signing off on behalf of Matt Roller and Venkat Raghav. Be well, stay safe.

11.20pm RCB made it tougher than they would've liked. For a moment, their faithful would've gone "here we go, again", but they found a saviours in Sherfane Rutherford, Shahbaz Ahmed, Dinesh Karthik and Harshal Patel in a small chase that was made that much more tougher. RCB specifically held back DK for a scenario like this, and it worked out in the end.

Wanindu Hasaranga is the Player of the Match for his four-for.

Abhilash: "MoM is really difficult- Harshal's twin wicket (including dre russ) maiden overs, Hasaranga's Quadra wickets, shabaz and rutherford contributions at crucial moments"

Bihag: "The number of runs Russell conceded in 2.2 overs is same as what Southee and Umesh conceded in 8 overs. "

Marten: "Shreyas's attitude and captaincy skills are refreshing. Kept a smile on despite everything. Good show overall."

Faf du Plessis: Very happy. Good win, obviously chasing small scores, you want to be positive and not leave it late, but it was good bowling from their seamers. Tonight there was seam and bounce, first night it swung a bit more. Two-three days ago, it was 200 v 200. Tonight it was 120 v 120, pretty good. In an ideal world, we would've liked to have won more convincingly but a win is a win. DK's experience helped in the end, cool-calm, runs weren't never really too far away. He's probably as cool as MS Dhoni can get in the last five overs.

Our post-match show with Chris Lynn and Wasim Jaffer is now live

Shreyas Iyer: I thought this game was exciting. Before coming in to the bowl, I told the boys this game could define our character. The way we fought reflects our mentality. Proud to have taken it till the last over. At the end, I decided to go with Venky because he has some experience bowling at the international level. Important to give confidence to the players as early as possible. Wicket was two-paced, bounce was odd. Wanindu bowled really well. We decided we'll play him as an off spinner, unfortunately didn't go to plan.

text: Test-match length from Bhuvneshwar: full and outside off, swings away further. Buttler is on the move as he hangs his bat out in the channel and is beaten
preText:
7.29pm SRH's players huddle up near the boundary. Good to see Williamson back in action after being sidelined with a long-standing elbow injury. Will Bhuvneshwar find some swing with the new ball on this greenish pitch? Buttler will open with Jaiswal for Royals. Let's go. Two slips in place

Daaniyal: "Contrary to popular opinion, I think Sunriser's batting looks stronger than before. Kane, Pooran, Markram and Samad are definitely a step over Kane, Pandey, Shankar and Jadhav in terms of power hitting and strike rotation."

Stuart: "Does it really matter who is in the line ups? Going off every game so far you win the toss, chase and win the match. Well done Kane Williamson "

KB: "@hemant. SRH has a decent batting line-up if used properly. They have a mix of anchors and power hitters be it at the top of the order or at the middle. With the addition of shepherd, they've got a good finisher too now."

Hemanth: "Sunrisers batting looks weaker than before. Really thought they would revamp and keep an eye on improving their batting stocks a bit"

Abhishek: "Seems like rajasthan only have 5 proper bowlers. Don't think parag would be a good 6th bowler so going with this team for most of the matches can be a problem. "

Vishnu: "My most memorable moment of Sanju in IPL is his clean straight drive loft over the mid off for a six of the Dale Steyn! Gee. What a shot was that! Ironically, Steyn is now the bowling coach of SRH. "

Rajasthan Royals: Yashasvi Jaiswal, Jos Buttler, Devdutt Padikkal, Sanju Samson (capt&wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, R Ashwin, Nathan Coulter-Nile, Yuzvendra Chahal, Trent Boult, Prasidh Krishna

WI and Guyana Amazon Warriors power-hitting allrounder Romario Shepherd makes his IPL debut ahead of Marco Jansen. Romario has a batting strike rate of nearly 160 in T20 cricket. He can also hit a heavy length with the ball. Watch out for him

Sunrisers Hyderabad: Abhishek Sharma, Rahul Tripathi, Kane Williamson(capt), Nicholas Pooran(wk), Aiden Markram, Abdul Samad, Washington Sundar, Romario Shepherd, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, T Natarajan, Umran Malik

Cricfan: "No disrespect to Warner, but I think KW will be able to extract more out of indian young players for SRH. Because, this is what he does consistently with NZ sides. "

7pm SRH captain Williamson wins the toss and opts to bowl first

Williamson: The grass is short and potential dew factor.... Most of the team has been there for a week or ten days. Amazing so much knowledge to tap into from Steyn, Murali, Lara. We're excited.

Samson: Seven of us are making debuts for the franchise. Our internationals are Jos, Hetmyer, Trent Boult and Coulter-Nile. We've played a lot of games in the same month of the year and there's some grass on this pitch.

Jos Buttler: Very excited for the season. The start of an IPL is always an exciting time; we're trying to gel quickly as a team. T20 is moving forward and guys are scoring quickly all around the ground. It's nice coming back to the same team and a lot of familiar faces, which helps you get settled quickly.

Shiny Side: "Marco Jansen has an economy rate in T20's of 7.75 to Romario's 11.21. Jansen also has a test bowling average of only 20.35, so he is a strike bowler."

6.55pm We're five minutes away from the toss. If you're in the USA, you can watch the game live on ESPN+.

Prithvi: "I am so looking forward to Kane mama's captaincy. He is a great captain for NZ but sometimes tries a lot of things when captaining SRH. "

kamal: "I hope Afghan pacer Fazal Haq Farooqi is given a chance in today's game. He is in such a good form! "

Surya Prakash : "This will be a test for Kane Williamson's captaincy. If he can lead this inexperienced outfit to the playoffs it will definitely speak a lot his leadership skills."

Sriram Sundar : "Given Umran Malik and Natarajan start the tournament for SRH, Will Kartik Tyagi keep out Umran or Natarajan later in the tournament?"

6.45pm After injury and Covid-19 ravaged his IPL 2021 stint, left-arm seamer T Natarajan is fit again and eager to return to action in the IPL. I recently visited his hometown Chinnappampatti, near Salem, in Tamil Nadu, to track his remarkable rise from obscurity. TCM: T Natarajan, the miracle man of Chinnappampatti. And here's a video that captures the sights and sounds of Natarajan's village, and his vision to build a fully equipped cricket ground there.

Felix: "Captain Samson to start with a bang as usual! Century on-cards :) "

Sanket: "Buttler should open with Jaiswal and DDP at 3. Yes you may feel that among them Jos is the most experienced and versatile to bat anywhere but he had great success at opening with England in recent times and on these true wickets where ball comes on to bat nicely he can be the game-changer"

Tushar: "Both the teams look fairly settled today with 10 players choosing themselves. only question is about the all rounders slot. I feel RR will go with Neesham as they want to strengthen their batting but SRH will be more inclined to go with Marco instead of Romario because traditionally SRH is strong bowling team and like to go for the kill."

Pradeep : "Can RR accommodate Karun somehow? His form looked good in Ranji and practice matches."

6.40pm In case you're into fantasy cricket, here are some tips from former India coach and our in-house expert Ravi Shastri.

Ruth: "I feel like people are being too hard on SRH. They finished last for the 1st time after qualifying for the playoffs 5 consecutive times and everybody are suddenly saying this and that"

Team previews

Can a mix of experience and youth take SRH forward? asks Shashank Kishore

Death bowling could be a worry for Rajasthan Royals, reckons Sruthi Ravindranath

Venu: "@mustafa: how could you forget warne when it comes to RR! smith ahead of warne?"

Afeef: "Gonna be interesting to see Malinga's influence on RR's bowling"

Mahesh : "RR should find a way to slot Vander Dussen. He is a very talented cricketer who can hit the ball long way" --- He's also a fine player of spin, but I'm afraid Royals may not have room to accommodate him in their XI right away. Buttler, Hetmyer and Boult are certainties in the XI. Jimmy Neesham will tussle with Nathan Coulter-Nile for the fourth overseas slot. Sreshth tells me that Rassie is unavailable anyway for RR's opener as their players will have to undergo quarantine for five days upon arrival

6.30pm If you're in the USA, you can watch the game live on ESPN+.

Got any #PoliteEnquiries for new Royal R Ashwin? (No more questions about him playing together with Jos Buttler please) And don't forget the hashtag!

Mustafa Moudi : "Though this is the 2nd season with their Respective Skippers, for me I will remember them as Warner and Smith's teams !!"

6.25pm Eight teams, including the two newbies, have been in action in IPL 2022. Now, it's time for Rajasthan Royals and Sunrisers Hyderabad to join the fun. Sunrisers finished rock bottom last season while Royals second from bottom. Sunrisers and Royals have since revamped their squads - each with obviously strengths and weak spots - as Sreshth Shah's preview points out. The chasing sides have won all fours game so far this season. Will a change of venue to the MCA stadium result in a change of fortunes or will dew continue to be a big factor? I'm Deivarayan Muthu and I'll be joined by Sreshth to bring you ball-by-ball action from Pune.
postText: Satish: "@ Abhishek - When you have 5 wicket taking bowlers, why would you even need a 6th option. That bowling looks lethal to me"

text: good length and curling away outside off, against the angle from over the wicket, left alone carefully
another lovely outswinger from Bhuvneshwar. Starts outside off and moves away further. Buttler drives away from the body and is beaten emphatically once again
inswinger from Bhuvneshwar. Swerves back in from a length, no shot. Does not threaten off stump
yorker length, jags away outside off, squeezing under Buttler's bat
preText: Free-hit ball

text: edged and taken by Samad at first slip! Another wide outswinger from Bhuvneshwar. Starts outside off and swings away even further. Buttler throws his hands at the ball and nicks it off. Ooooooh, hang on. The no-ball siren goes off at the MCA Stadium. No-ball. No part of the foot behind the line
on a length and nips back in, Buttler stabs at the ball and inside-edges it to the right of Bhuvneshwar. Eventful first over from Bhuvneshwar
he hits a heavy length outside off, angling across the left-handed Jaiswal. Swing and a miss
preText: Oh hello! Romario gets the new ball on debut

text: just short of a good length and angling across off from over the wicket, Jaiswal punches with an open face behind point
back of a length and angling into middle, the ball hits bat as opposed to bat hitting ball
postText: Paramarsha : "What a fiery over by Bhuvi despite that no-ball."

text: Buttler jumps across off and searches for the ramp. Romario follows him and Buttler ultimately cops a blow on his body. Doesn't lay bat on ball
overpitched and swinging into middle and leg, Buttler sizes it up and drives it with his wrists between mid-wicket and mid-on
Buttler hangs back for this short ball outside off. He punches it through the line and finds exra-cover
back of a length and on the hips, Jaiswal tucks a single through backward square leg
preText: RK: "Sunrises lacked proper all rounders for a long time after Moises Henriquies. Hope shepherd and sundar will turn fortunes for SRH"

text: edged and sliced past slips to deep third man. Wide outswinger, carved away by Buttler with some control
Bhuvneshwar tests Jaiswal with a lifter, sails through to Pooran, as Jaiswal is beaten on the hook
Jasiwal jumps across off. Bhuvneshwar aims for another yorker. Comes out as a low full-toss, which is squirted away fine of long leg for four
preText: Free-hit

text: Bhuvneshwar is showing his range year. He follows the bouncer with an inswinging yorker. Jaiswal brings his bat down in time and squirts it out. The no-ball siren goes off once again, taking sheen off the yorker
preText: Anand V: "Not sure about Padikkal playing in middle order instead of opening. He struggled a lot to score quickly after powerplays and also against spinners last season."

text: nice and full, slanting away outside off, carefully left alone
full and angling across off, Jaiswal reaches out and drives with a slicing finish to backward point
preText: Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo stat of the day: What are Trent Boult and Bhuvneshwar Kumar's numbers in the powerplay?
postText: Nandhana: "Am gonna wait around for our most underrated all rounder - Abhishekh Sharma. He's been around for sometime, barely gets any games, but when he does, he leaves that long lasting impact. He does very well with the new ball too, for a spinner."

text: back of a length and outside off, 143ks, Buttler uses the pace to his advantage and carves a four over backward point, gets it to the right of deep third man
preText: Umran Malik has been drafted into the attack. Over the wicket

text: Buttler jumps across off stump, 143.2ks from Malik. Works against the bowler once again. Stylishly ramped over the keeper for six

shortText: Umran Malik to Buttler, no run
text: full-toss on off, backs away and slaps it to mid-off
preText: Free-hit

shortText: Umran Malik to Buttler, (no ball) FOUR
text: Malik cranks it up to 150ks, edged and dropped at first slip. Bursts through the hands of Samad. Well, well, the no-ball siren goes off once again, this time Malik has overstepped. Shortish and zipping through outside off, takes the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat. The ball sneaks through the hands of Samad

shortText: Umran Malik to Buttler, no run
text: 146.2ks rocket from Malik, Buttler shuffles across off for another scoop, misses it this time
postText: ravi: "Dale steyn has some serious headaches regarding the no ball issue now. In limited overs these errors prove really costly."

shortText: Umran Malik to Buttler, no run
text: off-stump yorker at 144ks, jammed out to point with an open face
dug in short and wide of off. Buttler reaches out for the ball and flays it over backward point for another boundary
postText: Jeetu Sangwani: "A classic batting lesson by Buttler...respect the good bowlers and good balls...and go hard on the loose deliveries and weaker bowlers"

text: 100.4ks dart, hauled in the air to long-on, caught in the outfield, but it's off a free-hit

shortText: Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, (no ball) 1 run
text: sliding into the pads from round the wicket, 98ks, clipped away through square leg. Ooops, now Washington has overstepped
preText: Here comes Washington Sundar. He has a left-hander in Jaiswal to work with
postText: Free-hit coming up for Buttler

text: Jaiswal takes on Washington and dumps him over midwicket for a six. On a length and outside off, muscled away over the leg side. Samson applauds from the dug-out
fired into the pads, 103ks, whipped away through square leg
preText: Amiya: "When will people realise that u don't feed pace to Buttler."

text: pumped over mid-off for six. Fifty up for Royals with five overs. Washington lands it full, so that's in the slot for Buttler. Lofted away
darted into the stumps, hauled away towards long-on off the inside half
back of a length on middle, Jaiswal hangs back and tucks it through square leg. 18 runs off Washington's first over for SRH
postText: Jayant Isswani: "When would people realise that you can't give spin to Buttler!"

text: Jaiswal steps out. Stays leg-side of the ball and flays Natarajan over point for four
preText: Natarajan to bowl the last over of the powerplay

text: Jaiswal shuffles across off, Natarajan bowls into the pitch and pings the body, cramping the batter on the pull
Jaiswal stays leg-side of this short ball outside off and solidly punches it away to deep point
postText: Deepak Samson : "RR look such a strong team. It may their season this year."

text: lifter from Natarajan, bangs it outside off. Too high, so it's wide
back of a length and skids back in at off stump, no room for Buttler to free his arms, jabbed into the covers. Good ball from Natarajan
postText: Bhavin: "When will people realise, only Ashwin can get Butler out." --- I see what you did there

text: Natarajan hits a hard length once again, brings this back into Buttler, cramps him for room and hits the midriff
another hard-length inswinger from Natarajan, something that he's been working on during his time away from competitive cricket. Inside-edged onto the thigh pad
preText: Ashish Nehra: "4 no balls in 4 overs. That's crime in any format of cricket let alone T20 when you have just 20 overs. "

wkt_text: YBK Jaiswal c Markram b Shepherd 20 (33m 16b 2x4 1x6) SR: 125.00
text: Romario returns and provides SRH with the breakthrough. That's his maiden IPL wicket. Slower cutter into the pitch at 121ks, angling away from the left-handed Jaiswal. He swings into the leg side and holes out to deep square leg, where Markram, another SRH newbie, snags the catch
preText:
Double-change: Romario is back

Colonel Benny: "looking at SRH's side, what did they do at the auction? They bought back half their team from last year, and got mostly no new players in form... I looked at rr side and they look as destructive as ever, with hetmyer, boult, prasidh, ashwin, and more... There is no way srh will be even close to the top 4.."

text: jut short of a good length and slanting in at off stump, Samson aims for a pull and winds up weakly flapping the ball through square leg
preText: The time-out is over. Captain Samson has joined Buttler

text: seems like the legcutter outside off, jabbed into the off side for a single
dug in shorter and slanting into off stump, neither pullable nor cuttable length. Played back to Romario
back of a length and slanting into middle, Samson punches more or less straight to mid-on
lifter outside off, Samson withdraws from a hook
preText: Romario bowling. Pooran behind the stumps. Gives you Guyana Amazon Warriors vibes

text: forced past the bowler to long-off
preText: Abhishek comes on

text: shorter and turns away outside off, scythed away to sweeper cover, where Washington runs across to his right and stops the ball, cutting it off to a double
dragged down on middle stump, Samson rocks back and pummels a pull between deep midwicket and wide long-on
much fuller and sliding into middle, bunted along the ground between deep midwicket and wide long-on
preText: Abhilash: "KW tried to use Sundar the same way Kohli used to do"

shortText: Abhishek Sharma to Samson, no run
text: on a length and turns away slightly outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover
dragged down outside off once again, sits up to be smacked. Samson obliges, launching a six over long-off. SRH's spinners are leaking runs

wkt_text: JC Buttler c †Pooran b Umran Malik 35 (44m 28b 3x4 3x6) SR: 125.00
text: Mailk spins around and belts out a big appeal for caught behind. Umpire Oxenford turns down the appeal. Williamson challenges the on-field not-out decision. Good length and skids back in from over the wicket at 148ks. Rushes Buttler into a drive. He nicks it off to the keeper. Ultra Edge detects a spike. Oxenford reverses his decision and sends back Buttler. Strong comeback from Malik
preText:
Can Malik tighten up? He tears in from over the wicket

Hari: "Samson has been playing in some form after taking up the captaincy role. Calculated risks, not much loose shots, taking time to settle in and then blasting off, almost like R Sharma from 2013.."

text: short and outside off, 140.5ks, jabbed between point and covers
preText: Padikkal at No.4

text: short and veering down the leg side, helped away to long leg

text: overpitched and outside off, Malik gets away as Padikkal simply drives it straight to short cover
postText: Furryjester: "contrary to everyone's belief, I feel SRH has done an adequate job in the auction. They plugged their holes. Had a weak middle order so they bought poor, Markram, Shepherd, and Jansen bought Tripathi who can do the job at the top maybe not to the extent of warner. Didn't need to fill for Rashid because they trust their Indian bowling. Feel they could have bought a solid opener at least as a backup for Abhishek. "

shortText: Umran Malik to Padikkal, no run

full and wide of off, almost 148ks, Padikkal throws his bat at ball and carves it over backward point

postText: Bala: "To make the best use of their batting line-up, RR should probably start with DDP and Jos on the top with either of Sanju or Jaiswal to follow and maintain the left-right combination. That way they can torment the opposition bowlers and also create a suspicion in their bowling line and lengths with their left-right combination."

shortText: Umran Malik to Padikkal, 1 leg bye
text: Cutter into the pitch,  but it's still fairly quick at 133ks. Padikkal aims to tap it into the leg side, misses, and gets a leg-bye instead
postText: Ashish: "Malik has definitely come back stronger after his first over. I hope washy does the same. But it's looking highly unlikely that he will get another over."

text: bumper slanting down the leg side, Padikkal ducks under it. Wide called
Heaved over mid-on! Just short of a good length and outside off, sits up. Padikkal takes it from outside off and puts it over the infielder
thrashed into the sightscreen. Romario misses the yorker. Goes too full and pitches it in the slot. Padikkal holds his shape and hits it over the bowler's head
slower delivery from Romario, finishes on the pads, picked away through square leg
postText: Shankar: "All the SRH spinners are containment bowlers. They can't be your front line spinner playing in India. SRH should seriously consider playing Shreyas Gopal for Natarajan. "

text: another poor ball from Romario, with the fine leg inside the circle. Slower cutter, but strays on the hips once again, helped away past short fine leg for another four
on-pace shorter ball outside off, Padikkal leans back from a ramp but doesn't make contact
postText: Srividhya: "With DDP yet to move to full gear, the run rate is already north of 9. We should see that surge further and possibly breach 10 and beyond by the end of 20 overs. A true exhibition of fearless batting so far from RR."

text: overpitched on the stumps, Padikkal drives a single down to long-off.
postText: CricT: "@Bala the real issue here is, Jaiswal and DDP are two batters who are better off in the PP, and both are LHBs, both are young and need to be managed. Jos and Sanju can fit in anywhere, are RHBs, seniors and can strike well inside or outside PP. This is a serious headache for RR management."

text: hip-high short ball outside off, you got to get it up higher. Padikkal swivels back and hauls a pull to the midwicket fence
on a length and on middle, Padikkal stands tall and drives it down to long-on
preText: Teja: "SRH bowling looks so ordinary right now. So unlike SRH"
postText: Raghav Bansal: "@Shankar, Natarajan has been a consistent performer for SRH as well as for India but upfront and at death. He has just been a victim of tough injuries and hopefully. will come good in upcoming matches for sure."

text: too full and on the pads, duly picked up and whipped away to the midwicket boundary. Another poor ball, put away by Samson
preText: Vismay Gupta: "Umran Malik's slow ball is 133 kph !"

text: back of a length and outside off, belted through the line to the right of sweeper cover
preText: Satvik: "RR has always been good starters and MI has always been bad starters and we know the end result."
postText: Roshith : "Oh hello! Who says Padikkal can't bat in the middle order!"

shortText: Umran Malik to Padikkal, no run
text: Padikkal stands up tall to this short ball outside off and forces it to extra-cover

wkt_text: D Padikkal  b Umran Malik 41 (34m 29b 4x4 2x6) SR: 141.37
text: Pace like fire! Malik finishes his shift with the wicket of Padikkal. Nice and full, veers in from round the wicket, gathers extra pace off the deck and crashes into middle stump even before Padikkal could bring his bat down. Time for another time-out.
preText: Naren: "Romario and Malik lacking control. 2 of such bowlers would be very risky for any team"
postText: From the archive: Meet India's fastest bowler, Umran Malik

shortText: Washington Sundar to Samson, no run
text: sliding across off from round the wicket, dinked to short third man
preText: Washy gets another over

shortText: Washington Sundar to Samson, no run
text: darted across off, Samson reverse-sweeps and misses
swiped over midwicket for six. Washington tosses it up around off, Samson plants his front leg and clobbers it over the leg side
dragged down on middle, Washy keeps missing his lengths. Cops more punishment. Samson uses the depth of the crease and pulls another six over midwicket. Samson celebrates a 25-ball half-century
darted full and outside off, Samson squirts it away through point
pushed through on middle and leg, Hetmyer hangs back and clips it through midwicket. Washington has leaked 47 from his three overs on SRH debut
preText: Hetmyer is the new batter

wkt_text: SV Samson c Abdul Samad b Kumar 55 (51m 27b 3x4 5x6) SR: 203.70
text: Samad runs across to his left from long-on and takes a smart catch. Back of a length and angling into middle, no room for Samson, he aims the short straighter boundary once again, but can't clear Samad this time. Splices a pull to the outfielder
preText: Bhuvneshwar

text: just short of a good length and outside off, Parag sizes it up and punches it away to the right of sweeper cover for a first-ball four. The outfielder slies in vain
preText: Parag is the new batter

text: good length and ducks back in at off stump, steered down to deep third man
back of a length and on the stumps, whisked away wide of midwicket
preText: Sandeep J : "Should have tried Markram for an over instead of Washy.."

text: bouncer from Bhuvneshwar. Gets big on Hetmyer who seemingly looks away and hooks. Not given out caught behind. Called a wide instead. Williamson calls for a review. No spike on Ultra Edge

nip-backer from Bhuvneshwar. Fuller, starts outside off and veers in. Has Parag nicked this off? Not given out on the field once again. Another review from SRH. No bat involved. The ball brushed the pad on its way to Pooran. They check for lbw now, it would've bounced over the stumps
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, pushed back to the right of Bhuvneshwar
preText: ruchit: "Umran finished pretty well inspite of that 21 run over.. If only he realizes the merits of keeping on the fuller side than on the shorter side !"

text: full and wide of off, squeezed to sweeper cover
preText: Natarajan is back. Can he nail his yorkers on his return from injury?

text: Natarajan misses the yorker. Comes out as a low full-toss on middle. It's still a hard-to-hit low full-toss, but Parag whips it away between deep midwicket and long-on
Natarajan hits the blockhole this time, middle-stump yorker, which is jammed down the ground
attempted yorker from Natarajan. Comes out as a low full-toss outside off. Hetmyer goes low and cracks it over long-on for six
Washy's evening gets worse. He fumbles at sweeper cover, sliding to his right, and gives up four. Pitched-up delivery outside off, drilled away through the off side
postText: Raghav: "Just loving the 'see the ball hit the ball' approach from every RR batsman from word go!!"

text: mighty full and wide. Passes the tramline. Left alone by Hetmyer. Wide called
wide yorker, hauled away to deep midwicket
yorker-length delivery on leg stump, dug out to square leg
full and wide of off stump, lofted over extra-cover. Markram runs across to his left from long-off and cuts it off with a slide
banged in short and outside off, Hetmyer doesn't middle it but still clears the short straight boundary. Spliced down the ground for six
hip-high short ball outside off, slower variation. Hetmyer delays the pull and hits it to the left of long-on and right of deep midwicket
wide yorker, squeezed to extra-cover
Bhuvneshwar goes for the wide yorker once again. Hetmyer opens the bat-face and deliberately slices the ball to sweeper cover
postText: Shekhar Bandaru: "Whatever may be the target, in form Pooran is enough to blow it out. only thing is he needs stable support from other end."

text: Hetmyer pre-meditates, shuffles across off, anticipating the yorker from Natarajan. He goes low and scoops this full ball on middle over short fine leg

length ball on off and coming into him. Williamson offers almost no shot, hurried and with no foot movement. Ball hits him on his back leg, but probably too high. They did appeal, but Boult himself said its too high
preText: Hello, folks - it's a massive chase coming up, but Sunrisers have the muscle to do so. Only problem is standing their way are atleast four bowlers who are international quality. Abhishek Sharma and Kane Williamson walk out, which is a bit surprising since Rahul Tripathi was mentioned as opener in the official line-up provided. Trent Boult has the new ball. Since IPL 2020, nobody has taken more powerplay wickets than him. If you're in the USA, you can watch the game live on ESPN+.

text: fuller ball on off. This one angles across a bit and Williamson goes poking at it expecting it would come back. Past the edge.
off the mark, with Boult missing his line a bit. Length on leg, and clipped to square leg for a couple
preText: Two masterful deliveries from Boult.

text: another one that angles across. Williamson keeps the bat close to his pad, prepared for the ball coming in but knowing he's safe it it goes away from him. Again through to Samson
overpitched on off, and he presses forward to block to cover
that's the over. A terrific one barring that one ball which pitched outside leg. Length ball on off and angling across to the wicketkeeper

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: full outside off and Sharma drives, albeit with little footwork. Hit to Jaiswal at cover
preText: Here's Krishna.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: back of a length outside off and angling even further away. Sharma chooses to cut, but the ball is a tad too far away from his reach. Through to Samson, even though the umpire says not wide. Probably the right call

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run
text: back of a length on leg. Angled into his chest, and he wants to fend it, but it hits the shoulder of the bat and rolls away to third man
preText: Atif Syed: "Williamson is there to counter Boult and early swings from new ball RR bowlers. They know if they can hold early wickets they have firepower to chase this down. "

wkt_text: KS Williamson c Padikkal b Prasidh Krishna 2 (11m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 28.57
text: dropped? No, taken by first slip! Williamson stands his ground though. What will the TV umpire say? This was a length ball on off that he tried to fend, but it took the outside edge. Samson dived to his right, got a glove, but the ball popped out. Padikkal at first slip dived forward, and appeared to take a catch, but looks like he has grabbed it even though the ball was awfully close to grazing the grass. If you asked me - and I must say I am not an umpire at any level - that looked like it bounced before Padikkal took it. But the TV umpires are trained to judge calls like these, and has probably made the right call even though the eye can play some tricks sometimes

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Tripathi, no run
text: fended towards the off side

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Tripathi, no run
text: back of a length on middle. Tripathi came down the track but had to get his head away from the line since PK went short

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: full ball, moving away from the left-hander. Wants to drive, but past the edge
preText: Dimkesh: "A drop, I personally believe. To me it looked like the ball touched Paddikal's index finger and the ground at the same time." -- That looked awfully close to being given "NOT OUT", I thought. But I think the TV umpires are trained to judge calls like these, and are aware of tricks that a camera frame may play. Nonetheless, a debate point, and rightfully so.

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: full on off. Bit of movement away. Shuffles to the off side and fends

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: full on middle, and he plays it back towards Boult

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: good length ball, fourth-stump line. Bit of away movement as Sharma tries to poke at it. Beaten by the pace, and past the edge

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, 4 leg byes
text: full on middle and leg. Sharma wants to flick, but it hits his thigh and goes down the leg side for four. Samson did dive but couldn't get a hand to it

shortText: Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: that cuts through Sharma as he looks to play a mish-mash of a cut and punch. But Boult's length ball outside off jags in, and goes between the bat-body gap. A maiden over for Boult despite the four legbyes
postText: Benazir: "Decision should be reviewed by three people. One umpire can get confused or make a mistake, but a vote from the three will unlikely be a mistake or reduce it significantly. ICC can use the 4th umpire and someone else for that matter to cut cost."

wkt_text: RA Tripathi c †Samson b Prasidh Krishna 0 (8m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: former KKR bowler gets former KKR batter! Short of a length outside off. Hits the seam and moves away slightly. Tripathi wants to cut, but its got some extra bounce, and that's edged to Samson.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pooran, no run
text: good length ball angling across. Throws his bat to try and cut but the ball goes under the blade to Samson
preText: Here's Nicholas Pooran.
postText: Meanwhile in news for Indian fans, teenage archer Neeraj Chauhan qualified for the Asian Games ahead of a few big stars. During the lockdown, he had to sell vegetables with his father to support his family. This is his story about how he kept his dreams alive against all odds.

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pooran, no run
text: fuller ball, on off. Pooran offers a compact defensive shot off the front foot
preText: Manojkumar : "Hit the deck prasidh. Hit the deck. Fly to Australia with india t20 squad. "

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pooran, no run
text: good length outside off. Bit of movement away as Pooran wants to cut again. Like the ball two deliveries ago, he plays and misses
preText: Vikas: "KW is unlucky, to me it clearly bounced, even if it was close, tv umpire must have checked more angles with zoomed in camera"
postText: Asif: "I thought the umpire made the decision fairly quick. There are times when umpires takes even longer time to check for a boundary. That too, of a wicket of Williamson's caliber. "

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pooran, no run
text: fullish outside off. Angling across and he shoulders his arms

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Pooran, no run
text: maiden over to follow up a maiden over. Full outside off. Pooran gets forward to drive, but hits the inside half of the bat and rolls away to the on side
fullish on off. Stays on the back foot, closes the bat's face, and works it to square leg
full, fifth stump line. In the slot for him to try and slog, but he can't connect. Past the edge to Samson
preText: won't be surprised if Ashwin is introduced soon with two left-handers now in the middle.
postText: Rohan: "4 overs 7 runs 2 wickets. Is there even a contest now?" -- After a certain Rahul Tewatia's heroics in 2020, I truly believe anything is possible

text: full outside off stump. Another swipe to the leg side from Pooran, who has now faced six balls without scoring a run. Has missed connecting the ball on four of those occasions. Through to the keeper
another swing and a miss. Length ball around off stump, Pooran looks to pull in front of square, but again no connection
good length on middle, and angling down the leg side as he misses the attempted pull/leg-side swipe

wkt_text: N Pooran lbw b Boult 0 (8m 9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: that's plumb and Pooran's horror stay ends. Full on leg stump, and moving into middle stump. Pooran tries to have another crack at it by trying to play across the line. Misses, hits the front leg, and that is definitely crashing into middle or leg.
full on off stump. Wants to play straight but it flies off the bat's inside half and rolls away to deep backward square for four

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Abhishek Sharma, no run

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Abhishek Sharma, no run
text: full on off. Presses forward and fends it back

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Abhishek Sharma, no run

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Markram, no run

good length on middle and leg as Coulter-Nile delivers his first ball. Tapped to midwicket's left, and they pinch one as Hetmyer looks to intercept

preText: Stat alert: 14 runs is the joint lowest score by a team in the IPL. Here's a quiz question - do you know which game it's a tie with?

text: mistimed drive off the front foot to the off side
full just outside off. Bit of movement into Markram as he creams a drive to mid off
full on middle, and going down the leg side. But Samson dives to his left and grabs it before it can go for any extra
finally a convincing four from a Sunrisers batter as Markram drags a pull from outside off over the fielder at midwicket
back of a length just outside off. Nurdled to deep point for one
preText: Vishal: "14 by RR vs RCB in 2009." -- Spot on... Cape Town.

text: good length on middle stump. Nudged to the leg side
preText: Ashwin.

text: tosses it up, and fended to the off side
bit of a variation. Tries the carrom ball, on length and turning slightly away. Fended
good length on off. Backs away and clatters a cut in front of square to the infielder
good length on off. Stays on the back foot and hits a whippy shot down to long on for one
around the stumps and starts off with a full toss. Sharma drills it past Ashwin, and Parag dived at long off to stop it, but the ball dribbled under his body and hit the ropes
postText: Vinit: "This might be the right time for budding Kapil Devs to come to the front and play 175*. Sorry just saw the movie 83 yesterday."

text: too full for Markram to attempt a cut, but he gets a late dab to short third man. Think he was deceived by the release, and thought it was landing way ahead of where it actually did
preText: Chahal

wkt_text: Abhishek Sharma c Hetmyer b Chahal 9 (42m 19b 1x4 0x6) SR: 47.36
text: drilled to long on and Chahal gives a kiss towards Hetmyer as he pockets the catch. Tosses it up, took the pace off, and Sharma came skipping down to clear the boundary with a six. But he's too close to the ball at the time of contact, and cannot get his bat under it enough to get the elevation. Out for a 19-ball nine
postText: Time out. Sunrisers will now have to look at damage control, net run rate control, atleast.

text: googly from Chahal. Good length on off, and turning into middle. Squirted away to deep midwicket off the back foot
preText: Abhi: "I have to say (at least on paper) , RR team looks formidable with bowling and batting. And SRH is plagued by similar problems, no good batsmen to stay and keep the score moving along apart from KW>"

text: full on middle. Tries to whip it off his toes in front of square, but ends up playing it to square leg
full on middle. Big stride in and pushed towards long on for one

shortText: Ashwin to Abdul Samad, no run
text: full on off. Delivers from a bit wide of the crease. Defended back

full just outside off. Tapped towards short cover and they're off for one. Fielder runs across and throws it in, with Samson whipping the bails off, and Markram is in courtesy the dive. His bat was inside the crease but wasn't grounded, having bounced off the ground before the bat crossed the line
full outside off. Pushed towards cover
good length on off and going straight. Skips down the ground and punches to long on
full on off. Pushed to mid off. Yet another carrom ball
good length, just outside off. Bit slower from Ashwin. Cut to the right of point for a single
good length, outside off. Chops a cut in front of square to the man in the deep
preText: Run rate of 3.6 at the halfway stage.

wkt_text: Abdul Samad c Parag b Chahal 4 (8m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66
text: very high, but doesn't have the distance! Full just outside off stump. Turning away as he skips down the ground to try and find a big shot. Sliced it, and long on gets under it for a simple catch. Toe end of the bat, according to the replay
postText: Manu Ajmani: "What will it take for SRH to give Samad a long run as an opener? KW is the most experienced batter in this team and as captain, he should be coming in 1 down to stabilize the innings and hit it out at the back end (which he is more than capable of). They need to gamble with their batting order and hopefully they learn early this season. RR on the other hand seems to get everything right today!"

text: full just outside off stump. Swept from outside off to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump. Full face of the bat in his drive back to Yuzi

good length, on middle. Worked off the back foot to midwicket
postText: sandeep: "probably the most happiest right now would be Simon Katich. His decision is justified now" -- I don't think anyone would find joy in others' misery, although I guess he might have made a good point or two

text: tapped off the back foot to cover. Fielder can't stop it but the man in the deep runs in and keeps it down to one
fullish on off stump. Worked back to the bowler off the back foot
bit of a leading edge that goes past first slip even though Shepherd wanted to tuck one to midwicket.
full on middle and leg. Nudged to midwicket's left off the back foot
slower through the air. Full on leg. Shepherd wants to pull, and gets a glove. Ball rolls away to short fine leg
he's reduced his pace. Good length, wider outside off and turning away. Markram cuts in front of square and takes off for one

did Coulter-Nile lose the ball under the lights? He slid in to try and take a catch but think he slid too much! Good length on off, and Markram wanted to pull this off the back foot, but ended up slicing a catch towards mid off. He ran in from long off, but then that bizarre moment
smacked to long on, and enough time to come back for the second
faster ball, almost like how Shahid Afridi released his surprise delivery. A bit wide, and clattered to Boult at extra cover on the boundary line
short and wide. Stays on the back foot, and clubbed in front of square to extra cover for four
good length on off. Stays on the back foot, and drags a pull in front of square to deep midwicket
good length outside off. Backs away and pulls to cover. Direct hit from the fielder but he's safe
good length outside off. Bit of extra bounce as Markram shapes to punch. Hits the top half of the bat and rolls away to cover
preText: NCN is back.

text: good length on leg, and he swivels to try and aim for a boundary behind square. Can't connect, hits the knee roll, and the ball rolls away
good length on a fifth-stump line. Cut to deep point for a single
rolls his fingers over this ball. Full outside off, and Shepherd is through his attempted slog a tad too early. Sliced in the air, but lands between deep point and cover congregating to take a catch
back of a length on middle and leg. Swivels and makes top connection with his pull. Soars over fine leg
back to back! Same length, same treatment! Just that this went over the fielder at deep square leg who was stationed for that very shot
postText: Something for the Sunrisers fans to cheer.

text: good length on off. Skidding through. Worked off the back foot to deep square leg
slower. Length ball outside off, and the carrom ball turns slightly away. Shepherd can't cut

punched towards deep point for another one
full on middle. Shepherd moves to the off side, gets down on one knee, and tries to sweep. Gets something on it, but Krishna gets a hand to slow it down at short fine leg
preText: Kiran : "Which team have the highest win by runs in IPL?" -- This game. Here you go.

text: length ball. Another slower one from Ashwin. Shepherd waits and waits to cut, and when he has a go he fails to connect. Ashwin finishes with 0/21
postText: Faheem: "SRH has a very good team they shouldn't be too much disheartened by this performance. Actually their worst match has gotten out of the way very very early into the tournament."

text: full on middle. Quicker one, going straight through. Markram backs away to try and find the gap on the leg side but ends up hitting a shot right onto his own boot
full on middle. Comes down the ground and clubs a leg-side swipe to deep midwicket
bit of a wild hoick. Chahal goes full and wide in a bid to make Shepherd chase at it. Turns further away and he misses

wkt_text: R Shepherd  b Chahal 24 (19m 18b 0x4 2x6) SR: 133.33
text: that's No. 3! His 250th T20 scalp. The stumps are shattered, and Romario must walk after an entertaining 18-ball innings. Chahal sticks with a stump to stump line, Shepherd walks across to access the leg side behind square. Misses the slog sweep, and the zing bails have lit up. Time out

good length on off. Pulled off the back foot, along the ground, to deep midwicket. Jaiswal throws it flat from the deep, but Chahal grabs it with one hand and gets tangled up trying to release the ball. Misses the stumps, Markram surprises a run out chance
full on middle. Pushed to long on and Chahal finishes with 3/22
back of a length, outside leg stump. Sundar comfortably clips it off his waist over fine leg, using his wrists to place it finer than usual
around the stumps. Good length outside off stump. Sundar stands tall and drills a back-foot drive through cover for four more

good length on middle. Sundar is now just smacking whatever he can see. Mistimes the punchy shot after making room, and could've been out at mid off had Jaiswal run in a bit quicker. But he doesn't, the ball lands in front of him, and then goes past him for four at long off
yorker length almost. Sundar backs away and smacks it straight past the non-striker. Lot of running for Hetmyer at long on to do, but he dives to parry the ball back, saving two runs for Royals
full on leg. Sundar clears the front leg, breaks his wrists on purposes, and plays a flicky shot off his pads to deep backward square leg for four.

full toss on leg stump. Sundar once again uses his wrists to flick one behind square. Chahal is there at deep backward square for a catch, but he's run in too much! Caught in two minds, finds himself in no man's land, and Sundar survives, earns four, and dents Coulter-Nile's figures even further
postText:
Gagan Longia: "I think KW's wicket was the turning point of the innings. His wicket caused a ripple effect and hence the destruction. Had he been given not out (on the basis of benefit of doubt), present state would have been different. Can't say much about the match result though as chasing 200 is always a challenge."

Meera: "Better to open with washington sundar and keep Abhishek Sharma out for a proper batter or a proper bowler"

text: full and wide outside off. Gets low, and thrashes a sliced drive to Padikkal at deep point. He ran in to attack the ball, but it still fell short. Nonetheless he got his body behind it - a committed effort from DDP
postText: Roshith : "That's Chahal's revenge to Coulter-Nile :P"

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Washington Sundar, 1 run

yorker, almost. Square drive to deep point for one
postText: Azweer: "IPL Myth: If you loose the first game of the tournament, you get an opportunity to lift the trophy."

shortText: Prasidh Krishna to Washington Sundar, 1 run
text: yorker length, fifth stump line outside off. Sundar gets low and guides it to third man
postText: Azeez: "Washy gave 47 in 3, made sure he has someone else for company. NCN 47 in 3!!!"

text: moves to 40 with that six. Full and wide, and Markram used his bat's open face as a scoop of sorts to lift a six over extra cover
postText: Ashish : "Agree with meera, open with sundar and get in a better batsman. "

text: lucky from the batter as this is edged over the first slip fielder to third man for four. Prasidh went full and wide to make Markram reach out. Nearly had his man but as the old adage goes... when you slash it, you're better off slashing it hard
full on middle. Struck down the ground for a single
preText: Alex: "Why oh why do teams keep selection Coulter-Nile? He's uneconomical, rarely takes important wickets, and offers nothing with the bat!" -- On paper, Royals are missing a dedicated death-overs bowler. Prasidh's not known to be too successful at the death and Boult is too good at the top to not use him for three overs there

text: good length, on off stump. Takes the pace off. Drags an attempted pull to deep backward square

full on middle stump. Clears the front leg and drills it over Boult's head. Buttler straight down tries to intercept with his boot, but looks like the leg was touching the ropes. Sixth boundary or six in 12 balls
40 off 13! Full on off stump. In the slot, and Boult is punished. Sundar audaciously clears the front leg, gets super low, and then hammers it over long off
postText: Adi: "Abhishek Sharma has been sensational as an opener in domestic cricket. Cut him some slack, and watch him repay the faith in the next matches. This is SRH's strongest team, and they should be given 2-3 more chances before any change. "

text: aims for a wide yorker, and called a wide by the umpire. Sundar offered no shots

wkt_text: Washington Sundar c Hetmyer b Boult 40 (17m 14b 5x4 2x6) SR: 285.71
text: Hetmyer takes another catch and this Sundar's beautiful cameo comes to a close. Has played a big role in giving some sort of a good eventual total to Sunrisers. Another full ball, this time around middle and leg, and Sundar cannot truly get under it to clear long on
preText: The record for fastest fifty is KL Rahul's 14-ball 51.
postText:
StevO: "At least Markram, Shephard and especially Sundar saved Sunrisers from a horrific NRR start. Take some positives from the game."

Sameer: "Unpopular opinion.. Glen Phillips in place of pooran,and can open.. Or esle open with abdul samad.. Washy can handle pressure in the end of the innings better than abdul samad or Abhishek "

text: back of a length slower ball. Sundar sways away, and called a wide for height by the square umpire
good length ball on middle and leg. Tap and run to cover off the back foot
back of a length outside off. Bhuvi smacks it over the non-striker's head with the horizontal bat. Hetmyer takes a catch at long on, but it's a free-hit remember.
preText: Riyan Parag to bowl. Free hit, remember.
postText: Mas: "@Alex. They have Obed McCoy who can replace Coulter-Nile and complete that bowling attack with a potent death bowling option. "

text: waist high full toss outside off, and Coulter-Nile goes tumbling on his follow through. No ball given but uh oh, problem for Royals since Coulter-Nile gets up, holds his leg, takes his cap, and leaves the ground. How big is that injury? He does have a bad history with injuries.
preText: final over.

text: length ball on middle. Markram is cramped for space and clubs a shot off the back foot to the leg side. In the air, but falls between long on and deep midwicket
full on off. Bhuvi clears his front leg and tonks a beautiful shot to the gap at deep midwicket and long on but Padikkal runs across and intercepts before it can go for four
fifty with a boundary. Full on middle, and angling into him. Markram comes down the track, clears the front leg, closes the bat's face and finds a boundary with his flick to deep midwicket
ten rows back! Full on off and middle. Markram gets low, down on one knee, and absolutely clattered over cow corner. #FetchThat
good length, quite wide, almost on the tramline. Smacked to deep extra cover and Rajasthan Royals win by 61 runs as Sunrisers finish on 149.
postText:
That's all from us at ESPNcricinfo. That's all 10 teams done for IPL 2022's first round. Royals move to first on the points table with today's mammoth win. Tomorrow we have KKR facing RCB. Do join us then! On behalf of Chandan and Deivarayan, this is Sreshth saying ta-da!

Time for the presentation.

Winning captain AND Player of the Match Sanju Samson: "It was a very different wicket than what we thought. If you bowled Test match lengths, the wicket was helping fast bowlers. (Goals for IPL 2022) No long term goals, just want to win as much as possible and contribute to team's victory. Working on my fitness, game awareness, understanding conditions, and choosing my scoring options. Not rushing. I would like to spend lot of time in the middle knowing I can catch up anytime. (Auction strategy) Yes I had some say. Having a leader like Sanga, he gave me final option. Luckily everyone, lot of cricketing brains have worked together to get a good squad. I think every season we come with great dreams, its a franchise that takes good care of us. Our owners trust us, give us space. One game at a time."

Chris: "So by the end of the 1st round... The so called established captains lose and the young guns lift der respective teams! Coincidence? "

Prasidh Krishna (2-16): "I hit the hard lengths after seeing their bowlers. I got two slips in. When Jos got out, he said it was tough to hit off straighter lengths. Now that we've played the first match together (with Samson), we talk what is the best thing on how many overs I bowl in a spell. Boult put pressure and that helped me get wickets as well. We've had a few practice games, everybody had a good hit, good bowl - everyone has good experience and that will come to use in the future."

Losing captain Kane Williamson: "I think we started beautifully with the ball. We've seen in all games there's swing and assistance with the new ball - you have to try and make some inroads. We looked likely, but some fine margins. It was a good surface and they are a difficult team to stop. For us, we need to look at it logically and there are a number of things to improve on. That said, T20 throws some curveballs at you, got to get your chin up. (No balls from own bowlers) Its not something common to us as a side. It was a surprise. We certainly don't want to be doing that. It represents extra deliveries and when you take a wicket off it, its never nice. A number of things you can't control. (Umran Malik) Exciting, has the raw pace. He's young, got some experience last year and surely will continue to get better. We've got to side down, we've had a few days before the next game. We know the nature of T20 can be fickle. We were put under pressure in the first innings' second half, and for us as a young team we need to be nice and clear on what we want to execute. We want to learn. With the bat, it was tough - the ball moved. We threw some punches at the back end, and Rajasthan did that beautifully too."

Jay: "Interesting conundrum for MoM. My choice Prasidh Krishna, though they will give it to Sanju most likely!"

Vikas: "Importance of being 50/2 rather than 14/3 in a high scoring chase. SRH fell short only 60 and with some stability at the top, they might have even pulled this one off."

11.11pm Make a wish, Royals fans, it's 11.11. Will this be your year? Surely couldn't have wanted a more dominating performance from your team first up. Prasidh Krishna and Trent Boult did the early damage, Yuzvendra Chahal ran through the middle order, and of course the batters tonked it high and mighty today. All their key players did a solid job, and they'll hope the Coulter-Nile injury isn't too serious either. As for the Sunrisers, they should save a couple of applauses for Markram and Sundar for saving them an embarrassment of what could easily have been a defeat of 100+ runs. Also, the jinx of batting first is finally broken. Pune, the city, produces the first successful batting defense in IPL 2022.

wkt_text: KL Rahul c †Wade b Mohammed Shami 0 (3m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: big deflection and big appeal for caught behind given not out! Well, this will certainly be a memorable first ball in the history of both franchises. DRS is called for. It was on a fullish length on the fourth stump channel. Looked like a pretty obvious edge behind with Rahul prodding at this. Not sure what else it could have been. Rahul sold it well enough on field for the umpire to give it not out but the third umpire was not so forgiving. Decision overturned. Rahul out for a golden duck.
preText:
Shami has the new ball in hand, KL Rahul on strike.

Cheers Hemant. We're moments away from the first ball. Reminder, those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+.

And with that, I hand it over to Peter Della Penna for the first ten overs.

Rashid Khan: So happy to be back in India. The IPL is back in India. Most importantly, some of the crowd is also there. [When asked if he is eyeing the purple cap] It's more about what my team needs me to do, be it bowling dot balls or scoring runs. But yeah, it has been a long time since I have had the purple cap. In 2017, in my second game, I had the purple cap. I haven't had it since then. So, it will be nice.

Abhinandan : "When all the attention is on the big boys, I am exited to see Abhinav Manohar. He plays a similar role to that of SRK for his domestic side but with more gears."

Mustafa Moudi : "With Shami, Ferguson and Rashid, and support from Hardik, Varun, Tewatia and Shankar, GT bowling looks dangerous with both Quality and Quantity. It will make up for their slightly weak batting unit !!"

Prathamesh Sons: "No. 3 and 4 seem to be real weak links in GT's side considering they have to score the bulk of the runs in the innings"

Here are the XIs:

Gujarat Titans: 1 Shubman Gill, 2 Matthew Wade (wk), 3 Vijay Shankar, 4 Abhinav Manohar, 5 Hardik Pandya (capt), 6 David Miller, 7 Rahul Tewatia, 8 Rashid Khan, 9 Varun Aaron, 10 Lockie Ferguson, 11 Mohammed Shami

Lucknow Super Giants: 1 KL Rahul (capt), 2 Quinton de Kock (wk), 3 Evin Lewis, 4 Manish Pandey, 5 Deepak Hooda, 6 Krunal Pandya, 7 Mohsin Khan, 8 Ayush Badoni, 9 Dushmantha Chameera, 10 Ravi Bishnoi, 11 Avesh Khan

7.00pm Gujarat Titans have won the toss and they will bowl first. "It's the first game, we want to see how the wicket plays," Hardik says. "Also, the dew is a factor. One thing which is very clear is we are going to give all the guys full freedom, play freely and enjoy. Lockie, Wade, Rashid, and Miller are our four overseas."

"At Wankhede everyone wants to bowl first as dew plays a big part," Rahul says. "The wicket remains the same throughout. We get to set a legacy at a new franchise. Everyone comes with a fresh mindset and want to give their best. We have got three overseas players: Lewis, Quinton de Kock and Chameera."

Adarsh: "I hope Sai Kishore gets a game. I sincerely hoped he will get at least one game with CSK but the presence of Jadeja could have played a part in him not getting a game. If Sai can bowl in PP or probably with Rashid in middle overs, it will be a treat to watch! "

Pitch report: Matthew Hayden says it's a dry pitch. It has got some cracks as well. The captains would look to chase down. It's a new strip. One square boundary is just 59 metres, the other one is 70 metres.

Calvin: "I guess we'll see how far a strong bowling unit can carry a team with GT... huge imbalance between strength of bowling/batting"

Fasna: "Most has written off GT saying they have a weak squad but I consider them the dark horse this season. Their bowling unit is one of the best in the tournament and we have already seen that it is tough to win matches on these grounds if you dont have a strong bowling unit no matter how much you score. "

Abir: "I want this game to be a fair and nerve-wracking one since it is Lucknow's and Gujarat's first game in IPL!"

Ganesh kumar: "Eagerly waiting to see Hardik playing today. I hope surprises everyone with audacious hitting and superb bowling. "

6.45pm Titans went into the auction having picked Hardik Pandya, Rashid Khan and Shubman Gill, but came out with a squad that appears thin on paper. Their head coach Ashish Nehra disagrees and believes his team can be a contender: "IPL is the kind of a tournament in which from year one you can do well because everybody has the same purse." You can read Nagraj Gollapudi's interview with him here.

If you are into fantasy cricket, consistent KL Rahul and legspinners Rashid Khan and Ravi Bishnoi are must-haves. Click here for more tips.

6.35pm Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+.

Balaji: "LSG seems to be very strong side and very strong backroom staff as well. I am backing them to finish in top 4. "

6.30pm Hello and welcome to match 4 of IPL 2022. It's Gujarat Titans vs Lucknow Super Giants at the Wankhede Stadium. Two new teams but led by two old friends in Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul. Also, for the first team we will see the Pandya brothers playing against each other in the IPL.

It will be also be the first time that Rashid Khan will play for an IPL franchise other than Sunrisers Hyderabad. He has also been named Titans' vice-captain.

To know what more to expect from this game, do read Sruthi Ravindranath's preview.

text: fullish length ball on middle, flicked through square leg for one.
