shortText: Mohammed Shami to Lewis, no run
text: back of a length on the hips, goes to pull and is beaten for pace.
postText: Hashir: "My my my.. God bless all the fantasy teams. And the managers. And the inputs from analysts and experts. Pretty sure most had Rahul as Captain and he goes for a golden duck!"

shortText: Aaron to de Kock, no run
text: fullish length angled across fifth stump, miscues a drive back to Aaron.
preText: Varun Aaron to bowl over the wicket to de Kock.

text: half volley on leg stump at 132 kph, flicked wide of mid-on for one.
back of a length outside leg at 133 kph, Lewis plays the same flick pull he missed out on last over but this time gets it fine through fine leg to the rope.
full on middle, heaves for mid-on but gets this more off the inner half and it goes to deep square leg for one.
postText: Saksham: "While obviously Rahul and QDK form a devastating opening pair, I still feel Evin Lewis should open if he plays. Rahul has all the gears and can adapt to any situation that he walks in at No 3 or 4." Well, he's a de facto opener today coming in on the second ball of play.

shortText: Aaron to de Kock, no run
text: back of a length on fifth stump at 142 kph, defended into cover.
preText: Slight delay here as the ground staff runs out sawdust for the bowlers landing.

text: back of a length on fourth stump, goes to cut and bottom edges this past the stumps to fine leg for one.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to de Kock, FOUR
text: terribly sloppy from Lockie Ferguson at deep third man! Back of a length on fifth stump slashed for what should be a single but Ferguson allows three more with a fumble into the rope.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to de Kock, no run
text: good length ball on fifth stump, de Kock goes hard at this but is beaten.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to de Kock, OUT
wkt_text: Q de Kock  b Mohammed Shami 7 (17m 9b 1x4 0x6) SR: 77.77
text: Bullseye! Gem through the gate! Fullish length angled in on middle, de Kock prods at this but it tails in and splits the gap between bat and pad hitting middle stump three quarters of the way up.
good length ball on off, goes back to flick into square leg for one.
preText: Manish Pandey enters.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Lewis, no run
text: full on sixth stump at 140 kph, defended past the non-striker to mid-on.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Lewis, no run
text: good length ball on fourth stump, defended to point.
postText: Debs: "Shami should thank Lockie for the wicket"

text: short and wide, mistimes a cut into the ground in front of point, diving stop to keep it to one.
back of a length tailing down leg, diving stop to save it from being five wides.
attempted slower ball at 113 kph lands full on fourth stump, Lewis keeps the hands back late and plays an inside out square drive behind point that beats the ring fielder to the rope.

wkt_text: E Lewis c Shubman Gill b Aaron 10 (21m 9b 2x4 0x6) SR: 111.11
text: early nominee for catch of the tournament from Shubman Gill! Aaron bounces Lewis on fourth stump, who goes to pull this and top edges this over square leg. Gill tracks back 25 yards from the ring going out toward the rope, tracks it well the whole way and dives toward the rope to pull off a superlative catch. He made that look far easier than it was.
fullish length on the legs, flicked to deep fine leg for one.
full on middle, flicked wide of mid-on, matador cape effort from Hardik Pandya diving over theatrically over the top of the ball to let it go to the rope.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended behind point.
good length ball tailing down leg again for another wide.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Hooda, no run
text: good length ball on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
preText: Shami continues for a third in the Powerplay.

text: full on middle, whips this through wide mid-on for runs, sliding effort at the rope saves this from going over.

wkt_text: MK Pandey  b Mohammed Shami 6 (14m 5b 1x4 0x6) SR: 120.00
text: gem gem gem! A hat-trick of diamonds from Shami in this Powerplay! Good length ball just seams in ever so slightly from fourth stump and Pandey's lack of footwork is exposed. Pokes at this away from his body and is beaten through the gate, top of off knocked back.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Badoni, no run
text: short on fifth stump, drags a pull into the ground to mid-on.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Badoni, no run
text: back of a length on fifth stump, defended to cover.

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Badoni, no run
text: short on sixth stump at 137 kph, goes to cut and is beaten.
postText: Sneh: "Shami's performance as a bowler has been like a fine wine. Getting better with time. Not seen such a perfect seam position consistently in T20s as Shami's. These days cross seam has become a trend."

text: full on fifth stump, punched to point.
preText: Lockie Ferguson replaces Aaron.

text: good length ball on fifth stump, miscues a punch to mid-on.
back of a length on off at 145 kph, flicked through square leg for one.
postText: Karthik: "After the t20 WC, I thought Shami's white ball career was over but this splendid spell gives me hope he may well be on that flight to Australia!"

text: back of a length on fourth stump at 150 kph, defended to point.
full on middle, flicked wide of mid-on for one.
postText: Raj: "Will we see a fourth over in row from Shami?" I'd have him bowl four straight if I was the captain on field. Kill the game off now.

text: fullish length but sprayed down leg at 143 kph, diving stop to save it from being five wides.
back of a length on fourth stump, gets on his toes to defend.
good length ball shaping in a touch on fourth stump, defended to the off side.
preText: Shami won't bowl four straight. Hardik Pandya takes Shami off to bring himself on.

text: good length ball on sixth stump, opens the face to steer this to deep third man for one.
postText: Arun: "4 down with 4 overs of Rashid Khan left. Is this game over already?" A Himalayan mountain to scale for Lucknow for sure if they're going to get back into this game.

text: full on fourth stump, punched to mid-on for none.
back of a length on off stump at 137 kph, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on fifth stump seams in sharply and beats an attempted punch through cover.
back of a length on off, defended to the off side.
back of a length on off at 147 kph, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on middle, goes back to flick into the leg side for one.
bouncer on fifth stump, Hooda goes to uppercut this over third man and is beaten sharply for pace.
back of a length on off at 150 kph, flicked through midwicket for a sharp two.

nearly a wicket! Fullish length ball on middle, prods awkwardly at this and a thick edge carries low toward Tewatia at backward point but just skids off the turf in front of him and clangs off his fingers on the short hop.
slower ball at 124 kph on a good length on sixth stump, tries to punch this into the covers but mistimes this into the ground toward point and he's turned back.
short on sixth stump, goes to cut and misses.
back of a length on fifth stump, defended to cover.
postText: Lucknow going nowhere. No attacking shots played in several overs, and they're not getting singles either.

text: full on fifth stump, drives to mid-on for one.
back of a length on sixth stump, slices at this and gets a thick edge wide of backward point that beats third man (who was very fine) to the rope. First boundary outside of the Powerplay.
fullish length on fourth stump at 138 kph, punched into the ground to midwicket.
good length ball on middle and off, steered behind point with soft hands for one.
postText: Strategic timeout called. No respite after the break. Rashid Khan is being brought into the attack. Slip in place.

text: full on fourth stump, paddle sweep to fine leg for a sharp single.
googly spins in on a good length from fourth stump, goes back to flick through the leg side for one.
full on fourth stump at 95 kph, sweeps this through backward square for one.
full outside leg, flicked with ease through square leg for one.

shortText: Rashid Khan to Hooda, no run
text: full on middle and leg, paddle sweeps this to fine leg
googly lands on a good length on off and rips in, goes back and jams this out through backward square leg for one.
postText: Lucknow continue to try to dig themselves out of a hole. Does Hemant Brar own a shovel they can borrow? He's here to take over commentary.

text: Short of length outside off, Hooda stands tall and smashes it down the ground, long-on had no chance
preText: Thanks, Peter.

text: was in the air for a bit but falls well short of extra cover. Was a length ball on the stumps. Hooda gave himself room and pushed at it but was early into the shot
scythed over covers. Hardik goes full this time, just outside off. Hooda smashes it over extra cover, just evading the jumping fielder
fuller on the stumps, works it towards long-on for a single
length ball around off, drops it on the leg side and gets to the other end
short of length outside off, Hooda nails the cut but there is a sweeper out there. Just a single
preText: Tanmay : "Deepak Hooda smashing Hardik, and Krunal is clapping. Funny game!"

text: fuller outside off, sweeps it towards deep square leg

shortText: Rashid Khan to Badoni, no run
text: fuller length outside off, gets an outside edge towards short third man as he looks to work it on the leg side

a huge, huge appeal for lbw. Given not out but Titans want to review this. Fuller on the stumps, he went for the sweep and at first it looked like he missed it. But it brushed the glove and went towards short fine leg
length ball around off, turned towards midwicket. Rashid puts in the chase and even though he stumbles, that's enough to keep it to one

shortText: Rashid Khan to Badoni, no run
text: length ball around off, chopped towards slip
length ball around off, flicked wide of mid-on and they come back for the second. Good running between the wickets
short of length angling towards the batter, Hooda gives himself bit of room and opens the face of the bat to work it behind point. Rashid dives to his left but cannot get his hand to the ball
preText: Aaron is back

text: short of length on the stumps, looks like Hooda was waiting for it. Standing deep in his crease and pulls it over long leg for a six
a length ball around off, Hooda once again goes for the pull but gets an outside edge that flies to the left of third man. Shami runs across to cut it off
length outside off, Badoni too attempts the pull but is a bit hurried. The ball dribbles towards long-on
fuller around off, Hooda clears his front leg and drills it between the bowler and mid-off. The fielder had absolutely no chance to cut it off
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards short midwicket for a quick single. 17 from that over
smashed over wide long-on. Was fuller on the stumps, Hooda went for the slog sweep and cleared the boundary with easily
that's fifty for Hooda, off just 36 balls. A length ball on the stumps, sweeps it towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, flicked behind square leg

shortText: Rashid Khan to Hooda, no run
text: fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover
fuller outside off once more, swept towards deep square leg
short of length around off, goes back and punches it towards long-on
fuller around off, gets down on one knee and smashes it over deep midwicket, all the way for a six
length ball outside off, moves across and laps it over fine leg, four more, 100 comes up as well
delicate, deliberate! A length ball outside off, comes forward and opens the face of the bat to run it down between the keeper and short third man
length ball around off, tucked away towards midwicket
length ball outside off, charges down the ground and looks to smash it over the bowler's head, fails to connect
fuller outside off, throws his bat at it, it rotates in his hand as well but he has hit it behind point. A couple of bounces and over the boundary line
postText:
Meanwhile, those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+.

Our Forecaster is saying Super Giants can get to 155

Harry : "Hardik should've gone for the kill with shami in full swing when badoni walked in. 2 overs from tewatia the leggie rather than over bowling himself and Aaron. Tactical mistakes by the new skipper."

Time for a strategic timeout

shortText: Rashid Khan to Badoni, no run
text: a googly, pitched on a fuller length around off. Looks to work it on the leg side and gets hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but not given. A bit high maybe
preText: Brad: "Remember when everyone was gushing about Lucknow's top order, and said the middle order was their weakness."

shortText: Rashid Khan to Badoni, no run
text: fuller around off, pushed towards extra cover
brings out the slog sweep, it's the bigger boundary but he made a neat connection. Goes all the way for a six
another googly from Rashid. Dropped short and pulled down towards deep-backward square leg

wkt_text: DJ Hooda lbw b Rashid Khan 55 (62m 41b 6x4 2x6) SR: 134.14
text: another massive appeal for lbw from Rashid, and it went on and on like an aalaap. Given not out and Titans want to review this. Was a length ball in the line of the stumps and beat the batter on the sweep. It struck him below the knee pad and the ball-tracking shows it would have gone on to hit the middle stump

shortText: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
text: length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards extra cover
preText: Krunal now. A slip in
postText: Meenakshi : "Haha that appeal from Rashid. Hilarious!!"

text: fuller and wider outside off, opens the face of the bat to steer it towards third man. A tumbling stop by Rashid to keep it to one
preText: Ferguson

text: goes for the yorker, but just misses his mark. Ends up bowling a dipping full toss at 148.9kph. Took the batter by surprise and hit him on the bat
preText: Around the wicket

text: a slower short ball outside off, forehands it towards sweeper cover. The two fielders in the deep just slide into each other but manage to stop the ball
short of length, goes for the pull but mistimes it behind square leg
fuller around off, hits it hard towards the bowler who stops it in his follow-through
length ball around off, Badoni stands tall and smashes it over the bowler's head. One bounce and over the boundary line
fuller length outside off, looks to smash down the ground but cannot middle it. A single to long-on
preText: Shami is back

text: dropped by Lockie Ferguson. Was fuller outside off, goes aerial towards sweeper cover. It went low towards Ferguson, he got both hands to it but it popped out
a bouncer from Shami, Krunal goes for the pull, gets a top edge and it's four to fine leg
a full toss around off and Krunal punches it over the non-striker. Too straight for long-off to make the stop

a yorker from around the wicket. Krunal digs it out and calls for a single. Shami is quick to the ball and kicks it towards the stumps with his left foot. Had he hit the stumps, Badoni would have been run out. He was way, way short
another big over for Super Giants, a full toss on the pads, and Badoni clips it behind square leg
goes for the yorker but just misses his mark. Digs it out towards long-on
preText: Around the wicket

text: fuller length outside off, throws his bat at it but gets an under edge towards the keeper. Krunal wanted a single and was halfway down. The keeper lobs the ball towards Ferguson who collects and runs towards the stumps but by the time he dislodged the bails, Pandya had dived back
preText: Over the wicket to the right-hander

text: length ball around off, goes for the pull but mistimes it. Lands short of mid-off who was charging in. The fielder collects and attempts a direct hit at the bowler's end. Misses and Badoni can enjoy his luck
length outside off, pulls it in front of square leg for one
gets to his fifty in some style, 146.9kph bouncer and he simply swats it over deep midwicket
fuller outside off and this time he goes over extra cover. There is man in the deep, so it will be only a single
postText: Dimkesh: "Team batting first at the Wankhede, loses half the side within 10 overs, then explodes at the death as if on a different pitch altogether. So far a reflection of this year's opener, this match."

text: short outside off, pulled down towards deep midwicket
preText: Aaron

text: length ball on the stumps, goes for the pull and even though he didn't time it to perfection, it had enough power behind it. That it went wide of long-on did the rest; the fielder couldn't get there in time
fuller and wider outside off, throws his bat at it but cannot connect. Too wide
preText: Afeef: "Badoni really announcing himself here, making everyone sit up and take notice"

text: short of length outside off, goes for the pull again. Toe-end of the bat I think and it went behind the stumps

wkt_text: A Badoni c Pandya b Aaron 54 (78m 41b 4x4 3x6) SR: 131.70
text: fuller around off, clears his front leg and looks to go aerial but this time he got more height on it than distance and Pandya took a comfortable catch at mid-off
short of length at the batter who is standing well outside his crease. Goes for the pull but gets a top edge over the keeper's head. Fine leg cuts it off
length ball on the stumps, goes for the pull but there is n not much power behind it. A single to deep midwicket
postText:
Ayush Badoni: I wasn't even looking at the scorecard. I realised a bit late that I have reached the half-century. I was very nervous, couldn't sleep last night. But after I hit my first boundary, I felt I belong here. The wicket is good to bat on, the ball was coming onto the bat after the first six overs. I think we have got a good total and think we can defend it.

9.25pm A great recovery from Super Giants after behind reduced to 29 for 4. Shami rocked them with the new ball but Hooda and Badoni led the recovery. Hooda did most of the scoring early on. Badoni took his time but once he opened, he didn't hold back. Hooda finished with 55 off 41, Badoni 54 off 41. Super Giants finish with a much respectable 158 for 6.

shortText: Chameera to Shubman Gill, 4 leg byes
text: back of a length on the hips, late on a a flick but it comes off the thigh guard deflecting to the fine leg rope.
preText:
Lucknow take the field moments away from defending their total. Matthew Wade and Shubman Gill walk out to open for Gujarat. Dushmantha Chameera has the new ball in hand.

Reminder that if you're in the great old land of the Stars and Stripes, those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+

shortText: Chameera to Shubman Gill, no run
text: good length ball on middle, defended to the leg side.
postText: Mustafa Moudi : "Fun Fact: Wade is playjng an IPL match after 11 years. Interestingly, When he last played in IPL 2011, CSK was the defending champions, 2 New Teams joined IPL, Mega Auction just took place, RCB got an Overseas Captain while KKR bought an Ex-Delhi Captain and named him as their Captain and KKR vs CSK was the opening match of the season. All of them is true this year too !!"

wkt_text: Shubman Gill c Hooda b Chameera 0 (4m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: a charge down the track goes awry and a catch is skied to point for Hooda. Fullish length on sixth stump, tries to heave this back over the bowler's head but spoons this off the toe swirling high over the off side ring. Hooda settles under this and crouches low, reaching in front of his body to take this at knee height.
postText: So both teams lose an opener for a duck today. Vijay Shankar arrives at No. 3.

text: back of a length on off at 140 kph, defended to cover off the back foot.
back of a length sliding down leg at 145 kph, Shankar goes to flick and is late, wide called.
bouncer over middle, looked like he wanted to pull initially before aborting the attempt and turtling his head out of the way of a 141 kph delivery.
back of a length on sixth stump, goes back to punch through cover and picks the gap for two runs.
back of a length on fourth stump, tap and run into the covers for a sharp single.
preText: Avesh Khan has the new ball at the opposite end.
postText: Charlie A: "One thing I'm loving so far this season is how good the Sri Lankan players are performing this season after so many seasons of no representation. I hope we get to see more quality players from Lanka in the IPL."

text: full on fourth stump at 138 kph, goes to drive as the ball tails in, inside edge goes through fine leg for one.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Wade, 1 leg bye
text: full and swinging in sharply but pings Wade outside leg stump, he's late on a flick and there's a big lbw shout but no way is this hitting the stumps. The ball deflects off the pads through square leg for an extra.
full on fifth stump, miscues a drive wide of mid-on for one.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Wade, no run
text: short and wide at 137 kph, goes to cut and misses. Wade not happy that the ball was deemed legal on the line.
postText: Bhawesh: "Fantasy players having a rough day. Most would have picked Rahul and Gill and virtually no one the likes of Badoni".

text: inswinging yorker on leg stump at 139 kph, but Wade is even better flicking this out through square leg to the rope.

wkt_text: V Shankar  b Chameera 4 (10m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66
text: yorker at 145 kph cleans up Shankar! Chameera bounced him in the previous over and after a prolonged wait follows it up with the toe-crusher that pierces through Shankar's lame attempt to jam the bat down in time. Off stump is knocked back.
Chameera goes searching for the yorker again full at 143 kph on middle stump, but Hardik is up to the challenge and flicks this through midwicket fizzing to the rope.
preText: Hardik Pandya takes his sweet time arriving after this dismissal in dramatic fashion and needs Manish Pandey's help adjusting his chin-strap before he can face the first ball. Hooda has a helmet on fielding at short leg. Two slips in place.

text: full on fifth stump at 142 kph, punched firmly to mid-off.
postText: Samrat Ahuja: "Success Recipe for Fantasy cricket : if the player was released by RCB, pick the player!!"

text: good length ball on middle at 137 kph, gentle flick goes wide of mid-on and is chased down for two.
creative from Hardik. Bouncer on middle, ducks and tucks a short arm jab pull through backward square leg to the rope.
back of a length on off stump at 142 kph, defended to mid-off.
short and wide on sixth stump at 139 kph, goes to cut and chops this into the ground but goes wide of the field for one.
preText: Mohsin replaces Avesh.

shortText: Mohsin Khan to Pandya, no run
text: full on off at 141 kph, defended back to the bowler.
leg stump half volley at 145 kph, whipped with disdain through square leg and races to the rope.

full on fifth stump at 144 kph, driven straight to mid-off for what should be a dot but a sloppy misfield allows a single.
short and wide on seventh stump, slaps this like a scorned family member at the receiving end of a joke at an awards show through the covers to the rope.
full on middle, flicked elegantly through midwicket and skims away to the rope.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Pandya, no run
text: full on the legs, goes to flick and misses playing late with the deflection going off the pads through to de Kock.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Pandya, no run
text: full on the legs, another attempted flick and is very late on the shot. LBW shout denied. KL Rahul calls for DRS. Looked like it was always missing leg. Very optimistic from Lucknow. The contact on ball-tracker shows it was outside leg so they don't even continue on to see beyond that. Lucknow lose a review.

shortText: Avesh Khan to Pandya, no run

Finally Wade punishes the length in this over. Short on fifth stump, rocks back to punch this through the covers and sizzles to the rope.

postText: Ishaan Bazaz: "Gotta love IPL. It takes away bad blood between players. It was so nice to see Krunal celebrating with Hooda after that catch. Looking forward to seeing Ashwin and Butler together. " Perhaps we need to get Will Smith and Chris Rock into the IPL too then. They may be in their 50s, but it's never too late.

good length ball on fourth stump, defended.

postText: Ashok: "Also not to forget Warner-Bairstow who opened together for SRH after their Ashes fracas"

in the slot on the wide guidelines outside off at 139 kph, Wade shovels this over the off side beating the sweeper to the rope.

postText: Midway point of the chase. No slaps from me as I hand over commentary to Hemant Brar for the rest of the match.

wkt_text: HH Pandya c Pandey b Pandya 33 (40m 28b 5x4 1x6) SR: 117.85
text: Krunal wins the battle of the brothers. Tossed up in the line of the stumps, Hardik clears his front leg and looks to go over the bowler's head but the bat rotates in his hands and he ends up more like slicing it. Manish Pandey settles under it at long-off
preText: Thanks, Peter

text: length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards short midwicket

preText: Qaaid: "How different would this equation look if Chameera had been able to bowl his fourth over instead of Hooda bowling the 16th over? "
postText:
That's all from our side. Hope you enjoyed our coverage. See you soon.

Mohammed Shami, the Player of the Match: [On the first ball] I just wanted to bowl a good line and length. When the ball comes out of your hand well...people say it's a God gift but not exactly, I have worked on it a lot. Hardik had asked me if I wanted to bowl the fourth over, I said, no, keep one for later.

Hardik Pandya: This was a right game for us to finish on either side but I am happy that we won. When wicket assists you a little bit, Shami can really come into the game. He got us to a great start. [On batting at No. 4] I want to take some more responsibility with the bat. All the players contributed. It was quite humid as well so I didn't want to take the risk of giving Shami his fourth over on the trot. Getting out to Krunal found have pinched me more if we wouldn't have won.

Varun: "Both the newbies: Badoni and Manohar were impressive today. Was great to watch them."

Rahul Tewatia: The wicket was so good that Miller and I were discussing that we would take it deep and it's a matter of just one over. After I hit that six with the reverse sweep, that got Bishnoi thinking. Abhinav is a clear striker of the ball, so I had full trust in him that he would come and play his shots straightaway. It's a big thing to do it in your first game. I gave him the strike because I know he is a proper batter and can hit big shots. We are doing quality practice, not putting long hours. Ashish Nehra has kept the mood in the camp very light.

KL Rahul: I think it was a phenomenal game. The start wasn't ideal but the way we recovered was phenomenal. We know at the Wankhede the ball can do something initially. We couldn't have started the campaign in a better way. The win would have been great but a lot to learn from this. If anyone can exploit the pitch, it's Shami. I have played with him for three-four years the last franchise and I knew he could be dangerous. I think we gave ourselves a good chance with the ball till the 14th or 15th over. But it can be difficult with the dew. We need to go back and practise a bit more with the wet ball. Credit to Tewatia and Abhinav as well. [On Ayush Badoni] He is the baby AB for us, From the first day he was batting, it was unbelievable. He can hit the ball 360 degrees.

11.25pm Fourth time in four games the team winning the toss and opting to chase wins the match. This one, arguably, had more twists and turns. Shami bowled magnificently in the first innings before Hooda and Badoni revived Super Giants. Chasing 159, Titans were 72 for 2 in ten overs but lost Hardik and Wade in successive overs. They needed 68 from the last five overs when Hooda and Bishnoi's overs turned the complexion of the game. Tewatia and Miller started the turnaround and Manohar applied the finishing touches.

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, no run

preText:
Sandeep Sharma has the new ball. Over the wicket.

du Plessis and Rawat ready to start things.

Mojo jojo: "I predicted kuldeep being out of syllabus and dc winning but didn't get published in the comms of the other match. My prediction here is a kohli century and a big win for rcb!" --- Hurrah to the forecasting...

TOSS: Punjab Kings win toss, choose to bowl.

Punjab Kings: M Agarwal (c), S Dhawan, L Livingstone, B Rajapaksa (wk), O Smith, S Khan, R Bawa, A Singh, H Brar, S Sharma, R Chahar

RCB: F Du Plessis (c), A Rawat, D Karthik (wk), S Rutherford, V Kohli, D Willey, W Hasaranga, S Ahamad, H Patel, M Siraj, A Deep

7pm It's toss time at the DY Patil, so a few reminders before we get the ball rolling. We have Deiva Muthu and Sid Monga on the "Live Report" and if you're in the USA, you can watch the cricket LIVE by clicking here.

6.55pm We all love a good quiz contest, don't we? Well, here's Harshal Patel - last year's purple cap winner - taking a fun Q&A with ESPNcricinfo on "How well he knows his RCB team-mates." PS. After seeing his performance, I'm thinking of asking him to team up with me in the next cricket quiz that happens in Bengaluru!

Rajiv: "Unlike the SL selectors who are looking for the athletes instead of the cricketers, Punjab Kings may pick Bhanuka Rajapaksha knowing his true potential."

Noor: "This won't happen but I would love to see RCB playing David Willey at the top of the batting order. He even has a 100 while opening in T20."

6.42pm Under 20 minutes for the toss, so let's look closer at the two teams - shall we? For starters, RCB are without Maxwell and Hazlewood for now but Finn Allen and Sherfane Rutherford could provide some fireworks. They'll also be relying on Mahipal Lomror and Siddarth Kaul to bring their IPL experience. Dinesh Karthik could provide the finishing touches, Faf du Plessis - the new captain - will give the opening solidity, Wanindu Hasaranga to provide the mystery... so that leaves just one question: where will Virat Kohli bat? Well, wherever he does, Ravi Shastri on ESPNcricinfo says that "he should bat freely." More in our video preview.

For Punjab Kings, its a side that is jam-packed with solid, big hitters through the batting order (more here in our team preview) with Shikhar Dhawan, Agarwal, Liam Livingstone and Shahrukh Khan having the potential to bring out the fireworks. They'll miss Jonny Bairstow's presence, though, and Kagiso Rabada's with the ball, and their biggest challenge today will be for the slightly inexperienced bowling unit to show that they have the skills to dismantle RCB's batting. With so many unanswered questions, I wish you the best of luck in selecting your Fantasy Teams. Here's our tip anyway.

6.35pm The first game of any IPL season for a team can often have more questions than answers. With international commitments and quarantine rules aplenty, how will both sides shape up for their opener? Here's Al Muthu's preview dissecting the nitty-gritties of today's contest. Don't forget, the IPL is being covered by our Hindi desk too, so for Hindi comms, head over here.

6.30pm Hello and welcome to Round 2 of Super Sunday! We are roughly 34 kilometres away from where the afternoon IPL game is happening for game No. 3 of IPL 2022. The venue is the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai and two teams with two new captains look to start their campaigns with a W. Faf du Plessis leads Royal Challengers Bangalore, Mayank Agarwal leads Punjab Kings - is it going to be Ee Sala Cup Namde this season or will IPL 2022 belong to Sadda Punjab?
