preText: SuGP: "As a CSK fan, I'm sad for not having Faf anymore and jealous of RCB while watching this. "

shortText: Chahar to du Plessis, no run
text: play and a miss. Fullish just outside off stump. Turns away as Faf tries to drive. Past the edge, and the keeper can't hold on either. But was there an edge? Need the replay for that
around the stumps. Full outside off, and turning away with the new angle. Smacked towards deep extra cover
full on his toes around leg stump. Nurdled to deep midwicket
postText: Karthik: "Anything less than 200 isn't going to work as this Punjab is built to chase down monster scores "

text: over the stumps. Full just outside off. Caressed to long off for a single. Chahar finishes with 1 for 22
preText: Supradeep: "Cricket's James Bond at it again! What a man! Whata playa!"
postText:
Time out. ESPNcricinfo's forecaster says RCB should reach 202. At the halfway mark projected score was 163. This has been some acceleration.

The ghost: "@Karthik and others, being good on paper and actually going out and chasing a score are two different things. We have seen a lot of teams fall on that single premise over many seasons."

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, 1 run
text: full toss around off stump, and slapped to deep point for a single
preText: Ready to play. Arshdeep returns. Two overs for 12 on paper, but had conceded five wides at the top off his very first ball of IPL 2022. But he's made his name by being excellent at the death last season - leading him to be retained. How will he do now?

text: back of a length, maybe rolled his fingers over the ball. Kohli smacks a tennis-smash type shot down the ground to long on. Could've collected a wide for height if he let that go, but when the adrenaline is flowing it is hard to resist

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, SIX
text: RCB 150 in style! Arshdeep goes full, and a bit wider to make Faf reach out. But this man is in sublime form. Reaches out, and uses those muscular arms to swat a six over long off

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, 1 run
text: full, on off. Flicked towards deep midwicket. Faf wants two, but Virat says no
full toss on off stump. Waist-high, or thereabouts. Punched to long off for one
preText: Partnership of 101 in 56 balls.

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, SIX
text: seventh six of the innings for FdP! Arshdeep concedes 16. Two full tosses earlier in the over did not get punished, this time he is. Full toss around off stump. Faf uses his arm strength to loft a six with the full face of the bat over Singh's head. Long on was there, and tried to run around and put in an acrobatic dive, but all in vain
postText: Stefan: "Moment of silence for the guy who dropped Faf when his strike rate was less than 100..."

text: back of a length, quite wide outside off. Skips down the ground and flat-bats a shot to long off

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR
text: searches for the yorker, does not pitch it as full as he wanted. Ends up as a half volley, and Faf drives it well enough to get it over extra cover with the bat's open face working as a scoop of sorts
preText: Akshay: "Where is Ravi Bishnoi?" -- You'll see him tomorrow in Lucknow Super Giant colours. Sandeep Sharma is back.

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run
text: digs this yorker length ball down the ground
full on off and middle. A classical drive to long off for a single
postText: Afeef: "On paper, Faf's innings is a good one so far, but when you look at how slow he was going at the start and how he has accelerated, the appropriate term to describe this innings would be Magnificent"

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run
text: slower ball yorker, on off stump. du Plessis turns it towards short fine for one
full on middle, and he breaks his wrists to flick it smartly to the right of deep midwicket. But Smith puts in a dive and intercepts

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to du Plessis, OUT
wkt_text: F du Plessis c Shahrukh Khan b Arshdeep Singh 88 (82m 57b 3x4 7x6) SR: 154.38
text: out for double eight! Changes the angle by coming around the stumps. Not really a yorker, in the slot, but Faf's inside out loft to try and clear long off does not work out. Taken at long off #CaptainFaftastic
full toss around the stumps. On middle stump. Punched to long on
preText: DK - he is on strike due to the new IPL rules where new batters will always face the first ball (unless its the last ball of the previous over) even if batters cross while getting dismissed

text: back of a length outside off. Slower ball bouncer. VK drags a pull to the right of long on

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, no run
text: fuller ball. Karthik can't get under it, and drives it right back to the bowler. Intercepted on the followthrough

shortText: Arshdeep Singh to Karthik, no run
text: over the stumps. Short ball outside off and angling further away. DK throws his bat at this to cut behind point, but slices it instead. Falls just short of short third man
And Arshdeep finishes his last over well. Nearly ends with a wicket as this short ball is pulled by Karthik, but mistimed. Just over the square-leg fielder
preText: Ankit : "Missed a trick here RCB......should have sent Willey ahead of DK"

text: easy peasy! Full on leg and angling further down. DK could've collected the wide but why do that when the swipe can get him a six? Mowed over fine leg!
ten off two and Smith's initiation into the IPL has been quite rough. DK has been brought for this sort of innings and he's delivering it. Length ball angling in, and pulled in front of square
full on middle and leg. Karthik wants to flick but misses. Hits the boot and they scurry across for one. Looks like bat first
good length, on off stump. Pulled behind square to deep backward square leg
postText: Satvik: "To be frank, Odean bowled pretty well at the starting, had 2-3 dropped catches of his bowling so the figures aren't entirely his fault."

text: 50+ for Smith as this slower ball does not work out. Tries to go full and wide with the slower ball, but DK waited for an extra microsecond, does not commit early, and when the ball gets to him, he deposits it over Odean's head
economy of 13 for Smith on IPL debut but finishes well with a dot. Goes full outside off. DK runs across to the off side to try and play the paddle over the keeper's head but can't get any connection
digs this in, and he drags this pull to deep midwicket
preText: Final over. 11 needed for 200. RCB favourites to get there, you'd have to think. Here's Kohli, starved a bit of strike, but he wouldn't be complaining.

text: DK expected Sharma to go wide. So he walks to the off side as Sharma releases the ball. Gets close to the pitch of it, and flays it over extra cover!
there's the 200 and what an exquisite way to reach the landmark for RCB. Full around off, but he runs across to the off side and ramps it over short fine leg

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, no run
text: around the stumps. Yorker on a fifth stump line. Can't get bat on all
punchy shot first up, given width outside off and drilled to deep point
preText: 9.20pm: Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis in an animated discussion, with head coach Sanjay Bangar also in there, sporting a smile. Soon after, RCB get into a huddle at the edge of the boundary. Meanwhile, Mayank Agarwal and Shikhar Dhawan stride out to open the innings for Punjab. Mayank will be on strike. One slip. David Willey has the ball.

text: good length, swing away from the left-hander in the channel, left alone
nice shape away again, this one is on a fuller length and closer to off, goes past the outside edge as Dhawan doesn't follow it with hands but keeps bat tucked close to body
takes steps down the track, so he bangs it in short, Dhawan still laces a pull to deep square leg
sharp and short, rising into him, pings him on the glove near chest height and rolls away towards backward point
down the track again, this time the ball is fuller and he frees his arms to stroke an extra cover drive and find the boundary

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Agarwal, no run
text: length ball into him, tucked to midwicket
preText:
Siraj to share the new ball.

Kumar : "And to think RCB is adding Maxwell after two games ?? This is going to be terrific treat to watch! "

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Agarwal, no run
text: was making room to free his arms, Siraj follows him like a heat-seaking missile and the ball goes between bat and body through to the keeper

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Agarwal, no run
text: beaten. Hard length nibbling on an off stump line and nips away, Mayank left feeling for it
loses control of that, banged in too short and down leg, no chance for the keeper either. Goes for five wides

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Agarwal, no run
text: another one that jags back in at good pace on a good length, stabbed to point

launches into a drive and finds the point boundary. Was looking to go straighter, it went off the leading edge, but with the field restrictions on, it's a safe enough shot. Full ball outside off, nicely forward to it
length ball coming into him, softly dabbed to cover for a quick single

loses his radar once again, too far down leg, too much for even a diving DK to stop to his left. Another five wides. Siraj has given up 10 runs not off the bat in this over, and been threatening at all other times
fuller on the pads, clipped to midwicket in the circle
spanked over cover. Short of a length outside off, sat up, and he got hold of it well, but Willey has protection in the deep there
fullish on off, chips it over cover, not a well-timed one but that works for him as it clears the in-field but falls well short of the man in the deep
down the track, Willey sees him and bangs it in short, so he has to pull from in front of his face. Goes only till midwicket in the circle
hard length into him again, he goes for the pull, doesn't get hold of it, but clears the in-field for a single
down the track again, some shape away, bunted to cover. Willey sprints across to his right, slides and has a shy. They were taking a quick single, would have been in trouble if Willey hit
length ball into him, tucks him up, guides it to third man
preText: Rohan: "Similar start to both innings. Good amount of extras to begin with."

text: again looking for the big shot but not getting hold of it. This was full and into the pads, he wanted to pick this up over midwicket, but it plops down just past the in-field
he's finally connected with one. Too full from Siraj, allowing him to come on the front foot confidently and hit through the line to loft this over long-off

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Agarwal, no run
text: length ball into him, pushed back to the bowler
postText: This is a fascinating contest. Both Agarwal and Siraj have put in the hard yards in domestic cricket and shown they are too good for that level. They've had a lot of time with India A, but had to wait for their India chances because of the sheer level of competition.

text: wanted to bang this into a hard length, but Mayank read the length early, swiveled and transferred weight back, then pulled to deep square leg
fuller, on the front foot to tap it gently to mid-on for a quick single
stunning shot. Short ball going across him and rising up, but he's making room so he has the space to free his arms and upper cut it over point
preText: Sajid: "Both Dhawan and Agarwal are also playing for a place as an opener in the upcoming WT20. Rohit, Rahul are sure starters and then you have Ishan, Rutu and Shaw to give a stiff competition. "

text: good length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
oh that's an innovative way to get a boundary. Moved well across his stumps to a length ball, and slog-paddled it almost, to the fine leg boundary
length ball on off,  a bit late in getting bat down but manages to jam it down to the legside
stumping chance missed. Down the track, but the ball sneaks between bat and body with a bit of extra bounce. Really tough for DK, must have been unsighted by the batter
makes room and slashes this short ball over point. The last few overs have been mighty productive for Punjab
flatter and trying to keep it out of his arc, uses a flat bat to send it to mid-on
preText:
Conference between Faf, Kohli and Shahbaz - who is being given the final powerplay over. Pace hasn't worked, so here's spin.

Arun: "Agarwal vs Siraj is also a contest between friends. Agarwal is so happy in his celebrations when Siraj gets a wicket in Test cricket. That is genuine friendship"

text: down the track and over the top. Gets to the pitch of it and lifts him straight back over, the ball bounces just half a foot before the boundary

shortText: Shahbaz Ahmed to Dhawan, no run
text: valiant attempt by DK to catch that but it just eludes him. Dhawan went for the sweep, got a top edge that went to backward short leg. DK sprinted there and dived full lenth forward, but just got the tip of the glove to it. Not a chance, he created a half-chance out of nothing
sweeps again, connects better this time, single to short fine leg

shortText: Shahbaz Ahmed to Agarwal, no run
text: back of a length, punched to cover

shortText: Shahbaz Ahmed to Agarwal, no run
text: making room, he follows him, and the cut only finds point
postText:
In the USA, you can watch the match LIVE on ESPN+.

Arrow: "Is DRS available in IPL?" -- Yes it is. Each team has two unsuccessful reviews.

Time out.

shortText: Akash Deep to Dhawan, no run
text: length ball going across him, punched to point
preText: Akash Deep into the attack.

text: fuller on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
slightly short, swivels and pulls to fine leg

great job by Shahbaz at fine leg, but it's still a boundary. Dhawan whips that fine and it's travelling fast, Shahbaz raced across the turf and slid to stop it, did well to get to it at all, but there was little chance of stopping it
length ball outside off, steered to third man
postText: Shiva: "I am not just liking the new addition to cricinfo stories "Talking points" after every match , i am loving them:)))"

text: top edge but lands safe. Short ball outside off, went for the pull, climbed onto him more than he expected, and the ball balloons up over the bowler and into a vacant mid-off area

wkt_text: MA Agarwal c Shahbaz Ahmed b de Silva 32 (42m 24b 2x4 2x6) SR: 133.33
text: he's smacked a short ball straight to square leg. Hasaranga strikes with the first ball of the season, although Mayank will be filthy with himself for not getting a boundary off that long hop. Googly, but dragged short, he rocked back and smacked it but Shahbaz at square leg dives to his right and pulls off a great catch
preText:
Hasaranga into the attack.

Zeeshan: "The constant thing about Punjab is their power packed powerplay. Be it Gayle-Rahul, Rahul-Mayank, or now Mayank-Dhawan" --- well Rahul was not exactly bringing the 'power' in the powerplay.
postText: Rajapaksa is the man at No.3.

text: goes back and clips it off his pad through midwicket
preText: Abhinav: "Have been using Cricinfo for so long, but the score updation has never been this fast! Great work guys!"

text: length ball on leg stump, nudged to midwicket's left

shortText: de Silva to Rajapaksa, no run
text: googly beats him. Good length, he's left with feet static against his countryman, ends up feeling for it as he tries to steer it

shortText: de Silva to Rajapaksa, no run
text: normal legbreak, he's pinned to the crease by the trajectory which is flat, and the length which is good. Defends
slightly legside, clips it through midwicket off the back foot
down the track, he bowls it into him, ends up defending to cover
preText: Here's Harshal now.
postText: runs through the crease without delivering the ball. Probably run-up went awry

text: too full and itn ohim, clipped off his toes to deep square leg
postText: Sumith: "Hasranga has an x-factor about him. Does not look menacing but always gets wickets. "

text: he's hoicked that over deep square leg. Seemed to be tucked up while playing the pull, did it with a short-arm jab almost, and got it not off the middle, but it still carries over
tapped softly towards square leg for a single
postText: Gokul Pradeep V: "Rajapaksa should use the platform to storm his way back to the national team, we all know how talented he is !!"

text: yorker into him from around the wicket, but he's deep in his crease and flicks it off his toes through midwicket
postText: Anish: "Why was Livingstone not sent? Right hander replacing a right hander" --- maybe they feel Bhanu can deal with Hasaranga better?

text: steered to point
postText: Right, that ends my stint. Back to Sreshth.

text: full on leg stump. Skips down the ground and clatters it back towards Dhawan, who had to take evasive action. Goes to long off
they've faced each other plenty of times in the nets! Hasaranga goes for the legbreak. Full on leg stump, and he comes down the ground before depositing a six over deep midwicket
full on middle stump. Gets low and sweeps it super hard and this has been drilled through deep square leg for four more!
full on middle. Googly turning across. Mistimed drive to long on
full ball on middle and leg. Swept to fine leg for one
postText: Shabd Wahal: "Punjab I feel has been the most heart broken team. They come so so yet not finish matches on winning side. Hope it's nots the case today as usual for them."

shortText: de Silva to Rajapaksa, no run
text: full outside leg stump. Googly turning into him from outside the stumps. Wants to fend, but it hits the pad
postText: Arunabh : "Great to see Lankans back in ipl. They are going through transition but they always produced great players. "

text: full on middle and leg, but Dhawan walks across to the off side, opening his leg side, and flicks it nonchalantly to get six over fine leg
more innovation. Length ball on middle and leg. But Dhawan walks across, getting inside the ball's line, and paddles one from near his chest to fine leg
flayed and gets this drive to find the point boundary. Ball angling across Rajapaksa and he sliced that drive to play it behind square instead of in front of it

shortText: Akash Deep to Rajapaksa, no run
text: back of a length, on middle. Rajapaksa is slow to play the pull. Through to the keeper on the pounce

dropped? fell short? good stop? What happened there! Full and wide, and he sliced the drive. Ball went high towards deep point, and Harshal tried to get under it. Can't take the catch, but recovers well to stop the four with the ball dribbling towards the rope
audacious! Back of a length, aiming for his hips, and whipped over a deep backward square leg for half a dozen
around the stumps. Slower ball, good length on off. Dhawan comes down the track and tries to go leg side. Enough time to come back for two
preText: Harshal's coming back.

wkt_text: S Dhawan c Anuj Rawat b Patel 43 (63m 29b 5x4 1x6) SR: 148.27
text: soft dismissal and #PurplePatel - a nickname he got from last season - has struck. Slower ball, quite full, and Dhawan is through the drive a touch too early. Straight to cover, who takes it at knee height
postText: Faf got Harshal back for literally this sort of impact.

text: slower ball yorker attempted. Ends up as a dipping full toss. Tapped towards cover point for one
around the stumps. Fullish on off stump. Flicked off his pads towards the big gap at deep square leg for a couple
well deceived. Cutter, full, outside leg stump. Rajapaksa comes down the track to go inside out, but the ball goes between bat and body through to the keeper
back of a length outside off. Angling further away as he can't get bat on ball on this slower ball. Umpire calls a wide, and also says one for the over for height
good length outside off. Another change of pace. Rajapaksa can't cut it square. Through to the keeper
good length just outside off. Turning into him. Liam rocks back and punches to long off
preText: Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+

text: full on leg stump. Turning towards middle. Tries to fend off the back foot, but takes the outside edge and goes past off stump to short third man
m-a-s-s-i-v-e! Full on off stump. Livingstone runs down the track and golf-swings a six over the bowler's head, and maybe even out of the ground!

shortText: de Silva to Livingstone, no run

text: Hasaranga will not enjoy this! Tosses it up on leg stump. Bhanuka does a jig down the ground, and hammers it against the turn over deep midwicket. Strike-rate of 200+

full and wide. Turning further away as he offers no shot. Keeper dives to his right but can't stop it completely. Hits his glove and the ball rolls away to short third. They pinch an extra run to add salt to the wounds
full outside leg. Swept to deep backward square leg, where the ball is picked up by the sweeper fielder
postText: Johal : "When Jonny bairstow is available..I think Punjab should put choose Jonny ,rajapaksa,Liam Livingston And rabada as 4 overseas players ..and play either bawa or rishi as all arounder ..that would be 1 hell of middle order "

wkt_text: PBB Rajapaksa c Shahbaz Ahmed b Mohammed Siraj 43 (34m 22b 2x4 4x6) SR: 195.45
text: oops, that will change the forecaster as Siraj gets Rajapaksa. Length ball outside off, he goes for the cut, but can't get it over the infielder. Gobbled up by the man on the circle line
preText: Who you backing, fellow cricket fans? ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster gives Punjab Kings almost 60% chance of winning from here.
postText: Nikhil: "I am not letting go of the grunt, is it allowed?" -- If Kachra could do it, why can't Harshal? :) On a serious note, you have a good point, but I'm sure that the umpire would've intervened if it wasn't allowed. Also, I doubt the batter can hear it with the noise out there. We can hear it due to the stump mic at the bowler's end.

wkt_text: RA Bawa lbw b Mohammed Siraj 0 (3m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
text: heartbreaking start for the 2022 U-19 World Cup final's player of the match! Out for a first ball duck. Gets a full toss on leg stump. Bawa is surprised as he tries the flick. Misses the shot, hits the pad, and the umpire raises his finger. Don't bother reviewing that, young man. You'll have your day to shine on another occasion

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run
text: good length on off. Punched to the vacant mid on region for one
postText: Malli: "I feel so sorry for Raj Bawa, he doesn't get to bowl a ball and gets out on first ball"

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Shahrukh Khan, 1 wide
text: full on leg stump. Siraj's plan is to cramp Shahrukh from freeing his arms. But this goes down the leg side again as he misses the flick

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Shahrukh Khan, 1 wide
text: back of a length on middle. SRK tries to pull. Ball goes down the leg side though, and that's a wide
preText: SRK time. Can Siraj get a hat-trick?

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Livingstone, no run
text: tries for the yorker, ends up near his toes. Wants to flick it square, but hits the boot en route to the keeper
preText: Ashish: "Unhappy for Bawa. He was such a star for Indian U19. But then it's just a start for him. He has plenty of years to come. Among the big boys it will take some time to come to that level. "

text: back of a length outside off. Worked from near his chest to midwicket for one
postText: Ashish: "Siraj was much quicker than what Bawa was used to playing at U19. And in a match situation it feels extra fast when you are on debut. Bawa should just throw these out of his mind. I am sure he will be a star for his franchise and probably for India in the future."

text: knuckleball, full, but too wide outside off stump

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run
text: end of a nine-ball over as Shahrukh tries to play a straight drive, but an inside edge takes it to short fine leg
postText:
Final time out of the night.

BK: "Today is a cricket day, 1st match IND-W loosing to SA-W in a nail biting last ball finish, 2nd match DC stunning MI with a lower order clinical performance, and now PBKS and RCB locking horns displaying some classic cricket. a wonderfull day indeed!!" -- Throw in West Indies beating England

shortText: Akash Deep to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run
text: Akash Deep is back. Starts off with a full ball outside off stump. Driven to long off, but timing is not 100%
preText: Chotu: "BTW the bowler in Lagaan was Goli (seamer who bowls with a grunt) not Kachra (the spinner).." -- sorry for that! I will pay a fine (three times the amount)

text: short and wide. Slapped in front of square, past the diving cover fielder. Man in the deep cleans up as LL comes back for the second
preText: Manu Ajmani: "With Livingstone at the crease, Punjab still ahead of RCb at the moment. Shahrukh can hit it out of the park too. I would be worried if I were Faf. Harshal has 2 overs but we all remember the Jadeja massacre last season. My bet is still on Punjab unless Faf can pull out another trick from his captaincy hat. Still feels weird not seeing King as captain!"

text: briLLiant from Liam Livingstone! Akash goes in the slot on off, and he uses the bottom hand so well to club a six over the bowler's head. Strong wrists
top shot, top fielding by Rawat! Clubbed by Livingstone in front of square on the off side. Rawat runs to his right from deep cover and gets low to parry the ball back

wkt_text: LS Livingstone c Anuj Rawat b Akash Deep 19 (26m 10b 0x4 2x6) SR: 190.00
text: another stunning effort from Rawat as Deep gets the dangerous Livingstone. Full ball, wide outside off. Livingstone tried to flay it over the off side. Wanted to play it over cover point, but gets it to deep extra cover instead. Rawat - usually a keeper - runs in, and then dives forward to take a low catch. Did well to ensure the ball didn't pop out once the elbows his the floor

shortText: Akash Deep to Smith, no run
text: full toss, wider outside off. Bunted towards cover, but straight to the fielder there

shortText: de Silva to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: good length outside off. Googly turning in. Cut a bit uncomfortably
preText: Malli: "Odean Smith is either hit or bust, you don't find in between. Let's see what we have today from him" -- and Faf wants wickets. Hasaranga is back

shortText: de Silva to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full on off. Big stride forward and blocked away

shortText: de Silva to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full just outside off. Shahrukh is careful to not throw his wicket away to Hasaranga. Defended back, rather tentatively

shortText: de Silva to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: good length outside off. Googly turning in as he hops backwards while trying to cut. To point

shortText: de Silva to Shahrukh Khan, SIX
text: there's the release shot! Full outside off stump. Bit more room for him to free his arms as Hasaranga offers a l'il bit of extra width. Smacked over his head

shortText: de Silva to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full on off stump. Defended back to the bowler
full slow ball around off stump. Tapped towards cover and off they go for one

shortText: Patel to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full toss outside off. Shahrukh could've swatted it away #BaseballStyle but can't connect at all. On the bounce to the keeper
preText: Shahrukh is aware that Harshal will either try to cramp him or bowl super wide

text: wide yorker, and Shahrukh offers no shot. Way outside the tram-lines so he'll have to reload
full and wide outside off. Gets low and drills a drive to deep extra cover
took a great catch few overs ago, drops the easier catch this time and Smith gets a second life. Good length outside off, and clubbed to deep extra cover. Rawat is under it, but the ball pops out!
postText: Is it the dew that forced the drop?

shortText: Patel to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full toss outside off stump. Bunted towards cover and Smith is off for a single. Shahrukh says 'no' and Smith has to turn. Siraj throws a gentle one to Harshal and Harshal himself is quite slow to whip the bails off. Smith successfully dives back before Harshal does the deed
full and wide outside off. Smacked to the left of long off for two more
flayed! Siraj gives length outside off. Smith backs away, allowing him to free his arms. Smacked over deep point for six
preText: 18 balls. 36 runs.
postText: Kumar : "That must be the most slow motion run out attempt ever. Slow throw and an artificial pause to and slowmo whip of the bail. What happened there ?" -- I think Harshal thought he had more time, and that Smith wasn't trying to return.

text: gets one away! Fast ball on middle, but Smith shuffles and scurries it past short fine leg for four!
full and wide outside off stump. Slower ball

Smith is punishing Siraj-Harshal for that missed run out and the RCB camp in the stands has gone ultra silent. Slower ball, back of a length outside off. Smith waits for it before swatting a six over deep extra cover
back of a length outside off. Flat-batted down the ground to long on for one

shortText: Mohammed Siraj to Shahrukh Khan, 1 leg bye
text: full on middle and leg. Tries to swipe across the line, but misses. Hits the pad and rolls away as they pinch a run.

the extra ball is punished and Siraj finishes on 2-59. Back of a length outside off, and Smith stays on the back foot before smacking a straight six by hitting a shot from over his head! Jo Wilfried Tsonga - the hardest overhead smasher of the tennis ball - would be proud of how Smith executed that!
full just outside off stump. Wants to work it leg side but outside edge takes it to deep point. Big gap there allows them to come back for two

shortText: Patel to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: short ball, the quicker ball. Shahrukh swivels to pull but can't get any connection
trying the wide yorker, but Shahrukh is happy to let it go.
up and over! Tries the cutter to take pace off. Shahrukh expected that. Didn't commit early, and lofted that slot delivery over Harshal's head for six
postText: Vivek: "Smith made sure he is not the one going back with highest economy in this match."

shortText: Patel to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: full toss outside off stump. Tries to play an off-side shot but can't connect

shortText: Patel to Shahrukh Khan, no run
text: yorker length, full pace. Dug out back to Harshal
fuller on off, gently driven to mid-off
preText:
3.27pm: Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan punch gloves and stride onto the ground. The Delhi Capitals players already milling about. Shardul Thakur has the ball. Two slips.

Those of you in the US can watch the action live on ESPN+

Muhammed Riyas: "Really looking at Anmolpreet, has been around for a while with MI now. Hasn't got many chances, but heard he has got so much potential. Remember him hitting a six of the first ever ball he faced in IPL. There should be a fair reason for MI to retain him!" --- been a consistent domestic performer too.

Husain Malvi: "Is this the first time a team is playing only 2 foreigners in their lineup" -- Hemant tells me, this is not the first time. Of course, Delhi's hand is forced by unavailability. Otherwise, the likes of David Warner and Anrich Nortje would certainly be in the XI.

Delhi Capitals: 1 Prithvi Shaw, 2 Tim Seifert, 3 Mandeep Singh, 4 Rishabh Pant (capt, wk), 5 Rovman Powell, 6 Lalit Yadav, 7 Axar Patel, 8 Shardul Thakur, 9 Kuldeep Yadav, 10 Khaleel Ahmed, 11 Kamlesh Nagarkoti

Mumbai Indians: 1 Ishan Kishan (wk), 2 Rohit Sharma (capt), 3 Tilak Varma, 4 Anmolpreet Singh, 5 Kieron Pollard, 6 Tim David, 7 Daniel Sams, 8 M Ashwin, 9 Tymal Mills, 10 Jasprit Bumrah 11 Basil Thampi

3.00pm: Delhi Capitals win the toss and chose to bowl.

Rishabh Pant: Very excited. The first thing we decided is we wanted to win the toss and we got it. The pitch looks fresh.

Rohit Sharma: We would have bowled first as well. Fresh pitch, we don't know what really to expect. Nonetheless, the wicket looks like a good batting track. There will be initial movement because of a slight green tinge on it. When you play in Mumbai, you have to adapt as quickly as possible. We look forward to coming back to Mumbai, the crowds come out in large numbers. Obviously some restrictions in terms of capacity but good to see crowds.

Jais: "MI looks lethal even in the absence of Archer. The only concern is injury. Rohit, Mills and Meredith don't have great fitness history behind them. "

Hari: "Is Sanjay Yaday "the other one" ?" --- I think it was him, but can't be sure, Hari.

Prasana: "Hasn't IPL history not shown that the most expensive players are always a bust? Yuvi, Stokes, Morris etc.etc. I wonder why they continue to follow that all-eggs-in-one-basket strategy?" --- IPL history also has Glenn Maxwell, who was bought for huge money last year and did fantastically for RCB.

Thanks Himanshu. High voltage clash coming up. There were five caps that DC handed out from what I saw. Not fully sure who the five are. Mumbai Indians handing caps to Tilak Varma, Tim David, Tymal Mills, Riley Meredith Daniel Sams, M Ashwin and one other.

2.50pm Ten minutes to the toss, and here comes Saurabh to toss the coin soon. Let him know what XIs you see the teams fielding today.

Afeef: "Here's something I realized: Out of the 14 completed seasons so far, Malinga played a match in 9 of those seasons, out of which MI qualified for the play-offs 8 times and missed out once"

Mohd Hamed: "@mustafa- Ishan was the captain for U19 World cup so he can also be potential captain if he performs consistently." --- But he first needs to really cement his status as a certain starter in India's XI. Plus, he is more of a limited-overs player now.

2.40pm It's not long before the toss takes place. So why not firm up your fantasy sides quickly? We are backing Pant and Kishan to score big. However, our in-house experts Sam Curran and Ravi Shastri feel Suryakumar's absence will be huge.

Farhan: "@Mustafa - Ishan wasn't retained. He was BOUGHT for a hefty price at the auction"

As Sruthi Ravindranath's preview mentions, Mumbai may be the five-time champions, but Capitals have been the team to beat in the last couple of years.

Mustafa Moudi : "Excited for the Pant Vs Ishan Battle. Both the players have been Retained by their Respective Teams for hefty paychecks. Though Pant is frontrunner in Indian T20I setup as he Rahul-Rohit are already established openers plus Pant gives a Captaincy Option too, Ishan can prove his case with Extra Ordinary Performance this season!!"

2.30pm Rohit Sharma vs Rishabh Pant. Current India captain vs potential future India captain; at least Ricky Ponting thinks so. Both sides have to deal with some issues: no Suryakumar Yadav for one, and many overseas absentees for the other. This is Himanshu taking things off on the second day of IPL 2022, with Saurabh set to join me soon.

text: back ofa  length, Rohit stays back and punches to midwicket's left. They think about a single but there isn't one there
postText: second slip goes out.

text: and he strays on the pads, Rohit flicks off the thigh pad to the vacant fine leg region and gets runs on the board with a boundary
a bit too full, on the front foot to clip it, but can't beat midwicket in the circle
short and wide outside off, Rohit eases into the cut, but can't beat point
postText: Fasna: "Just noticed that Sams, Mills, Tim and Ashwin played for RCB. They didn't have good time playing for them. "

text: over the top and clears wide long-off. Rohit launched into a full ball outside off with a full-blooded lofted drive, didn't time it perfectly but hit it hard enough to carry over the ropes. A safe shot anyway because no fielder there
bangs it in short of a length and rises to Ishan's mid-riff, he fends it down awkawrdly towards mid-on
preText:
Khaleel Ahmed.

Sheldon: "How will Mumbai do without the Pandya brothers around Pollard in the middle order will be the real question" --- Tim David is an able replacement I'd think.

text: short on off, Rohit went to pull but this came onto him slower, perhaps held in the pitch a bit. Got the toe-end of the bat and the ball trickled back down the pitch
beaten outside off. Good left-armer's angle going across Rohit from back of a length, who looks to steer it to third man but can't connect
full outside off, eases into the extra cover drive, to the left of the fielder in the circle. He's got enough time to run to his left and field it
imperious. Full outside off, he goes down on one knee and unfurls a regal cover drive that screams along the turf to the boundary

shortText: Ahmed to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: length outside off, punched to point
full on off, bit of shape into the right-hander, clipped to wide mid-on
preText: Kritesh: "Really really excited to see Tim David bat... "

shortText: Thakur to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: back of a length dug into the pitch, tapped down to the bowler's left
length ball on leg stump, tucked to midwicket's left in the circle
back of a length outside off, gently steered to third man

shortText: Thakur to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: down the track, Shardul saw hiim coming and shortened the length and kept it at him to deny room, Ishan ends up bunting it back towards the bowler

he's chopped it over third man. Short ball outside off, and he climbs into that - given the room to free his arms and not pacy enough to trouble him while doing so. Hits it hard enough that it sails over the boundary
slightly short, Rohit rocks back and whips it to deep midwicket
preText: First sign of spin. Axar inside the powerplay.
postText: favourable match-up for Mumbai now with left-hander to left-arm spinner. Rohit did well to get a single first ball

text: lays into a sweep that travels along the ground through midwicket, got it off the toe-end only. In the gap though, so they get two

shortText: Patel to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: quicker on off, jabbed to cover

shortText: Patel to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: shorter outside off, was looking to come forward, transfers weight back and strokes it to cover
leading edge but it goes for four. He was early into the attempted flick, uses his wrists to whip it, gets a leading edge that clears the bowler and runs into the straight boundary

shortText: Patel to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: length outside off, punched to mid-off from the back foot
and inauspicious start by him but you can't do much against Rohit's timing. Given room outside off and he steers a cut expertly to beat short third man
preText: And double change. Here's Kamlesh Nagarkoti. First game for Delhi after three injury-hit seasons for KKR. Plenty of promise.
postText: dipen chheda: "In T20s since 2020, Ishan Kishan plays with a strike rate of 147.9 against pace as compared to 118.1 against spin." -- I bet you used, AskCricinfo for that!

text: he's looking to put the young man under early pressure. Slightly short of a length and he goes for the pull, has a big swat at it but no timing and can't beat midwicket in the circle
boom. Initiation by fire for Nagarkoti. Strays down legside with a short ball, Rohit swivels and unleashes one of his famous pulls on it, sends it soaring over fine leg
good length coming into him, defended
short and wide outside off again, too wide for Rohit to touch. Wide.
delicately done. Room outside off again and he late cuts it fine, but there's a third man in place and he's fine enough to cut it off

and now Ishan gets in on the action. Short and wide again, going away from the left-hander this time, he climbs into a fierce cut that he doesn't bother to keep down, flies over point and into the boundary
good bowling, back of a length going across him and surprised him with the bounce, Rohit had to drop his wrists after he was shaping to cut it
preText: Pant goes back to Khaleel after that potentially momentum-shifting over.

text: keeps it on a good length going across him, this one is closer to off stump and not as short as the first ball, has Rohit feeling for the ball outside off. Beaten
postText: Khaleel pulls out of his run-up. Something seemed to have distracted him maybe? all sorted.

text: keeps it on off on a good length, Rohit defends with a slightly limp bat and the ball trickles down near boot
almost picked out short fine leg. Rohit moved across, looking to improvise after three dots, was looking to paddle it. that's actually a drop. It went straight to Shardul.
Rohit steps out and decimates the ball to the extra cover boundary. Absolutely dismissive batting, almost asserting who the boss is after three dot balls and a drop. Stepped out and thrashed it
length ball outside off, steered to third man
postText:
Elsewhere, PV Sindhu has begun a double final day for India at the Swiss Open. She takes on Busanan Ongbamrungphan followed by HS Prannoy vs Jonatan Christie. Follow along on ESPN's Live blog for the two finals.

Time-out.

text: length ball outside off, punched to long-off
preText: Kuldeep Yadav to start after the powerplay. Another new cap for DC.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: flattish on middle and leg, on the front foot to work it through square leg

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Sharma, no run
text: down the track, pulled the length, he ends up defending
little more air, Rohit clears his front leg and drills it to long-off, but the man cuts it off to his right

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: good length outside off, Ishan beaten in length had to end up getting hands to hit after having taken a stride out. Defended into the offside

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: excellent start from Kuldeep. Keeps this on the stumps and quicker, Ishan defends
darted into him, works it forward of square. Mix up between the batters with Rohit wanting two initially then sending Ishan back, but a mis-field means they are not in danger
preText: Pallavi George: "How are we all feeling about India being knocked out of the Group Stages of the Women's World Cup? " --- It's a game. Someone qualifies, someone doesn't.

text: excellent from Mandeep at deep mdiwicket. Kishan danced down and belted this to deep mdiwicket, Mandeep ran to his left and jumped to pat the ball in
gets down to paddle it fine, short fine leg in place so just one
fuller outside off, on the front foot to drive to long-off

shot. He cut that from so close to the stumps, and stayed not only perfectly balanced but also got perfect timing and placement on it. Not much wrong with the ball, just Rohit being too good on that occasion.
pulls the length shorter, and I think Rohit was expecting that, went down to slog sweep but gets it off the bottom edge to run to short fine leg for a single
went for the reverse sweep, doesn't really connect, maybe just a thin glove. Went through Pant's legs for runs
postText: Virat: "@Pallavi we have switched to IPL matches!"

wkt_text: RG Sharma c Powell b Kuldeep Yadav 41 (42m 32b 4x4 2x6) SR: 128.12
text: he's picked out deep midwicket. Kuldeep took the pace off, Rohit had to create his own power in trying to pull this short of length ball. Didn't get it right off the middle, and Rovman Powell gleefully takes it. Important strike for Kuldeep.
postText: Anmolpreet Singh is the new man in. Rohit and Ishan have laid a sound platform. As per the new rules, he'll be on strike regardless of whether the batters crossed.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Anmolpreet Singh, no run
text: given some air outside off, on the front foot to drive to cover

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run
text: he went airborne at that, but only got fingertips to it. Beaten him in flight an the leading edge flies to Kuldeep's left. He makes a goalkeeper like dive for it but can't get to it. Harsh to call it a drop.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: on the front foot to work it through square

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Anmolpreet Singh, no run
text: comprehensively beaten by the wrong un. Anmolpreet had no clue about that, nicely flighted, spun from leg to off and the batter was left standing and poking
full toss, smacked to long-on
makes room and goes inside out over cover, bit of a leading edge on that but not entirely out of control
too short outside off, and Kishan rocks back to cut it fiercely through point to find a much-needed boundary for Mumbai after a period of lull
flatter and quicker, goes back and punches to long-on
good work by the man at deep midwicket. Anmolpreet danced down the track and flicked it nicely through midwicket, but the fielder there dived to his left and stopped it.
shorter, goes back and cuts through point
postText: That's me done with my first stint. Here's Himanshu back.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run
text: goes to sweep this full delivery outside off. Single to fine leg
preText: Thanks Saurabh. Kuldeep will continue from over the wicket.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: skip down early, as Kuldeep goes pretty full on middle and off. Whipped to deep midwicket
preText: Stays over the stumps to the left-hander

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Anmolpreet Singh, 2 runs
text: Good running. Fullish ball on middle, and turning into him. He clips toward midwicket after a step back in the crease

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Anmolpreet Singh, OUT
wkt_text: Anmolpreet Singh c Lalit Yadav b Kuldeep Yadav 8 (10m 9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 88.88
text: lofts that down the ground, and finds long-off! Kuldeep strikes again. Tosses this ball up, and bowls full and outside off. Lalit Yadav at long-off has to run in a few steps before grabbing the ball. Anmolpreet goes aerial as he presents the full face of the bat, but ends up skying that right into the breadbasket of the man in the deep. Kuldeep right into the action here

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: shortish ball on middle, and goes on with the arm. He clears his front leg, and pulls to fine leg to get off the mark
preText: Tilak in at No. 4. Kuldeep from over the wicket.

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: fuller ball on middle. He closes the bat face to flick toward midwicket, as the bowler gives the chase

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: good length ball on middle and leg. He clips this deep square leg from deep in the crease
preText:
Lalit Yadav from the other end. Around the wicket.

Samriddhi: "Kuldeep coming back to form is good for India. Ponting effect"

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: bowls short on leg, and that is pulled commandingly to fine leg, where the man runs to his left and slides to cut that off

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: continues bowling short, but this is on middle and off. Pulled away to deep midwicket
postText: SB: "(c) yadav (b) yadav :)"

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Tilak Varma, 2 runs
text: this is a lot fuller on middle. He is down the pitch to whip that lowish full toss. There is a a misfield at long-on, who runs to his left, and that allows another run. The fielder there slipped

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Tilak Varma, no run
text: full ball on middle and off, and tucked toward cover

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: tossed up ball on middle, and it is a full toss too. Dragged to long-on

shortText: Nagarkoti to Tilak Varma, no run
text: bowls a yorker length ball a little wide of off. Tilak has a jam at that, but is beaten
preText: Nagarkoti replaces Kuldeep. Over the wicket.
postText: Sibi: "Return of the Yadav's. It was Umesh last night and Kuldip today." --- Well, there is a Kuldip, and then there is Kuldeep.

shortText: Nagarkoti to Tilak Varma, no run
text: slashes that back of a length ball outside off, but finds point. The sound off the bat was pleasing, but it didn't find the gap

crunches a pull wide of long-on! Short of a length ball just outside off, as it angles away after pitching on middle and off. Tilak has a full and free swing of the arms to dispatch that near deep midwicket

gorgeously lofted over the bowler's head! Presents the full face of the bat to this overpitched ball on off, which is bowled with a scrambled seam. Tilak hangs back in the crease, and gently sends that over mid-off
back of a length ball on middle, and this is a tighter length. A hint of movement away after pitching, as it is clipped toward midwicket from deep in the crease

drags that for four to deep extra cover! Three boundaries in the over now. The ball was too full and a touch wide of off, as Kishan went down on his knees to drag that rapidly between mid-off and cover
preText: Stays over the wicket to Kishan

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: loopy ball and pretty full leg. Pushed to long-on after getting his front leg out of the way
postText: Sriram Sundar: "Was there a bit of Hardik Pandya in that Tilak pull?" --- Yup, a left-hand one of course.

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: pulls his length back a touch to go full on off. He closes the bat face to clip to short fine leg

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: makes room, and slog-sweeps to deep midwicket on the bounce. Full ball on leg, and sends that aerially

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Tilak Varma, 2 runs
text: short of a length ball on middle and leg, and pulled to deep midwicket. Good stop diving to his right there

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Tilak Varma, 1 run
text: fullish ball outside leg, as he follows the batter, who makes room to go outside leg. Clipped to short fine leg

shortText: Lalit Yadav to Ishan Kishan, FOUR
text: crashed down the ground! It was a full toss on middle and leg, as Kishan gave himself room again and thrashed that to just beat long-on to his right. Four more, as Mumbai keep pressing the accelerator
preText: Nandhana: "Would've loved to see Yash Dhull play today, especially after that staggering Ranji season and U19 World cup."

text: swung away over short fine leg! Pitches it on a good length and wide of off, as he goes across off to send that whipping away for four more
preText:
Khaleel back from over the wicket.

Our forecaster says Mumbai can get to 172 from here. What do you think?

Vinod Rajpal: "Now is the time Mumbai would love to have David and Pollard come out to the crease and brutalise the bowling."

wkt_text: NT Tilak Varma c Shaw b Ahmed 22 (18m 15b 3x4 0x6) SR: 146.66
text: taken at third man! Tilak's fun is over, though that was a useful cameo. Backed away early to go outside leg, as Khaleel banged the ball in short and outside off. There was some extra bounce available on that occasion, as Tilak was ready to upper cut that already. But he found Shaw, who was placed a few steps into the fence. He went low, and tumbled to complete the take
sharp short ball there! Pitches it on a short of a length on middle, as Pollard sways out of the way
preText:
In comes Pollard. Where can he take Mumbai? Khaleel stays over the wicket to the right-hander.

Vinay: "With Ishan on the crease, 180 is minimum possible score"

text: short of a good length, and just outside off. Pollard dabs that down from deep in the crease. Good use of the short deliveries from Khaleel
more short stuff from Khaleel. Again bowls short, but this is outside off. Pollard drags that pull to deep midwicket
preText: Siddharth: "@Vinod -- Your wish has partially come true."

shortText: Ahmed to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: good delivery there. A slower ball on a short of a length on middle, and he gets that to angle into the batter, as Kishan has to swat and sway out after trying to have a poke at that. Beaten in the end
preText: Stays over the stumps to Kishan

text: swings that across the line to deep midwicket. Tossed up full and outside off, as that comes off the inside half of his bat
preText: Kuldeep back from over the wicket
postText: Josh: "It's not often Pollard is the wrong choice , but David and Sams can go from ball 1!! Pollard will take a few dot balls to get going and halt any momentum MI have!" --- But who knows? What if he cracks 20 off 10?

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: turns away after pitching on a shortish length outside off. Cut away to deep point
preText: Over the wicket to Kishan too

text: much fuller ball on middle. He clips that to deep square leg after closing the bat face
preText: A slip for Pollard, by the way

shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, 1 run
text: again there is turn away from the left-hander. A touch fuller and just outside off, and that is swung away to long-on

wkt_text: KA Pollard c Seifert b Kuldeep Yadav 3 (8m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
text: brilliant catch at square leg! Seifert flies across to his left and clings on to the ball wonderfully well. That is the kind of catch you need to send Pollard back early. It was a short of a length ball on middle, with a hint of turn into the batter. Pollard saw that early, with his eyes lit up seeing the scoring opportunity. He cracked a pull, but that was well anticipated by the man placed on the edge of the circle. Kuldeep turning the screws here
preText: Slip gone
postText: With that, it is the time-out

text: full ball on middle, and that is flicked aerially to deep midwicket, as Kuldeep finishes with a match-defining 3 for 18
preText:
Out comes the much-awaited David. Kuldeep over the wicket, with a slip and leg slip.

Anil Panghal: "Looking at the way Pant celebrated after Pollard's wicket, seems they planned it exactly like that."

Murali: "Watching live on TV and reading commentary on cricinfo. The score seems to be updated faster in cricinfo than live tv. Wonders of technology."

text: short of a length ball on middle, and coming on with the angle. Clipped to fine leg
preText:
Axar back from around the wicket

Four overs to go now. We are into the death overs after all. Can Kishan and David pump a few for Mumbai?
postText: Anish: "Wondering Seifert was a goal keeper. "

text: bashed disdainly over deep midwicket! That is Kishan's fifty too. Looked like he used all his power in that shot. Fuller ball on off, and almost in the slot. He swung that away forcefully, as that went high and far into the stands
preText: Over the stumps to Kishan

text: yorker length ball on off, and quicker too. Jammed to deep point
preText: Around the wicket now

text: shortish again on middle, as that is pushed to long-on from deep in the crease
swatted away wide of long-off! Maybe like a left-handed Dhoni? That was short and wide of off, as he went across off early, and sent that ramming into the fence
too full on middle, and dragged to long-on

shortText: Thakur to Ishan Kishan, no run
text: that was a might swing. Now this reminds me of Pant. That was a dipping full toss wide of off, as he went swinging and lost his balance to fall on his back. The ball raced off his top edge to short third man. Good stop diving to his right by Shaw
preText:
Thakur back. Over the stumps.

Harti: "I was really afraid that the huge price tag might add pressure to Kishan. But he bursts that fear with that authoritative six. "

shortText: Thakur to Ishan Kishan, 1 leg bye
text: yorker length delivery, and Thakur goes up in a leg before appeal. Pant doesn't go for a review. That was again dipping, and was a very accurate yorker, but the impact was just outside off, as Kishan swung to the on side and missed. They sneaked a leg bye in time though
pulls his high full toss on middle and off for a single to fine leg. Looked like an above-waist no-ball for a moment, but that is fine
pretty full ball just outside off - nearly a yorker - and dragged to long-off. Good over so far by Thakur
preText: Ah, Kishan had actually got some bat in that leg before appeal

text: swats that short ball wide of off, and goes over cover. Long-off chases that to his left to keep that to two
postText: Snehil: "Sending love from Singapore to our very own Tim David. Really excited to watch him play"

text: that is a commanding shot! Flat-bats that for six over the bowler's head. Thakur bowls short and outside off, as David sends that effortlessly for six. Fantastic timing and placement, that went pretty far too
sends that to deep square leg! Slower ball, and right in the slot on off stump. Kishan takes a step back in the crease, and hoicks that across the line over the umpire's head
preText:
Khaleel back from over the wicket

Rose: "Timmy D has arrived!"

text: great fielding by Seifert at deep square leg! After taking that catch, he now leaps while running to his right, and pats the ball back from his left hand after it bounced high on pitching inside the rope. There was a boundary check, but it seems fine. Another ball close to the slot and outside off, as Kishan swung to deep square leg again
launched over the bowler's head! Kishan racing away now. This is a touch fuller, and just outside off, with a hint of movement into him. He tears into that to send that down the ground
pretty full and outside off. Drilled to long-off from deep in the crease
swing and a miss! The ball is full and wide of off, as David has a go at that away from his body. There is not foot movement to get to the pitch of the ball, and he is beaten
preText: Over the stumps to David
postText: Anil Panghal: "That effort. Seifert was definitely a goalkeeper in his last birth."

wkt_text: TH David c Mandeep Singh b Ahmed 12 (17m 8b 0x4 1x6) SR: 150.00
text: slices to deep backward point! Khaleel comes back well in the second half of the over. This was like the last ball - full and close to the hitting range, but wide of off. David went to loft that over the off side, but ended up opening the bat face and sending that right into the hands of the fielder there
loses his bottom hand to this wide yorker outside off, and sends that to long-off away from his body
preText: Final over. 175 anyone?

text: takes a slight step across, and sends that milessss into the air! Six over long-off. The ball was full and a touch wide of off, as Sams swung with freedom there
wide delivery. Again goes for the wide yorker, but this lands pretty far from the batter, who has a slash at that but doesn't connect
preText: Sams the new batter in

text: and they manage a run to bring Kishan back on strike. Shortish in length and outside off, as Sams went to pull, but got that off the bottom off the bat to the keeper behind
a helicopter four! Finds the gap between long-on and deep square leg. The ball was pretty full on middle, but Kishan went deep in the crease to send that crashing
preText: dipen chheda: "174/5"

text: a full toss, and four more! This time Thakur bowls cross seam, as the ball is a low full on off. Kishan clears his front leg, and swings away to deep square leg
yorker on off, and that is a very good ball to finish. Jammed back to rush for a quick single. Mumbai finish with 177
postText:
Join Saurabh for the chase in ten to see where this one goes. Can Shaw and company get going early?

"I still feel, it's a CSK match today. While reading the name Thakur on commentary column", recalls an emotional Azweer.

Rana: "60 runs from 10 overs of Kuldeep, Khaleel "

Kuldeep Yadav after taking 3 for 18: "Very happy, since most of my balls were on a good length. I have been talking to Ricky [Ponting] regarding the length of the ball in T20s. I did the same with Rohit bhai with the India side. I didn't change my pace, it just depended on the rhythm. All three wickets were important. If Pollard would have stayed, he could have scored more. The wicket was good, and it didn't help me. The length has to be good to not allow the batters the time to hit. I varied my length and my pace, which was important."

5.15pm So it is the big-bucks boy who delivers for Mumbai - again! Kishan slams an unbeaten 81 off 48 balls, and carries his side to 177, a very good total in the end. Rohit and Tilak contributed too, but credit to Kuldeep for keeping Mumbai quiet with regular strikes. But then, don't forget that catch from Seifert. Who knows what might have been had Pollard hung around?

text: fuller and going across him, Shaw aims an airy drive at it, and doesn't connect.
preText:
5.29pm: Daniel Sams has the ball. One slip in place. Shaw facing.

5.25pm: Rohit gathers the Mumbai players at boundary's edge for a huddle. Prithvi Shaw and Tim Seifert will be Delhi's openers. Ishan Kishan has gone for a scan after a hit to the toe during his fantastic knock (at over 17.1). Aryan Juyal will take the keeping gloves in his absence.

text: dug in short and rising up to above his chest, shuffled a bit and defended to the bowler's right
strays legside and is picked off the thigh pad to long leg
crisp as the first tea on an early morning. Full on off, takes a step forward and punches a cover drive that rolls royces its way to the cover boundary
too far down legside and he'll have to rebowl that
postText: Vinod Rajpal: "Orange Cap is now with the expensive player of the league - Ishan Kishan !! --- Most expensive player of the auction, Vinod Rajpal. Most expensive of the league is KL Rahul I think, at 17 crore.

text: follows up the elegant with the brutal. Too short, swivles and pulls ferociously to the deep square leg boundary
length ball on the stumps, tucked to fine leg

on the front foot to a fuller length ball outside off, drives it to the midwicket fielder in the circle off the inside half
preText: Bumrah to share the new ball

text: good length coming into him, nudged to mid-on

stunner. Not of the Stone Cold variety, of the pulse-racing one. Full ball on the stumps, stays still and shows the full face of the bat in lofting the straight drive over the bowler's head. Bounces just in front of the boundary. He was so supremely balanced when playing it
length ball into him, pushed back towards the bowler, beats him, but the mid-on and mid-off in the circle are there to prevent thoughts of a single

class from Seifert. Similar to the previous boundary this over, but this time he does it over cover. Confident stride out, read the slower ball, and shows the full face of the bat in driving over the in-field and into the boundary
length ball strays legside, flicked to fine leg

shortText: Basil Thampi to Seifert, no run
text: fuller, driven to mid-on
preText: Bowling change after Sam's first over. Thampi now. He burst onto the scene with an ability to bowl consistent yorkers

text: goes over the top again, but this time it's not as well timed. Was looking to be more aggresive with this, lifting over cover. Tymal Mills in pursuit, slides and stops it just inside the boundary line so that keeps them to three.

shortText: Basil Thampi to Shaw, no run

postText:
Amit: "Not an easy thing to hit Bumrah straight back. Excellent shots in last over. "

Anil Panghal : "That shot at 1.3 from Seifert off Bumrah was Kohli-sque"

text: thumped. Too short, rocks back and slugs it across the line, sends it over the deep midwicket boundary

preText:
M Ashwin now. Early in the powerplay.

KB: "I know Warner is class and can't bench him without a very solid reason but by the time he arrives to the Delhi camp, what if seifert makes a names for himself with a couple of extraordinary innings? Would that give DC a headache to choose between Warner and seifert?" --- a happy headache I think, but Warner should still get the starting spot, if it was my call.

text: dropped by the keeper. Top-spinner bounces more than he expected as he was shaping to cut, and gets a thick top edge that pings into sub keeper Juyal's thigh pad almost before he can react

wkt_text: TL Seifert  b Ashwin 21 (19m 14b 4x4 0x6) SR: 150.00
text: googly bowls him through the gate! Superb bowling by MAsh, as he'll doubtless be called. Perfectly looped up, Seifert drawn forward into a punch, and the ball fizzes through the gap to knock the stumps over. Seifert was going so well, this is a crucial strike.
postText: Mandeep Singh the new batter. Rohit has his arm around MAsh with words of advice.

postText: On Ishan Kishan going for a scan, here's the tournament health and safety guidelines: "In exceptional circumstances, if players are required to visit a hospital for scans, injections, etc green corridors will be created to avoid close contact with any individuals who are outside their bio-secure bubble. Players and accompanying team staff must wear PPE (face masks and gloves) during hospital visits."

preText: Over the stumps to Axar too
postText:
It's a double-header Sunday so although this game is done, head over to the second game of the day, where Royal Challengers Bangalore are takign on Punjab Kings.

7.24pm: What a fightback by Delhi Capitals. And they've done it without David Warner, Mitchell Marsh and Anrich Nortje. They've done it while playing with only two overseas players - something that's been done only once before in the IPL. Lalit Yadav and Axar Patel were their last 'batting' pair, and how well both came to the party. Lalit showed the chops that the few who might have seen him in domestic cricket always knew he had. Axar has been an under-rated allrounder in any case, and was great with both bat and ball. Don't forget Kuldeep Yadav's excellent bowling up top. He's been out of favour for a while, but he showed that he's far from done.

Sharat Verma: "Daniel Sams and Jasprit Bumrah's 7.2 overs produced 100 runs for DC! " --- a rare off-day for Bumrah. Delhi did well to capitalise on it. As an opposition, you have to do that because those days don't come around too often.

Viren: "I am a die-hard Delhi fan, switched off the TV after fall of Shaw, just checked Espncricinfo to find one of the most stunning recovery, still rubbing my eyes. "

Tim Seifert: Everything is going good, and it's obviously a great way to start, for me in a new franchise and for the team, an awesome way to start the tournament. It was entertaining, that's just T20 cricket. And cricket in general as well, you show that fighting courage and you never know where the game is going to end. (his catch) Sometimes those just stick! It was nice to get that, obviously a big part for us getting Pollard out. We know what he can do, so good to get him. (Ponting) He's been excellent. The courage he gives you and the cricket we've been talking has been outstanding.

Rohit Sharma: I thought it was a good score. It didn't look like that kind of a pitch where you could get 170-plus at the start. But we played really well in the middle and finished off really well as well. Good score on the board, it's just that we didn't bowl according to the plans. (Not won the opening IPL match since 2012?) Honestly, that's never been the talk. We always come prepared, whether it's the first game or last game, we want to try and win every game. But we made some mistakes on the field which didn't go according to plans. But those things can happen. We just need to keep it tight within the group. Disappointed, but it's not the end.

Over to Saurabh for the presentations.

Ben: "This is not a jailbreak by these two. This is proper knockout punches and prevailed "

Binod Paudel: "Bumrah and Sams combined for 100 runs in 7.2 overs."

7.17pm What a comeback by Capitals! Many - including me - thought it was done long back. The game seemed headed in one direction after Thakur fell, but kudos to Lalit and Axar for helping their side cross the line. A stand of 75 in five overs, and Mumbai's history with opening-day losses continues.

text: beaten as he has a wild swing at this full delivery that's moving away
preText: There's a wide slip in place btw

text: starts with a zippy back of length delivery that thuds into Gaikwad's thigh pad as he hops back to defend. But hey, Umesh has overstepped and we'll have a free-hit immediately.
preText:
7.28pm Gaikwad and Conway are the openers for CSK. Gaikwad is last year's orange cap holder. He'll take strike. Umesh Yadav with the new ball.

Neev says: "CSK's batting depth fascinates me. Having Jaddu at 5, Dhoni at 6, Bravo at 7, Dube at 8, Santner at 9, even Milne is a more than handy batter, and having him at 10 further increases the depth."

KKR are a brand-new team in many ways, with a new captain and new men in key positions. Iyer Power, though, could be key for them.

Those of you in the USA can watch today's action live on ESPN+

MS Dhoni isn't the captain of CSK anymore, after leading the team seemingly forever. Here are five magical moves from the man, in the IPL, as picked out by Deivarayan Muthu.

How will Deepak Chahar's absence, at least in the initial phase of the IPL, affect CSK?

Skand : "Mind your words Shashank, don't use the term 'both wicketkeepers'. Baba Indrajith is a wicketkeeper too." -- Ah, Skand. Of course. I've already got a earful from Deiva Muthu :)

7.10pm In between the toss and start time, the BCCI has held a small felicitation function for gold-winning Olympian Neeraj Chopra. He has been awarded a prize money of INR 1 crore. Boxer Lovlia Borgohain the bronze medallist gets INR 25 lakhs. The men's hockey team gets a combined INR 1 crore. Manpreet Singh, the captain, picks up the cheque from Sourav Ganguly.

Azweer: "Ruturaj and CSK fans mind voice. "Miss you Faf""

CSK playing three New Zealanders in their XI. Interesting to see KKR playing both their keepers Sheldon Jackson and Sam Billings.

The XIs:

KKR: Venkatesh Iyer, Rahane, Shreyas Iyer (capt), Rana, Billings, Russell, Narine, Jackson (wk), Umesh, Mavi, Chakravarthy

CSK: Gaikwad, Conway, Uthappa, Rayudu, Jadeja (capt), Dhoni (wk), Dube, Santner, Bravo, Milne, Deshpande

It's toss time. Heads says Shreyas Iyer, heads it is. KKR will bowl first. "I'm super excited, great honour to don the [KKR] jersey," he says. "This is a belter to bat down, dew could come in later. That's why we're bowling.

Just three overseas players for KKR tonight: Billings, Russell & Narine.

"Big shoes to fill, happy and excited about the new role," says CSK's Jadeja. "Preparation been good, hopefully it'll come good.

CSK's four foreign players: Conway, Bravo, Milne & Santner are the four overseas.

6.50pm As we get ready for toss, here's one for you: What's MS Dhoni's record against Varun Chakravarthy like - good or bad? You can check this, and many more stats, on Maruti Suzuki ASKcricinfo.

Sree: "Is it possible to convert the 5 match T20I series against South Africa in June into a each face each twice tri series adding a CSK team to it? I don't want to see Dhoni retiring without a farewell match in Chennai. "

MahiForLife: "I only partially agree with CricDude.One of Milne/Jordan (maybe both today) will always start, because CSK and Dhoni like their foreign fast bowlers. Especially now that Chahar isn't there.Theekshana might play in the Pune matches, though."

6.42pm Shreyas Iyer, Ajinkya Rahane, and Sam Billings have received their maiden KKR caps.

KB: "I agree with @cricdude.Without Conway and mooen, CSK batting will look very weak compared to other teams and they both bring a totally different approach to the game. Conway can drop the anchor at one end and mooen can go bonkers to his Liking and both being lefties is another added advantage."

CricDude: "Conway, Moeen, Maheesh Theekshana will be CSK's first 3 overseas players going forward. Pretorious will be Bravo's back-up. Those who do not put Conway and Maheesh in CSK's 11 do not understand how Dhoni and CSK operate."

Dhaval : "We fans thought we will see Dhoni as a captain for one last season. But he said - DEFINITELY NOT. :("

Lakshan: "Looking forward to an IPL debut for Maheesh Theekshana. Who was the last Sri Lankan to play for CSK in the IPL?" --- Might've been Kulasekara in 2012

Tushar: "Without Deepak Chahar, CSK's bowling looks weakest among the 10 teams. Having said that I was also a part of the group who called them dad's army in 2018, so wont be surprised if top 2 in purple cap race are from CSK."

6.22pm Valimai Update: Moeen Ali will miss this game because of visa delay. However, he has procured the visa and is in India now. He's set to be available for CSK's second match of the season, against Lucknow Super Giants, on March 31. In the absence of Moeen, CSK are likely to hand an IPL debut to NZ batter Devon Conway. Speaking to the franchise's social-media team batting coach Mike Hussey said that he's also looking forward to seeing Conway in the IPL. Head coach Stephen Fleming rates him highly, having worked with him during an NZ preparatory camp, ahead of last year's T20 World Cup in the Emirates.

Brendon McCullum confirmed on the eve of the game that Tim Southee will be unavailable. The NZ seamer got married earlier this week and joined the squad late. Will KKR replace him with SL Chamika Karunaratne or will they pick an extra Indian seamer in Rasikh Salam Dar?

Dimkesh: "Have something to say about one of the lesser discussed players, Umesh Yadav. He must start with the new ball for KKR, and ideally should bowl 3 in the powerplay. He's best with the new ball, and at his best, he can be deadlier than anybody else on the planet."

Nandhana: "Among the uncapped players of KKR, resides another explosive batter - Aman Khan. Pinch hitting is his strength and he brings it out with ease. Here's to hoping that he gets a few games to make a mark."

6.10pm No team starts as favourite, but will the thinner spread of talent compromise the league's competitiveness? Gaurav Sundararaman and Nagraj Gollapudi roll out the potential trends and key factors that could have a bearing on the results. Vishal Dikshit tells you everything you need to know about IPL 2022. CSK's Rajvardhan Hangargekar and KKR's Sheldon Jackson are among the uncapped players to watch out for this season.

Vignesh: "2 new teams, csk defending champions, rcb appointing a new foreign captain, kkr buying a player from delhi and appointing him as captain... folks, we are back to 2011!!!"

Dipanjan Show: "KKR Vs CSK is an underrated rivalry, just like KXIP Vs RR. Since CSK's re-introduction to IPL in 2018, they have played 9 Matches. At least 6 of them have been thrillers. I hope this match lives up to the reputation, regardless of the victor (Though I'd want KKR to win)."

6pm As many pointed out in the feedback section, Dhoni stepping down as CSK captain marks the end of an era in IPL. We look back at some of Dhoni's memorable moves as CSK captain. Spoiler alert: The plan to trap Pollard in the 2010 final was laid in a practice game in the lead-up to that season.

Speaking of Dhoni magic, do you remember how Joginder Sharma and he tricked Laxmi Ratan Shukla in 2008?

"It was an unusual way to be run-out but credit must go to the Chennai fielders for thinking on their feet. With two balls to go in the innings, Laxmi Ratan Shukla couldn't put away a yorker but Ishant strangely seemed intent to get the strike. Dhoni immediately threw the ball back to the bowler (Joginder Sharma) and Ishant had run too far. The bowler, though, didn't take the bails off immediately and waited for Ishant to start his walk to the pavilion. Once Ishant got into the striker's end, Dhoni spotted Shukla out of the crease and signalled to Joginder to take the bails off. It prompted Parthiv Patel to rush the bowler and urge him to break the stumps. One batsmen misjudged the run but the other had to go."

Mustafa Moudi : "10 years ago these 2 sides clashed in the final where KKR Won and last year they again clashed in the final and CSK won in 2021. Interesting Rivalry to open this season!!"

Vinay: "I suspect Sir Jadeja is a good leader. The fact he often needs to be assisted to set fields for his own bowling, is a red flag for me. He could prove me wrong, but having Dhoni to fall back on is a good start nevertheless."

5.45pm Shreyas Iyer has embraced KKR's explosive brand of cricket, which recently saw them surge to the IPL 2021 final, despite putting together just two wins in their first seven games. Their head coach Brendon McCullum embodied a similar attack-first approach when he captained New Zealand to the 2015 World Cup final.

Team previews

CSK: Absence of Chahar could give CSK selection headache

KKR: Knight Riders bank on Iyer power

sivaramakrishna: "As ardent fan of CSK Dhoni stepping down as captain put me under withdrawal symptoms. It will take some time to rehab myself "

Bouncer Avenue : "Narine must open for KKR along with Venky as he has been quite successful with Lynn, who is aggressive opener and his weakness only came when paired up with Gill, who is a defensive opener. Since Venky is an aggressive opener, Narine would be apt for opening, also considering the fact that he has overcome his trouble against bouncers too. Plus, Finch isn't available yet."

5.35pm Four venues. Ten teams. Seventy league-stage matches. Multiple new leaders. Two of those new leaders - Chennai Super Kings' Ravindra Jadeja and Kolkata Knight Riders' Shreyas Iyer - will kick off IPL 2022 at the Wankhede Stadium later this evening.

Regan Jeya Anto: "CSK should give Gaikwad VC opportunity in the longer run so that Gaikwad will be ready to lead for another 7-10 years after Jadeja retires."

Mustafa Moudi : "Dont think Dhoni's Stepping down as the captain was the last moment decision. The fact that Jadeja is being paid higher than Dhoni suggest that Dhoni had conveyed his decision was long ago but his love of giving surprises (like his test retirement, Captaincy Stepping down and International retirement). Its sad that the only captain left from the inaugural season,has left the post too !!" --- Indeed, CSK's CEO Kasi Viswanathan told ESPNcricinfo that the team management had discussed the succession plan even before the 2021 IPL

The only time Dhoni has represented Super Kings strictly as a player was in 2012, in a dead-rubber Champions League T20 game against Yorkshire. Suresh Raina captained CSK in that game where Dhoni even rolled his arm over. Both Super Kings and Knight Riders will have to contend with the absence of some first-choice players. I'm Deivarayan Muthu and I'll be joined by Shashank Kishore to bring you all the action from the tournament opener. The preview, by yours truly, should be your first stop here.

Umesh Yadav actually has a better record than Deepak Chahar in IPL powerplays - here are the numbers on ASKcricinfo.

Those numbers support what KKR coach Brendon McCullum had to say on the eve of the tournament: "Umesh Yadav was a really good pick-up for us in the auction because of his ability to swing the ball upfront and he is also a wicket-taker too. His statistics in powerplay are really, really good and that's where we'll look to try and use him."

preText:
9.29pm Hello, again, everyone. Cheers Shashank. Dhoni's blows in the slog overs have dragged CSK to 131 for 5. Can Chahar-less CSK make a fist of the defence? Adam Milne made his T20 debut, against CSK, in the CLT20, as an 18-year old in 2010, when Central Districts were ravaged by injury. In the absence of Jacob Oram and Graham Napier, Milne was fast-tracked into the XI and he bounced out Suresh Raina . He's now making his CSK debut after impressing Stephen Fleming at a preparatory camp in the UAE, in the lead-up to last year's T20 World Cup.

Ajinkya Rahane will open with Venkatesh Iyer. Tushar Despande has the new ball. Can he find some swing? Two slips in place for Deshpande

text: just short of a good length and outside off, doesn't bounce as much as Rahane expected it to. He pulls and does not connect
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, jabbed away to point off the  back foot
short and sliding down the leg side, Rahane flicks it in the air....does not carry to Dube diving forward from long leg
overpitched and outside off, Deshpande floats it up. Rahane leans into it and caresses a drive between cover and mid-off
on a length and angling in towards off stump, Rahane presses forward and pats it to extra-cover

just short of a good length and outside off, Venkatesh stands up tall and punches it past the right of point. Tushar slides to his left in the outfield and cuts it off to two. Excellent work in the deep from Tushar

shortText: Milne to VR Iyer, no run
